dialogue: Pehle main akela tha ... aur ab bilkul akela hoon
englishDialogue: First I was alone ... and now I am completely alone

dialogue: Jab geet swayam ke liye gaya jaata hai ... toh sangeet ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a song is sung for self ... it becomes music

dialogue: Pyar bhagwan hai ... lekin saath yeh bhi kahoongi, ki pyar mein joh shaadi na kare ... woh shaitan hai
englishDialogue: Love is god ... but along with that I'll say that, the one who doesn't get married in love ... is a devil

dialogue: Bhagwan ne insaan ko banaya hi aaise hai ki jab tak woh zinda hai ... usse jhoot aur lobh aur moh se koi mukti nahi
englishDialogue: God has made a human such that until he is alive ... he won't get freedom from lies and greed and fascination

dialogue: Main pyar karoongi toh sirf ek hi aadmi se ... aur agar mujhe utna hi pyar vapas nahi milega toh tukde tukde ho jaongi andar hi andar
englishDialogue: If I fall in love then I'll only love that one person ... and if I don't get the same amount of love back then I'll break into pieces from the inside

dialogue: Kunwari ladki ek patang ki tarah hoti hai ... joh shaadi se pehle apni marzi se khuli hawa mein idhar udhar udhti phirti hai ... lekin phir kismat ki patang se pech ladta hai ... aur woh katkar apne pati ki aangan mein aa girti hai
englishDialogue: An unmarried girl is like a kite ... who before marriage flies here and there as she wishes in the open air ... but then she battles with the kite of destiny ... and then she gets cut off and falls into the courtyard of her husband

dialogue: Chaand suraj apni jagah se hat sakte hai ... lekin Thakur apne vaade se nahi palat sakta
englishDialogue: The moon and the sun can move from their place ... but a Thakur can never change from his promise

dialogue: Ladki ki maang tab khoobsurat hoti hai ... jab uska pati us mein sindoor bhar deta hai
englishDialogue: The hair parting of a girl looks good ... when her husband fills vermilion in it

dialogue: Pyar ek aaisi khushboo hai joh chupaye nahi chupti
englishDialogue: Love is a fragrance that cannot be hidden even if you want to

dialogue: Karele jaisi soorat aur jalebi ke sapne
englishDialogue: Your face is like bitter melon and you dream for sweets

dialogue: Humne koi dharam khata nahi khol rakha hai ... hum jab kuch deta hai toh uske badle mein kuch leta bhi hai
englishDialogue: I haven't opened an free account in the name of religion ... when I give something then I take something in exchange for that

dialogue: Tum aur tumhare dost is waqt meri hukumat mein ho ... aur yahan par meri ijazat ke baigar ek patta bhi nahi hil sakta
englishDialogue: Right now you and your friends are under my rule ... and here without my permission not even a leaf can move

dialogue: Tumhari building ko police ne charon taraf se gher rakha hai ... aur agar main do minute ke andar andar yahan se bahar nahi gaya ... toh tumhari aur is building ki dhajjiyan udaa di jayengi
englishDialogue: The police has surrounded your building from all four sides ... and if I don't go out in the next two minutes from here ... then you and your building will be blown into pieces

dialogue: Chahe mujhe zindagi bhar tumhe talaash karna padhe ... main tumhe dhoondunga zaroor ... aur phir joh tumhara haal karoonga ... usse dekhkar tumhare farishtey bhi kaanp uthenge
englishDialogue: Even if I have to search for you throughout my life ... I'll definitely find you ... and then the condition that I'll do of yours ... seeing that even your angels will get scared

dialogue: Jee toh janwar bhi lete hai ... lekin insaan ussi ko kehte hai joh samajhdari se jee sake
englishDialogue: Even an animal lives on ... but the one who lives sensibly is called a human

dialogue: Khoj ek nasha hai, ek ishq hai ... jis mein khoj karne waala khoya rehta hai
englishDialogue: Discovery is an intoxication, it is love ... in which the person doing the discovery is lost

dialogue: Taqatwar se taqatwar insaan bhi kuch ghadiyon mein kamzor se kamzor ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: In some moments of time even the strongest of the person can become the weakest of all

dialogue: Badle badle mere sarkar nazar aate hai ... aur mujhko barbaadi ke aasaar nazar aate hai
englishDialogue: My love looks very different ... and I see the symptoms of destruction

dialogue: Mohabbat ek kaanta hai joh bas chukar toot jaye ... mohabbat ki bas itni dastaan hai
englishDialogue: Love is a thorn that touches and breaks ... this is the story of love

dialogue: Hindustani jab desi peeta hai toh angrezi bolta hai
englishDialogue: When an Indian drinks local alcohol then he talks in English

dialogue: Pratap ke haath itne lambe hai ... ke tujhe jahanum se bhi ghaseet laaye
englishDialogue: The hands of Pratap are so long ... that they will pull you from hell also

dialogue: Yeh duniya bahut badi hai ... apna shikaar khud maarna seekho
englishDialogue: This world is very big ... learn to kill your own prey

dialogue: Main rupaiya ginkar kabhi nahi rakhta
englishDialogue: I never count and keep the money

dialogue: Is kamine ki haddiyon ka toh main soorma banaonga
englishDialogue: I will crush the bones of this sneaky person

dialogue: Main tum se bhi zyada oonchi awaaz mein bol sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I can talk in a voice louder than yours

dialogue: Yeh galat nahi hai ... yeh haqeeqat hai
englishDialogue: This is not wrong ... this is reality

dialogue: Is duniya mein kabhi kabhi insaan itna majboor ho jaata hai ... sivah iske ke woh apne aapko kismat ke havale karde ... aur kuch nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: In this world sometimes a person becomes so helpless that ... other than surrendering himself to destiny ... he can't do anything else

dialogue: Jinki zindagi maut ki chaon mein guzri ho ... woh maut se kahan darte hai
englishDialogue: Those who have spent their life in the shadow of death ... are not scared of death

dialogue: Nadiya se dariya, dariya se sagar, sagar se gehra hai jaam ... jaam mein doob gayi hai yaaron, mere jeevan ki har shyam
englishDialogue: From the river to the sea, from the sea to the ocean, my drink is deeper than the ocean ... and my friends, every evening of my life is drowned in the drink

dialogue: Baarish ki boondon se darne waale toofan ka muqabla nahi kar sakte
englishDialogue: You can't fight the storm if you are scared of rain drops

dialogue: Jeene ki aarzoo mein marre ja rahe hai log ... marne ki aarzoo mein jeeye ja raha hoon main
englishDialogue: People are dying in the hopes of living ... and I am living in the hope of dying

dialogue: De jaam ya gham de humko ... sharaab bhi pee jaati hai aur aasoon bhi peeye jaate hai
englishDialogue: Give me a drink or sadness ... because one can drink alcohol and tears also

dialogue: Akal se sirf nakshe ban sakte hai ... imaaratein nahi
englishDialogue: Brains can only make blueprints ... not buildings

dialogue: Footpath har sadak hi hai aashiyan hamara ... rehne ko ghar nahi hai, sara jahan hamara
englishDialogue: The footpath and the road are my dwelling ... I don't have a house to live in, so the whole world is mine

dialogue: Jigar ki chot hai aye dost, dauraahi nahi jaati ... lapat hai aag ki, hoton pe phir laayi nahi jaati
englishDialogue: My friend the wound on the heart should not be repeated ... and flames of fire should never be bought on the lips again

dialogue: Jis din ek mazdoor kaam pe nahi jaata ... uske ghar par chula nahi balki uska pet jalta hai
englishDialogue: The day when a laborer doesn't go to work ... that day the stove in his house doesn't burn, instead his stomach does

dialogue: Jahan yaar nahi wahan pyar nahi ... jahan pyar nahi wahan yaar nahi
englishDialogue: Where there is no friend there is no love ... where there is no love there is no friend

dialogue: Aaj ke samaaj mein imaandar hokar koi bhi crorepati nahi ho sakta
englishDialogue: In today's society no one can become a millionaire by being honest

dialogue: Hum mein khilane waale haath abhi pehda nahi hue
englishDialogue: The hands that can feed me have not yet been born

dialogue: Shakaal jab baazi khelta hai ... toh jitne patte uske haath mein hote hai ... utne hi uski aasteen mein
englishDialogue: When Shakaal plays a bet ... then the number of cards he has in his hands ... the same number of cards he has in his sleeve

dialogue: Jab dil bahut kuch kehne ko chahe aur zubaan saath na de ... toh yeh mohabbat ki pehli seedi hoti hai
englishDialogue: When the heart wants to say a lot and the words don't give support ... then that is the first step to love

dialogue: Pilana bhi farz tha toh kuch bhi pila diya hota ... sharaab kam thi toh pani mila diya hota
englishDialogue: If it was your duty to make me drink, then you could have given me anything ... if the alcohol was less, then you could have added some water

dialogue: Main apne plan khud banata hoon
englishDialogue: I make my own plans

dialogue: In kandhon par wahi sar hai jisne katna seekha hai ... jhukna nahi
englishDialogue: The head on these shoulders has learnt to be chopped ... but not to bow down

dialogue: Main tere napaak khoon se haath nahi rangoonga
englishDialogue: I won't color my hands with your dirty blood

dialogue: Joh apni jaan par khelte hai ... woh apni manzil par khud pahunch jaate hai
englishDialogue: People who play with their life ... they reach their destination by themselves

dialogue: Intezari ka waqt aur dil se bahut taluk hota hai ... jab humne intezar kiya toh unka dil nahi tha ... aur jab unhone intezar kiya toh hamara dil nahi tha
englishDialogue: There is a big connection between waiting time and the heart ... when I was waiting then her heart was not there ... and when she was waiting then my heart was not there

dialogue: Ghar ek qila ki tarah hota hai ... aur us mein basne waale log maa, baap, bhai, behen, bachche uski deewar ... kisi bhi deewar mein zara si bhi daraar padh jaye ... toh deewar hi nahi gir jaati balki ghar hi toot girta hai
englishDialogue: A home is like a fort ... and the people who live it like mother, father, brother, sister, children are its walls ... if even a small crack builds in any of the walls ... then not only the wall falls but also the entire house breaks and falls

dialogue: Agar ichcha mein bal ho toh woh azaad hoti hai ... aur shakti bhi azaadi se aati hai, bandish se nahi
englishDialogue: If your desires are strong then they are free ... and even strength comes from freedom and not from restriction

dialogue: Jab tak baithne ko na kaha jaaye sharafat se khade raho ... yeh police station hai ... tumhare baap ka ghar nahi
englishDialogue: Stand straight until you are told to sit ... this is a police station ... not your father's house

dialogue: Sher Khan ne shaadi nahi ki toh kya hua ... lekin baaraatein bahut dekhi hai
englishDialogue: So what if Sher Khan is not married ... he has seen a lot of processions

dialogue: Is ilaaqe mein naye aaye ho sahab? ... varna Sher Khan ko kaun nahi jaanta
englishDialogue: Sir, are you new in the area? ... otherwise who does not know Sher Khan

dialogue: Aaj zindagi mein pehli baar ... Sher Khan ki sher se takkar hui hai
englishDialogue: For the first time in life ... Sher Khan has come across a tiger

dialogue: Baarah junglee kutte milkar sher ko maar daalte hai
englishDialogue: 12 wild dogs together killed the tiger

dialogue: Sher Khan aaj ka kaam kal par nahi chodta
englishDialogue: Sher Khan does not leave today's work for tomorrow

dialogue: Kutta jab pagal ho jaata hai toh usse goli maar dete hai
englishDialogue: When a dog does mad then we shoot him

dialogue: Sher Khan kaale ka dhanda karta hai ... lekin imaandari se
englishDialogue: Sher Khan does black money business ... but with honesty

dialogue: Hum aaya tha karza lene ke liye ... par tumne Sher Khan ko khareed liya
englishDialogue: I had come to take a loan ... but you bought Sher Khan himself

dialogue: Chillaaoo nahi sahab ... gala kharab ho jayega
englishDialogue: Don't shout sir ... your throat will go bad

dialogue: Aao Vijay, baitho aur hamare saath ek scotch piyo ... hum tumhe kha tohdi jaayenge ... vaise bhi hum vegetarian hai
englishDialogue: Come Vijay, sit and have a scotch with me ... I won't eat you ... by the way I am a vegetarian

dialogue: Jis tarah kuch aadmiyo ki kamzori baimaani hoti hai ... is hi tarah kuch aadmiyo ki kamzori imaandari hoti hai
englishDialogue: Just like some people have cheating as their weakness ... just like that some people have honesty as their weakness

dialogue: Aaj ke baad apne aadmiyo se keh do ki hamesha tumhare nazdeek rahe ... kyun ki tumhari nazdeek ki nazar kamzor hai
englishDialogue: From today tell your men to always stay near you ... because you have farsightedness

dialogue: Sher Khan khud aaya tha khud chala jayega
englishDialogue: Sher Khan came by himself and will himself go

dialogue: Apni umar se badhkar baatein nahi karte
englishDialogue: You shouldn't talk about things bigger than your age

dialogue: Khaane ke saath cigarette peena bahut buri baat hai
englishDialogue: Smoking a cigarette while eating food is a very bad thing

dialogue: Kuch logon ke liye tumhare dil mein itni nafrat bhar gayi hai ... ke pyar ke liye tumhare dil mein zara bhi jagah nahi bachi
englishDialogue: Hatred for a few people has filled up your heart such that ... you don't have any space left for love in your heart

dialogue: Achche khareedar hamesha sauda karne se pehle ... doosre ki keemat ka andaza lagate hai
englishDialogue: Before making a deal good buyers always ... surmise the value of the other person

dialogue: Kal subah tak tumhare sab juakhane aur kaale dhandhe band ho jaane chahiye
englishDialogue: Till tomorrow morning all your casino's and black market businesses should be closed out

dialogue: Joh haath angaare ko chupaye ... angaara us hi haath ko jalaa deta hai
englishDialogue: The hands who will hide the burning coal ... the burning coal will burn the same hands

dialogue: Dukh toh sabhi ki zindagi mein hota hai ... kisi ko bin maange mil jaata hai meri tarah ... aur koi jaan-mooch ke modh le leta hai tumhari tarah
englishDialogue: Everyone has sorrow in their life ... some people like me get it without asking for it ... and some people like you purposely call for it

dialogue: Tum mere jeevan mein us rog ki tarah ho ... jis mein aadmi ghulta rehta hai, tadapta rehta hai ... na jee sakta hai, na mar sakta hai
englishDialogue: You're like a disease in my life ... in which a person keeps sulking, keeps wriggling ... where neither can he live, nor can he die

dialogue: Dost ki galati bhi dosti ki saughat hoti hai
englishDialogue: Even the mistake of a friend is a gift in friendship

dialogue: Shaadi shuda zindagi ki buniyad hai ... pati aur patni ka ek doosre par atal vishvas
englishDialogue: The foundation of a married life is ... the strong trust of a husband and wife on each other

dialogue: Tera shaq tujhe kha gaya ... ek chingari aag bani aur ek insaan jal gaya
englishDialogue: Your suspicion destroyed you ... one flame turned into a fire and one person got burnt

dialogue: Aurat tawaif vichaaron se banti hai ... peshe se nahi
englishDialogue: A woman becomes a prostitute with her thoughts ... not by her occupation

dialogue: Chaku chalane ke liye kalai nahi kaleja chahiye ... joh bazaar mein nahi bikta
englishDialogue: To use a knife you don't need a wrist, you need courage ... which doesn't sell in the market

dialogue: Armaan dabaye ja sakte hai, chupaye ja sakte hai ... lekin jalaye nahi ja sakte
englishDialogue: Desires can be suppressed, they can be hidden ... but they can't be burned

dialogue: Chaku aur churi ke bal pe jeene waale log ... ek din khud chaku churi ke neeche aa jaate hai
englishDialogue: Those who live on the support of knives and cutters ... one day they themselves come under the knives and the cutters

dialogue: Petrol ka bhav badh gaya ... tarkaari ka bhav badh gaya ... tera bhav bhi badh gaya kya?
englishDialogue: The price of petrol has gone up ... the price of vegetables has gone up ... has your price also gone up or what?

dialogue: Inhe aaisa kadva aadmi hai ki agar ganderi khake thukenga ... toh uspe makkhi bhi nahi behethengi
englishDialogue: He is such a bitter person that if he eats sugarcane and spits ... then even a mosquito won't sit on that

dialogue: Mujhe aaj tak kisi ka khoon karne ki zaroorat hi nahin padi
englishDialogue: To date I haven't had the need to kill anyone

dialogue: Maine revolver pehli baar uthaya hai ... lekin itna jaanta hoon ki trigger dabane se goli chalti hai
englishDialogue: I have picked a revolver for the first time ... but I know that a bullet fires on pressing the trigger

dialogue: Ek taraf maut hai ... doosri taraf maut se battar zindagi
englishDialogue: One side there is a death ... and on the other side there is life which is worst than death

dialogue: Itni aasani se tujhe maut nahi aane waali ... tujhe toh jail ki kali kothri mein maut ka intezaar karna padega
englishDialogue: Death will not come to you so easily ... you will have to wait for death inside the dark cell of a jail

dialogue: Ek khoon ki saza phansi ... aur do khoon ki saza bhi sirf phansi
englishDialogue: The punishment for one murder is execution ... and the punishment for two murders is still execution

dialogue: Insaan ko dil de, jism de, dimaag de lekin yeh kambakht pet mat de ... usse pet deta hai toh usse bhook mat de ... usse bhook deta hai toh do waqt ki roti ka intezam karke bhej ... varna tujhe insaan ko paida karne ka koi haq nahi hai
englishDialogue: Give a heart, body, brain to a human but don't give this wretched stomach ... if you give a stomach then don't give him hunger ... if you give him hunger then send him with food arranged for twice a day ... or else you don't have the right to create humans

dialogue: Aadmi ke seene mein khanjar bhokane se woh sirf ek baar marta hai ... lekin jab kisi ka dil tootta hai na toh usse bar-bar marna padta hai, har roz marna padta hai
englishDialogue: By stabbing a person with a knife he dies only once ... but when someone's heart breaks then he has to die many a times, he has to die everyday

dialogue: Agar is samaaj aur society se paap aur gunaah ko hamesha ke liye khatam karna hai ... toh un shaitano ko khatam karna hoga joh chand sikkon ki khatir gareebon ki sharafat aur insaaniyat khareedkar unke dilon mein gunaah ka bheej bohte hai ... paap ke saaye mein unki parvarish karte hai ... logon ka khoon pilakar unhe badne par majboor karte hai
englishDialogue: If we want to eradicate sin and crime from today's society forever ... then we'll have to finish those devils who for a little bit of money buy the honesty and humanity of the poor and sow the seeds of crime in their hearts ... who raise them in the shadow of sin ... who compel people to drink blood of others and grow

dialogue: Roti roti mein bhi farak hota hai mere dost ... ek roti woh hoti hai joh cheenke khai jaati hai jis mein kisi ke khoon ki boo aati hai ... lekin mujhe woh roti chahiye jis mein kisi ke khoon ki boo nahi, balki mere paseene ki mehak aati ho
englishDialogue: My Friend there is a difference even between breads ... there is one type of bread which is eaten by snatching and which has the smell of someone's blood ... but I want that bread which doesn't have the smell of someone's blood, but instead has the fragrance of my sweat

dialogue: Kasoor mera nahi roti ki kasam ... bhook ki duniya mein imaan badal jaate hai
englishDialogue: I swear on bread it's not my fault ... in the world of hunger people change their faith

dialogue: (Kaun ho tum?) ... Kahi naam hai mere ... gareeb maa baap mujhe apna beta kehte hai, mazloom ladkiyan apna bhai ... besahare yateemon ka dost hoon aur zalimon ka dushman
englishDialogue: (Who are you?) ... I have many names ... poor parents call me as their son, victimized girls as their brother ... I'm a friend of the helpless and an enemy of the vicious

dialogue: Jitni badi kranti lani hoti hai ... utni hi badi shanti ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: The bigger the revolution that you want to bring ... that much more silence you need to have

dialogue: Jal se shareer ka snaan hota hai aur aasoon se atma ka
englishDialogue: A body bathes with water and the soul with tears

dialogue: Ek police officer duty par mahez ek police officer hota hai ... wahan na koi behen hoti hai, na bhai hota hai ... wahan na koi rishta hi hota hai aur na hi koi naata
englishDialogue: A police officer on duty is nothing but a police officer ... there is no sister there, there is no brother there ... there is no relation there and neither a connection

dialogue: Jiske tann mein Isa, mann mein Allah aur atma mein Om basa hai ... uska duniya ki koi bhi taqat baal bhi bhaka kar sakti hai kya
englishDialogue: The one who has Jesus in his body, Allah in his heart and Om in his soul ... no power of this world can even affect him

dialogue: Dahej ke laalchi kutton ke dil mein aaisi dehshat pehda kar denge ... ki dahej lena toh kya ... dahej ka naam sunte hi kaanp uthenge
englishDialogue: We will invoke such a fear in the hearts of the dogs who are greedy for dowry ... that forgive taking dowry ... they will shiver just by hearing the name of dowry

dialogue: Vishwasghaat toh woh paap hai ... jisse bhagwan bhi maaf nahi karta
englishDialogue: Betrayal is that sin ... which even god doesn't forgive

dialogue: Ek aur ek do nahi ... gyarah hote hai
englishDialogue: One and one is not two ... it is eleven

dialogue: Jab chacha Shaadilal par chhod di hai baat ... toh koi na koi rishta zaroor aayega haath
englishDialogue: When you have trust in your uncle Shaadilal ... then some connection will definitely come forward

dialogue: Yeh chandi ke sapne aur sone ki saansein lete the ... lekin inhe nahi malum tha ... ki chandi ke sapne pranon par zanjeer ban jaate hai ... aur sone ki saansein atma mein zehar gholne lagti hai
englishDialogue: They used to go for the dreams of silver and the breathe of gold ... but they didn't know that ... the dreams of silver become the shackles on life ... and the breathe of gold mixes poison into the soul

dialogue: Joh sar par kafan bandkar nikalte hai ... woh anjaam nahi sochte
englishDialogue: Those who leave wearing a shroud on their head ... they don't think about the consequence

dialogue: Pyar aur dushmani mein ek hi kadam ka faasla hove hai
englishDialogue: There is only a difference of one step between love and enmity

dialogue: Goli ka jawab goli se denge aur loot ka jawab loot se
englishDialogue: In reply we will give a bullet for a bullet and theft for a theft

dialogue: Dost marte hai, dosti nahi marti
englishDialogue: Friends die, but friendship doesn't die

dialogue: Yeh maut ka shehar hai ... is shehar ki galiyon mein andhera hi andhera hai
englishDialogue: This is the city of death ... and there is darkness in the streets of this city

dialogue: Jab tak chance rahega baki ... main nahi bandwaonga rakhi
englishDialogue: Until there is a chance ... I won't get the thread of brotherhood tied from you

dialogue: Bijnor mein gunda pakda gaya ... hairan hoon is daur mein gunda pakda gaya
englishDialogue: A goon was caught in Bijnor ... I'm surprised that a goon was caught in this era

dialogue: Pajame ne kaha dhoti se ... bane hum dono ek dhaage se ... farak agar hai hum mein toh sirf itna ... tu khulti peeche se, main aage se
englishDialogue: The pajama said to a loincloth ... we both are made from one thread ... if there is a difference between us then it's only that ... you open from the back and I open from the front

dialogue: Bambai ki ladki aur Bambai ki barish ... kabhi bhi aayegi, kabhi bhi jayegi
englishDialogue: Mumbai girls and Mumbai rains ... they come anytime and they go anytime

dialogue: Mein ek nanha sa, pyara sa, chota sa bachcha hoon
englishDialogue: I am a tiny, lovable, small baby

dialogue: Tujhe toh main all India star bankar dikhaongi
englishDialogue: I will become an all India star and show you

dialogue: Main aaya hoon yahan par tere liye ... aur tu banayi gayi hai mere liye
englishDialogue: I have come here for you ... and you are made for me

dialogue: Main madira nahi peeti ji
englishDialogue: I don't drink alcohol

dialogue: Aaj Sunday hai, toh daru peene ka din hai
englishDialogue: Today is Sunday, so it is a day to drink alcohol

dialogue: Dard ki dawa na ho ... toh dard ko hi dawa samajh lena chahiye
englishDialogue: If there is no medicine for pain ... then you should consider pain as the medicine itself

dialogue: Jab tum mujhe apna kehte ho ... apne pe guroor aa jaata hai
englishDialogue: When you call me your own ... I feel proud of myself

dialogue: Raaton ko jaagna meri kismat ban chuki hai
englishDialogue: It has become my fate to stay awake at night

dialogue: Pyar hawa ka ek jhonka hai ... joh sab udakar le jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is a gust of wind ... which blows away everything

dialogue: Jeevan ke kis modh pe, kab koi mil jaaye ... kaun keh sakta hai?
englishDialogue: On what path of life, whom do we meet ... who can say that?

dialogue: Hum Delhi waale mulk ke saath saath ... dil pe bhi hukumat karna jaante hai
englishDialogue: We Delhiites along with ruling over the country ... also know how to rule over the heart

dialogue: Yeh baatein bekaar ki nahin ... intezaar ki hain, ikraar ki hain, methe methe pyar ki hain
englishDialogue: These talks are not a waste ... they are of waiting, they are of acceptance, they are of sweet sweet love

dialogue: Bhagwan ne aapko daulat toh zaroorat se zyada di hai ... magar dil dene mein thodi si kanjhoosi kar gaya
englishDialogue: God gave you wealth more than what you need ... but when it came to the heart he was a little stingy

dialogue: Tumhe insaanon se nahin ... paison se pyar hai
englishDialogue: You don't love humans ... you love money

dialogue: Daulat aapke is ghar ke nizaam ko zaroor badal sakti hai ... lekin vidhi ke vidhan ko nahi badal sakti
englishDialogue: Wealth can definitely change the ruler of your house ... but it can't change destiny

dialogue: Insaan apne vyavhaar, apne charitra, apni zubaan aur apne dil se amir hota hai
englishDialogue: A human gets rich from his behavior, his principles, his words and from his heart

dialogue: Yeh unnees reel ki film hai ... aage aage dekho hota hai kya
englishDialogue: This film has 19 reels ... keep watching what happens ahead

dialogue: Inki zindagi ke lifaafe par ... upar jaane ka tickut toh lagai dena
englishDialogue: On the envelope of his life ... put a ticket to go up (to God)

dialogue: Sone chandi ke bartano mein khana khane waala amir nahi hota hai ... aircondition caron mein ghoomne waala amir nahi hota hai ... aaise sangemarmar ke bunglay mein rehne waala amir nahi hota hai ... besaharon ko sahara dena waala amir hota hai ... rote hue ko hasane waala amir hota hai ... marne waala nahin, bachane waala amir hota hai
englishDialogue: The one who eats food in golden and silver plates is not a rich person ... the one who roams around in aircondition cars is not a rich person ... the one who lives in a bungalow made from marble is not a rich person ... one who helps the needful is a rich person ... one who makes a crying person laugh is a rich person ... the one who kills is not, the one who saves is a rich person

dialogue: Raat toh gayi, magar baat nahin gayi
englishDialogue: The night is over, but the talk isn't over

dialogue: Bhaag kar kahan jaaogi? ... darwaza dono taraf se bandh hai
englishDialogue: Where will you run and go? ... the door is closed from both sides

dialogue: Tere gande shareer se ... teri paapi aatma ko mukt kar doonga
englishDialogue: From your dirty body ... I'll release your evil soul

dialogue: Insaan ko insaan ka hi kaam karna chahiye ... bhagwan ka nahi
englishDialogue: Humans should only do the work of humans ... not of God

dialogue: Kaale brahman pe haath uthake ... tune shani ki mahadasha ko bulaya hai
englishDialogue: By putting your hands on a black brahman ... you have called for the bad stars in your horoscope

dialogue: Aaj ke baad main tujhe kahin bhi, kabhi bhi, kissi bhi waqt maar daloonga
englishDialogue: After today I will kill you anywhere, anytime, at any moment

dialogue: Pati patni ki narazgi garmiyon ki barsaat ki tarah hoti hai ... joh hamesha nahi rehti
englishDialogue: The fight between a husband and wife is like the rain in summer ... it doesn't last forever

dialogue: Lagta hai tum aasman se tapki ho ... upar se neeche aakar zameen par chamki ho ... uparwaale ne kya super kaam kiya hai ... tujhe fursat mein bana diya hai
englishDialogue: Looks like you have come from the sky ... you have shined on the ground after coming from the top ... god has done such a great work ... he has made you with a lot of time

dialogue: Inteqam ka josh farz aur sachai ka sar kabhi nahi jhuka sakta
englishDialogue: The passion for revenge can never bow down the head of duty and truth

dialogue: Aurat zindagi leti nahi ... zindagi deti hai
englishDialogue: A woman doesn't take a life ... she gives one

dialogue: Leader ke jazbaat ka, Bambai ki barsaat ka aur producer ki baat ka ... kabhi bharosa karna nahi chahiye
englishDialogue: You should never trust ... the emotions of a leader, the rain of Mumbai and the words of a producer

dialogue: Ek andha bhi mann ki aankhon se bahut kuch dekh leta hai ... lekin andhvishvasi toh tann aur mann dono ki aankhen kho behetta hai
englishDialogue: Even a blind person can see a lot from the eyes of his heart ... but a superstitious person loses both, the eyes of his body and that of his heart

dialogue: Hum toh yeh samajhkar aapke paas aaye the, ki hum apni samajh ko aapki samajh ke charano mein rakh denge ... aur aap is nasamajh ki bina samajhayi hui samajh ko, apni samajhdari se samajhake sabko yeh samajha denge ki hum samajh gaye ... lekin aap samajhenge nahi ... samajh gaye na?
englishDialogue: I came to you thinking that, I'll keep my thinking under the feet of your thinking ... and that with your sensible thinking you'll make everyone understand that, the foolish thinking of this silly person now understands ... but you won't understand that ... do you understand?

dialogue: Bhagwan ka ansh har insaan ke andar hota hai
englishDialogue: A portion of god is within every person

dialogue: Kalyug mein chamatkar ko hi namaskar kiya jaata hai
englishDialogue: In the age of vice magic is saluted

dialogue: Kanoon ek aaisa hathyar hai joh sau achaiyon ko bhool jaata hai ... magar ek galati ho jaye toh gardan kaat deta hai
englishDialogue: The law is a weapon that forgets hundreds of good deeds ... but if you do one mistake then it'll cut your neck

dialogue: Marne waala chahe apne aap ko lohe ki deewaron mein bhi band karle ... bach nahi sakta ... aur jeene waala chahe lakhon goliyon ki bauchaar se guzar gaye ... mar nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The one who is supposed to die, even if he locks himself up inside the walls of iron ... he still won't escape ... and the one who is supposed to live, even if he goes through millions of raining bullets ... he still won't die

dialogue: Hazar bura aadmi burai ka rasta akhtyar kare toh itna khatarnak nahi ... lekin jab ek achcha aadmi burai ka rasta akhtyar karta hai na ... toh burai ka seena bhi kaanp uthta hai
englishDialogue: Even if thousands of evil people adopt the path of evilness it's still not dangerous ... but when a single good person adopts the path of evilness ... then even the body of evilness shivers

dialogue: Doosron ko maarkar jeena koi gaurav ki baat nahi ... magar khud ko maarkar kisi aur ke liye jeena hi jeena hai
englishDialogue: It's not prideful to live by killing someone ... but to kill yourself and then to live for someone else is called as living

dialogue: Tum aur hum kachre ke dher se uthne waali woh badbu hai ... jisko zamane ki naak kabhi seh nahi sakti ... aur kachra chahe kitna bhi saaf ho jaye usse badbu hi uthti hai
englishDialogue: You and I are the smell that comes out from a pile of garbage ... which can never be tolerated by the nose of the world ... and no matter how clean garbage becomes it still smells

dialogue: Kyun ki mera colour black hai, kaleja black hai aur uske andar ka khoon bhi black hai ... is liye main tujhe blackmail kar raha hoon
englishDialogue: Because my (skin) colour is black, my heart is black and the blood inside it is also black ... that's why I'm blackmailing you

dialogue: Jis tarah se bomb mein aag lagte hi saat second ke andar barood phatke bahar nikal jaata hai ... ussi tarah se Shambu saat dino ke andar jail ki char deewari se bahar nikal jayega
englishDialogue: When a bomb is fired up then in 7 seconds the gunpowder inside blasts and comes out ... just like that Shambu will break the four walls of the jail in 7 days and come out

dialogue: Galati ek baar hoti hai, do baar hoti hai ... lekin teesri baar iraada hota hai
englishDialogue: Mistake can happen once, can happen twice ... but the third time it's the intention

dialogue: Kal hum Holi khelenge ... lekin is Holi mein gulaal ki bajai dhuna udhega ... pichkariyon mein se rang nahi, bandookon mein se goliyan niklengi ... geeton ki jagah cheekein ... aur laaj ki jagah laashein tadapengi
englishDialogue: Tomorrow I'll play Holi ... but in this Holi instead of colour powder, smoke will fly ... bullets will come out from guns instead of colour from water toys ... screams instead of songs ... and bodies will drop instead of modesty

dialogue: Dushman ko dushmani se hi nahi ... dosti se bhi maara ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: You can not only kill an enemy with enmity ... but also with friendship

dialogue: Hamara rasta kaatne waali koi bhi billi ... zinda nahi rehti
englishDialogue: Any cat that cuts my path ... doesn't stay alive

dialogue: Budhape ko maut ka nahi ... akelepan ka darr hota hai
englishDialogue: Old age is not scared of death ... it is scared of loneliness

dialogue: Aaj ke baad mujhe agar kisi ke khilaaf koi bhi report mili ... toh main uska woh haal karoonga, ki maa baap bhi nahi pehchanenge
englishDialogue: After today if I get any report against anyone ... then I'll make such a condition of that person, that even his parents will not be able to recognize him

dialogue: Joh jitna ooncha hota hai ... utni hi zor se zameen par girta hai
englishDialogue: The higher the person is ... that much more harder he falls on the ground

dialogue: Duty aur biwi mein khaas farak nahi hota ... dono ki maang mein laali bharni padti hai
englishDialogue: There is not much of a difference between duty and a wife ... since you have to fill the colour red on both of their foreheads

dialogue: Hum mein oonchi awaaz sunna bhi pasand nahi ... hamare samne joh oonchi awaaz mein bolta hai ... uski awaaz hamesha hamesha ke liye band kar di jaati hai
englishDialogue: I don't like to hear loud voices ... the person who speaks loudly in front of me ... I shut their voice forever

dialogue: Chipkali ke bachche kabhi magarmach nahi ban sakte ... woh deewar par rhengte rhengte hi mar jaate hai
englishDialogue: The children of a lizard can never become crocodiles ... they will simply die crawling on the walls

dialogue: Mera naam hai Mahakaal ... Kali ka pujari hoon main ... libaz bhi kaala, dhanda bhi kaala aur dushmanon ko joh kafan pehnata hoon uska rang bhi kaala
englishDialogue: My name is Mahakaal ... and I worship (the goddess) Kali ... my dress is black, my business is black and the shroud that I put on my enemies is also black

dialogue: Hum toh woh bhanwar hai jis mein samundar ke samundar doob jaate hai
englishDialogue: I am that vortex in which the ocean of the oceans drowns

dialogue: Krishna Prasad maut ki diary mein ek baar jiska naam likh deta hai ... usse yamraj bhi nahi mitta sakta
englishDialogue: Once Krishna Prasad writes a name in the diary of death ... then even the god of death can't erase that

dialogue: Haraam ki daulat insaan ko shuru shuru mein sukh zaroor dilati hai ... magar baad mein le jaakar ek aaise dukh ke sagar mein dhakel deti hai ... jahan marte dum tak sukh ka kinara kabhi nazar nahi aata hai
englishDialogue: Unlawful wealth surely gives happiness to one in the start ... but later on it takes you and throws you into the sea of sadness ... where you will never ever see the shores of happiness

dialogue: Agar insaan dukh se dosti karle ... toh phir zindagi mein kabhi usko sukh ki tamanna hi nahi rahegi
englishDialogue: If a man befriends sorrow ... then in life he will never have the wish for happiness

dialogue: Insaan ki zindagi ek aaine ki tarah hoti hai ... farak itna hai ki aam aaine mein hum joh harkat karte hai uski tasveer us hi waqt nazar aa jaati hai ... magar zindagi woh aaina hai ki aaj kiya hue harkat ki tasveer barso baad nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: The life of a human is like a mirror ... the only difference is that whatever we do in front of a regular mirror we can see the picture of that right away ... but life is that mirror which shows the picture of whatever we do today, after a long time

dialogue: Sukh toh bewafaa tawaif ki tarah hai ... joh aaj iske pass, kal uske pass
englishDialogue: Happiness is like the unfaithful prostitute ... who is with one today and with another tomorrow

dialogue: Yeh zindagi ek khet ki tarah hai jahan insaan ... kisan ki tarah paap aur punya ke beejh bohta hai
englishDialogue: Life is like an farm where a person ... like a farmer sows the seeds of sins and boons

dialogue: Jahan paisa roti ki hadh se badh gaya ... wahin insaan baimaani ke daldal mein gadh gaya
englishDialogue: Where money goes beyond the limits of food ... over there a man gets stuck in the bog of dishonesty

dialogue: In duniya mein jis insaan ke paas har sawaal ka jawab nahi hota hai ... kabhi kabhi uski apni zindagi sawaal ban jaya karti hai
englishDialogue: In this world a person who does not have the answer to every question ... sometimes his own life becomes a question

dialogue: Jaane do isse ... is waqt yeh khudgarzi ke ghode pe savar, barbaadi ke toofan mein udhta hua chala ja raha hai ... aur aaise sawar ko waqt ke thappad aur zamaane ki thokar ke sivah koi nahin rok sakta hai
englishDialogue: Let him go ... right now he is riding the horse of selfishness and flying in the storm of destruction ... and no one can stop such a rider other than the slap of time and the kick of the era

dialogue: Tumhari umar mere tajurbe se bahut kam hai ... tumne utni Diwaliyan nahi dekhi hai jitni maine tum jaise bikne waalon ki barbaadiyan dekhi hai
englishDialogue: Your age is much less than my experience ... you haven't seen as many Diwali's, as many as I have seen the destruction of people like you who take bribes

dialogue: Aulad ki judai ka dard ... maut ke dard se bhi zyada hota hai
englishDialogue: The pain of separation from a child ... is much more than the pain of death

dialogue: Shabdon ke teer maar maarkar mujhe aur zakhmi mat kar
englishDialogue: Don't injure me more by firing these arrows of words

dialogue: Aapne joh samjhaya meri samajh mein kuch nahi aaya ... kyun ki aapki joh samajh hai na meri samajh ki samajh se bahar hai
englishDialogue: Whatever you explained I didn't understand anything ... because your thoughts are beyond my understanding

dialogue: Aaj kal ke yug mein har cheez ke daam bhad gaye hai ... magar aadmi ki nazar mein insaaniyat ke daam ghat gaye hai
englishDialogue: In today's age the price of everything has gone up ... but the price of humanity in the eyes of a person has dropped

dialogue: Hasso mat ... aaj se tumhare rone ke din shuru ho gaye hai
englishDialogue: Don't laugh ... from today the days of your crying start

dialogue: Humse takrane waale ka ek hi anjaam hota hai ... jisse Hindi mein maut aur angrezi mein death kehte hain
englishDialogue: There can only be one outcome of anyone going against me ... which we call as "maut" in Hindi and "death" in English

dialogue: Bahut oonchi boli bolta hai tu ... magar aaj main tujhe itna ooncha pahuncha doonga ki hamesha ke liye bolti bandh kar doonga
englishDialogue: You talk very loudly ... but today I will send you to such heights that you will stop talking forever

dialogue: Main toh aapse dur rehna chahta hoon ... magar yeh kambhakt haath uchal uchal ke, uchal uchal ke ... tumse chipak jaata hai
englishDialogue: I want to stay away from you ... but this bloody hand keeps jumping around ... and sticks on you

dialogue: Mujhe hisaab kitaab karna bahut achchi tarah se aata hai
englishDialogue: I know very well how to keep accounts

dialogue: Pati patni saath rehte rehte ek doosre ko itni achchi tarah janne lag jaate hai ... ki ek doosre ke liye aaina ban jaate hai
englishDialogue: A husband and wife staying together understand each other so well ... that they become a mirror for each other

dialogue: Jab dil mein paap ka andhera ho ... toh koi bhi pooja, kaisi bhi prarthana ujaala nahi kar sakti
englishDialogue: When there is darkness in the heart from sins ... then no worship, no prayer can create brightness

dialogue: Chahe insaan ki gardan ho ya telephone ka taar ... katne mein zyada waqt nahi lagta
englishDialogue: Be it a human's neck or a telephone wire ... it doesn't take time to cut it

dialogue: Beete dino ki yaad ka sahara toh tab liya jaata hai ... jab sirf yaadein hi reh gayi ho
englishDialogue: You take the support of the past days ... when only memories are left

dialogue: Kis bedardi se ujhada hai mera chaman ... ab main kahan bechunga dal sabzi aur mutton
englishDialogue: With great brutality you have destroyed my garden ... now where will I sell vegetable lentil and mutton

dialogue: Galati toh har insaan se hoti hai ... par maafi ka asli haqdar wohi hota hai joh galati karke pachtaye
englishDialogue: Every person makes a mistake ... but only that person is worth an apology who repents after committing a mistake

dialogue: Pagalpan bahut khatarnak bimari hoti hai ... jisse ho jaye uske liye bhi aur auron ke liye bhi
englishDialogue: Becoming mad is a very dangerous illness ... for the one who goes through it and for others as well

dialogue: Usse yeh kaho ki un raasto par chalna chhod de ... jahan par hamari hone waali bahu chalti hai
englishDialogue: Tell him to stop walking on those roads ... where my to be daughter-in-law walks

dialogue: Katal karna hamara dhanda hai ... aur yeh kaam bhi hum muft nahi karte
englishDialogue: To kill is our business ... and even that we don't do it for free

dialogue: Kal uske jism ki har haddi toot chuki hogi
englishDialogue: Tomorrow every bone in his body will be broken

dialogue: Khwab aur hakikat mein jab bhi jung hoti hai ... khwab haar jaata hai
englishDialogue: Whenever there is a battle between a dream and reality ... the dream loses

dialogue: Hum uski woh beizzati karenge, woh beizzati karenge ... ki saale ki aane waali saath nasale beizzat pehda hongi
englishDialogue: We will humiliate him so badly, so badly ... that his next seven generations will be born humiliated

dialogue: Gussa ek bahut badi daulat hoti hai ... usse bhi sooch samajhkar karch karna chahiye
englishDialogue: Anger is a large amount of wealth ... you should think before you spend it

dialogue: Meri aadat hai, main jis cheez ko ek baar pasand karta hoon ... usse yah toh paa leta hoon ... yah usse is layak nahi chhodta ki woh kisi aur ke layak rahe
englishDialogue: It is my habit that, once I like a thing ... I either achieve it ... or else I don't leave it in a condition where it can be of any use to someone else

dialogue: Is duniya mein sharifon ki bahumat hai ... lekin yeh sharif kuch hi gundon se sar jhukaye darr darr ke jeete hai
englishDialogue: Honest people have the majority in this world ... but these honest people bow down in front of a few goons and live a scared life

dialogue: Abhi toh tamasha hoga ... bahut bada tamasha hoga
englishDialogue: Now there will be entertainment ... big time entertainment

dialogue: Aayenda uske aas paas bhi dhikai diya ... toh itni zor se maroonga ki thook bhi nahi ugal sakega
englishDialogue: If I ever see you near her ... then I will hit you so badly that you won't even be able to gulp your spit

dialogue: Jism ki maut insaan ki maut nahi hoti
englishDialogue: The death of a body is not the death of a person

dialogue: Election mein gareebo se vaade aur ameero se saude kiye jaate hai
englishDialogue: During elections you make promises to the poor and deals with the rich

dialogue: Aadha sach jhoot se bhi zyada khatarnak hota hai
englishDialogue: Half truth is more dangerous than lies

dialogue: Itne baazu itne sar, ginle dushman dhyan se ... harega woh har baazi, jab khelein hum jee jaan se
englishDialogue: So many hands and so many heads, let the enemy count them properly ... he will lose every battle, when we play with our heart

dialogue: Raat ke sannate mein jab kisi bhooke bachche ke rone ki awaaz aati hai ... toh raat bahut kaali lagti hai
englishDialogue: When you hear a hungry child crying in the silence of the night ... then the night feels very dark

dialogue: Yeh woh zamanaa hai ki tum aahista se sach bologe, toh koi nahi manega ... aur zor se jhoot bologe, toh sab maan lenge
englishDialogue: This is a generation in which if you say the truth quietly, no one will listen ... and if you shout and say lies, then everyone will listen

dialogue: Tum is samaaj ke liye sivah maut aur andhere ke kuch nahi ho
englishDialogue: You are nothing but death and darkness for this society

dialogue: Udaas hona, yun akele mein rona ... is injurious to health, sehat ke liye hanikarak hota hai
englishDialogue: To be sad and crying in alone ... is injurious to health

dialogue: Dosti ka ek oosul hai madam ... no sorry, no thank you
englishDialogue: Friendship has one rule madam ... no sorry, no thank you

dialogue: Dosti ki hai nibhani toh padegi hi
englishDialogue: If friendship is there then one must fulfil it

dialogue: Abhi mood nahin hai
englishDialogue: I am not in the mood

dialogue: Ek ladka ladki kabhi dost nahin hote
englishDialogue: A boy and a girl are never friends

dialogue: Aaj kal darwaaze pe knock karke aane ka zamaana nahin raha
englishDialogue: Nowadays people don't knock on the door before coming in

dialogue: Aaj kal darwaaze ko lock karke rakhne ka bhi zamaana nahin raha
englishDialogue: Nowadays people don't keep their doors locked

dialogue: Yeh dukh naam ki bimari ka ilaaj kisi doctor ke paas bhi nahi ... iska ilaaj khud dhoondna padta hai ... dukh ko bhoolna parta hai
englishDialogue: No doctor has the cure for the disease of grief ... one has to find the cure for it themselves ... one has to forget grief

dialogue: Dhande mein koi kisika bhai nahi, koi kisika beta nahi
englishDialogue: In business no one is a brother, no one is a son

dialogue: Apne saath kaam karna hai toh usse imtihaan mein toh bethna hi padega
englishDialogue: If he wants to work with us then he must sit for the exam

dialogue: Joh aadmi ek lakh rupaiy mein tujhe yeh khabar de sakta hai ... woh aadmi paanch lakh rupaiy mein tujhe yahan laakar bech bhi sakta hai
englishDialogue: The man who can sell you this news for one lakh Rupees ... that man can also get you here and sell you for five lakh Rupees

dialogue: Jis tarah tumne doosron ka khoon bahaya hai ... waise hi ek din tumhare apno ka khoon bahega ... kyun ki woh saari goliyaan joh tumne doosron ke seeno par chalayi hai ... koi ek din tumhare apno ke seene par chalayega
englishDialogue: Just like you have spilled the blood of others ... like that one day the blood of your own people will spill ... because all the bullets that you have fired on the chest of others ... someday someone will fire them on the chest of your own people

dialogue: Is haveli mein rehne waala har insaan marega ... yeh haveli nahi maut ka ghar hai
englishDialogue: Every person living in this mansion will die ... this mansion is a house of death

dialogue: Main kabar khodta nahi hoon ... main kabar banata hoon ... aur ab ek ek karke tum sabki kabaren yahan ban jayengi
englishDialogue: I don't dig graves ... I make graves ... and now one by one all your graves will be made here

dialogue: Biwi ko achcha khana pakana aur achcha gaana toh zaroor aana chahiye
englishDialogue: A wife should definitely know how to cook well and how to sing well

dialogue: Khushi hazar sahi, gham judha nahi hota ... gareeb kitni bhi pee le, nasha nahi hota
englishDialogue: No matter how much happiness is there, sadness doesn't leave us ... no matter how much a poor person drinks, he doesn't get drunk

dialogue: Achcha bura toh waqt hota hai ... aadmi nahi ... bure waqt hi pata chalta hai aadmi bura hai ki achcha
englishDialogue: Time happens to be good or bad ... not a person ... and during bad times is when you get to know if a person is good or bad

dialogue: Aurat ki bewafai ko samajhna duniya ke kisi mard ke bas ki baat nahi
englishDialogue: No man in the world can understand the dishonesty from a woman

dialogue: Main tumhari yaadon ki mitti se tumhari murti banakar ... zindagi bhar uski puja karta rahoonga
englishDialogue: I'll make a statue from the soil of your memories ... and I'll worship that for my entire life

dialogue: Aapke haathon bikke hum, uski kudrat dekhiye ... baat ki sholon ki, aur khud pani pani ho gaye
englishDialogue: I was bought by you, look at gods play ... you talked about embers, and you yourself got scared

dialogue: Zindagi subah ki dhoop ki tarah phailti hai ... joh kal andhere mein tha woh tumhe aaj dikhai dene laga ... joh aaj ka andhera hai woh kal ki roshni ke saath door ho jayega
englishDialogue: Life spreads like the sunlight of morning ... today you're able to see the thing that was in darkness yesterday ... and the darkness of today will go away with the sunlight of tomorrow

dialogue: Jab sar ke upar se chatt aur pair ke neeche se naram carpet hat jayega ... tab pata chalega isse ki bahar ki duniya baap ka ghar nahi hai
englishDialogue: When the roof above his head and the soft carpet under his feet will go away ... then he'll come to know that the world outside is not his father's house

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi naam hona bhi badnaami ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes becoming famous turns into defamation

dialogue: Woh bank is duniya mein nahi bana joh pyar ki keemat ka cheque cash kara sake
englishDialogue: A bank that can cash the cheque for the value of love doesn't exists in this world

dialogue: Tumhara saath ho aur tumhare seene par mera sar ho toh ... aasman ki chatt aur zameen ka bistar hi kaafi hai mere liye
englishDialogue: If I have your company and if my head is on your chest ... then the roof of the sky and the bed of the ground is more than enough for me

dialogue: Pyar ki taqat mitti ko sona bana deti hai ... jisse duniya ki koi taqat mitta nahi sakti
englishDialogue: The power of love can turn mud into gold ... which no power of the world can erase

dialogue: Aurat ka sangharsh uske aasuon se nahi ... uske nischay se hota hai
englishDialogue: The battle of a woman is not with her tears ... it is with her decisions

dialogue: Yeh nyay nahi ... anyay hai!
englishDialogue: This is not justice ... it is injustice!

dialogue: Dhande aur career ke bare mein bhai, bhai se jal sakta hai
englishDialogue: When it comes to business and career, a brother can be jealous of another brother

dialogue: Ho jaye tayaar, jaana hai bahaar, waqt hai kam, manzil hai door ... lekin jaana hai zaroor
englishDialogue: Get ready, we have to go out, the time is less, the destination is far ... but we have to go

dialogue: Gareeb ka dil agar sone ka hota hai ... toh haath faulaad ke hote hai
englishDialogue: If the heart of a poor person is made from gold ... then his hands are made from steel

dialogue: Mazdoor ko mazdoori paseena sookhne se pehle mile ... aur mazloom ko insaaf dard mitne se pehle
englishDialogue: A worker should be paid before his sweat dries up ... and a victim should get justice before his pain ends

dialogue: Haqeeqat chup nahi sakti banavat ke usoolon se ... ki khushboo aa nahi sakti kabhi kagaz ke phoolon se
englishDialogue: The truth cannot be hidden by the principles of lies ... and fragrance can never come from flowers made out of paper

dialogue: Inteqam bhi ek tarah ka insaaf hi hota hai ... joh saboot ka mohtaj nahi hota
englishDialogue: Even revenge is a kind of justice ... which doesn't depend on any proof

dialogue: Kanoon par kabza hamesha amir ka hi raha hai ... woh hamesha amir ke haath ki laathi bana hai ... toh gareeb ke haath ki hathkadi
englishDialogue: The rich have always controlled the law ... the law has always been a stick in the hands of the rich ... and the handcuffs in the hands of the poor

dialogue: Sooraj dhalne se pehle tumhare kadamon ke nishaan is gaon ki mitti se mitt jaane chahiye ... varna tum mitta diye jaoge
englishDialogue: Before the sun sets the marks of your footsteps should erase from the soil of this village ... or else you will be erased

dialogue: Akalmand ki pehchan gusse ke waqt hoti hai ... aur bahadur ki maidan-e-jung mein
englishDialogue: The smartness of a person is identified when he is angry ... and the strength of a person is identified in the battlefield

dialogue: Khetti kisaan ki hogi joh us par kaam karta hai ... zameendar ki nahi joh us par aaram karta hai
englishDialogue: The farms will belong to the farmers who work on them ... and not to the landlords who relax on them

dialogue: Gareeb ka muqaddar us par reham karne se nahi ... balki us mein zimmedari pehda karne se badla jaata hai
englishDialogue: The fate of a poor person doesn't change by having mercy on him ... but it changes by igniting responsibilities in him

dialogue: Paap se dharti phati, adharm se aasmaan, atyachaar se kaanpi insaaniyat, raj kar rahe haivaan ... jinki hogi taqat apoorv, jinka hoga nishana abhed, joh karenge inka sarvanaash ... woh kehlayenge Tridev!
englishDialogue: The earth is torn by sin, the heavens are cleaved by wrong, atrocities leave humanity trembling, the satans are ruling ... those who will have infinite strength, those who will target the evil unflinchingly, those who will destroy the wrong-doers ... they will be called trinity

dialogue: Police ka kaam hai kauwon ki tarah choch marna ... aur hamara kaam hai unhe bajra dalkar gumrah karna
englishDialogue: The work of police is to peck like a crow ... and our work is to feed them pearl millet and misdirect them

dialogue: Joh insaan jurm ke khilaaf awaaz uthata hai ... usko duniya baaghi hi kehti hai
englishDialogue: A human who raises his voice against crime ... is called a rebel by the world

dialogue: Kam kapde pehenna tujhe pasand hai ... aur teri is ada pe marna hum mein pasand hai
englishDialogue: You like wearing less clothes .... and I love this style of yours

dialogue: Intezaar kar aur dekh, maut jab dheere dheere aati hai ... toh kitni khaufnak hoti hai
englishDialogue: Wait and watch, when death comes slowly slowly ... then how ferocious it is

dialogue: Bade baap ka bigda hua beta aksar galat raaste par hi chalta hai
englishDialogue: An ill-mannered son of rich man usually walks on the wrong path

dialogue: Gunaah ke keechad mein begunaahi ke kamal kabhi nahi khil sakte
englishDialogue: The flowers of innocence can never blossom in the mud of crime

dialogue: Apne aasoon sukh jaye toh aadmi doosron ke aasoon pochne chala jata hai
englishDialogue: When the tears of a person dry then they go to wipe the tears of others

dialogue: Khoon ke saare rishtey ek sachche police officer ke liye ussi din khatam ho jaate hain ... jis din yeh vardi pehenta hai
englishDialogue: All blood relations for a true police officer end on the same day ... when he wears this uniform

dialogue: Hamare jaise police officer ki maut par, desh ka jhanda jhuk jaata hai ... haan jis din teri maut kanoon ke haathon hogi, ek kutta bhi rone nahi aayega
englishDialogue: When a police officer like me dies, the country's flag bows down ... but yes when you will be killed by the hands of law, not even a single dog will come to cry

dialogue: Kutte ko izzat di jaye toh use pichli seat pe bithaya jata hai ... par koode ko bori mein daalkar dicki mein patka jata hai
englishDialogue: A dog is given respect when it allowed to sit on the back seat ... but thrash is wrapped in a sack and thrown in the car trunk

dialogue: Jo neta desh ko progress ki aur le jaaye, us desh bhakt ko shaheed ho jaana chahiye
englishDialogue: The politician who takes the country towards progress, that patriot should become a martyr

dialogue: Kanoon ki hifazat karte karte, aap khud ek gunahgaar ban gaye
englishDialogue: By protecting the law overtime, you yourself have become a criminal

dialogue: Yeh gaon nahi shehar hai ... yahan darindon ko sher ki tarah bahaduri se nahi, shikari ki tarah jaal dalkar maara jata hai
englishDialogue: This is a city not a village ... here barbaric people are not killed with courage like a tiger, they are killed using a hunters net

dialogue: Agar kisi ne tilbhar bhi hilne ki koshish ki ... toh sabke sar jism se alag kar doonga
englishDialogue: If anyone tries to move even a bit ... then I will break everyone's head from their body

dialogue: Hum mein logo ko is hadh tak darrana hai ... ki unhe apni zindagi ka har din aakhri din lage
englishDialogue: We have to scare people to an extent that ... they should feel everyday of their life as their last day

dialogue: Farz ki keemat is vardi se shuru hoti hai ... aur kafan ke saath khatam hoti hai
englishDialogue: The value of duty starts with this uniform ... and ends with the shroud

dialogue: Hum mein kya joh turbat ke melay rahenge ... tah-e-khaak hum toh akele rahenge
englishDialogue: I don't care if there are festivals in the world ... I'll reside alone beneath the loads of dust

dialogue: Kadam aahista rakho, dil bichche hai paon ke neeche ... nazar tirchi na dalo, log mar jayenge teeron se
englishDialogue: Put your feet down slowly since there are hearts lying under your feet ... don't leer in such a way or else people will die with arrows

dialogue: Bulbul se, aashiyan se, na sayyaad se gila ... kismat mein qaid thi likhi fasl-e-bahar mein
englishDialogue: I have no complaints against the nightingale, the house, the hunter ... it was in my destiny to be locked in a cage in the spring season

dialogue: Allah joh banata hum mein moti teri nath ka ... lete kabhi rukhsar ka bosa, kabhi lab ka
englishDialogue: Had god made me the pearl of your face ... then sometimes I would have kissed your cheeks and sometimes your lips

dialogue: Ek baar mujhe pyar dikhane ke liye aao ... aye meri raat-e-jaan mujhko bulane ke liye aao
englishDialogue: Come over once to show me your love ... my love of night come over and call me

dialogue: Main bhi hai, Meena bhi hai, sagar bhi hai, saakhi nahi ... jee mein aata hai laga de aag maikhane ko hum
englishDialogue: I'm here, Meena is also here, the sea is also here, but my friend is not here ... I wish to put the bar on fire

dialogue: Bachche bado ko bhool jaaye par bade bachchon ko nahi bhoolte
englishDialogue: Kids can forget the elders but the elders never forget the kids

dialogue: Paise mein badi taqat hoti hai ... jinke paas paisa nahi hai na, unse toh unke apne bhi nazar pher lete hai ... aur jinke paas paisa hai, unke gair tak apne ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: Money has a lot of power ... those who don't have money, they lose their near and dear ones ... and those who have money, even strangers become their near and dear ones

dialogue: Iss duniya ki gaadi baimaani aur rishwat ke paiyon par chal rahi hai
englishDialogue: The car of this world is running on the wheels of dishonesty and bribe

dialogue: Sangeet woh daulat hai jisse duniya ka koi chor chura nahi sakta, koi daaku loot nahi sakta ... sangeet woh jadoo hai jiske samne duniya ka har jadoo beqaboo ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Music is that wealth which cannot be stolen by any thief of this world, cannot be looted by any dacoit ... music is that magic in front of which every magic of the world becomes uncontrollable

dialogue: Insaan agar kisi baat ki umeed na rakhe toh na dil tootne ka afsoos hota hai ... na baad mein behosh hota hai
englishDialogue: If a person doesn't keep a hope for anything then you don't feel sad when your heart breaks ... and neither does he faint later on

dialogue: Waqt aane par na dushman ko chhodna chahiye ... na saanp ko dekhkar laathi ko todna chahiye
englishDialogue: When the time comes you should neither leave the enemy ... nor should you break the stick on seeing a snake

dialogue: Kismat hamare saath hai, uske haathon mein apna haath hai, chand chakori ki mulaqat hai, premi ko mili daulat ki saugat hai, lekin is baat mein bhi ek baat hai, shaadi ke baad main aapse poochunga daddy ... aapki kya aukaat hai?
englishDialogue: Luck is with us, my hand is in her hand, the bird and the moon are meeting, the lover has got a gift of money, but in this thing there is also a thing, and after marriage I'll ask you daddy ... what is your status?

dialogue: Ab toh baat hi baat hai, har taraf chandni raat hai, khushiyon ki barsaat hai, tera aur Kavita ka zindagi bhar ka saath hai, teri aane waali baraat hai, sari jaidaad apne haath hai ... aye kabootar rone ki kya baat hai?
englishDialogue: Now the time is good, everywhere there is moonlit night, it's raining happiness, you and Kavita will stay together for life, your wedding procession is going to come, the whole wealth is in our hands ... so why are you crying you pigeon?

dialogue: Teri tabiyat toh hamesha murghi ki tarah khauff ke ande diya karti hai
englishDialogue: You health just like a chicken always gives the eggs of fear

dialogue: Har ladki apne maikke ki chaya chhodkar sasural mein aati hai ... agar maa baap ki jagah saas sasur lele ... toh sasural mein maikke ki kami nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Every girl leaves the shadow of her parents house and comes into her in-laws house ... if the mother-in-law and father-in-law take the place of the mother and father ... then in her in-laws house she doesn't miss her parents house

dialogue: Pati ka pyar milne se patni mein sab kuch sehne ki shakti aa jaati hai
englishDialogue: A wife gets the strength to tolerate everything when she gets the love of her husband

dialogue: Maine jab se hosh sambhala hai ... khilono ki jagah maut se khelta aaya hoon
englishDialogue: Since I have held my sense ... I have played with death instead of toys

dialogue: Nasha toh ab utrega ... dosti ka, pyar ka, insaaniyat ka
englishDialogue: Now the intoxication will come down ... of friendship, of love, of humanity

dialogue: Abhi hamari ek mulaqat aur hogi ... aur woh tumhare liye aakhri hogi
englishDialogue: We will meet one more time ... and that one will be your last

dialogue: Meri nazroon mein jis aadmi ki jitni keemat hoti hai ... main uske saath utni hi sharat lagata hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever is a persons value in my eyes ... I place a bet with that person for that amount only

dialogue: Hamari organization ko insaanon ki nahi ... balki kaam karne waalon ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: Our organization doesn't need humans ... instead it needs people who do the work

dialogue: Is pistol mein teen goliyan hai ... kitni khaoge?
englishDialogue: This pistol has 3 bullets ... how many should I fire on you?

dialogue: Jis tarah dane dane pe khane waale ka naam likha hota hai ... bilkul ussi tarah har sikke pe paane waale ka naam bhi likha hota hai
englishDialogue: Like on every bite of food is written the name of the person who will eat it ... just like that on every coin is written the name of the person who will get it

dialogue: Hamara aadmi pehle zindagi se alag hota hai ... baad humse
englishDialogue: My man separates from life first ... and then me

dialogue: Jis tarah parayi biwi apne ghar mein laane se apni nahi ho jaati na ... ussi tarah paraya music apne desh mein bajane se apna nahi ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Just like by bringing a stranger's wife in your house, she doesn't become yours ... just like that by playing foreign music in our country, it doesn't become ours

dialogue: Is duniya mein insaan ki aukaat uski haisiyat uske paise se nahi ... balki uske karamon se pehchani jaati hai
englishDialogue: In this world the capacity and status of a person is not judged by his money ... instead it is judged by his deeds

dialogue: Ajeeb janwar hai ... kitna bhi khaye bhookha hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: What a strange animal ... no matter how much he eats he is still hungry

dialogue: Yeh mera ussool hai ... main hamesha ghar mein ghus ke hi maarta hoon
englishDialogue: My rule is that ... I always come in the house and hit

dialogue: Shakaal ke haath mein jitne patte hote hai ... utne hi patte uski aasteen mein bhi hote hai
englishDialogue: The number of cards Shakaal has in his hands ... that many cards he has under his sleeve

dialogue: Yeh zahreeli gas dheere dheere mehfil ko aur rangeen banati rahegi
englishDialogue: This poisonous gas will slowly slowly make this party much colorful

dialogue: Tum logon ko haarna hi tha aur mujhko jeetna hi tha ... is liye ke yeh baazi dono taraf se main hi khel raha tha
englishDialogue: You people had to lose and I had to win ... because I was playing this game from both sides

dialogue: Main unko yunhi nahi maar daloonga ... bahut khel khelke maaronga ... jaise billi chuhon ko maarti hai
englishDialogue: I will not kill them just like that ... I play will a lot of games and then kill them ... just like a cat plays with the mice

dialogue: Jab jab joh joh hota hai ... tab tab woh woh hota hai
englishDialogue: What happens when ... it only happens then

dialogue: Aaj se tum hamare dost ho, saathi ho, bhai ho
englishDialogue: From today you are our friend, our partner, our brother

dialogue: Zulm aur paap ka khel toh hamesha zaalimo aur paapiyo ki zindagi ke saath hi khatam hota hai
englishDialogue: The game of injustice and sin always ends with the death of ruthless and sinful people

dialogue: Pita ka hukum manna beti ka farz hai ... lekin patni ko pati se alag rehne ka hukum agar bhagwan bhi de ... toh usse bhi thukra dena patni ka dharam hai
englishDialogue: It is the duty of a daughter to obey her father's order ... but even if God gives an order to a wife to stay away from her husband ... then it is the religion of the wife to reject that order

dialogue: Pyar karne waale jismon ke milan par nahi ... aatmaon ke milan par bharosa karte hai
englishDialogue: People in love don't believe in the union of the bodies ... they believe in the union of the souls

dialogue: Badal ki taqdeer mein toh sirf garajna aur aasoon bahana likha hota hai
englishDialogue: Only thunder and tears are written in the destiny of clouds

dialogue: Jis pyar mein tyaag ho, woh tyaag mahaan hota hai ... aur usse bhi mahaan hota hai, tyaag karne waala
englishDialogue: The love that has sacrifice in it, that sacrifice is great ... and much greater than that, is the one who gives the sacrifice

dialogue: Kaante beejhne waale kaanto par hi chala karte hai ... kaante beejhkar phoolon ki umeed moorkh kiya karte hai
englishDialogue: Those who sow thorns walk on thorns itself ... only fools expect flowers after sowing thorns

dialogue: Agar garajne se hi barbadi ka toofan uthne lage ... toh barasne ki zaroorat nahi padti
englishDialogue: If the storm of destruction starts just by thundering ... then there is no need for the rain

dialogue: Joh jeevan de sakta hai ... woh jeevan le nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The one who gives a life ... will not take a life

dialogue: Duniya ke dastoor paon ki zanjeer ban sakte hai, maut ki nahi ... zamana zinda laashon ka milan rok sakta hai, aatmaon ke milan ko nahi rok sakta
englishDialogue: The laws of the world can become the shackles of the legs, not of death ... the world can stop union of living bodies, but it can't stop the union of the souls

dialogue: Pyar andha hota hai ... usse koi niyam, koi hadd dikhai nahi deti ... woh kisi bhi sulukh ki parwah kiye baigar apni hadd se guzar jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is blind ... it can't see any rules, any limits ... it crosses it's limits without worrying about any behaviour

dialogue: Insaanon ka paap ya toh aulad bankar samne aate hai ... ya phir aulad ko bhugatne padte hai
englishDialogue: The sin of a person comes out in the form of his child ... or else his children have to endure it

dialogue: Patthar par aasoon girne se, patthar pighalta nahi
englishDialogue: A stone does not melt when tears fall on it

dialogue: Ghamand toh ek sheesha hai joh toot kar hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: Haughtiness is a mirror that has to break

dialogue: Duniya alag alag ho jayegi lekin hamare desh ke Hindu Musalman ... kabhi alag nahi honge
englishDialogue: The world will get separated but the Hindus and the Muslims in our country ... will never get separated

dialogue: Bhagwan ka shukar ki jiye ki usne hum mein koi behen nahi di ... varna saala kehne par cheerkar phek deta
englishDialogue: Thank god he hasn't given me a sister ... or else on calling me your brother-in-law, I would have torn you apart and thrown you away

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Naye pati patni jahan bhi akele ho ... usse apna bedroom bana lete hai
englishDialogue: Wherever a recently married husband and wife are alone ... they make their bedroom out there

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Izzatdar aur bazaru aurat mein sirf ek hi farak hota hai ... suhaag ki nishani mangalsutra
englishDialogue: There is only one difference between a respectful and a disrespectful woman ... the sign of being married, that is her wedding necklace

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Tareef joh hai na woh ek promissory note ki tarah hai aur gaali hai ready cash ki tarah ... tareef karke kisi ko kharab karne se achcha hai ... ki gaali dekar usko sudhara jaye
englishDialogue: Appreciation is like a promissory note and cursing is like ready cash ... rather than appreciating someone and spoiling them ... it's better to improve them by cursing

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Aurat woh shola hai joh pyar se aadmi ki zindagi ko roshan kar sakti hai ... aur agar nafrat kare toh uski zindagi ko jalakar raakh kar sakti hai
englishDialogue: A woman is that flame which can lighten a man's life with love ... but if she hates him then she can burn his life into ashes

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Ek hi chhat ke neeche ek saath rehne waale alag ho sakte hai ... lekin ek hi ghar mein alag alag rehne waale kabhi ek saath nahi ho sakte
englishDialogue: Those who live together under the same roof can get separated ... but those who live separately in the same house can never get together

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Aadmi aurat ko dokha dete waqt yeh bhool jaata hai ki ... jis din aurat apni aan par utar aaye woh aadmi ko jeete jee chalti phirti laash bana sakti hai
englishDialogue: When a man cheats a woman then he forgets that ... the day a woman realizes her self-respect then she can make a man into a moving dead body

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: You came into my house that is god's nature ... sometimes I look at you and sometimes my furniture
englishDialogue: You came into my house that is god's nature ... sometimes I look at you and sometimes my furniture

movie: Ghar Mein Ram Gali Mein Shyam
dialogue: Pati rogi ho ya dhogi ho, yogi ho ya dhongi ho ... patni ka farz hai ki pati ke saath jeeye aur pati ke saath mare
englishDialogue: Whether the husband is sick or a cheater, whether he is a yoga practitioner or a fake person ... it's the duty of a wife to live with her husband and die with her husband

dialogue: Rishte sirf teen hote hai ... ek roti ka bhook se, doosra dosti ka dushmani se aur teesra zindagi ka maut se
englishDialogue: There are only three types of relationships ... one of bread with hunger, second of friendship with enmity and third of life with death

dialogue: Apun ki parchai maut ka pehghaam lati hai ... apun ki awaaz jung ka elaan karti hai ... aur apun ki maujoodgi sare bazar dushman ko nanga karti hai
englishDialogue: My shadow brings the message of death ... my voice announces the war ... and my presence makes the enemy naked in the middle of the market

dialogue: Aaisa dimak bankar khaonga ki kab tootta, kab bhikra aur kab tabah hua ... teri parchaiyon ko bhi pata nahi chalega
englishDialogue: I'll become such a termite and eat you that when you'll break, when you'll separate and when you'll be destroyed ... even your shadow won't come to know of that

dialogue: Jaise sher ki aankhon mein dekhkar uska shikaar apni jagah se hil nahi sakta ... waise hi mere dushman meri izaazat ke bagair kahin nahi jaa sakta
englishDialogue: Just like a prey can't move from its spot after looking into the tiger's eye ... just like that my enemy can't go anywhere without my permission

dialogue: First hand samajh mein aata hai, second hand samajh mein aata hai, third hand tak samajh mein aata hai ... lekin yeh aaisa hand hai jiska saala koi "The End" hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: I can understand first hand, I can understand second hand, I can even understand third hand ... but this is such a hand which has no "The End"

dialogue: Koi shayar, koi pagal, koi bepeer ban jaye ... teri tasveer joh dekhe woh khud tasveer ban jaye
englishDialogue: People might become a poet, or a crazy person, or unforgiving ... the one who sees your photo will himself turn into a photo

dialogue: Aurat aur zevar dono ka sangam is duniya ki sabse badi sundarta hai
englishDialogue: The union of a woman and jewellery is the biggest beauty of this world

dialogue: Bhagwan ki adalat ka faisla insaan ko pata nahi chalta ... is liye woh gunah pe gunah kiye jaata hai ... aur insaan ki adalat kabhi kabhi faisla karne mein dokha kha jaati hai ... is liye maine banayi hai teesri adalat joh tum jaise hathyaron ko sazaa degi ... saza-e-maut
englishDialogue: A human doesn't come to know of the decision in the court of god ... that's why he keeps on committing crimes ... and sometimes the court of humans makes a mistake in taking decisions ... that's why I've made a third court which will punish killers like you ... with the punishment of death

dialogue: Farz ki ibaadat aur usool ke maqaam par pahunchne ke liye ... bahut kuch peeche chhod dena padta hai ... taki farz ke raaste mein koi jazba rukavat na pehda kar sake
englishDialogue: To achieve the devotion for duty and the peak of principles ... you have to leave behind a lot ... so that no emotion can come in the way of duty

dialogue: Bahut kam baha khoon zameeno ki khatir ... katte sar hazaron haseeno ki khatir
englishDialogue: Very less blood has been shed for earth ... but thousands of heads have been chopped for beautiful women

dialogue: Main tujhe apne nange haathon se maaronga aur woh anjaam doonga ... ki marne se pehle tera dil phat jayega ... aankhen pathrane se pehle bahar nikal aayengi ... cheekte cheekte tere halak ki awaaz sookh jayegi
englishDialogue: I'll kill you with my naked hands and I'll make such a condition of yours that ... your heart will blast before you die ... your eyes will pop out before they close ... and the voice from your throat will dry up as you shout

dialogue: Kisi ka maara hua shikaar khana mera usool nahi ... aur maal ko baantkar lena mera pesha nahi
englishDialogue: It's not my principle to take someone else's dead prey ... and it's not my business to divide and take the bounty

dialogue: Main aandhi hoon joh ek hi saans mein hawa ka rukh badal deti hai ... yehi aandhi tumhe tinke ki tarah udhake maut ke ghat tak pahuncha degi ... aur woh ghat itna sookha hoga ki marte waqt joh tum pani maangoge ... toh tumhe pani ki boond bhi naseeb nahi hogi
englishDialogue: I'm that storm which can change the direction of the wind in just one breath ... and this storm will pick you up like a particle and drop you on the mountain of death ... and that mountain will be so dry that, even if you ask for water when you're dying ... then to you won't get even a drop of water

dialogue: Ek teer se do shikaar khelne waala khiladi ... kabhi kabhi khud apne hi teer ka shikaar ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: A player who aims for two targets with one arrow ... sometimes he himself becomes the prey of his own arrow

dialogue: Talvar jab tootti hai toh aadmi ki jaan bach jaati hai ... lekin kalam ki nok jab tootti hai toh aadmi ki jaan chali jaati hai
englishDialogue: When a sword breaks then a person's life is saved ... but when the tip of a pen breaks then a person loses his life

dialogue: Bada pyara hai pyare yeh ladki ka chakkar ... nahi mili toh shayar, mil gayi toh shohar
englishDialogue: Running behind a girl is a lovely thing ... you become a poet if you don't achieve her, or you become a husband if you achieve her

dialogue: Jaan lene se laash pe kabza jamaya ja sakta hai ... dil pe nahi
englishDialogue: You can claim possession on a dead body after death ... but not on their heart

dialogue: Ek achcha insaan banane ke liye aadmi ko puri zindagi bhi kam padti hai ... aur bura insaan banane ke liye sirf ek lamha kaafi hai
englishDialogue: For a person to become into a good human being, even the whole life is less ... and to become into an evil person, even one moment is more than enough

dialogue: Duniya mein ooncha naam kamane waale waqt se pehle apne iraade zahir nahi karte
englishDialogue: People who make a big name in the world don't disclose their intentions before time

dialogue: Duniya mein jis insaan ka zameer zinda hai ... woh maut bardasht kar lega lekin apni beizzati aur apmaan nahi
englishDialogue: In this world a person whose conscience is alive ... he will tolerate death but not his disrespect and insult

dialogue: Hukumat karne waale ke haath se taqat aur aurat ke haath se jab mard nikal jaata hai ... toh woh dono zyada der tak chup nahi reh sakte
englishDialogue: When power from a person ruling and a man under a woman's hand are lost ... then they both can't stay quiet for long

dialogue: Ladki hai ya naram naram double roti ... isko dekhte hi mohabbat ke pet mein bhook lag jaati hai
englishDialogue: Is she a girl or a soft bread ... after seeing her, I'm feeling hungry in the stomach of love

dialogue: Zehar ko amrit banaya jaa sakta hai ... lekin aaise insaan ko dus janam tak insaaniyat ka sabak sikhane ke bawajood ... insaan nahi banaya jaa sakta
englishDialogue: Poison can be turned into holy water ... but even if you teach the lesson of humanity for ten generations to a person like him ... still he will not become a human being

dialogue: Kanoon saboot ki nazaron se dekhta hai ... aur gawah ki zubaan ko samajhta hai aur sunta hai
englishDialogue: The law sees from the eyes of a proof ... and it listens and understands the language of a witness

dialogue: Jiske dil mein aag lagi hoti hai ... uski insaaniyat bhi ussi aag mein jalkar khaak ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Those who have a fire burning in their heart ... their humanity also burns in that fire and turns into ashes

dialogue: Pyar ek jazbaat hai joh kiya nahi jaata ... yeh ittefaq se ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is a sentiment that can't be done ... it happens by coincidence

dialogue: Shaadi toh kabhi na tootne waala ek bandhan hai, ek haqeeqat hai ... yeh woh rishta hai joh saans tootne ke baad hi tootta hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is a bond that can never break, it's a reality ... it's a relationship which breaks only when we stop breathing

dialogue: Phool pyar ki nishani hoti hai aur khushboo uska ehsaas
englishDialogue: Flower is the sign of love and it's fragrance is the feeling of it

dialogue: Ehsaas sirf dil mein yaadon ke diye jalate hai ... dilon ke beech nahi aate
englishDialogue: A feeling only ignites the lamps of memories in the heart ... it doesn't come in between the hearts
