dialogue: Maine tumhari tarah dikhave ke liye sharafat ka chola nahi audh rakha hai ... balki farz ki vardi pehani hui hai aur is vardi ka daaman saaf rakhne ke liye main apna khoon tak baha sakta hoon
englishDialogue: Like you I don't wear a coat of honesty only to show ... instead I have worn the uniform of my duty and I can even shed my blood to keep this uniform clean

dialogue: Hamari kitaab mein galati ka lafz hi nahi hai ... hum galat kare toh sahi kehlata hai aur zulm kare toh insaaf kehlata hai
englishDialogue: I don't have the word wrong in my book ... when I do wrong then it's called as right and when I do injustice then it's called as justice

dialogue: Jis tarah ghoda dabakar bandook se goli bahar nikaal dete hai ... ussi tarah galati manane waale ke sar par haath pherkar hum purani baaton ko dil se nikaal dete hai
englishDialogue: Just like I press the trigger and fire the bullet out of the gun ... just like that I roll my hands on the head of the person accepting his mistake and remove the old things from my heart

dialogue: Ek se bhale do, do se bhale chaar ... manzil apni door hai, aur rasta karna hai paar
englishDialogue: Two are better than one, four are better than two ... our destination is far, and we have to travel the road

dialogue: Jin haathon se tune mere bhai ka khoon bahaya hai ... un haathon ka woh hashar karoonga ki zindagi bhar un haathon ko phailakar maut ki bheek maangti rahegi ... aur maut tere kareeb aane se inkaar karegi
englishDialogue: The hands that have shed my brothers blood ... I'll make such a condition of those hands that you'll spread them to beg for death your entire life ... and death will deny coming close to you

dialogue: Har insaan apne karmon se pehchana jaata hai ... apne baap ke karmon se nahi
englishDialogue: Every person is known by his own deeds ... not by his father's deeds

dialogue: Baazuon ki taqat toh uparwale ki den hai
englishDialogue: The strength in the arms is god's gift

dialogue: Bhagwan ke prem aur vishvas ka ek hi saboot hai duniya mein ... joh maa ke dil mein mamta bankar palta rehta hai
englishDialogue: There is only one proof of god's love and faith in this world ... which grows in the heart of a mother as motherly love

dialogue: Pehle khoon ke baad aadmi kanoon se darta hai ... lekin do-char khoon karne ke baad kanoon aadmi se darta hai
englishDialogue: A person is scared from the law after his first murder ... but after two-four murders the law gets scared from that person

dialogue: Joh kam bolte hai, woh aksar khatarnak hote hai ... is liye chalak aadmi ko khamosh dushman se hamesha hoshiyar rehna chahiye
englishDialogue: People who speak less, usually are dangerous ... that's why a smart person should always be careful of a silent enemy

dialogue: Aasoon gareeb ki dil ki tijori se nikalne waale keemti moti hote hai
englishDialogue: Tears are the precious pearls that come out from the vault of the heart of the poor

dialogue: Izzat toh daulat walon ki hoti hai ... bhikhariyon ki toh izzat ko bhi duniya nafrat ki nazar se dekhti hai
englishDialogue: Rich people get respect ... whereas the world sees even the respect for beggars with an eye of hatred

dialogue: Naam lene se umar lambi nahi hoti ... umar lambi hoti hai mehnat se, mushaqat se
englishDialogue: Life gets longer by hard work, by toiling ... not by calling out a name

dialogue: Begum, ishq ka mazaa hi chupke chupke se karne mein hai
englishDialogue: Wifey, the fun of love is in doing it in hiding

dialogue: Actor kya hai? ... director ke haath ki kathputli
englishDialogue: What is an actor? ... a puppet in the hands of the director

dialogue: Pati ke gunn dheere dheere pata chalna chahiye ... usse pyar dheere dheere bhadta hai
englishDialogue: One should know her husbands talents slowly slowly ... with that love grows slowly slowly

dialogue: Climax mein pahuchakar drama ke chutti mat karao
englishDialogue: Don't spoil the drama after getting it to the climax

dialogue: Joh hai woh nahin hai ... aur joh nahin hai woh, woh kaise ho sakta hai?
englishDialogue: The thing that is there is not there ... and the thing that is not there, how can it be there?

dialogue: Jitna bada jism diya hai ... utna bada dil bhi diya hai
englishDialogue: The way you have a big body ... you also have a big heart

dialogue: Jhinga machi, machi hai ... lekin machi nahin, jhinga hai ... khoa ki barfi, barfi hai ... lekin barfi nahin, khoa hai
englishDialogue: Prawn fish, is a fish ... but it's not fish, it's prawn ... sweet from condensed milk, is a sweet ... but it's not a sweet, it's condensed milk

dialogue: Main tum logon ko aisi sazaa doongi ... ki tum log maut ke liye tarsoge ... aur maut tum tak nahi aayegi
englishDialogue: I will punish you guys in such a way ... that you people will long for death ... and death will not come to you

dialogue: Paap ke khilaaf na ladna ... sabse bada paap hota hai
englishDialogue: To not fight against the evil ... is the most evil thing

dialogue: Suraj ki kiran gandagi par padhti hai toh ... kiran mayli nahi hoti
englishDialogue: When the rays of the Sun fall on dirt ... then the rays don't get dirty

dialogue: Ek karsi Gangajal mein agar ek boond sharaab mila di jaye ... toh saara Gangajal apavitra ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: If you mix a drop of alcohol in the water from river Ganga ... then the whole water becomes unholy

dialogue: Zindagi ki cricket mein draw nahi hota ... ya toh jeet hoti hai ya haar ... aur jeet ussi ki hoti hai joh upar hai ... aur upar wahi hai joh neeche nahi hai
englishDialogue: In the cricket of life there is no draw ... you either win or you lose ... and the one who is on the top wins ... and the one who is not down is on the top

dialogue: Pyar paane ke liye koi bhi tareeka najayaz nahi hai
englishDialogue: No way is illegitimate to achieve love

dialogue: Tum mujhe giraftar toh kar sakte ho magar sazaa nahi de sakte ... jis din maine tujhe giraftar kar liya na ... us din kanoon bhi mera hoga aur sazaa bhi meri
englishDialogue: You can arrest me but you can't punish me ... but the day I arrest you ... that day the law will be mine and even the punishment will be mine

dialogue: Aaise tadpa tadpakar maroonga ... ki maut bhi teri laash ko dekhkar kaanp uthegi
englishDialogue: I will torture and kill you such that ... even death will get scared looking at your dead body

dialogue: Main tumhare jism ke har ang ko apni mohabbat ke sone se sajja doonga
englishDialogue: I will decorate every part of your body with the gold of my love

dialogue: Mohabbat ke liye mahalon ki nahi ... dilon ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: You don't need mansions for love ... you need hearts

dialogue: Mujhe Raj Mahal ki zindagi chahiye ... aur kisi Taj Mahal ki maut
englishDialogue: I want the life of mansions ... and I want to die in some Taj Mahal

dialogue: Raaste badal sakte hai, saathi badal sakte hai ... magar manzil kabhi nahi badalti
englishDialogue: The paths can change, the travelers can change ... but the destination can never change

dialogue: Gareeb sapne zaroor sajja sakta hai ... magar usse poora nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: A poor man can definitely see dreams ... but he cannot make them true

dialogue: Mujhe malum hota aaisa kalank mere ghar mein pehda hone waala hai ... toh main apne nakhoono se apni kok phad dalti
englishDialogue: If I knew that such a disgrace is going to be born in my house ... then I would have torn apart my womb with my nails

dialogue: Chaand ko apni chaandni sabit karne ke liye ... chiragon ki shahadat ki zaroorat nahi padhti
englishDialogue: To prove its moonlight the moon does not need ... the testimony of light

dialogue: Main kanoon ka baazu nahi khud kanoon banonga ... aur aaisa kanoon joh khud mujrimo ko pakdega, khud mukadma sunega ... aur unka faisla bhi khud karega
englishDialogue: I am not the arm of the law, I am myself the law ... such a law which itself catches the criminals, itself listens to the case ... and itself will decide on it

dialogue: Rishtey mein to hum tumhare baap hote hai ... naam hai Shahenshah
englishDialogue: In relation I am your father ... my name is Shahenshah

dialogue: Har reporter ki tarah meri ragon mein bhi khoon ki jagah roshnai behti hai ... aur jab tak woh roshnai behti rahegi ... mera kalam sachai likhte hue kaanpega nahi
englishDialogue: Just like every reporter ink flows in my veins instead of blood ... and until that ink is flowing ... my pen will not tremble to write the truth

dialogue: Business mein laga hua rupaiya ... saanp ke daanto mein phase hue mendhak ki tarah hota hai
englishDialogue: The money applied in a business ... is like a frog stuck in the teeth of a snake

dialogue: Shahenshah jahan khade ho jaate hai ... wahin darbar lag jaate hai
englishDialogue: Wherever the king stands ... the court is set right there

dialogue: Joh achcha tairakh hota hai na ... woh toofani lehron mein beh nahi jaata ... balki unhi lehron ko apni naav bana leta hai
englishDialogue: A good swimmer ... does not flow away in the storm waves ... instead he makes those waves as his boat

dialogue: Duniya ki koi jagah itni door nahi hai jahan jurm ke paon mein kanoon ... apni faulaadi zanjeeren pehna na sake
englishDialogue: No place in this world is so far away where the law ... cannot tie the steel shackles on the legs of crime

dialogue: Zakhm dene waala bhi wohi hai, bharne waala bhi wohi hai ... insaan toh sirf marham rag sakta hai
englishDialogue: God is the one who gives the wounds, and God is the one who fills them up ... a human can only apply the ointment

dialogue: Joh baant ke khaate hai ... unki sehat achchi aur umar lambi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Those who distribute and eat ... they have good health and long age

dialogue: Sachai apna saboot kudh hoti hai
englishDialogue: Truth itself is its own proof

dialogue: Shehar mein koi aaisa raasta, koi chowk, koi aasia naka nahi bacha tha ... jahan par katilo ne hum par goliyo ki barsaat na ki ho
englishDialogue: There was not one road, not one block, not one junction in the city ... where the bullets of the killers were not showered on us

dialogue: Jis din main koi gori titli dekh leta hoon na ... mere khoon mein sehkado kaale kutte ek saath bhaukne lagte hai
englishDialogue: The day when I see a white girl ... several black dogs start barking in my blood simultaneously

dialogue: Tum apni haddi pasliyan achchi tarah ginke rakhna ... kahin hawalat ke andhar jaate hue aur hawalat se bahar aate hue ... tumhari ginti mein farak na padh jaaye
englishDialogue: Make sure you count your bones properly ... because when you go to the jail and when you come out of the jail ... they should be the same in count

dialogue: Desh mein do kanoon nahi ho sakte hai ... ek gareebo ke liye, doosra ameero ke liye
englishDialogue: There cannot be two laws in the country ... one for the poor and other for the rich

dialogue: Tumne police ki vardi kahan pehan rakhi hai ... yeh toh ek kafan hai joh tumhare zameer ki laash ne pehan rakha hai
englishDialogue: You haven't worn the police uniform ... this is a shroud which is worn by the dead body of your conscience

dialogue: Tip baad mein dena toh ek rivaaz hai ... pehle dena achchi service ki guarantee hai
englishDialogue: It is customary to tip at the end ... but giving it first is a guarantee for good service

dialogue: Main yeh toh jaanta tha ki aurat agar apne makaam se uthe toh devi ban sakti hai ... magar yeh nahi jaanta tha ki agar girne pe aaye toh aap jaisi nagin bhi ban sakti hai
englishDialogue: I knew that if a woman stood from her place then she could become a Goddess ... but I didn't know that if she comes to falling then she can become a snake lady like you

dialogue: Aaj sharaab ki lehren baha do ... joh bhi aaye tumhare bar mein usse whiskey se nehla do
englishDialogue: Let the waves of alcohol flow today ... bathe anyone who comes to your bar in whiskey

dialogue: Yeh sachai ka bazaar hai ... yahan usool na beche jaate hai ... na khareede jaate hai
englishDialogue: This is the market of truth ... here neither ideals are sold ... and neither they are bought

dialogue: Aaj hum tumhare andhar chupe hue tamaam kaale kutte bahar nikalkar ... tumhara ghost nochne ke liye tum hi pe chhod denge
englishDialogue: Today I will remove all the black dogs hiding inside you ... and I will leave them behind you to nip your flesh

dialogue: Budhapa jab jawani ka intezaar karta hai ... toh bahut intezaar karta hai
englishDialogue: When old age waits for the youth ... then it has to wait a lot

dialogue: Jaan hum tumhari aaisi bhikharan bana denge ... ki maut bhi uski jholi mein bheek nahi dalegi
englishDialogue: I will make your life into such a beggar ... where not even death with give you anything

dialogue: Pyar toh rahega ... uske dil mein nafrat ki tarah aur mere dil mein nasoor ki tarah
englishDialogue: There will be love ... as hatred in her heart and as a wound in my heart

dialogue: Nasik ho yah Bambai ... ladkiyan ladkiyan hoti hai, patane ka tarika aana chahiye ... pyar kiya nahin jaata, karvaya jaata hai
englishDialogue: Be it is Nasik or Mumbai ... girls are girls, one should know how to impress them ... love doesn't happen, it is made to happen

dialogue: Tujh jaise desh drohiyon ko kanoon ke pairon par jhukane ke liye ... na vardi ki zaroorat hai aur na hi is pistol ki ... mere desh ke naujawanon ke sirf do haath hi kaafi hai
englishDialogue: To bend a traitor like you in front of the law ... one doesn't need an uniform and neither this pistol ... only two young hands of my country are enough for that

dialogue: Aadmi ko sirf rishtey rokte hain ... aur mera koi rishta nahin
englishDialogue: Only relations stop a man ... and I don't have any relation

dialogue: Ab meri baat dhyan se sunle ... varna zindagi bhar kisi ki baat sunne ke layak nahin rahega
englishDialogue: Now listen carefully to what I am saying ... otherwise you'll not be capable of hearing anymore

dialogue: Agar main tere liye mar sakta hoon ... toh tujhe maar bhi sakta hoon
englishDialogue: If I can die for you ... then I can even kill you

dialogue: Lotia jab deta toh ehsaan nahin karta ... aur jab leta hai toh lihaaz nahin karta
englishDialogue: When Lotia gives he doesn't do a favor ... and when he takes he doesn't respect

dialogue: Aankh ke badle aankh, haath ke badle haath, jaan ke badle jaan ... aur bhai ke badle behen
englishDialogue: Eye against eye, hand against hand, life against life ... and sister against brother

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi rooh jism se zyada taqatwar hoti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the soul is stronger than the body

dialogue: Joh haath rishwat lete lete aur apne farz ke saath gadaari karte karte ghis jaate hain ... un mein belt istamaal karne ki kya uthane tak ki taqat nahin hoti
englishDialogue: The hands which are used to taking bribe and betraying their duty ... they don't have the power to lift their belt, forget using one

dialogue: Chhodna mat ... pakadke rakh!
englishDialogue: Don't leave it ... catch it!

dialogue: In dono haathon ko milana hi meri zindagi ka maqsad hain ... aur zaroori hua toh meri maut ka maqsad bhi
englishDialogue: The only aim of my life is to bring both these hands together ... and if needed then the aim of my death too

dialogue: Uska aur mera toh khoon ka rishta hai ... khoon uska, chaku mera
englishDialogue: I have a blood relation with him ... his blood, my knife

dialogue: Jab duty tafri ban jaye aur juari vardi se darne ki bajah vardi ke saath behetkar jua khelne lage ... toh dav par chand sikke nahin ... mulk ki kismat bhi lag jati hai
englishDialogue: When duty becomes time pass and a gambler instead of being scared of a cop, gambles along with him ... then that bet not only has money ... but it also has the fate of the country

dialogue: Mera farz sirf gunahgaron ko rokne ka nahin ... balki gunah rokne ka bhi hai
englishDialogue: My duty is not only to stop the criminals ... but it is also to stop the crime

dialogue: Tumne apna raasta aur pesha bhale hi badal liya ho ... main ab bhi usse raaste par chal raha hoon aur mera pesha bhi wahi hai
englishDialogue: You may have changed your path and profession ... but I am still walking on the same path and my profession is also the same

dialogue: Achai ki koi seema nahi hoti ... aur burai ka koi anth nahi
englishDialogue: Goodness has no limits ... and evil has no end

dialogue: Yeh aurat jaat hi aaisi hoti hai ... baat ka batangar bana deti hai, rai ka pahaad aur bedh ka sava-ser
englishDialogue: Women are like this only ... they make an issue out of small things, a mountain out of a molehill and a tiger out of a sheep

dialogue: Main aaj bhi phenke hue paise nahin uthata
englishDialogue: Even today I don't collect money that is thrown

dialogue: Mere paas maa hai
englishDialogue: I have mom

dialogue: Aaj khush to bahut hoge tum?
englishDialogue: Today you will be very happy right?

dialogue: Koi is liye pee raha hai ki din bhar kaam kiya, thak gaye ... koi is liye pee raha hai ki aaj din bhar kuch nahi kiya, bore ho gaye ... koi is liye pee raha hai ki aaj doston ke saath hai ... aur koi is liye pee raha hai ki aaj dost saath nahi
englishDialogue: Someone is drinking because they've worked for the entire day and are tired ... someone is drinking because they didn't do anything today and are bored ... someone is drinking because they are with friends today ... and someone is drinking because today their friends are not with them

dialogue: Jab tak ek bhai bol raha hai, ek bhai sun raha hai ... jab ek mujrim bolega, ek police officer sunega
englishDialogue: Until a brother is talking, a brother will listen ... when a criminal will talk, a cop will listen

dialogue: Zyada paisa aaye toh neend nahi aati ... neend aaye toh zyada paisa nahi aata
englishDialogue: When a lot of money comes then you can't sleep ... and when you sleep a lot of money can't come

dialogue: Main jab bhi kisise dushmani mod leta hoon ... saste mehenge ki parvah nahi karta
englishDialogue: Whenever I take enemity against someone ... I don't care about its cost

dialogue: Isse apni jeb mein rakh le Peter ... ab yeh taala main teri jeb se chabi nikaalkar hi kholoonga
englishDialogue: Peter keep this (key) in your pocket ... I will open this lock only after I remove the keys from your pocket

dialogue: Sapne bhi samundar ki leharon ki tarah ... haqeeqat ki chattanon se takraate hi toot jaate hain
englishDialogue: Dreams are like the waves of the ocean ... they clash with the rocks of reality and break

dialogue: Jao pehle us aadmi ka sign lekar aao jisne mere haath pe yeh likh diya tha ... uske baad mere bhai tum jis kagaz pe kahoge main uspe sign kar doonga
englishDialogue: Go first get the sign of the person who wrote this on my hand ... after that my brother I will sign on any paper that you say

dialogue: Aaj mere paas buildingey hai, property hai, bank balance hai, bungla hai, gaadi hai ... kya hai, kya hai tumhare pass?
englishDialogue: Today I have buildings, properties, bank balance, bungalow, car ... what do you have?

dialogue: Yeh duniya ek third class ka dibba ban gayi hai ... jagah bahut kam hai, musafir zyada
englishDialogue: This world has become a third grade place ... the space is very less and people are more

dialogue: Suna hai lift ki deewaaron ke kaan nahin hote
englishDialogue: I have heard that walls of an elevator do not have ears

dialogue: Bhai, tum sign karoge ya nahin?
englishDialogue: Brother, will you sign or no?

dialogue: Jis raaste par main chal raha hoon uska anjaam shayad bura bhi ho sakta hai ... lekin jis raaste pe tum chal rahe ho uska anjaam sirf bura hi hota hai bhai
englishDialogue: The path that I am on may result in something bad ... but the path that you are on will definitely result into something bad

dialogue: Tu abhi itna amir nahi hua beta ... ki apni maa ko khareed sake
englishDialogue: My son you haven't become that rich yet ... that you can buy your own mom

dialogue: Car se aane waale aksar derr se aate hai
englishDialogue: People who come by car are usually late

dialogue: Uff tumhare ussool, tumhare adarsh ... kis kaam ke hai tumhare ussool ... tumhare saare ussoolon ko goond kar ek waqt ki roti nahi banayi ja sakti
englishDialogue: Ohh your beliefs, your idols ... what's the use of these beliefs ... all your beliefs mixed together cannot even make a single meal

dialogue: Paisa nahi toh kuch aur sahi ... har insaan ki koi na koi kamzori zaroor hoti hai
englishDialogue: If not money then something else ... every person has a weakness for something or the other

dialogue: Jis kaam ke liye aapne mujhe rakha hai ... woh kaam kaise kiya jayega ... yeh soochna bhi mera kaam hai
englishDialogue: The work for which you have kept me ... how will that work be done ... to think about that is also my work

dialogue: Tumhari jaisi ladkiyan apna naam ... kapdon ki tarah badalti hai
englishDialogue: Girls like you change their name ... just like they change clothes

dialogue: Meri maa mujhe wapas dedo
englishDialogue: Give me my mom back

dialogue: Pyar aur sadbhavna ki badi se badi deewar bhi ... zindagi aur maut ke beech nahi khadi ho sakti hai
englishDialogue: Even the biggest of the walls of love and good will ... can't stand in between life and death

dialogue: Char-aane kamane ke liye aath-aane ka jhoot bolna padta hai
englishDialogue: To make 25 paise you have to lie worth 50 paise

dialogue: Humse poocho ki haqeeqat kya hai ... tum jisse apni mohabbat de do, usko daulat ki zaroorat kya hai
englishDialogue: Ask me what's the reality ... the person whom you'll give your love, has no need for money

dialogue: Aurat aur sharaab dono mein koi farak nahi ... dono ka kaam hai aag lagana
englishDialogue: There is no difference between a woman and alcohol ... both of them do the job of starting a fire

dialogue: Uljhe dhaagon ka sera toh mil jaata hai ... lekin uljhi zindagi ka sera badi mushkil se milta hai
englishDialogue: You can straighten up tangled thread ... but it's very hard to straighten up tangled life

dialogue: Poocha unse ishq kiya kya yeh koi paap hai ... usne kaha chup raho tere peeche khada mere baap hai
englishDialogue: I asked her what sin have I done by falling in love ... she said keep quiet since her father was standing me

dialogue: Mere khwaabon ke jharokhon ko sajane waali ... tere khwaabon mein kahin mera guzar hai ki nahi
englishDialogue: The one who decorates the balcony of my dreams ... do you mention me somewhere in your dream

dialogue: Chale the zamaane se mooh pherkar ... yaka-yak tera saamna ho gaya
englishDialogue: I had walked away turning my face from the world ... but suddenly you came in front of me

dialogue: Taar is majnoon ka aaya mujhe Holland se ... Sonia ji sair karke aa gayi England se
englishDialogue: I got a letter of this fanatic person from Holland ... and Sonia has come back after touring England

dialogue: Tumhare dil ki, mere dil ki, sari duniya ke dil ki ek hi awaaz hai ... rupaiya, rupaiya, rupaiya
englishDialogue: Your heart, my heart and the heart of the entire world is saying ... money, money, money

dialogue: Shut-up kehne waali ladkiyan toh sabse zyada pyar karti hai
englishDialogue: The girls who say shut-up, give the most love

dialogue: Ladki hai ki whiskey ki botal ... dekhte hi nasha aa gaya
englishDialogue: Is she a girl or a bottle of whiskey ... I'm intoxicated just by looking at her

dialogue: Abhe oh tan-tambure ... barsaati kan-khajure!
englishDialogue: Hey you musical instrument ... centipede from the rain!

dialogue: Chook gaye do nain se aur thokaren kha gaye paon ... moorakh mukhiya bhool kare aur bhugte saara gaon
englishDialogue: You slipped from both your eyes and your legs got hurt ... a foolish chief does a mistake and the whole village pays for it

dialogue: Punya kamaye kikri aur peepal daan kare ... jungle jaisa vaid kahan joh sabka dhyan kare
englishDialogue: The kikar tree earns the virtue and the fig tree does the donation ... there is no doctor like the jungle who cares for everyone

dialogue: Kaam kare so soonth kare aur kuch kare afeem ... karmo ki gath prani bhukte theli bhare hakeem
englishDialogue: Dried ginger does the work and a little is done by drugs ... a human pays for his deeds and the doctor fills his bags

dialogue: Dosti achchi ya buri nahi hoti ... dost achche ya bure hote hai
englishDialogue: Friendship is not either good or bad ... friends are either good or bad

dialogue: Waqt ke saath saath aadmi thoda bahut zaroor badalna chahiye ... varna waqt burra maan jaata hai
englishDialogue: With time a person should change at least just a little bit ... or else time feels bad

dialogue: Aaj kal achche chawal ki tarah ... achche ladke bhi black mein milte hai
englishDialogue: Just like good rice today ... you get good guys in the black market as well

dialogue: Zindagi mein sirf khushiya baanti jaati hai ... gham ka bhoj har insaan ko akele hi dhona padta hai
englishDialogue: In life you can only distribute happiness ... every person has to carry the weight of sorrow by themselves

dialogue: Joh log talwar ke zor par zinda rehte hai ... ek din unki gardan uss hi talwar se katti hai
englishDialogue: People who live on the strength of the sword ... one day the same sword will cut their neck

dialogue: Chori chahe ek paise ki ho yah lakh rupaiye ki ... chori, chori hai
englishDialogue: It does not matter if the robbery is for a paisa or lakh rupees ... a robbery, is a robbery

dialogue: Main roz kanoon banata hoon aur roz todhta hoon
englishDialogue: I make the law everyday and break it everyday

dialogue: Inteqaam ek aaisi sharaab hai ... yeh jitni purani hogi iska nasha utna hi tezz hoga
englishDialogue: Revenge is such an alcohol ... the more older it is, the more its intoxication will be

dialogue: Bhaagne ka naam jawani ... aur tham gayi toh thehra pani
englishDialogue: Running is called youth ... and if you stop then it is called standing water

dialogue: Kanoon, kanoon, kanoon ... kaunsa kanoon ... main apne liye khud kanoon hoon
englishDialogue: Law, law, law ... which law ... I am the law for myself

dialogue: Is trigger ke har tick ke saath tere chehre pe maut ka naksha ubrega ... lekin maut is revolver ke kis ghar mein hai ... yeh sirf maut ka farishta jaanta hai
englishDialogue: With every click of this trigger there will be a map of death created on your face ... but in which house of this revolver death is ... only the angel of death knows that

dialogue: Maut hi ek aaisi sachchai hai joh atal hai ... jisse koi bhaag nahi sakta
englishDialogue: Death is one truth which is firm ... no one can run away from it

dialogue: Maut ko ek baar dhokha dene se ... zindagi lambi nahi ho jaati
englishDialogue: By deceiving death once ... life doesn't become longer

dialogue: Joh main hoon woh main nahi hoon ... joh main nahi hoon woh main bilkul nahi hoon ... joh main bilkul nahi hoon woh main hoon
englishDialogue: I am not what I am ... I am certainly not what I am not ... and I am what I am certainly not

dialogue: Ajeeb nyay hai bhagwan ka bhi ... jinko bhook deta hai unko khane ko nahi deta ... aur jinko khane ko deta hai unko bhook nahi deta
englishDialogue: God's justice is strange ... those who are hungry don't have anything to eat ... and those who are not hungry have everything to eat

dialogue: Pet anaaj se nahi bharta ... pyar se bharta hai
englishDialogue: Food doesn't fill the stomach ... love does

dialogue: Hum waqt ka intezaar nahi karte ... waqt hamara intezaar karta hai
englishDialogue: I don't wait for time ... time waits for me

dialogue: Tumhare liye toh main ek sundar shareer se zyada kuch thi hi nahi ... aur ab bhi tumhe mere shareer ke alava kuch aur nahi milega
englishDialogue: I was nothing other than a beautiful body for you ... and now also you won't get anything else other than my body

dialogue: Duniya bahut choti hai ... yahan koi aaisi jagah nahi, jahan tum mujhse chup sako
englishDialogue: The world is very small ... there is no place here, where you can hide from me

dialogue: Kitna bada dil hai unka ... us dil mein sabke liye kitna pyar hai ... aur mere liye us pyar ki gehrai ka andaza, main bhi nahi laga sakti
englishDialogue: He has such a big heart ... there is so much love for everyone in it ... and how deep is the love for me in it, that even I can't estimate

dialogue: Zakhm maine diye hai marham bhi main hi lagaunga
englishDialogue: I will apply the ointment since I have given the wounds

dialogue: Gabbar ke taap se tumhe ek hi aadmi bacha sakta hai, ek hi aadmi ... khud Gabbar
englishDialogue: Only one man can save you from Gabbar's anger, only one man ... Gabbar himself

dialogue: Basanti in kutto ke samne mat nachna
englishDialogue: Basanti don't dance in front of these dogs

dialogue: Tumhara naam kya hai Basanti?
englishDialogue: Basanti, what is your name?

dialogue: Arrey oh Sambha ... kitna inaam rakhe hai sarkar ham par?
englishDialogue: Hey Sambha ... how much price money has the government kept on me?

dialogue: Kitney aadmi the?
englishDialogue: How many men were there?

dialogue: Bahut yaraana lagta hai
englishDialogue: It seems you are very close friends

dialogue: Jab tak tere pair chalenge uski saans chalegi ... tere pair ruke toh yeh bandook chalegi
englishDialogue: He will live until your legs keep moving ... if your legs stop then this gun will fire

dialogue: Tera kya hoga Kaalia?
englishDialogue: What will happen to you Kaalia?

dialogue: Aadhe idhar jao ... aadhe idhar jao ... aur baaki hamare saath aao
englishDialogue: Half of you go here ... half of you go here ... and the rest come with me

dialogue: Hum kaam sirf paison ke liye karte hai
englishDialogue: We work only for money

dialogue: Joh darr gaya ... samjho marr gaya
englishDialogue: If one is scared ... means he is dead

dialogue: When I dead, police coming ... police coming, budiya going jail ... in jail budiya chakki peesing, and peesing, and peesing, and peesing, and peesing
englishDialogue: The police will come when I die ... and when the police comes the old lady will go to jail ... and in the jail the old lady will grind, and grind, and grind, and grind, and grind

dialogue: Chal Dhanno ... aaj teri Basanti ki izzat ka sawaal hai
englishDialogue: Go Dhanno ... today is the question of Basanti's honor

dialogue: Mujhe toh sab police waalon ki suratein ek jaisi lagti hai
englishDialogue: To me all cops seem to have the same face

dialogue: Hum angrezon ke zamaane ke jailor hai
englishDialogue: I am a jailor from the days of Englishmen

dialogue: Itna sannata kyun hai bhai?
englishDialogue: Why is it so silent brother?

dialogue: Yeh haath humko de de Thakur
englishDialogue: Give me these hands Thakur

dialogue: Yunki, yeh kaun bola?
englishDialogue: Hmmm, who said that?

dialogue: Yahan se pachas pachas kos door gaon mein ... jab bachcha raat ko rota hai, toh maa kehti hai bete soo ja ... soo ja nahi toh Gabbar Singh aa jayega
englishDialogue: In a village fifty kilometers from here ... when a child cries in the night, then the mom says sleep my son ... sleep or else Gabbar Singh will come

dialogue: Holi kab hai ... kab hai Holi, kab?
englishDialogue: When is Holi ... when is Holi, when?

dialogue: Tum agar ek maaroge toh hum char maarenge
englishDialogue: If you kill one then we will kill four

dialogue: Dekho, mujhe befuzool baat karne ki aadat toh hai nahi
englishDialogue: Look, I don't like to talk nonsense

dialogue: Ab goli kha
englishDialogue: Now eat a bullet

dialogue: Soowar ke bachcho!
englishDialogue: Sons of pigs!

dialogue: Yeh Ramgarh waale apni betiyon ko kaun chakki ka pisa aata khilate hai re?
englishDialogue: Which flour mill do these people from Ramgarh use to feed their daughters?

dialogue: Loha garam hai ... maar do hathauda
englishDialogue: The iron is hot ... hit the hammer

dialogue: Ek ek ko chun chun ke maaronga ... chun chun ke maaronga
englishDialogue: One by one I will choose and kill ... I will choose and kill

dialogue: Ramgarh waalo ne pagal kutton ke samne roti dalna band kar diya hai
englishDialogue: People of Ramgarh have stopped feeding mad dogs

dialogue: Yeh haath nahi ... phansi ka phanda hai
englishDialogue: These are not hands ... they are hangman's knot

dialogue: Sardar maine aapka namak khaya hai
englishDialogue: I have been loyal to you Sir

dialogue: Kya samajhkar aaye the ... ki sardar bahut khush hoga, shabashi dega?
englishDialogue: What did you think and come here ... that the boss will be very happy and he will praise you?

dialogue: Thakur na jhuk sakta hai na toot sakta hai ... Thakur sirf marr sakta hai
englishDialogue: Thakur cannot bow and neither can he break ... Thakur can only die

dialogue: Iski sazaa milegi ... barabar milegi!
englishDialogue: You will be punished for this ... properly punished!

dialogue: Hamari jail mein surang?
englishDialogue: A tunnel in my jail?

dialogue: Paise ... aaise kaise paise maang rahe ho?
englishDialogue: Money ... what money are you asking for?

dialogue: Keemat joh tum chaho ... kaam joh main chahon
englishDialogue: Price whatever you want ... work whatever I ask

dialogue: Woh badmash hai lekin bahadur hai ... khatarnak hai is liye ki ladna jaante hai ... burre hai magar insaan hai
englishDialogue: They are naughty but they are brave ... they are dangerous since they know how to fight ... they are evil but they are humans

dialogue: Che goli aur aadmi teen ... bahut nainsaafi hai yeh
englishDialogue: Six bullets and three people ... that's injustice

dialogue: Izzat ki maut zillat ki zindagi se kahin achchi hai
englishDialogue: Death with respect is much better than life with humiliation

dialogue: Is pistol mein teen zindagi, teen maut bandh hai ... dekhen kisse kya milta hai
englishDialogue: In this gun there are 3 lifes and 3 deaths ... let's see who gets what

dialogue: Is story mein emotion hai, drama hai, tragedy hai
englishDialogue: There is emotion, drama, tragedy in this story

dialogue: Saanp ko haath se nahi ... pairon se kuchla jaata hai
englishDialogue: You crush a snake with your legs ... not with your hands

dialogue: Bach gaya saala!
englishDialogue: Bloody he got saved!

dialogue: Jis din main bhaag nikla ... bahut pachtaoge Thakur
englishDialogue: Thakur, the day I run out ... you will repent a lot

dialogue: Hamare jasoos is jail mein charon taraf failay hue hai
englishDialogue: My detectives are spread all around this jail

dialogue: Ab tak meri zubaan tujhse sawaal pooch rahi thi ... lekin ab jawaab degi teri zubaan aur sawaal karega hamara inteqam
englishDialogue: Until now my mouth was asking you the question ... but now your mouth will give the answer and my revenge will ask the question

dialogue: Bambai mein bus ki aur chokariya ki intezar nahi karni chahiye ... pati nahi kab aa jaye ... aaye aaye nahi aaye
englishDialogue: In Mumbai one should not wait for a bus or a girl ... who knows when they'll come ... or may be whether they'll even come or not

dialogue: Mujhe sone chandi se nahi ... un baazuon se pyar hai joh do waqt ki roti toh kama sake ... jinko duniya unki mehnat, unke naam se jaane ... jinki peeth par apne A1 baap ke naam ka stamp nahi hota
englishDialogue: I don't love gold and silver ... I love those hands who can earn to feed food twice a day ... whom the world knows because of their hard work and their own name ... and who don't have an famous stamp of their father on their back

dialogue: Takleef insaan ke andhar bahut kuch badal deti hai
englishDialogue: Affliction changes a lot of things inside a human

dialogue: Is dress ki taqdeer toh dekho ... tumhare pehente hi pehle se zyada khoobsurat aur bezkeemti ho gayi hai
englishDialogue: Look at the destiny of this dress ... after you wore it, it has become more beautiful and expensive than what it was before

dialogue: Agar aap log mera saath chhodkar gaye ... toh zindagi aap logon ka saath chhod degi
englishDialogue: If you guys leave me and go ... then life will leave you guys

dialogue: Duniya mein koi bhoot pret, koi jungli janwar is insaan naam ke janwar se zyada khatarnak nahi hota ... nuksaan toh sirf jeete jaagte insaan hi pahunchate hai
englishDialogue: In this world no ghost or spirit, no wild animal is more dangerous than the animal named human ... because only the living humans hurt us

dialogue: Badle ke aag mein jalti hui naari aur chot khai hui nagin ... dono ek samaan hoti hai
englishDialogue: A woman burning in the fire of revenge and an injured snake lady ... both are the same

dialogue: Lohe ke darwaze taqat se tootte na tootte ... akal se khule zaroor ja sakte hai
englishDialogue: It doesn't matter if the doors of steel can be broken with strength or not ... they can definitely be opened with a mind

dialogue: Bholenath ki teesri aankh hai hum ... aur jab yeh aankh khulti hai toh zindagi maut mein badal jaati hai
englishDialogue: I'm the third eye of Lord Shiva ... and when this eye opens then life turns into death

dialogue: Jab insaan nasha karko haivaan ban jaata ... toh haivaan nasha karko shaitaan hi banega na
englishDialogue: When a human gets intoxicated he becomes a monster ... hence when a monster gets intoxicated he will obviously become a devil

dialogue: Horror shows, horror novels kabhi mat padna ... dimaag ke khaate mein haddiyon ka dhancha nazar aata hai
englishDialogue: Don't watch horror shows and read horror novels ... because your brain then looks like a frame of bones

dialogue: Koyle ko kitna bhi sabun lagao ... woh kaala ka kaala hi rahega
englishDialogue: No matter how much soap you apply to charcoal ... it remains black

dialogue: Kapdon se izzatdar ... karamon se kaatilon ke pehredar ... police station chaloge mere sarkar?
englishDialogue: You're respectful by the clothes you wear ... you're a guard of killers by deeds ... Sir will you come to the police station?

dialogue: Agar ladki haan bole na toh chhodna nahi ... aur agar na bole toh chhedna nahi
englishDialogue: If a girl says yes then don't leave her ... and if she says no then don't tease her

dialogue: Is shehar ki kisi bhi adalat mein woh typing machine nahi hai ... joh warrant par Baba ka naam type kar sake
englishDialogue: No court of this city has a typing machine ... which can type Baba's name on a warrant

dialogue: Jinke khoon mein wafaadari hoti hai ... woh gaddari ke bare mein sooch bhi nahi sakte
englishDialogue: Those who have loyalty in their blood ... they can't even think about cheating

dialogue: Aag joh dil mein lagi hai, usse duniya mein laga doonga main ... joh teri doli uthi, zamaane ko jalaa doonga main
englishDialogue: The fire that is burning in my heart, I will spread that in the world ... if you get married, I will burn the era

dialogue: Hum toh kabse apni jaan hatheli pe liye ghoom rahe hain ... kambakht koi leta hi nahin
englishDialogue: Since a long time I am carrying my life on my palms ... bloody hell no one is taking it

dialogue: Pyar mein sauda karne ki aadat in aamiron ki ... jaan le leti hai hum jaise gareebon ki
englishDialogue: The habit of rich people to bargain in love ... takes life of poor people like me

dialogue: Jaan pyari hai toh uska khayal tak apne dil se nikaal do ... varna jal jaoge ... kyun ki hum diljale hain
englishDialogue: If you love your life then remove even the thought of her from your heart ... or else you will burn ... because I am burnt at heart

dialogue: Premi hai, pagal hai, deewana hai
englishDialogue: He is a lover, a mad guy, a crazy guy

dialogue: Main mar nahin sakta, na hi zinda pakda ja sakta hoon ... bas maar sakta hoon, sirf maar sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I cannot die, neither can I be caught alive ... I can kill, I can only kill

dialogue: Joh mere pyar ka daava na sabit kar sake ... woh jaan kis kaam ki hai
englishDialogue: The life that cannot claim my love ... is of no use

dialogue: Zindagi ka mazaa toh khatte mein hi hai
englishDialogue: The fun of life is in sour taste only

dialogue: Is dharti se gaddari mat kar ... varna yeh dharti phategi, sholay ughlegi ... aur tujhe raakh kar degi
englishDialogue: Don't cheat on this land ... otherwise this land will rip apart, erupt fire balls ... and it will turn you into ashes

dialogue: Joh jab Hindustan ko mitana chahega ... mitti mein mil jayega
englishDialogue: Whenever one will try to erase Hindustan ... they will dissolve in the soil

dialogue: Agar woh chale gaye ... toh insaan nahin, barood bankar lautenge
englishDialogue: If they go away ... then they will not return as humans, but as gunpowder

dialogue: Shukriyada karne se ehsaan khatam ho jata hai ... aur agar ehsaan khatam ho jaaye toh dosti kaise shuru hogi
englishDialogue: By thanking the favour ends ... and if the favour ends then how will the friendship start

dialogue: Maut ke saath sirf zindagi khatam hoti hai ... mohabbat nahi
englishDialogue: Only life ends with death ... not love

dialogue: Maut toh muft mein badnaam hai ...  jaan toh zindagi leti hai
englishDialogue: Death is defamed uselessly ... life is the one that kills

dialogue: Koi bhi insaan paidaishi mujrim nahi hota ... ya toh banaya jaata hai, ya phir ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: No person is a born criminal ... he either is made into one, or he becomes one

dialogue: Main tumhari maut bankar aaya tha ... lekin tum meri zindagi ban gayi
englishDialogue: I had come as your death ... but you became my life

dialogue: Dil sirf dhadakne ki bhasha jaanta hai ... usse yeh nahi pata hota woh kyun dhadak raha hai ... kiske liye dhadak raha hai
englishDialogue: The heart only knows the language of beating ... it doesn't know why is it beating ... and for whom is it beating

dialogue: Joh apne aap se ladta hai ... woh hamesha haar jaata hai
englishDialogue: The one who fights with himself ... always loses

dialogue: Jab bade, bade na rahe ... toh bachchon ko bada banna padta hai
englishDialogue: When elders are no more elders ... then the kids have to grow up

dialogue: Seene mein jis raftaar se goli utarti hai ... usse zyada raftaar se pyar
englishDialogue: The speed at which a bullet enters the heart ... love enters at a much faster speed

dialogue: Zakhm ko zakhm nahi samajhna bahaduri nahi ... bewakoofi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Not considering a wound as a wound isn't courage ... it's foolishness

dialogue: Goli ka koi imaan nahi hota ... woh yeh nahi dekhti ki jis seene mein woh ghus rahi hai ... woh seena kiska hai
englishDialogue: A bullet has no faith ... it doesn't see that the body that it's entering ... whose body is that

dialogue: Yeh dastarkhwan ek aaisi jagah hai ... jahan do insaan saath baithkar rotiyan todhte hai aur dil jodhte hai
englishDialogue: The dining table is such a place ... where two people sit together, break the bread and connect the hearts

dialogue: Zindagi bhar zillat ke tukdon par palte palte hamari haalat us apahij ki tarah ho gayi hai ... jiske paas chalne ke liye baisakhi toh hai ... par usse pakadne ke liye haath nahi
englishDialogue: After living our entire life on the pieces of humiliation our condition has become like that of a handicap person ... who has the crutches to walk ... but he doesn't have the hands to hold them

dialogue: Agar jurm ko khatam karna hai toh mujrim ko berahami se foran khatam kar dena chahiye ... I believe in bullet for bullet
englishDialogue: If you want to end crime then you should ruthlessly kill the criminal right away ... I believe in bullet for bullet

dialogue: Jab aurat baazi khelti hai toh uske haath mein jitne patte hote hai na ... utne hi uski aasteen mein
englishDialogue: When a woman plays a game then the number of cards she has in her hand ... she has that many up her sleeve as well

dialogue: Hindustan ke fauladi bazoo zung nahi khate
englishDialogue: The Indian hands of steel never get rusted

dialogue: Mard banne ka itna shauk hai ... toh kutto ka sahara lena chhod de
englishDialogue: If you so want to be a man ... then stop taking support from dogs

dialogue: Darakar logon ko woh jeeta hai ... jiski haddiyon mein pani bhara hota hai
englishDialogue: One who lives by scaring people ... has water filled in his bones

dialogue: Pinjare mein aakar sher bhi kutta ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Inside a cage even a tiger becomes a dog

dialogue: Yeh mazdoor ka haath hai ... loha piglakar uska aakar badal deta hai
englishDialogue: This is a hand of a laborer ... it melts iron and changes its shape

dialogue: Is ladai mein yah toh hamari poori jeet hogi ... yah poori haar
englishDialogue: In this battle we will either win completely ... or lose completely

dialogue: Kanoon aur insaaf taqatwar ke ghar ghulam bankar behte hai
englishDialogue: Law and justice are sitting as slaves in the house of the powerful people

dialogue: Joh gurda rakhta hai ... usse hi jeene ka haq hai
englishDialogue: One who has the courage ... only he has the right to live

dialogue: Ab saare neta log hawala ke chakkar mein hawalat ke chakkar khayenge
englishDialogue: Now all politicians will be imprisoned because of money laundering

dialogue: Iski maut soochni padegi!
englishDialogue: I will have to plan his death!

dialogue: Woh zindagi hi kya jis mein koi namumkin sapna na ho
englishDialogue: What good is a life in which you don't have an impossible dream

dialogue: Jab tak dil dhadakta hai ... sangeet zinda rehta hai
englishDialogue: The music lives ... until the heart beats

dialogue: Jab tum hasti ho tum bahut khoobsurat lagti ho ... you look very ugly
englishDialogue: You look very beautiful when you laugh ... you look very ugly

dialogue: Aaj joh khoon apne khoon ke liye pani ho sakta hai ... kal hum sabke liye zehar bhi ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: Today the blood that can become water for its own blood ... tomorrow it can also become poison for all of us

dialogue: Agar mujhe malum hota ki mujhe dekhkar tumhare chehre pe hazaar watt ki muskaan phail jati ... toh main kab ka aa chuka hota
englishDialogue: If I knew that there will be a 1000 watts smile on your face after seeing me ... then I would have come much earlier

dialogue: In haathon ne sirf hathyaar chhode hai ... chalana nahi bhoole
englishDialogue: These hands have only left the weapons ... they have not forgotton using them

dialogue: Aaj ke baad teri har saans ke peeche main maut bankar khada hoon
englishDialogue: From today onwards I will be standing like death behind every breathe of yours

dialogue: Laashen bicha doonga laashen!
englishDialogue: I will spread dead bodies!

dialogue: Hum usse hi dushman samajhte rahe ... joh hamare liye masiha tha
englishDialogue: We kept thinking he was our enemy ... who actually was our savior

dialogue: Sau kutte milkar bhi khule sher ka shikaar nahi kar sakte
englishDialogue: Even 100 dogs together cannot hunt a free tiger

dialogue: Pattharon ki is duniya mein devta banna toh bahut aasaan hai ... insaan banna bahut mushkil
englishDialogue: In this world of stones it is very easy to become God ... but very hard to become a human

dialogue: Chehre pe itna noor tumhare, aankhon mein itna pyar ... aaisa laga milkar jaise, aaj mile hai hum pehli baar
englishDialogue: There is so much beauty on your face, so much love in your eyes ... after meeting you today, I felt as if we are meeting for the first time

dialogue: Police ke insaaf aur zulm mein koi farak nahi
englishDialogue: There is no difference in the justice and the injustice provided by police

dialogue: Hum sab kuch chhod denge ... yeh ghar, yeh duniya, yeh zindagi
englishDialogue: I will leave everything ... this house, this world, this life

dialogue: Kaash unke zulm ki mujhe khabar hoti ... toh main tere jism par apna jism bicha deti
englishDialogue: I wish I knew about their injustice ... then I would have spread my body on top of your body

dialogue: Kasoor na mera hai na tera ... kasoor hamare daaman ka hai ... jis mein phool bhi gire ... toh kaante ban gaye
englishDialogue: It is not my fault, neither yours ... the fault is of our moral ... in which even if flowers fall ... then they become thorns

dialogue: Duniya ne toh apne dil nafrat se is kadhar bhar liye hai ... ki kisi aur shay ke tikne ki jagah hi nahi bachi
englishDialogue: The world has filled its hearts with so much hatred ... that nothing else can fit in there

dialogue: Gutter ke gandhe pani mein agar puja ke phool mila do ... toh woh Ganga jal nahi ban jata
englishDialogue: I you mix the flowers of worship in the dirty water from the gutter ... then it does not become water from the Ganges river

dialogue: Hamari duniya daulat aur maut ka woh chakravyuh hai ... jis mein ek baar dakhil ho jao, toh koi vapsi nahi
englishDialogue: Our world is such a labyrinth of money and death ... in which once you enter, then there is no return

dialogue: Agar zindagi mein kuch paana chahti ho, toh kuch khona seekho ... agar upar uthna chahti ho, toh thoda jhukna seekho ... agar kisi se jeetna chahti ho, toh usse haarna seekho
englishDialogue: If you want to achieve something in life, then learn to lose something ... if you want to rise above, then learn to bow down a little ... if you want to win against someone, then learn to lose against them

dialogue: Hum jaisa police waala sar par topi nahin, kafan baandta hai ... taki tum jaise hathyaaron ko ... kanoon ki zanjeeron mein jakarkar ... maut ke andhe kuye mein dhakel sake
englishDialogue: A cop like me wears a shroud on his head, and not a cap ... so that murderers like you, can be tied in the shackles of law ... and thrown in the dark well of death

dialogue: Jiske dil mein maut ka darr hota hai ... uske jism par yeh vardi nahin hoti
englishDialogue: One who is scared of death ... he does not wear a cops uniform

dialogue: Main har Hindustani ka bhai hoon ... lekin tujh jaise gaddaro ke liye kasai hoon
englishDialogue: I am a brother for every Indian ... but for traitors like you I am a butcher

dialogue: Yeh tumhara beta ho yah is mulk ke President ka ... A.C.P. Arjun Verma ki nazar sirf muzrim ko dekhti hai ... unke rishton ko nahi
englishDialogue: He may be your son or the son of President of this country ... A.C.P. Arjun Verma's eyes only looks at the accused ... and not at his relationships

dialogue: Aap sirf woh dekhte hai joh aapko dikhaya jaata hai ... aur main woh dekhta hoon joh dikhaya nahi jaata
englishDialogue: You only see what is shown to you ... and I see what is not shown to me

dialogue: Gehre se gehra zakhm bhi itna dard nahi deta ... jitna aaj tumne mujhe diya hai
englishDialogue: The deepest of deepest wound does not give so much pain ... what you have given me today

dialogue: Jab bhi hamari kismat hum mein muskurata hua dekhti hai ... toh usse jalan hone lagti hai
englishDialogue: Whenever my destiny looks at me laughing ... then it gets jealous

dialogue: Main haraam ke paise leta nahi aur halaal ke chhodta nahi
englishDialogue: I don't take money that you get for free and I don't leave money earned by hardwork

dialogue: Main khud police waala nahi hoon lekin kanoon ka ek aaisa sipahi hoon ... joh khud police ki vardi nahi pehanta ... balki maut ki vardi pehnata hai gunehgaron ko
englishDialogue: I'm not a policeman myself but I'm such a soldier of the law ... who himself doesn't wear the police uniform ... but instead I make the criminals wear the uniform of death

dialogue: Hindustan ki janta ko koi taqat se nahi jeet sakta ... jeet sakta hai toh sirf aasunyon se
englishDialogue: No one can win over the people of India with power ... if someone can win then it's just with tears

dialogue: Main toh samajhta tha ki insaan ka muqadar aasman pe behta bhagwan likhta hai ... lekin mera muqadar toh likha hai aapne woh bhi kaali syahi se nahi ... lal khoon se
englishDialogue: I used to think that destiny of a person is written by god sitting in the sky ... but you have written my destiny and that to not with black ink ... but with red blood

dialogue: Aaj raajneeti woh vaishya hai jiski kamai bazar ke sab log khana chahte hai ... aur neta ki kursi kutton ke beech padi hui haddi ki tarah hai ... ab is desh ka vatavaran do hi sooraton mein badla ja sakta hai ... ya toh sare netaon ko bhrashtachar ki kanooni azaadi di jaye, ya kisi bhi bhrasht neta ko zinda na chhoda jaye
englishDialogue: Today politics is a prostitute whose income everyone in the market wants to eat ... and the chair of a politician is like a bone in the middle of dogs ... now the atmosphere of this country can only be changed under two conditions ... either give all the politicians the freedom of corruption or else don't leave any corrupt politician alive

dialogue: MLA janta ka pratineedhi hai, uske sukh dukh ka saathi ... lekin aapne toh un teeno aksharon ka matlab hi badal diya ... "M" for murder, "L" for loot, "A" for Atrocities ... yani atyachar
englishDialogue: An MLA (Member of Legislative Assembly) is the representative of the people, he is a companion of their happiness and sadness ... but you have changed the meaning of those 3 letters ... "M" for murder, "L" for loot, "A" for Atrocities ... as in brutality

dialogue: Pehle din Meena, doosre din Tina, teesre din Reena aur aaj yeh nagina
englishDialogue: First day Meena, second day Tina, third day Reena and today you've bought this pearl

dialogue: Gareeb ki taqat uski vote hoti hai
englishDialogue: The power of the poor is their vote

dialogue: Gunde toh ungliyon par ginne ja sakte hai, phir bhi yeh gunde hum karodon par raj karte hai ... kyun? ... sirf is liye ki hum mein se har insaan yeh sochta hai ki woh akela kya kare ... woh yeh kyun nahi sochta ki hum sab milkar kya nahi kar sakte
englishDialogue: You can count the goons on your fingers, but still these goons rule over millions of us ... why? ... just because every one amongst us thinks that what will he do alone ... but why can't he think that together what not can we do

dialogue: Agar koi bhi aadmi vote dene gaya toh woh hamara gunahghar hoga ... aur uski sazaa maut hogi
englishDialogue: If any person goes to vote then he will be guilty ... and his punishment will be death

dialogue: Ladkiyan kapur ki tarah hoti hai ... teeli lagi nahi ki jalkar roshni dene lagti hai ... aur tum ladke tubelight ki tarah hote ho ... bahut der se jalte ho
englishDialogue: Girls are like a camphor ball ... the moment a matchstick ignites they start spreading the light ... and you boys are like a tubelight ... you start very late

dialogue: Maa se badkar duniya mein koi cheez nahi hoti ... koi rishta nahi hota ... koi jazba nahi hota
englishDialogue: In this world there is nothing greater than a mother ... no relation is stronger than that ... no emotion is stronger than that

dialogue: Yaadon ke aaine mein jab waqt ki dhool jamti hai ... toh chehre dhundale ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: When the mirror of memories becomes dusty by the sands of time ... then the images seen in them look obscured

dialogue: Tera tabassum ho gaya mere dil ke paar ... yeh zakhmi dil lekar kahan jaon main ... main chahoonga ki tum meri rafiq-e-hayat bano ... jab tak is duniya mein qaid muqarrar hai, tum mere saath raho
englishDialogue: Your smile went across my heart ... now where should I go with this wounded heart ... I wish that you become my friend in life ... and that you stay with me until captivity is constituted in this world

dialogue: Mausiki ki taseer aaise dil se nikalti hai ... joh paakh saaf ho
englishDialogue: The effect of music comes from a heart ... which is completely pure

dialogue: Aap ki aankhen meri taxi ki headlight ki tarah hai memsaab
englishDialogue: Madam, your eyes are like the headlights of my taxi

dialogue: Jab maine tumhare zindagi mein paon rakha, toh waapsi ke saare raaste saare darwaze bandh kar diye ... ab mere paas aur koi raasta nahi hai sivah tumhare, yah phir maut ke
englishDialogue: When I stepped into your life then I closed all roads, all doors of returning ... now I don't have any other choice besides you or death

dialogue: Jab do barabar ke log ek doosre ko kuch dete hai toh woh tofha kehlata hai ... lekin jab koi rayees kisi gareeb ko kuch deta hai toh wahi cheez bheek kehlati hai, madad kehlati hai
englishDialogue: When two equal people give each other something then it is called a gift ... but when a rich man gives something to a poor man then the same thing is called begging and help

dialogue: Kehdo uss bade baap ki beti se ke uske samaaj mein shaadi byah ek khel hoga, joh kagaz pe kiye hue dastakhat se bhi toda ja sakta hai ... lekin hamare samaaj mein hum usse puja mante hai ... agni ke saath pheron ke baad yeh bandhan atoot ho jata hai
englishDialogue: Go tell that rich mans daughter that in her society marriage is a game, which can be broken with a signature on paper ... but in our society we worship it ... and after the seven rounds around the fire this relationship becomes unbreakable

dialogue: Woh aulaad nahi janni, joh apne maa baap ke shraap se bach sake
englishDialogue: A child who can escape the curse given by his parents, is not yet born

dialogue: Kaun uthaya Raja Hindustani ko?
englishDialogue: Who woke up Raja Hindustani?

dialogue: Log kehte hai ki agar sherni ke mooh khoon lag jaye na ... toh woh zinda nahi chodti
englishDialogue: People say that if a tigeress tastes blood ... then she does not leave one alive

dialogue: Main aisa vaar karoonga ki Shakuni mama bhi sharminda ho jaye
englishDialogue: I will attack in such a manner that even Shakuni uncle will be embarrassed

dialogue: Yahan sab gadbad hai ustad ... naram garam hai aur garam naram hai
englishDialogue: Master, everything here is a disorder ... soft is hot and hot is soft

dialogue: You come come memsaab!
englishDialogue: You're welcome madam!

dialogue: Chai, cigarette, cheroot, beedi, paan, zarda, tambaku, brandy, whiskey yah rum ... in sab cheezo ke paale hi nahi maine gham
englishDialogue: Tea, cigarette, cigar, beedi, betel leaf, snuff, tobacco, brandy, whiskey or rum ... I have stayed away from all these

dialogue: Hum bahut bada sangeetkar, kalakar ... lekin aaj kal ekdum bekaar
englishDialogue: I am a very big musician and artist ... but nowadays I am completely idle

dialogue: Hamara father north Indian, hamara mother south Indian ... is liye hum complete Indian
englishDialogue: My father is a north Indian, my mother is a south Indian ... that is why I am a complete Indian

dialogue: Noton ka malik wahi hota hai ... joh unhe apni jeb mein rakhta hai
englishDialogue: The owner of money ... is the one who has it in his pocket

dialogue: Tum dushmano ko taane marte ho ... main dushmano ko goli marta hoon
englishDialogue: You hit your enemies with taunts ... and I hit my enemies with bullets

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein maafi nahi chalti ... sirf luck chalti hai
englishDialogue: In our business apology doesn't work ... only luck works

dialogue: Bichhoo se zyada khatarnak hoon main ... aur saanp se zyada zehereela
englishDialogue: I am more dangerous than a scorpion ... and more poisonous than a snake

dialogue: Jab hum offer karte hai ... toh koi hum mein inkaar bhi nahi karta
englishDialogue: When I offer something ... then no one says no

dialogue: Tumne gareeb dekhe honge ... gareebi nahi
englishDialogue: You might have seen the poor ... but you ain't seen poverty

dialogue: Main aate ki roti khata hoon ... aur tum gobar ki roti khate ho
englishDialogue: I eat bread made from wheat ... and you eat bread made from cow-dung

dialogue: Agar koi gareeb ladki apni izzat bechna na chahe ... toh duniya ka koi bhi amir uski izzat khareed nahi sakta
englishDialogue: If a poor girl doesn't want to sell her dignity ... then no rich man in this world can buy her dignity

dialogue: Sarr par croreron ke heere rakhne se ... aadmi akalmand nahi ho jaata
englishDialogue: Just by keeping diamonds worth millions on the head ... a person doesn't become smart

dialogue: Ek baar apne jism par hamla bardaash kar sakta hoon magar ... mere dil par joh hamla karega, main usse kabhi maaf nahi karoonga
englishDialogue: For once I can bear an attack on my body ... but if anyone attacks my heart, then I will never forgive them

dialogue: Tumhare dil ke jail mein umar bhar ke liye qaid ho gaya hoon ... chahkar bhi yahan se riha hone ka koi chance nahi ... aur tumhari zulfon ki zanjeeron mein is tarah jakad gaya hoon ... ki agar chahon bhi toh usse todh nahi sakta
englishDialogue: I've been imprisoned for life in the jail of your heart ... even if I want there is no chance of me being released from here ... and I'm tied up in the shackles of your hair in a way that ... even if I want I won't be able to break that

dialogue: Azaadi ka nasha sabse bada nasha hota hai ... usse bada koi nasha nahi
englishDialogue: The intoxication of independence is the biggest intoxication ... there is no other intoxication bigger than that

dialogue: Ek din woh aaisa hungama karega aur unka blood pressure itna bad jayega ... ki sirf pressure hoga, blood nahi hoga
englishDialogue: One day he'll do such a commotion and his blood pressure will increase so much that ... only pressure will be there and no blood

dialogue: Insaan apni umar se, apne aaude se chota bada ho sakta hai ... lekin haqeeqat mein insaan apni bahaduri se, apne kaam se chota bada hota hai
englishDialogue: A person can be small or big by his age and by his position ... but in reality a person is small or big by his courage and by his work

dialogue: Kanoon kabhi kisi ke samne sar jhukane nahi jaata ... balki bade bade mujrim aur soorma kanoon ke aage adab se sar jhukane khud aate hai
englishDialogue: The law never goes in front of anyone to bow it's head down ... instead the biggest of the criminals and rowdies themselves come in front of the law to bow down their head in respect

dialogue: Vishwasghaat sabse bada gunaah hota hai ... ek aaisa gunaah joh maafi ke layak nahi
englishDialogue: Betrayal is the biggest crime ... a crime that cannot be forgiven

dialogue: Tu toh kanoon ka woh pilla hai joh botiyan dekh ke talve chatta hai
englishDialogue: You are that dog of the law which licks the boots when you see bones

dialogue: Ek baar, sirf ek baar unke chehre mere samne saaf ho jaye ... main unka woh hashar karoonga ki woh duayen maangenge zindagi ke liye nahi ... maut ke liye
englishDialogue: Once their faces come in front of me ... then I'll do that condition of them, that they will pray not for life ... but for death

dialogue: Tu zulm badhata ja hum sabrr badha lenge ... mitt jayenge hum lekin tujhko bhi mitaa denge
englishDialogue: You keep increasing the cruelty and I'll increase the patience ... I'll get erased but I'll erase you as well

dialogue: Aurat ki sabse badi himmat hoti hai kisi gair mard ke aage apne jism se kapde utarna
englishDialogue: The biggest courage that a woman can have is to take her clothes off in front of a strange man

dialogue: Kaisi deewani hoon main, kaun pehchane ...  jisne deedar kiya bas wohi jaane
englishDialogue: Who can recognize how crazy am I ... the one who has seen me only he will know that

dialogue: Kitna haseen hai shabab dekhoge tab janoge ... kahan kahan khilte hai gulaab chuoge tab janoge
englishDialogue: You'll come to know how beautiful is my body when you'll look at it ... you'll come to know where all do roses blossom when you'll touch it

dialogue: Hamare hausalon ka sar kat toh sakta hai ... lekin tere aage jhuk nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The head of our morale can be chopped off ... but it won't bow down in front of you

dialogue: Aurat mitna jaanti hai, mitaana nahi ... aurat pyar karna jaanti hai, pyar ka sauda karna nahi
englishDialogue: A woman knows how to perish and not how to perish someone else ... a woman knows how to love and not how to sell love

dialogue: Roop badal lene se badan ki boo nahi badalti
englishDialogue: By changing your appearance the smell from your body doesn't change

dialogue: Jitna chahe zulm karle par yaad rakh ... uske baad bhi is bejaan jism se ek hi awaaz aayegi ... mera pyar amar rahe, meri mohabbat amar rahe, mera mehboob salamat rahe
englishDialogue: No matter how much cruelty you do, but remember ... even after all that there will only be one voice coming out of this lifeless body ... that my love shall remain immortal, my romance shall remain immortal, my lover shall remain safe

dialogue: Aurat ka jism toh bikh sakta hai magar uska dil nahi bikh sakta ... uske pyar ka mol nahi lagaya ja sakta
englishDialogue: The body of a woman can be sold but her heart can't be sold ... her love is priceless

dialogue: Deewane tu kya jaane kya hai mohabbat ... marne waale se poocho jeene ka matlab
englishDialogue: What do you know about love you crazy person ... ask the meaning of life from someone who is dying

dialogue: Main zindagi se nahi ... apne aap se naraaz hoon
englishDialogue: Not with life ... I am displeased with myself

dialogue: Main tumhare accountant ka beta hoon ... aur yeh pitai tumhare account mein bahut dino se likhi thi
englishDialogue: I am a son of your accountant ... and this beating was written in your account since days

dialogue: Chalo utho ... abhi tumhe bahut pitna hai
englishDialogue: Come on get up ... you still have to be thrashed a lot

dialogue: Main us Mahabharat ka Arjun hoon ... jis Mahabharat ke Duryodhan aap hai
englishDialogue: I am the Arjun of that Mahabharat ... in which you are the Duryodhan

dialogue: Heere ko apni keemat ka khud andaza nahi hota hai ... uski keemat yah toh johari jaanta hai, yah phir badshah
englishDialogue: A diamond does not have a sense of its own value ... its value is either known by a jeweler, or a king

dialogue: Aap sab apni dabi hui, kuchli hui, zillat bhari zindagi ka bojh utha sakte hai ... magar zulm ke khilaaf awaaz uthane ko tayaar nahi
englishDialogue: You all can lift the weight of your suppressed, crushed, humiliated life ... but you are not ready for raising your voice against injustice

dialogue: Arjun jab chidiye ki aankh ka nishana lagata hai ... toh usse chidiye ki aankh ke siva kuch dikhayi nahi deta
englishDialogue: When Arjun aims at the eye of a bird ... then he can't see anything else other than the birds eye

dialogue: Agar zulm karna paap hai ... toh zulm sehna bhi paap hai
englishDialogue: If it is evil to do injustice ... then it is also evil to endure the injustice

dialogue: Woh log kamzor hote hai jinhe zindagi jahan chahti hai wahan le jati hai
englishDialogue: The people whose life takes them where it wants are weak

dialogue: Har paida hone waale ko marte waqt kafan pehenna padta hai ... vaise hi har kaale dhande karne waale ko hathkadi pehenni padti hai
englishDialogue: Everyone who is born has to wear a shroud when you die ... just like that everyone who does unofficial business has to wear handcuffs

dialogue: Kanoon banane se pehle kanoon todne waale paida ho gaye the
englishDialogue: People who break the law were born before the law itself was made

dialogue: Socho kuch, bolo kuch, dekho kuch, dikhao kuch, karo kuch ... ho jaye kuch ... samajh mein aaya kuch?
englishDialogue: Think something, say something, see something, show something, do something ... and something else happens ... did you understand anything?

dialogue: Jab pyar ki aag ek baar jalti hai ... toh woh kabhi nahi bujhti
englishDialogue: Once the fire of love ignites ... then it doesn't go off

dialogue: Taala mazboot hone se kuch nahi hota hai ... darwaza mazboot hona chahiye
englishDialogue: Having a strong lock doesn't do any good ... you need a strong door

dialogue: Gareebon ko naukri se nikaal nikaal ke amir log thak jayenge ... magar uparwala naukri dete dete kabhi nahi thakega
englishDialogue: The rich will get tired removing the poor people from their jobs ... but god won't get tired from giving them jobs

dialogue: Buzdilon ki goliyan Karan ka seena dekh kar apna rukh badal leti hai
englishDialogue: The bullets of the cowards turn their direction once they hit the chest of Karan

dialogue: Devi devta naraaz ho jaye toh aadmi pareshan ho jaata hai ... lekin aadmi naraaz ho jaye toh devi devta parwah hi nahi karte
englishDialogue: A man gets worried if the gods becomes unhappy ... but the gods don't care when a person becomes unhappy

dialogue: Yeh kahan le aaye kaptan ... nazar aata nahi koi makan ... sirf kabristan kabristan
englishDialogue: Where did you bring me captain ... I don't see any house here ... it's only a graveyard

dialogue: Ye ada jaane tamanna aap se seekhe koi ... jaankar anjaan banna aap se seekhe koi
englishDialogue: Someone should learn this lovely style from you ... someone should learn from you how to act as a stranger even after knowing them

dialogue: Log phoolon ki khushboo ko bhool jaate hai lekin kaanton ki chuban ko nahi bhoolte
englishDialogue: People can forget the fragrance from a flower but they can't forget the sting from thorns

dialogue: Jisse barfo mein ice-cream khane ka shauk ho ... usse sardi nahi lagti
englishDialogue: Those who like to eat ice-cream in snow ... they don't feel cold

dialogue: Duniya mein ek hi Majnu hai, duniya mein ek hi Laila hai ... ek haath mein glass pakado, doosre haath mein thaila hai
englishDialogue: There is only one Majnu in the world, there is only one Laila in the world ... hold the glass in one hand and hold a bag in the other hand

dialogue: Gaadi aur meri aadat kuch milti jhulti hai ... chalte chalte chalti hai aur rukte rukte rukti hai
englishDialogue: The habits of this car and me are somewhat same ... it moves when it's moving and stop's when it's stopping

dialogue: Kar liya bahut kuch maine ab aur kuch karne ko jee chahta hai ... maar diya bahuton ko maine, ab marne ko jee chahta hai
englishDialogue: I have done a lot and now I feel like doing something else ... I have killed many but now I wish to die

dialogue: No Bond, no three-knot-three (303) ... chuttiyon mein bilkul free
englishDialogue: No Bond, no three-knot-three (303) ... and I'm totally free during a vacation

dialogue: Sarakti jaye hai rukh se naqab aashista aahista ... nikalta aa raha hai aftab aahista aahista ... woh bedardi se sar kaate mera aur main kahun huzoor aahista aashita ... ab aa bhi jaiye aashita aahista
englishDialogue: Slowly the mask from the face is sliding out ... slowly the sunlight is coming out ... she may cut my head with brutality and slowly I'll tell her madam ... now come over to me slowly

dialogue: Gaddari ki jitni badi sazaa hoti hai ... utna hi bada inaam
englishDialogue: The bigger the punishment of cheating is ... that much bigger is the reward

dialogue: Chand ki thandak bhi hai, ishq ki garmi bhi hai, farsh ki sakti bhi hai, jism ki narmi bhi hai ... thodi besharmi bhi hai
englishDialogue: There is chill from the moon, there is heat from love, there is hardness from the floor, there is softness from a body ... and there is a little bit of shamelessness as well

dialogue: Shatranj ke mohre wahi hai ... magar baazi palat chuki hai
englishDialogue: The pawns of chess are the same ... but the game has turned

dialogue: Kya main ek phool ki tarah khoobsurat ladki ko ek ... ladki ki tarah khoobsurat phool de sakta hoon
englishDialogue: To a girl beautiful as a flower, can I give one ... flower beautiful as a girl

dialogue: Jiske paas koi saboot ya gawah na ho ... kya woh nirdosh nahi hota?
englishDialogue: One who does have a proof or a witness ... can't he be innocent?

dialogue: Kanoon ki talwar se kanoon ka hi khoon kiya tumne
englishDialogue: With the sword of law you have killed the law itself

dialogue: Jab gareeb ka dil roh uthta hai ... toh apne hosh kho beheta hai
englishDialogue: When the heart of a poor person cries ... then he loses his senses

dialogue: Har ek aadmi ke saath kahi log hote hai phansi ke takhte par, koi akela nahi hota phansi ke takhte par ... uske saath us phande par dum todhta hai uski biwi ka suhaag ... uske bachon ka bhavishya ... uske ghar mein basne waali ek ek khushi ... uske aagan mein utarne waali ek ek kiran ... sabko ek saath phansi ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: There are many people who get executed when a person is executed on a scaffold, no one is executed alone ... along with him also dies the life partner of his wife ... the future of his children ... each and every happiness that resides in his house ... each and every ray of sunlight that lands in his veranda ... everything gets executed together

dialogue: Mujhe tumhari maut nahi, zindagi chahiye
englishDialogue: I don't need your death, I need your life

dialogue: Hum kahan aaise ki soche koi ... tumne socha toh yeh ehsaan hua
englishDialogue: I'm not so good that someone will think about me ... it's a favour that you thought about me

dialogue: Pehli baar jana ki chudi bhari kalaiyon ka matlab suhaag hota hai ... pehli baar jana ki subah ghar se nikle mard ke lautte kadamo ki aahat sunane ki koshish ko intezar kehte hai ... pehli baar jana ki biwi kehlane se hi aurat ke jism mein rooh padti hai
englishDialogue: For the first time I understood that a wrist full of bangles means to be married ... for the first time I understood that trying to listen to the footsteps of a man returning back home is called as waiting ... for the first time I understood that only when a woman is called a wife, a soul enters her body

dialogue: Duniya mein har aurat ek bikau maal hai ... woh chahe toh ghar mein bikke, chahe bazar mein ... kabhi woh paise ke liye bikti hai, kabhi ghar grahasti ke liye ... kahin woh khud bikti hai apni marzi se, kahin woh bech dali jaati hai
englishDialogue: In this world every woman is there to be sold ... she either sells in the house or in the market ... sometimes she is sold for money and sometimes for household duties ... somewhere she sells herself at her own wish and somewhere she is sold

dialogue: Kothe ki dehleez par aag hoti hai ... us par pair rakhte hi ladki ki izzat jal jaati hai ... aur woh izzatdar se tawaif ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: There is fire on the threshold of a brothel ... and a girl's honour burns when she steps on it ... and she turns from a respected person into a prostitute

dialogue: Dil pahad thodi na hai ... jahan se awaaz takrakar wapas laut aaye ... dil ki awaaz toh dil se takrati hai ... phir wahi bas jati hai
englishDialogue: The heart is not a mountain ... from where sound can bounce and come back ... the sound of the heart clashes with the heart ... and then settles right there

dialogue: Bazaaru cheezon se ghar sajaaye jaate hai ... basaaye nahi
englishDialogue: Things from the market can decorate a house ... but it cannot settle one

dialogue: Raah dekhongi sahiba ... laute toh bhi, na laute toh bhi
englishDialogue: I will be waiting for you ... if you return, and even if you don't return

dialogue: Kutta bhi lakh bura ho ... wafaadari nahi chodta
englishDialogue: No matter how bad a dog is ... he never quits loyalty

dialogue: Juda hone se rishtey nahi tootte
englishDialogue: Relations don't break upon separation

dialogue: Yeh saath pheron ka bandhan nahi hai ... vachan ka bandhan hai ... joh mujhe mitta toh sakta hai ... lekin toot nahi sakta
englishDialogue: This is not a bond of marriage ... this is a bond of promise ... which can erase me ... but it cannot break

dialogue: Nikal ja nahi toh tukdon mein bhijwa doonga tujhe
englishDialogue: Get out or else I will send you back in pieces

dialogue: Jeevan mein teen cheezon se hamesha parez rakhiye ... shakkar, namak aur neta
englishDialogue: In life always stay away from 3 things ... sugar, salt and politician

dialogue: Zukham kamzor aadmi ko hota hai
englishDialogue: Only the weak people catch cold

dialogue: Beva ki aankh mein khwab toh hote nahi ... bas aasoon hote hai
englishDialogue: A widow doesn't have dreams in her eyes ... she only has tears

dialogue: Jiske dil mein pyar ka chand utra ho ... woh bahut khush kismat hai
englishDialogue: The one who has the moon of love in their heart ... is very lucky

dialogue: Maska hai maska ... ekdum jhakaas!
englishDialogue: She is butter ... simply terrific!

dialogue: Agar ladki akeli ho aur woh bhi aap jaisi khoobsurat ... toh badmaash toh kya, hum jaise sharif bhi aap par toot pade
englishDialogue: If a girl is alone and that to as beautiful as you ... then forget the bad guys, even decent guys like me will jump on you

dialogue: Adaalat shaq par nahi ... yakeen ki buniyaad par faisla karti hai
englishDialogue: The court does not make its decision on suspicions ... it does on the basis of proof

dialogue: Joh kaam rishwat se na ho ... daan punya se ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: The work that cannot be done by giving bribes ... it can be done by giving charity

dialogue: Hum khatron ko paalte nahi, khatam kar dete hai
englishDialogue: I don't nurture threats, I finish them

dialogue: Jab doosra koi kaam kar raha ho toh beech mein dhakal dena badtameezi hoti hai
englishDialogue: It's bad manners to interfere when someone else is working

dialogue: Duniya mein joh aadmi jitna zyada chanda deta hai ... log usse utna hi sharif aur imaandar samajhte hai
englishDialogue: In this world the amount of charity a person does ... people consider them that much decent and honest

dialogue: Business mein main dosti nahi paala karta
englishDialogue: I don't encourage friendship in business

dialogue: Kisi badi khushi ke intezaar mein ... hum yeh chote chote khushiyon ke mauke kho dete hain
englishDialogue: In waiting for a big happy moment ... we miss these small small happy moments

dialogue: It is so simple to be happy ... but it is so difficult to be simple
englishDialogue: It is so simple to be happy ... but it is so difficult to be simple

dialogue: Is duniya mein jab tak bhalai rupai aur paison se na tauli jaye ... woh bhalai nahin kehlati
englishDialogue: In this world until a good deed is not weighed against money ... that good deed is not called a good deed

dialogue: Log zindagi ka sabse chota, sabse keemti labz bhool gaye hain ... pyar
englishDialogue: People have forgotten the smallest and the most precious word of life ... love

dialogue: Jisme insaan ki bhalai ho woh kaam kabhi bura nahin hota
englishDialogue: A task which is good for the human can never be bad

dialogue: Khushi ke gaane toh bilkul phuljadiyon ki tarah hai ... jalte hai aur bhuj jaate hai ... lekin udasi agarbatti ki tarah jalti hai der tak ... aur bhujne ke baad bhi mehakti rehti hai
englishDialogue: Songs of happiness are just like sparklers ... they burn and finish off quickly ... but sadness burns long like a incense stick ... and even after going off their fragrance still exists

dialogue: Raja ki puja sirf uske desh mein hoti hai ... aur vidhvan ki puja puri duniya mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: A king is worshipped only in his country ... and a scholar is worshipped in the whole world

dialogue: Katega bhunega toh alu ... isse main khaon ya bhalu
englishDialogue: The potato will be cut and cooked ... whether I eat it or a bear

dialogue: Insaan bhale hi nafrat zahir kare ... lekin uske dil mein pyar chupa hota hai
englishDialogue: Even if a person expresses hatred ... but still love is hidden in his heart

dialogue: Jis tarah soot aur kapas alag nahi ho sakte, tann aur mann alag nahi ho sakte, baal aur khaal alag nahi ho sakte ... issi tarah male aur female bhi alag nahi ho sakte ... in dono ka milap hi prem aur shanti ki manzil hai
englishDialogue: Just like thread and cotton cannot be separated, body and heart cannot be separated, hair and skin cannot be separated ... just like that male and female also cannot be separated ... their union is the destination of love and peace

dialogue: Insaan hona hi sabse oonchi zaat hai, sabse bada dharam, sabse nek mazhab
englishDialogue: Being a human is the biggest caste, the biggest faith, and the most virtuous religion

dialogue: Dilon mein agar sachchai na hoti ... toh mohabbat mein deewangi nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Had there not been truth in the hearts ... then there wouldn't have been any passion in love
