dialogue: Mere khamosh rehne se jiski maut hogi, uske saath sirf main maroonga ... magar mere bolne se jiski maut hogi, uske saath bahut log mar jayenge
englishDialogue: The one who will die if I remain quiet, with her only I will die ... but the one who will die if I speak, along with her many others will die

dialogue: Dil aur daulat ka mel kabhi nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: The heart and money can never get together

dialogue: Ishq ki duniya hoti hai mehboob ki ek nazar ... aur woh nazar zamane bhar ke husn se zyada haseen hoti hai
englishDialogue: The one look from a lover is the world of love ... and that look is more beautiful than all the beauties of the world

dialogue: Sach ko chupana ek bahut bada jurm hai ... duniya ka koi logic, insaan ka koi jazba is jurm ko justify nahi karta
englishDialogue: It's a big crime to hide the truth ... and no logic of this world, no passion of a person can justify this crime

dialogue: Tu aaisa khatarnak keeda hai joh aurat ki kismat khata hai ... tumhe maarna toh gunah nahi sawab hoga
englishDialogue: You are a dangerous insect who eats the destiny of a woman ... to kill you will be a reward and not a crime

dialogue: Nasha sharaab mein nahi hota bewakoof ... varna paimaane nachte
englishDialogue: Alcohol doesn't have intoxication in it you fool ... or else the glass would have been dancing

dialogue: Sau baar jahannam mein jalana ya rab ... jee chahe toh phansi pe chadana ya rab ... mashooq kahe humko buzurg ... woh din na dikhana ya rab
englishDialogue: Oh god burn me 100 times in hell if you want ... oh god hang me to death if you want ... but my lover calling me an old person ... oh god don't make me see that day

dialogue: Hamari shayari mein apne husn ka rang bhar do ... hamari awaaz ko apni adaon ka saaz do ... hamare tassavur ko zindagi bhaksh do
englishDialogue: Fill the colour of your body in my poem ... give the music of your style to my voice ... grant life to my imagination

dialogue: Zindagi mein yahi tamanna bhi thi hamari ... ki jab bhi pyar karenge ya toh taaron ki chaon mein ya talwaron ke saaye mein
englishDialogue: In life I've always wished that ... whenever I fall in love it will be under the shade of stars or under the shadow of swords

dialogue: Ya rab tu apni jannat ko rehne de apne paas ... humne zameen pe kar liya jannat ka nazara
englishDialogue: Oh god keep your heaven to yourself ... since I have seen heaven on earth itself

dialogue: Maa ki mamta ko maut ke thapadhe bhi nahi badal sakte
englishDialogue: Even the strikes of death can't change the love of a mother

dialogue: Joh doosron ke liye zehar gholta hai ... usse khud bhi zehar peena padta hai
englishDialogue: The one who mixes poison for others ... he also has to drink poison

dialogue: Tohe neend kaise aave hai re moore neend ki dushman ... yahan toh har raat kaali nagin bankar aave hai, dasse hai, jaan mein zehar gholke chali jaave hai
englishDialogue: The enemy of my sleep how can you sleep well ... here every night comes as a black snake lady, bites me, and mixes poison in my life and leaves

dialogue: Baaghi kamzor ho toh usse phansi ka takhta milta hai aur taqatwar ho toh takht milta hai
englishDialogue: If a rebel is weak then he is hanged to death and if he is strong then he gets the throne

dialogue: Talwar zulm karne ke liye bhi uthti hai aur zulm rokne ke liye bhi ... joh zulm rokne ke liye talwar ko uthta hai wohi bada kaam karta hai
englishDialogue: A sword can be raised to do injustice and even to stop injustice ... and the one who raises the sword to stop injustice is doing a great job

dialogue: Hota hai woh kaam achcha jiska ho anjaam achcha
englishDialogue: Anything that has a good ending is a good deed

dialogue: Iss tarah aanchalon se ulajhne ke shaukh ya kaanton ko hota hai ya mardon ko ... sheron ko nahi
englishDialogue: Either thorns or men like to play with scarfs ... not tigers

dialogue: Vaada kiya tha yaar ne aayenge din dhale ... suraj khuda ke vaaste ho ja tale tale
englishDialogue: My friend had promised that she will come in the evening ... oh please sun go away for the sake of god

dialogue: Junglee janwaron ke ghosh par jeene waala sher ... goli se ghayal hokar insaan ke ghosh ka bhookha ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: A tiger that lives on the flesh of wild animals ... becomes hungry for the flesh of humans if he is injured by a bullet

dialogue: Yeh raajneeti ke chakkar toh bas do kisam ke logon ko raas aate hai ... ek toh woh jinke ghar khane peene ki fikar na ho ... aur doosre woh jinke ghar khane peene ko kuch na ho
englishDialogue: Politics only works for two kinds of people ... first those who don't have to worry about food in their house ... and second those who have nothing to eat in their house

dialogue: Main paidahishi imaandar hoon ... baimaan ki maut marna mere liye beizzati hai
englishDialogue: I'm honest from birth ... to die the death of a cheater is dishonour for me

dialogue: Kadve sach se meetha jhoot kabhi kabhi achcha hota hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes a sweet lie is better than the sour truth

dialogue: Likhna padhna toh school mein sikhaya jaata hai ... lekin insaaniyat school mein nahi, sanskaron se aati hai
englishDialogue: Writing and reading is taught in school ... but humanity doesn't come from school, it comes from values

dialogue: Joota kitna bhi keemti ho paon mein hi pehna jaata hai ... sar pe nahi
englishDialogue: No matter how expensive a pair of shoes are, they are still worn in the feet ... and not on the head

dialogue: Pyar ka samay kam hai jahan ... ladte hai log kaise wahan
englishDialogue: Where there is less time for love ... how can people fight there

dialogue: Kaisa re baandha prem ka bandhan ... loot liya mera komal tann mann ... jaa ghar jaa tu dekh le darpan ... lagti hai burman ki lotan ... tu mera jogi main teri jogan ... main teri Rati tu mera Madan ... na main jogi na main Madan ... main toh hoon Raampur ka Lakshman
englishDialogue: How strong is this bond of love ... it has stolen my soft body and heart ... go home and look at the mirror ... you look totally lost ... you're my love and I'm your lover ... I'm your Rati and you're my Madan ... neither I'm your love nor Madan ... I'm Lakshman from Raampur

dialogue: Gham ka ilaaj gham se nahi ... balki himmat se hota hai
englishDialogue: Sadness is not treated with sadness ... instead it is treated with courage

dialogue: Jeene ke liye phool hi nahi chunne padte hai ... balki kaante bhi hatane padte hai
englishDialogue: To live you not only have to select flowers ... but you also have to remove the thorns

dialogue: Yeh Hindustani ladkiyon ka khaas andaz hota hai ... yeh haan bhi na ki tarah karti hai ... aur na haan ki tarah
englishDialogue: Indian girls have this unique style ... they say yes as if it's no ... and they say no as if it's yes

dialogue: Aashiq ko apni mehbooba ki sab adayein pasand hoti hai ... aur mard ko apni biwi ki saadgi
englishDialogue: A lover likes all the styles of his love ... and a husband likes the simplicity in his wife

dialogue: Mere jaal mein aayi hui chidiya udh nahi sakti ... kyun ki main uske par katar deta hoon
englishDialogue: A bird that comes in my cage can't fly ... because I cut their wings off

dialogue: Ab na ye haath chhodenge, na mooh modhenge, na dil todhenge
englishDialogue: Now I will not leave this hand, neither will I turn my face, neither will I break this heart

dialogue: Main bhi tumhari khoobsurati ki ek zamane se puja kar raha tha ... tumhari surat apni umeedon ki tasveer se mila milake dekh raha tha
englishDialogue: Even I was worshiping your beauty since years ... and I was trying to match and see your face with the pictures of my hopes

dialogue: Kali dekhi thi, ab gulzar hai tu ... churi dekhi thi, ab talwar hai tu
englishDialogue: I saw you as a flower bud, but now you're a flower garden .. I saw you as a knife, but now you're a sword

dialogue: Duniya bhi kitni ajeeb jagah hai ... jinhe hum chor, gunda aur badmaash kehte hai ... woh insaaniyat ke liye daulat ko thukra dete hai ... aur jinhe hum nek, shareef aur baizzat kehte hai ... woh daulat ke liye ek bachche ko apne baap se alag kar dete hai
englishDialogue: The world is a strange place ... the people whom we call as a thief, goon and naughty ... those people leave money for humanity ... and the people whom we call as good, noble and dignified ... those people separate a child from his father for money

dialogue: Kahin bhi apna thikana nahi is zamane mein ... na aashiyane ke bahar, na aashiyane mein
englishDialogue: We don't have a residence in this world ... not outside a beautiful house, not inside a beautiful house

dialogue: Woh kaali kaali botalein joh hai sharaab ki ... arre raatein hai in mein band hamare shabaab ki
englishDialogue: Those black bottles of alcohol ... have our nights of youth enclosed in them

dialogue: Jhamela char din ka tha, hawali they mawali they ... Sikandar jab gaya duniya se, dono haath khali they
englishDialogue: The fuss was of four days, and there were crazy and rowdy people ... when Sikandar left the world, both his hands were empty

dialogue: Beta rayees ka magar jangju bhi hai ... daulat ke saath saath, ladai ki khubhi bhi hai
englishDialogue: He is a son of a rich man, but he is aggressive as well ... along with wealth, he also knows how to fight

dialogue: Badalkar fakeeron ka hum bhes Ghalib ... ahle-e-tamasha ke dekhte hain karam
englishDialogue: Mr. Ghalib, we can change into a beggar's guise ... and see the spectacle of generocity

dialogue: Laayi hayaat aaye, qazaa le chali chale ... apni khushi na aaye, na apni khushi chale
englishDialogue: Life brought me, death took me away ... I didn't come at my will, nor did I leave at my will

dialogue: Rajneeti ke vachan samay ki zaroorat dekhkar diye jaate hai ... aur ussi tarah samay ki zaroorat dekhkar todh diye jaate hai
englishDialogue: The promises in politics are given according to the needs of time ... and just like that they are broken according to the needs of time

dialogue: Yeh azaadi ki ladai mere mar jaane se khatam nahi hogi ... yeh ladai toh mere mar jaane ke baad shuru hogi ... aur us waqt tak ladi jaati rahegi jab tak yeh Bharat maa ke bichade hue bachche maa ki ghod mein vapas nahi chale jaate
englishDialogue: This battle of independence won't end after I die ... this battle will start after I die ... and it will go on until these separated children of India don't return into the lap of their mother

dialogue: Jail ki deewar ko todkar bhaag jaana aasaan hai ... lekin prem aur dosti ki deewar ko phandna namumkin hai
englishDialogue: It's easy to break the walls of jail and run away ... but it's impossible to jump across the walls of love and friendship

dialogue: Pyar jab nafrat mein badal jaata hai ... toh khatarnak ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When love changes into hatred ... then it becomes dangerous

dialogue: Yahan suraj hamari aagya lekar nikalta hai aur chand hamare ishare se doobta hai ... hamare liye aane waale kal aur guzar jaane waale kal mein koi fark nahi ... dono hi hamare ghulam hai
englishDialogue: Here the sun rises with my permission and the moon sets with my gesture ... for me there is no difference between tomorrow and yesterday ... both are my slaves

dialogue: Dosti aur wafaadari ka saboot baaton se nahi ... kaam se diya jaata hai
englishDialogue: The proof of friendship and honesty is not given by words ... it's given by actions

dialogue: Aadmi zindagi aur maut dono se jhoot bol sakta hai ... lekin apni premika se nahi
englishDialogue: A person can lie both to life and death ... but not to his girlfriend

dialogue: Devta ki mahaan shakti apne bhakton ki hamesha raksha karti hai
englishDialogue: The powerful divine energy of god will always protect its worshippers

dialogue: Vidhata ne jab jeevan aur mrityu ke daurahe par doobara lakar khada kar diya hai ... toh is khel ko jeevan ki baazi lagakar hi khatam karoonga
englishDialogue: Since god has made me stand once again on the crossroads of life and death ... then I'll end this game by putting my life on the line

dialogue: Izzat hamare jeevan ka updesh hai ... daulat toh sirf jeene ka sadhan hai
englishDialogue: Respect is the moral of our life ... and money is just a mean for living

dialogue: Paisa insaan ko woh cheez nahi de sakta joh usse shiksha se milti hai ... izzat ... shiksha insaan ko izzat ke saath jeena sikhati hai
englishDialogue: Money can't give a person the thing that he gets from knowledge ... which is respect ... knowledge teaches a person to live with respect

dialogue: Sui ke is chote se chhed mein se oont jaisa bhari bharkam janwar guzar sakta hai ... magar ishwar ke raj mein daulat ka pujari kabhi nahi ja sakta ... kyun ki wahan daulat ka koi mol nahi
englishDialogue: A big animal like camel can pass through the small hole of a needle ... but under the rule of god, a money worshipper won't be able to pass ... because there is no value for money there

dialogue: Izzat ke bagair insaan ka jeevan, mrityu samaan hai
englishDialogue: Without respect, life and death means the same for a person

dialogue: Aadmi mein dil hota hai ... dil mein aadmi
englishDialogue: There is a heart in a human ... and a human in a heart

dialogue: Duniya mein ek cheez sher-e-babbar se bhi zyada khatarnak aur darawani hai ... aur woh hai gareebi aur bhookh
englishDialogue: In this world there is one thing that is more dangerous and scary than a tiger ... and that is poverty and hunger

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi puraane dino ki yaad ... sehat ke liye bahut achchi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Remembering the old days ... sometimes is very good for health

dialogue: Insaan is duniya mein chaar din ki zindagi guzaarne aata hai ... lekin chaalis din ka gham usse gehre rakhta hai
englishDialogue: A human comes to this world to live for 4 days ... but the sadness of 40 years keeps surrounding him

dialogue: Dil bada hona badi khatarnak baat hai
englishDialogue: It is very dangerous to have a big heart

dialogue: Saari ka kaam khoobsurati ko chupana nahi ... ubhaarna hai
englishDialogue: A saari is not used to hide beauty ... it is used to enhance it

dialogue: Dil insaan ka sabse bada dost bhi hai ... dushman bhi
englishDialogue: The heart is the biggest friend of a person ... and enemy as well

dialogue: Insaan badal jaate hai ... insaano ke naam nahi badalte
englishDialogue: People change ... but their names don't change

dialogue: Aurat woh haseen paheli hai jisse samajhne ke liye insaan baar baar galati karta hai ... magar phir bhi samajh nahi paata
englishDialogue: A woman is that beautiful riddle which a man tries to solve and makes a mistake multiple times ... but still he is not able to solve it

dialogue: Jis tarah main apne pyar ko ruswa nahi kar sakta ... us hi tarah apne farz ko bhi sharminda nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: Just like I can't dishonour my love ... like that I can't make my duty feel ashamed as well

dialogue: Apne yahan ki mitti ki khushboo hai na ... woh toh ajnabi logo ki saanson mein bhi sanskar bhar deti hai
englishDialogue: Even the smell of soil from our place ... fills culture in the breath of strange people

dialogue: Agar tumhare maathey ki bindiya aur maang ka sindoor, suhaag ki nishani nahi kalank hai ... toh mitta do isse
englishDialogue: If the bindi on your forehead and the vermilion in the (hair) parting, is a sign of disgrace and not your husband ... then erase it

dialogue: Yahan maa baap ke liye aulad sab kuch hai ... aur aulad ke liye maa baap?
englishDialogue: Here for the parents the offspring is everything ... and for the offspring the parents?

dialogue: Tum usse apna samajhte ho, joh madad leta hai ... main usse apna kehta hoon, joh madad deta hai
englishDialogue: One who takes help, you call him a friend ... one who gives help, I call him a friend

dialogue: Shareer jitna thanda hoga, jalne mein utna hi anand aayega
englishDialogue: The colder the body is, the more delightful it will be when it burns

dialogue: Abhi shareer mein garmi hai beta ... jab thanda ho jaye toh jhauk dena aag mein
englishDialogue: My body is still hot son ... when it gets cold then throw me into the fire

dialogue: Beti ke aasoon dekh kar bhi yadi pita ka dil na roye ... toh woh dil nahin patthar hai
englishDialogue: Even after seeing a daughter in tears if a fathers heart does not cry ... then that heart is a stone

dialogue: Jahan life partners badal sakte hain ... toh naam kyun nahi?
englishDialogue: When one can change life partners ... then why not the name?

dialogue: Desh pe marne waala, kabhi nahin marta
englishDialogue: One who dies for the country, never dies

dialogue: Jab yahan se jao, toh itne kalank saath lekar mat jaana ... jinhe Ganga maiya bhi na dho sakey
englishDialogue: When you go from here, then don't take so many disgraces with you ... which even the river Ganges won't be able to clean

dialogue: Sharam yahan ka sabse anmol gehna hai
englishDialogue: Shyness is the most precious ornament here

dialogue: Jab paschatap nahi ... toh prayaschit bhi nahi
englishDialogue: When there is no regret ... then there is no penance either

dialogue: Main marne se pehle marna nahin chahta
englishDialogue: I don't want to die before dying

dialogue: Cancer ke keedon ke samne ... na meri zindagi ki koi keemat hai ... na tumhare aasuon ki
englishDialogue: In front of the bugs of cancer ... there is no value of my life ... nor of your tears

dialogue: Tum shamshaan mein bujhi chitta ki rakh mein zindagi dhoond rahi ho
englishDialogue: You are trying to find a life in the ashes of a pyre in a mortuary

dialogue: Hum the jinke sahare, woh hue na hamare ... doobi jab dil ki naiyya, samne the kinare
englishDialogue: The person who was supporting me, didn't become mine ... when the boat of the heart drowned, then the shore was near

dialogue: Yeh toh main hi jaanta hoon ki zindagi ke aakhri mod par kitna andhera hai
englishDialogue: Only I would know how much darkness there is on the last turn of life

dialogue: Main tumhe tumse zyada jaanta hoon
englishDialogue: I know you more than you know yourself

dialogue: Har saas yeh bhool jaati hai ki woh bhi kabhi bahu thi ... aur har bahu yeh bhool jaati hai ki usse bhi ek din kisi ki saas banna hai
englishDialogue: Every mother-in-law forgets that even she was a daughter-in-law at some time ... and every daughter-in-law forgets that one day even she has to become a mother-in-law of someone

dialogue: Meri zabaan se ughla hua zehar bhi amrut ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Even the poison that comes out from my mouth becomes the holy water

dialogue: Maya Devi toh meri bachpan ki saheli hai ... hum ek doosre ke naakhun tak pehchante hai
englishDialogue: Maya Devi and I are childhood friends ... we even recognize each others nails

dialogue: Hai Ram kya waqt aa gaya hai ... maa ki shiksha ka amrut bhi beti ko zehar lag raha hai
englishDialogue: Oh my god, what time has come ... even the holy water of teachings by the mom, feels like poison to the daughter

dialogue: Insaan jab aadmiyon se mayoos ho jaata hai ... toh phir kutte aur billiyon se pyar karne lagta hai
englishDialogue: When a person is disappointed by humans ... he then starts to love dogs and cats

dialogue: Meri chaati par aakar toh saanp bhi rassi ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Even a snake becomes a rope when it comes on my body

dialogue: Kavita toh atma ki khuraakh hoti hai ... achcha sher sunne ya kehne se dil aur dimaag saaf ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: A poem is a medicine for the soul ... by saying or listening to a poetry the heart and mind becomes clean

dialogue: Agar aadmi ko galati karne ka adhikar hai ... toh galati karke pachtane ka haq bhi hai
englishDialogue: If a person has the right to make a mistake ... then he also has the right to repent after making the mistake

dialogue: Khoob phulegi phalegi beti Harparsad ki ... baap ne toh karke shaadi zindagi barbaad ki
englishDialogue: The daughter of Harparsad will blossom and grow ... but the father has destroyed his life by getting married

dialogue: Zindagi bhar nahi bhoolegi woh barsaat ki raat ... maine jab pakda tha kambakht teri saas ka haath
englishDialogue: I'll never forget that rainy night in my life ... when I had held your mother-in-law's hand

dialogue: Duniya mein kisi ko gaali dena shayad paap na hoga ... lekin gareeb ko baar baar gareeb aur mohtaj ko baar baar mohtaj kehne se bada kukarma aur koi nahi hai
englishDialogue: It might not be a sin to curse someone in this world ... but there is no bigger sin that repetitively calling a poor person poor and a dependent person dependent

dialogue: Purani haddiyan badi mazboot hoti hai
englishDialogue: Old bones are very strong

dialogue: Mohabbat ko mile aasoon wahan se ... sitare banke aate hai jahan se
englishDialogue: Love gets tears from the place ... from where stars are made

dialogue: Nagan khubsoorat hoti hai ... par das bhi deti hai
englishDialogue: A snake lady is beautiful ... but she bites also

dialogue: Mohabbat ek tam-tam hai joh daudai nahi jaati ... bhadak uthti hai apne aap hi, bhadkai nahi jaati
englishDialogue: Love is a vehicle that shouldn't be driven fast ... you don't have to push it, since it rises by itself

dialogue: Saas kisi ki bhi ho ... sab ek jaisi hoti hai
englishDialogue: No matter whose mother-in-law it is ... they are all the same

dialogue: Hum apne pote ka dada banenge ... tabla, sarangi aur baja banenge
englishDialogue: I will become the grandfather to my grandson ... and I'll become the tabla, the violin and the band

dialogue: Hawa hi aaisi chali hai ki jee bahal nahi ... varna hum toh bahut kam udaas rehte hai
englishDialogue: The wind is blowing such that my heart doesn't want to reinstate ... or else I hardly am sad

dialogue: Hai dekhkar aaina hairat ho gayi ... meri soorat unki soorat ho gayi
englishDialogue: She was astonished looking at the mirror ... her face looked like my face

dialogue: Jisse marna nahi aaya ... usse jeena nahi aaya
englishDialogue: The one who doesn't know how to die ... doesn't know how to live

dialogue: Pyar duniya ki sabse khoobsurat sachai hai
englishDialogue: Love is the most beautiful truth of the world

dialogue: Duniya kitni choti hai ... lekin do aadmiyon ke beech ka faasle kitne lambe ho sakte hai ... kitne bhayanak aur kitne kaale
englishDialogue: The world is so small ... but the distance between two people can be very big ... very scary and very dark

dialogue: Aadmi jab sant banta hai toh jaat paat, oonch neech, Hindu Muslim, desh videsh, rang nasal ke tamaam bedh bhav bhool jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a person becomes a saint then he forgets all the differences between caste, status, religion, countries, colour

dialogue: Kahi bar marna aasaan malum hota hai aur jeena mushkil
englishDialogue: Many a times dying seems to be much easier than living

dialogue: Jeene waala kisi ki jaan bankar bhi jeeta hai ... aur kisi ko jaan banakar bhi jeeta hai
englishDialogue: The one who lives becomes someone's life and lives ... and he also lives by making someone as his own life

dialogue: Sudharne mein sadiyan lag gayi ... bighadne mein sirf ek pal
englishDialogue: It took ages to change for the better ... but only a moment to degenerate

dialogue: Maa ka matlab joh mujhe kisi dictionary ne nahi, balki zindagi ne sikhaya hai ... woh hai ek aaisi aurat jiski aankhon se bacha dekhna seekhta hai, jiski zabaan se bacha bolna seekhta hai aur jiske pairon se bacha chalna seekhta hai
englishDialogue: Life has taught me the meaning of the word mother and not any dictionary ... and it means that she is a woman through the eyes of whom a child learns to see, through the words of whom a child learns to speak and through the legs of whom a child learns to walk

dialogue: Tumhari shaadi usse nahin hogi jise tum prem karti ho ... tumhari shaadi usse hogi jise main prem karta hoon
englishDialogue: You will not get married to the person you love ... you will get married to the person I love

dialogue: Joh apna naam short karde, woh kaam bhi chota hi karega
englishDialogue: One who shortens his name, he will do small work

dialogue: Kaun kambakht kehta hai ki Hitler mar gaya?
englishDialogue: Who the hell says that Hitler is dead?

dialogue: Lambe kapde pehenna bahut hanikarak fashion hai
englishDialogue: Wearing long clothes is a very harmful fashion

dialogue: Kaam karna ho ... toh waqt ka mooh nahin dekhna chahiye
englishDialogue: If you want to work ... then you must not see the face of time

dialogue: Jis naujawan ko kaam mein jee lagata dekho ... uss naujawan mein apna dil lagao
englishDialogue: The youngster that you see giving his heart to his work ... give your heart to that youngster

dialogue: Jiske paas mooch nahin ... uske paas mann hi nahin hai
englishDialogue: One who does not have a mustache ... does not have a heart

dialogue: Aap police officer nahin ...  foolish officer
englishDialogue: You are not a police officer ... foolish officer

dialogue: Maaf nahin, main tujhe saaf kar doonga
englishDialogue: I will not forgive you, I will clean you

dialogue: National dress ka mazaak nahin udayoge toh broadminded kaise kehe jaoge
englishDialogue: If you don't make fun of the national dress then how will you be called broadminded

dialogue: Hamare paas sone chandi ki daulat hai ... tumhare paas husn ki
englishDialogue: I have the wealth of gold and silver ... and you have the wealth of beauty

dialogue: Aaj hum joh kuch bhi hai na, yeh aap hi ke wajah se hai ... is liye jitna hum yeh charan thame rahenge na ... utna hi dharam aur badega
englishDialogue: What I am today is all because of you ... that's why the more I hold your feet ... the more my righteousness will grow

dialogue: Maine aapko devi jankar puja ... par aap devi nahi, devi ki murti nikli ... joh na kuch dekh sake, na mehsoos kar sake
englishDialogue: I worshipped you thinking you are a goddess ... but you are not a goddess, you are a statue of a goddess ... who can't give anything, and neither can it feel anything

dialogue: Ladies ko sharaab offer karne ka tarika yeh hai ... ki hurricane aaye, toofan aaye, bhuchal aaye lekin glass se ek boond sharaab bhi na chalke ... aur chalke toh kaide se chalke
englishDialogue: You should offer alcohol to women in such a way that ... whether a hurricane comes, whether a storm comes, whether an earthquake comes, not even one drop of alcohol should fall from the glass ... and if it falls then it should in the right manner

dialogue: Rupaiya bhes bhi badalta hai
englishDialogue: Money does change its appearance

dialogue: Tumhare mooh se jitne jhoot niklenge ... main utni goliyan tumhare seene mein daal doonga
englishDialogue: The number of lies that come out from your mouth ... I will fire that many bullets in your body

dialogue: Joh mard hote hai woh apni chaati pe vaar toh seh sakte hai ... lekin doosron ki peeth par chupke vaar nahi kar sakte hai
englishDialogue: Men can withstand an attack on their chest ... but they will not hide and attack on a persons back

dialogue: Jaani dushman samajh loon aaisi nahi hai tu ... magar joh maine samjha tha waise bhi nahi hai tu
englishDialogue: You are not such that I should consider you as my biggest enemy ... but what I had thought, you aren't that either

dialogue: Mard tayaari nahi karte ... hamesha tayaar rehte hai
englishDialogue: Men don't do preparations ... they are always ready

dialogue: Yeh sab kuch sunne ke baad ... maut hamare liye inaam hogi aur zindagi sazaa
englishDialogue: After hearing all this ... death will be a reward for me and life will be a punishment

dialogue: Joh haare woh anari hai ... aur joh jeete wohi khiladi hai
englishDialogue: The one who loses is a fool ... and the one who wins is a player

dialogue: Dil dukh ki aag mein jalta hai ... toh aasoon bankar behne lagta hai
englishDialogue: When the heart burns in the fire of sadness ... then it turns into tears and flows

dialogue: Hum mein joh cheez pasand aa jaye ... pehle hum haath jodhkar maangte hai ... aur agar na mile toh, haath todhkar le lete hai
englishDialogue: The thing that I like ... first I ask for it with respect ... and if I don't get it, then I break the hands and take it

dialogue: Dharam ka rishta janam ke rishtey se bhi bada hota hai
englishDialogue: The relation of religion is bigger than the relation of birth

dialogue: Kangan pehne nahi jaate ... pehnaye jaate hai
englishDialogue: You don't wear the bangles yourself ... someone else must put them on you

dialogue: Paap karne waalon par patthar uthane ka adhikaar ... sirf usse hai jisne paap na kiya ho
englishDialogue: Only those people have the right to throw stones on the people who have committed sins ... who have not committed sins themselves

dialogue: My pain is my destiny and I can't avoid it
englishDialogue: My pain is my destiny and I can't avoid it

dialogue: Yeh koyle ki khaan ek ajgar hai ... joh roz anginat mazdooron ko nighalta hai aur unhe chabake, peeske, kuchalke ... unke jismon se zindagi ka ek ek katra chooskar ... ek laash ki soorat mein unhe vapas ughal deta hai
englishDialogue: This coal mine is a python ... which swallows countless workers everyday and chews them, crushes them, smashes them ... it sucks every drop of life from their body ... and then spits them out in the form of a dead body

dialogue: Aadmi Himalaya ki choti se girke uth sakta hai ... lekin ek baar khud apni nazron se gir jaye toh phir woh girta hi chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: A man can get up after falling from the top of the Himalaya ... but once he falls in his own eyes then he keeps falling

dialogue: Is mein sirf itni zindagi baki chhodna ... ki yeh apni maut apni aankhon se dekh sake
englishDialogue: Only leave that much life in him ... so that he can see his own death with his own eyes

dialogue: Har chor apni maut marta nahi ... maara jaata hai
englishDialogue: Every thief doesn't die his own death ... he gets killed

dialogue: Tu toh apne saathiyon ko bhi dokha de sakta hai ... lekin main apne dushman se kiye huye vaade ko bhi poora karta hoon
englishDialogue: You can even cheat your friends ... but I fulfill the promises that I have made even to my enemies

dialogue: Swatantra Bharat ka nagrik hoon, krantiveer hoon, tanashahi ke liye talwar hoon, yam lok mazdooron ka sardar hoon
englishDialogue: I'm a citizen of independent India, I'm a brave revolutionary, I'm a sword for dictatorship, I'm the leader of the labourers of hell

dialogue: Mere liye tum aaise badal ho ... main ek din pyar se mar jaongi, lekin tum mere pyar ke aangan mein kabhi nahi barsoge
englishDialogue: For me you are such a cloud ... that one day I'll die from love, but still you won't pour the rain in the backyard of my love

dialogue: Main tumhe zinda nahi chhodunga ... joh aag tumne mere seene mein lagayi hai ... woh tumhare khoon se bujhegi
englishDialogue: I won't leave you alive ... the fire that you have started in my heart ... will erase only with your blood

dialogue: Dharam rakshak hoon, narak lok shashak hoon, yamraj hoon!
englishDialogue: I'm the protector of religion, I'm from hell, I'm the god of death!

dialogue: Kisiko apnane ke liye waqt ki zaroorat nahi hoti
englishDialogue: To make someone our own you don't need time

dialogue: Apna patta khulega toh apun ko salaam karte hue khulega
englishDialogue: When my card will open it will salute to me and open

dialogue: Zindagi ki har badi ladai insaan apne aap se hi ladta hai ... apne hi andar insaan Mahabharat jaisi kahi ladaiyon se guzar jaata hai
englishDialogue: A person fights all the big fights of life with himself ... within himself he goes through many fights like the Mahabharata

dialogue: Meri mohabbat ka tum yakeen karlo ... kahin na umar guzar jaye aazmane mein
englishDialogue: Have trust in my love ... or else your life will pass by just trying it

dialogue: Pooche joh koi mujhse bahaar kaisi hoti hai ... naam tera leke keh doon yaar aaisi hoti hai
englishDialogue: If someone will ask me how is spring ... then I'll take your name and say my friend it's like her

dialogue: Yeh nazar unki nazar se aaisi takrayi ki bas ... hosh rukhsat ho gaye woh bekhudi chai ki bas ... zulf bikhri aur lipatkar mere dil se reh gayi ... meri duniya khushbuon se aaisi mehakai ki bas
englishDialogue: Her eyes connected with my eyes ... my senses left and I was unaware ... her hair flew and hugged my heart ... and my world started to smell so good

dialogue: Zindagi bankar nasha kuch aaisi lehrai ki bas ... kya kahoon har saans ne woh aag badkai ki bas ... dillagi kuch der ki, haai ban gayi dil ki lagi ... baaton baaton mein yahan tak baat badh aayi ki bas
englishDialogue: Life became an intoxication and was unfurling ... what should I say that every breath raised the fire in me ... pleasantry for some time turned into love ... and just by talking we became really serious

dialogue: (Koi ladki tumse nahi takrai?) ... Takrai ... takrake gabrai, gabrake sharmai, upar se uski mummy chali aayi ... is liye ladki haath nahi aayi
englishDialogue: (No girl bumped into you?) ... One did ... she got scared bumping into me, she felt shy being scared, and on top of that her mom came along ... that's why I couldn't get the girl

dialogue: Khuda gharat kare motor banane waale ko ... sach kaha zalim ghar se beghar kar diya is saale motor chalane waale ko
englishDialogue: May god punish the people who made the motor vehicle ... it is said truly that people who drive a motor vehicle have become homeless

dialogue: Jab mann mein pachtava aata hai toh saare paap dhul jaate hai
englishDialogue: When you feel remorseful from the heart then all sins are wiped clean

dialogue: Kutte aur aadmi ki nasal kaan kheench kar hi pata chalti hai
englishDialogue: You can find out the breed of a dog and a man by pulling their ears

dialogue: Yeh whiskey soda agar aap peeyega ... toh whiskey soda andar aur aapka dum bahar
englishDialogue: If you drink whiskey and soda ... then whiskey and soda will go inside and your life will come outside

dialogue: Babumushoi, zindagi badi honi chahiye ... lambi nahin
englishDialogue: My friend, life should be big ... not long

dialogue: Babumushoi, zindagi aur maut upar waale ke haath hai ... usse na toh aap badal sakte hai na main ... hum sab to rangmanch ki kathputliyan hai jinki dor upar waale ki ungliyon mein bandhi hai
englishDialogue: My friend, life and death is in the hands of God ... you can't change it and neither can I ... we all are puppets of the theater whose string is tied in the fingers of God

dialogue: Jab tak zinda hoon tab tak mara nahi ... jab mar gaya sala main hi nahi
englishDialogue: Until I am alive I am not dead ... when I die bloody I won't be there

dialogue: Kab, kaun, kaise uthega ... yeh koi nahin bata sakta hai
englishDialogue: When, who, how someone will die ... no one can tell that

dialogue: Hum aane waale gham ko kheench taan kar aaj ki khushi pe le aate hai ... aur us khushi mein zehar ghol dete hai
englishDialogue: We stretch and pull the sadness of the future and bring it onto today's happiness ... and we mix poison in that happiness

dialogue: Maut toh ek pal hai
englishDialogue: Death is just a moment

dialogue: Yeh bhi toh nahi keh sakta ... meri umar tujhe lag jaye
englishDialogue: I can't even say that ... let my age be added to yours

dialogue: Jeena toh Bambai mein ... marna toh Bambai mein
englishDialogue: If I live, I will live in Mumbai ... if I die, I will die in Mumbai

dialogue: Anand mara nahi, Anand marte nahi
englishDialogue: Anand is not dead, Anand are immortal

dialogue: Maanta hoon ki zindagi ki taqat maut se zyada bhadi hai ... lekin yeh zindagi kya maut se bhattar nahi
englishDialogue: I agree that the strength of life is more powerful than death ... but isn't this life worse than death

dialogue: Marte marte chela guru ko jeena sikha gaya
englishDialogue: As the disciple was dying he taught the teacher how to live

dialogue: Aaj tak tum bolte aaye aur main sunta aaya ... aaj main bolonga aur tum sunoge
englishDialogue: Till today you said and I listened ... today I will say and you will listen

dialogue: Maut tu ek kavita hai ... mujhse ek kavita ka vaada hai milegi mujhko ... doobti nabzon mein jab dard ko neend aane lage ... zard sa chehra liye chaand ufak tak pahunche ... din abhi paani mein ho raat kinaare ke kareeb ... na andhera, na ujala ho ... na abhi raat, na din ... jism jab khatam ho aur rooh ko jab saans aaye ... mujhse ek kavita ka vaada hai milegi mujhko
englishDialogue: Death you are a poem ... a poem has promised me that it'll meet me ... when in drowning pulse you feel sleepy ... when the moon carrying her yellow face will reach the horizon  ... when day is still in water and the night is close to the shore ... it's not dark, neither bright ... it's not midnight, nor the day ... when the body is dying and the soul is still breathing ... a poem has promised me that it'll meet me

dialogue: Haste huye insaan ke saath saari duniya hasti hai ... lekin jab woh rota hai toh akela rota hai
englishDialogue: The whole world laughs with the person who laughs ... but when he cries, then he cries alone

dialogue: Har dayaar mein aati hai phir bahaar ... khilte hai phool bhi wahan daur-e-fiza ke baad
englishDialogue: Spring comes in every region ... and even flowers bloom there, after the era of breeze

dialogue: Talash zindagi ka doosra naam hai ... kisi ko rozi ki talash hai aur kisi ko chain aur sukoon ki
englishDialogue: Search is the second name of life ... someone is searching for a job and someone is searching for peace

dialogue: Main joh chahta hoon woh paata nahi ... aur joh paata hoon woh sirf ek ittefaq hai
englishDialogue: I don't attain what I desire ... and what I attain, that's just an coincidence

dialogue: Dushmani ko khareedne kahi jana nahi padta ... aur dosti kisi bhi keemat pe nahi milti
englishDialogue: You don't have to go anywhere to buy enmity ... and you can't buy friendship for any price

dialogue: Aadat kisi bhi kisam ki ho achchi ya buri ... uska ghulam hona buri aadat hai
englishDialogue: Doesn't matter if the habit is good or bad ... it's bad to be a slave of that habit

dialogue: Do suiyon ke beech zindagi kya kya khel dikhaye ... naya purana natak karta waqt guzarta jaye
englishDialogue: Life shows so many tricks between the two needles ... time passes on by doing the drama of the new and the old

dialogue: Agar hum apne buzurgon ki nakhushi ki buniyaad par apni khushiyon ki imaarat khadi karenge ... toh woh zyada din nahi tik payegi
englishDialogue: If we build our buildings of happiness on the foundation of sadness of our elders ... then it won't stand for many days

dialogue: Jab jeb thandi hoti hai toh dimaag garam ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When your pockets are cold then your mind becomes hot

dialogue: Naya kitna hi naya kyun na ho ... uski buniyaad purani hoti hai
englishDialogue: No matter how new is new ... it's foundation is old

dialogue: Na zehan mein aap, na rum mein aap ... dono jahan pukar aaye, kahan hai aap ... itna guroor husn pe achcha nahi janaab ... humko lagalo dil se samajhkar yahi kitaab
englishDialogue: Neither you are in my memory, neither you are in rum ... I searched for you everywhere, where are you ... having so much pride on your body is not good ... hug me thinking I'm a book

dialogue: Joh aaj naya hai, kal purana ho jayega ... joh aaj purana hai, kal naya bankar samne aayega
englishDialogue: What is new today, it will become old tomorrow ... what is old today, tomorrow it will come forward as new

dialogue: Jiska mann saaf hota hai ... uski nazar bhi saaf hoti hai
englishDialogue: One who has a clean heart ... his vision is also clean

dialogue: Jabbar Singh ne sirf do hi baatein seekhi hai ... ek mauke ka fayda uthana ... aur apne dushman ka naam aur nishaan mitta dena
englishDialogue: Jabbar Singh has only learnt two things ... one to take benefit of the situation ... and other to eliminate the name and the sign of your enemy

dialogue: Bharat ko angrezon se azaadi lene mein 200 saal lage the ... tu 18 tak toh ruk hi sakti hai
englishDialogue: It took India 200 years to get freedom from the British ... you can wait at least until you turn 18

dialogue: Bachpan mein bacha hamari ungli pakad ke chale hai taake bheed mein kho na jave ... aur jis din woh hamari ungli chhod de ... toh aise laage jaise hum hi kho gaye ho ... par baat bhi hai bhaisaab ... jab talak balak aapki ungli chhodega nahi ... tab talak aake gale kaise lagavega
englishDialogue: In childhood a child holds our finger and walks so that they don't get lost in the crowd ... and the day they leave our finger ... it feels as if we've lost ourselves ... but there's a point in this my friend ... until the child leaves your finger ... they won't be able to come and embrace you

dialogue: Aadmi ka sapna toot jaata hai na, toh aadmi khatam ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a person's dream breaks, then the person breaks down as well

dialogue: Zindagi mein kuch bhi hone se pehle, imaandar hona bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: In life before you become anything, it's important to be honest

dialogue: Shauk do tarah ke hove hai ... ek toh woh joh samay ke saath khatam ho jave hai ... aur duja woh joh samay ke saath maqsad ban jave hai
englishDialogue: There are two types of hobbies ... one which ends over a period of time ... and second that turns into your mission over a period of time

dialogue: Maine suna tha police walo ko kabhi ungli nahi karni chahiye ... lekin police wale hamari aisi ungli karenge ... kabhi nahi socha tha yaar
englishDialogue: I had heard that you should never mess with the police ... but the police will mess with us ... I had never even thought about that

dialogue: Joh kehne ko aaya tha ... ankahi hi reh gayi woh baat ... sab baaton ke baat
englishDialogue: What I'd come to say ... I wasn't able to say that ... even after all the conversations

dialogue: Aana toh poori tarah aana ... ya toh aana hi mat
englishDialogue: If you come then come wholeheartedly ... or else don't even come

dialogue: Shaadiyan mahurat se hoti hai ... par pyar ka koi mahurat nahi hota hai ... na rang hota hai ... aur na koi ling hota hai
englishDialogue: Marriages happen on auspicious dates ... but there are no auspicious dates when it comes to love ... neither does it have a particular colour ... and nor does it have a particular gender

dialogue: Jack and Johnny went up the hill to live in love and laughter ... Jack ki leli papa ne aur Johnny chup gaya bhaagkar
englishDialogue: Jack and Johnny went up the hill to live in love and laughter ... Jack was scolded by his father and Johnny just ran away and was hiding

dialogue: Roz humein ladai ladni padti hai zindagi mein ... par joh ladai pariwar ke saath hoti hai woh saari ladaiyon mein sabse badi aur khatarnak hoti hai
englishDialogue: We face battles everyday in life ... but the battle that we have with our family is the most dangerous one

dialogue: Sher hoon main sher ... aur sher tab tak raja hota hai jab tak akela rehta hai
englishDialogue: I'm a lion ... and a lion is a king until he's single

dialogue: Family na aadmi ko chomu bana deti hai
englishDialogue: A family turns a brave person into a timid one

dialogue: Mard apni poori zindagi mardangi ki baatein karte hai ... par pregnancy sunte hi jaise namard ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: Men keep talking about their manhood for their entire life ... but when they hear about pregnancy then they become a coward

dialogue: Ek darr do baar nahi lagta
englishDialogue: A fear of something can't last twice

dialogue: Badle mein hamesha do kabarein khodni padti hai ... jis mein ek apni khudki hoti hai
englishDialogue: When taking revenge you have to always dig two graves ... in which one of them belongs to you

dialogue: Aaj ka andhera bahut gehra aane wala hai ... aur khamoshi kaan phaad
englishDialogue: Tonight's darkness will be pitch dark ... and the silence will tear your ears

dialogue: Darr ki pahunch na bahut solid hoti hai ... kisi ko dil pe effect karti hai ... kisi ko dimaag pe ... aur kisi ko seedha taango ke beech
englishDialogue: Fear has very solid impact ... it effects someone on their heart ... it effects someone on their mind ... and it effects someone directly with their confidence

dialogue: Criminal ko arrest karke case khatam hota hai ... criminal nahi ... woh kabhi na kabhi dushman bankar phir vapas lautta hai
englishDialogue: The case ends when you arrest a criminal ... the criminal doesn't end ... he does return sometime or the other as an enemy

dialogue: Deewane ka dimaag hai khali ... bina hope ke hi duniya basa li
englishDialogue: This lover's brain is empty ... but still you've settled in your world without any hope

dialogue: Tareef kya karoon main aapki, words nahi milte ... itne kam budget mein aise honhar balak nahi milte
englishDialogue: How should I praise you, as I can't seem to find the words ... and you can't find such great guys in such a low budget

dialogue: Kuch log joh sochte hai usse paate hai ... aur kuch aise loser hote hai joh sirf apna waqt ganwate hai
englishDialogue: Some people attain what they aim for ... and some people are losers who just waste their time

dialogue: Pyar us hi se karna joh tumse pyar kare ... khud se zyada tumpar aitbaar kare
englishDialogue: Fall in love with the one who loves you ... the one who trusts you more than themselves

dialogue: Jahan dekho ishq ke bimaar baithe hai ... lakhon mar gaye, saikadon taiyaar baithe hai
englishDialogue: Everywhere you look, you'll see lovers ... so many have died, but still hundreds more are ready to die in love

dialogue: Jis goli se tu marega uske upar aisa bade mein likha hoinga ... Made in India
englishDialogue: The bullet that will kill you will be stamped in bold reading ... Made in India

dialogue: Mumbai police passport pe religion dekhkar goli nahi chalati ... criminal record dekhkar thokti hai
englishDialogue: Mumbai police doesn't fire a bullet based on the religion mentioned on the passport ... it fires based on the criminal record

dialogue: Aapka kanoon kisi insaan ko ek hi jurm ke liye do baar sazaa nahi de sakta
englishDialogue: Your law cannot punish any one person twice for the same crime

dialogue: Maine usse maara bhi nahi ... aur maar bhi dala
englishDialogue: I didn't hit him ... but I killed him

dialogue: Allah re jism-e-yaar ki khoobi ke khud-ba-khud ... rangeeniyon mein doob gaya pairahan tamaam
englishDialogue: Oh God her alluring beauty by itself ... is filling the colors on her dress

dialogue: Kanoon itna maila hai ... ki usse apne haath mein lekar main apna haath ganda karna chahta bhi nahi
englishDialogue: The law is so dirty ... that I don't want to dirty my hands by taking it in my hands

dialogue: Ek maut tere gunaahon ke sazaa ke liye kaafi nahi
englishDialogue: One death is not enough as a punishment of your crimes

dialogue: Maut se kiski rishteydari hai ... aaj hamari kal tumhari baari hai
englishDialogue: Death is not related to anyone ... today it is my turn and tomorrow it will be yours

dialogue: Aaj tak woh rassi hi nahi batti gayi ... joh mujhe phansi laga sake
englishDialogue: A rope that can hang me ... has not been made till date

dialogue: Pyar bhari zindagi ka ek pal ... bina pyar ki sadiyon se kahi bada hota hai
englishDialogue: A single moment full of love ... is much bigger than years without love

dialogue: Agar amiri insaan ko wahi bana deti hai joh aap ban gaye hai ... toh bhagwan ka shukar hai ki hum amir nahi rahe
englishDialogue: If riches makes a person what you have become ... then thank god I am not rich

dialogue: Kuch baatein kehne aur sunne mein utni achchi nahi lagti ... lekin phir bhi woh sach hoti hai
englishDialogue: Some things don't sound good when you say and hear them ... but still they are true

dialogue: Aadmi ko khwab dekhne chahiye apni aukaad aur haisiyat ke hisaab se
englishDialogue: A man should see dreams based on his position and status

dialogue: Tere haath mein maut ka samaan hai toh ... mere seene pe khuda ka naam hai
englishDialogue: If you have an item of death in your hands ... then I have Gods name on my chest

dialogue: Mazdoor ka paseena sookhne se pehle, uski mazdoori mil jani chahiye janaab
englishDialogue: Sir, the laborer must be paid before his sweat dries out

dialogue: Koi mai ka laal kisi ko do waqt ki roti nahi dila sakta ... kyun ki roti dilane waala woh malik hai ... jisne har insaan ko do haath diye hai aur kaha hai ki ... cheer de zameen ka seena aur nikaal le apne hisse ki roti
englishDialogue: No one person can provide two meals a day to another person ... because food is provided by God ... who has given everyone two hands and said that ... tear apart the body of the earth and remove the food of your share

dialogue: Jiske seene mein dil nahi usse dil ki bemaari kaise ho sakti hai?
englishDialogue: One who doesn't have a heart, how can he get a heart attack?

dialogue: Ameeron ne toh joh kuch bhi banaya hai woh rishvat ya rishvat ke balbute par banaya hai ... koi dus rupaiya mein vote khareed leta hai ... sau rupaiya mein koi apni arzi pass karva leta hai ... hazar rupaiya dekar koi apna imteham pass kar leta hai ... lakhon rupaiya dekar yeh log apna tender pass karva lete hai ... arre main toh kehta hoon sabse pehle in rishvatkhoron ko fail karo ... tab ja karke yeh mulk pass hoga
englishDialogue: Whatever rich people have made they have made it using bribe or on the basis of bribe ... someone buys a vote for Rs.10 ... someone passes their documents using Rs.100 ... someone passes their exam using Rs.1000 ... and these people pass their tender using millions of rupees ... what I'm saying that first fail these people who give bribe ... and then this country will pass

dialogue: Zindagi ke meethe sur jhoot ke taaron se nahi ... vishvas ke saaz se nikalte hai
englishDialogue: The sweet tunes of life come from the musical instrument of trust ... and not from the strings of lies

dialogue: Dost agar dosti mein dosti ka interest 100% na le ... toh dosti nahi rehti
englishDialogue: Within friendship if a friend doesn't take 100% interest in friendship ... then it's not friendship

dialogue: Khamoshi mein udasi ab rahi kahan ... tumhe dekh liya phir se toh sari udasiyan khamosh ho gayi hai ab toh jaise
englishDialogue: Sadness doesn't exist in silence anymore ... and now that I've seen you, all the sadness has become silent

dialogue: Tumhare pyar ka kya sila doon yeh nahi malum ... umar mil saki agar kuch aur toh yeh bhi seekh loongi main tumse
englishDialogue: I don't know what reward to give you for your love ... if I get to live a little longer then I'll learn that from you as well

dialogue: Log toh ghar basakar, tamaam rishtey naate banakar bhi pyar ke chand lamhe nahi jee paate aksar ... lekin maine toh chand lamhon mein pyar ki mukammal zindagi ko paa liya hai tumse
englishDialogue: People even after making relationships and settling in houses are often not able to live a few moments of love ... but I've achieved a complete life of love with you in just a few moments

dialogue: Adhoore sapne chubte bahut hai ... bahut teekhi hoti hai unki chuban
englishDialogue: Incomplete dreams prick a lot ... their pricking hurts a lot

dialogue: Har din ki kismat mein aftab nahi hota ... lekin phir bhi har din zindagi ka ek naya daur shuru hota hai
englishDialogue: Not every day has sunlight in its destiny ... but still every day in life a new chapter starts

dialogue: Samundar tabhi tak samundar hai jab tak woh khamosh rehta hai ... aur jab uski khamoshi tootti hai toh woh toofan ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: An ocean is an ocean until it is silent ... and when it breaks its silence then it turns into a storm

dialogue: Jise humdum banaya ho, jise humkadam banaya ho ... usse humraaz nahi banaya ja sakta
englishDialogue: The one who is our soulmate, the one who is our companion ... we cannot make them our confidant

dialogue: Sneh aasman se tapki hui sharaab ki ek boond hai ... joh insaani jism mein dhalkar zameen ka sabse khoobsurat phool ban gayi
englishDialogue: Affection is a drop of alochol dripping from the sky ... which by mixing with the human body has become the most beautiful flower on earth

dialogue: Sirf saanson ke aane jaane ka naam hi toh zindagi nahi ... saans toot bhi jaye toh kya, saans kho bhi jaye toh kya?
englishDialogue: Life is not just about breathing in and out ... so what if breathing stops, so what if breath is lost?

dialogue: Bade gaur se sun raha tha zamana ... tum hi so gaye dastan kehte kehte
englishDialogue: The world was listening very carefully ... you yourself slept while saying the story

dialogue: Woh chalti toh zameen par hai ... lekin uske kadmo ke nishaan hamare dil par padte hai
englishDialogue: Even though she walks on the ground ... but her footprints are created in my heart

dialogue: Tum khud ek aaisi churi ho ... jiski dhaar par katne waala kat bhi jaye par uff na kare
englishDialogue: You yourself are a knife ... on the edge of which a person being cut will get cut, but he won't say a thing

dialogue: Ek hum hai joh dushman ke khoon se mohabbat karte hai ... aur ek tum ho joh apne hi khoon ke dushman ban gaye ho
englishDialogue: I am one who loves the blood of my enemy ... and you are one who has become the enemy of your own blood

dialogue: Ghodi aur jawan ladki ki lagaam zara kaske rakhni chahiye
englishDialogue: You should have a strong hold on the rein of a mare and a young girl

dialogue: Hum mein bhi aa padha hai doston se kaam kuch yaani ... hamare doston ke bewafaa hone ka waqt aaya
englishDialogue: I need help from my friends ... hence the time has come for my friends to become unfaithful

dialogue: Jin takleefon se log marte hai un takleefon ne hum mein paala hai ... humne maa ki godh mein nahi, chaku ki nok par parvarish payi hai
englishDialogue: I have grown up with the pains that the people die with ... I have been nurtured under the tip of a knife and not in the lap of a mother

dialogue: Khuda ke bhi ajeeb khel hai ... kahi bichadkar mil jaate hai, kahi milkar bichad jaate hai
englishDialogue: The games of god are strange ... some people meet after being separated, and some people separate after meeting

dialogue: Tumhari zindagi chaku ke dhaar se khelti hai ... aur tumhare pankh gundagardi ke dal-dal mein dhasse hai ... jitna nikalne ki koshish karoge, utna hi dhasste jaoge
englishDialogue: Your life plays with the edge of a knife ... and your wings are stuck in the bog of crime ... the more you try to come out of it, the more you'll get pulled in

dialogue: Husn ka raaz zamane se chupaye rakhiye ... dil mein jalta hua ek shola dabaye rakhiye
englishDialogue: Keep hiding the secret of your beauty from the world ... keep the burning fire withheld in your heart

dialogue: Tumhe toh woh takleefen deke maaronga ... jinke bare mein tumne na kabhi kitaabon mein padha hoga ... na kahaniyon mein suna hoga
englishDialogue: I'll kill you giving such pains ... which you haven't even read about them in books ... and neither heard about them in stories

dialogue: Hamare khoon ka katra katra aapke namak ka ehsaanmand hai
englishDialogue: Every drop of my blood is indebted to your work

dialogue: Jaise ki rahi bina rasta suna, sindoor bina maang suni, aur pyar bina jeevan suna hota hai ... vaise hi seeshay ke bina khidki suni hoti hai
englishDialogue: Just like the path is lonely without a traveller, the hair parting is lonely without vermilion, and life is lonely without love ... just like that without a mirror a window is lonely

dialogue: Nazuk ladkiyan dadagiri karte huye achchi nahi lagti
englishDialogue: Delicate girls don't look good when bossing

dialogue: Pyar ek imtihaan hai ... aur nateeje se darne waalo ka pyar jhoota hota hai
englishDialogue: Love is a test ... and those who fear it's results, their love is a lie

dialogue: Patthar ki duniya, patthar ke dil, patthar ki Heer ... tu jaisi bhi hai manzoor hai
englishDialogue: The world is made of stones, and stone hearten people, the stone statue of Heer ... however you are, I accept you

dialogue: Aap ki kameez ka size bahut chota hai, Sir ... kyun ki mera seena aap se bahut bada hai
englishDialogue: Sir, the size of your shirt is very small ... because my chest is much bigger than yours

dialogue: Qurbani se pyar amar ho jata hai
englishDialogue: Love becomes immortal with sacrifice

dialogue: Gande khoon ki aulaad ko hum gunday ke naam se jaante hai
englishDialogue: We call the child of dirty blood as a goon

dialogue: Aashiq ki jagah zameen pe nahi ... upar hoti hai
englishDialogue: The place for lovers is not on the ground ... it is up (in heaven)

dialogue: Peeonga, khoob peeonga ... itna peeonga ke seene ka khoon gale tak, aur gale ka khoon bahar tak
englishDialogue: I'll drink, I'll drink a lot ... I'll drink so much that the blood from the chest comes to the throat, and the blood from the throat comes out

dialogue: Mere hi kutte ne mujhe kaata
englishDialogue: My dog has bitten me

dialogue: Yahan bansuri ki bhasha koi nahi samajhta ... yeh duniya sirf lathi ki bhasha samajhti hai ... sirf lathi ki
englishDialogue: Over here no one understands the language of a flute ... this world only understands the language of a nightstick ... only a nightstick

dialogue: Joh mazaa apne bete ko jawan hote dekhkar aata hai ... woh apni jawani mein bhi nahi aata tha
englishDialogue: The joy that you get in seeing your son growing young ... that much joy we didn't get in your own youth as well

dialogue: Angdhai na lena aaise haathon ko uthakar ... seene se tere dekh dupatta na satak jaye
englishDialogue: Don't raise your hands and pandiculate ... since your scarf might fall from your body

dialogue: Manushya ko makhan mein baal ki tarah, samudra mein jaal ki tarah aur yudh mein dhaal ki tarah rehna chahiye
englishDialogue: A human should stay like a hair in butter, like a net in the sea and like an armour in battle

dialogue: Khat kabutar kis tarah le jaye bam-e-yaar par ... par kattarne ke liye hai kaichiyan deewar par ... jawab hai ki khat kabutar is tarah le jaye bam-e-yaar par ... khat ka mazmoon ho paron par, par katte deewar par
englishDialogue: How does the pigeon take a letter to the terrace ... when there are scissors on the wall to cut his wings ... the answer is that the pigeon takes the letter to the terrace in such a way that ... the envelope of the letter is on his wings, and his wings are cut down on the wall

dialogue: Hum do hamare do, teesra kabhi na ho ... patni se bhaiya door raho, kitni bhi adhchan ho
englishDialogue: We two and our two, there should never be a third ... stay away from the wife, no matter how big the problem is

dialogue: Samajh samajhke samajh ko samajho toh samajhna bhi ek samajh hai ... samajh gaye?
englishDialogue: If you understand the understanding then to understand is also an understanding ... did you understand?

dialogue: Duniya ek stage hai, zindagi uska drama hai, insaan keval naam-matra actor hai aur maut uska parda hai
englishDialogue: The world is a stage, life is it's drama, a human is an actor for namesake and death is the curtain

dialogue: Ek ladki jab saari bandkar, gale mein phoolon ka haar dalkar, ladke ke saath apna pallu bandkar agni ke saat phere leti hai ... toh woh phere uski zindagi ko phira dalte hai
englishDialogue: When a girl wears a saari, puts a flower garland in her neck, ties her scarf to a guys dress and takes 7 rounds around the holy fire ... then those rounds spin her world around

dialogue: Sau saal yehi dialogue natakon aur filmon mein pitt raha hai ... lekin jab bhi bola gaya hai, hit raha hai
englishDialogue: Since 100 years this dialogue has been used in plays and movies ... but whenever it has been said, it's been a hit

dialogue: Aap kare aaram hum kare vishram ... aam ke aam guthliyon ke daam
englishDialogue: You rest and I'll relax ... that's like mangoes for the price of kernels

dialogue: Uthade parda, dikha de jalwa ... boondi ke ladoo, gajar ka halwa
englishDialogue: Life the curtain, show your talent ... ball-shaped sweets, carrot dessert

dialogue: Bade logon ke haath nahi alfaaz istamal hote hai ... jinke ishaare par chote log choriyan karte hai
englishDialogue: Big people don't use their hands, they use their words ... based on which small people commit robberies

dialogue: Hazaaron ladkiyan hamare ghar ke bahar ghaslet ki line ki tarah hum mein pati banane ke chakkar mein khadi rehti hai ... aur tum hum mein pati banane ke bajaye vanaspati banana chahti ho
englishDialogue: Thousands of girls stand outside my house like they do in a kerosene line to make me their husband ... and you instead of making me your husband you want to make me into vegetation

dialogue: Tumhari yeh baat sunkar mera dil Hyderabad ki tarah aabad ho gaya
englishDialogue: Listening to this point of yours my heart has become happy like Hyderabad

dialogue: Ladki toh pehda hi hoti hai zulm sehne ke liye
englishDialogue: A girl is born to endure injustice

dialogue: Aaj jahan fan latak raha hai ... kal wahan meri laash latak rahi hogi
englishDialogue: Today where the fan is hanging ... tomorrow my dead body will be hanging there

dialogue: Main tumhe Kashmir se baghakar, Jammu mein girakar, Delhi mein uthakar, Bhopal mein ghumakar, Madras mein nachakar, Kanyakumari mein thokar maarkar ... Lanka ke samundar mein phek doonga
englishDialogue: I will make you run from Kashmir, make you fall in Jammu, lift you up in Delhi, turn you around in Bhopal, make you dance in Madras, kick you in Kanyakumari ... and will throw in the ocean of Lanka

dialogue: Ek bakri hokar tune sher ki jabde mein haath daala hai
englishDialogue: Being a goat you have put a hand into the tiger's jaw

dialogue: Noton ki seedi par chadkar aakash ko choone ki koshish mat karna, warna gir jaoge ... itni chotein lagegi, ki agla janam lene ke baad bhi shareer zakhmi hoga
englishDialogue: Don't try to touch the sky by climbing on the ladder of money, you will fall ... and you will get so many wounds, that even in the next life your body will be wounded

dialogue: Ek toh waise teri shakal kharab hai, upar se royega aur manhus lagega
englishDialogue: You face is already bad, on top of that if you cry you'll look more ominous

dialogue: Maalik, aapke charno ki lagi hui dhool ko mera namaskar
englishDialogue: Sir, please accept my greetings for the dust on your feet

dialogue: Bachche tumne sirf shehar ke college mein padai ki degree li hai ... maine yeh duniya ke college mein tajurbe ki padai haasil ki hai
englishDialogue: Son, you have only received a degree in education from a college in the city ... I have achieved the education of experience in the college of this world

dialogue: Mere raaste mein aane ki koshish mat karna, kadam kadam pe barood biccha hua hai ... chithre udh jayenge tumhare ... koi pehchaan nahi payega ke tumhare tudke hai ya ret ke zarre
englishDialogue: Don't try to come in between my road, there is gunpowder laid out on every step ... you will be blown into pieces ... nobody will be able to recognize whether its your pieces or sand particles

dialogue: Hum unlogo mein se nahin hai, joh saanp ka sar kuchalkar usse maar dalte hai ... hum unlogo mein se hai, joh saanp ka sar pakad lete hai aur uske baad uske zehrile daanton ko nikaalkar ... usse nachate hai aur paisa kamate hai
englishDialogue: I am not someone who crushes a snakes head and kills it ... I am someone who catches the snakes head and removes the poisonous teeth ... and then I'll make it dance and make money

dialogue: Tumhare paas na sharm hai na sharmane waala dil hai
englishDialogue: You don't have shame and neither do you have a heart that can feel ashamed

dialogue: Joh hamari baat nahi maanta ... main usse singh maarke Singapore bana deta hoon
englishDialogue: Whoever doesn't listen to us ... I hit him with horns and turn him into Singapore

dialogue: Yeh coat aur pant kya pehen liya, apne aap ko Rajkot samajh behte? ... humse uljhoge toh hum tumhe Pathankot bana denge yaad rakhna
englishDialogue: By wearing this coat and pant you think you are Rajkot? ... don't scuffle with me or else remember, I will make you into Pathankot

dialogue: Yeh Dilli ki parliament nahin hai, hamari parliament hai ... yahan wahi aadmi bolega, jise hum sawaal poochenge
englishDialogue: This is not Delhi's parliament, this is my parliament ... here only that person will speak, whom I ask the question

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi toh lagta hai bhagwan bhi dhanwanon ki tarah gareebon ka saath nahi deta
englishDialogue: Sometimes it feels like even God just like the rich does not help the poor

dialogue: Tum insaan nahin balki ek chalti phirti tijori ho ... tumhare seene mein dil ki jagah noton ka bundle rakha hua hai
englishDialogue: You are a moving vault not a human being ... there is a stack of money instead of a heart in your chest

dialogue: Ek insaan ko koi haq nahi ki doosre insaan ko sazaa de ... yeh ishwar ka kaam hai
englishDialogue: A human has no right to punish another human ... that's the work of God

dialogue: Bhagwan sab kuch maaf kar sakta hai ... lekin ghamand maaf nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: God can forgive everything ... but he cannot forgive pride

dialogue: Maine jitni bhi taleem haasil ki, jitni bhi kitabein padhi hai ... un kitabon ki likhayi meri maa ki mehnat ke pasine se likhi hui hai
englishDialogue: Whatever education I have achieved, whatever books I have read ... those books have been written from the sweat of my moms hard work

dialogue: Thu thu thu ... sharafat ki vardiyon mein kaise kaise baimaanon ne shareer apne chupa rakhe hai
englishDialogue: This is so bad ... cheaters have hidden their bodies in the uniforms of honesty

dialogue: Joh koi hamare kanoon ke khilaaf bagavat karne ki koshish karta hai ... toh hum usse bina phatak ki railway line par leta kar uski zindagi khatam kar dete hain
englishDialogue: Whoever tries to protest against my laws ... I kill him by making him lie down on a railway line without a crossing

dialogue: Maa bhi bhagwan ne duniya mein ek nirali hi cheez banayi hai ... janam dene se lekar bete ki aakhri saans tak, har gadhi yeh hi kehti hai ... "jug jug jiyo beta, jug jug jiyo"
englishDialogue: In this world god has made mother as a very particular thing ... from birth until the last breath of her son, every moment she keeps saying that ... "live long my son, live long"

dialogue: Jeevan ek sapna hai, duniya ek maya hai ... yeh main nahi kehta hoon, yeh vedon ne bataya hai
englishDialogue: Life is a dream, world is an illusion ... I'm not saying that, it has been written in the Vedas

dialogue: Mujhse baimaani mat karna main bahut pahuncha hua aadmi hoon ... baimaani mein shaitan ko tuition deta hoon
englishDialogue: Don't cheat with me since I'm a very recognized person ... and when it comes to cheating then I give tuitions to the devil

dialogue: Daulat waalon se kabhi dil lagana nahi chahiye ... woh kapde aur gadiyon ki tarah dil bhi badalte rehte hai
englishDialogue: You should never fall in love with rich people ... like clothes and cars they keep changing their heart as well

dialogue: Aapke chehre ko dekhne ke baad aate hue idea vapas chale jaate hai
englishDialogue: After looking at your face the ideas that come go away

dialogue: Gaadi mein bithao driver ban jaonga ... peeche bithao cleaner ban jaonga ... gaadi bighade toh usse dhakka lagaonga ... aur tumhe koi chhede toh uska khoon pee jaonga
englishDialogue: Make me sit in the car and I'll become a driver ... make me sit behind and I'll become a cleaner ... if the car breaks down then I'll push it ... and if someone teases you then I'll drink his blood

dialogue: Jis tarah vidhata ka likha taqdeer koi nahi badal sakta ... us hi tarah suhagan ka mangalsutra bhi koi nahi todh sakta
englishDialogue: Like no one can change the destiny written by god ... just like that no one can break the wedding necklace of a married woman

dialogue: Maa aurat ka sabse pavitra roop hota hai
englishDialogue: A mother is the most purest form of a woman

dialogue: Jab tak bandook mein aakhri goli hoti hai ... jung jeeti ja sakti hai
englishDialogue: Until there is one last bullet left in the gun ... a war can be won

dialogue: Shaadi janam janam ka bandhan hai ... aur yeh bandhan swarg mein hi tay ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is a bond of multiple life's ... and this bond is decided in heaven itself

dialogue: Main woh bala hoon joh sheeshe se patthar ko todhta hoon
englishDialogue: I am that trouble who breaks the stone with a glass

dialogue: Main is jhoot ko itne bade sach mein badal doonga ... ki woh sach ke sivah aur kuch nahi rahega
englishDialogue: I will transform this lie into such a big truth ... that it will be nothing but the truth

dialogue: Kanoon ki koi bhi kitaab zindagi ki kitaab se badhkar nahi ho sakti
englishDialogue: No book of law can be bigger than the book of life

dialogue: Main woh bala hoon joh jooton se tum jaise kutton ke sarr phodta hoon
englishDialogue: I am that trouble who breaks the head of dogs like you with shoes

dialogue: Puja ke diye se agar haath jal jaaye ... toh woh jalan bhi chandan jaisi thandak deti hai
englishDialogue: If your hands get burned from the oil lamp used in a prayer ... then that burning gives the coolness of sandalwood

dialogue: Doosro ki daulat ke pankh logon ko gharon se dur le jaate hai ... aur yeh pankh jinhe lag jaate hai ... woh wapis ghar lautkar kabhi nahi aate
englishDialogue: The feathers of money from others take people away from their homes ... and whoever gets these feathers ... they never return back home

dialogue: Jab tum tana maarte ho ... toh teer ki tarah aar paar ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When you taunt ... then the words goes through like an arrow

dialogue: Pati ke liye patni punya ka saathi hoti hai
englishDialogue: A wife is a companion of virtue for a husband

dialogue: Nange halaat ko alfaazo ki poshaak se dhakne ki koshish mat karo
englishDialogue: Don't try to cover the naked situation using the dress of words

dialogue: Tumhari khushi ke liye ... jeena hi meri zindagi hai
englishDialogue: For you happiness ... just living is my life

dialogue: Apna toh ek hi usool hai ... jeeyo toh apne liye, socho toh doosron ke liye
englishDialogue: I have only one protocol ... if you live then live for yourself, and if you think then think for others

dialogue: Ek doosre ka jootha peene ka matlab? ... ek doosre ka wafaadar rehna ... dost ka sar jhukne se pehle apna sar kata dena
englishDialogue: What is the meaning of drinking from the same glass? ... it means to stay loyal to each other ... and to slit your head before the head of your friend bows down

dialogue: Jab dil par bhoj ho aur dimag mein pareshani ... toh nishana kabhi fit nahi behatta
englishDialogue: When your heart is heavy and your mind is troubled ... then your aim never fits well

dialogue: Hum ek aur ek gyarah hai ... aur us saale ko nau-do-gyarah karna hai
englishDialogue: We are 1 and 1 equaling 11 ... and we have to make him run away from here

dialogue: Jab sar par burre din mandraate hai ... toh zabaan lambi ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When bad days come along ... then you tend to speak a lot

dialogue: Humko mitta sake yeh zamane mein dum nahin ... humse zamana khud hain ... zamane se hum nahin
englishDialogue: The world is not strong enough to obliterate me ... the world exists because of me ... not me because of the world

dialogue: Khudi ko kar buland itna ke har taqdeer se pehle ... khuda bande se khud pooche, bata teri raza kya hai?
englishDialogue: Elevate yourself to such an extent that before setting the destiny ... God himself shall ask the person, tell me what is your desire?

dialogue: Agar ab bhi tum na badal sake ... toh tumhare liye mujhe badalna padega
englishDialogue: If you still don't change ... then I'll have to change for you

dialogue: Paise ka lalach insaan ki akal mein daraare daal deta hai ... aur woh tumhari tarah, apni kismat khud jala bethta hai
englishDialogue: The greed of money makes cracks in the mind of a human ... and then just like you, he to burns his own destiny

dialogue: Waqt ki pabandi aadhi kamyabi hai ... aur baki lagan, shauk aur iraade se milti hai
englishDialogue: Being on time is half the success ... and the rest one gets from dedication, love and intention

dialogue: Hukum leta nahin, professor hukum deta hai
englishDialogue: Professor doesn't take orders, he gives them

dialogue: Insaaf toh ek chamakta hua suraj hai ... joh aankh dekhle toh savera ... joh na dekhe toh andhera
englishDialogue: Justice is a shining sun ... its morning for the eyes that see it ... and its dark for the eyes that don't see it

dialogue: Hamesha akal ki jeet nahi hoti ... kabhi kabhi akal taqat ke shikanje mein aa jati hai
englishDialogue: The mind does not win every time ... sometimes the mind comes inside the clutches of strength

dialogue: Meri nazar mein paida hona toh ittefaq hai ... lekin jeena ittefaq nahi
englishDialogue: In my opinion being born is a coincidence ... but living is not coincidence

dialogue: Iraada paida karo, iraada ... iraade se asmaan ka chaand bhi insaan ke kadmo mein sajda karta hai
englishDialogue: Keep an intention, intention ... with intention even the moon of the sky prostrates in front of the human feet

dialogue: Baadalo aur insaan ki saanso ka kya bharosa ... baadal kabhi bhi baras sakte hai ... saans kabhi bhi toot sakti hai
englishDialogue: One cannot trust the clouds and the human breathe ... the clouds can make it rain anytime ... and the human breathe can break anytime

dialogue: Log kehte hai teen din baad mehmaan shaitan dikhai deta hai
englishDialogue: People say that after three days a guest looks like a satan

dialogue: Yeh zindagi bhi ek ajeeb khel hai ... is khel mein bewakoof, kayar aur apahij tamasha dekhte hai ... aur akalmand, hauslamand and bahadur kood padte hai
englishDialogue: Life is also a strange game ... in this game the fools, the cowards and the handicap watch the entertainment ... and the wise, the spirited and the brave jump into it

dialogue: Apni laashon se hum tarikh ko aabad rakhe ... woh ladai ho ki angrez jisse yaad rakhe
englishDialogue: We will make the date eternal with our dead bodies ... but it should be a fight that the Englishmen should remember

dialogue: Kulhadi mein lakdi ka dasta na hota ... toh lakdi ke katne ka rasta na hota
englishDialogue: If the axe didn't have the handle of wood ... then there would have been no way to cut the wood

dialogue: Zulm aur jhoot ki dhaali par ek baar phal lagta hai ... dobara nahi
englishDialogue: Fruits can grow only once on the branches of injustice and lies ... not again

dialogue: Jab zindagi daudti hai ... toh ragon mein behta hua khoon bhi daudta hai
englishDialogue: When life runs ... then the blood flowing in the veins also runs

dialogue: Prem ki raah hoti hi hai aaisi ... raasta jitna lamba hota hai ... rahi utne nasdeek ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: The path of love is such that ... the longer the road is ... the closer the travelers get

dialogue: Yeh dard nahi zehar hai ... jise main na andhar pee sakta hoon ... na bahar ugal sakta hoon
englishDialogue: This is poison and not pain ... which I can't gulp inside ... and neither can I spit it outside

dialogue: Hum tum dono jab mil jayenge ... ek naya itihaas banayenge ... aur agar hum na mil paye toh ... toh bhi ek naya itihaas banayenge
englishDialogue: When we two meet together ... we will make a new history ... and if we are not able to meet ... then to we will make a new history

dialogue: Woh toh aaise chipak gaye hai ... ki agar censor dekhle toh kainchi chala de
englishDialogue: They are stuck in such a way ... that if the censor board sees it then they will use the scissors

dialogue: Tu patte baant ... jiski mem uski game
englishDialogue: You deal the cards ... one who gets the queen wins the game

dialogue: Gundon ko ek lakh aur bhale aadmi ko ek hazaar
englishDialogue: Goons get one lakh and the good man gets one thousand

dialogue: Pehle jaan pehchaan, phir dheere dheere dosti, phir pyar mohabbat ... phir waghera waghera
englishDialogue: First get to know, then slowly slowly friendship, then love romance ... then etc. etc.

dialogue: Naukri mili hai ... tankha nahi
englishDialogue: I've got a job ... not the salary

dialogue: Pehli tareek se, badi company mein, chota afsar ban raha hoon
englishDialogue: From the 1st, in a big company, I am becoming a small officer

dialogue: Dil mein kisi ke raah kiye ja raha hoon main ... kitna haseen gunah kiye ja raha hoon main
englishDialogue: I'm making a path in someone's heart ... what a beautiful crime I'm doing

dialogue: Yeh ashtray bhi khali karde ... yeh aur zulm nahin seh payegi
englishDialogue: Clean this ashtray also ... it won't be able to bear any more oppression

dialogue: Pehle mooh toh kadva karo
englishDialogue: First make your taste bitter

dialogue: Jaya-ji ke baad ... bada vacuum aa gaya hai industry mein
englishDialogue: After Jaya-ji ... there has been a big vacuum in the industry

dialogue: Zikr us parivash ka aur bayan apna ... ban gaya raqeeb aakhir tha joh razdan apna
englishDialogue: The tale of that beauty and my eloquent speech ... he who was my confidant has become my rival

dialogue: Oh ho shikaar!
englishDialogue: Oh ho prey!

dialogue: Maine joh tumhe chaha kya is mein khata meri ... yeh tum ho ya aaina, insaaf zara karna
englishDialogue: It's not my mistake that I love you ... whether it's you or the mirror, please do the justice

dialogue: Bankar, savarkar woh nikle makaan se ... yahi shor hoga yahan se, wahan se ... qayamat qayamat kisse kehte ho ... woh dekho qayamat chali jaa rahi hai
englishDialogue: She has stepped out of her house all dressed up ... there will be voices shouting that from here and there ... whom are you calling a calamity ... look there is a calamity passing by

dialogue: Udhar hai intezar apna, idhar dil beqarar apna ... aaye hai tere dar pe Omi, tu karde beda-par apna
englishDialogue: There she is waiting for me, here my heart is restless ... Mr. Omi has come to your door, you please make me happy

dialogue: Mere dost beediyon par utar aaye hain
englishDialogue: My friends are down to beedis

dialogue: Kanoon jurm ko dekhta hai, insaan ko nahi dekhta ... uske samne raja aur runk, ameer aur gareeb, maalik aur ghulam ... sab barabar hai
englishDialogue: The law looks at the crime and not at the person ... in front of it a king and a pauper, a rich person and a poor person, a boss and a slave ... are all equal

dialogue: Jis tarah insaan purane kapde phekkar naye kapde pehan leta hai ... us hi tarah aatma bhi purane jism ko chhodkar naya jism dharan kar leti hai
englishDialogue: Just like a person throws his old clothes and wears new clothes ... just like that even the soul leaves the old body and occupies a new body

dialogue: American ladki se ishq kar sakte hai ... shaadi nahi kar sakte ... aur desi ladki se shaadi kar sakte hai ... ishq nahi kar sakte
englishDialogue: You can romance an American girl ... but you can't marry her ... and you can marry an Indian girl ... but you can't romance her

dialogue: Aurat ko apna maan, bhakt ko uska bhagwan, gareeb ko uski aan aur amir ko uski shaan ... bahut pyari hoti hai
englishDialogue: Respect to a woman, god to a devotee, self-respect to a poor person and status to a rich person ... are very important to them

dialogue: Bhagwan kuch bhi nahi ek insaan hai joh mahaan hai ... bhakti kuch bhi nahi ek shakti hai ... karam kuch bhi nahi ek kartavya hai ... prem kuch bhi nahi ek anand hai ... yeh anand agar tumhe prapt karna hai toh tumhe usse, mujhse, har ek se prem karna hoga
