englishDialogue: God is nothing but a human who is great ... devotion is nothing but divine energy ... virtue is nothing but duty ... love is nothing but peace ... and if you want to achieve this peace then you'll have to love him (god), me, and everyone

dialogue: Bhagya ki rekhayein haathon mein nahi hoti ... insaan ke karamon mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: The lines of destiny don't exists in the hands ... they exists in the deeds of a person

dialogue: Duniya mein aaisa mujrim koi pehda nahi hua ... jiska anth kanoon ne na likha ho
englishDialogue: No criminal has ever been born in this world ... whose end is not written by the law

dialogue: Samajhte ho ki sab samajhta hoon ... isse badhkar insaan ki nasamajhi aur kya ho sakti hai
englishDialogue: To believe that you know you everything ... there is nothing more foolish than that for a person

dialogue: Hum police waale jis din yeh vardi pehen lete hai na ... us hi din se police waalon aur maut ka rishta kuch aas paas ka hi ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: The day we police officers wear this uniform ... from that day itself the relationship between a police officer and death becomes very close to each other

dialogue: Jinke haath na ho woh aatma se aashirwad dete hai
englishDialogue: Those who don't have hands give blessings from their soul

dialogue: Aulad na ho dukh hota hai ... aulad ho aur marr jaye bahut dukh hota hai ... lekin aulad ho aur nalayak, toh bardaash nahi hota
englishDialogue: You feel sad if you don't have a child ... and you feel very sad when your child dies ... but if you have a child who is useless, then you can't tolerate that

dialogue: Apun kutte ki woh dum hai joh barah baras nalli mein daalke rakho ... nalli tedhi ho jayegi ... apun seedha nahi hoga
englishDialogue: I am a dog's tail which even if you keep in a tube for 12 years ... the tube will get curled ... but I won't become straight

dialogue: Apne kiye ki sazaa toh har insaan ko bhugatni padti hai ... lekin apna jurm kubool karne se, uski sazaa jhelna aasaan ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Every person has to go through the punishment for their deeds ... but by accepting your mistake, it becomes easier to tolerate that punishment

dialogue: Aaj ya toh insaaf hoga ... ya mamla saaf hoga
englishDialogue: Today either there will be justice ... or the case will be cleared

dialogue: Apun jiske darwaze pe paon rakhta hai na ... uske aakha department ka darwaza band ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Whosoever's door I step on ... the door of their entire department then closes

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi insaan apne paap ka ek chota sa paudha chhodkar bhaag jaata hai ... lekin kismat us paudhe ko ek pedh banakar uske samne khada kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes a person runs leaving behind a small plant of his sins ... but destiny turns that plant into a tree and puts it in front of that person

dialogue: Hum toh un logon mein se hai joh is duniya mein sirf shareer lekar pehda huye hai ... hamari na toh taqdeer likhi jaati hai ... na hi aasman mein hamare muqaddar ke sitare hote hai
englishDialogue: I am one of those people who are born in this world only with a body ... no fate is written for us ... and neither are there any stars in the sky for our destiny

dialogue: Shareer par kodhe barsane se aatma ko koi farak nahi padta
englishDialogue: The soul doesn't care when the body gets whipped

dialogue: Jiske sar pe tujh jaise dost ki dosti ka saaya ho ... uske liye bankar aayi maut, uske dushmano ki maut ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: Whoever has the shadow of friendship on their head from a friend like you ... for him even the death that comes, becomes the death of his enemies

dialogue: Zindagi insaan ko laati hai, maut le jaati hai ... yeh sharaab beech mein kahan aati hai
englishDialogue: Life brings a human, death takes him away ... where does this alcohol come in between

dialogue: Kapde badalne se aadmi ki asliyat nahi badal jaati
englishDialogue: The reality of a man does not change by changing clothes

dialogue: Waqt se pehle aur naseeb ke baad koi cheez agar tere pass dene ko ho ... toh mujhe de dena
englishDialogue: If you have anything to give before time and after fate ... then do give that to me

dialogue: Aap ek achche aadmi hai ... aur ek achche aadmi ke haath mein sharaab ki bottal achchi nahi lagti
englishDialogue: You are a good man ... and an alcohol bottle does not look good in the hands of a good man

dialogue: Apne desh mein ladkiyan kapde utaarkar nahi ... balki pehenkar khoobsurat lagti hai
englishDialogue: In our country girls don't look beautiful by removing clothes ... instead they look beautiful by wearing clothes

dialogue: Hum apne dhande mein jis kisike saath taluk rakhte hai ... uski agli, pichli, sari zindagi ka hisaab kitaab apni kitaab mein rakh lete hai
englishDialogue: In our business whoever we connect with ... I keep an account of their past, future and their entire life in my books

dialogue: Kis kis tarah se mujhko na rusva kiya gaya ... gairon ka naam mere lahu se likha gaya ... kyun aaj uska zikr mujhe khush na kar saka ... kyun aaj uska naam mera dil dukha gaya
englishDialogue: I was dishonored in so many ways ... the names of strangers was written with my blood ... why is that her mention today could not make my happy ... why is that her name today broke my heart

dialogue: Tu mujhe chahe na chahe yeh tere bas mein toh hai ... aur main tujhko na chahun yeh mere bas mein nahi
englishDialogue: To love me or not is in your control ... but for me not to love you is beyond my control

dialogue: Dil cheez kya hai aap meri jaan lijiye ... bus ek baar mera kaha maan lijiye ... is anjuman mein aapko aana hai baar baar ... deewar-o-dar ko gaur se pehchaan lijiye
englishDialogue: What is this heart, you may take my life ... but for once you listen to me ... you have to keep coming in this gathering ... so carefully recognize these walls and doors

dialogue: Kitne toofan uthaye aankhon ne, naav yaadon ki doobti hi nahi ... tujhse milne ki, tujhko paane ki koi tatbir soojti hi nahi
englishDialogue: So many storms have these eyes have seen, but the boat of memories does not drown ... and I can't get any idea to meet you, to achieve you

dialogue: Ab aap samne hai toh kuch bhi nahi hai yaad ... varna kuch aapse hum mein kehna zaroor tha
englishDialogue: No that you are in front of me I don't remember anything ... otherwise I wanted to say something to you

dialogue: Aaine ke paas toh kuch bhi nahi ... meri aankhon mein teri tasveer hai
englishDialogue: The mirror does not have anything ... your picture is in my eyes

dialogue: Main aur meri tanhayi, aksar yeh baatein karte hai ... tum hoti toh kaisa hota ... tum yeh kehti, tum woh kehti, tum is baat pe hairaan hoti, tum us baat pe kitni hasti ... tum hoti toh aaisa hota, tum hoti toh waisa hota ... main aur meri tanhayi, aksar yeh baatein karte hai
englishDialogue: Me and my loneliness, often we talk ... if you were here then how would it have been ... you would have said this and said that, you would have been surprised at this, how much would you have laughed on this ... if you were here then this would have happened and that would have happened ... me and my loneliness, often we talk

dialogue: Phool khamosh rehkar bhi apne rang aur khusboo se bahut kuch keh jaate hai
englishDialogue: A flower stays quiet but it still says a lot with its colour and fragrance

dialogue: Woh baat joh lafzo mein ada ho jaye ... woh baat hi kya hui
englishDialogue: The thing that can be said with words ... is not a thing at all

dialogue: Majboor yeh halaat idhar bhi hai udhar bhi, tanhai ki ek raat idhar bhi hai udhar bhi ... kehne ko bahut kuch hai magar kisse kahe hum, kab tak yunhi khamosh rahe aur sahe hum ... dil kehta hai duniya ki har ek rasam utha dein, deewar joh hum dono mein hai aaj gira dein ... kyun dil mein sulaghte rahe, logon ko bata dein ... haan humko mohabbat hai, mohabbat hai, mohabbat
englishDialogue: This helpless situation is here and there as well, a night of loneliness is here and there as well ... I have a lot to say but whom should I say it to, until when should I remain quiet and suffer ... the heart says that let's break all the procedures of the world, and let's drop the wall that is between us ... why should we burn in our hearts, let's tell the people ... that we are in love, we are in love, in love

dialogue: Hum gayab hone waalo mein se nahi hai ... jahan jahan se guzharte hai jalwe dikhate hai ... dost toh kya, dushman bhi yaad rakhte hai
englishDialogue: I am not someone who will vanish ... from wherever I pass I show my talent ... not only friends, even my enemies remember me

dialogue: Aaj tak toh gham-e-rozgaar se daaman nahi chuda saka ... aap se milne ke baad shayad gham-e-dil se rishta ho jaye
englishDialogue: Till today I haven't been able to separate from the torment of life ... but after meeting you may be, I'll be able to build a relation with the torment of heart

dialogue: Haadsa banke koi khwaab bhikar jaye toh kya ho ... waqt jazbaat ko tabdeel nahi kar sakta ... door ho jaane se ehsaas nahi mar sakta ... yeh mohabbat hai dilon ka rishta ... aaisa rishta joh zameenon ki tarah sarhadon mein kabhi taqseem nahi ho sakta ... tu kisi aur ki raaton ka haseen chand sahi ... meri duniya ke har rang mein shamil tu hai ... tujhse roshan hai mere khwaab, meri umeedein ... main kisi raah se guzron, meri manzil tu hai
englishDialogue: So what if a dream turns into an incident and scatters ... time cannot change the emotions ... the feeling doesn't die when one becomes distant ... this love is a relationship of hearts ... a relationship which cannot be distributed like land on the borders ... you may be the beautiful moon of someone else's nights ... but you are present in every colour of my world ... my dreams, my hopes are enlightened because of you ... whichever path I may pass through, but you are my destination

dialogue: Sawaal agar khud jawaab ho ... toh sawaal, sawaal nahi rehta
englishDialogue: If the question itself is the answer ... then the question does not remain a question

dialogue: Tumhara intezar na karte hue bhi har modh par tumhara intezar kiya ... tumhari umeed na rakhte hue bhi maine har kadam par tumhari tamanna ki ... tumhe na chahte hue bhi maine tumhe itna chaha ki kisi aur ko chahne ki aarzoo bhi na rahi
englishDialogue: Without waiting for you I still waited for you on every turn ... without wishing for you I still yearned for you at every step ... without loving you I still loved you so much that I didn't have the desire to love anyone else

dialogue: Do lafz hai ... tanha, akele ... lekin ek saath likh diye jaye toh ek duniya, ek kainaat, ek talash, ek lamha, ek khushi ban sakte hai
englishDialogue: Two words ... isolation, loneliness ... but if you write them together they can become one world, one universe, one quest, one moment, one happiness

dialogue: Joh jitna door ho ... utna hi paas rehta hai
englishDialogue: The more distant a person is ... that much more closer that person is

dialogue: Yaadon ke jharokhon mein beeti hui baaton ko ... ukdhi hui saanson mein kuch lamhon ke raazon ko ... pyar ki shabnam mein unsune geeton ko ... sunsaan si rahon mein bhoole hue vaadon ko ... kaise koi yaad kare, kaise koi yaad kare ... khamosh sadaaon mein sapnon bhari raaton ko ... bheege hue mausam mein sarke hue aanchal ko ... moondi hui aankhon mein dhadakte nainon ko ... adh-khule hoton mein pritam ke chumman ko ... kaise koi yaad kare, kaise koi yaad kare
englishDialogue: The past things in the windows of memories ... the secrets of some moments in the disturbed breathes ... the unheard songs in the dew of love ... the forgotten promises on the lonely paths ... how can one remember that, how can one remember that ... the nights filled with dreams in the silent voices ... the disturbed scarf in the wet weather ... the moving eyeballs in the blinking eyes ... the kiss with your lover with his half open lips ... how can one remember that, how can one remember that

dialogue: Waqt jin mein tumhare labon ka rang nahi ... woh waqt guzra nahi ... tehar gaya hai kahin
englishDialogue: The moments that don't have the colour of your lips ... those moments haven't passed ... they have stopped somewhere

dialogue: Yeh raat hai ya tumhari zulfein khuli hui hai ... hai chandni ya tumhari nazaron se meri raatein dhuli hui hai ... yeh chand hai ya tumhara kangan, sitaren hai ya tumhara aanchal ... hawa ka jhaunka hai ya tumhare badan ki khushboo ... yeh pattiyon ki hai sarsarahat ki tumne chupke se kuch kaha hai ... yeh soochta hoon main kabse gumsum, ki jabki mujhko bhi yeh khabar hai ki tum nahi ho, kahin nahi ho ... magar yeh dil hai ki keh raha hai ki tum yahin ho, yahin kahin ho
englishDialogue: Is it night or is your hair disseminated ... is this moonlight or are my nights damped by your eyes ... is this the moon or your bangle, are these the stars or your scarf ... is this a gust of wind or the fragrance of your body ... is this the soft rustling sound of the leaves or did you whisper something ... I'm quietly thinking about this since a long time, and when I know that you are not here, nowhere around here ... but this heart is saying that you are here, somewhere around here

dialogue: Mister ka murder ho gaya, murder ka mister ho gaya ... dono milake murder mystery ho gaya
englishDialogue: The mister was murdered, the murder became mister ... together it became murder mystery

dialogue: Dosti joh hai na, bahut pavitra hai ... isko dosti hi rehne de ... iske upar pet, paisa, roti iski parchai na padne de
englishDialogue: Friendship is very holy ... let it be friendship only ... don't allow the shadow of stomach, money, food to fall on it

dialogue: Main tera dost hoon, tu haddi main gosht hoon ... tera mera saath hai, maut ki baat hai, dushman ki gardan mere haath hai ... yeh uski khopdi, yeh meri laat hai
englishDialogue: I am your friend, you are the bone I am the meat ... you and me are together, the topic is death, the enemies neck is in my hand ... this is his skull, this is my kick

dialogue: Tere liye toh maine nark ke darwaze bhi bandh kar diye kamine
englishDialogue: Bloody, for you I have even closed the doors of hell

dialogue: Yeh aasoon bhi bade baimaan hote hai ... na gham chupane dete hai, na khushi
englishDialogue: Tears are very fraudulent ... they don't let you hide sadness and neither happiness

dialogue: Insaan ki do maayen hoti hai ... ek maa joh insaan ko janam deti hai aur doosri us desh ki dharti jahan pe woh janam leta hai
englishDialogue: A human has two mothers ... one who gives birth to him and second the soil of the country where he is born

dialogue: Daulat se bhi badkar koi cheez hai aur woh hai pyar ... pyar se bhi ooncha kuch hai aur woh hai aadmi ka apna usool
englishDialogue: There is something bigger than money and that is love ... and there is something bigger than love as well and that is the principles of a person

dialogue: Na tera koi dharam hai, na tera koi karam hai ... tu bada besharam hai
englishDialogue: You have no faith, no generosity ... you're very shameless

dialogue: Marte marte main itna mar chuka hoon ... ki mujhe toh apne jeene par bhi shaq hone laga hai
englishDialogue: By dying bit by bit, I'm so dead that ... I've started to doubt on my existence

dialogue: Aapke anurodh pe main yeh geet sunata hoon ... apne dil ki baaton se aapka dil behlata hoon
englishDialogue: On your request I'm singing this song ... I'm entertaining you with the stories of my heart

dialogue: Pyar ka mazaa saath marne mein nahi ... saath jeene mein hai
englishDialogue: The fun of love is not in dying together ... it's in living together

dialogue: Kanoon kehta hai ki karz agar purana ho jaye ... toh usse chukane ki koi zaroorat nahi
englishDialogue: The law states that if the loan becomes old ... then there is no need to repay that

dialogue: Zinda rehne ke liye apne sivah kisi aur ka hona bilkul zaroori nahi hai ... aadmi jinke saath jeena chahta hai woh unke bagair bhi jee sakta hai
englishDialogue: To stay alive you don't anyone else other than you ... a person can also live without the people with whom he wants to live

dialogue: Bus mein tel jalta hai aur taange mein janavar ka khoon jalta hai
englishDialogue: In a bus oil burns and in a horse cart the blood of the animal burns

dialogue: Yeh toh anyay hai, ghor anyay ... aur main har anyay ka virodh karunga
englishDialogue: This is injustice, pure injustice ... and I'll fight against every injustice

dialogue: Aaisa toh aadmi life mein do-heech time bhaagta hai ... Olympic ka race ho yah police ka case ho ... tum kahe mein bhaagta hai bhai?
englishDialogue: A man runs like this only for two reasons in his life ... either in a race in Olympics or if it is a police case ... what are you running for brother?

dialogue: Hindu Muslim Sikh Isai ... sabhi toh hai bhai bhai
englishDialogue: Hindu Muslim Sikh Christian ... all are brothers

dialogue: Apun bahut famous aadmi ... bada bada paper mein apun ka chota chota photo chapta hai
englishDialogue: I am a very famous person ... big newspapers do publish a small picture of mine

dialogue: Kisi ki shab-e-vasl haste kate hai, kisi ki shab-e-hijr rote kate hai ... hamari yeh shab kaisi shab hai ki ya rab, na haste kate hai na rote kate hai
englishDialogue: The night of meeting for some people passes by in happiness, the night of separation for some people passes by in sadness ... oh god what kind of night is my night, it doesn't pass by in happiness and neither in sadness

dialogue: Kutte ki zaat pehchanni ho toh uske aage haddi daal do ... aur aadmi ko pechanna ho toh usse daulat aur taqat de do
englishDialogue: If you want to know the character of a dog then put a bone in front of him ... and if you want to know the character of a person then give him money and power

dialogue: Bina mushkil mein padhe kamyabi milti bhi toh nahi ... mushkilen itni padhi mujhpar ki aasaan ho gayi
englishDialogue: Without falling into difficulties you don't get success ... and there were so many difficulties on me that it actually became simple

dialogue: Mohabbat mein chirag-e-gul zamane ki hawa thandi ... chahe jitni bhi aag jale ishq ki, hawa thandi ki thandi
englishDialogue: In love the air flowing in the world of lightened flowers is cold ... no matter how much fire burns of romance, the air is still cold

dialogue: Is duniya mein apne zakhm dikhane nahi chahiye ... varna yeh log marham ki jagah usse namak se bhar dete hai
englishDialogue: You should not show your wounds in this world ... or else people will fill it with salt instead of ointment

dialogue: Goli ke bagair pistol bekaar hai ... aur akal ke bagair dono bekaar hai
englishDialogue: A pistol is useless without a bullet ... and both of them are useless without a brain

dialogue: Yeh haath bada ziddi hai ... gardan pakad le toh dum nikaal ke chhodta hai ... aur haath pakad le toh apna ke chhodta
englishDialogue: This hand is very stubborn ... if it catches a neck then it leaves only after squeezing it ... and if it catches a hand then it leaves only after owning it

dialogue: Malik ne hamari mitti kuch special kisam ki banai hai ... ki jis saanche mein dalo wohi roop dharan kar leta hai ... agar tange mein behta do toh tangewaala ban jata hoon, agar hawaijahaz mein behta do toh pilot ban jata hoon ... masjid mein mulla, mandir mein pandit ... aur agar dil mein behta do toh dilwaala
englishDialogue: God has made my properties of a special kind ... in whichever shape you put me I adopt that shape ... if you make me sit in a horse cart then I become a horse cart driver, if you make me sit in an aeroplane then I become a pilot ... religious leader in a mosque, saint in a temple ... and if you put me in a heart then I become a lover

dialogue: Khuda meherban toh gadha pehelwan ... sambhal meri jaan ... ek hi vaar mein dikhaon Hindustan
englishDialogue: A donkey is strong if god is graceful ... but take care my friend ... or else I'll show you India in one shot

dialogue: Insaan ko uske janam se nahi ... karam se parakhna chahiye
englishDialogue: A person should be judged by his deeds ... not by his birth

dialogue: Satyam, shivam, sundaram ... policesam, arrestam, andarham
englishDialogue: Think about truth, godliness and beauty ... forget it since the police is coming to arrest you and take you into captivity

dialogue: Sachai ka rishta khoon ke rishtey se ooncha hota hai
englishDialogue: The relationship of truth is bigger than the relationship of blood

dialogue: Yeh mitti pyasi hai, jis din iski pyaas bhuj jayegi ... yeh mitti sona ban jayegi
englishDialogue: This land is thirsty and the day its thirst will end ... this land will turn into gold

dialogue: Mein kal ke bare mein kabhi bhi nahi sochti ... ho rahega kuch na kuch ghabrayen kya ... zindagi sirf ek ittefaq ka naam hai
englishDialogue: I never think about tomorrow ... something will happen, no need to worry ... life is nothing but a coincidence

dialogue: Sahare insaan ko kamzor bana dete hai
englishDialogue: Support makes a person weak

dialogue: Hamare haath se naseeb waale hi marte hai
englishDialogue: Only the lucky people die from my hands

dialogue: Tu mere samne hai ... teri zulfein hai khuli, tera aanchal hai dhala ... main bhala hosh mein kaise rahoon, kaise rahoon
englishDialogue: You're in front of me ... your hair is untied, your scarf is flowing ... how can I not lose my senses

dialogue: Tera haath, haath mein aa gaya ... ke chirag raah mein jal gaye
englishDialogue: When your hand came in my hand ... then lamps lit in the path

dialogue: Main ek aurat hoon mitti ka dher nahi ... jiski joh chahe shakal bana li, jahan jee chahe rakh diya
englishDialogue: I'm a woman and not a pile of dirt ... which can be made to look as you desire and can be kept wherever you want

dialogue: Koi bhi pauda itni jaldi bada nahi hota jitni jaldi ke ladki
englishDialogue: No plant can grow as fast as a girl

dialogue: Door se main aap nazar aata hoon ... zara paas aa jaon toh baap nazar aata hoon ... aur bhi paas aa jaon toh phir potato chaap nazar aata hoon ... aur agar bilkul paas aa jaon toh phir chup-chap nazar aata hoon
englishDialogue: From far I look respectful ... when I come slightly closer then I look like a father ... and if I come even more closer then I look like a patty of potato ... and if I come absolutely close then I look very silent

dialogue: Wahan ka zarra zarra apni halat par salamat hai ... tumhare ek na hone se wahan lekin qayamat hai
englishDialogue: Every bit of there is doing well in it's condition ... but if just you're not there then there will be a disaster

dialogue: Jis desh mein humne janam liya hai ... us desh mein sachai ki puja hoti hai ... sach ke sivah zubaan par kuch nahi aa sakta
englishDialogue: The country in which we are born ... in that country truth is worshipped ... and I'll say nothing but the truth

dialogue: Jab bhi hamari tumhari mulaqat hoti hai ... koi na koi baat zaroor pehda hoti hai
englishDialogue: Whenever you and I meet ... something or the other definitely happens

dialogue: Aye meri jaane-jigar, patthar ka seena cheerkar, sari deewarein todkar, sabko akela chhodkar ... toofano se lad jaonga, tujhko magar le jaonga aur apne ghar jake garam garam chai pilaonga ... aur reh jayenge sab taapte, ek dujhe ka mooh taakte ... band karke raste aur tumhare vaste gajar ka halwa laonga
englishDialogue: Oh my love, I'll tear apart a stone, I'll break all the walls, I'll leave everyone alone ... I'll fight with the storms, but I'll take you to my house and serve you hot tea ... and everyone will be jealous, and will watch each others face ... I'll close the roads and bring a carrot dessert for you

dialogue: Jab hawa shabd ko badalti hui pehlu aayi ... muddaton apne badan se teri khushboo aayi
englishDialogue: When the air changed course and came on my side ... for a long time your fragrance was coming from my body

dialogue: Apni aankh ka shateer bhi tinka nazar aata hai ... aur doosron ki aankh ka tinka shateer nazar aata hai
englishDialogue: Even a huge thing in our eye looks like a particle to us ... and even a particle in someone else's eyes looks huge to us

dialogue: Gareeb ka janamdin toh uska maramdin hota hai ... janamdin, khansi-din, cheek-din yeh sab ameeron ke hote hai
englishDialogue: The birthday of a poor person is death-day for him ... birthday, cough-day, sneeze-din are only there for the rich people

dialogue: Kyun behti ho khoyi khoyi ... mere yogya hai seva koi?
englishDialogue: Why are you sitting as if you're lost ... is there anything that I can do?

dialogue: Joh kho diya uska gila nahi mujhe ... joh kabhi pa saka tha bas uska naaz hai
englishDialogue: I don't repent on what I have lost ... I am only proud of what I was able to achieve

dialogue: Insaan yaadon ke sahare nahi, umeedon ke sahare jeeta hai ... log mitt jaate hai, zindagi nahi mitati ... woh hamesha aage badti rehti hai, kisi naye sahare ke umeed mein
englishDialogue: A human doesn't live on the support of memories, he lives on the support of hopes ... people die, but life doesn't die ... it always keeps moving ahead, in hope of some new support

dialogue: Jawani ka mausam zindagi bhar nahi rehta ... jab tak hai aao dhoom machate hai
englishDialogue: The season of youth doesn't stay for the entire life ... but let's celebrate until it's there

dialogue: Zindagi ki khushi duniya ko pa lene mein nahi ... apne aap ko kho dene mein hai
englishDialogue: Happiness in life is not about achieving the world ... it is about forgetting yourself

dialogue: Wahin hai duniya, wahin hai swarg mera ... jahan tum ho, jahan tum ho, jahan tum ho
englishDialogue: My world is there, my heaven is there ... where you are, where you are, where you are

dialogue: Zindagi ki asli khushi doosron ko khush karke haasil ki jaati hai
englishDialogue: True happiness in life is achieved by making others happy

dialogue: Bhagwan jab dukh dard devat hai ... toh saath saath sehan shakti bhi devat hai
englishDialogue: When god gives sadness and pain ... then along with that he also gives the power to bear that

dialogue: Ladki zindagi mein sirf do baar ghar chhodkar jaati hai ... ek baar jab apne maa baap ke ghar se uski doli jaati hai ... doosri baar apne pati ke ghar uski arthi uthti hai
englishDialogue: A girl leaves her house only twice in her life ... first when her palanquin leaves from her parents house ... and second when her funeral leaves from her husbands house

dialogue: Khamosh rehna aur chup-chap sab kuch sehne ka naam hi aurat hai
englishDialogue: To stay quiet and to bear everything silently is what we call as a woman

dialogue: Hamare kaam mein joh aadmi hoshiyar nahi rehta ... woh kisi waqt bhi phas sakta hai
englishDialogue: In our work the one who is not alert ... he can get caught anytime

dialogue: Zindagi mein jis cheez ki tamanna ho usse logon mein baant do ... dhan chahiye dhan do, sukh chahiye sukh do, pyar chahiye pyar do ... sirf do aur dete raho ... kabhi kisi se kuch maango mat bas aankh bandh karke diye jao, diye jao
englishDialogue: In life distribute in people the thing that you desire for ... give money if you want money, give happiness if you want happiness, give love if you want love ... just give and keep on giving ... never ask for anything from anyone, just close your eyes and keep on giving

dialogue: Jeevan ke sare sapne vishvas ke bal par hi toh sache hote hai
englishDialogue: All the dreams of life come true on the strength of belief

dialogue: Jis desh ki ladkiyan besharam ho jaati hai ... wahan ke mardon ko sharam aane lagti hai ji
englishDialogue: A country in which the girls becomes shameless ... over there the men feel shy

dialogue: Pyar maangne ki cheez nahi hai ji ... dene ki cheez hai
englishDialogue: Love is not something that can be asked ... it's something that is given

dialogue: Aurat ke aanchal mein kutumb ki, desh ki, insaan ki aabroo hoti hai
englishDialogue: The honour of a family, a country, a person lies in the scarf of a woman

dialogue: Kaatilon ke aage koi rasta nahi hota ... sirf kanoon ki ek kali deewar hoti hai
englishDialogue: Killers have no path in front of them ... they only have the dark wall of the law in front of them

dialogue: Pyar devtaon ka vardaan hai joh sirf bhagyashaliyon ko milta hai
englishDialogue: Love is a blessing of gods that only the lucky ones get

dialogue: Dil hai kahan ... woh toh tune le liya hai zalim
englishDialogue: Where is the heart ... you have taken that away ruthless

dialogue: Sharafat se baat karo taaki main tumhe sharafat se jawaab de sakon
englishDialogue: Talk to me with decency so that I can answer you with decency

dialogue: Yahan joh bhi aata hai ... hamari marzi ki bagair bahar nahin jaata hai
englishDialogue: Whoever comes here ... does not go out without my permission

dialogue: Joh hamari jaan ka dushman na ho ... hum uski jaan nahin lete
englishDialogue: One who is not an enemy of my life ... I don't take their life

dialogue: Hamare samne koi doosra pistol rakhe ... yeh hum mein pasand nahin
englishDialogue: If someone keeps a pistol in front of me ... I don't like it

dialogue: Tu sarkar aur janta ko lootta hai ... aur main tujh jaise looteron ko
englishDialogue: You steal from the government and people ... and I steal from stealers like you

dialogue: Upar waala aaj tak jise na pehchan paya usse main kya pehchanuga
englishDialogue: How can I identify someone who has not been identified by God to date

dialogue: Aadmi chahe kitna bhi sangdil ho ... lekin uske andar ka insaan ekdum mar nahi jaata ... purani yaadein uska peecha nahi chhodti
englishDialogue: No matter how ruthless a person is ... but the human inside him just can't die lie that ... the old memories don't leave him alone

dialogue: Baat pistol ki goli hoti hai ... joh ek baar nikal jaye doobara vapas nahi aati
englishDialogue: Words are like a bullet from a gun ... once they come out then they can't go back

dialogue: Sangeet cheez hi aaisi hai ... saaz ho ya awaaz, kaano mein padte hi dil ke taar jhun-jhuna uthte hai ... aur chanchal mann ko shanti mil jaati hai
englishDialogue: Music is such a thing ... be it a musical instrument or a voice, the moment it reaches the ears the strings of the heart start to dance ... and the soft heart comes to peace

dialogue: Jeevan mein mahan wohi hota hai ... joh doosron ki muskaan ke liye apne aasoon pee le
englishDialogue: A person is defined great in life ... if he drinks his own tears for the smile of others

dialogue: Mere sapne ka sambandh aankhon se nahi hai, dil se hai ... jise mehsoos kiya ja sakta hai, dekha nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: My dream is connected to my heart, and not my eyes ... hence you can feel it, but can't see it

dialogue: Joh doosron ka adhikar cheenane mein kamyab nahi hote ... woh kisi na kisi tarah unki zindagi mein zehar bhar dete hai
englishDialogue: Those who are unsuccessful in snatching the rights of others ... they somehow or the other fill poison in their life

dialogue: Insaan ki sabse badi daulat hai uski insaaniyat, uska character
englishDialogue: The biggest wealth of a person is his humanity, his character

dialogue: Dhan daulat ko chalti phirti chaya kaha gaya hai ... aaj hai toh kal nahi ... fakr toh us daulat pe kiya jaye joh kabhi insaan ka saath na chhode ... aur woh hai sachai aur imaan ki daulat ... insaaniyat, daya aur dharam ki daulat
englishDialogue: Money and wealth has been called as a moving shadow ... today it's there and tomorrow it's gone ... you should only be proud of the wealth that never leaves the company of a person ... and that is the wealth of truth and honesty ... the wealth of humanity, sympathy and faith

dialogue: Yeh duniya than-than gopal ki hai ... jiske paas rupaiya nahi woh kuch nahi
englishDialogue: This world belongs to those who have money ... those who don't have money are nothing

dialogue: Aadmi ki achchai, uska character tab puja jaata hai jab uske paas rupaiya ho ... jab rupaiya paas na rahe toh aam logon ki nazar badal jaati hai
englishDialogue: The honesty and character of a person is appreciated when he has money ... when you don't have money then the general public changes their viewpoint

dialogue: Jise mile qadardan aaisi sundar ... woh prani hai naseeb ka sikandar
englishDialogue: The one who gets such a beautiful appreciator ... that person is very lucky

dialogue: Kuch cheezein aaisi hoti hai, jinhe jitna door hatao ... utna hi kareeb aati hai
englishDialogue: There are a few things that, the more you push them away ... they come that much closer

dialogue: Jiska koi dost nahi hota ... uska koi dushman bhi nahi hota
englishDialogue: One who doesn't have any friends ... also doesn't have any enemies

dialogue: Hum toh chamatkar ko namaskar karte hai
englishDialogue: I salute to magic

dialogue: Qatta kijiye na taluk humse ... kuch nahi hai toh adawat hi sahi
englishDialogue: I can stay for life with my worst enemy ... but I can't stay for a moment with a moron

dialogue: Mohabbat mein sawaal nahi kiye jaate
englishDialogue: You shouldn't ask questions in love

dialogue: Jeet toh uss hi ki hoti hai ... joh aakhri baazi jeete
englishDialogue: One who wins the last challenge ... wins the game

dialogue: Ek din mein main ek hi daav lagata hoon
englishDialogue: In one day I only gamble once

dialogue: Agar aaj shaam tak woh ghar wapas nahi lauta ... toh main dimaag ki jagah apne haathon ka istamal karoonga ... joh ki main yakeen se keh sakta hoon, utne hi tezz aur mazboot hai jitna ki mera dimaag
englishDialogue: If he doesn't return home by today evening ... then instead of my mind I will use my hands ... and I can say this with guarantee that, they are as sharp and strong as my mind is

dialogue: Hum, hum hai ... tum nahi
englishDialogue: I am, what I am ... and I am not you

dialogue: Yeh sher ki maa hai ... maine bakri ka nahi, sherni ka dhood piya hai
englishDialogue: She is a mother of a tiger ... and I have drunk the milk from a tigress and not a goat

dialogue: Saanp ki aulad ko kitna bhi dhood pilao ... aasteen ka saanp hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: No matter how much milk you feed to a snakelet ... he always stays under the arm

dialogue: Choron ke yahan chori ... chori nahi kehlati ... hera pheri kehlati hai
englishDialogue: Robbery at a robbers house ... isn't called robbery ... it's called monkey business

dialogue: Husn ke daamo mein hum ... dost ko nahi bechne waale
englishDialogue: For the price of a beautiful body ... I am not going to sell my friendship

dialogue: Naya khel, nayi taash
englishDialogue: New game, new pack of cards

dialogue: Kitna bhi bhaago, apni maut se nahi bhaag sakte ... aur tumhari maut mere haathon likhi hai
englishDialogue: No matter how much you run, you can't run from your death ... and your death is written in my hands

dialogue: Manzil tak pahunchne ke liye hosh nahi ... josh ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: To get to your destination you don't need your senses ... you need passion

dialogue: Kanoon ke haath kitne bhi lambe ho inspector sahab ... kisi sharif aadmi ke gelabaan tak kabhi nahi pahunch sakte
englishDialogue: No matter how long the hands of the law are ... they can never reach the neck of a honest person

dialogue: Kabhi raste mein mil jao toh katrakar guzar jana ... hum mein is tarah takna jaise pechana nahi tumne ... hamara zikr jab aaye toh yun anjaan ban jana ... ki jaise naam sunkar bhi hum mein jana nahi tumne
englishDialogue: If you ever see me on the road then cut through and pass by ... look at me as if you don't know me ... and if ever my name comes up then act unknowningly ... that you don't know me even after hearing my name

dialogue: Tera haath, haath mein ho agar ... toh safar hi asle-hayaat hai ... mere har kadam pe hai manzilein ... tera pyar gar mere saath hai
englishDialogue: If your hand is my hand ... then the journey itself is life ... and there is a destination on every step of mine ... if your love is with me

dialogue: Mere dil ka woh hissa ... kambakht mera kab tha
englishDialogue: That part of my heart ... hell was never mine

dialogue: Meri zindagi ka har ek pal, tere husn se hai judha hua ... tere honth thirke toh subah hai, teri zulf bhikre toh raat hai
englishDialogue: Every moment of my life, is connected to your body ... when your lips move then it is morning, and when you open your hair then it is night

dialogue: Is duniya mein aadmi insaan ban jaye ... toh bahut badi baat hai
englishDialogue: In this world if a man becomes a human ... then it will be a pretty big thing

dialogue: Tum insaan ke roop mein devta ho ... yah devta ke roop mein insaan
englishDialogue: Are you God in humans disguise ... or a human in Gods disguise

dialogue: Daag daaman pe nahin ... dil pe liya hai maine
englishDialogue: I haven't taken the hit on my moral ... but on my heart

dialogue: Aapne kabhi apni aankhen dekhi hai? ... jahan dekhti hai ek rishta kayam kar leti hai
englishDialogue: Have you ever seen your eyes? ... wherever they see, they build a relation

dialogue: Zindagi chand sawaal aur kuch jawaab hi toh bankar reh jaati hai
englishDialogue: Life in the end only becomes a few questions and some answers

dialogue: Main zara romantic kisam ka aadmi hoon ... shaadi ke baad ishq karna toh chhod diya hai ... is liye biwi se romance karke kaam chala leta hoon
englishDialogue: I am a slightly romantic person ... and I have stopped flirting after marriage ... that's why I live around by romancing with my wife

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi mere dil mein khayal aata hai ... ke zindagi teri zulfon ki naram chhaon mein guzarne pati ... toh shadaab ho bhi sakti thi ... yeh ranj-o-gham ki shayahi joh dil pe chayi hai ... teri nazar ki shuaon mein kho bhi sakti thi ... magar yeh ho na saka ... magar yeh ho na saka aur ab yeh aalam hai ... ki tu nahi tera gham teri justaju bhi nahi ... guzar rahi hai kuch is tarah zindagi jaise ... isse kisi ke sahare ki aarzu bhi nahi ... na koi raah, na manzil, na roshni ka suraag ... bhatak rahi hai andhero mein zindagi meri ... inhi andhero mein reh jauga kabhi khokar ... main janta hoon meri humnafas ... magar yoon hi kabhi kabhi mere dil mein khayal aata hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes, in my heart a feeling emerges ... that, if my life had passed in the soft shade of your hair ... then it could have been delightful ... this ink of sorrow that is spread on the heart ... it could have been lost in the rays of your eyes ... but that didn't happen ... but that didn't happen and now such is the scenario ... that you're not there, nor is your sorrow ... life is passing by in such a way ... as if it doesn't need anyone's support ... there is no path, no destination, and no clue of light ... my life is wandering in darkness ... in this darkness itself, I'll remain lost ... I know that my companion ... but still sometimes, in my heart a feeling emerges

dialogue: Meri baat ka meri humnafas, tu jawab de ki na de mujhe ... teri ek chup mein joh hai chupi, woh hazaar baaton ki baat hai
englishDialogue: Oh my life whether you reply or not to my question ... the silence that is hidden in you, has given me the answers for a 1000 questions

dialogue: Aap sooch kuch aur rahen hain ... pooch kuch aur rahen hain
englishDialogue: You are thinking something else ... asking something else

dialogue: Woh pyar hi kya joh samay ke parivartan ke saath badal jaye
englishDialogue: What good is that love which changes with the change in time

dialogue: Zindagi bhi ajeeb hai ... koi kisi ke itna kareeb hote huye bhi kabhi kabhi kitna door nazar aane lagta hai
englishDialogue: Life is strange ... a person may be very close to someone but still sometimes they seem to be so far

dialogue: Tum jaisi patni pakar apni taqdeer ki aarti utaarne ko dil chahta hai
englishDialogue: I wish to worship my destiny after getting a wife like you

dialogue: Zabaan aadmi ko neecha dikha deti hai ... usse zyada nahi chalana chahiye
englishDialogue: Talking makes a person look shallow ... hence you should not talk much

dialogue: Andhe paramatma ko pehchante hai ... aur aankhon waale aadhe ko bhi nahi pehchante
englishDialogue: The blind people recognize god ... and the people who can see don't even recognize the half of it

dialogue: Sukh na rahe toh dukh apas mein milkar baant lena chahiye
englishDialogue: If there isn't any happiness then you should share your sadness with others

dialogue: Stree ka bhagya muskurata hai toh tum jaisa pati milta hai
englishDialogue: When the destiny of a woman smiles then she gets a husband like you

dialogue: Ameer se uski daulat aur gareeb se uski izzat cheen lo ... toh hamesha hamesha ke liye mar jayega
englishDialogue: If you snatch the wealth from the rich and diginity from the poor ... then they will die forever

dialogue: Libaas badal dene se aatma nahi badal jaati
englishDialogue: By changing clothes the soul doesn't change

dialogue: Shaadi ke baad ka pyar hi zyada gehra hota hai
englishDialogue: The love after marriage is much more deeper

dialogue: Pistol haath mein le lena aasan hai ... lekin chalana aasan nahi
englishDialogue: It is easy to take the gun in your hand ... but it is hard to fire it

dialogue: Khushi ka ek pal aaisa bhi hota hai ki insaan sab kuch bhool jaata hai
englishDialogue: There comes a moment in happiness when a person forgets everything

dialogue: Zindagi insaano ko todhti, nritya naye sancho mein dhaalti rehti hai
englishDialogue: Life breaks people apart and keeps putting them in the mold of new plays

dialogue: Ek achche hospital ke liye sirf pakki imaarat aur chamakte hue furniture ki zaroorat nahi ... zaroorat hai to kaam karne waale haathon ki aur mehsoos karne waale dil ki
englishDialogue: For a good hospital you just don't need a strong building and shining furniture ... what you need are hands that work and hearts that can feel

dialogue: Raat mein soote hue joh sapne aate hai, woh sache nahi hote ... lekin din mein jaagte hue joh sapne dekhe jaate hai, woh hamesha sache hote hai ... kyun ki unka doosra naam hai irrada
englishDialogue: The dreams that come in the night while sleeping are not true ... but the dreams that you see being awake during the day are always true ... because their second name is intention

dialogue: Duniya abhi tak woh bandook nahi bana saki joh sachai ka khoon kar sake, nekki ko khatam kar sake
englishDialogue: The world has not yet been able to make that gun which can kill truth, which can end good deeds

dialogue: Doosre ke ghar ka cheena hua diya ... apne ghar mein kab tak ujala de sakta hai
englishDialogue: The lamp stolen from someone else's house ... how long can it give light in our house

dialogue: Jab jab insaan ke haath nek kaam karte hai ... unhe jalna padta hai, chaale padte hai ... phir aaise hi haathon par pyar ka marham lagta hai
englishDialogue: When the hands of a person perform good deeds ... they have to burn and get blisters ... and then on these hands we apply the ointment of love

dialogue: Aaisi nafrat bhi achi nahi ... joh ghate toh nafrat aur bade toh mohabbat ban jaye
englishDialogue: Such hatred is also not good ... which when reduces becomes hate and when it grows it becomes love

dialogue: Jaise sugandh ke bina phool adhoora reh jaata hai ... waise hi naari ka jeevan bina jeevan saathi ke adhoora reh jaata hai
englishDialogue: Just like a flower is incomplete without fragrance ... just like that the life of a woman remains incomplete without a life partner

dialogue: Nasha pilake girana toh sabko aata hai ... aare mazaa toh tab hai ki girton ko thaam le saakhi
englishDialogue: Everyone knows how to make someone drink alcohol and fall ... but my friend the fun is when you help the people falling

dialogue: Jab itni bewafai par tujhe dil pyar karta hai ... aare zalim agar tu bawafaa hota toh kya hota
englishDialogue: When the heart loves you with even such little unfaithfulness ... then what will happen when you become completely unfaithful

dialogue: Nar ka naari se, phool ka phulwari se aur mandir ka pujari se hamesha ek hi naata rehta hai ... aur uska naam hai dharam
englishDialogue: The relationship of a man with a woman, of a flower with a garden and of a temple with a priest is always only one ... and the name of that is duty

dialogue: Fall from a hilltop, fall from above, fall from anywhere ... but never fall in love
englishDialogue: Fall from a hilltop, fall from above, fall from anywhere ... but never fall in love

dialogue: Badhi dilchasp ghaflat ho gayi hai ... haai achanak unse ulfat ho gayi hai
englishDialogue: There has been a very interesting lethargy ... suddenly I'm in love with him

dialogue: Bhagwan ne kitni achchi tarah tumko sajakar is duniya mein behja hai ... aankhen jaise jheel mein khile hue do kamal ... dekhti hai toh aakash mein indradhanush khil uthte hai ... sharamati hai toh kaliyon ka sar jhuk jaata hai
englishDialogue: God has decorated you so well and sent you in this world ... your eyes are like two blossomed lotus flowers in a lake ... when they see then rainbows are formed in the sky ... and when they feel shy then flowers bow their head down

dialogue: Maine tumhari mohabbat ko ishwar ka vardaan samajhkar seene se lagaye rakha ... aur uske badle mein tumne mujhe kya diya? ... apni bewafai ka yeh zehar ... yeh zehar jisne meri nas-nas mein nafrat aur inteqam ke jwalamukhi bhar diye
englishDialogue: I kept your love in my arms thinking it was a blessing from god ... and instead of that what did you give me? ... this poison of your betrayal ... this poison that has filled volcanoes of hatred and revenge in my veins

dialogue: Hazaron beh gaye in botalon ke bandh pani mein ... glasson mein joh doobe phir na ubhare zindagani mein
englishDialogue: Thousands have been washed away with the liquid enclosed in these bottles ... those who drowned in the glasses have never come back in life

dialogue: Aurat ki izzat uska dharam hota hai
englishDialogue: The dignity of a woman is her duty

dialogue: Meri zindagi mein ek aag lagakar tum bhi chain se nahi jee sakogi ... tumhari aatma til-til karke jalegi aur tumhe sukh ka ek saans bhi nahi milega
englishDialogue: After starting a fire in my life even you won't be able to live peacefully ... your soul will burn slowly and you won't even get a single breath of happiness

dialogue: Joh haath tumhari madad ko uthega ... main us haath ko kaatkar phenk doonga ... joh chhat tum logon ko aasra degi ... main us ghar ko jalakar raakh kar doonga
englishDialogue: The hands that will rise to help you ... I'll cut those hands and throw them away ... the roof that will cover you guys ... I'll burn that house into ashes

dialogue: Chand tasveer-e-butaan, chand haseeno ke khutoot ... baad marne ke mere ghar se yeh samaan nikla
englishDialogue: A few photos and a few letters of beautiful women ... were found from my house, after I died

dialogue: Saaya palkon ka na chug jaye tan-e-nazuk mein ... unse kehta hoon joh aankhon mein basa karte hai
englishDialogue: I hope that the shadow of your eyes doesn't peck your delicate body ... I'm telling her who lives in my eyes

dialogue: Kahin sher aur nagma bankar, kahin aasoonyon mein dhalkar ... woh mile mujhe toh e-dil, kahin sooratein badalkar
englishDialogue: Sometimes as a poem and a song, sometimes within my tears ... she met my heart with many different faces

dialogue: Pyar ki seema sirf issi duniya tak nahi ... pyar toh bhavnaon ka ek aaisa phool hai ... joh ek janam se doosre janam aur phir janam janam tak mahekta rehta hai
englishDialogue: Love is not just limited to this world ... love is a flower of emotions ... which provides it's fragrance from one life to another and then for eternity

dialogue: Aadmi kitna hi bura kyun na ho ... woh kabhi na kabhi zaroor pachtata hai
englishDialogue: No matter how bad a person is ... at some point or the other he repents

dialogue: Dil ke paas rehne waala jab door chala jaata hai ... tabhi pata chalta hai hum usse kitna pyar karte hai
englishDialogue: When the one that is close to our heart goes far away ... then only we come to know how much we love them

dialogue: Ameeri aur gareebi ke darmiyan yeh joh fasla hai na ... yeh sadiyon se badta hi ja raha hai ... isse koi kam na kar saka
englishDialogue: The gap between the rich and the poor ... is growing since ages ... no one has been able to reduce that

dialogue: Naukri milne ke baad kaam rahe na rahe ... lekin naukri dhoondna bahut bada kaam hai
englishDialogue: Whether there is work or not after I get a job ... finding a job is big work itself

dialogue: Humko toh gardish-e-haalat pe rona aaya ... rone waale tujhe kis baat pe rona aaya?
englishDialogue: I was crying looking at my situation ... what are you crying for?

dialogue: Joh paa lene ko pyar kehta hai ... usse hazaron lakhon janam lene padenge pyar ka matlab samajhne ke liye
englishDialogue: The one who says that achieving someone is love ... that person will have to take hundreds and thousands of births to understand the meaning of love

dialogue: Sach joh kisi ki jaan lele ... usse kahin achcha hai woh jhoot joh kisi ko maut ke mooh se bacha le
englishDialogue: A lie that saves someone from the mouth of death is much better than ... the truth that kills someone

dialogue: Insaan par duniya pehre laga sakti hai ... magar pyar par nahi
englishDialogue: The world can confine a human ... but not love

dialogue: Milap ki teen manzilen hoti hai ... pehli manzil nafrat aur ladai ... doosri manzil dosti aur safai ... teesri manzil pyar aur sagai
englishDialogue: Amalgamation has three storeys ... first storey of hatred and fight ... second storey of friendship and purification ... and third storey of love and engagement

dialogue: Duniya mein bahut si aaisi baatein hoti hai joh namumkin nazar aati hai ... lekin agar insaan himaat se kaam kare aur woh sachcha hai ... toh jeet ussi ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: There are so many things in the world that appear impossible ... but if a person acts with courage and if he is truthful ... then he will win

dialogue: Jab koi nadaan ladki pyar ki manzilon se guzar jaati hai ... apni izzat aur abroo kho beheti hai ... toh anjaam zindagi nahi, maut hota hai
englishDialogue: When an innocent girl travels across the destinations of love ... she loses her respect and honour ... and then the outcome is death, not life

dialogue: Fakira khada dukaan par, maange sabki khair ... na kahu usse dosti, na kahu usse bair
englishDialogue: A priest is standing outside the shop, and he wishes welfare of all ... neither friendship nor enmity with anyone at all

dialogue: Fakira jama nadi mein, sabki maange khair ... ho gayi dosti Mahesh se, ab na raha khandan ka bair
englishDialogue: A priest is standing in a river, and he wishes welfare of all ... we are now friends with Mahesh, hence the family doesn't have an enemy

dialogue: Ajeeb waqt mohabbat mein aaye jaate hai ... woh hum mein aur hum un mein samaye jaate hai
englishDialogue: Strange times do come in love ... she gets engrossed in me and I get engrossed in her

dialogue: Dane dane par likha hai khane waale ka naam ... woh teri hai aur teri hi rahegi subah shyam
englishDialogue: On every bite of food is written the name of the person who will eat it ... morning and evening she is yours and she will remain yours

dialogue: Yeh zindagi ki mehfil, mehfil mein hum akele ... daaman ko koi chume, zulfon se koi khele
englishDialogue: This party of life and I'm alone in the party ... let someone kiss your scarf and play with your hair

dialogue: Mohabbat bhare dil ka salaam kubool farmaiye ... meherbani hogi naam bataiye
englishDialogue: Please accept greetings from a heart filled with love ... it will be your courtesy if you tell me your name

dialogue: Raat bhar anda pakaya, phir bhi woh kacha reh gaya ... mar gaye shayar, lekin ullo-ka-patha reh gaya
englishDialogue: I boiled the egg all night but still it was uncooked ... all the poets have died but this fool got left behind

dialogue: Daulat dekar insaan khareede jaate hai, imaan khareede jaate hai ... magar kisi ke mann mandir mein base hue bhagwan nahi khareede jaa sakte
englishDialogue: With money you can buy people, you can buy integrity ... but you can't buy the god that lives in the heart of someone

dialogue: Butane mahwaz ujadhi hui manzil mein rehte hai ... ki jiski jaan lete hai, us hi ke dil mein rehte hai
englishDialogue: She lives in a ruined building ... but she kills me and then she resides in my heart

dialogue: Ajab hoti hai yeh jhooti mohabbat ... zabardasti main phuslaya gaya hoon ... main apni maa se darkar bhaag aaya ... main khud aaya nahi, laya gaya hoon
englishDialogue: False love is strange ... I've been convinced forcefully ... I ran away being scared of my mother ... I've not come myself, but I've been brought here

dialogue: Khili thi dhoop-e-harsam aur pani barasta tha ... jab tu paida hua toh teri maa roti thi aur baap hasta tha
englishDialogue: There was sunlight everywhere and water was flowing ... when you were born your mother was crying and your father was laughing

dialogue: Koi mooh chum lega is nahi par ... shikhar reh jayegi yunhi zabi par
englishDialogue: I wish to kiss you when you say no ... and your apprehensions will be put to rest

dialogue: Ab mujhe tumhe pyar karne se koi nahi rok sakta ... tum bhi nahi
englishDialogue: Now no one can stop me from loving you ... not even you

dialogue: Tumhara naam maine sirf apne jism par hi nahi ... apne dil, apne dimag aur apni aatma par bhi gaad diya hai
englishDialogue: Not only have I buried your name on my body ... but also in my heart, in my mind and in my soul

dialogue: Koi bhi rishta kitna bhi mahaan, kitna bhi bada kyun na ho ... uske khatam ho jane se zindagi khatam nahi hoti
englishDialogue: No matter how great and how big a relation is ... life does not end when that relation ends

dialogue: Sansar mein agar koi cheez logon ko zinda rakhti hai na ... toh woh pyar hai, pyar
englishDialogue: If there is something that keeps people alive in the universe ... then that is love, love

dialogue: Rishta wahi safal ho sakta hai ... jisme do logon ke beech barabari ho
englishDialogue: Only that relation is a success ... in which two people are equal

dialogue: Bahar ki duniya mein kadam rakhte hi tumko pata chal jayega ... ki zindagi kis berehami se mushkilon ka samna karati hai
englishDialogue: When you step in the world outside you will know ... that how ruthlessly life makes you encounter with problems

dialogue: Ek chota aadmi apne ochepan ka saboot tab deta hai ... jab woh bewajah kisi ki kabiliyat pe shak karta hai
englishDialogue: A cheap person gives the proof of his cheapness ... when he unnecessarily doubts on someones elses potential

dialogue: Imaandari ka toofan baad par aayi nadi ke paani ki tarah phail jaata hai ... aur baimaani ki fasal ka naam aur nishaan mitta deta hai
englishDialogue: The storm of honesty spreads like the flood water from the river ... and it erases the existence of the crops of dishonesty

dialogue: Mohabbat karne waala door ho jaye ... toh nafrat se hi mohabbat karni padti hai
englishDialogue: When the person you love becomes distant ... then you have to love hatred itself

dialogue: Sharafat aur imaandari ka certificate yeh duniya sirf unhe deti hai ... jinke paas daulat hoti hai
englishDialogue: The world gives the certificate of truth and honesty only to those people ... who have money

dialogue: Taqdeer jiska mazaak banade ... uska sabhi mazaak udhate hai
englishDialogue: A person who is fooled by destiny ... everyone makes a fool out of him

dialogue: Jhoot ki deewarein imaandari ki thokar par ret ka dher ban jayengi
englishDialogue: The walls of lies break and turn into sand when they are knocked by honesty

dialogue: Jhoote saboot kitne bhi mazboot ho ... jhoote hi hote hai
englishDialogue: No matter how strong the false evidences are ... they are lies

dialogue: Suraj paschim se nikal sakta hai ... chandni aag barsa sakti hai ... lekin tujh jaisa mujrim kabhi nahi sudhar sakta
englishDialogue: The Sun can rise from the west ... the moonlight can emit fire ... but a criminal like you can never improve

dialogue: Purana kaam chhodne se purani dushmani nahi choot jaati
englishDialogue: By leaving old work you don't lose old enmity

dialogue: Kanoon jazbaat ki nahi sabooton ki zabaan sunta hai
englishDialogue: The law listens to the language of proofs and not emotions

dialogue: Jiske sar par kafan banda ho ... uske sar par sehra nahi bandh sakta
englishDialogue: The one who wears a shroud on his head ... he can't wear a turban on his head

dialogue: Jab zulm sehne waala apna sar jhuka leta hai ... toh zulm karne waale ki taqat badh jaati hai
englishDialogue: When the person bearing the injustice bows his head down ... then the strength of the person doing the injustice grows

dialogue: Tumhare jaise gunahgaron ke khilaf mere jaise officer ... file nahi banate ... faisla kar dete hai
englishDialogue: Against criminals like you, officers like me ... don't make a file ... they decide the verdict

dialogue: Maut ke baad maut ... tumhe kai mauten maroonga
englishDialogue: Death after death ... I'll give you multiple deaths

dialogue: Talwar kitni bhi tezz ho ... lekin apne mayaan ko kabhi nahi kaatti
englishDialogue: No matter how sharp a sword is ... it never cuts it's own scabbard

dialogue: Sharaab bhi aaisi cheez hai ... koi gham mein peeta hai toh koi khushi mein ... magar main sharaab is liye peeyonga ... ki ab na gham raha na khushi
englishDialogue: Alcohol is such a thing that ... someone drinks in sorrow and someone drinks in happiness ... but I'll drink alcohol because ... now there is no sorrow and no happiness left for me

dialogue: Kuch log chale jaate hai magar marte nahi ... aane waali zindagiyon mein khushboo bankar reh jaate hai
englishDialogue: Some people leave but they don't die ... then stay like fragrance in the coming lives

dialogue: Mujhe zyada bolne ki aadat nahi hai ... main joh bolta hoon woh sun aur joh nahi bolta hoon woh dhyaan se sun
englishDialogue: I'm not in the habit of saying a lot ... listen to what I'm saying and listen carefully to what I'm not saying

dialogue: Jab sangeet aur sangeetkar ek ho jaye ... toh us samay bhagwan ke darshan hote hai
englishDialogue: When music and musician become one ... then at that moment you get to witness god

dialogue: Shaadi vivah mein jab bhi jaana hota hai na ... toh hamari memsaab ko toh do din pehle bata dena padta hai ... unko sajne savarne mein itna waqt lag jaata hai ... ki shaadi ke din ki bajai hum pehle bache ke janam din par hi pahunch paate hai
englishDialogue: Whenever we have to go for a wedding ... then I have to tell my wife atleast a couple of days ahead of time ... she takes so much time to get ready that ... instead of the wedding we end up reaching on the birthday of the couple's 1st child

dialogue: Ek aurat ke liye uske pati ke pyar ke bina duniya ki tamaam daulat, saare sukh ke samaan ... us bejaan kagaz ke phool ki tarah hote hai ... jin mein banavati rang toh hote hai lekin zindagi ki khushboo nahi hoti
englishDialogue: For a woman all the wealth and all the luxuries of the world, without her husband ... are like those lifeless paper flowers ... which have artificial colours in them but not the fragrance of life

dialogue: Jab tu bahar se kisi daulat waale ka bangla dekhega na ... toh tujhe lagega ki bhagwan ne isse bahut kuch diya hai ... par jab andar jaake dekhega ... toh tujhe lagega bhagwan ne isse bahut kuch cheen bhi liya hai
englishDialogue: When you'll look at a rich man's bungalow from outside ... then you'll feel that god has given him so much ... but when you'll go inside and see ... then you'll feel that god has also taken away a lot from him

dialogue: Aurat ki sundarta aur jawaani ka mehatva tabhi hai ... jab us mein mard ko rijhane ki adayein ho ... patthar ko pighlane waale husn ka jaadu ho
englishDialogue: The beauty and youth of a woman has value only when ... she has the style of pleasing a man ... she has the magical body that could melt a stone

dialogue: In doctoron ke chakkar bhi ajeeb hote hai ... jinke paas kuch nahi hota, unhe kehte hai phal khao, makhan khao, badam khao ... aur jinke paas sab kuch hota hai, unhe kehte hai ki yeh mat khao woh mat khao
englishDialogue: These doctor are very strange ... those who have nothing, they tell them eat fruits, butter, almonds ... and those who have everything, they tell them don't eat this and don't eat that

dialogue: Is duniya mein tarakki karne ke liye ... na bolna bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To make progress in this world ... it is very important to say no

dialogue: Insaan bhi pehle janwar tha ... sadiyan lagi usse janwar se insaan banne mein ... lekin tujhe insaan se janwar banne mein zara bhi waqt nahi laga
englishDialogue: A human was also an animal before ... it took him ages to turn into a human from an animal ... but it hardly took you time to turn into an animal from a human

dialogue: Tum apni maut ki taraf chal nahi ... balki daud rahe ho
englishDialogue: You are not walking towards your death ... infact you are running towards it

dialogue: Apna ussool kehta hai ... agar fayda ho toh jhoot ko sach maan lo ... dushman ko dost bana lo
englishDialogue: My rule says that ... if you see the benefit, then treat the lie as the truth ... and make the enemy your friend

dialogue: Dushman se agar fayda ho ... toh usko apna dost banalo
englishDialogue: If you see any benefit from the enemy ... then make him your friend

dialogue: Vijay Dinanath Chauhan ... poora naam
englishDialogue: Vijay Dinanath Chauhan ... is my full name

dialogue: Maine tumhe maa ke kadmo ke neeche swarg dhoondne ka paath padaya ... aur tum tawaif ke kadmo ke neeche nark dhoondne chale aaye ho
englishDialogue: I taught you the lesson to find heaven in your mother's feet ... and you have come here looking for hell in the feet of a prostitute

dialogue: Agar aaisa ho gaya toh apna khopdi phir jayega ... aur tumhara mundi kat jayega
englishDialogue: If this happens then my head will spin ... and your head will be chopped

dialogue: Sawaal jis zabaan mein kiya jaye ... jawaab us hi zabaan mein dena chahiye
englishDialogue: The tone is which the question is asked ... the answer should also be given in that tone

dialogue: Sirf tere haath hi nahi ... tera shareer, teri aatma, sab maile ho chuke hai
englishDialogue: Not only your hands ... even your body, your soul, everything has become dirty

dialogue: Kamzor ki dosti ... taqatwar ke vaar ko kam kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Friendship with the weak ... makes the attack of a strong person weak

dialogue: Galat cheez banaya telephone ... udhar se aadmi soochta kuch hai, bolta kuch hai, karta kuch hai
englishDialogue: Telephone is a bad thing ... from the other side a person thinks something, says something else and does totally something else

dialogue: Kehne ko yeh shehar hai, sirf kehne ko ... par idhar jungle ka kanoon chalta hai
englishDialogue: Only to say this is a city, only to say ... but here the laws of the jungle work

dialogue: Waqt pe pahunchneka apna purana aadat hai
englishDialogue: It is my old habit to be on time

dialogue: Manzil ko paane ke liye insaan jab apne hi aasoon, khoon aur pasine mein lat-pat ho jaata hai ... toh mushkilen uska raasta kabhi nahi rok sakti
englishDialogue: When a person gets covered with his tears, blood and sweat to achieve a goal ... then the difficulties can never stop him

dialogue: Idhar har taqatwar apne se kam ko maarkar jeeta hai malum? ... maarkar
englishDialogue: Do you know here every strong person lives by killing people weaker than him? ... by killing

dialogue: Apna ussool kehta hai ... har galati ki saza maut hai ... sirf maut!
englishDialogue: My rule says that ... every mistakes punishment is death ... only death!

dialogue: Apna ussool kehta hai ... daayen haath se jurm karo ... baayen haath ko pata bhi na chale
englishDialogue: My rule says that ... when you commit the crime with your right hand ... your left hand should not even come to know about it

dialogue: Aaj shaam che bajhe maut ke saath apna appointment hai
englishDialogue: I have an appointment with my death at six o'clock today evening

dialogue: Apna ussool kehta hai ... jab dushman ki umar badh jaaye toh usse dosti karlo ... apni umar badh jaati hai
englishDialogue: My rule says that ... when the life of your enemy increases then befriend him ... it increases your life also

dialogue: Yeh che foot ka body ludkane ke liye char inch ka goli kam pad gaya malum?
englishDialogue: You know that a 4 inch bullet was not enough to bring down this 6 foot man?

dialogue: Is duniya mein zinda rehne ke liye ... bhigda hua hona bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To stay alive in this world ... it is very important to be naughty

dialogue: Buzdil hota hai woh insaan joh doosre ke bataye huye paap ke raaste par chalkar ... apni sharafat ko apne pairo tale raund daalta hai
englishDialogue: A coward person walks on someone else's sinful path ... and crushes his own honesty with his own legs

dialogue: Sachchai ke raaste par chalne waalo ko ... duniya ki parwah nahi karni chahiye
englishDialogue: People who walk on the path of truth ... should not worry about the world

dialogue: Andhere ko agar mitaana ho ... toh diye ko apne sarr mein aag lagani padti hai
englishDialogue: If you want to eliminate the darkness ... then the candle has to burn its wick

dialogue: Agar pyar karna bagawat hai, kisi ko sahara dena bagawat hai ... toh main aapke khilaf, aapke kanoon ke khilaf, aapke samaaj ke khilaf bagawat karta hoon ... main bhaagi hoon ... haan main bhaagi hoon
englishDialogue: If loving is to revolt, if helping someone is to revolt ... then I am revolting against you, against your law, against your society ... I'm a rebel ... yes I'm a rebel

dialogue: Agar yeh hi hai aapki duniya toh nahi chahiye mujhe aapki duniya ... nahi chahiye mujhe woh duniya jis mein ek ladki ke saare haq cheene jaye ... beti hone ka, behen hone ka, biwi hone ka ... ek zinda insaan ko ek bejaan cheez ki tarah bazar mein rakha jaye ... uska mol lagaya jaye, usse khareeda jaye, usse becha jaye ... aur phir kaha jaye ki yahi duniya ka dastoor hai ... nahi chahiye mujhe aapki duniya
englishDialogue: If this is your world then I don't want your world ... I don't want the world in which all the rights are taken away from a girl ... to be a daughter, to be a sister, to be a wife ... where she is kept as a non-living thing in the market ... she is priced, she is bought, she is sold ... and then it is said that it's the custom of the world ... I don't want your world

dialogue: Apun ke dhande ke andhar rishta nahi ... fayda soocha jaata hai
englishDialogue: In our business we don't think relations ... we think profit

dialogue: Yeh duniya bahut badi aur lambi hai ... magar Dhanraj ke haath usse kahin zyada bade aur lambe hai
englishDialogue: This world is very big and long ... but the hands of Dhanraj are much bigger and longer than that

dialogue: Aurat aur sharab ka mila-jula nasha aaisa nasha hai ki ... bade bade sultan barbad ho gaye
englishDialogue: The combined intoxication of women and alcohol is such that ... even the best of the best rulers have got ruined

dialogue: Yeh chor aur police ki joh dosti hoti hai na badi mushkil se hoti hai ... aur jab hoti hai toh atoot hoti hai
englishDialogue: The friendship between thieves and police is very hard to happen ... but when it happens then it is unbreakable

dialogue: Tumhe kho diya hai paane ke baad ... teri yaad aayi tere jaane ke baad
englishDialogue: I lost you after achieving you ... and I remembered you after you left

dialogue: Aurat, aag aur sharab mard ke bas mein hi ho toh achcha hota hai ... mard inke bas mein ho, inka ghulam ban jaye ... toh yeh usse jala dalti hai
englishDialogue: It's good if a man has control over women, fire and alcohol ... but if a man is under their control and he becomes their slave ... then they burn him

dialogue: Woh maar maroonga tujhe ... joh shaitan ne apni sauteli aulaad ko bhi nahi maari hogi
englishDialogue: I'll hit you in such a way ... which not even the devil would have used on his step children

dialogue: Tujhe main itne dino tak bandh rakhunga saale ... jab tak tu chakki pees-peeskar sarkar ke liye itna paisa kama le ... ki sarkar ka jail banane ka karcha vasool ho jaye
englishDialogue: I'll keep you locked up for so many days ... until you earn enough money for the government by grinding flour ... which would cover the expenses of the government for building the jail

dialogue: Woh aaye apun ke ghar khuda ki kismat hai ... kabhi apun darwaza bandh kar dete hai, kabhi kholte hai
englishDialogue: It's a blessing of god that you came to my house ... sometimes I close my door and sometimes I open it

dialogue: Mujh mein itna zehar bhara hai ... ki mujhe kaatkar shaitan bhi zinda nahi reh sakta
englishDialogue: I have so much poison in me ... that even the devil won't be able to stay alive after cutting me

dialogue: Mujrim kitni bhi hoshyari kare ... saboot ko zameen ki kok mein dafan kyun na karde ... lekin ek na ek din uska gunaah uske samne aaine ki tarah khada ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: No matter how smart a criminal is ... and even if buries the evidence in the ground ... but one day his crimes will come and stand in front of him like a mirror

dialogue: Jab baat apni maut ki aati hai na ... toh aadmi ke dimaag ki sari khidkiyan khul jaati hai
englishDialogue: When it comes to your own death ... then all the windows of a persons mind open up

dialogue: Bahut khush hona bhi achchi baat nahi hai ... aasoon nikal aate hai
englishDialogue: It's not good to be very happy ... because tears come out

dialogue: Sharifon ki izzat paison se zyada keemti hoti hai
englishDialogue: Respect for honest people is more expensive than money

dialogue: Zulm ko insaaf ki chakki mein pisne ka waqt aa gaya hai
englishDialogue: The time has come for injustice to grind in the mill of justice

dialogue: Khamoshi mein joh baat kahi jaati hai ... usse samajhne ke liye ek dard bhara dil chahiye
englishDialogue: The point that is said in silence ... to understand that you need a heart full of pain

dialogue: Woh meri zindagi hai, meri aatma hai ... woh meri hai bilkul ussi tarah jis tarah is seene mein dhadakta hua dil mera hai ... is seene mein chalti hui saans meri hai ... in ragon mein daudta hua khoon mera hai
englishDialogue: She is my life, she is my soul ... she is mine just like the heart beating in my chest is mine ... just like the breath in my heart is mine ... just like the blood flowing in my veins is mine

dialogue: Chai ki chah hai kuch aur nahi hai ... ek cup agar mil jaye parvah nahi hai
englishDialogue: I wish for tea and nothing else ... if I can get a cup of it then I don't mind it

dialogue: Samajh samajhke samajh ko samajho ... samajh samajhna bhi ek samajh hai ... samajh samajhke na joh samajhe meri samajh mein woh nasamajh hai ... teri samajh hi samajh nahi hai, samajh parayi ko bhi toh samajho ... samajh parayi ko joh na samajhe ... meri samajh mein woh nasamajh hai
englishDialogue: After thinking and understanding try to understand the thought ... even thinking and understanding is a thought ... the one who doesn't understand even after thinking and understanding is silly in my opinion ... your thought is not the only thought, try to understand someone else's thought as well ... the one who doesn't understand someone else's thought ... is silly in my opinion

dialogue: Badna daam ka poocho na tum aaj ke is zamane mein ... subah joh thi char aane mein, shyam mein hai woh barah aane mein
englishDialogue: Don't ask about the rising prices in this world ... what was for 25 paise in the morning, is for 75 paisa in the evening

dialogue: Apni toh khair man gayi jab aap aayi thi yahan ... dhoonda kiye khud hi ho, jaane kahan kahan
englishDialogue: I've been totally lost since you came here ... I searched for myself here, there and everywhere

dialogue: Paise mein kya rakha hai, baat karo tum prem pyar ki ... paise ki keemat sasti hai, mehengi dosti yaar ki
englishDialogue: What is there in money, let's talk about love and affection ... the value of money is cheap and the value of friendship with a friend is worth a lot

dialogue: Kal se bekal hoon kisi kal mujhe kal nahi aati ... kal joh aa jaati mujhe kal toh bekal aati
englishDialogue: Since yesterday I'm restless that tomorrow will not come for me tomorrow ... and if tomorrow comes to me tomorrow then restlessness will also come along

dialogue: Yun toh bhuj chuka hai tumhare husn ka hookah ... aare ek hum hai joh gudh-gudhaye jaate hai
englishDialogue: The hookah of your beautiful body is however blown off ... but I'm still the one who is blowing it

dialogue: Na maal tera, na maal mera ... yeh maal hai bas maal-e-ganimat ... badhe buzurgon ne sach kaha hai ... maang mat, maang mat, maang mat
englishDialogue: Neither the money is yours, nor is the money mine ... this money is free booty ... elders have said the truth ... don't ask for it, don't ask for it, don't ask for it

dialogue: Cancer ka ilaaj hai iss duniya mein ... lalach ka nahi hai
englishDialogue: In this world cancer can be treated ... but not greed

dialogue: Zindagi mein kabhi izzat mat khona
englishDialogue: Never lose respect in life

dialogue: Bade ghar ka damaad banna, jaise topi ko sar se utaar ke pairo mein pehenna
englishDialogue: Becoming a son-in-law of a rich family, is like removing the hat from the head and wearing it on the legs

dialogue: Kulhaari ko pair pe maaro, ya pair ko kulhaari pe maaro ... har halat mein pair hi katne waala hai
englishDialogue: Whether you hit the axe on the leg, or hit the leg on the axe ... in any case the leg is going to get cut

dialogue: Insaan toh is duniya mein ek doosre ki hamdardi ke liye hi paida hua hai
englishDialogue: A human has been born in this world to sympathize with others

dialogue: Jis ghar mein naari jaati ko maan diya jaata hai, izzat di jaati hai ... us ghar mein devta baste hai ... aur jis ghar mein naari jaati ka apmaan hota hai ... us ghar mein rakshash rehte hai
englishDialogue: The house in which women are treated well and respected ... in that house God lives ... and the house in which women are humiliated ... in that house devils live

dialogue: Bhagwan ka banaya hua sansar ek aisa bazaar hai ... jahan insaan ka kiya hua hisaab usse yahin chutta karke jaana padta hai
englishDialogue: The universe made by God is a market ... where you have to pay right here for your deeds

dialogue: Jakh marti hai police, utaar kar phenk do yeh vardi aur pehan lo Balwant Rai ka patta apne gale mein ... you bastards
englishDialogue: Police is a waste, take out and throw the uniform, and wear Balwant Rai's leash in your neck ... you bastards

dialogue: Aane waale chaubis ghanto mein tumhare chaubis tukde karke ... har tukde ka alag alag antim sanskar karoonga
englishDialogue: In the next 24 hours, I will cut you into 24 pieces ... and I will do the funeral rites of each piece separately

dialogue: Rishwatkhori aur makaari ne tum logon ke jism mein maa ke doodh ke asar ko khatam kar diya hai
englishDialogue: Bribery and cunningness has finished the affect of mothers milk in your body

dialogue: Andhe behron ka shehar hai yeh ... patthar hai yeh sab ke sab ... yahan toh bas sarr phoda ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: This city is of the blind and the deaf ... everyone is a stone ... here only one can break their head

dialogue: Main tera woh hashar karoonga ... ke tujhe apne pehda hone par afsoos hoga
englishDialogue: I will bring you to the condition where ... you will repent on your birth

dialogue: Woh aayega, zaroor aayega ... aur apne saath ek aaisa toofan layega ... jisse tumhari yeh maut ki factory, reth ke gharonde ki tarah deh jayegi
englishDialogue: He will come, for sure ... and he will bring such a storm with him ... which will destroy your factory of death, just like the houses of sand flow away

dialogue: Jakar dumm hilana unke samne ... talwe chatna ... botiyaan phekenge botiyaan!
englishDialogue: Go and wag your tail in front of him ... and lick his boots ... he will throw bones at you, bones!

dialogue: Joh zindagi mujhse takrati hai ... woh sisak-sisakar dum todhti hai
englishDialogue: The life that collides with me ... sobs in despair and dies

dialogue: Is chot ko apne dil aur dimaag par kayam rakhna ... kal yahi aasoon kranti ka sailaab bankar is mulk ki sari gandagi ko baha le jayenge
englishDialogue: Continue to remember this wound on your heart and mind ... tomorrow these tears will become the flood of revolution and they will flow away all the dirtiness of this country

dialogue: Tumhari oonchi shakhsiyat ... aur sharifana libaas ke peeche chupe shaitan ko main pehchaan chuka hoon
englishDialogue: I have identified the devil hiding behind your respectful dress ... and your big personality

dialogue: Yeh ajeeb rishtey hai ... in mein log alag toh ho sakte hai ... par juda nahi ho sakte
englishDialogue: These relationships are strange ... in these people can separate ... but they cannot stay away

dialogue: Jin logon ko qaid mein rehne ki aadat ho jaati hai ... unhe khushi qaid mein hi milti hai
englishDialogue: The people who are used to staying in captivity ... they are happy in captivity only

dialogue: Ameeron se gareebon ki haddiyan toh chabayi ja sakti hai ... unke ghar ki roti nahi
englishDialogue: Rich people can chew the bones of poor people ... but not the food of their house

dialogue: Ab hua malum aahon ka dhuan hota hai kya ... apne daaman mein lagi aag toh rota hai kya?
englishDialogue: Now you know how it feels like to be in pain and sorrow ... and now that you're on fire, you're crying?

dialogue: Main tera khoon karoonga aur tera ghost apni gali ke kutton ko khilaonga
englishDialogue: I'll kill you and give your meat to the dogs of my colony

dialogue: Jab gareeb ka khoon khaulta hai ... toh uske gusse ke sailaab mein daulat ke bade se bade pahad toot jaate hai
englishDialogue: When the blood of a poor person boils ... then in that flood of anger even the biggest mountain of money breaks apart

dialogue: Mazloomon ka saathi, bebason ka bhai ... aur ablaon par zulm karne waalon ke liye kasai hoon main
englishDialogue: I'm a friend for the victims, a brother for the helpless ... and I'm a butcher for those who do injuctice on the weak

dialogue: Waqt kaise bhi guzar jaata hai ... waqt ki yahi ek achchi baat hai
englishDialogue: Time passes by somehow or the other ... this is the only best thing about time

dialogue: Jurm ki zindagi ek aaisa dhagaa hai ... jis mein agar ek baar aadmi uljha toh bas ulajhta hi jaata hai
englishDialogue: The life of crime is such a thread that ... if a person gets tangled in it once then he only gets more and more tangled in it

dialogue: Tumne abhi tak mere sholay nahi dekhe, sharafat dekhi hai ... jis din sharafat chhod di maine, us din koi bhi tumhara rakhwala banne se inkaar kar dega
englishDialogue: You have seen my honesty, not my embers ... and the day I leave my honesty, no one will be ready to protect you

dialogue: Mujhe jeetne ki bahut buri aadat hai
englishDialogue: I have a very bad habit to win

dialogue: Do premiyon ko milane ke liye hazaar jhoot bhi bolne pade ... toh bolna chahiye
englishDialogue: If you have to say a thousand lies to unite two lovers ... then you should say them

dialogue: Meri shaan meri laash ke saath hi giregi ... usse pehle nahi
englishDialogue: My pride will only fall with my body ... not before

dialogue: Naya nau din ... purana sau din
englishDialogue: 9 days of the new generation ... are like 100 days of the old generation

dialogue: Asli daulat gadiyaan, bungley, bank balance, kutte, billiyaan nahi hote ... asli daulat woh hamare apne hote hai
