englishDialogue: Real wealth is not cars, mansions, bank balance, dogs, cats ... real wealth is our own people

dialogue: Dil daulat se zyada taqatwar hota hai
englishDialogue: The heart is much stronger than money

dialogue: Main tera Yamraj hoon
englishDialogue: I am your God of death

dialogue: Joh mard apne pyar ke bandhan ki hifazat nahi kar sakta, woh mard nahi ... joh aurat apne pyar ke bandhan ko todna chahti hai, woh aurat nahi
englishDialogue: A man who cannot protect his bond of love, is not a man ... and a woman who wants to break her bond of love, is not a woman

dialogue: Mere paas woh kuch bhi nahi joh aapke paas hai ... lekin itna paisa hai ki ek mangalsutra khareed sakta hoon ... itni taqat hai ki kamakar khila sakta hoon ... aur itni mardangi hai ki bachche pehda karke aapko nani bana sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I don't have anything that you have ... but I have the money to buy a wedding necklace ... I have the strength to earn and feed ... and I have so much manhood that I can become a father and make you a grandmother

dialogue: Bhagwan se toh kayi baar aapko maang liya hai ... bas ab aapse aapko maangna baaki hai
englishDialogue: I have asked god many a times for you ... but now what's remaining is to ask you for you

dialogue: Agar kabhi phir se shaadi karoonga toh aaisi khubsoorat ladki se ... joh hotel mein entry kare toh lage Sridevi, drawing room mein behti ho toh Madhuri Dixit, aur andar ke room mein ho toh Kimi Khaatpar ... matlab Katkar
englishDialogue: If I ever get married again then I'll marry such a beautiful girl ... who looks like Sridevi when she enters a hotel, Madhuri Dixit when she is sitting in the drawing room, and Kimi Khaatpar when she is in the room inside ... I mean Katkar

dialogue: Apni zindagi toh aaise chal rahi hai jaise ee desh ko tohri sarkar ... bina engine ke handle, upar se scandal pe scandal
englishDialogue: My life is going on just like your government for this country ... it's a handle without an engine, and on top of that there are many scandals

dialogue: Pair choone se bade chote nahi ho jaate hai ... magar chote joh hai woh khote zaroor ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: By touching the feet a big person doesn't become small ... but a small person definitely becomes insincere

dialogue: Pedh, nadi aur dharti se bada koi daani nahi ... aur foren joh apni bhool sudhaar le usse bada koi gyani nahi
englishDialogue: There is no bigger giver than a tree, river and earth ... and no learned person is bigger than the one who corrects his mistake right away

dialogue: Shareer ke botal mein jawani ka khoon joh hai woh sode ki tarah ubal raha hai ... kyun ki jawani rang hai, bahaar hai, khumaar hai, suroor hai, guroor hai ... ashaon ka khilna hai, mann ka milna hai, mann ki mannat hai, dil ki jannat hai
englishDialogue: The blood of youth is boiling like soda in the bottle of the body ... because youth is colour, is spring, is intoxication, is pleasure, is pride ... it's the blossoming of desires, it's the meeting of the hearts, it's a wish of the heart, it's the heaven of the heart

dialogue: Hum saadharan premi nahi ... desh premi hai
englishDialogue: I'm not a simple lover ... I'm a patriot

dialogue: Aapka suputra bahut samajhdar hai ... yeh maana ki teekhi dhaar hai, magar zara dildar hai
englishDialogue: Your son is very sensible ... I agree that he is a bit rude, but he is slightly beloved as well

dialogue: Yeh hi Mama Banarasi ka dhanda hai ... gale mein samasya ka phanda hai ... magar Mama Banarasi kaatte hai aur shaadi byah ke rishtey ko prasad ke ladoo ki tarah baantte hai
englishDialogue: This is Mama Banarasi's business ... there is a hangman's knot of problems in the neck ... but Mama Banarasi cuts that and distributes the relationships of marriage like a sweet from a religious offering

dialogue: Is duniya mein bahut sari khushkismat jawaniyan aaisi hai jinke saron par baap ke daulat ki chhat hai ... joh apne pair pe nahi baap ke pair pe chalti hai ... aur baap ki jeb ko apna dil banake duniya mein jeeti hai
englishDialogue: In this world there are many lucky youngsters who have the roof of their father's wealth on them ... those who walk on their father's legs and not on their legs ... and those who make their father's pocket as their heart and live in this world

dialogue: Main toh film bhi dekhkar pasand karti hoon, story sunkar nahi ... ussi tarah main ladka bhi dekhkar pasand ya napasand karoongi
englishDialogue: I select a film after seeing it, not by listening to its story ... just like that I'll select or reject a guy after seeing him

dialogue: Jab kaam ka bhoj badh jaata hai na ... toh dimaag ki wiring mein short circuit ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When the load of work increases ... then the wires of the brain get short circuited

dialogue: Ek ek do do peg toh do do takke ke log peete hai ... hum toh poori botal peene waalon mein se hai
englishDialogue: Cheap people drink one or two pegs ... I'm someone who finishes the entire bottle

dialogue: Hum toh kalakar hai ... hamari kala ki taqdeer mein car likhi hi nahi hai ... yeh kalakar bekaar sadakon par dhukaar ki tarah ghoom raha hai, dhukaar ki tarah
englishDialogue: I'm an actor ... and there is no car written in the destiny of my talent ... here an actor is roaming on the streets like an useless person

dialogue: Aatma ek magar naam do, Kishen Kanhaiya ... ab dekhna main kaise bajata hoon inka band bhaiya
englishDialogue: One soul but two names, Kishen and Kanhaiya ... now watch how I play drums with them

dialogue: Main toh aakhi zindagi samajhdari ki baat karte rehta hoon ... magar afsoos ki baat yeh hai ki pehli martaba meri samajhdari ki baat aapki samajhdari ki pitaari mein utari hai ... samajhe ki nahi?
englishDialogue: I keep talking about sensible things my entire life ... but it's a pity that for the first time my sensible point has entered into your pot of senses ... does that make sense?

dialogue: Chup chaap anyay sehna kamzori hai ... magar anyay karne waale ko chetavani dekar muqabale ki ghoshana karke ... mann ki dhirdta se, magar ahinsa se uske anyay ka anth dekhna kamzori nahi, shakti hai
englishDialogue: It is weakness to bear injustice ... but challenging a sinner, announcing a battle ... and to watch the end of injustice with non-violence and a strong heart is power, and not weakness

dialogue: Dharti par itna anyay karne ke baad bhi ... insaan ko jeene ke liye, palne ke liye, yahan tak ki marne ke liye bhi dharti ko gaud chahiye ... yahi dharti ki jeet hai
englishDialogue: Even after committing so many sins on the earth ... to live, to grow and even to die a human needs the lap of the earth ... this is victory for the earth

dialogue: Atmavishvas se insaan ko hi nahi ... bhagwan ko bhi jeeta ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: With self confidence you can not only win a person ... but God as well

dialogue: Jab aulad ki zindagi ka sawaal ho ... toh maa din aur raat nahi dekhti
englishDialogue: When it comes to the life of a child ... then a mother doesn't see if it's day or night

dialogue: Upar waale ne yeh dil patthar ka banaya hai ... isse shock toh lag sakta hai, lekin kabhi stop nahi ho sakta
englishDialogue: God has made my heart of stone ... it can take a shock, but it can never stop

dialogue: Muqaddar ke badshah ke liye kuch bhi namumkin nahi hai
englishDialogue: Nothing is impossible for the king of destiny

dialogue: Ek baap das bachche paida kar sakta hai ... lekin das bachche milkar ek baap nahi bana sakte
englishDialogue: One father can produce 10 children ... but even 10 children together cannot make a single father

dialogue: Ek patni apni pati ke liye apne armaano ka khoon toh kar sakti hai ... lekin ek maa apni aulad ki khushi ke liye sari duniya se takra sakti hai
englishDialogue: A wife can kill her wishes for the sake of her husband ... but a mother can fight with the entire world for the sake of happiness of her child

dialogue: Joh rishta swarth ke dhaago se bandha ho ... uske toot jaane mein koi harj nahi
englishDialogue: A relationship that is tied together with a thin thread ... should have no issues when it breaks

dialogue: Naye jooton ki tarah shuru mein naye naye afsar bhi kaatte hai
englishDialogue: Just like new shoes, even new officers bite in the beginning

dialogue: Toofan mein hum apni khushi chahte hai ... jaan hatheli pe liye jee jaate hai ... tum woh joh samundar jinhe kha jaata hai ... hum woh joh samundar ko pee jaate hai
englishDialogue: In the storm I want my own happiness ... I live carrying my life in my hands ... you are the one whom the ocean eats ... I am the one who drinks the ocean

dialogue: Sher ki khaal pehenkar aaj tak koi aadmi sher nahin ban saka
englishDialogue: By wearing a tigers skin no man has become a tiger till today

dialogue: Aurat toh narm matti ki bani hoti hai ... kabhi bhi toot sakti hai
englishDialogue: Women are made out of soft clay ... they can break anytime

dialogue: Chalaaki karne waala khud hi apni chalaaki ka shikaar ho jata hai
englishDialogue: A foxy person will become the prey of his own foxiness

dialogue: Dil ki awaaz dil se suni jaati hai
englishDialogue: The voice of the heart is heard from the heart

dialogue: Kauva oonchai par bahetne se kabootar nahi ban jata
englishDialogue: But sitting on great heights a crow does not become a pigeon

dialogue: Rishwat khao aur rishwat khilao
englishDialogue: Take bribe and give bribe

dialogue: Bahut log is rupaiye ke peeche bhaagte hai ... lekin chand aaise hote hai jinke peeche rupaiya bhaagta hai
englishDialogue: There are a lot of people who run behind money ... but there are a few behind whom money runs

dialogue: Humne dekhe hai bahut baatein banane waale ... baatein waale toh janaab kaam kidhar karte hai ... woh joh dekhe hi nahi toofan uthate sagar ... woh kya khaak samundar mein safar karte hai
englishDialogue: I have seen a lot of people who cook stories ... and people who cook stories don't work ... those who have not seen the sea raising the storm ... no way they can travel in the sea

dialogue: Insaaf ke jin saudargaro ke bhram par, tum farz ka sauda kar rahe ho ... unki gardane bhi hamare haatho se door nahi
englishDialogue: The deal that you are doing of the duty, under the delusion from the merchants of the law ... even their necks are not far away from my hand

dialogue: Hamari aadatein bhi toh harami hai
englishDialogue: My habits are also scoundrelly

dialogue: Yeh maa ki gaud nahin hai ... maut ki gaud hai
englishDialogue: This is not the lap of a mother ... it is the lap of death

dialogue: Mere chehre pe kutte ki naak lagi hui hai ... main apne karazdaar ko soongh ke pakad leta hoon
englishDialogue: I have a dogs nose on my face ... I can smell my debtor and catch him

dialogue: Shobhraj joh karta hai woh kehta nahi ... pehle karta hai phir kehta hai
englishDialogue: Shobhraj doesn't say first whatever he does ... he does it first and then says it

dialogue: Jab bete ki ghar mein shikayatein aane lage aur gaon mein charcha hone lage ... toh samjho beta jawan ho gaya
englishDialogue: When the complaints for a son start coming into the house and people start talking about it in the village ... then understand that he has become young

dialogue: Meri nazar padne se pehle isse itni door le jana ... ki hawa bhi iska pata mujh tak na pahuncha sake
englishDialogue: Before I see him again, take him so far away ... that even the wind won't be able to give his address to me

dialogue: Kaam samajh kar karogi toh mushkil hai ... pyar samajh kar karogi toh kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: It will be hard if you do it thinking it as work ... but if you do it as love then it is nothing

dialogue: Kalakar banne ki chah ko bahar agar hai lana ... toh sheeshey ko thodi takleef dijiye aur dil ko ek bahana
englishDialogue: If you want to bring out your interest of becoming an actor ... then give the mirror some difficulties and your heart a reason

dialogue: Joh ek baar bhaagte hai ... woh hamesha bhaagte rehte hai
englishDialogue: Those who run once ... they keep running forever

dialogue: Chabuk banakar tudha maroongi na ... hosh aayega toh budha ho jayega
englishDialogue: If I'll use my hand and hit you as a whip ... then you'll be old when you regain your consciousness

dialogue: Style bhi toh koi cheez hoti hai
englishDialogue: Style is also something

dialogue: Shakal dekhi hai aaine mein ... amavas ke chand par Maggi noodles latkaye hue hai ... chudail kahinki
englishDialogue: Have you seen your face in the mirror ... it looks like Maggi noodles are hanging on the moon of a no moon night ... you witch

dialogue: Tu is duniya ke isharon par nahi ... apne dil ki dhadkan par nachne ke liye paida hui hai
englishDialogue: You are born to dance on the heartbeats of your heart ... not on the fingers of this world

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi apne heere ki pehchan nahi hoti ... keh dete hum toh yunhi kuch bhi ladakpan mein ... magar sach yeh hai ki ... aap nahi hote toh jaan nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Sometimes you can't recognize your own diamond ... and we say anything in our youth days ... but the truth is that ... this life would not be here if you were not here

dialogue: Chokriyan bahut mil jaati hai ... lekin Laila dobara kisi ko nahi milti
englishDialogue: You'll get many a girls ... but no one gets Laila for the second time

dialogue: Kismat toh kholne ki baat hai, khul jaati hai ... har dil ki chaabi hai, dhoondo toh mil jaati hai
englishDialogue: Destiny is all about opening it, it sure will open ... every heart has a key, you'll find it if you look for it

dialogue: Meri toh juein bhi nahi nachi aaj tak
englishDialogue: Not even my louses have danced to date

dialogue: Jhatak ke patak doongi, latak ke mar jayega
englishDialogue: I will jolt and throw you, and you'll die hanging

dialogue: Galat baat ko kis tarah lena chahiye ... yeh hamare khandan ke bachchon ko doodh mein pilaya jaata hai
englishDialogue: How do you deal with the wrong thing ... the kids in our family are given that lesson mixed with milk

dialogue: Joh dil se nikalta hai woh kala hota hai ... joh dil mein dabba rehta hai woh kaala hota hai
englishDialogue: What comes out from the heart is talent ... and what stays within the heart is black

dialogue: Zindagi bilkul in barf ki reshu ki tarah hi toh hai ... pal bar ke liye taherti hai aur pighal jaati hai ... par kambhakt jitni derr rehti hai, badi khoobsurat lagti hai
englishDialogue: Life is just like the soul of the snow ... it stays for sometime and then melts ... but for the time it stays, it looks beautiful

dialogue: Zindagi mein paise zyada bhale hi ho ... kam kabhi nahi padne chahiye
englishDialogue: In life it is OK to have more money ... but you should never have less

dialogue: Pehle ek Hindustani ko samajh lo ... Hindi apne aap aa jayegi
englishDialogue: First try to understand an Indian ... you will understand Hindi automatically

dialogue: Itihaas koi akela nahi rach sakta ... itihaas rachne ke liye apno ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: No one can create history alone ... you need your dear ones to create history

dialogue: Jab dost ke irrade pakke ... toh dushman ke chutte chakke
englishDialogue: When the intentions of friends are strong ... then the enemies will bite dust

dialogue: Mukka-laat ke baad joh mulaqat hoti hai ... badi pakki hoti hai
englishDialogue: The meeting that happens after a fight ... is very strong

dialogue: Jab tarazu mein paise ka palhada halka ho jaata hai ... tab maut ka palhada bhari ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: In a beam balance when the pan of money becomes light ... then the pan of death becomes heavy

dialogue: Joh hamara taraf aankh uthayega, hum uska aankh phod dalega ... joh saala awaaz uthayega, hum uska zubaan kaat dalega ... aur joh sar uthayega, uska sar todh dega
englishDialogue: The one who will look into my eyes, I'll smash his eyes ... the one who will raise his voice, I'll cut his tongue ... and the one who will raise his head, I'll break his head

dialogue: Kaam, naam aur anjaam ... sab tay hai
englishDialogue: Work, name and outcome ... are all decided

dialogue: Insaan joh karam karta hai ... unhi karamon ki karmi milti hai usse
englishDialogue: The deeds that a person does ... he goes through the consequences of the same deeds

dialogue: Agar tune meri zindagi ki taraf aankh uthakar bhi dekha ... toh teri zindagi mein aaise aaise scene likh doonga ... joh na tune kabhi dekhe honge na sune honge
englishDialogue: Even if you try to look towards my life ... then I'll write such scenes in your life ... which you would have never seen before and neither heard of

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi jeetne mein woh mazaa nahi hai ... joh doosron ko jeetane mein hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the fun in winning is not that great ... as the fun that you get in letting others win

dialogue: Ya rab na woh samjhe na samajhenge meri baat ... de aur na dil unko, toh de mujhko zabaan
englishDialogue: Oh god she hasn't and she will not understand my point ... don't give her any more heart, instead give me the words to explain

dialogue: Chinta chitta ke samaan hoti hai

dialogue: Beer sharab ki choti behen hoti hai
englishDialogue: Beer is a small sister of alcohol

dialogue: Rab milaye jodi ... ek andha, ek kodi

dialogue: Abhe tu chal ... bavasir ka phoda!
englishDialogue: Move on ... you boil from piles!

dialogue: Desire is the root cause of all evil
englishDialogue: Desire is the root cause of all evil

dialogue: Ek awaaz hai joh mere kano mein goonjti rehti hai ... ek chehra hai joh meri aankhon ke samne baar baar aa jata hai ... mere dil ka sukoon thi woh
englishDialogue: There is one voice that keeps echoing in my ears ... there is one face that keeps coming in front of me every time ... she was the peace of my heart

dialogue: Maine maut ko bahut kareeb se dekha hai ... kisi aur ki zindagi ke liye marna hi meri manzil hai
englishDialogue: I have seen death very closely ... to die for someone else is my destination

dialogue: Jinke apne sapne poore nahi hote na ... woh doosron ke sapne poore kartein hai
englishDialogue: Those who don't fulfill their own dreams ... they fulfill others dreams

dialogue: Mujhe jannat mein jagah nahi chahiye ... mein bas is ladki ko is jahannum se bachane aaya hoon

dialogue: Aurat ka dil aur samundar ki gherai ... maapna aasaan nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: The heart of a woman and the deepness of the ocean ... is hard to be measured

dialogue: Kisi insaan ka kadh janna ho, toh pata lagao ke uske dushman kaun hai ... jitna bada dushman, utna bada woh
englishDialogue: If you want to know the level of a person, then find out who are his enemies ... the bigger his enemies are, the bigger he is

dialogue: Insaan apne liye gaye faislo se hi bada hota hai
englishDialogue: A man gets bigger by the decisions he takes

dialogue: Jab achchai ke paude pe phal lagne lage na ... toh uske upar burai ki khaad nahi sejhni chahiye
englishDialogue: When the tree of goodness has started growing fruits ... then you should not throw the compost of badness on it

dialogue: Yeh dimag hai na is a very fascinating thing ... yeh kab, kahan, kaise humpar chaal chale ... koi bhi nahi bol sakta
englishDialogue: This mind is a very fascinating thing ... when, where, how it will play a trick on us ... no one can say that

dialogue: Jo khel tumne mere saath khela ... wahi khel main tumhare saath khelungi
englishDialogue: The game that you played with me ... that same game I'll play with you

dialogue: Shaadi ke baad duniya ki har ladki nazar aati hai ... biwi dikhai nahi deti hai
englishDialogue: After marriage you can see every girl of this world ... but you just can't see your wife

dialogue: Che mahine ke baad sab biwiyan bhoot ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: After 6 months all wives become ghosts

dialogue: Jeetna bhi ek aadat hoti hai ... joh dheere dheere aati hai
englishDialogue: Winning is also a habit ... that comes slowly

englishDialogue: In life a person gets two or four such opportunities ... where he can say that I have done something in life

dialogue: Sirf Hindustan chhoda hai ... Hindustaniyat nahi

dialogue: Tu marega nahi ... tu sadega!
englishDialogue: You won't die ... you will rot!

dialogue: Imaandari ke paise mein sirf mehnat lagti hai ... rishwat ke paise mein mehnat aur jokhim dono lagte hai

dialogue: Goti ... kalti maar!
englishDialogue: Goti ... run!

dialogue: Har baap ka ek baap hota hai ... aur usse hum dadaji kehte hai
englishDialogue: Every father has a father ... and we call him grandfather

dialogue: Abhe tere jaise ko toh main har shanivar ko ... paanch hari mirchion ke saath apne ghar ke bahar latkata hoon
englishDialogue: I hang a person like you every Saturday ... outside my house along with 5 green chili peppers

dialogue: Meri unglioon ki raftar ... tumhare pairoon ki raftar se zyada tezz hai
englishDialogue: The speed of my fingers ... is faster than the speed of your legs

dialogue: Kya udibaba udibaba ... chalti to hai nahi ... udibaba udibaba
englishDialogue: What udibaba udibaba ... this can't move ... and you're talking about flying

dialogue: Dharm wohi hai joh matti se janam leta hai ... dharm wohi hai joh tumhari buddhi se janam leta hai ... dharm wohi hai joh tumhare dil, tumhare mann ko sachcha lagta hai ... dharm wohi hai joh tumhari aatma ko sachcha lagta hai
englishDialogue: Religion is what is born out of your thought ... religion is what is born out of your mind ... religion is what your heart and mind believes is true ... religion is what your soul believes is true

dialogue: Ek ek saans sambhaal kar le rahi hoon ... ki kahin tumhare aane tak yeh saanse khatam na ho jaye
englishDialogue: I am taking every single breathe carefully ... so that I am not of breathe when you come

dialogue: Maine hamesha socha tha ki mera sapna aapke pyar se poora hoga ... aapke reham aur aapki daya se nahi
englishDialogue: I always thought that my dream will be fulfilled by your love ... not by your mercy and pity

dialogue: Meri zindagi ka ek ek pal is deewaar ki ek ek eent hai
englishDialogue: Every single moment of my life is a brick in this wall

dialogue: Jab pita ke budhe haath kaapne lage ... toh jawaan bete ka farz hota hai ki woh aakar unke haath batayein
englishDialogue: When the hands of an old father start to shake ... then it becomes the duty of the young son to give a helping hand

dialogue: Aap hukum kijiye ... main uski gardan kaat kar aapki godh mein rakh doonga
englishDialogue: You simply order ... I will behead him and bring his head in your lap

dialogue: Mere haath kaanp sakte hai ... lekin mera mann atal hai

dialogue: Jab tak koi awaaz nahi hogi ... tab tak tum zinda rahoge

dialogue: Mera dharm hai aapki maut
englishDialogue: Your death is my religion

dialogue: Zindagi ek bhel puri ki tarah hai ... jis mein kuch meethi cheezein hoti hai, meri tarah ... aur kuch teekhi cheezein hoti hai, tumhari tarah
englishDialogue: Life is like a savoury snack ... in which there are some sweet things, like me ... and some spicy things, like you

dialogue: Agar hamari kismat mein jeetna likha hoga toh hum jeetenge ... lekin hum haarne tak haar nahi manenge
englishDialogue: If we are destined to win then we will win ... but we won't accept defeat until we lose

dialogue: Mere marks 90% na ho ... lekin maine joh kuch bhi kiya hai sirf isliye kiya hai ... kyun ki tumse pyar maine hamesha 100% hi kiya hai
englishDialogue: My marks may not be 90% ... but whatever I have done, I have done only because ... I have always loved you 100%

dialogue: Kisi bhi badi uljhan se nikalne ka sach hi raasta hota hai
englishDialogue: Only truth is the way out from any big problem

dialogue: Ek beta gaya hai apna farz nibhane ... doosra yahan apna farz nibhayega

dialogue: Yeh Dubai hai ... yahan reham nahi, sirf paisa aur luck chalta hai
englishDialogue: This is Dubai ... here only money and luck works, not mercy

dialogue: Abhe tu driver hai ki screwdriver hai?
englishDialogue: Are you a driver or a screwdriver?

dialogue: Haath mein ghoda hone se goli nahi chalti ... jigra chahiye
englishDialogue: The bullet doesn't fire just by having the gun in your hand ... you need courage for that

dialogue: Jiski laathi uski bhains ... nikaal cash
englishDialogue: The buffalo belongs to the one who has the stick ... now give me the cash

dialogue: Aakha duniya ghum sakta hai boss ... lekin apun ka zabaan ghumega nahi
englishDialogue: The whole world can spin ... but my tongue won't spin

dialogue: Jab se tumko jaana hai, tab se tumko chaha hai ... jab se tumko chaha hai, tab se khudko jaana hai ... yahi kehne ke bahane, dhoondta dil deewana hai
englishDialogue: Since I've known you, I've loved you ... since I've loved you, I've known myself ... to say this, my crazy heart looks for you

dialogue: Tere hoothon ki muskurahat ki hifazat hum karenge ... tere aankhon se behte huye aasoon ki bagawat hum karenge
englishDialogue: I will protect the smile on your lips ... and I will revolt the tears that flow from your eyes

dialogue: Yeh lo khao ... aur apne bachcho ko bhi khilao ... taki woh hari bhari poty karen
englishDialogue: Here eat ... and feed your kids also ... so that they can do lot of poty

englishDialogue: That's a sexy name and I must say that's a sexy frame

dialogue: Mutra mukti karke aaon?
englishDialogue: Can I pee and come?

englishDialogue: When people start talking against you ... then you are making progress

dialogue: Mere ko yeh golf khelna nahi aata ... yeh ghode ki race bhi nahi khelta ... lekin apne dhande ka mazbood khiladi hoon main
englishDialogue: I don't know how to play golf ... neither do I play in the horse race ... but I am a strong player in my business

dialogue: Main baniya hoon sahab ... sab kuch bahut sambhaal ke kharch karta hoon
englishDialogue: Sir, I am a businessman ... I spend everything very cautiously

dialogue: Agar paisa ban sakta tha ... toh maine banaya hai
englishDialogue: If there was money to be made ... then I have made money

dialogue: Na sunta nahin hai mujhe
englishDialogue: I cannot hear no

englishDialogue: You gave me 5 mins right? ... in 4 minutes 30 seconds I finished everything ... 30 seconds profit, profit ... this is called business

dialogue: Meri himmat aam aadmi ki himmat hai ... is desh ki himmat hai

englishDialogue: What is there to be scared from public ... I am myself public

dialogue: It's not the age ... it's the mileage!

dialogue: Koi kisi ko dokha nahi deta ... sirf halaat hote hai

englishDialogue: You are now serviced

englishDialogue: If you participate in the miss world (contest) ... then you'll only win the 1st, 2nd and 3rd place title

dialogue: Kehte hain agar kisi cheez ko dil se chaho ... to puri kainaat usse tumse milane ki koshish mein lag jaati hai

dialogue: Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost
englishDialogue: Movie is still not over my friend

dialogue: Ek chutki sindoor ki keemat tum kya jaano Ramesh babu ... ishwar ka aashirwad hota hai ek chutki sindoor ... suhagan ke sarr ka taj hota hai ek chutki sindoor ... har aurat ka khwab hota hai ek chutki sindoor
englishDialogue: Mr. Ramesh, you don't know the value of one pinch of vermilion ...  one pinch of vermilion is the blessing of God ... one pinch of vermilion is the crown of a married woman ... one pinch of vermilion is the dream of every woman

dialogue: Hamari filmo ki tarah, hamari zindagi mein bhi end tak sab kuch thik hi ho jaata hai ... happy's ending
englishDialogue: Just like our films, in our lives also everything becomes fine till the end ... a happy ending

dialogue: You shot gun, me quick gun Murugun ... ati-pati-kati yenna rascala tu dai ... Mind It!
englishDialogue: You are shot gun, I am quick gun Murugun ... ati-pati-kati you rascal ... Mind It!

englishDialogue: When is Diwali ... when is Diwali!

englishDialogue: From today we'll hit you on your head everyday for the next one year ... and you'll become shorter inch by inch

dialogue: Joh ho gaya, woh kabhi nahi hua ... joh kabhi nahi hua, woh ab hoga
englishDialogue: Whatever happened, didn't ever happen ... and what has never happened, that will happen now

dialogue: Babban ke qahar se khud Babban bhi tumhe nahi bacha sakta
englishDialogue: Not even Babban himself can save you from the havoc of Babban

dialogue: Babban se darna jayaz ... ladna najayaz
englishDialogue: It's legitimate to be scared of Babban ... but its' illegitimate to fight with him

englishDialogue: Every policeman's wife in this city doesn't keep the Karva Chauth (auspicious) fast for the long life of her husband ... but infact she keep a fast in the name of Babban

dialogue: I'm ready to die in love, I'm ready to kill in love ... but I'm not ready to be a fool in love
englishDialogue: I'm ready to die in love, I'm ready to kill in love ... but I'm not ready to be a fool in love

dialogue: Aage ka raasta dhoondne ke liye kabhi kabhi ... chaar kadam peeche jaana padta hai

dialogue: You've not only given me a life ... but also become my reason to live
englishDialogue: You've not only given me a life ... but also become my reason to live

dialogue: 99% ladkiyo ko unka mann pasand ladka mil jaata hai ... lekin 99% ladko ko unki pasand ki ladkiya kabhi nahi milti
englishDialogue: 99% girls get the guy of their choice ... but 99% boys never get the girl of their choice

dialogue: Joh kuch bhi main kahoonga, sach main kahoonga ... ja rahi ho tum door, par main touch mein rahoonga
englishDialogue: Whatever I'll say, I'll say the truth ... you are going far away, but I will stay in touch

dialogue: Aye kisne ki hai ungli ... kaun hai hamare beech mein Ganguly?
englishDialogue: Who did this mischief ... who is Mr. Ganguly in between us?

dialogue: Meri girlfriend ke saath tu saiyaan banke, naiya ke upar, chaiyya chaiyya kare ... aur main UP ka bhaiya banke wahan kinare pe se haath hilaon
englishDialogue: You want to be my girlfriends partner and dance with her on a boat ... and you want me to behave like a man from Uttar Pradesh (UP) and wave at you from the shore

dialogue: There is only one thing I cannot stand ... is a one night stand
englishDialogue: There is only one thing I cannot stand ... is a one night stand

dialogue: Kuch paane ke liye kuch khona padta hai ... aur joh nahi bhi ho, woh bhi hona padta hai
englishDialogue: To get something you have to lose something ... and you have to become someone, that you are not

dialogue: Propose karne mein itna pause lega ... toh woh tujhe dispose karke chali jayegi
englishDialogue: If you take such a long pause to propose ... then she will dispose you and go away

dialogue: Tu Superman hai? ... Spiderman hai? ... abhe tu common man hai
englishDialogue: Are you Superman? ... are you Spiderman? ... you are a common man

dialogue: Aye Brian Lara ... chal ho ja nau do gyarah
englishDialogue: Hey you Brian Lara ... go away from here

dialogue: Style sikhaya ja sakta hai ... saadgi yah simplicity nahi
englishDialogue: You can teach style ... but not plainness and simplicity

dialogue: Agar Priya Mercedes hai toh tu Maruti ... agar Priya Boeing hai toh tu bhail-gadi ... agar Priya Kohinoor ka heera hai toh tu Kohinoor ka basmati chawal ... agar Priya kabil hai toh tu Kabuli chana
englishDialogue: If Priya is a Mercedes then you are Maruti ... if Priya is a Boeing then you are a bullock cart ... if Priya is a Kohinoor diamond then you are Kohinoor basmati rice ... if Priya is a capable then you are chick peas from Kabul

dialogue: Priya jab assi saal ki ho jayegi na ... I promise you main tab bhi usko itna hi pyar karoonga ... dhoop mein iska chashma banuga, baarish mein iska chaata ... kyun ki pyar ke sivah mujhko kuch nahi aata
englishDialogue: When Priya will become 80 years old ... I promise you even then I'll love her as much as I do today ... in the sun I'll become her sunglasses, in the rain I'll become her umbrella ... because other than love I don't know anything else

dialogue: Duniya mein do cheezein infinite hai ... yeh universe aur mard ka ego
englishDialogue: There are two things that are infinite in the world ... this universe and the ego of a man

dialogue: Idhar aa raqeeb mere tujhe main gale se laga loon ... mera ishq bemazaa tha teri dushmani se pehle
englishDialogue: Come here my rival so that I can give you a hug ... since my love was no fun before your enmity

dialogue: Muntazir hoon kab se, ki itni shafaa meri aahon mein aaye ... kuch dawa ho jayegi zindagi ki, maut agar teri baahon mein aaye
englishDialogue: I'm waiting since a long time for some recovery to come in my cries ... life will get a little bit of medicine, if death comes in your arms

dialogue: Hum jab bhi kuch hasil karte hai na ... uske saath saath usse khone ka darr bhi hasil karte hai
englishDialogue: Whenever we achieve something ... then with that we also achieve the fear of losing that

dialogue: Zindagi ki sabse badi tradegy hai ... kisi zinda insaan ke andar jazbaat ka mar jana
englishDialogue: The biggest tradegy of life is ... the dying of feelings in a living person

dialogue: Hum apni kamzori ko agar kamzori samajhna chhod de ... toh duniya bhi usse kamzori nahi samajhti
englishDialogue: If we stop considering our weakness as a weakness ... then even the world doesn't treat it as our weakness

dialogue: Mil jaye tumhe tumhari mohabbat, toh maan lo khuda tumpar meherban ho gaya ... aur agar na mile, toh jaan lo ke khuda tumse ek jaan ho gaya
englishDialogue: If you get your love, then understand that god is kind with you ... and if you don't get it, then understand that god is within you

dialogue: Yeh kambhakt mohabbat cheez hai hi aaisi ... joh kabhi patthar ko bhagwan ... toh kabhi farishtey jaise insaan ko patthar bana deti hai
englishDialogue: This cruel love is one such thing ... that sometimes turns a stone into god ... and sometimes it turns an angel like person into a stone

dialogue: Kisi se itni bhi mohabbat na karna ... ki ek din khud se nafrat ho jaye
englishDialogue: Don't love someone so much that ... one day you'll hate yourself

dialogue: Bina khaddon ke raste nahi hote ... aur bina dukh ke zindagi
englishDialogue: There are no roads without potholes ... and there is no life with sorrow

dialogue: Agar woh ladki tumhare liye hai, toh then nothing on earth can keep her from you ... aur agar woh ladki tumhare liye nahi hai, then nothing on earth can bring her to you
englishDialogue: If that girl is made for you, then nothing on earth can keep her from you ... and if that girl is not made for you, then nothing on earth can bring her to you

dialogue: Jinke saath mohabbat ka noor hota hai ... unhe koi andhera chuh nahi sakta
englishDialogue: Those who have the light of love with them ... no darkness can touch them

dialogue: Mudh ke dekho, paas bulao ... paas aaye toh haath pakad lo ... jatpataye toh baal jakad lo ... nazdeek chehra laake uska, kaan mein dil ki baat suna do
englishDialogue: Turn around, call her close to you ... hold her hand when she comes close to you ... hold her hair if she shivers ... bring her face close to yours and tell the words of love in her ear

dialogue: Ek toh yeh shehar naya, upar se yeh naukri nayi ... aur koi jana pehchana nahi, kisi ke ghar ghusne ka bahana nahi ... ek ajnabi pe bharosa kare, aaisa toh koi zamana nahi ... in short rehne ka thikana nahi
englishDialogue: This city is new to me, on top of that this job is new for me ... no one knows me and I don't have any reason to enter anyones house ... also it is not an era where we can trust a stranger ... in short I don't have a place to stay

dialogue: Mohabbat mein rupaiyo se zyada patthar keemti hote hai
englishDialogue: In love stones are more valuable than money

dialogue: Mere kuch sapne the, apne sapne the ... par tumse milne ke baad ... tumhare khwab mere khwab ban gaye ... tumhari zindagi meri zindagi ban gayi
englishDialogue: I had some dreams, my own dreams ... but after meeting you ... your dreams became my dreams ... your life became my life

dialogue: Hamara kal jaisa bhi ho, hum saath milkar usse khoobsurat banayenge ... lekin agar tum saath na aayi ... toh na aaj hai na aane waala kal
englishDialogue: However our tomorrow may be, together we'll make it beautiful ... but if you're not there ... then there is no today and neither there is tomorrow

dialogue: Har cheez karo limit ke andar ... lekin pyar limit ke bahut baahar
englishDialogue: Do everything within the limit ... but love totally out of limit

dialogue: Pyar har waqt saath rehta hai ... kyun ki pyar waqt se nahin, usse kiya jaata hai jiske saath waqt guzaarte hain
englishDialogue: Love is with you every time ... because you don't love time, you love the person with whom you spend the time

dialogue: Ek kahani khatam ... ek nayi zindagi shuru
englishDialogue: One story ends ... one new life starts

dialogue: Kal kisi ne nahi dekha hai ... aur kya pata kal aaye ya nahi aaye ... aur main apna har kal aaj mein badal doonga
englishDialogue: No one has seen tomorrow ... who knows whether tomorrow will come or not ... and that's why I'll turn my every tomorrow into today

dialogue: New York mein jabhi bhi koi sapna tootta hai na ... toh ek taxi driver paida hota hai
englishDialogue: In New York whenever a dream breaks ... then a taxi driver is born

dialogue: I can talk cars, I can walk cars ... infact main khud hi ek car hoon
englishDialogue: I can talk cars, I can walk cars ... infact I'm myself a car

dialogue: Dance a day keeps the doctor away

englishDialogue: This is shining India ... here rich people are ready to pay a high price for higher education

englishDialogue: If I die, I'll die only from a bullet ... not from blood pressure or diabetes

englishDialogue: There are two kinds of people in this world ... one who themselves say who they are ... and others are, about whom the world says who they are

englishDialogue: Men die of a heart attack ... because they have a heart

englishDialogue: Once I start hitting someone ... I kill him

englishDialogue: I will hit you so much that ... you will start repenting on your birth

englishDialogue: Hey you keep quiet ... or else I will curse you so bad that even the censor board will go crazy ... as to which ones to keep and which ones to eliminate

englishDialogue: Do a favor for me that ... don't do any favor for me

englishDialogue: I am a bodyguard ... other than my duty I can't see anything, nor can't I hear anything

englishDialogue: When it comes to loyalty ... there also he doesn't leave royalty

englishDialogue: You're not following the call of duty and you're following doll of beauty

englishDialogue: Let's forgive and not fight ... go and clean dog's poop

dialogue: Chahe suraj thanda ho jaye ... chahe murgi anda ho jaye ... chahe sarkari karamchari rishwat khake mooh khol de ... chahe bhagwan khud is office mein aake kyun na bol de ... hum Mussaddilal ko zinda nahi manenge
englishDialogue: Even if the sun becomes cold ... even if the chicken becomes the egg ... even if a government officer takes bribe and opens his mouth ... even if god himself comes to this office and says ... we won't consider Mussaddilal alive

englishDialogue: India is incomplete without Tendulkar, Veeru completes Jai ... Rocko calls and Hunter has to come, on this dialogue even Rajinikanth claps

englishDialogue: No book in this world can teach you how to make a woman happy ... for that you don't need a degree, you need pedigree

englishDialogue: I will give you one tight slap ... and even your plastic surgeon will need surgery

englishDialogue: In front of Don a man has only two choices ... either he agrees or he dies ... whatever he chooses

englishDialogue: Don's enemy should always remember this point ... that Don never forgets anything

englishDialogue: My enemies were thinking that I'll never come back ... there is an ocean of anonymity and I'll go drown in that ... now my story is still pending, which I have to tell to the world ... try to recognize who am I ... I'm turning around and coming, I'm Don, Don, Don

dialogue: Tere paas bungla hai, gaadi hai, bank balance hai, sab kuch hai ... lekin mere paas maal hai
englishDialogue: You have a bungalow, you have a car, you have bank balance, you have everything ... but I have the goods

englishDialogue: Oh my dry fruit, oh my cashew, oh my almond ... give me a hug, give me a kiss

englishDialogue: (You've studied till where?) ... Until 10 o'clock ... 9 o'clock the school started ... when one hour was over then the principal understood that I could hardly study nothing

englishDialogue: Everyday at 9 o'clock Bachchan Sir came and shouted on TV ... that Who Wants To Be A Millionaire, Who Wants To Be A Millionaire ... then I understood, that to become a Millionaire ... you have to be a "Conman" first

englishDialogue: You have created a movie story in real life

englishDialogue: Far from this earth and sky ... where there is no time and no one else other than you and me ... there is just one feeling, one passion ... that you are within me and I am within you

englishDialogue: Everybody is somebody in Delhi ... nobody is a nobody

englishDialogue: If you laugh you will win, if you cry you will make me sad ... whether you stay close to me or not, you will always find me on your side

dialogue: Ek kal hamare peeche hai, ek kal hamare baad ... aaj, aaj ki baat karo, aaj hamare saath
englishDialogue: One day is behind us, one day is after us ... today, talk about today, today is with us

dialogue: Tum har saal Raavan ko isliye jalate ho, kyun ki tum jaante ho ... woh kabhi nahin marta
englishDialogue: You burn Raavan every year, because you know that ... he never dies

dialogue: Banta nahi hero muscle yah metal parts se ... banta hai aur mitta hai superhero sirf apne heart se
englishDialogue: A hero is not made from muscles or metal parts ... a superhero is made and perished only by his heart

dialogue: Burai sang joh mel rachaya ... phir kabhi na chutte uska saaya
englishDialogue: If you befriend evil ... then its shadow will never leave you

dialogue: Joh ek baar marta hai ... usse baar baar maarna nahi padta
englishDialogue: Those who die in a single attempt ... you don't have to kill them multiple times

dialogue: Ladai goliyo se nahin ... dil se jeeti jaati hai
englishDialogue: A war is not won by bullets ... it is won by the heart

dialogue: Kaun kehta hai bada size sab par bhaari hai ... kabhi machar ke saath ek raat guzari hai
englishDialogue: Who says that you need something big to cause trouble ... have you ever spent a night with a mosquito

dialogue: Woh raat bhi khoobsurat thi aur woh ladki bhi ... raat ko subah ka intezaar tha aur ladki ko mera
englishDialogue: That night was beautiful and so was that girl ... the night was waiting for the morning and the girl was waiting for me

dialogue: Achche log marr jaate hai ... unki achchai hamesha zinda rehti hai
englishDialogue: Good people die ... but their goodness always remains alive

dialogue: Burra waqt bin bulaye hi aata hai
englishDialogue: Bad times do come without an invitation

dialogue: Phone pe mat karo aankhen char ... concentration se chalao apni car
englishDialogue: Don't look at the phone ... concentrate and drive your car

dialogue: Main aaisa game banaonga ... jis mein villain kabhi nahin harega
englishDialogue: I will make such a game ... in which a villain never loses

dialogue: Bina izzat ki bhaigiri ... matlab bina Meena Kumari ke Pakeezah
englishDialogue: Bullying without respect ... is like the movie Pakeezah without Meena Kumari

dialogue: Takleef humko ka takleef degi ... hum toh khud takleefon ko takleef de dete hai
englishDialogue: What pain can misery give me ... I myself give pain to the misery

dialogue: Daal ke bataya nahi jaata ... aur bata ke daala nahi jaata
englishDialogue: Don't show it when you put it ... and don't put it when you show it

dialogue: Na jaane badalon ke darmiyan kaisi saazish hui ... mera ghar mitti ka tha, mere hi ghar baarish hui
englishDialogue: I don't know what conspiracy happened within the clouds ... my house was made of mud and the rain fell only on my house

dialogue: Galati se galati ho gayi
englishDialogue: By mistake this mistake happened

dialogue: Jab hum thak ke so rahe the ... yeh so so ke thak rahe the
englishDialogue: When we were tired and sleeping ... he was getting tired of sleeping

dialogue: Mukar jaane ka qatil ne achcha bahana dhoond nikala hai ... har ek se poochta hai ... isko kisne maar daala hai?
englishDialogue: The killer has found a nice way to pull back ... he is asking everyone ... who has killed her?

dialogue: Daal mein kaala ho ya garam masala ... kahan chup gaya hai saala?
englishDialogue: I don't care whether the lentil soup has black pepper or a mixture of spices in it ... I want to know where the hell is he hiding?

dialogue: Mera dushman toh paida hote hi phas jaate hai
englishDialogue: My enemies are in problem right from the moment they are born

dialogue: Hoshiyaari toh hoshiyaar logon se ki jaati hai
englishDialogue: Smartness is only shown with smart people

dialogue: Dhamki dene waalo ki main saans bandh karta hoon ... tera naseeb achcha hai, sirf mooh bandh kar raha hoon
englishDialogue: I kill people who threaten me ... you are lucky that, I am only closing your mouth

dialogue: Tijori saaf, kaha suna maaf
englishDialogue: Please pardon me, I've cleaned the vault

dialogue: Kutton ka koi Sunday nahi hota ... kutte saaton din kutte hi hote hai
englishDialogue: Dogs don't have a Sunday ... dogs are dogs for all 7 days

dialogue: In ladkiyon ko na koi khush nahi rakh sakta ... a happy woman is a myth!
englishDialogue: No one can keep a girl happy ... a happy woman is a myth!

dialogue: Any discussion with a woman is an argument!
englishDialogue: Any discussion with a woman is an argument!

dialogue: Shaadi ke pehle woh nagin been kyun bajhta hai ... kyun ki na band waala bhi tumhe chetavani de raha hota hai kaun aa raha hai tumhari zindagi mein ... inka signature tune hai woh
englishDialogue: Why do they play the snake's tune before you get married ... because even the person playing the band is warning you, as to who is coming in your life ... it's their signature tune

dialogue: Ladke ne ladki ko do din hug nahi kiya toh problem ... hug kiya toh cheap ho rahe ho, itna bhi achcha nahi lagta
englishDialogue: If a guy didn't hug the girl for two days then that's a problem ... and if he hugged then she says that you're being cheap, it doesn't look good

dialogue: Behind every successful man there is a woman ... true ... but koi yeh nahi batata ki behind every unsuccessful man also there is a woman
englishDialogue: Behind every successful man there is a woman ... true ... but no one tells you that behind every unsuccessful man also there is a woman

dialogue: Ab pata chala yeh aadmiyon ko itne heart attack kyun aate hai aur yeh gay bandhe itne successful kyun hote hai ... because they don't have a woman to screw their happiness na
englishDialogue: Now I came to know why so many men get heart attacks and why these gay people are so successful ... because they don't have a woman to screw their happiness

dialogue: Problem yeh hai ki main chahta hoon meri life mein koi problem hi na ho ... lekin agar meri life mein koi problem na ho na ... toh yeh uski life ki sabse badi problem hai
englishDialogue: The problem is that I want there to be no problems in my life ... but if there are no problems in my life ... then that's the biggest problem of her life

dialogue: Relationship ka matlab hi hota hai an end to your own happiness
englishDialogue: The meaning of relationship is to end your own happiness

dialogue: Do hafte dimaag chatengi table lena hai, table lena hai ... paanch ghante mall mein bitaake ek sadi si chappal uthake le aayengi ... aur phir agle do hafte dimaag chatengi table lena hai, table lena hai
englishDialogue: For two weeks they will fry your brain that we need to buy a table, we need to buy a table ... and after spending five hours in the mall they will bring back an ugly pair of slippers ... and again for the next two weeks they will fry your brain that we need to buy a table, we need to buy a table

dialogue: Saali shopping khatam nahi hoti inki ... pehle cushions aaye, phir curtains aaye ... phir cushions curtains se match nahi kiye toh aur cushions aaye ... saale mug itne hai mere yahan ki unhe bechne jaon toh mahine ka kharcha nikal aaye
englishDialogue: Bloody their shopping never ends ... first the cushions came, then the curtains came ... then the cushions did not match the curtains so more cushions came ... bloody I have so many mugs at my place that if I go to sell them then it will cover a full month's expenses

dialogue: Jab aap log zindagi ki mauj mein the ... tab hum fauj mein the
englishDialogue: When you guys were having fun in life ... at that time I was in the military

dialogue: Jab aadmi ka waqt bura aata hai ... toh chahe woh unth pe hi kyun na behta ho ... phir bhi kutta usse kaat leta hai
englishDialogue: When a man goes through a bad time ... then even if he is sitting on a camel ... then to a dog bites him

dialogue: Jhooti aastha nahi, raasta sachcha doonga ... tum mera haath pakad lo, main tumhe bachcha doonga
englishDialogue: I will show you the true path, and not the false opinion ... you hold my hand, and I will give you a child

dialogue: Gujarati ke haath se dandiya ... Tarzan ke badan se jhangiya ... aur Chetan Bhagat ke haath se rupaiya ... koi nahi cheen sakta
englishDialogue: No one can steal ... dancing from the Gujaratis ... the underwear from a Tarzan's body ... and money from Chetan's and Bhagat's hand

dialogue: Jis aandhi toofan mein logon ke aashiyane udh jaate hai ... us mein hum chaddi aur banyan sukhate hai
englishDialogue: The storms in which people lose their beautiful homes ... in those we dry our undergarments

dialogue: Mohabbat ho ya motorcycle ... dono mein break bahut zaroori cheez hoti hai
englishDialogue: Be it love or a motorcycle ... it is very important to have a break in them

dialogue: Without cash tu kaise karega aaish?
englishDialogue: How will you enjoy with cash?

dialogue: Zara soocho, aap logon ke paas power hai, naukar hai, locker hai, rehne ke liye tower hai, nahane ke liye shower hai ... inke paas kya hai?
englishDialogue: Just think, you guys have power, servant, locker, tower to live in, shower to bathe in ... what do they have?

dialogue: Khamosh kyun hai zameen aasman ... kya curfew lag gaya hai meri jaan?
englishDialogue: Why is the ground and sky silent ... is there a curfew going on?

dialogue: Ghadi ho toh Rado, gaadi ho toh Prado ... serial ho toh "Na aana is desh mein Lado"
englishDialogue: A watch should be like Rado, a car should be like Prado ... and a serial should be like "Lado don't come to this country"

dialogue: Bank ke loan ki tarah saans andhar lo ... aur installment ki tarah dhere dhere bahar chodo
englishDialogue: Breathe in just like you take a bank loan in ... and breathe out slowly just like you pay the installment out

dialogue: Hai rabba, main hoon iska abba ... main engine aur yeh mera dabba
englishDialogue: Oh my, I am his dad ... I am the engine and he is the carriage

dialogue: Dost do kisam ke hote hai ... ek woh jinhe raat ke do bajhe bhi phone kiya ja sakta hai ... and you know ki they will be there for you ... aur doosre woh jinhe raat ke do bajhe hi phone kiya jaata hai
englishDialogue: There are two types of friends ... one whom we can call at 2am in the night ... and you know that they will be there for you ... and second whom we call only at 2am in the night

dialogue: Pehle lagta tha ki zindagi ek intezar hai ... a long boring wait ... lekin ab lagta hai jaise ki zindagi ek film ki tarah hai ... boring hai toh kya hua, forward toh kar sakte hai na
englishDialogue: First it used to feel that life is a wait ... a long boring wait ... but now it feels as if life is like a film ... so what if it's boring, you can atleast forward it

dialogue: Sach aur sachai mein farak hota hai ... aur sach yeh hai ki har police waale ka dharam hai ki woh niswarth bhav se desh ki seva kare ... lekin sachai yeh hai ki 8,500 ki is tankha mein desh sambhalo, ghar sambhalo, imaan sambhalo
englishDialogue: There is difference between truth and reality ... the truth is that it's the religion of every policeman to serve his country unselfishly ... but the reality is that he has to manage his country, manage his house, manage his honesty within a salary of Rs. 8,500

dialogue: Kuch bacha nahi toh kuch kho nahi sakte ... jab kuch kho hi nahi sakte toh dar kis baat ka
englishDialogue: If we don't have anything left then we can't lose anything ... and if we can't lose anything then what are we scared of

dialogue: Jab gehun ki zaroorat hoti hai toh ye zameen kisaano ki hoti ... aur jab factory ki zaroorat hoti hai toh ye zameen public purpose ke liye ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When you need wheat then the land belongs to the farmers ... and when you need a factory then the land is used for public purpose

dialogue: Jab kuch bolne ka fayda na ho toh ... chup hi rehna chahiye
englishDialogue: When there is no benefit in saying something ... then you should stay quiet

dialogue: Aadmi hai na woh marne ke baad bhoot banta hai ... lekin aurat joh hai, woh chudeil ki chudeil hi rehti hai
englishDialogue: A man becomes a ghost after he dies ... but a woman, remains a bitch before and after death

dialogue: Theoretically toh mujhe darna chahiye ... par practically mujhe dar lag nahi ra
englishDialogue: Theoretically I should be scared ... but practically I am not scared

dialogue: Aaisa kyun hota hai ki hum jisse sabse zyada pyar karte hai ... dukh bhi hum sabse zyada us hi ko dete hai
englishDialogue: Why is that the person we love the most ... we give them the most pain

dialogue: Music joh hai na woh haatho se nahi ... dil se bajhta hai
englishDialogue: Music is not played by the hand ... it is played by the heart

dialogue: Shaadi ho gayi hai phir bhi boondiyan loot raha hai saala
englishDialogue: Bloody he is married but is still stealing sweets

dialogue: Mard chahe jitne bhi chakkar chala le chalta hai ... lekin jab biwi ka chakkar chalta hai na ... toh hamare joh mard hai woh chakkar khake gir jaate hai
englishDialogue: No matter how many affairs a man has, it is fine ... but when the wife has an affair ... then the men swirl and fall down

dialogue: Mardo ka toh nature yeh hai ... ki unhe bachche joh hai, woh apne achche lagte hai ... aur biwiyan dosro ki achchi lagti hai
englishDialogue: The nature of men is that ... they like their own kids ... and they like others wives

dialogue: Dil achcha ho ya na ho ... lekin shakal, surat aur kapde achche hone chahiye
englishDialogue: Whether your heart is good or not ... but your face, looks and clothes must be good

dialogue: Arre jab Dharmendra aur Sunny Deol lad rahe hai ... toh Bobby Deol kya karega
englishDialogue: When Dharmendra and Sunny Deol are fighting ... then what will Bobby Deol do

dialogue: Yeh Punjab hai Punjab ... yahan pehle goli marte hai ... phir shayad laash se kuch baat karlein
englishDialogue: This is Punjab, Punjab ... here first they shoot ... then may be they will talk with the dead body

dialogue: Oye illaka kutton ka hota hai, bhen ke takke ... sher ka nahi
englishDialogue: Hey, neighborhood is for dogs you sister sucker ... not for a tiger

dialogue: Rab di sau ... agar mujhe gussa aagaya na ... toh main aaisi dhulai karoonga, aaisi dhulai karoonga ... ki na koi dawa kaam aayegi aur na hi dua
englishDialogue: Swear on God ... if you make me angry ... then I will beat you so much, beat you so much ... that neither medicine will work nor prayers

dialogue: Liver kidney thoda bahut kharab ho sakta hai ... lekin yeh dil kamaal ka hai
englishDialogue: My liver and kidney may be a little defective ... but my heart is wonderful

dialogue: Is duniya mein aaye ho toh kuch aisa kar jao kadardan ... gali, kooche se aawaaz aaye, abba jaan abba jaan abba jaan
englishDialogue: Since you have come in this world then do something that ... sounds calling you Dad come from every street and corner

dialogue: Discount middle class logon ke liye hota hai
englishDialogue: Discount is for middle class people

dialogue: Abhe chalayega ya ukharega
englishDialogue: Will you start it or will you uproot it

dialogue: Jatt risky after balti whiskey
englishDialogue: A punjabi is risky after a bucket of whiskey

dialogue: Sache dil se baat karne se ... zindagi bhar ki galatiyan maaf ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When you talk with a honest heart ... then all the mistakes of life will be forgiven

dialogue: Hamari ragon mein hamari maa ka doodh aur shudh Gangajal beh raha hai
englishDialogue: My mom's milk and the pure water from the river Ganga is flowing in my veins

dialogue: Maine iske saath saat phere liye the ... magar yeh saat kadam bhi hamare saath nahi chal payi
englishDialogue: I have taken 7 seven roads around the marriage homa (fire ritual) with her ... but she could not walk 7 steps with me

dialogue: If you take bath in ghar ka bathroom ... ghar ki izzat ghar ke andhar ... if you take bath in nadi khulam-khula ... ghar ki izzat on road
englishDialogue: If you take a bath in the bathroom of the house ... then the honour of the house stays within the house ... but if you take a bath in the river openly ... then the honour of the house comes on the road

dialogue: Jab do dost dushman bante hai ... toh aur bhi zyada khatarnak hote hai ... kyun ki woh ek doosre ki kamzori jante hai
englishDialogue: When two friends become enemies ... then they become more dangerous ... because they know about each others weaknesses

dialogue: Yeh illaka tera ho, tere baap ka ho, ya tere baap ke baap ka ho ... yeh desh hamara hai
englishDialogue: Whether this area is yours, your fathers, or your grandfathers ... this country is mine

dialogue: Aaj shyam ka suraj doobne se pehle agar mujhe paise nahi mile ... toh duniya ki bheed mein kal tum bhi kisi ko nahi miloge
englishDialogue: If I don't get the money before today's sunset ... then tomorrow you will not be found in the crowd of this world

dialogue: Jhoot do kisam ke hote hai ... ek bhalai ke liye aur ek burai ke liye
englishDialogue: Lies are of two types ... one that is said for the better and one that is said for the worse

dialogue: Aadmi ko hamesha ladna chahiye ... lekin jiska time achcha ho usse ladna nahi chahiye
englishDialogue: A man should always fight ... but not with a person who has a good time going on

dialogue: Is vardi ki shaan pe jaan dena seekho ... imaan bechna nahi
englishDialogue: Learn how to give your life for this police uniform ... not how to sell your honesty

dialogue: Taqat is vardi mein nahi ... iske pehenne waale ke zameer mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: Strength doesn't lie in the police uniform ... it lies inside the conscience of the person wearing it

dialogue: Aaj ke baad tune meri biwi ki taraf kadam bhi uthaya ... toh yaad rakhna yeh paon tere zameen pe rakhne ke kabil nahi rahenge
englishDialogue: If after today even if you step towards my wife ... then remember your feet will not be capable of stepping on the ground

dialogue: Joh tumhari tarah shaadi ke chakkar mein phaste hai ... woh phir hamari tarah nahi haste hai
englishDialogue: People who get stuck in the circle of marriage ... they don't laugh like me

dialogue: Naye naye chaku ki dhaar bahut tezz aur vaar bahut gehra hota hai
englishDialogue: A new knife's edge is very sharp and the wounds from it are very deep

dialogue: Yeh meri tarah bewakoof todhi hai joh shaadi ke chakkar mein phas jaye ... yeh toh sirf chakkar chalana janta hai
englishDialogue: He is not foolish like me that he will get lost in the circle of marriage ... he only knows how to have fun

dialogue: Jab jab dard ka baadal chaya, jab gham ka saaya lehraya, jab aasoon palkon tak aya, jab yeh tanha dil ghabraya ... humne dil ko yeh samjhaya, dil aakhir tu kyun rota hai ... duniya mein yunhi hota hai ... yeh joh gehre sannate hai, waqt ne sabko hi baante hai ... thoda gham hai sabka qissa, thodi dhoop hai sabka hissa ... aankh teri bekaar hi namm hai, har pal ek naya mausam hai ... kyun tu aise pal khota hai, dil aakhir tu kyun rota hai
englishDialogue: Whenever the cloud of pain loomed, whenever the shadow of sadness waved, whenever tears reached my eyelids, whenever this lonely heart was worried ... I asked, why do you cry my heart ... this is what happens in the world ... this deep silence, time has given it to everyone ... everyone has a little bit of sorrow, everyone has a little bit of sunshine ... your eyes are wet for no reason, in every moment there is a new season ... why do you lose moments like that, why do you cry my heart

dialogue: Dilon mein tum apni betaabiyan leke chal rahe ho toh zinda ho tum, nazar mein khwabon ki bijliyan leke chal rahe ho toh zinda ho tum ... hawa ke jhokon ke jaise aazad rehno seekho, tum ek dariya ke jaise lehron mein behna seekho ... har ek lamhe se tum milo khole apni baahen, har ek pal ek naya samha dekhe yeh nigaahen ... joh apni aankhon mein hairaaniyan leke chal rahe ho toh zinda ho tum, dilon mein tum apni betaabiyan leke chal rahe ho toh zinda ho tum
englishDialogue: If you carry eagerness in your heart then you are living, if you carry dreams in your eyes then you are living ... learn to live freely like the wind, learn to flow freely like the river ... embrace every moment with open arms, see a new horizon every moment with your eyes ... if you carry surprises in your eyes then you are living, if you carry eagerness in your heart then you are living

dialogue: Dost mujhe Majnu bulate hai
englishDialogue: Friends call me Majnu (lover)

dialogue: Kya tum mantally challenged ho my bwoy?
englishDialogue: Are you mentally challenged my boy?

dialogue: Insaan ka kartavya hota hai koshish karna ... kaamyabi nakaamyabi sab uske haath mein hai
englishDialogue: It is the duty of a human to try ... success or failure is in the hands of God

dialogue: Pighle neelam sa behta hua yeh samaan, neeli neeli si khamoshiyan, na kahin hai zameen na kahin aasmaan ... sarsaraati huyi tehniyan pattiyan, keh rahi hai ki bas ek tum ho yahan ... sirf main hoon meri saansein hai aur meri dhadkane, aisi gehraiyan, aisi tanhaiyan, aur main sirf main ... apne hone pe mujhko yakeen aa gaya
englishDialogue: This moment flows like a molten sapphire with deep blue silence, neither there is the earth nor the sky ... the rustling branches and leaves, are saying that only you are here ... only me, my breathe and my heartbeat, the deepness, the loneliness, and me and only me ... all makes me believe in my existence

dialogue: Insaan ko dibbe mein sirf tab hona chahiye ... jab woh mar chuka ho
englishDialogue: A person should only be in a box ... after death

dialogue: Sieze the day my friend ... pehle is din ko poori tarah jiyo, phir chalis ke bare mein soochna
englishDialogue: Sieze the day my friend ... first live today to the fullest, then think about when you become 40 years old

dialogue: Kabhi pay check milte waqt ... tumhare aankhon mein aasun aye hai?
englishDialogue: While getting a pay check ... do you get tears in your eyes?

dialogue: Ik baat honthon tak hai joh aayi nahi, bas aankhon se hai jhaankti ... tumse kabhi, mujhse kabhi kuch lafz hai woh maangti ... jinko pehan ke honthon tak aa jaye woh, awaaz ki baahon mein baahein daalke ithlaye woh ... lekin joh yeh ek baat hai, ehsaas hi ehsaas hai ... khushboo si hai jaise hawa mein tairti, khushboo joh be-aawaaz hai ... jiska pata tumko bhi hai, jiski khabar mujhko bhi hai ... duniya se bhi chupta nahi, yeh jaane kaisa raaz hai
englishDialogue: There is a thing that still hasn't come on my lips, it only peeks through my eyes ... it is asking for words, sometimes from you and sometimes from me ... so that it can wear those words and come on the lips, so that it can be embraced by words ... but this thing, is only a feeling ... it's like fragrance floating in the air, fragrance without a voice ... that you know of, and so do I ... it's not hidden from the world, what kind of a secret is this

dialogue: Yeh the mantally sick ho chuka hai
englishDialogue: He has become mentally sick

dialogue: Doobara agar aaisi harkat ki toh tumhara woh haal karoonga ... ki kursi par baithna toh door bistar par letne ke bhi kaabil nahi rahoge
englishDialogue: If you do this thing again then I'll make your condition such that ... forget sitting on a chair you won't even be able to lie down on a bed

dialogue: Sau badmaasho ko chaano toh ek kameena nikalta hai ... sau kameeno ko chaano toh ek harami nikalta hai ... aur yeh suvar sau haramiyo ko chaankar nikla hai
englishDialogue: When you filter 100 bad guys then you get one rascal ... when you filter 100 rascals then you get one bastard ... and this pig has come out after filtering 100 bastards

dialogue: Zinda rakhna chahe woh toh koi fanaa kar nahi sakta ... aur in gunehgaron ko aaj tabahi se koi bacha nahi sakta
englishDialogue: If god wants to keep one alive then no one can destroy him ... and no one can save these criminals today from destruction

dialogue: Tumne toh kamaal kar diya ... dhoti ko phaadkar rumaal kar diya
englishDialogue: You have done such a great job ... you ripped a loincloth and made it into a handkerchief

dialogue: Agar nahin kaata na, toh aaisi jagah katunga ... tu confuse ho jayega ki pant pehnu yah ghagra
englishDialogue: If you don't cut, then I will cut in such a place ... that you will be confused whether to wear a pant or a skirt

dialogue: Aurat joh hai na, rainbow ki tarah hoti hai ... jitne rang utne roop
englishDialogue: Women are like a rainbow ... she has many colors and that many guises

dialogue: Har aadmi ke liye ek aurat bani hai, usse bach gaye ... toh life ban jayegi ... varna gaye
englishDialogue: For every man there is a women made, if you survive from her ... then life will be set ... else you are gone

dialogue: Mujhe to chadhi zehar ki tarah ... ki ab pani bhi peeta hoon na to aag lag jati hai
englishDialogue: I was high as if with poison ... that a fire starts even if I drink water

dialogue: Main Silk hoon, Silk ... koi film nahin joh interval ke baad badal jaoongi
englishDialogue: I am Silk, Silk ... not a film that will change after the interval

dialogue: Tumhari baaton mein itna horsepower hai na ... ki aadmi ke dimag kharab ho jaate hai aur godhon ka chalna shuru
englishDialogue: Your talks have so much horsepower that ... peoples mind go bad and horses start walking

dialogue: Raat ko barah ki sui ke tarah chipke rehte ho ... aur din me che ki tarah
englishDialogue: In the night you stick to me like a 12 o'clock hand ... and during the day like a 6 o'clock hand

dialogue: Bachche bhi tumse zyada kapde pehente hai
englishDialogue: Even kids wear more clothes than you

dialogue: Holi khelne ka shaunk hai ... par teri pichkari mein dum nahin
englishDialogue: You like to play Holi ... but your water gun is useless

dialogue: Har film ka ek hi hero hota hai ... director
englishDialogue: Every film has just one hero ... the director

dialogue: Jab sharafat ke kapde utarte hai ... tab sabse zyada mazaa sharifon ko hi aata hai
englishDialogue: When the clothes of honesty fall ... then the honest people enjoy the most

dialogue: Jab zindagi ek bar mili hai toh ... do bar kyun soche
englishDialogue: When life is given only once ... then why think twice

dialogue: Insaan ka jab waqt achcha hota hai tab logon ko uske phatte kapde bhi stylish lagte hai ... jab taste badalta hai tab wohi log uske kapde phadne lagte hai
englishDialogue: When a person is going through a good time then people think his ripped clothes are stylish ... and when the taste changes then the same people start to tear his clothes

dialogue: Touch toh bahuton ne kiya hai ... par chuha kisi ne nahin
englishDialogue: A lot of people have touched me ... but none have felt me

dialogue: Filmein sirf teen cheezo ke wajah se chalti hai ... entertainment, entertainment, entertainment ... aur main entertainment hoon
englishDialogue: Films do well only because of 3 reasons ... entertainment, entertainment, entertainment ... and I am entertainment

dialogue: Dikhana wahi chahiye ... joh log dekhana chahte hai
englishDialogue: You should show ... only what people want to see

dialogue: Public samaan dekhti hai ... dukaan nahin
englishDialogue: People look at the goods ... not the shop

dialogue: Girlfriend pehle pehle malai jaisi lagti hai ... phir dheere dheere cholesterol jaisa feel deti hai ... and finally seedhe heart attack
englishDialogue: Initially the girlfriend looks like cream ... then slowly slowly gives the feel like cholesterol ... and finally direct heart attack

dialogue: Jawani taste karne ke liye hoti hai ... waste karne ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: Youth is to taste ... not to waste

dialogue: Mujhe joh chahiye ... uska maaza sirf raat ko hi aata hai
englishDialogue: What I want ... the fun for that, only comes in the night

dialogue: Taarif mein gaali de rahe ho yah gaali mein taarif kar rahe ho
englishDialogue: Are you cursing me in a praise or are you praising me in a curse

dialogue: Yeh sab idli, rasam aur rum ka kamaal hai
englishDialogue: All this is the wonder of idli, rasam and rum

dialogue: Aaise mat dekho ... lagta hai marinated murghi ko tandoor dekh raha hai
englishDialogue: Don't look at me like this ... it feels like the oven is staring at the marinated chicken

dialogue: Kuch logo ka naam unke kaam se hota hai ... mera badnaam hoker hua hai
englishDialogue: Some people make their name from their work ... I have spoilt mine with my work

dialogue: Dil bhale hi left mein hota hai ... lekin uske faisley hamesha right hote hai
englishDialogue: Even though the heart is on the left ... but its decisions are always right

dialogue: History uthake dekh lo, do cheezein hamesha common rahi hai ... mardon ka zamana raha hai ... auraton ne aake aafat ki hai
englishDialogue: Read the history and you'll see that two things have always remained common ... it was the era of men ... and women came over and created trouble

dialogue: Heroine ki zindagi is like an elected government ... paanch saal tak party ... uske baad support
englishDialogue: The life of a heroine is like an elected government ... party for 5 years ... after that support

dialogue: Woh item number ka guitar thi, main sufi gaane ka ek tara ... boss woh star thi aur mera toh tara hi doob gaya tha
englishDialogue: She was a guitar of a hot song, and I was a note of a poetic song ... boss she was a star and my star had drowned

dialogue: Tum ek bahut badi daayan ho joh apne aap ko Draupadi se kam nahi samajhti hai
englishDialogue: You are a big witch who thinks she is not any less than Draupadi

dialogue: Kanoon shaadi ko todh sakta hai ... pyar ko nahi
englishDialogue: The law can break a marriage ... but not love

dialogue: Chandni Chowk mein chandni raat mein chachi ne chacha ko chandi ke chamach se chutney chatayi
englishDialogue: Aunty fed uncle chutney in a silver spoon in Chandni Chowk on a night with the moon

dialogue: Zindagi sirf pyar par nahi palti ... zindagi chalane ke liye paisa chahiye, aaram chahiye, rutba chahiye
englishDialogue: Life doesn't live only on love ... for life to move you need money, relaxation, status

dialogue: Yeh toh trailer hai ... sari ki sari shooting karti toh puri video library bhar jaati
englishDialogue: This is just a trailer ... if I would have shot the entire film then the whole video library would have got filled

dialogue: Main bardasht karna bhi jaanta hoon aur saans lena bhi jaanta hoon
englishDialogue: I know how to tolerate and also how to breathe

dialogue: Zindagi ka doosra naam problem hai
englishDialogue: Life's second name is problem

dialogue: Hum hi hum hai toh kya hum hai ... tum hi tum ho toh kya tum ho
englishDialogue: If it's only me, then what am I ... if it's only you, then what are you

dialogue: Isse pehle ki main tujhe gaddar karaar dekar goli maar doon ... bhag ja yahan se
englishDialogue: Before I pronounce you a traitor and shoot you ... run away from here

dialogue: Hum toh kisi doosre ki dharti par nazar bhi nahi dalte ... lekin itne nalayak bachche bhi nahi hai ... ki koi hamari dharti maa par nazar daale aur hum chup chap dekhte rahe
englishDialogue: We don't even eye on someone elses land ... but we are not so unworthy kids ... that we will sit quiet if someone eyes on our land

dialogue: Khilono se khelte khelte ... bachche jawaan ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: Playing with toys ... turns kids into youth

dialogue: Main tumhara saaya hoon ... tum mujhse peecha nahi chhuda sakte
englishDialogue: I am your shadow ... you cannot run away from me

dialogue: Zindagi aur maut Waheguru ke haath mein hai ... aur mera Waheguru dushman ke saath nahin ... mere saath hai
englishDialogue: Life or death is in the hands of God ... and my God is not with my enemies ... he is with me

dialogue: Pehli goli woh chalayega ... aur aakhri goli hum
englishDialogue: They will fire the first bullet ... and we will fire the last bullet

dialogue: Meri zubaan se, mere haath zyada achcha bolte hai
englishDialogue: My hands do the talking better than my mouth

dialogue: Shayad tum nahi jaante ... yeh dharti sher bhi pehda karti hai
englishDialogue: May be you don't know ... this land also gives birth to tigers

dialogue: Mohabbat aur pagalpan ka bahut purana rishta hai
englishDialogue: Love and madness have a very old relation

dialogue: The more you sweat in peace ... the less you bleed in war
englishDialogue: The more you sweat in peace ... the less you bleed in war

dialogue: Aaj se tumhari har goli par desh ke dushman ka naam likha hoga
englishDialogue: From today on every bullet of yours there will be the name of the enemy of this country

dialogue: In paon mein kya rakha hai ... mere kaleje se lag ja ... mera kaleja thanda ho jayega ... toh rom rom aashirwad dega
englishDialogue: What is there in my feet ... instead give me a hug ... if my heart becomes cold ... then every part of me will bless you

dialogue: Abhe hata saavan ki ghata ... kha, khuja, bati bhujake soja nintakle pintukle ... mandi pe khareli hai aunty baja rahi hai baar-baar ghanti ... kulla ghumake paschim ko palat le ... bahut ho gaya phutle, vatle, shaana ban kya?
englishDialogue: Hey remove rain clouds ... eat, scratch, turn of the light and sleep you tiny little one ... the aunty standing in the market is ringing the bell again and again ... now turn your butt and move towards the west ... that's enough get lost, go, and be smart ok?

dialogue: Yeh duniya ek bus stop hai aur ladki ek bus ... peeche bhaago toh saala chute jaati hai ... wahin khade raho samne se doosri aati hai
englishDialogue: This world is a bus stop and a girl is a bus ... if you run behind it then you will miss it ... and if you stay in the same place then another one will come from the front

dialogue: Abhe shamshaan ke bhuje huye koile
englishDialogue: Hey you, burnt coal from the mortuary

dialogue: Pappu Pager kya hai pehle thokta hai, phir bajata hai ... phir thok bajake confirm karta hai
englishDialogue: Pappu Pager first hits, then smashes ... and then after hitting and smashing he confirms

dialogue: Aye jhantule jhatak, zyada na matak ... aur meri baat gale mein satak
englishDialogue: Hey you shaky person, don't move a lot ... and listen properly to what I am saying

dialogue: Aye amavas ke chamakte chaand
englishDialogue: Hey you, the shining moon of a new moon night

dialogue: Aye side hero ... beech mein nahi bolneka, samjha
englishDialogue: Hey you side hero ... don't talk in between, understand

dialogue: Aye tamatar ke aakhri daane
englishDialogue: Hey you, the last seed of a tomato

dialogue: Abhe marre huye kauve ke pankh
englishDialogue: Hey you, feather of a dead crow

dialogue: Amir aadmi bada banne ke baad ... black se white ho jata hai
englishDialogue: When a rich man becomes big ... he turns from black to white

dialogue: Waada karo ki aaj raat tum mere khwaabon mein zaroor aaoge
englishDialogue: Promise me tonight you will come in my dreams

dialogue: Woh aaye ward mein hamare Sahil ki harkat hai ... kabhi hum unke plaster ko, kabhi apni pattiyon ko dekhte hain
englishDialogue: He came to the ward because of Sahil ... sometimes I see his plaster, sometimes I see my bandages

dialogue: Ek sachcha aadmi hi apne sar par goli khane ke liye tayaar ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: Only a honest person will be ready to take a bullet on his head

dialogue: Ek waqt par main sirf ek hi kaam karta hoon ... jab peeta hoon toh khoob peeta hoon ... aur jab duty karta hoon toh sirf duty karta hoon
englishDialogue: At one time I only do one work ... when I drink then I drink a lot ... and when I am on duty then I only do duty

dialogue: Faanoos banke jiski hifaazat sarkar kare ... woh mantri kyun mare, jiska ilaaj poora aspataal kare
englishDialogue: One who gets protection like a lamp from the government ... why will that minister die, who gets care from the whole hospital

dialogue: Samaaj se gandagi saaf karne ka keeda hai mere andar
englishDialogue: I have a bug inside me to remove dirtiness from the society

dialogue: Jaan mat maangna ... iski bazaar mein koi keemat nahi hai
englishDialogue: Don't ask for my life ... it has no value in the market

dialogue: Usne rulaya hai ... wohi hasayega
englishDialogue: God made me cry ... God will make me smile

dialogue: Maut se badkar koi dost nahi hai ... hamesha mere saath chalti hai
englishDialogue: There is none better friend than death ... it always walks with me

dialogue: Behetar hai tu apna iraada badal de ... nahin toh main tera naksha badal doonga
englishDialogue: It's better if you change your opinion ... or else I will change your figure

dialogue: Ek mandir ka diya bhi tereko tawaif ke kothe ki laal batti lagta hai
englishDialogue: Even a lamp in a temple looks to you like a red light from a brothel

dialogue: Main toh laawaris tha, lekin mere marne ke baad meri laash laawaris nahi hogi
englishDialogue: I was an orphan, but after I die my dead body will not be an orphan

dialogue: Chalo ro lo ... kyun ki aaj ke baad is ghar mein koi royega nahi
englishDialogue: Alright cry ... because from today no one in this house will cry

dialogue: Main shehar ki dahshat ko mitane ke liye kanoon ke ek aaise muhafiz ko tainaat karoonga ... joh kanoon ki aan ke liye apni jaan bhi de sakta hai ... joh vardi ki shaan ke liye dono jahan se ladh sakta hai
englishDialogue: To end the terror in the city I'll deploy such a guardian of the law ... who can give his life for the honour of the law ... and who can fight against both the worlds for the reputation of the police uniform

dialogue: Mana ki bandook aur talwar mein bahut dum hai ... lekin kalam aur kalam ki awaaz hazaron bandookon aur lakhon talwaron par bhari hai
englishDialogue: I agree that there is a lot of power in a gun and a sword ... but a pen and the words from a pen can overcome thousands of guns and millions of swords

dialogue: Yeh vardi mehaz sood ka dagha nahi ... Hindustan ki izzat hai
englishDialogue: This police uniform is not only a piece of thread ... it's the honour of India

dialogue: Maut aur zindagi ki lakeer toh pehda hote hi uparwaala likh deta hai
englishDialogue: The lines of life and death are written by god when you're born

dialogue: Main kanoon ka woh ajgar hoon joh dasta nahi ... nighal jaata hai
englishDialogue: I'm a python of the law who doesn't bite ... but simply swallows

dialogue: Yahan khaki vardi ka nahi ... gundagardi ka raj chalta hai
englishDialogue: Here hooliganism rules ... and not the police uniform

dialogue: Kanoon hum mein phaasne ke liye rozana dus raaste banata hai ... aur hum usse nikalne ke liye sau raaste banate hai
englishDialogue: The law plans 10 ideas everyday to catch me ... and I plan 100 ideas to escape from them
