dialogue: Saanp ke toh sirf daant mein zehar hota hai ... meri har saans mein zehar hai
englishDialogue: A snake has poison only in his fangs ... but I have poison in every breath of mine

dialogue: Police, gundagardi aur politics ek mala mein pehrohe hue motiyon ke samaan hai ... aur in teeno mein se kisi ek ko kasht ho jaye toh ek doosre ke hamdard ban jaate hai
englishDialogue: Police, hooliganism and politics are pearls tied together in one necklace ... and if any one amongst them is in trouble then they share the pain in between them

dialogue: Journalist mar sakta hai ... journalism nahi
englishDialogue: A journalist can die ... but not journalism

dialogue: Yeh zameenay jispar apna raj kayam karna chahte ho ... ek din tumhare liye kabristan ban jayega
englishDialogue: The lands where you want to build your empire ... one day they will become a graveyard for you

dialogue: Kanoon ke dushmano ko main chitta ki raakh bana deta hoon
englishDialogue: I turn enemies of the law into ashes of the pyre

dialogue: Aurat ek khoobsurat phool ki tarah hoti hai ... jiski khushboo ko sirf mehsoos kiya ja sakta hai ... magar usse kuchla ya masla nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: A woman is like a beautiful flower ... whose fragrance can only be felt ... but it can't be destroyed or smashed

dialogue: Main tere pyar mein kya kya na bana Meena ... kabhi bana kutta, kabhi kamina
englishDialogue: Meena, what not did I become in your love ... sometimes a dog, sometimes a scoundrel

dialogue: Duniya mein aadmi ki nahi ... uske kapdon ki, uske dhan ki kadar hoti hai
englishDialogue: In this world a person's clothes and his money has value ... he himself has no value

dialogue: Duniya banane waale kya tere mann mein samayi ... kahe ko ghadi banayi
englishDialogue: Hey God what was in your heart ... why did you make the clock

dialogue: Sari duniya ke bache jab pehda hote hai toh maa maa karke rohte hai ... yeh gadha cinema cinema karke roh raha tha
englishDialogue: All the kids of the world cry mom mom when they are born ... this donkey was crying cinema cinema

dialogue: Lalach bahut badi kamzori hai insaan ki
englishDialogue: Greed is a very big weakness of humans

dialogue: Jiske paas mohabbat hai ... usse na jaan ka darr hai, na jahaan ka
englishDialogue: Those who have love ... are not scared of life, or the world

dialogue: Shor lehron ki aadat hoti hai aur khamoshi chattanon ki taqat ... lehren awaaz toh bahut karti hai ... magar chattanon se takrakar toot jaati hai
englishDialogue: Sound is a habit of the waves and silence is the strength of mountains ... waves do make a lot of sound ... but they break apart when they collide with the mountains

dialogue: Jism ki numaish paschim ki ada hai ... sharm Hindustan ka gehna
englishDialogue: To reveal the body is the style of the west ... shyness is the jewel of India

dialogue: Zameen ussi ki hoti hai jinke hal chalte hai ... unki nahi joh unpar hal chalate hai
englishDialogue: The land belongs to the person who owns the plow ... not the person who plows the field

dialogue: Insaan kitni bhi jaldi kare, pahunchta tabhi hai jab usse pahunchna hota hai ... aur pahunchta wahi hai jahan usse pahunchna hota hai
englishDialogue: No matter how much a person rushes, he reaches only when he is suppose to reach ... and reaches the place where is he is suppose to reach

dialogue: Agar tum mein mazaak sehne ki himmat nahi hai ... toh mazaak kiya bhi mat karo
englishDialogue: If you don't have the courage to stand a joke ... then don't be jovial yourself

dialogue: Aap hai gul-e-gulzar, mausam-e-bahar ... chehre par hai gussa, dil mein hai pyar ... aa gale lag ja mere yaar
englishDialogue: You are a beautiful flower of the spring ... you have anger on your face and love in your heart ... come give me a hug my friend

dialogue: Life mein teen cheezon ke peeche khabi nahi bhagna chahiye ... bus, train aur chokri ... ek gayi doosri aati hai
englishDialogue: In life you should never run behind 3 things ... bus, train and girl ... one goes another one comes

dialogue: Abhe oh ujhdi hui riyasat ke lutte huye sultan
englishDialogue: Hey you broken ruler of a ruined kingdom

dialogue: Yeh kaunsa tha jaam joh tune pila diya ... is sirphere ka sara system hila diya
englishDialogue: What drink did you give me ... it shook the whole system of this mad person

dialogue: Yeh aap par itne phool barsaingi, itne phool barsaingi ... ki aap bloody fool ho jayenge
englishDialogue: They will shower so many flowers on you... that you will become a bloody fool

dialogue: Toofan mein bahaa hai na yeh sholon mein jala hai ... ghayal hua teeron se na khanjar se kata hai ... kehte hai jisse ishq qayamat hai, bala hai ... takraya joh bhi isse woh duniya se mitta hai
englishDialogue: Neither has it flown away in the storm nor has it burnt in the embers ... neither has it been wounded with arrows nor has been cut with a knife ... that is love and it is also a catastrophe ... because anyone who fights with it, gets eradicated from the world

dialogue: Ab toh is zindagi mein wohi aayegi ... yah phir is aashiq ki jaan jayegi
englishDialogue: Now only she can come in my life ... or else this lover will die

dialogue: Yeh phool nahi mere dil ka lahu hai ... aur Daddy yeh dushman nahi, tumhari hone waali bahu hai
englishDialogue: This is the blood of my heart, not a flower ... and Dad she is your daughter-in-law to be, not your enemy

dialogue: Royega toh tu, jab khelenge hum hu tu tu ... aur thukenge tere mooh par thu thu thu
englishDialogue: You will cry when we play Kabaddi ... and we will spit on your face

dialogue: Tumne samundar ko lalkaara hai ... ab aaisa toofan aayega, aaisa sailaab uthega ... ki tumhara ishq, jispar tumhe bahut naaz hai ... tinke ki tarah beh jayega, tabah ho jayega, fanaa ho jayega
englishDialogue: You have challenged the ocean ... now such a storm will come, such a flood will come ... that your love, which you are proud of ... will flow away like a small particle and it will be wrecked, it will be destroyed

dialogue: Jab baazi dukki aur tikki se jeeti ja sakti hai ... toh uske liye ekka nikalne ki kya zaroorat hai
englishDialogue: When you can win the game with 2's and 3's ... then why do you need to remove the ace for that

dialogue: Aaisi maut maaro inko ... ki ishq karne waalo ki rooh tak kaanp jaaye
englishDialogue: Kill them in such a way ... that even the soul of the people in love will shudder

dialogue: Upar waale tera khel nirala ... kutte ki dumm ko seedha kar daala
englishDialogue: Oh God your game is strange ... you've straightened a dogs crooked tail

dialogue: Mera beta sharafat ki missile hai missile
englishDialogue: My son is a missile of honesty

dialogue: India mein time se aane waale ki koi value nahi hoti ... der se aane waale ko star samjha jaata hai
englishDialogue: In India there is no value for people who come on time ... and people who come late are considered a star

dialogue: Hindustan ki pavitra dharti par pehda hokar ... gadhe ki tarah mehnat karke, kutte ki tarah jeena chhodkar ... chori chakari kar raha hai?
englishDialogue: Being born on the holy land of India ... after working hard like a donkey, and leaving the life of a dog ... instead you are stealing?

dialogue: Tera mooh baatein karta hue achcha nahi lagta hai ... Fevicol dhal uske andhar
englishDialogue: Your mouth doesn't look talking ... put glue in it

dialogue: Sar se paon tak khud ko dhak liya hai ... meri Roopa ka roop toh kahin se nazar hi nahi aata ni
englishDialogue: You have covered yourself from head to toe ... so we can't see the beauty of my Roopa

dialogue: Chalti hai kya nau se barah?
englishDialogue: Are you coming for the 9 to 12 show?

dialogue: Yeh achanak Star TV mein se Doordarshan kaise ho gayi?
englishDialogue: How did she suddenly become from Star TV into Doordarshan?

dialogue: Udhar log mitane jaate hai gham ... aur uska naach dekhke nikal jaata hai ache-achon ka dum
englishDialogue: People go there to erase their sadness ... and after seeing her dance even the best of the best are left helpless

dialogue: Yeh upar waala hai na hamesha chuhe billi ka khel khelta hai ... kabhi itna sukh deta hai ki sambhala nahi jaata ... kabhi itna dukh de deta hai ki dil se nikala nahi jaata
englishDialogue: God always plays the game of cat and mouse ... sometimes he gives so much happiness that you can't handle it ... and sometimes he gives so much sorrow that you can't remove it from the heart

dialogue: Tumne khud mujhe zindagi ke aaise modh par akela chhoda hai ... jahan se aage main badh nahi sakti aur peeche hatne ke kabil nahi rahi
englishDialogue: You yourself have brought and left me on such a path of life ... from where I can't move forward and I'm not in a position to move back

dialogue: Apne maqsad mein kamyaabi haasil karne ke liye ... taqat se zyada himmat ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: To get success in your motive ... more than strength you need to have courage

dialogue: Woh pyar nahi ek mazak tha ... aur mazak dil behlane ke liye hota hai ... dil mein basane ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: That was a joke and not love ... and a joke is used to entertain ... not to settle in the heart

dialogue: Agar maarna chahte ho toh che ki che goli humri khopadiya mein utaar do ... kyun ki agar humre jism mein thodi bhi jaan reh gayi ... toh hum tujhko jaan se maar daalonga
englishDialogue: If you want to kill me then shoot all six bullets into my head ... because even if a little life is left in my body ... then I'll kill you

dialogue: Ghaas aur dushmani kahin bhi aur kabhi bhi pehda ho sakte hai
englishDialogue: Grass and enmity can grow anywhere and anytime

dialogue: Main inteqam ka ek aaisa dahekta hua koyla hoon ... jiski uthti hui aag ki lapton mein tum sabki zindagiyan aa chuki hai ... aur is jalte hue koyle ki aag mein tum sab bari-bari jalkar raakh ho jaoge
englishDialogue: I'm a burning charcoal of revenge ... in the flames of which all of your lives have been caught ... and in the fire of this charcoal you all will burn into ashes one by one

dialogue: Bacha maa ki kok mein baad mein panapta hai ... humra ghulam pehle banta hai
englishDialogue: A child grows later in a mother's womb ... first he becomes my slave

dialogue: Main teri ek ek saans maut ke bazaar mein bechkar aaya hoon
englishDialogue: I have sold every single breath of yours in the market of death

dialogue: Do kadam kya, sau kadam peeche hatt ja ... lekin aaj na tu apni maut se peecha chhuda sakta hai ... na maut ke saaye se
englishDialogue: Not only 2 steps, you can even go back 100 steps ... but today you won't be able to run away from your death ... and neither from the shadow of death

dialogue: Aaj mile hai saare friends old old ... sab milke khao zarda "Gopal Gold"
englishDialogue: Today all old friends have met ... everyone eat together "Gopal Gold" tobacco

dialogue: Gareebon ke mooh mein zabaan hote hue bhi ... woh ameeron ki duniya mein goonge bankar jeete hai
englishDialogue: Even though poor people have a voice in their throat ... still they live mute in the world of rich people

dialogue: Main hoon Mr. Tolmol, baat karun main gol-gol ... khol doon main sabki pol
englishDialogue: I'm Mr. Tolmol, I speak confusingly ... and I reveal everyone's secrets

dialogue: Abhe kamzor dil ke kabutar ... astabal ke khabeez!
englishDialogue: Hey you weak heartened pigeon ... you wicked person of a stable!

dialogue: Aap humre pati hai ... parmeshwar banne ka bhool mat ki jiye
englishDialogue: You are my husband ... don't make the mistake of being my god

dialogue: Anyay kabhi karna mat ... aur uske samne jhukna bhi mat
englishDialogue: Don't ever do injustice ... and never bow down in front of it either

dialogue: Jawan beti ka baap Taj Mahal ke chaukidaar ki tarah hota hai ... usko hamesha darr laga rehta hai ke kisi gande aadmi ke haath se Taj Mahal ganda na ho jaye
englishDialogue: The father of a young girl is like the watchman of the Taj Mahal ... he is always scared that the Taj Mahal will get dirty by the hands of some dirty person

dialogue: Paise ke pair mein paiye lage hote hai ... woh kabhi bhi khasak jaati hai
englishDialogue: Money has wheels on its legs ... it can slide away anytime

dialogue: Inspector sahab aapne ab tak jail ki zanjeeron aur salakhon ka loha dekha hai ... magar Shalu ki himmat ka faulad nahi dekha ... pehna di jiye sar se paon tak loha, kheench di jiye zameen se aasman tak lohe ki deewar ... magar Shalu har deewar ko todh degi
englishDialogue: Mr. Inspector, till now you have only seen the iron of the jail and the shackles ... but you haven't seen the steel of Shalu's courage ... put the shackles on me from head to toe, build the wall of iron from the ground to the sky ... but Shalu will break every wall

dialogue: Chori chupe pyar ya toh ghar ke pichwade mein hota hai ya gaadi ke pichwade mein hota hai
englishDialogue: Making love in hiding is either done on the back side of a house or on the back side of a car

dialogue: Insaan aaise gunaah zindagi mein sirf do hi baar karta hai ... ek ya toh sar pe kisi ka udhaar ho aur doosra jab dil mein kisi ka pyar ho
englishDialogue: A person commits such a crime only in two conditions of life ... first if he is in debt to someone and second when he is in love with someone

dialogue: Ek baar ghulami se peecha chhudaya tha hamare buzurgon ne ... toh kya aaj hum phir ghulam ban jayenge? ... chand aaise gaddar netaon ke haathon mein desh ki bhaag-daur ko saunp denge ... jinki gaadiyan bullet-proof, kapde daag-proof, kaan sound-proof aur aankhen sharam-proof? ... bolo, jawaab do!
englishDialogue: Our elders had saved us once from slavery ... so today will we become slaves once again? ... will we give the operations of our country into the hands of a few corrupt politicians ... whose cars are bullet-proof, clothes are stain-proof, ears are sound-proof and eyes are shame-proof? ... tell me, answer me!

dialogue: Zabaan kabu mein rahe toh zabaan rehti hai ... bekabu ho jaye toh kataar bankar ki masoom begunah ka seena cheer sakti hai
englishDialogue: If a tongue in under control then it's called a tongue ... if it becomes uncontrollable then it turns into a blade and tears the body of infallible innocent people

dialogue: Insaaf bik raha hai, emaan bik raha hai ... bazar sa laga hai, samaan bik raha hai ... is Ram ki dharti par Ravan ka raj hai ... kanoon thak chuka hai, napunsak samaaj hai ... har modh par yahan toh insaan bik raha hai ... bazar sa laga hai, samaan bik raha hai ... noton ke naam par, kahin voton ke naam par ... tirthon ke naam par, kahin dharamon ke naam par ... lag rahi hai boliyan, bhagwan bik raha hai ... bazar sa laga hai, samaan bik raha hai ... manavta lut rahi hai, khamosh hai vidhata ... dharti par badte paapon ko mitaane ... janam kyun nahi leta koi mrityudaata
englishDialogue: Justice is being sold, faith is being sold ... a market is setup and goods are being sold ... Ravana rules on this land of Lord Ram ... the law is tired, the society is impotent ... on every corner here a human is being sold ... a market is setup and goods are being sold ... somewhere in the name of money, somewhere in the name of votes ... somewhere in the name of holy places, somewhere in the name of religions ... the prices are being set and god is being sold ... a market is setup and goods are being sold ... humanity is being stolen and god is silent ... to erase the growing sins on earth ... why doesn't some giver of death take birth

dialogue: Hamara raaj aur tumhari neeti ... in dono ke gathbandan se hi chalti hai tumhari raajneeti
englishDialogue: My rule and your policy ... your politics runs on the union of these two

dialogue: Sachai dimaag ka darwaza khat-khatati toh hai magar uski dastak sunai nahi deti
englishDialogue: Truth does bang on the door of your mind but you can't hear the sound of it

dialogue: Maut ho aaisi jisse sara zamana yaad kare ... yun toh aate hai sabhi is duniya mein marne ke liye
englishDialogue: Death should be something that the world remembers ... because everyone comes in this world to die

dialogue: Joh log apna pasina bahakar desh ka muqadar banate hai ... unke bachche toh rotiyon ke liye taraste hai ... aur tum log joh kursiyon par behetkar desh ke muqadar ka faisla karte ho ... apne aulad ki shaadiyon mein karodon rupai lutate ho ... kahan se aati hai daulat?
englishDialogue: Those who shed their sweat in order to build the destiny of the country ... their children long for food ... and you people who sit on chairs and take the decisions about the destiny of the country ... spend crores of rupees in the weddings of your children ... where does all this money come from?

dialogue: Kauva agar Kashi bhi ho aaye toh bhi "kav-kav" hi karega ... "Ram-Ram" nahi
englishDialogue: Even if a crow visits Varanasi, he will still say "kav-kav" only ... he won't say "Ram-Ram"

dialogue: Raajneeti ka zehar, dharam, jaati aur basha ka glucose bana karke do kaumon ki ragon mein bhar dete ho ... aur phir apne mahalon mein behet karke janta ki khoon ki holi ka tamesha dekhte ho
englishDialogue: You fill the glucose made from the poision of politics, religion, caste and language into the veins of people from two different religions ... and then you sit in your mansions and watch the entertainment of the blood bath of people

dialogue: Mera bas chale toh ek minute mein 60 seconds, ek ghante mein 60 minute aur ek din mein 24 ghante ... bas tumhe dekhta rahoon, tumhe choomta rahoon
englishDialogue: If it was in my control then for 60 seconds in one minute, 60 minutes in one hour and 24 hours in one day ... I would just look at you and kiss you

dialogue: Jab tak main tujhe maar nahi deta ... maut bhi mujhe maar nahi sakti
englishDialogue: Until I kill you ... even death won't be able to kill me

dialogue: Teri maut tujhse utni hi door hai ... jitni door main tujhse hoon
englishDialogue: You death is only that much far from you ... as much far I am from you

dialogue: Pyar hum dono ne kiya ... magar tadapna sirf mere naseeb mein aaya
englishDialogue: We both fell in love ... but the suffering only came in my destiny

dialogue: Mohabaat ka dard bada jaan leva hota hai
englishDialogue: The pain of love can take one's life

dialogue: Paal le koi rog nadan zindagi ke vaaste ... sirf sehat ke sahare zindagi katti nahi
englishDialogue: Build some bad habits for this silly life ... life cannot be completed only with good health

dialogue: Mujh jaise dost baat maar sakte hai ... magar kabhi laat nahi maar sakte
englishDialogue: Friends like me can hit you with the words ... but not with the leg

dialogue: Yeh India hai India ... yahan par aurat deewar se toh gir sakti hai ... magar apne mayaan se nahi
englishDialogue: This is India ... here a woman can fall from a wall ... but she cannot fall from her limits

dialogue: Mujhko lambi umar ki dua na do ... jitni ghuzri nagawar ghuzri
englishDialogue: Don't give me the blessing of a long life ... whatever time I have lived it has been unpleasant

dialogue: Bhare saawan mein reghistaan lagta hai ... yeh ghar mera khali makaan lagta hai
englishDialogue: In heavy rain it looks like a desert ... this home of mine looks only like a house

dialogue: Jab maine apne dil mein rehne waalon ke jaane ka afsoos nahin kiya ... toh ghar se jaane waalon ki parvah kya karoonga
englishDialogue: When I don't repent for people living in my heart leaving ... then why will I care for people leaving the house

dialogue: Gham se khali nahi jism ka kona koi ... hum rahe na rahe, hum pe mat rona koi
englishDialogue: No corner of my body is without sadness ... whether I live or not, don't cry for me

dialogue: Maine kabhi tumhare jism se nahin ... tumhari aatma se pyar kiya
englishDialogue: I have never loved your body ... I have loved your soul

dialogue: Auron ke liye gunaah sahi ... hum piye toh shabaab banti hai ... arre sau ghamo ko nichodne ke baad ... ek katra sharaab banti hai
englishDialogue: It may be a crime for others ... but when I drink I become young ... and after you squeeze 100 sorrows ... you get one drop of alcohol

dialogue: Mohabbat ko samajhna hai agar toh dariya mein kuda kar ... kyun ki kinare pe ukhudu bahetne se andaaz-e-toofan nahi hota
englishDialogue: If you want to understand love then get in the ocean ... because you cannot get the sense of the storm by sitting on the shore

dialogue: Kispe kare yakeen, kisse kare gilla ... mere naseeb ne mera yeh haal kar diya
englishDialogue: Whom to believe, whom should I complain ... my destiny has created this condition of mine

dialogue: Jitni tumhari saal bhar ki kamai hai ... utne rupaiy ke surf aur sabun se ... meri haveli ke farsh dhoye jaate hai
englishDialogue: Whatever you earn in a year ... powder and soap of that much amount is used ... to wash the floors of my mansion

dialogue: Zindagi toh khuda ki rehmat hai ... joh nahi samjha uski zindagi pe laanat hai
englishDialogue: Life is a blessing of God ... those who don't understand that, their life is a shame

dialogue: Zindagi ke faisle naseeb karta hai ... maa baap nahi
englishDialogue: The decisions of life are made by destiny... not by parents

dialogue: Aurat us waqt tak Sita Savitri hoti hai, jab tak uska pati Ram aur Satyavan hota hai ... jis din yeh maryada tootti hai na, aurat ek aaisa uljha hua sawaal ban jaati hai ... jisse koi mard suljha nahi sakta
englishDialogue: A woman is like Sita and Savitri, until her husband is like Ram and Satyavan ... but the day this limit breaks, the woman turns into such a twisted question ... which no man has the answer to

dialogue: Ladki toh hoti hi hai tyag ka zehar peene ke liye
englishDialogue: Girls are meant to drink the poison of sacrifice

dialogue: Kisi shaitan ki di hui saugaat se ... kisi insaan ki di hui khairaat zyada achchi hai
englishDialogue: The charity received from a human is better than ... the gift received from a devil

dialogue: Koi mard kisi kulta ke maang mein apne naam ka sindoor bardaasht nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: No man can tolerate the vermilion of his name in the hair parting of a promiscuous woman

dialogue: Yeh kaide kanoon ... hum gareebo ko insaaf dilane ke liye nahi ... balki ameero ki sahuliyat ke liye hai
englishDialogue: These rules and laws ... are not there to bring justice to the poor like us ... instead they are there for the convenience of the rich

dialogue: Zindagi imtihan leti hai aur joh aadmi us imtihan mein first aata hai ... woh asli hero kehlata hai
englishDialogue: Life always tests us and the person who comes first in that test ... that person is called as the real hero

dialogue: Jab tum paas hoti ho toh waqt kitni jaldi guzar jaata hai ... aur jab tum nahi hoti ho toh waqt kaate nahi kat'ta
englishDialogue: When you're with me then time passes by very fast ... and when you're not there with me then it's hard to spend that time

dialogue: Yeh prem rog bada khatarnak rog hota hai ... iska ilaaj toh sirf ussi ke paas hota hai jis insaan ko prem ho jaata hai ... varna yeh aisi jaan leva bimari hai ... ke iska ilaaj toh kisi vaid ke paas bhi nahi hota
englishDialogue: The disease of love is a very dangerous thing ... only a person in love has the cure to that ... or else it's a killer disease ... and no doctor has the cure to this

dialogue: Thakur waqt ke hisaab se nahi chalte ... waqt Thakur ke hisaab se chalta hai
englishDialogue: The lord doesn't move according to time ... time moves according to the lord

dialogue: Khoon ek baar karo ya sau baar ... phansi sirf ek baar hoti hai
englishDialogue: No matter if you kill once or a hundred times ... you are hanged to death only once

dialogue: Shehar ka sabse bada gunda ... doosre gunday ko zamanat par le jaane aaya hai
englishDialogue: The biggest goon of the city ... has come to bail the other goon

dialogue: Gunday aur gundagardi yahi se janam lete hai ... jisse aap police station kehte hai
englishDialogue: Goons and rowdyism are born right here ... what you call as police station

dialogue: Jurm ko mitane ke liye ... mitna bhi padta hai
englishDialogue: To eradicate crime ... sometimes you have to die

dialogue: Mere gunaah mat gina ... sazaa de, chala goli
englishDialogue: Don't count my crimes ... punish me, fire the bullet

dialogue: Samundar mein mutthi bhar shakkar dalne se ... uska namak kam nahin ho jaata
englishDialogue: If you throw a handful of sugar in the ocean ... that doesn't reduce its salt

dialogue: Agar kisi ne iski taraf aankh uthakar bhi dekha ... toh uske saare khandaan ki aankhen nikaal doonga
englishDialogue: If anyone raises their eyes and looks at her ... then I'll remove the eyes of that persons entire family

dialogue: Sipahi jab maidan-e-jung mein utarta hai ... toh apna hathyaar lana nahin bhulta
englishDialogue: When a soldier steps into the war field ... he never forgets his weapon

dialogue: Haath toh laga ... iske baad dhoondhta reh jayega ki tere jism ke saath koi haath bhi tha
englishDialogue: If you touch me ... you will be lost imagining whether you had a hand on your body or not

dialogue: Yeh khel teri zindagi ka aakhri khel hoga ... aakhri khel
englishDialogue: This game will be the last game of your life ... last game

dialogue: Sabka sukh chain cheenkar kaise chain se lete hue ho
englishDialogue: How comfortably are you lying down after snatching the peace of everyone

dialogue: Main teri maut bankar aaya hoon ... aur teri maut atal hai
englishDialogue: I have come as your death ... and your death is firm

dialogue: Aag ko jab tak na chedo, tab nak nahi bhadhakti ... chedo toh aaisa bhadhakti hai, ke jalakar raakh kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Until you tease the fire, it does not grow ... and when you tease it, it grows in such a way that it burns you into ashes

dialogue: Saari duniya ka dard ... maa ki chatti se lagte hi mitt jaata hai
englishDialogue: All the pains of the world ... go away when you hug a mother

dialogue: Aap kanoon haath mein le nahi sakte ... aur apun ka haath duniya ka koi kanoon rok nahi sakta
englishDialogue: You cannot take the law in your own hands ... and no law of this world can stop my hands

dialogue: Buraiyon se ladte ladte joh log mar jaate hai ... unki maut ko maut nahi ... shahadat kaha jaata hai
englishDialogue: People who die fighting against the evil ... their death is not called death ... it's called martyrdom

dialogue: Yeh adalat hai na, yeh rishton aur jazbaton se nahi chalti ... adalat chalti hai sabooton se, adalat chalti hai gawahon se
englishDialogue: The court doesn't run on relations and emotions ... the court runs on proofs, the court runs on witnesses

dialogue: Ek ladka, ek ladki, chota sa ghar pyara pyara ... yahi sandesh de raha hai desh hamara
englishDialogue: One boy, one girl, and small lovable house ... our country is giving this message

dialogue: Tu kanoon ko khareed sakta hai, adalaton ko khareed sakta hai ... lekin bhagwan ke us insaaf ko nahi khareed sakta
englishDialogue: You can buy the law, you can buy the court ... but you can't buy the justice of god

dialogue: Log peete hai isse hosh ko khone ke liye ... aur hum mein hosh bhi aata hai peene ke baad
englishDialogue: People drink this (alcohol) to lose their senses ... and I get into my senses only after drinking

dialogue: Mauka deta hai parmeshwar ... maut deta hai Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: The god gives a chance ... and Rajeshwar gives death

dialogue: Langoor ki dumm par angoor ki bail ... ab main nikaalonga mujrimon ka tel
englishDialogue: There is a grapevine on the tail of a monkey ... now I'll squeeze the oil out of criminals

dialogue: Zindagi deta hai parmeshwar ... magar taqdeer likhta hai Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: God gives life ... but Rajeshwar writes the destiny

dialogue: Main chaal chalta nahi ... aur chalta hoon toh maat nahi khata
englishDialogue: I don't plan ploys ... but if I plan them, then I don't lose

dialogue: Maarne waale sochte nahi aur sochne waale maarte nahi
englishDialogue: People who kill don't think and people who think don't kill

dialogue: Langoor ki dumm par angoor ki bail ... mohabbat mein ab tu saare sitam jhel
englishDialogue: There is a grapevine on the tail of a monkey ... now bear all the pains in love

dialogue: Mausam banata hai parmeshwar ... usse badalta hai Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: God creates the seasons ... and Rajeshwar changes them

dialogue: Dekh raha hai parmeshwar ... raj karega Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: The god is looking ... and Rajeshwar will rule

dialogue: Is zindagi mein sirf do hi sach hai ... ek hai jeevan aur doosra mrityu
englishDialogue: There are only two truths in life ... one is life and other is death

dialogue: Langoor ki dumm par angoor ki bail ... patni ko dekh ke engine ho gaya mera fail
englishDialogue: There is a grapevine on the tail of a monkey ... my engine failed after seeing my wife

dialogue: Baat ban gayi, life ban gayi ... bhabhi bhaiya ki wife ban gayi
englishDialogue: Life is great and it's confirmed ... sister-in-law has become my brothers wife

dialogue: Elaan karta hai parmeshwar ... aaj marega Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: The god is announcing that ... today Rajeshwar will die

dialogue: Langoor ki dumm par angoor ki bail ... ab ho jayega dushmanon ka engine derail
englishDialogue: There is a grapevine on the tail of a monkey ... now the engine of the enemies will derail

dialogue: Langoor ki dumm par angoor ki bail ... khatam ho gaya is moti ka khel
englishDialogue: There is a grapevine on the tail of a monkey ... the game of this fat lady is over

dialogue: Mandiron mein beheta rahega parmeshwar ... ishwaron ka ishwar banega Rajeshwar
englishDialogue: The god will be sitting in the temples ... and Rajeshwar will become the god of gods

dialogue: Jab jab jiske lagne hai ... tab tab uske lagte hai ... ab usse ittefaq kaho ya phir what the f*ck
englishDialogue: When someone is going to get screwed ... then that person will get screwed ... you can call that coincidence or what the f*ck

dialogue: Kayi baar kismat badalne ke liye khudko badalna padta hai
englishDialogue: Many a times one has to change themselves to change their destiny

dialogue: Aadmi achcha hoon, iraada nek hai aur mausam first class hai ... chale?
englishDialogue: I am a good man, intention is good and the weather is great ... can we go?

dialogue: Zindagi ki har baat sirf sach yah jhoot nahin hoti
englishDialogue: Everything in life is not only either true or false

dialogue: Meri shaadi mere sapne se ho chuki hai
englishDialogue: I am married to my dream

dialogue: Achche logon ke saath hamesha achcha hota hai
englishDialogue: Good things always happen with good people

dialogue: Kapde jitne chote hote hain ... kaamyabi utni hi badi hoti hai
englishDialogue: The shorter the clothes ... the bigger the success

dialogue: Joker agar baazi bana sakta hai ... toh joker baazi bhigaad bhi sakta hai
englishDialogue: If a joker can win the game ... then the joker can also destroy the game

dialogue: Pehle shaurat, baad mein aurat
englishDialogue: First money, and then honey

dialogue: Dil ki gali bahut choti hoti hai ... us mein yah toh paisa reh sakta hai, yah pyar
englishDialogue: The lane of the heart is very small ... in it either money can stay, or love

dialogue: Do kamzoor insaan ek kamyaab zindagi nahin bana sakte
englishDialogue: Two weak people cannot make a successful life

dialogue: Is duniya mein agar tum sach dheere se bologe toh koi nahin manega ... aur agar jhoot, jhoot chila chila kar bologe toh sab maan jaate hain
englishDialogue: In this world if you say the truth softly then no one will believe it ... and lie, if you shout and say the lie then everyone believes it

dialogue: Tu bhi chup chap kehta ja ... yes boss, yes boss, yes boss
englishDialogue: You also keep saying quietly ... yes boss, yes boss, yes boss

dialogue: Ek machhar sala aadmi ko hijda bana deta hai!
englishDialogue: One bloody mosquito can turn a man into a eunuch!

dialogue: Giro saalo giro, lekin giro toh us jharne ki tarah ... joh parbat ki oonchai se girke bhi apni sundarta khone nahi deta ... zameen ke teh se milke bhi apni astitva ko narth nahi hone deta
englishDialogue: Fall you bloody people fall, but fall like a waterfall ... who even after falling from the heights of the mountain does not lose its beauty ... who even after meeting the ground does not let its exsistence go away

dialogue: Sau mein se assi beimaan ... phir bhi mera desh mahaan
englishDialogue: Out of 100, 80 are cheaters ... but still my country is great

dialogue: Ek khatmal poori raat ko apahij kar deta hai
englishDialogue: One bed bug can handicap the whole night

dialogue: Yeh mera pasina nahi mera khoon hai joh pani bankar behta hai mere badan se
englishDialogue: This is not my sweat, this is my blood that flows from my body like water

dialogue: Paanch baje ke baad Deva ki adaalat shuru hoti hai
englishDialogue: After 5 o'clock, Deva's court starts

dialogue: Agar daud tujhe teri maut se door le ja sakti hai toh ... daud ... daud!
englishDialogue: If running can take you away from your death then ... run ... run!

dialogue: Baki meetings meri meeting ke baad
englishDialogue: Do rest of meetings after my meeting

dialogue: Agar dobara tune aaisi galati ki ... toh tera woh hashar karoonga ... ki tujhe apne haathon se apni zindagi phisalti hui nazar aayegi
englishDialogue: If you do this mistake again ... then I will treat you in such a way ... that you will see your life sliding out of your own hands

dialogue: Maut aur waqt ka koi taal-mel nahi hota
englishDialogue: Death and time do not have any coordination between them

dialogue: Alga woh daraar hai joh kisi bhi imarat ki buniyaad mein samahkar ... us imarat ko barbaad kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Incoherence is that gap which can settle in the foundation of any building ... and it can destroy that building

dialogue: Char din ki zindagi hai aur aaj chautha din hai ... yeh sochkar itne saal nikaal diye
englishDialogue: Life is short and today is the last day of life ... I've spent so many years thinking just that

dialogue: Yeh joh samay hai na, yeh sabki leta hai ... samay samay par, sahi samay par ... sahi tarah se leta hai
englishDialogue: Time screws everyone ... all the time and at the right time ... it screws perfectly

dialogue: Sharam aur main toh ek sentence mein nahi aate madam
englishDialogue: Madam, shyness and I don't come in a single sentence

dialogue: Waqt tha emergency ka ... mahol tha dehshat ka ... mauka tha kismat badalne ka ... woh army thi, par hum bhi toh harami the
englishDialogue: It was a time of emergency ... there was fright in the atmosphere ... it was an opportunity to change the destiny ... there was an army, but even I was a evil

dialogue: Woh ishq hi kya joh salamat chhod de
englishDialogue: Love that keeps you safe, isn't real love

dialogue: Zubaan aur jaan sirf ek hi baar di jaa sake hai ... aaj se dono taare
englishDialogue: A promise and a life can only be given once ... from today both of these are yours

dialogue: Aankhon mein tabhi chamak aati hai jab unmein khatra hota hai
englishDialogue: There's a shine in the eyes only when they have danger in them

dialogue: Duniya mein do kisam ke log hote hai ... ek jinke saath hum peete hai ... doosre jinki wajah se hum peete hai
englishDialogue: There are two types of people in the world ... one with whom we drink ... and second are those for whom we drink

dialogue: Jeevan mein do tarah ke log aapke saath hamesha hone chahiye ... ek Krishna jaise joh aapke liye na bhi lade tab bhi aapki jeet pakki kar de ... aur doosre Karna jaise joh aapke liye tab bhi lade jab aapki haar saamne dikh rahi ho
englishDialogue: In life two types of people should always be there with you ... one like Lord Krishna, who don't even fight for you but still they ensure that you win ... and second like Karna, who will fight for you even when you can see your defeat in front of you

dialogue: Rajai, lugai aur ladai hamesha barabar ki honi chahiye
englishDialogue: A blanket, a wife and a fight must always be appropriate to your own size

dialogue: Main kahani badal doonga
englishDialogue: I'll change the story

dialogue: Aankhen bhi ajeeb raazdar hove ... dekhe kuch aur, dikhaye kuch aur ... bayaan kuch aur kare, jaati kuch aur
englishDialogue: The eyes are strange type of secret keepers ... they see something and they show something else ... they say something and they express something else

dialogue: Maut jab sar pe hoti hai ... zindagi ki keemat tab samajh mein aati hai
englishDialogue: When death hangs around your head ... only then you understand the value of life

dialogue: Aapke sone ka karat maare character ko kharaab nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: The karat of your gold can't spoil my character

dialogue: Karne se pehle kya sochna ... pehle karo phir daro
englishDialogue: Why think before doing it ... first do it and then worry about it

dialogue: Zindagi badi choti hai ... bade bade faisle lene ke liye zyada time nahi lena chahiye
englishDialogue: Life is very short ... you should not take a long time for making big decisions

dialogue: History is always written about men ... but not always made by them
englishDialogue: History is always written about men ... but not always made by them

dialogue: Jab baat jugaad ki ho toh jaan ki keemat kam ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When it's about hacking something then the value of life decreases

dialogue: Kisi ko tum gusail lagti ho, kisi ko bighdail lagti ho ... tumhari amma mazak mazak mein kehti hai ki raat bhar ghoomti rehti ho toh chudail lagti ho ... kisi ko tumhari baatein atpatti lagti hai, kisi ko behad chatpatti lagti hai ... tumhari kasam humein tumhari har ek baat bahut hi achchi lagti hai
englishDialogue: Someone thinks you're great and someone thinks you're naughty ... your mother jokingly says that you look like a witch when you roam around in the night ... someone thinks your talks are strange and someone thinks they're pretty interesting ... I swear on you, I love every bit that you do

dialogue: Aasaan nahi hai tumse pyar karna ... magar tumse pyar na karna usse bhi zyada mushkil hai
englishDialogue: It's not easy to love you ... but it's more difficult to not love you

dialogue: Agar shakal dekh ke ladkiyan shaadi karti na ... toh Hindustan mein aadhe ladke kanware hote
englishDialogue: If girls would marry just by looking at the face ... then half the guys in India would be bachelors

dialogue: Aaj ke baad galat time pe phone kiya na ... toh aisi laat maarenge koole pe dimple nikaal denge tumhare
englishDialogue: From today if you call me at the wrong time ... then I'll kick your ass in such a way that, a pimple will pop up there

dialogue: Laxmi ji ki kripa se paisa toh itna hai ki Dhanteras pe aap hi ki dukaan khareed ke aap hi ko gift karde
englishDialogue: By the grace of Goddess Laxmi I have so much money that, I can buy your shop on the festival of Dhanteras and gift it to you itself

dialogue: Apna aakhri shradh mana le ... kyun ki iske baad tere haath aur hathyar bhi kaam nahi aayenge
englishDialogue: Celebrate your last death ceremony ... because after this even your hands and weapons won't be useful for you

dialogue: Ek second lagega tujhe maarne mein ... lekin nahi ... tujhe har din maarunga, har second maarunga
englishDialogue: It'll take me one second to kill you ... but no ... I'll kill you every day, I'll kill you every second

dialogue: Hide and seek toh bache khele hai ... yo hide and cheek hai
englishDialogue: Kids play the game of hide and seek ... but this is hide and scream

dialogue: Jab tak haarne ka darr na ho na ... tab tak jeetne mein maza nahi aata
englishDialogue: Until you don't have the fear of losing ... till then there's no fun in winning

dialogue: Ek ladki ka maika hota hai, sasural hota hai ... par ghar kahan hota hai?
englishDialogue: A girl has her parents house, her in-laws house ... but where is her home?

dialogue: Hone wale miyan ke tareefon ke pul baand rahe hai ... baraat kam lagta hai khule saand khade hai ...  aise bhi kya heere jadhe hai ... darshan chote bas naam badhe hai
englishDialogue: Everyone is praising the to be groom ... they seem more like wild bulls rather than the wedding procession ... does he have diamonds on him ... only his name is big but his deeds are small

dialogue: Yeh dekhne mein shareef hai lekin sharafat bhi pani bharti hai inke aage
englishDialogue: He looks innocent from his face, but in reality there's nothing honest about him

dialogue: Mujhse related sari cheezein world mein ban hai ... toh mere glasses bhi Ray-Ban hi honge na
englishDialogue: Everything related to me is banned in the world ... hence my glasses should also be Ray-Ban

dialogue: Hollywood ke alava main porn dekhna pasand karta hoon ... kahani is mein bhi nahi hoti, kahani us mein bhi nahi hoti ... action zaroor hota hai
englishDialogue: Other than Hollywood, I like to watch watch porn ... as there's no story in either of them ... but yes, there's definitely action

dialogue: Desh naam se nahi, logon se banta hai
englishDialogue: A country develops due to its people, and not due to its name

dialogue: If everything is coming your way then you're in the wrong lane
englishDialogue: If everything is coming your way then you're in the wrong lane

dialogue: Umeed pe nahi ... jugaad pe duniya kayam hai
englishDialogue: Not on hope ... the world survives on hacking

dialogue: Yakeen ke chakke pe toh duniya ghoomti hai ... maano toh mitti mein khazana hai, na maano toh khazane mein mitti
englishDialogue: The world spins on the wheel of belief ... if you believe then there's treasure in the dust, if you don't then there's dust in the treasure

dialogue: Saath na rehne ke bahut saare bahane ban jaate hai ... par saath rehne ka bas ek bahana bahut hai ... pata hai kyun ... pyar
englishDialogue: You can find many excuses for not living together ... but you need only one excuse for living together ... and you know why ... because of love

dialogue: Pant pe gira pani aur phisli huyi jawani bada badnaam karti hai
englishDialogue: Water on your pants and out of control youth can dishonour you

dialogue: India mein guest aur pest aise hi kabhi bhi kahin pe bhi aa jaate hai
englishDialogue: In India guest and pest can come anytime and anywhere

dialogue: India Pakistan mein biwi shohar ke bare mein agar itna jaante honge, toh phir woh biwi shohar nahi honge ... Karan aur Johar honge
englishDialogue: In India and Pakistan if a husband and wife know a lot about each other, then they must not be husband and wife ... they must be Karan and Johar

dialogue: Rishton ki mehak bhi le udhe paad ... ab baap pehda ho rahe hai beton ke baad
englishDialogue: A fart can carry away the fragrance of relationships ... nowadays fathers are being born after their sons

dialogue: Bal se kiya hua kaam balaatkar hota hai
englishDialogue: Anything done with force is like a rape

dialogue: Tere liye kaam karte karte logon ka paseena nikla ... aur tu toh bahut bada kameena nikla ... tune toh bola tha tu izzat dega ... lekin kya pata tha tu saala hamari bhi le lega
englishDialogue: People sweated a lot while they worked for you ... but you turned out to be a big rascal ... you had said that you'll give respect ... but who knew that you'll get us in trouble as well

dialogue: Tu shaitaan ki aulaad hai, gadhe da bateeja hai ... tere maa baap ki galti ka nateeja hai
englishDialogue: You're a child of the devil, a nephew of the donkey ... you're the result of a mistake that your parents made

dialogue: Buzurgon ki paad toh bachon ke liye aashirwad samaan hoti hai
englishDialogue: The fart of elders is like blessings for the young ones

dialogue: Bache toh mitti ke khilone hote hai ... kaske pakdo na toh toot jaate hai
englishDialogue: Children are like toys made from clay ... if you hold them tight then they'll break

dialogue: Arre sharam hai toh yaad kar apne vaade ... kutte, kamine, sovar ke pyaade
englishDialogue: If you have any shame then remember your promises ... you're a dog, rascal and a pig

dialogue: Municipality ke nal se pani aaye na aaye ... inki aankhon se behna shuru ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Whether the municipality tap pours water or not ... there's always water flowing from her eyes

dialogue: Christmas mein sab log bolte hai na Santa aayega, Santa aayega ... sabko pata hai ghanta aayega
englishDialogue: In Christmas everyone says that Santa Claus will come ... but everyone knows that no one will come

dialogue: Jab God ki marzi hoti hai ... toh cheezon mein logic nahi sirf magic hota hai
englishDialogue: When it comes to the wishes of God ... then there's no logic in things, there's just magic

dialogue: Jis tarah dehle ke pehle nehla aata hai ... vaise hi guru ke pehle chela aata hai
englishDialogue: Like 9 comes before 10 ... just like that a pupil comes before his teacher

dialogue: Har Diwali bonus nahi hota ... har pimple pus nahi hota ... aur har cross Star Plus nahi hota
englishDialogue: Every Diwali doesn't have a bonus ... every pimple doesn't have pus ... and every cross doesn't mean it's the Star Plus channel

dialogue: Duniya mein ek hi cheez pe vishvas kiya jaata hai ... woh hai andhvishvas
englishDialogue: There's only one thing that people have faith for in this world ... and that's blind faith

dialogue: Bhoot hai toh bhootni hai ... sambhar hai toh chutney hai ... zyada phailoge toh pant phatni hai
englishDialogue: If there's a ghost then there's a witch ... if there's lentil soup then there's chutney ... if you spread a lot then your pant will tear apart

dialogue: Subah subah jab koi bole mujhe apna bana lo ... toh samajh jao ki waqt aa gaya hai ki Godrej hair dye kholo, gholo aur laga lo
englishDialogue: In the morning when someone says to make them your dear one ... then understand that the time has come to open Godrej hair dye, mix it and apply it

dialogue: Iski madad karna toh aisa hai ... ke apne pairon pe axe, black money pe tax aur interval mein hi climax
englishDialogue: Helping him is like ... hitting an axe on your own leg, paying tax on black money and seeing the climax in the interval itself

dialogue: Har ladki hai na apne hone wale mein father figure dhoondti hai ... figure uske paas hai, father tu hai
englishDialogue: Every girl searches for a father figure in her to be partner ... she has the figure and you're the father

dialogue: Main tumhari girlfriend nahi hoon ... par I can be your half girlfriend
englishDialogue: I'm not your girlfriend ... but I can be your half girlfriend

dialogue: Kuch cheezein aisi toot'ti hai ki unka doobara judna possible nahi hota ... sirf daraarein reh jaati hai
englishDialogue: Some things break in such a way that, you can't reconnect them ... only rifts are left behind

dialogue: Hamari amma bachpan se sikhayi ... haaro mat ... haar ko harao
englishDialogue: My mother has taught me this since childhood ... don't lose ... instead defeat the loss

dialogue: When the heart breaks, awaaz toh nahi hoti ... but ek broken heart ko doosre broken heart ka awaaz always sunai deta hai
englishDialogue: When the heart breaks, then there's no sound ... but a broken heart can always hear the sound of a broken heart

dialogue: Wajah milta nahi hai, dhoondna padta hai ... aur dimaag se nahi, dil se poochiye ... aur jab dil wajah dhoond lega toh saara duniya aapko aapke lakshya tak pahuchane mein jutt jayega
englishDialogue: You don't just find a reason, you have to search for it ... ask your heart and not your mind for it ... and once your heart finds that reason then the entire world will get together behind uniting you with your goal

dialogue: Agar you playing, may be you losing ... magar agar you running away, toh you pakka losing
englishDialogue: If you play, may be you'll lose ... but if you run away, then you'll definitely lose

dialogue: Koi sach ka sahara leta hai toh koi jhooth ka ... maine ittefaq ka sahara liya
englishDialogue: Someone takes the help of truth and someone takes the help of lies ... I took the help of coincidence

dialogue: Khud ko blame karne se dard sirf badta hai ... kam nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: By blaming yourself the pain only increases ... it doesn't decrease

dialogue: Character ho tum ... A1
englishDialogue: You're a character ... of A1 quality

dialogue: Jitna dhokla, thepla te fafda khana hai khao ... par meri zindagi to jao
englishDialogue: Eat as much snacks and fritters as you want ... but go away from my life

dialogue: Jalte ghar ko dekhne walon phoos ka chappar aapka hai ... aag ke peeche tezz hawa, aage muqadar aapka hai
englishDialogue: People who look at burning houses, remember that your roof is also made from grass ... there's a gust of wind behind the fire, hence the destiny ahead will be yours

dialogue: Jungle mein sirf ek sher hota hai ... aur shehar mein sirf ek khalifa ... baki joh hote hai woh sirf hote hai
englishDialogue: There can only be one tiger in a jungle ... and there can only be one successor in a city ... everyone else is just useless

dialogue: Sirf hungama khada karna mera maqsad nahi, mera maqsad nahi meri koshish hai yeh soorat badalni chahiye ... aaj yeh deewaar parde ki tarah hilne lagi, sharat yeh thi lekin ki buniyaad hilni chahiye ... meere seene mein na sahi, tumhare seene mein sahi ... ho kahin bhi aag, lekin aag jalni chahiye
englishDialogue: It's not my intention to just make a blast, it's my attempt that the faces must change ... today this wall is shaking like a curtain, but the bet was to shake the foundation ... if not in my heart, then atleast in your heart ... it doesn't matter where the fire is, but the fire must keep on burning

dialogue: Mutthi mein band hai maut ka khel ... dekh raha hai tujhe aasmaan se sohail
englishDialogue: The game of death is locked in your fist ... the stars are staring at you from the sky

dialogue: Yeh shehar jitna zameen ke upar hai na ... utna hi zameen ke neeche hai
englishDialogue: The height this city has above the ground ... it is that much deeper beneath the ground as well

dialogue: Talab ki raah mein kuch paane se pehle kuch khona padta hai ... bade saude nazar mein ho toh chota hona padta hai
englishDialogue: In the path of finding something you have to lose something before you find something ... if you have big deals in sight then you have to become small

dialogue: Hum jis din apni aukaat par aaye na ... by god us din tumhare adab ki pudiya banakar tumhare pichwade mein ghused denge ... na paadein niklengi na huggi
englishDialogue: The day I come to my skin ... by god that day I'll turn your respect into a packet and I'll push it up your a*s ... you won't be able to fart and neither will you be able to shit

dialogue: Is baar angrezi mein Barack Obama ki maa bhi tumhe fail nahi kar sakti
englishDialogue: This time in English even Barack Obama's mother won't be able to fail you

dialogue: Bekaar aadmi kuch kiya kar ... kapde udherkar siya kar
englishDialogue: Hey useless person, please do something ... tear the clothes and stitch them again

dialogue: Tumhara yeh mendak sa mooh dekhkar hum samajh gaye the ke tum bahut phudkoge
englishDialogue: Right when I saw your frog like face, I understood that you'll jump a lot

dialogue: Bina kursi ke neta ... bina superhit ke abhineta ... aur bina chamber ke vakeel ki koi izzat nahi hai guru
englishDialogue: A politician without a seat ... an actor without a superhit ... and a lawyer without a chamber, don't get any respect

dialogue: Acchai aur acche log ek roshni ki tarah hai ... apne aap mein hi ujaala hai ... kehne ki zaroorat nahi hoti ... dikh jaate hai
englishDialogue: Goodness and good people are like the light ... they have brightness within themselves ... you don't have to say it ... you can just see it

dialogue: Main tumhe machli doon khane ke liye ... pet toh tumhara bhar jayega ... lekin agar main tumhe machli pakadna sikha doon ... toh zindagi bhar bhook se nahi tarsogi
englishDialogue: If I give you a fish to eat ... then it'll fill your stomach ... but if I teach you how to catch a fish ... then you'll never go hungry in life

dialogue: Kuch log janam lekar apne liye naseeb le aate hai ... lekin Julie ka janam doosron ke liye naseeb tha
englishDialogue: Some people bring their destiny with them when they're born ... but Julie's birth was destiny for others

dialogue: Raja ki izzat hai na koi Saundarya sabun ki tikiya nahi hai ... joh tu gis-giske dho-dhoke phek daale
englishDialogue: Raja's dignity is not like a bar of Saundarya soap ... that you can scrub it as needed and then throw it away

dialogue: Joh main bolta hoon, woh main karta hoon ... aur joh main nahi bolta hoon, woh main WhatsApp karta hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever I say, I do that ... and whatever I don't say, I simply WhatsApp that

dialogue: Duniya ka sabse amir insaan bhi na maa baap ke bina gareeb hota hai
englishDialogue: Even the richest person of the world is poor without a mother and a father

dialogue: College mein aata hoon lekin lecture mein nahi aata hoon ... six pack mein aata hoon lekin family pack mein nahi aata hoon ... bus mein aata hoon lekin kisi ke bas mein nahi
englishDialogue: I go to the college, but I don't attend the lecture ... I come with six pack, but not as a family pack ... I come in a bus, but no one can control me

dialogue: Life mein main sirf do cheezon ki izzat karta hoon ... ek maa aur doosra khana ... kyun ki ek humein janam deti hai aur doosri humein zinda rakhti hai
englishDialogue: I only respect two things in life ... one is a mother and other is food ... because one gives us birth and the other keep us alive

dialogue: Pehli line mein panga ... doosri line mein main nanga
englishDialogue: You want to fight with me in your first line ... and you want to make me naked in your second line

dialogue: Iski pehli line aafat thi ... lekin last line mein rahat thi
englishDialogue: His first line was a disaster ... but there was peace in his last line

dialogue: Dil mein aata hoon samajh mein nahi ... pant mein aata hoon shirt mein nahi ... cycle pe aata hoon gaadi mein nahi ... aur sun langoth mein aata hoon shorts mein nahi
englishDialogue: I am in the heart, but I am hard to understand ... I come wearing a pant, but not a shirt ... I come on a bicycle, and not in a car ... and listen I come wearing a loincloth, but not shorts

dialogue: Pehle line mein honesty ... doosre line mein molesty
englishDialogue: Honesty in the first line ... and molesty in the second line

dialogue: Salamat hai har woh bete ka papa ... jiske saath hai Ganpati Bappa
englishDialogue: Every son's father is safe ... whoever has Lord Ganesha by their side

dialogue: Maana door se dekha toh moongphali hai ... paas aakar dekh tera Baahubali hai
englishDialogue: I agree that he looks like a groundnut from a distance ... but go close and see as he's your strong and brave man

dialogue: Door se dekha toh Alia Bhatt ... paas aakar dekha toh Mahesh Bhatt
englishDialogue: When I saw from a distance it seemed like Alia Bhatt ... but when I went closer it turned out to be Mahesh Bhatt

dialogue: Ek baar aagad paachad sahi dikhe na ... toh ladka aagad paachad ghoomta rahega
englishDialogue: If your front and back looks great ... then the boy will roam in front of you and behind you

dialogue: Uska bank balance itna hai ki bank bhi balance nahi kar paata hai
englishDialogue: He has so much bank balance that even the bank isn't able to balance that

dialogue: (Bhagwan har jagah nahi hota hai) ... Issi liye toh usne maa banayi hai
englishDialogue: (God is not everywhere) ... That's why he has created a mother

dialogue: Galat aur bahut galat mein se chun'na ho ... toh aap kya chunenge?
englishDialogue: If you have to pick between something wrong and something very wrong ... then what will you select?

dialogue: Insaan ki raakh se uski kundli nikaal leta hoon
englishDialogue: I can define the horoscope of a person even from his ashes

dialogue: Jab bhi koi aur mere liye mera kaam karta hai ... tab bhi mujhe bahut gussa aata hai
englishDialogue: When someone else does my work for me ... then I feel very angry

dialogue: Bande ko na hard working nahi ... smart working hona chahiye
englishDialogue: A person should not be hard working ... he should be smart working

dialogue: Agar tum logon ka pyar sacha hai toh woh zaroor madad karega ... woh joh soote huye parindon ko pedh se neeche nahi girne deta ... woh apne bandon ko besahara kaise chhodega
englishDialogue: If your love is true then God will definitely help you guys ... when he doesn't let the sleeping birds fall from a tree ... then how can he leave his devotees alone

dialogue: Aapke yeh Bernard Shaw wale idea jisne maan liye na ... usko toh Waheguru bhi nahi bacha sakte
englishDialogue: The one who listens to these Bernard Shaw ideas of yours ... even God won't be able to save him

dialogue: Agar tum dono ne pehle din hi jhoote pati ka patta pehan liya na ... toh sari zindagi bow-bow bhi karte rahoge na ... toh meow-meow hi sunai dena hai
englishDialogue: If both of you wear the tag of a lying husband on the first day itself ... then even if you bark bow-bow like a dog for your entire life ... then to it'll sound meow-meow like a cat

dialogue: Jab do log ek saath pyar mein rehte hai ... toh aadat pad jaati hai ek doosre ki ... aur waqt aane pad na aadat chhut'ti hai na pyar
englishDialogue: When two people live together being in love ... then you get habituated with each other ... and when the time comes you can't leave the habit nor your love

dialogue: (Yeh joh hum kar rahe hai, yeh theek hai) ... Ghor paap hai ... lekin yeh paap na baar baar karne se dhul jaata hai
englishDialogue: (What we are doing, is that alright) ... It's a big sin ... but committing this sin again and again, wipes it

dialogue: Imaandari ke award mein sabse zyada baimaani hoti hai
englishDialogue: In the award for honesty, there's a lot of cheating involved

dialogue: Mere se pehle bahut pehle bhi ek Newton tha ... padhai karte waqt kabhi uski baat samajh nahi aayi ... par ab kaam karte waqt aa rahi hai ... ke jab tak kuch nahi badloge na dost, kuch nahi badlega
englishDialogue: Long before me there was another Newton ... I never understood what he meant while I was studying ... but now while working I've understood it ... that until you yourself don't change, nothing is going to change

dialogue: Aap natural tarike se apne imaandari ki kamai ka kaam karte jayiye ... desh pragati khud ba khud karta chala jayega
englishDialogue: You keep doing your honest work in a natural way ... and the country will keep progressing by itself

dialogue: Mumbai you're killing me ... tu bhi andar se khokli hai ... main bhi
englishDialogue: Mumbai you're killing me ... you're empty from within ... and so am I

dialogue: Himmat toh josh mein aakar koi bhi dikha sakta hai ... par sabar se kaam lena yeh har kisi ke bas ki baat nahi hai ... aur yahi fark hai ek amateur aur ek professional ke beech
englishDialogue: Anyone can show their courage in the heat of the moment ... but not everyone is capable of handling the situation with patience ... and that shows the difference between an amateur and a professional

dialogue: Asli bahadur woh nahi hote joh camera ke peeche sawaal poochte hai ... asli bahaduri woh dikhate hai joh camera ke samne aakar sach bolne ki himmat rakhte hai
englishDialogue: People who ask questions behind a camera are not brave people ... instead people who have the courage to speak the truth in front of the camera are brave people

dialogue: Kya success ki seedi par upar aur upar chadte jaana hi sab kuch hai ... aisi success ka kya faida joh hamare apno ko humse door karde ... unko apne saath leke chalo toh aur bhi maza aayega
englishDialogue: Is climbing the ladder of success higher and higher everything ... what's the use of that success which takes us farther from our dear ones ... take them with you and you'll enjoy it even more

dialogue: Meri aadhi zindagi Mumbai ke roads pe kat'ti hai ... average commuting time Mumbai Dubai ki flight se zyada ... aur turbulence full
englishDialogue: I spend half my life on the roads of Mumbai ... my average commuting time is more than a Mumbai Dubai flight ... and with full turbulence

dialogue: Is saal main seedhi savitri se tedhi savitri banungi
englishDialogue: This year I'm going to change from a simple woman to a wicked woman

dialogue: Yahan supari deke kisi ko jaan se maar dalna, ek decent ladka dhoondne se zyada aasaan hai
englishDialogue: Here getting someone killed with a contract, is more easier than finding a decent guy

dialogue: The trouble is you think you've got the time
englishDialogue: The trouble is you think you've got the time

dialogue: Mohabbat kis chiddiya ka naam hai, humein bhi batana ... bhor saver woh kabhi gungunaye, toh humein bhi sunana ... dikh jaye toh dikhana ... kisi roz kabhi aangan aaye, behla phuslake rok toh lenge ... mishri ki daaliyan apne haathon se uski chonch mein denge ... sikha denge usse hamara naam daurana ... seekh lenge bina parwah kiye udh jaana ... suna hai kaante pe dil khop gulaabon mein rakht bhar deta hai ... jaan dekar dil mein ghar kar leta hai ... neend chura churake, chain jodh jodhke, ek gharaunda banata hai, aahon ke jhule jhulata hai ... phir jab do din sau saal se guzarte hai hum patjhad se bhikarte hai ... woh pinjre mein band chhod, rooh ko todh marodh kisi aur chajje pe ek naya geet gaata hai ... dana tum daalo woh kisi aur ko phasata hai
englishDialogue: Which bird is like love, tell me that ... early morning when he sings, then let me know ... if you see him, then let me know ... someday when he comes to my courtyard, I'll coax and stop him ... I'll put the sugar cubes in his mouth using my own hands ... I'll teach him how to repeat my name ... and I'll learn from him how to fly away being carefree ... I've heard that he pricks his heart with thorns and fills the flowers with his blood ... he sacrifices his life to make some room in our heart ... he steals our sleep, he builds peace and makes a house where he swings with sighs ... later when a couple days pass like a hundred years, then we disperse like the autumn season ... he breaks the cage, he twists and turns his soul, and then sings some new song on a new terrace ... you give him the food and he falls for someone else

dialogue: Ab tak sab khayali tha, abhi abhi toh jaage re ... tu hi sach, jhuk gaya tere aage re ... ab tu na chhod mirza ko, tujh bin jholi khaali re ... O sahiban ejire ki chhot hai laagi re
englishDialogue: Until now everything was just an imagination, I've just now woken up ... you're the truth and I've bowed down in front of you ... now you don't let go your lover as I'm empty without you ... hey beloved, I'm injured from the wound of my heart

dialogue: Rab ne awaaz bhakshi hai ... awaaz nahi, mehar hai ... soch badalne ki taqat hai tum mein
englishDialogue: God has given you this voice ... it's not a voice, it's a blessing ... you have the power to change how people think

dialogue: Everything is fair in love and war ... love is over ... now war begins
englishDialogue: Everything is fair in love and war ... love is over ... now war begins

dialogue: Yeh ishq nahi aasaan bas itna samajh lijiye ... ek aag ka dariya hai aur wahin bhasma ho jaana hai
englishDialogue: Just understand that love isn't easy ... it's like a sea of fire and one has to burn to ashes in that

dialogue: Agar shaadi se pehle tum itni tension logi na ... toh shaadi ho na ho ... sugar aur BP dono ho jayegi
englishDialogue: If you take on so much tension before getting married ... then whether you get married or not ... you'll definitely suffer from diabetes and blood pressure

dialogue: Zindagi mein kabhi teen cheezon ko ignore mat karo ... ek toh foreign ka call, doosra UK ka Hall, aur teesra jhadte huye baal
englishDialogue: In life never ignore these three things ... first an international call, second the UK Hall, and third hair that's falling apart

dialogue: Itihaas mein hum ho na ho ... lekin Hindustan ke bhavishya mein hum zaroor honge
englishDialogue: Whether we become a part of history or not ... but we'll definitely be there in the future of India

dialogue: Jeet ek aisi cheez hai joh khud chalkar tumhare paas nahi aayegi ... usse ladkar haasil karna padta hai
englishDialogue: Victory is something that won't come to you by itself ... you'll have to fight for it to attain it

dialogue: Kya hai sainik hona ... aaj hamare desh ka kisaan kheton mein logon ke liye anaaj ugha raha hai ... bina kisi fikr ke, kyun ... kyun ki usse pata hai ki seema par hum khade hai ... maa har subah khushi khushi apne bachon ko school chhodkar aati hai ... uske mann mein koi dar nahi hota, kyun ... kyun ki usse pata hai ki seema par hum khade hai ... is desh ka har ek insaan, har roz kadi mehnat karta hai ... apne pariwar ke bhavishya ke liye ... apne bachon ki tarakki ke liye ... usse unki suraksha ki koi chinta nahi hoti, kyun ... kyun ki usse pata hai ki seema par hum khade hai aur rahenge ... is bharose ko nibhana, yeh hota hai sainik hona
englishDialogue: What does it mean to be a soldier ... today the farmer of our country is growing food for our people ... without any tensions, why is that ... because he knows that we're protecting the border ... a mother happily drops her children to the school ... she has no fear in her heart, why is that ... because she knows that we're protecting the border ... every citizen of this country works hard everyday ... for the future of his family ... for the well being of his children ... he doesn't worry about their safety, why is that .... because he knows that we're protecting the border and we'll keep protecting it ... fulfilling this confidence is what is called to be a soldier

dialogue: Jung joh hai na, shaheed hokar nahi ... dushman ko shaheed karke jeeti jaati hai
englishDialogue: You don't win a war by becoming a martyr ... you win it by making your enemy a martyr

dialogue: Yakeen ek tubelight ki tarah hota hai ... der se jalta hai ... lekin jab jalta hai, toh full light kar deta hai
englishDialogue: Faith is like a tubelight ... it takes time to light up ... but once it lights up, then it illuminates everything around us

dialogue: Agar insaan ke dil mein yakeen ho ... toh woh chataan bhi hila sakta hai
englishDialogue: If a person has confidence in his heart ... then he can even move a mountain

dialogue: Kisi bhi insaan ke prati dushmani, khud ke prati dushmani hoti hai ... is liye dushman ko bhi apna dost maan lo
englishDialogue: Enmity against any person is like enmity against yourself ... that's why you should make your enemy as your friend

dialogue: Maa kehti thi ... English tubelight jaisi English khopdi hai meri ... joh aayega, dhere dhere aayega ... magar aayega pakka, bharpoor
englishDialogue: My mother used to say that ... my brain is like a English tubelight ... whatever you'll learn, you'll learn slowly only ... but you'll learn it perfectly and completely

dialogue: Hum sab system ka hissa hai ... system decide karta hai, apun follow karta hai
englishDialogue: We are all part of the system ... the system decides, and we follow it

dialogue: Tum log society ka kachra hai ... main society ka jamadar
englishDialogue: You people are the trash of the society ... and I am the cleaner of the society

dialogue: Senior officers hai na mausam ki tarah hote hain ... badalte rehte hai
englishDialogue: Senior officers are like the weather ... they keep changing

dialogue: Zindagi ka har pal aakhri samajhkar jeena chahiye ... tab zindagi ka asli maza aata hai
englishDialogue: You should live every moment of life as if it's the last moment ... only then you realize the real fun of life

dialogue: Kafan mein jeb nahi hoti, kabar mein safe nahi hoti aur maut ke farishtey rishwat nahi lete
englishDialogue: A shroud doesn't have a pocket, a grave doesn't have a safe and the messengers of death don't take bribe

dialogue: Aaj kal ke rishtey is ice cube ki tarah hai ... paani mein gire aur apna wajood kho behte
englishDialogue: The relationships these days are like this ice cube ... they lose their existence the moment they fall in the water

dialogue: Sarphire hi itihaas likhte hai ... samajhdar usse padhte hai
englishDialogue: Crazy people create history ... and the smart people just read it

dialogue: Bade khudgarz hote hai hum ... jisse pasand karte hai uski buraiyan bhool jaate hai ... jisse nafrat karte hai uski achaiyan bhool jaate hai
englishDialogue: We're very selfish ... we forget the bad habits of the ones whom we like ... and we forget the good habits of the ones whom we hate

dialogue: Darr ko apna bana lo ... dost ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Make fear as your dear one ... it'll become your friend

dialogue: Hamare bhoot ka koi bhavishya nahi hota ... lekin woh bhoot hamare vartamaan mein zinda rehta hai
englishDialogue: Our past doesn't have a future ... but still that past stays alive in our present

dialogue: Nobody is virgin in this world ... yahan tak ki kudrat bhi virgin nahi hai ... updar baadal ek doosre se chhedkhani karte hai ... neeche hum bheeg jaate hai ... kehte hai baarish ho gayi
englishDialogue: Nobody is virgin in this world ... not even nature is a virgin ... the clouds tease each other in the skies ... and we get drenched down here ... and we say that it's raining

dialogue: Hamare beete huye kal ka koi shareer nahi hota ... lekin uski maujoodgi ka ehsaas hamare aaj ko jinjhoor deta hai
englishDialogue: Our past doesn't have a body ... but still the feeling of its presence disturbs our present

dialogue: Jab kisi ko jaan'na hai, kisi ki chahat ko pechaan'na hai ... zaroori hai ki pehle khud ko pehchaano ... varna chalte raho zindagi bhar rail ki patri ki tarah ... milne ki koi gunjaish hi nahi
englishDialogue: When you want to know someone, you want to understand their love ... then it's important to understand yourself first ... or else keep walking like the railway tracks for your entire life ... and there won't be a chance that you guys will meet

dialogue: Zindagi barsaat ki sadak ki tarah hoti hai ... kabhi phislan, kabhi thokar
englishDialogue: Life is like a road in the rains ... sometimes you slip and sometimes you fall

dialogue: Phool kabhi bhawron se, kinare kabhi leharon se, aur patte kabhi hawa ko dawat nahi dete ... unka toh choli daaman ka saath rehta hai
englishDialogue: The flowers don't invite the bees, the shores don't invite the waves, and the leaves don't invite the breeze ... they're always made for each other

dialogue: Bheek mein mila pyar dard zyada deta hai ... khushi kam
englishDialogue: The love that you get by begging for it, gives more pain ... and less happiness

dialogue: Shareer ki seemayein hoti hai, beemaar hota hai, thak jaata hai, bhook lagti hai, sota hai ... janam leta hai, kuch pal yahan guzarta hai ... mar jaata hai ... chahat ka in cheezon se koi rishta nahi, koi sambandh nahi ... chahat ki na umar hoti hai, na maut ... passion is immortal
englishDialogue: A body has boundaries, it falls sick, it gets tired, it feels hungry, it sleeps ... it's born, it spends some time here ... and then dies ... but love has no relationship and no connection with all this ... love doesn't have any age, nor does it die ... passion is immortal

dialogue: Kisi ka dost, kisi ka raazdaar, kisi ka humdard ... duniya mein har koi kisi na kisi ka kuch hota hi hai
englishDialogue: Someone is a friend, someone is a secret bearer, someone is a soulmate ... everyone in this world is something to someone

dialogue: Shaq kabhi marta nahi
englishDialogue: Suspicion never dies

dialogue: Corporate companies ka toh bas ek hi aim hai ... nichhod dalo sabko ... pachees saal ki umar se khoon choosna shuru karti hai yeh companies ... bas market aur target ... shubah utho toh market, sone jaao toh target ... screen taakte taakte umar guzar rahi hai ... zindagi ke khoobsurat lamhe guzre jaa rahe hai ... na koi rishta, na koi apna ... dost hai toh bas tension
englishDialogue: Corporate companies only have one aim ... to squeeze everyone ... these companies start sucking blood since the age of 25 ... there's just market and target ... in the morning there's market and when you sleep there's target ... life passes by as we just stare at the screen ... the beautiful moments of life just keep passing ... there's no relationship, and no dear one ... only tension is our friend

dialogue: Raah kaunsi jaaun main ... chaurahe pe lut'ta cheer ... pyaade se pitt gaya wazir, pyaade se pitt gaya wazir ... chalo aakhri chaal ke chaal koi bichaun main ... sapna janama aur mar gaya ... basant ritu main baagh jadh gaya ... do din mile udhaar mein ... ghaate ke vyapar mein ... chaurahe pe lut'ta cheer ... pyaade se pitt gaya wazir
englishDialogue: Which path should I walk on ... people are being robbed at the crossroads ... the queen lost to the pawn, the queen lost to the pawn ... make your last move as I plan mine ... a dream was born and then died ... the garden got ruined in the monsoon season ... we've got a couple of days to live ... in this business full of losses ... people are being robbed at the crossroads ... the queen lost to the pawn

dialogue: Tum hamesha jeetne waale ghodhe par hi paisa lagate ho ... aur main jis ghodhe par paisa lagata hoon ... usse jeetna hi padta hai
englishDialogue: You always bet on the winning horse ... but the horse that I bet on ... has to win

dialogue: Kafan ka kapda aur dafan ki zameen ki tayaari kar lena ... kyun ki jis din woh mila mujhe ... us din woh andhar nahi jayega ... seedha upar jayega
englishDialogue: Keep the cloth for the shroud and the land for the burial ready ... because the day I get him ... that day he won't go inside ... he will go straight up (to God)

dialogue: Billi ke nakhoon badh jaane se ... billi sher nahi ban jaati
englishDialogue: When the nails of the cat grow ... the cat does not become a tiger

dialogue: Hum tere pairon ke neeche ki zameen itni garam kar denge ... ki tere jooton tak mein chaale padh jayenge
englishDialogue: I will heat the ground under your feet so much ... that even your shoes will have blisters

dialogue: Aurat pe haath uthana ... namard ki pehli nishaani hai
englishDialogue: Hitting a woman ... is the first sign of an impotent man

dialogue: Waqt hai ... waqt se pehle sambhal jao
englishDialogue: There is time ... correct yourself before the time ends

dialogue: Bahut pehle maine seekha tha ki kisi bhi jagah duty join karo ... toh ek din pehle join karo ... asliyat bahar aa jati hai
englishDialogue: Long ago I had learnt that wherever you join duty ... join a day earlier ... you'll come to know the truth

dialogue: Aaj ke baad dubara koi aaisi harkat ki na ... toh yeh haath khane ke layak toh kya ... dhone ke layak bhi nahi rahega
englishDialogue: From now on if you do this again ... then your hands will not be capable for eating ... and neither for washing

dialogue: Kahi baar choti choti nadaaniyo se nuksaan bada ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Many a times small small mistakes cause a big loss

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi criminal ko pakadne ke liye ... no entry mein ghusna padta hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes to catch a criminal ... you have enter in a no entry

dialogue: Chup chap chala ja yahan se ... varna tere right ke saath saath left thopda bhi chaupat kar doonga
englishDialogue: Go away from here quietly ... otherwise along with your right face I will smash your left face also

dialogue: Pyar sirf ek baar kiya ja sakta hai ... aur uske liye har kisi ko aazmane ki koi zaroorat nahi hoti ... sirf dil ki awaaz sunni hoti hai
englishDialogue: You can only fall in love once ... and for that you don't need to try everyone ... you just have to listen to the voice of your heart

dialogue: Bahut jala hoon main is akelepan ki aag mein ... aur tumhare liye main sari duniya ko jala sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I have burnt a lot in the fire of loneliness ... and for you I can burn the entire world

dialogue: There is nothing better than you ... and for you I want nothing to be better than me
englishDialogue: There is nothing better than you ... and for you I want nothing to be better than me

dialogue: Plan yeh hai ki koi plan nahi hai
englishDialogue: The plan is that there is no plan

dialogue: Indian aadmi jahan bhi rahe, kuch bhi kare ... hamesha Indian hi rahega
englishDialogue: Wherever a Indian man stays, whatever he does ... he will always remain Indian

dialogue: Pyar, pyar hota hai ... jis mein vishvas hota hai, passion hota hai, wafaa hoti hai ... aur yeh woh wafaa hai joh aadmi ko bewafaa nahi hone deti
englishDialogue: Love is love ... in which there is belief, there is passion, there is faith ... and this is the faith that stops a man from becoming unfaithful

dialogue: Aadmi ke pass dimag ho na ... toh woh apna dard bhi bech sakta hai
englishDialogue: If a man has brains ... then he can sell his sorrow also

dialogue: Aurat nadi ke samaan hoti hai ... yadi apne kinaron ki maryada mein rahe, toh lati hai khushali ... aur yadi apne kinaron ki maryada todh de, toh lati hai vinash, barbadi
englishDialogue: A woman is like a river ... if she stays within the limits of its shores, then she brings happiness ... and if she crosses the limits of its shores, then she brings wrecking, destruction

dialogue: Jab pati par kisi bala ka saaya par jata hai ... tab patni hi uski nazar utarti hai
englishDialogue: When a troublesome shadow falls on a husband ... then it is the wife who protects him

dialogue: Na main shayar hoon, na shayar ka bhatija hoon ... main toh jhi apne maa baap ke manoranjan ka natija hoon
englishDialogue: I am not a poet, neither am I related to a poet ... I am the outcome of my parents entertainment

dialogue: Kya figure hai yaar ... na ek millimeter idhar na ek millimeter udhar ... upar waale ne bhi cold coffee peete hue banaya hoga yeh garma garam piece
englishDialogue: What a figure she has ... not a millimeter here and not a millimeter there ... God must have made this hot piece while drinking cold coffee

dialogue: Pyas ab pani ho jaye, katra katra ghulab ho jaye .... tum apne haathon se joh pila do mujhko, toh mineral water bhi sharab ho jaye
englishDialogue: The thirst may now become water, every drop may now become a rose ... and if you make me drink from your hands, then even mineral water will become alcohol

dialogue: Kutton ke bhaunkane se haathi ki chaal pe koi farak nahi padta
englishDialogue: Elephants are not bothered by barking dogs

dialogue: Khuredne se zakhm bharte nahi hai ... hare ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: By scratching wounds don't fill up ... they become even more worse

dialogue: Main ab tak jee raha tha apne bhai ke liye ... aur ab jee raha hoon uski maut ka badla lene ke liye
englishDialogue: Until now I was living for my brother ... and now I'm living to take the revenge of his death

dialogue: Yeh shehar bhale hi chain ki neend soye ... par aaj ke baad tu kabhi chain ki neend nahi soyega
englishDialogue: Even if this city sleeps peacefully ... but from today you will never sleep peacefully

dialogue: Jab tak main tum logon ko adalat mein phaasi ki sazaa na dilwa doon ... maut bhi mera kuch nahi bighaad payegi
englishDialogue: Until I get you guys the death penalty in court ... till then even death can't do anything to me

dialogue: Agar hum mein himmat hai, agar hum mein hausla hai ... toh dushman hamara kuch nahi bhigaad sakta ... jism tootte, lekin hausla na tootte
englishDialogue: If you have the courage, if you have the morale ... then the enemy can't do anything to you ... the body may break, but don't let your morale break

dialogue: Tum mera jism todh sakte ho ... meri himmat nahin todh sakte ... mera yakeen nahin todh sakte
englishDialogue: You can break my body ... but you cannot break my courage ... you cannot break my trust
