dialogue: Waqt ne tumhe hamesha dhokha diya hai ... lekin is baar woh tumhare saath chalega
englishDialogue: Time has always betrayed you ... but this time it will be with you

dialogue: Mere rules koi nahi todh sakta ... main bhi nahi
englishDialogue: No one can break my rules ... not even me

dialogue: Tezzi goli mein nahi ... chalane waale mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: Speed is not in the bullet ... it is in the shooter

dialogue: Agar tum chor na hote to hum zaroor dost hote
englishDialogue: If you were not a thief we would have surely been friends

dialogue: Joh bhi karenge ... style se karenge
englishDialogue: Whatever we'll do ... we'll do it in style

dialogue: Nothing is permanent ... na tum, na main, na plan, na time
englishDialogue: Nothing is permanent ... neither you, neither me, neither the plan, neither the time

dialogue: Tumhari kismat badal rahi hai ... tum bhi badal jaoge
englishDialogue: Your destiny is changing ... you will also change

dialogue: Jail jaana meri kismat mein nahi hai
englishDialogue: Going to jail is not in my destiny

dialogue: Yes yes, thank you thank you, very ok very ok
englishDialogue: Yes yes, thank you thank you, very ok very ok

dialogue: Main criminals se baat nahin karta
englishDialogue: I don't talk to criminals

dialogue: Burai chahe jitni bhi aage chali jaye ... hamesha achchai se peeche rehti hai
englishDialogue: No matter how much ahead evil gets ... it always remains behind good

dialogue: Bahut jhankaar beat aadmi hai woh
englishDialogue: He is a very crazy guy

dialogue: Jahan the wahin hai, na koi izafa hai ... halaat yeh hai ki, na mazmoon hai na lifafa hai
englishDialogue: We are where we were, there is no increment ... the condition is such that, there is no paper and neither an envelope

dialogue: Apne paap maqsad se is kadar hath gaye ... phadna tha dushman ko, khud hi phat gaye
englishDialogue: Because of our sin we got so disturbed ... that we had to tear apart the enemy, but we ourselves got torn

dialogue: Bewakoof kahin ke yahi toh maar khate hai ... karne se pehle hi sab kuch bol dete hai ... aur hum kar dete hai ... pata bhi nahi chalta
englishDialogue: Fools lose just because of this ... they say everything before doing it ... and we do it ... and no one even comes to know

dialogue: Pyar waqt nahi hai ... joh agar guzar jaye toh vapas nahi aata
englishDialogue: Love is not time ... that once it passes, it doesn't come back

dialogue: Lamhon ko yaadein nahi ... yaadgar banate hai
englishDialogue: Don't make moments into memories ... but make them memorable

dialogue: Joh guzar gaya woh kal tha ... joh aane waala hai woh bhi kal hai ... faisla tumhe karna hai tum kis kal mein jeena chahte ho
englishDialogue: What has past was yesterday ... what is going to come is tomorrow ... and you have to decide in which one you want to live

dialogue: Tumhara dil roaming hai ... kyun ki tumhara roam roam tumhara dil hai
englishDialogue: Your heart is roaming around ... because every part of your body is your heart

dialogue: Har love story mein hamesha do naam hote hai ... lekin meri love story mein sirf ek hi naam hai ... mera
englishDialogue: Every love story has two names ... but in my love story there is only one name ... mine

dialogue: I've loved you like crazy ... now I am going to hate you like crazy
englishDialogue: I've loved you like crazy ... now I am going to hate you like crazy

dialogue: Ab tak tumpar marta tha ... ab tumhare liye marr mitna hai
englishDialogue: Until now I was madly in love with you ... now I am going to die for you

dialogue: Tujhe dene ke liye toh is duniya mein koi gaali bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: There is not even a single curse in this world that can be given to you

dialogue: Main maarta jaonga ... tu harta jayega
englishDialogue: I will keep on hitting ... and you will keep on losing

dialogue: Computer pe ungli marte marte tu mere se ungli kiya?
englishDialogue: By typing on the computer with your fingers, you fingered with me?

dialogue: Sitaron ki mehfil sajji hai, us mein ek hoor ek pari hai ... joh zindagi hamari hai, hum mein jaan se bhi pyari hai
englishDialogue: There is a party of stars and in that there is one beautiful fairy ... who is my life, and is more special to me than my life

dialogue: Ishq kare koi kisi se hum mein kya harz hai bhai ... nuksaan joh hamara hoga kaun karega bharpai
englishDialogue: Why would I be bothered if people are in love ... but if I'm at loss then who will pay for it

dialogue: Humne tumhare naam ki titli daboch li ... sab rang kayanat ke mutthi mein aa gaye
englishDialogue: I held a butterfly in your name ... and all the colours of the universe came into my hand

dialogue: Agar hota koi bhai ka beta toh woh hum mein kehta chacha ... aur agar bhai hi na ho toh aaya kahan se yeh bhatija
englishDialogue: If I had a brother who had a son then he would have called me uncle ... but since I don't have a brother then from where did this nephew come

dialogue: Is shehar ki khushboo woh bheeni bheeni raat ... bhatke sari duniya, na mili Lucknow waali baat
englishDialogue: That beautiful night with the fragrance of this city ... I roamed all around the world, but there was nothing like Lucknow

dialogue: Main maut ko takiya, aur kafan ko chaadar banakar audhta hoon
englishDialogue: Death is my pillow, and shroud is my bed sheet

dialogue: Izzat se baat, izzatdar logon se ki jaati hai ... bhadwon se nahin
englishDialogue: Respect is given, to respectful people ... not pimps

dialogue: Ayanda mardon ki baraat lootne ... hijadon ki toli kabhi mat bhejna
englishDialogue: From now on to steal from men ... don't send a troop of eunuchs

dialogue: Teri liye no chargesheet sirf D-final ... yani death final
englishDialogue: There will be no chargesheet for you, only D-final ... meaning death final

dialogue: Arjun kabhi marte nahin ... Arjun ladte hain!
englishDialogue: Arjun does not die ... Arjun fights!

dialogue: Khoon ki holi aap jaise politicians khelte hain ... police nahin
englishDialogue: Politicians like you play with blood ... not the police

dialogue: Tu goli lena kaise pasand karega ... pani ke saath, sode ke saath, whiskey ke saath ... yah phir direct
englishDialogue: How would you like to take the bullet ... with water, with soda, with whiskey ... or directly

dialogue: Is napunsak samaaj mein antim vijay ... sada asatya, adharm aur anyaay ki hi hoti hai
englishDialogue: In this impotent society the victory in the end ... is always of lies, immorality and injustice

dialogue: Mere revolver se nikalne waali goli ... mujrim se uski zaat, ya uska mazhab nahin poochti ... ki woh Hindu hai yah Musalman
englishDialogue: A bullet fired from my gun ... does not ask the criminal for his caste or religion ... whether he is a Hindu or Muslim

dialogue: Sarkar badalte hi netao ko afsaro ka tabaadla karne ki purani bimari hai
englishDialogue: Whenever the government changes it is an old habit of the politicians to transfer the officers

dialogue: Mujhe toh yahan har mard ki nazar mein sirf bhook aur havas nazar aati hai ... lekin Arjun ki nazar mein mujhe imaan aur izzat nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: Here in every mans eyes I see only hunger and greed ... but in Arjun's eyes I see faith and respect

dialogue: Paiso ke liye aatankwadi ladte hai, sipahi nahi ... sipahi sirf apne vatan ki izzat aur mulk ki hifazat ke liye ladte hai
englishDialogue: Terrorist fight for money, not soldiers ... soldiers only fight for the respect and the protection of their country

dialogue: Tujhe kaandha dene ke liye ek aadmi bhi naseeb nahin hoga
englishDialogue: There will not be a single person to carry your dead body

dialogue: Humne uski jamaad aur uska naam ration card se kaatna shuru kar diya hai
englishDialogue: We have started to remove his existence and his name from the ration card

dialogue: Tum jaise gundo ke liye ... police se bada gunda is duniya mein doosra koi nahi
englishDialogue: For goons like you ... there is no bigger goon in this world other than the police

dialogue: Main apna antim sanskar kar chuka hoon
englishDialogue: I have done my funeral rites

dialogue: Is umar mein jab haddiyan tootti hai ... toh badi mushkil se judti hai
englishDialogue: In this age when bones break ... then it is very hard to join them together

dialogue: Kyun ki bhagwan ek hi waqt har jagah nahi ho sakte na ... is liye unhone maa ko banaya hai
englishDialogue: Because God can't be in every place at the same time ... that's why he made mother

dialogue: Tabaadlo se ilaake badalte hai ... iraade nahi
englishDialogue: With transfers only the areas change ... not the intentions

dialogue: Hamara Constitution karam pradhaan hai ... dharam pradhaan nahi
englishDialogue: Our Constitution is based on deeds ... it is not based on religion

dialogue: Hum joh kahenge woh aadesh hoga ... hum joh banayenge woh kanoon hoga
englishDialogue: Whatever I say it will be an order ... and whatever I make it will be the law

dialogue: Apni atmaraksha mein goli chalana ... hamara manav adhikaar hai, hamara loktantrik adhikaar hai
englishDialogue: Firing a bullet in self defense ... is our human right and our democratic right

dialogue: Mukadma sabooto aur gawaho se lada jaata hai ... bhashan-baazio, nautanki aur tamasho se nahi
englishDialogue: A case is fought with proofs and witnesses ... not with speeches, drama and entertainment

dialogue: Jab beti badhi ho jaati hai ... toh maa ke seene ka bhoj badh jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a daughter grows older ... then the weight on a mothers heart increases

dialogue: Agar tune un policewaalo ka koi game nahi kiya ... toh main teri puri nasal ka game kar daloonga
englishDialogue: If you don't kill those policemen ... then I will kill your entire generation

dialogue: Woh meri jagah doosre vyakti badal sakte hai ... hamare sankalp aur vichaar nahi
englishDialogue: They can replace me with someone else ... but they can't change our resolution and thoughts

dialogue: Jodhenge todhenge, ladenge ladwaenge, dal banayenge bhigadenge ... par ek roz hi kursi par bahetke dikhayenge
englishDialogue: We will make and break, we will fight and get people to fight, we will make a party and break it ... but one day I will sit on this chair and show you

dialogue: Main tujhe is qaid mein ... har roz ek nayi maut maroonga
englishDialogue: In this confinement ... I will give you a new death everyday

dialogue: Inteqam bhi ajeeb funda hai, sharaab ki tarah ... jitna purana utni hi zyada kick deta hai
englishDialogue: The concept of revenge is strange, like alcohol ... the older it is the more kick it gives

dialogue: Himmat uske paas hoti hai jiske dil mein sachchai ho
englishDialogue: Courage only lies with the person who has truth in his heart

dialogue: Tumhe bheja mujhe rokne ke liye ... mujhe bheja tumhe thokne ke liye
englishDialogue: You were sent to stop me ... and I was sent to kill you

dialogue: Isse kehte hai maar ... khane waala bhi roye aur maarne waala bhi roye
englishDialogue: This is called a beating ... the one who gets the beating cries and the one who beats also cries

dialogue: Main tumhe itni maar maroonga ... shareer mein itne zakhm doonga ... ki dard bhi pareshaan ho jayega ki uthe toh kahan se uthe
englishDialogue: I will hit you so badly ... and I will give you so many wounds in your body ... that even pain will be confused as to where to rise from

dialogue: Koi jee ke kaam aata hai, koi marke kaam aata hai ... tum jee ke bhi kaam aayi aur marke bhi
englishDialogue: Someone is useful while they live, someone is useful when they die ... you were useful while you lived and also when you died

dialogue: Shikaar jitna hi tezz aur chalaak ho ... shikaari ko utna hi mazaa aata hai
englishDialogue: The faster and smarter the prey is ... the hunter enjoys that much more

dialogue: Meri tension ka ilaaj toh sirf tumhari khamoshi hai
englishDialogue: Only your death is the cure to my tension

dialogue: Kapde badalne se insaan badal nahi jata
englishDialogue: A human does not change by merely changing clothes

dialogue: Zameen aur aasman ek nahi ho sakte ... us hi tarah kasoorwar aur bekasoor bhi ek nahi ho sakte
englishDialogue: The ground and the sky can't be one ... just like that the guilty and the innocent also can't be one

dialogue: Aapke ek shaunk ki keemat ... hamari kahi chhaton ki keemat hai
englishDialogue: The price of your one hobby ... is the price for many of our roofs

dialogue: Waqt halaat badalte hai ... aur halaat insaan
englishDialogue: Time changes situations ... and situations change humans

dialogue: Aapko dekhte hi ... main jal bin machali, nritya bin bijli ban jata hoon
englishDialogue: When I see you ... I become a fish without water and lightening without dance

dialogue: Zindagi nikalti jaati hai aur hum sab pyar ke bina jeena seekh lete hai ... kyun pyar ko mauka nahi dete, kyun apno par vishvas nahi karte
englishDialogue: Life keeps going on and we all learn to live without love ... why don't we give love a chance, why don't we trust our own people

dialogue: Itni choti hokar teacher ... amazing
englishDialogue: A teacher at this small age ... amazing

dialogue: Jawani ke din ... kamaal ke hote hai
englishDialogue: The days of youth ... are wonderful

dialogue: Nafrat bahut soch samajhkar karni chahiye ... kyun ki ek din hum bhi wahi ban jaate hai, jise hum nafrat karte hai
englishDialogue: You should hate someone only after careful thinking ... because one day even we become the person, whom we have the hatred for

dialogue: Yeh zindagi nafrat ke liye bahut choti hai
englishDialogue: This life is very short for hatred

dialogue: Itne bade hokar student ... disgusting
englishDialogue: A student at this old age ... disgusting

dialogue: Chehra wahi chupate hai ... jinhe apni asliyat se sharam aati hai
englishDialogue: Only those hide their face ... who are ashamed of their reality

dialogue: Jab Lucky ko pyar hoga na, toh saare college mein violins bajenge
englishDialogue: When Lucky falls in love, then there will violins playing in the entire college

dialogue: Bees saalon ke zakhm ... bees dino mein nahi bhare jaate hai
englishDialogue: The wounds of 20 years ... cannot be filled in 20 days

dialogue: Main apne dost khud chunti hoon
englishDialogue: I myself select my own friends

dialogue: Fasla kitna bhi lamba ho ... shuruvat ek kadam se hoti hai
englishDialogue: No matter how big the distance is ... the start always happens with a step

dialogue: Is saal tu paas ho gaya na ... toh main tujhe Cadabury doongi, woh bhi milak ki
englishDialogue: If you pass this year ... then I will you a Cadbury (chocolate), and that to a milk one

dialogue: Teen baar lagataar fail hona koi mamuli baat nahi hai ... lekin dosto agar mehnat, lagan aur imaandari se koshish ki jaye toh aap sab is mukaam pe pahunch sakte ho
englishDialogue: To fail 3 times consecutively is not a small thing ... but friends if you try with hard work, dedication and honesty then you all can get there

dialogue: Thodi tondh honi chahiye ... sukhi aadmi ki nishani hai
englishDialogue: One should have a little bit of belly ... it is the sign of a happy man

dialogue: Hai hai, taude muscal kitne satong hai nee
englishDialogue: Oh my, what strong muscles you have

dialogue: Meri zindagi mein koi aur aa gaya hai ... ek sailaab, ek toofan ki tarah aur baha le gaya mujhe
englishDialogue: Someone else has come in my life ... like a flood, like a storm and he has taken me away

dialogue: Us waqt par joh maine sahi samjha maine kiya ... lekin aaj joh hone ja raha hai woh bilkul galat hai
englishDialogue: I did what I thought was right at that time ... but what is going to happen today is very wrong

dialogue: Kiya hai ishq toh har imtihaan se guzrenge ... tumhare vaaste har intehaan se guzrenge
englishDialogue: Since I'm in love I'll go through every test ... and for you I'll go through every limit

dialogue: Tumhe koi chahe yeh toh bahut hi mamuli si baat hai ... magar tum kisi ko is tarah tootkar chaho bahut badi baat hai
englishDialogue: If someone loves you it is a very small thing ... but it is a very big thing if you love someone to this extent

dialogue: Auratein apne pati ko apna bhagwan maanti hai ... aur main woh khushnaseeb hoon joh apne bhagwan ko apna pati banane ja rahi hoon
englishDialogue: Women consider their husband as their god ... and I am that lucky person who is going to make her god as her husband

dialogue: Us aadmi ka sab kuch ho kar bhi kuch nahi ho sakta ... jiska ghar nahi bana hota
englishDialogue: The one who doesn't have a proper home ... that person may have everything but yet nothing

dialogue: Aap toh woh hai joh saare jahan ka khoon peekar bhi pyasa reh jaye ... maut toh kya yamraj ko bhi nighalkar bhooka reh jaye
englishDialogue: You're the one who even after drinking blood of the entire world still remains thirsty ... and the one who still remains hungry even swallowing death and the god of death

dialogue: Sache aadmi ko gale lagane se ... jhoote aadmi ke, kaminey aadmi ke paap thode kam ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: By hugging a honest person ... it reduces the sins of a liar, a dishonest person

dialogue: Mohabbat ki chingari ko gusse ki phoonk maaro ... toh aaisi aag badhakti hai ki ghar ke ghar jal jaate hai, mahal toot ke bikhar jaate hai
englishDialogue: When you blow anger at the spark of love ... then such a fire erupts that houses burn and mansions break apart

dialogue: Main yeh toh nahi keh rahi ki paison se khushiyan kharidi jaa sakti hai ... magar zindagi ko cash toh kiya jaa sakta hai
englishDialogue: I am not saying that you can buy happiness with money ... but you can cash into life with it

dialogue: Chor ke ghar mein chori karne ko paap nahi kehte
englishDialogue: It is not a sin to rob a robbers house

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi jannat aur duniya ke beech ka fasla ... sirf ek kadam hota hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the distance between heaven and the world ... is just one step

dialogue: Main is duniya ka bhut aur bhavishya hoon
englishDialogue: I am the past and the future of this world

dialogue: Bada kamzor leg piece hai ... is murghi ko polio ho gaya tha kya?
englishDialogue: It is a very thin leg piece ... did this chicken have polio?

dialogue: Mujhe tumhari ungli nahi ... poora haath thaamna hai zindagi bhar ke liye
englishDialogue: I don't want your finger ... I want to hold your complete hand for my entire life

dialogue: Thoda sa hamari taraf se bhi ro dena
englishDialogue: Please cry a little on my behalf also

dialogue: Graduate samajh ke humko line maar rahi hai kya?
englishDialogue: Are you hitting on me thinking I am a graduate?

dialogue: Kaika Dilli hai bhaiya, dil toh hai hi nahi kisi ke paas
englishDialogue: What Delhi city is this, no one has a heart here

dialogue: Abe chai mangi thi, parliament se ayegi kya?
englishDialogue: I had asked for tea, is it coming from the parliament or what?

dialogue: Bhagwan ko malum tha ki aadmi saala kuch kare na kare lekin daru zaroor piyega ... isiliye usne aadmi ko ek dimag, ek thopda, ek dil de diya ... lekin kidney do de diya, ki agar ek kharab ho jaye toh aadmi doosri se apna kaam chalata rahe
englishDialogue: God knew it that whether a man does anything or not, he will drink alcohol for sure ... that's why he gave a man one mind, one face, one heart ... but he gave two kidneys, so that if one goes bad then the man can still function with the other one

dialogue: Doosre ka suitcase aur doosre ki biwi ko haath nahi lagana chahiye
englishDialogue: One should not touch someone else's suitcase and someone else's wife

dialogue: Yeh ek zakhm khaye hue naujawan ka haath hai ... yeh jiske gaal pe padta hai uski duniya ghoom jaati hai
englishDialogue: This is a hand of a wounded young person ... and the one who gets a slap from it, their world spins around

dialogue: Raajneeti mein kabhi kabhi apne support karne waale ko bhi marwana padta hai
englishDialogue: In politics sometimes you have to even get a person supporting you killed

dialogue: Sachai aur burai ki jab bhi bhidant hui hai ... dum hamesha burai ne hi todha hai
englishDialogue: Whenever truth and evil have had a clash ... evil has always lost it's life

dialogue: Taqdeer teri chutti pe hai, maut tere sarr pe hai ... lekin baatein aise karta hai, jaise zindagi tere bistar pe hai
englishDialogue: Your fate is on vacation, death is on your head ... but you're talking as if, life is on your bed

dialogue: Police asli ho ya nakli ... aati saali hamesha late hi hai
englishDialogue: Whether the police is real or fake ... bloody it always comes late

dialogue: Jahan dekhi laundiya, nachne laga dandiya
englishDialogue: Wherever you see a girl, you start dancing

dialogue: Sex aur chocolate dono ek hi type ka maza dete hai ... fark sirf itna hai ... ek mein wrapper nikalna padhta hai aur doosre mein aaj kal chadhana padhta hai
englishDialogue: Sex and chocolate both give the same kind of pleasure ... the only difference is that ... in one you have to remove the wrapper and in the other nowadays you have to put it on

dialogue: Ab Gandhiji ko hi le lo ... puri zindagi ahinsa ahinsa ke peeche bhaagte rahe ... aur humne unki photo aaisi cheez par chaap di ... joh hinsa ki sabse badi jhad hai ... paisa
englishDialogue: Just take the case of Gandhi ... his whole life he ran behind non-violence ... and we put his picture on such a thing ... which is the biggest cause of violence ... money

dialogue: Insaan chahe janwar se mard ban gaya ho ... lekin kuch aaise mard hai joh janwar se insaan kabhi nahi ban sakte
englishDialogue: Even if a human has become a man from an animal ... but there are some men who can never become a human from an animal

dialogue: Is mein sirf ek goli, aur bheje ki khali kholi ... peeche ka khadda do centimeter ka, aur samne se thopda Mr.India
englishDialogue: In this (gun) there is only one bullet, and your brain goes empty ... the hole behind is two centimeters, and your face from front becomes Mr.India

dialogue: Ab dekh tamasha ... dhikhata hoon tereko Bipasha
englishDialogue: Now you see my entertainment ... I'll show you Bipasha

dialogue: Thukai aur kamai mein ek se zyada zariya hona bahut zaroori hai ... varna khud ki thukti hai
englishDialogue: When it comes to hammering and income you should have more than one way ... otherwise you yourself will get hammered

dialogue: Lambi race ke ghode ko goli nahin maarte ... gud aur chana khilate hain ... phir daav lagage paisa kamate hain
englishDialogue: One does not fire a bullet at the horse of a long race ... you feed him jaggery and chickpeas ... then bet on it and make money

dialogue: Tiger na billo se darta hai ... aur na billo ke pillo se
englishDialogue: A tiger is not scared of cats ... and neither of her kittens

dialogue: Aadmi musafir hota hai hero ... aata hai, jaata hai
englishDialogue: A man is a traveler buddy ... he comes, he goes

dialogue: Mere aage hai jannat, toh aaj teri shaamat hai ... dil yun kisiko dena, mardo ki buri aadat hai
englishDialogue: Heaven is in front of me, hence today you'll have problems ... giving the heart to anyone, is an old habit of men

dialogue: Jis din meri hatt gayi na ... tu zaroor hatt jayega
englishDialogue: The day I go crazy ... you will be gone

dialogue: Kal se duniya ek pyari si jannat hai ... joh khul rahi hai dheere dheere woh aaj teri kismat hai
englishDialogue: From tomorrow the world will be one sweet heaven ... and what is opening slowly slowly today, is your fate

dialogue: Yeh jism dekh raha hai, resham hai resham ... is pe fisalna bahut aasaan hai ... chahe woh haath ho yah niyat
englishDialogue: Are you seeing this body, it is silky ... it is very easy to slip on it ... be it the hand or intention

dialogue: Nasha jitna badhe ... hosh utni hi derr se aata hai
englishDialogue: The more the intoxication ... the later one regains consciousness

dialogue: Bike nahi hai yeh time machine hai yeh ... so put your hands around me and let me take you back in time
englishDialogue: This is a time machine not a bike ... so put your hands around me and let me take you back in time

dialogue: Aurat agar jhoot bolne par aaye na ... toh shatir se shatir aadmi ko dhokha de sakti hai
englishDialogue: When a woman comes to lying ... then she can betray even the smartest of the men

dialogue: Baarish ki woh boodein achanak aisi lagne lagi ... jaise aasmaan se pani nahi, aag barasne lagi ho
englishDialogue: Suddenly those raindrops felt as if ... the sky was dropping fire, not water

dialogue: Dil apni aakhri dhadkan tak kya kar behte ... koi keh sakta hai bhala?
englishDialogue: What the heart can do until its last beat ... no one can say that?

dialogue: Agni ke saat phere toh sabhi lete hai ... lekin zindagi ki aag se guzarkar joh rishta kayam hota hai ... usse pavitra, usse sacha bandhan aur koi nahi
englishDialogue: Everyone gets married ... but the relationship that is built after going through the fire of life ... is the purest and the truest bond

dialogue: Ek kuari ladki ka alekapan, us shaadi shuda aurat le akelepan se lakh guna behtar hai ... joh woh har pal, har raat apne pati ke bistar mein mehsoos karti hai
englishDialogue: The loneliness of a single girl is far better than the loneliness of that married woman ... who feels it every moment, every night on the bed of her husband

dialogue: Destiny hi toh hoti hai, jab aap bhatakte hue kisi aaise raaste par pahunch jaye ... jise humne nahi chuna ... balki khud-ba-khud woh raasta hum tak pahunch gaya
englishDialogue: It is destiny, when while wandering you reach on such a path ... which we have not chosen ... instead that path by itself comes to us

dialogue: Achcha hua sanam hum bewafaa nikle ... wafaadar toh kutte hote hai
englishDialogue: It's good that I turned out to be unfaithful ... since dogs are the ones that are faithful

dialogue: Apne dhande mein rishtey paalna achcha nahi hota ... zindagi ki kishtein kam ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Having relations is not good in our business ... the installments of life get reduced

dialogue: Dhoondi sari duniya, dhoonde sare khopche ... kahan chupa hai re tu Mussa, Sultan se bachke
englishDialogue: I searched the entire world, I searched all the corners ... Mussa where are you hiding, escaping from Sultan

dialogue: Mumbai ... ek aaisa station jahan koi bhi musafir kabhi akele nahi utarta ... uske saath koi na koi sapna zaroor utarta hai
englishDialogue: Mumbai ... is a station where no traveller gets down alone ... some dream or other gets down along with him

dialogue: Yahan rahoge toh saans lene mein taqleef hogi ... jahan bhej raha hoon wahan saans lene ki zaroorat nahi padegi
englishDialogue: If you stay here then you'll have problems to breathe ... and where I'm sending you there you won't have any need to breathe

dialogue: Doston ke dukh dard baatne dekho Jaggi aaya hai ... abhe kaun hai woh kabootar jisne tumhe sataya hai
englishDialogue: Look Jaggi has come to share the sadness and pain of friends ... who is that pigeon who is bothering you

dialogue: Achche log jaldi upar jaate hai ... achcha hua main achcha nahi hua
englishDialogue: Good people die early ... it's good that I'm not good

dialogue: Maana maine Ali Bhai ka kehna, maana tune Ali Bhai ka kehna ... lekin us budhe ki baat tu seriously mat lena, aur hamesha Mussa se bachke rehna
englishDialogue: I did what Ali Bhai said, you did what Ali Bhai said ... but don't take what the old man said seriously, and always beware of Mussa

dialogue: Na yeh Mussa marega, na mujhe jeene dega ... itna batade re mujhe, tu Mussa ki kitni supari lega
englishDialogue: Neither will Mussa die, nor will he let me live ... tell me atleast, what will you take to kill Mussa

dialogue: Taqleef is baat ki nahi ki log mar jaate hai ... taqleef is baat ki hai ki log zinda rehkar bhi nahi jeete
englishDialogue: I'm not troubled by the fact that people die ... I'm troubled by the fact that people don't live when they are alive

dialogue: Hamari zindagi hamari hokar bhi hamari nahi hoti ... woh marte dum tak kisi doosre ki marzi ke mutabik chalti hai
englishDialogue: Our life being ours is still not ours ... it moves as per the decisions of others until you die

dialogue: Zindagi us bewafaa aurat ki tarah hai ... joh bure waqt mein apne pati ka saath chhod deti hai
englishDialogue: Life is like that dishonest woman ... who leaves her husband's in bad times

dialogue: Century banane ke liye shuruvat pehle run se karni padti hai
englishDialogue: To make a hundred runs you have to start with the first run

dialogue: Sach kalpana se bhi zyada vichitra hota hai
englishDialogue: Truth is stranger than fiction

dialogue: Sach ka nakaab pehne huye kuch namumkin kisse ... aahista aahista wakehi sach ban jaate hai
englishDialogue: Some impossible stories that wear the mask of truth ... slowly slowly in fact turn into the truth

dialogue: Tumhari kamzori hi tumhari sabse badi taqat hai
englishDialogue: Your weakness is your biggest strength

dialogue: Wah re saali kismat tu kaisi hai re bala ... ek Majnu banke behta doosra Ranjha banne chala
englishDialogue: Oh destiny, you are such a curse ... one is sitting like Majnu and other wants to become Ranjha

dialogue: Tu hai aag main hoon shola ... aaja meri Coca-Cola
englishDialogue: You are fire and I am ember ... come here my Coca-Cola

dialogue: Main tumhara haath kabhi nahi chhodunga ... aaj nahi, abhi nahi, kabhi nahi
englishDialogue: I will never leave your hand .. not today, not now, and never

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein hum doston se zyada dushmano ki khabar rakhte hai
englishDialogue: In our business we keep more news about our enemies than that of our friends

dialogue: Kehte hai ki jab bachche ke zid baap poori na kar sake ... toh woh apni maa ke paas chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: It is said that when a child's obstinance is not fulfilled by his father ... he then goes to his mother

dialogue: Aap haath uthayen ya haath phailayen ... main apna pyar aapki jholi mein nahi daal sakta
englishDialogue: Whether you raise your hand or open it ... I cannot drop my love with you

dialogue: Pyar mein jeet ussi ki hoti hai ... joh raaste mein aane waali har deewar ko gira de
englishDialogue: Only those people succeed in love ... who drop every wall that comes in between

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein kisi ek ki kamzori ... doosre ki taqat ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: In our business the weakness of one ... becomes the strength of other

dialogue: Pathan kabhi burkhe ke peeche chip kar vaar nahi karta
englishDialogue: A Pashtun never attacks hidingly from behind a veil

dialogue: Apni beti ko toh main sirf is desh se door bhej raha hoon ... magar aaj ke baad Sapna ka naam bhi teri zubaan pe aaya ... toh main tujhe zindagi se door bhej doonga
englishDialogue: I am only sending my daughter away from this country ... but if after today even if Sapna's name comes on your lips ... then I will send you away from this life

dialogue: Yeh kaisa locha kiya tune mere pyar ka ... maal toh bika nahi bill chad gaya udhaar ka
englishDialogue: What problem did you bring into my love ... the merchandise didn't sell and instead I got a bill of a loan

dialogue: Is chor bazaar mein aake apne ho gaye vare nyare ... apun akhiyon se goli maare
englishDialogue: By coming to this thief market I've become rich ... and I shoot bullets from my eyes

dialogue: Mereko damaad thoda hatke chahiye ... aaisa jisko dekh ke public sadak pe se hat jave ... police station se police hat jave ... aur mahulle mein se bade se bada gunda phut jave
englishDialogue: I need an unique son-in-law ... as in seeing whom the public moves away from the road ... the police moves away from the police station ... and the biggest goon of the locality runs away

dialogue: Bewajah log kahan marte hai ... yaar hi bewafai karte hai
englishDialogue: People don't die without a reason ... it is friends who are unfaithful

dialogue: Yeh dhanda hai na bewafaa aurat ki tarah hai ... bewafai par utar aaye toh kangaal kar deta hai ... aur wafaadari par utar aaye toh malamaal
englishDialogue: This business is like an unfaithful woman ... if it comes to unfaithfulness then it will make you broke ... and if it comes to faithfulness then it will make you rich

dialogue: Aadmi agar thode time ke liye pareshaan hai na ... toh matlab time kharab hai ... aur aadmi agar hamesha pareshaan hai na ... toh samajh lena ki aadmi kharaab hai
englishDialogue: If a man is worried for sometime ... then it means his time is bad ... and if a man is worried always ... then understand that the man himself is bad

dialogue: Is jahaan mein aaye ho toh kuch aaisa karo kadardaan ... ke jis gali se guzro toh awaaz aaye, abbajaan abbajaan
englishDialogue: Since you have come in this world then do something that ...  sounds calling you Dad come from whichever street you pass through

dialogue: Bewafaa aadmi khuda se gabra jaata hai ... aur sacha pyar hai na khuda se takra jaata hai
englishDialogue: An unfaithful man is scared of god ... and true love will fight against god

dialogue: Pyar maanga tha, judaai nahi ... wafaa maangi tha, bewafai nahi
englishDialogue: I asked for love, not separation ... I asked for faith, not unfaithfulness

dialogue: Usse giraftar mat karna, uspar muqadma mat chalana, usse phansi ki sazaa mat dena ... kuch bhi ho jaye usse zinda mat chhodna
englishDialogue: Don't arrest him, don't file a case on him, don't give him capital punishment ... under any condition, don't leave him alive

dialogue: Janta hai tu ki danger naam hai mera ... aur main janta hoon ki kya kaam hai tera
englishDialogue: You know that my name is danger ... and I know what work you have

dialogue: Sarhad paar ek aisa shaksh hai ... joh aapke liye apni jaan bhi de dega
englishDialogue: Across the border there is a person ... who can give his life for you

dialogue: Sachi mohabbat zindagi mein sirf ek baar hoti hai ... aur jab hoti hai ... toh koi bhagwan yah khuda usse nakamyab nahi hone deta
englishDialogue: True love happens only once in life ... and when it happens ... then God makes sure that it is successful

dialogue: Woh kehte hai yeh tera desh nahi, phir kyun mere desh jaisa lagta hai ... woh kehta hai main us jaisa nahi, phir kyun mujh jaisa woh lagta hai
englishDialogue: They say that this is not my country, then why does it look like my country ... he says that I am not like him, then why does he look like me

dialogue: Mere desh ki har maa ... aap jaisi zaroor hai
englishDialogue: Every mother of my country ... is just like you

dialogue: Woh kehte hai ki woh koi nahi thi, phir kyun mere liye duniya se woh ladti hai ... woh kehte hai main us jaisa nahi, phir kyun mujh jaisi woh lagti hai
englishDialogue: They say that she was no one to me, then why does she fight with the world for me ... they say that I am not like her, then why does she look like me

dialogue: Ek aurat ki mohabbat aur ek mard ki mohabbat mein bahut fark hota hai
englishDialogue: There is a lot of difference between a man's love and a woman's love

dialogue: Mohabbat kitaabon mein hoti hai, shayari mein hoti hai ... zindagi mein nahi
englishDialogue: Love exists in books and in poems ... not in life

dialogue: Yeh khuda ke roop mein insaan hai ... yah insaan ke roop mein khuda
englishDialogue: Is he a human in the guise of God ... or is he God in the guise of a human

dialogue: Azaadi har insaan ka paidayashi haq hai
englishDialogue: Independence is the birthright of every person

dialogue: Aadmi di zindagi vich jab sahi aurat aa jandi hai na ... tab woh zindagi poori tarah jeenda hai
englishDialogue: When the right woman comes in a man's life ... he then lives his life to the fullest

dialogue: Woh kehte hai mera desh uska nahi, phir kyun mere ghar woh rehti hai ... woh kehte hai main us jaisa nahi, phir kyun mujh jaisi woh lagti hai
englishDialogue: They say that my country is not her's, then why does she live in my house ... they say that I am not like her, then why does she look like me

dialogue: Dharam ka asli matlab prem ke alava kuch aur ho hi nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The real meaning of religion can't be anything but love

dialogue: Ek ladki Miss Universe ka taj apne sar par pehan sakti hai ... gold medal apne gale mein latka sakti hai ... lekin ek mangalsutra bina mantra ke kabhi nahi pehan sakti
englishDialogue: A girl can wear the tiara of Miss Universe on her head ... she can hang a gold medal in her neck ... but she can never wear a wedding necklace without taking the vows

dialogue: Doosron ki madad karne mein joh fayda hai ... woh apni madad karne mein ho hi nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The benefit that lies in helping others ... that benefit doesn't lie in helping ourselves

dialogue: Sar jhukane ka anjaam ... sar katane se kitna bura hota hai
englishDialogue: The consequences of bowing down your head ... is far worse than getting your head chopped

dialogue: Main sirf do kisam ke insaanon ko pehchaanta hoon ... ek dost aur doosra dushman
englishDialogue: I only know people of two types ... one friend and second enemy

dialogue: Sher ko jungle se pakad kar pinjare mein bandh kar diya hai ... magar sher toh pinjare mein bhi ghaas nahin khata
englishDialogue: They have caught the tiger and locked in a cage ... but a tiger does not eat grass even in the cage

dialogue: Hum sirf khelne ke liye nahin ... jeetne ke liye aaye hain
englishDialogue: We have come not only to play ... but to win

dialogue: Insaan ko usse shaadi nahi karni chahiye, jisse woh pyar karta ho ... balki usse shaadi karni chahiye, joh usse pyar karta ho
englishDialogue: A person should not marry someone whom he loves ... instead a person should marry someone who loves him

dialogue: Abhe oh dukkar Fiat ke cancelled model
englishDialogue: Hey you cancelled model of a piggy Fiat car

dialogue: Clinic all clear dandruff shampoo ki tarah clear clear bata do ... varna itna maarenge ki zindagi bhar badan pe kapdon ki jagah dukh dabao lep lagakar ghoomoge
englishDialogue: Tell me clearly like the Clinic all clear dandruff shampoo ... or else I'll beat you so much that instead of wearing clothes everywhere, you'll apply the pain killing balm for your entire life

dialogue: Abhe pain balm ... ghamorio ke saste powder!
englishDialogue: Hey you pain balm ... cheap powder for rashes!

dialogue: Chalo chalo chalo, jaldi se crore ko pati se alag kardo
englishDialogue: Go go go, lets quickly separate the money from the husband

dialogue: Baahar aag hai aur andar jwalamukhi hai ... jaaye toh kidhar jaaye?
englishDialogue: Outside there is a fire and inside there is a volcano ... where should we go?

dialogue: Anna tum logo ko ganne ki tarah chil chil ke chota kar daalega ... samjha na?
englishDialogue: Anna will peel you like a sugarcane and will make you small ... got it?

dialogue: Morning morning mein gents ka paise mangna ... ladies ke liye bahot bura bad luck honda hai
englishDialogue: Gents asking for money early in the morning ... is a big bad luck for ladies

dialogue: Aye good night ke machchar ... mere dimaag pe sawaalon ka manjira mat bajaa
englishDialogue: Hey you mosquito of a good night ... don't play a dulcimer full of questions on my mind

dialogue: Ek baar agar mera dimaag garam ho gaya na ... toh thanda bhi fatafat ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: If once my mind gets hot ... then it gets cold also very fast

dialogue: Yeh toh underwear dost nikle
englishDialogue: They turned out to be underwear (old) friends

dialogue: Thoda thoda karke peena chahiye na? ... aadha tum aadha main, dheere dheere
englishDialogue: You should drink little little right? ... half you half me, slowly slowly

dialogue: Abhe kum akal ki chai ki patti
englishDialogue: Hey you tea powder of a soft headed mind

dialogue: Adult baat mat kar, idhar maa behen khadi hai
englishDialogue: Don't talk adult stuff, mom and sister are standing here

dialogue: Aye hawai jahaj pack kar chal ... samaan mein baithke jaana hai fatafat
englishDialogue: Hey you pack the airplane ... we have to sit in the luggage and go quickly

dialogue: Agar main mar gaya, main tujhe zinda nahin chhodunga
englishDialogue: If I'll die, I'll kill you

dialogue: Marne se pehle mere baal dye kara dena, I want to die young
englishDialogue: Before dying you guys dye my hair, I want to die young

dialogue: Ye perfume ki khushboo ki smell kidhar se aa rahi hai?
englishDialogue: Where is this smell of perfume coming from?

dialogue: Jaise hi maine uski kanpatti par ye gunpatti rakhi ... uska chehra bina doodh ki chai jaisa kala pad gaya
englishDialogue: The moment I aimed this gun beneath his ears ... his face became black like tea without milk

dialogue: Agar woh deadly don hai, toh main bhi deadly daayan hoon
englishDialogue: If he is a deadly don, then I am also a deadly witch

dialogue: India mein jab tak apun ke jeb mein paisa hai na ... log poochta hai kaisa hai?
englishDialogue: In India until you have money in your pocket ... people ask how are you?

dialogue: Mooch toh mard ki shaan hai ... jiske chehre pe mooch nahi, woh mard hi nahi hota
englishDialogue: A moustache is the pride of a man ... a man who doesn't have a moustache on his face, is not a man

dialogue: Sar pe kafan wohi bandhta hai, jiski moochein hoti hai
englishDialogue: Only people who have a moustache, wear a shroud on their head

dialogue: Kissi ke ghar baar baar jaane se izzat kam ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: You lose respect when you keep going to someones house

dialogue: Mujrim bhi toh insaan hota hai ... pyar ka bhooka hota hai
englishDialogue: A criminal is also a human ... he is also hungry for love

dialogue: Jab vardi bolti hai ... toh achche achchon ki bolti bandh ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When the uniform talks ... then the greatest of the greatest people can't say a thing

dialogue: Game bahut achcha khela tune ... aadmi galat chun liya
englishDialogue: You played a very good game ... it's just that you chose the wrong person

dialogue: Maut ko bhi tum nahi chunte ... maut tumhe chunti hai
englishDialogue: You don't select death ... death selects you

dialogue: Bahut kainchi ki tarah chalti hai teri zubaan ... kainchi se hi kaat doonga
englishDialogue: Your tongue moves a lot like scissors ... I will cut it with a scissor itself

dialogue: Agar company mere bina chal sakti hai na ... toh main bhi company ke bina chal sakta hoon
englishDialogue: If the company can run without me ... then even I can run without the company

dialogue: Jiski nazar game se hati ... samjho woh game se hat gaya
englishDialogue: One who takes his eye away from the game ... then he is gone from the game

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein ek galati ko maaf karna ... usse bhi badi galati hai
englishDialogue: In our business to forgive one mistake ... is a bigger mistake

dialogue: Khaas aadmiyo ko yeh bhi yaad dilana chahiye ... ke woh kabhi bhi aam ho sakte hai
englishDialogue: You should remind special people that ... they can become a normal person anytime

dialogue: Malik, tu aur teri yeh company ... khallas
englishDialogue: Malik, you and your company ... finish

dialogue: Yahan koi bhi jab chahe bharti ho sakta hai ... magar istifa nahin de sakta
englishDialogue: Here anyone can join anytime ... but cannot resign

dialogue: Joh hamare usool todhta hai ... hum usse todh dete hain
englishDialogue: Whosoever breaks our rules ... we break them

dialogue: Pachees baar keh chuka hoon ki ... dhande ki baat phone pe nahi
englishDialogue: I have told you 25 times that ... no business talks over the phone

dialogue: Duniya mein har kaam fayde ke liye kiya jata hai
englishDialogue: In this world, every work is done for profit

dialogue: Maut se zyada ... maut ka darr kaam ka hai
englishDialogue: More than death ... the scare of death is useful

dialogue: Har insaan ke andar ek rakshash hota hai ... bas kuch log usse bahar nikaalne se darte nahi
englishDialogue: There is a devil inside everyone ... it's just that some people are not scared to take it out

dialogue: Ab tak joh khoon is company ko banane mein laga na ... wohi khoon is company ko barbaad karne mein lagega
englishDialogue: The blood that was used so far to build this company ... that same blood will now be used to destroy this company

dialogue: Udhne se pehle ... udha diye jaoge
englishDialogue: Before you fly ... you'll be shot

dialogue: Babuji ne kaha gaon chhod do ... sab ne kaha Paro ko chhod do ... Paro ne kaha sharab chhod do ... aaj tumne keh diya haweli chhod do ... ek din aayega jab woh kahenge, duniya hi chhod do
englishDialogue: Dad said to leave the town ... everyone said to leave Paro ... Paro said to leave alcohol ... today you said leave the mansion ... one day will come when they will say, to leave the world itself

dialogue: Kaun kambakht bardaasht karne ko peeta hai ... hum toh peete hai ki yahan par baith sake, tumhe dekh sake, tumhe bardaasht kar sake
englishDialogue: Who the hell drinks to tolerate ... I drink so that I can sit here, so that I can see you, so that I can tolerate you

dialogue: Apne hisse ki zindagi toh hum jee chuke Chunni babu, ab toh bus dhadkano ka lihaaz karte hai ... kya kahen yeh duniya waalo ko joh, aakhri saans par bhi aitraaz karte hai
englishDialogue: Mr. Chunni I have lived my part of the life, now I am just there for the sake of my heartbeats ... what to say to these people of the world, who disagree even on my last breathe

dialogue: Dil ke chaalon ko koi shayari kahe toh parwah nahi ... takleef toh tab hoti hai jab koi wah wah wah karta hai
englishDialogue: I don't care when someone calls the heart sores as poetry ... but it bothers when they praise it

dialogue: Itna guroor toh chaand ko bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Even the moon does not show so much pride

dialogue: Aurat maa hoti hai, bahen hoti hai, patni hoti hai, dost hoti hai ... aur jab woh kuch nahi hoti, toh tawaif hoti hai
englishDialogue: A woman is a mom, a sister, a wife, a friend ... and when she is nothing, then she is a prostitute

dialogue: Pyar ka karobaar toh bahut baar kiya hai ... magar pyar sirf ek baar
englishDialogue: I have done the business of love many a times ... but I have loved only once

dialogue: Ek baat hoti thi tab tum bahut yaad aati thi ... (kab) ... jab jab main saans leta tha tab tab
englishDialogue: I used to remember you a lot when one thing used to happen ... (when) ... whenever I used to breathe

dialogue: Yun nazar ki baat ki aur dil chura gaye ... hum toh samjhe the bud, aap toh dhadkan suna gaye
englishDialogue: You talked about sight and stole my heart ... I thought you were a statue, but you made me hear a beat

dialogue: Kitni aasani se ginvah diya ki tumhe har pal meri yaad aati thi ... lekin yeh nahi socha ki un palon mein beetta toh main hi tha ... diya tum jalati thi ... par jalta toh main hi tha
englishDialogue: How easily you said that you remembered me in every moment ... but you never thought that I was the one who was going through those moments ... you used to light the candle ... but I used to burn

dialogue: Har dukh aane waale sukh ki chitti hoti hai ... aur har nuksaan hone waale fayde ka ishara
englishDialogue: Every sorrow is the letter for the coming happiness ... and every loss is an indication to the coming profit

dialogue: Jahan 'kh' se khush hokar jeena chahiye wahan 'kh' se itne khamosh baithe ho ... arre 'kh' se itne khoye khoye ho ... ki pata hi nahi chalta ki aap ghar pe ho
englishDialogue: Where you should be happy in life there you are sitting so quietly ... you are so lost ... that one does not know if you are home or not

dialogue: Tawaifon ki taqdeer mein shauhar nahin hote
englishDialogue: Prostitutes do not have a husband in their destiny

dialogue: Tawaifon ki toh taqdeer hi nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Prostitutes don't even have a destiny

dialogue: Yeh toh 'sh' se shayari ho gayi
englishDialogue: Mr.Chunni, this became a poetry starting with 'sh'

dialogue: Pyar paana sabki kismat mein nahi hota
englishDialogue: Not everyone is destined to achieve love

dialogue: Tum meri zindagi mein ajnabee banke aaye the ... lekin ab tum iske maalik ho
englishDialogue: You came into my life as a stranger ... but now you have become the owner of it

dialogue: Yeh woh lamhe hai jin mein maine tumhari saanson ko chua hai ... jin mein maine ek bahut haseen sa khwaab dekha hai ... yeh lamhe kabhi guzar nahi sakte
englishDialogue: These are the moments in which I have touched your breathe ... in which I have seen a very beautiful dream ... these moments can never pass away

dialogue: Zindagi mein hamesha apna faida nahi dekhna chahiye ... kabhi kabhi kuch kaam doosron ki bhalai ke liye bhi karne chahiye
englishDialogue: In life you shouldn't always think about your profit ... sometimes you should do some work that benefits others also

dialogue: There are no sentiments in business
englishDialogue: There are no sentiments in business

dialogue: Zindagi mein hamesha logic kaam nahi karta
englishDialogue: In life logic doesn't always work

dialogue: Us chandani raat mein tum chand se bhi haseen lag rahi thi
englishDialogue: On that moonlit night you were looking more beautiful than the moon

dialogue: Jab business chalana samajh ke bahar ho jaye ... toh business band kar dena chahiye
englishDialogue: When you can't understand how to run a business ... then you should close the business down

dialogue: Tumhari jaisi sauteli beti paane ke liye ... main hazaar sagi betiyan kurbaan kar doon
englishDialogue: To get a step daughter like you ... I am willing to sacrifice a thousand real daughters

dialogue: Bandook se kisi ki jaan li ja sakti hai ... kisi ka dil nahi jeet sakte
englishDialogue: You can take someones life with a gun ... you can't win someones heart with it

dialogue: Apun ke ghar mein aake, apun ko gaali deke, apun ko dhamkakar, apun ko badmash bolkar agar tum zinda khada hai na ... toh isse badke aur koi sharafat nahi ho sakti
englishDialogue: After coming into my house, after cursing me, after threatening me, after calling me a rowdy person if you're standing alive ... then there is no decency bigger than that

dialogue: Joh jisse pyar karta hai ... agar uske dil mein zara si bhi jagah pa le ... toh marke bhi nahi marta
englishDialogue: When you love someone ... and if you find even a small place in their heart ... then you won't die even after dying

dialogue: Himmat bandook uthake trigger dabane ke liye nahi ... himmat bandook phekne ke liye chahiye
englishDialogue: Courage is not needed to lift the gun and press the trigger ... courage is needed to throw away the gun

dialogue: Log ikke se jeette hai ... hum tujhe rani se jeetke dikhayenge
englishDialogue: People win with an ace ... I'll show you how I win with a queen

dialogue: Kaam khatam hone ke pehle jashn nahi manate ... nazar lag jati hai
englishDialogue: One must not celebrate before the work is complete ... it spells bad luck

dialogue: Ishq par zor nahin hai, hai yeh woh aatish Ghalib ... joh lagaye na lage, aur bujhaye na bujhe
englishDialogue: Love can't be tamed, it's like a fire that overpowers everything else ... at times it doesn't start even after many tries, but once it starts, it's very hard to extinguish

dialogue: Ab yeh case aayega mere under ... aur main karoonga iska encounter
englishDialogue: Now this case will come under me ... and I will do his encounter

dialogue: Duniya mein koi bhi gunaah itna bada nahi hota ki shama ke layak na ho ... aur na hi koi gunaah itna chota hai, ki usse nazarandaz kiya jaye
englishDialogue: No crime in this world is so big that it cannot be forgiven ... and neither is any crime so small that it can be ignored

dialogue: Aadmi apna dukh toh phir bhi bardaasht kar leta hai ... lekin apne dushman ka sukh ... hum mein choor choor kar deta hai
englishDialogue: We can tolerate our own sorrow ... but the happiness of our enemy ... breaks us apart

dialogue: Aankh ke badle aankh, haath ke badle haath aur dokhe ke badle murda
englishDialogue: An eye for an eye, a hand for a hand and a dead body for a betrayal

dialogue: Police ki vardi har koi pehen sakta hai ... lekin har koi police waala nahi hota
englishDialogue: Anyone can wear a police uniform ... but not everyone is a policeman

dialogue: Dushman jab sachcha aur imaandar ho ... toh savdhani aur zyada baratni padti hai
englishDialogue: When the enemy is true and honest ... then one must be extra careful

dialogue: Jabse is raaste pe kadam rakha hai na ... tabse kafan saath leke ghoomta hoon main
englishDialogue: Ever since I have stepped on this path ... since then I am carrying a shroud with me

dialogue: Khaadi pehenne se achche achchon ke paap dhul gaye
englishDialogue: Even the greatest have washed their sins by wearing cotton

dialogue: Today corruption is a part of our lives ... an honest man is a liability
englishDialogue: Today corruption is a part of our lives ... an honest man is a liability

dialogue: Tumsa koi aur is zameen pe hua, toh rab se shikayat hogi ... tumhe chahane waala koi aur hua, toh qayamat se pehle qayamat hogi
englishDialogue: If there is anyone like you on the earth, then I will complain to God ... and if there is someone else who loves you, then there will be a disaster before a disaster

dialogue: Zindagi mein sirf future hi nahi ... present bhi hota hai
englishDialogue: In life there is not only the future ... there is also the present

dialogue: Dilon ke mamle hote hi aaise hai ... yeh kab apne paas se doosre ke paas chala jaye ... pata hi nahi chalta
englishDialogue: The situations of the heart are like this only ... when they go from us to someone else ... we don't even come to know

dialogue: Tumhare paas sirf do raaste hain ... ek tumhe phansi ke phande tak pahuncha sakta hai ... doosra tumhe crorepati bana sakta hai
englishDialogue: You only have two choices ... one can take you to death ... and the other can make you a millionaire

dialogue: Climax ke pehle hi meri love story ka end ho gaya hai
englishDialogue: My love story has ended before the climax

dialogue: Mana ki duniya mein karodon bache aise hai jinke maa baap nahi hai ... magar is duniya mein karodon maa baap aise bhi hai jinki koi aulad nahi hai
englishDialogue: I agree that there are millions of children in this world that don't have parents ... but there are millions of parents also in this world that don't have any children

dialogue: Phere hone ke baad beti baap ke ghar nahi ... pati ke ghar jati hai
englishDialogue: After getting married a daughter does not go to her dads house ... she goes to her husbands house

dialogue: Aulad toh saath janam lekar bhi maa baap ka karz nahi utaar sakti
englishDialogue: Even after seven lives a child can't repay the debt to his parents

dialogue: Tere farz ne hum mein hazaar janam ke liye tera karzdaar bana diya
englishDialogue: Your duty has made us your debtor for a thousand lives

dialogue: Tumhari zindagi meri muthi mein hai ... chahun toh zindagi bhar na chhodun
englishDialogue: Your life is in my hands ... if I want, I won't let it go for life

dialogue: Fashion ki shuruvat Adam aur Eve se hui thi
englishDialogue: Adam and Even started fashion

dialogue: Aap saas bankar hamari zindagi mein aayi ... aur itna pyar diya ki hamari maa ban gayi
englishDialogue: You came in my life as a mother-in-law ... and you gave me so much love that you became my mother

dialogue: Jiske paas maa hai uske paas sab kuch hai ... jiske paas maa nahi uske paas kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: The one who has a mother has everything ... and the one who doesn't have a mother has nothing

dialogue: Apni aankhen dekhi hai? ... jidhar bhi dekhti hai ek rishta kayam kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Have you seen your eyes? ... wherever they see, they build a relationship

dialogue: No FIR, no arrest, no talk ... faisla on the spot
englishDialogue: No report, no arrest, no talk ... judgement on the spot

dialogue: Log jahan par soochna band kar dete hai ... main wahan se soochna shuru karta hoon
englishDialogue: Where people stop thinking ... I start thinking from there

dialogue: Aap mantri hai ... thik se rahoge toh salute karoonga ... thik se nahi rahoge toh shoot kar doonga
englishDialogue: You are a minister ... if you behave well I will salute you ... and if you don't behave well then I will shoot you

dialogue: Galat logon ko choote hi yeh haath ... hathyaar ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: On touching the bad people this hand ... becomes a weapon

dialogue: Tum ek aaisa buth ho ... jiske kadmo mein sipahi apni talwar, shahenshah apna taj aur insaan apna dil nikaal ke rakh de
englishDialogue: You are a statue ... in front of which a soldier drops his sword, a king drops his crown and a human drops his heart

dialogue: Joh apne upar yakeen nahi karte ... log unpar yakeen nahi karte
englishDialogue: Those who do not believe in themselves ... people do not believe in them

dialogue: Jab mujhe pyar se pyar tha, tab tum bahut pasand thi ... ab jab mujhe pyar hi pasand nahi, toh tum kaise pasand aaogi?
englishDialogue: When I was in love with love, then I liked you a lot ... and now that I don't like love itself, then how can I like you?

dialogue: Pyar amrit hota hai agar safal hua toh ... nahi toh wohi pyar zehar ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is immortal if it's successful ... or else that same love turns into poison

dialogue: Love is not heart of life ... it is only part of life
englishDialogue: Love is not heart of life ... it is only part of life

dialogue: Pyar aadmi ko pagal bana deta hai, deewana bana deta hai, khooni bana deta hai ... magar issi pyar ne mujh jaise pagal ko ek insaan bana diya
englishDialogue: Love makes a person go mad, makes him go crazy, makes him a killer ... but this love has made a mad person like me into a human

dialogue: Pyar ko jaane bina mar jaane se toh behtar hai ... ke hum us pyar ko jaankar usse bhool jaye
englishDialogue: Rather than dying without knowing your love ... it is better that we know about that love and forget about it

dialogue: Zindagi race ki tarah hai ... joh ghoda jeetta hai ussi ki izzat hoti hai
englishDialogue: Life is like a race ... where only the horse that wins gets respect

dialogue: Budhapa aake jaata nahi aur jawaani jaake aati nahi
englishDialogue: Old age doesn't go once it comes and youth doesn't come once it goes

dialogue: Pyar kisi ke dil mein pehda nahi kiya ja sakta ... pyar ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: You cannot grow love in someones heart ... love just happens by itself

dialogue: Chandni mein nahaye nadi ki tarah hai woh ... swarg se utari apsara hai woh
englishDialogue: She is like a river that has taken a bath in moonlight ... and she is a beauty that has come down from heaven

dialogue: Agar maine mutthi bandh kar li na ... toh todh ke rakh doonga
englishDialogue: If I close my hand ... then I will break you apart

dialogue: Tumhara pyar night long hai ... aur mera pyar life long hai
englishDialogue: Your love is night long ... and my love is life long

dialogue: Maa ka doodh toh har koi peeta hai ... lekin badi badnaseeb hoti hai woh maatayen joh tujh jaise sapole ko doodh pilati hai
englishDialogue: Everyone drinks mother's milk ... but those mothers are very unfortunate who feed milk to snakes like you

dialogue: Is samaaj ke bhediye ne unki izzat ki kagaz par vasna ki kali syahi se balatkar ka ghinauna itihaas likh diya
englishDialogue: This coyote of the society wrote the disgusting history of rape on the paper of her dignity with the black ink of his lust

dialogue: Izzat ke moti insaan ki aankhon ke samundar ka woh sailaab hota hai ... joh aasoon bankar tapakta hai
englishDialogue: The pearls of honour are floods from the sea of human eyes ... which flow in the form of tears

dialogue: Jab jab paapiyon ka bhav badta hai ... tab tab paapiyon ka papad banane koi na koi aa hi jaata hai
englishDialogue: Whenever the value of sinners rises ... then someone or the other comes to make a Papadum out of the sinners

dialogue: Mera naam hai Inspector Natwarlal Bhinde ... khata hoon che-che ande ... aur choron ko maarta hoon lambe chaude dande
englishDialogue: My name is Inspector Natwarlal Bhinde ... I eat six eggs ... and I beat the thieves with big sticks

dialogue: Hai aaj mere yaar ki shaadi magar main khush nahi hoon ... hai kisi ke pyar ki shaadi magar main khush nahi hoon ... maine roka usse, toka usse samjhaya bhi ... deke vaasta apni yaari ka manaya bhi ... uski rah ka patthar bana aur kaanta bhi ... phool banke uske samne murjhaya bhi ... le karke chal diya hai woh baharen dahej mein ... hai gul-e-gulzar ki shaadi magar main khush nahi hoon ... hai aaj mere yaar ki shaadi magar main khush nahi hoon ... hai kisi ke pyar ki shaadi magar main khush nahi hoon
englishDialogue: Today is my friends wedding but I'm not happy ... today is someone's love's wedding but I'm not happy ... I tried to stop him, question him and make him understand ... I even tried to persuade using the concern of our friendship ... I even became the stone and the thorn of his path ... I even withered as a flower in front of him ... but he walked taking the blossom of spring as dowry ... it's my best friends wedding but I'm not happy ... today is my friends wedding but I'm not happy ... today is someone's love's wedding but I'm not happy

dialogue: Kabhi nahi socha tumne ki saari umar jhule par tumhara haath thaame joh ladki baithi hai ... uska is poore jahan mein le deke bas ek dost hi kyun hai ... kabhi nahi socha ki jis ladki ne ek ladke ke saath bachpan se jawani tak ka safar tay kiya ... usse apni baki zindagi ke liye kisi aur ki zaroorat kyun hoti ... kabhi nahi socha ki us pagli ke liye uska woh ek hi dost kaafi tha ... woh ek hi ladka ... tum
englishDialogue: You never thought that the girl who is sitting holding your hand on the swing ... give or take, why does she have only one friend ... you never thought that the girl who has travelled the journey from childhood to youth along with one guy ... why would she need someone else for the rest of her life ... you never thought for that crazy girl, her one friend was more than enough ... that one guy ... you

dialogue: Kuch baatein kuch kho kar hi samajhi jaati hai
englishDialogue: Some things are understood only after you lose something

dialogue: Zindagi ke bade bade faisle in choti choti baaton se nahi liye jaate
englishDialogue: The big decisions of life should never be taken with these small things

dialogue: Purani cheezein kabhi dhokha nahi deti
englishDialogue: Old things never cheat

dialogue: Joh dil ki rah par chalta hai ... woh duniya badal sakta hai
englishDialogue: The one who walks on the path of his heart ... he can change the world

dialogue: Mujhe joh karna hai woh main akele nahi kar sakta ... mujhe woh maa chahiye joh mere sar par haath rakhkar kahe ... haan beta tu sahi hai, main tere saath hoon
englishDialogue: The thing that I want to do, I can't do it alone ... I need that mother who will keep her hand on my head and say that ... you are right my son, I am with you

dialogue: Mera cheese omelette toh uske samne nacheez omelette hai
englishDialogue: My cheese omelette is a nothing omelette in front of her

dialogue: Pyar ka matlab sirf pyar ka izhaar karna nahi hota ... pyar bina kuch kahe bhi, pyar hi hai ... pyar qurbani bhi hai ... pyar ek doosre ke liye chup rehna bhi hai ... pyar ka matlab sirf pyar ko pana nahi hai ... pyar kisi aur ki khushi ke liye, apni khushi mitana bhi hai
englishDialogue: Love doesn't just mean saying I love you to someone ... love is love even without saying anything ... love is also sacrifice ... love also means keeping quiet for each others sake ... love doesn't mean simply possessing ... love is also giving up your own happiness

dialogue: Apne itne aasani se thodi nah milte hai

dialogue: Agar purani yaadon ke saath rahoge ... toh nayi yaadein kaise pehda karoge?

englishDialogue: I believe in one thing ... that god has decided something or the other for each one of us ... and that he knows and he decides when, where, with whom and how will we meet

dialogue: Woh wahi hai joh kabhi kabhi mere khayalon mein aata hai ... jise soochkar hi muskurane ka mann karta hai ... jiski awaaz meri har saans pehchaanti hai ... dil ko ussi ka intezaar hai ... jise meri tarah pyar se pyar hai
englishDialogue: He is one who sometimes comes in my dreams ... thinking about whom I feel like smiling ... whose voice is recognized by every breathe of mine ...  my heart is waiting for him ... and just like me he loves to love

dialogue: Tumne bachpan se lekar aaj tak mujhe bahut khushiyan di hai ... har baar ek muskurahat khatam hone se pehle, ek nayi muskurahat di hai
englishDialogue: From childhood to date you have given me a lot of happiness ... every time before a smile ends, you have given me a new smile

dialogue: Patjhad ke baad aate hai din bahaar ke ... jeena kya jeevan se haar ke

englishDialogue: When you were small and couldn't speak ... then I could understand everything you said ... now you have become so big and you speak every word so clearly ... but I can't understand anything that you say

dialogue: Kai baar logon ke liye yeh faisla karna mushkil ho jaata hai ... ki hamara dil bada hai yah hamara bungla
englishDialogue: A lot of times people find it difficult to decide ... whether my heart is big or my bungalow

englishDialogue: You pray for yourself ... because if anything happens to her then I won't leave you

englishDialogue: The true color of men is known after marriage ... before marriage they are everywhere in the train, bus, crowd ... and after marriage they feel shy even to hug you

englishDialogue: 100% total dedication to one client ... start to finish no compromise ... mother promise

englishDialogue: Burning flames is called fire, after burning what is left is called ash ... and the ash used to make gunpowder, is called Raghav Prakash ... I'll start a fire and burn the sky ... in your memory my love I'll shake this world

englishDialogue: Everytime, every lady ... becomes your wife and my sister ... and your luck is bad?
