dialogue: Aadmi ki shakal achchi na ho na ... toh bhagwan kehta hai baatein achchi karni chahiye
englishDialogue: When a person doesn't have a good face ... then god says that he should talk good things

dialogue: America mein jao toh American milenge, Germany mein jao toh German milenge, France mein jao toh aapko Frenchmen milenge, England mein jao toh Englishmen milenge ... aur India mein jao toh aapko milenge Marathi, Gujarati, Punjabi, Malayali, Bengali ... Indian kahan hai?
englishDialogue: If you go to America you'll get Americans, if you go to Germany you'll get Germans, if you go to France you'll get Frenchmen, if you go to England you'll get Englishmen ... and if you go to India then you'll get Marathi, Gujarati, Punjabi, Malayali, Bengali ... where are the Indians?

dialogue: Is desh ka sabse bada shraap hai bureaucracy
englishDialogue: Bureaucracy is the biggest curse of this country

dialogue: Har insaan pehle Hindustani hai ... phir baad mein Musalman ya Hindu
englishDialogue: Every person is an Indian first ... then Muslim or Hindu

dialogue: Neetu Singh jab koi mission par nikalti hai toh kafan apne saath lekar chalti hai ... ya toh dushman ko pehna deti hai ... ya khud pehenkar desh par shaheed ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When Neetu Singh leaves on any mission she takes a shroud with her ... which she puts it on the enemy ... or else she puts it on herself and becomes a martyr for the country

dialogue: Main apne haath do hi waqt uthata hoon ... dua ke liye, joh mera imaan hai ... aur zulm ke khilaaf ladne ke liye, joh mera ishq hai
englishDialogue: I raise my hands only at two times ... once to pray, which is my faith ... and other to fight against injustice, which is my love

dialogue: Hussain ka ek ghoonsa ... aur teri khopdi ke bawees tukde
englishDialogue: One punch from Hussien ... and your brain will be in 22 pieces

dialogue: Jab main dushman ke saath haath milata hoon ... toh uske haath ki jeevan rekhayein mitt jaati hai
englishDialogue: When I shake hands with my enemy ... it erases his lifeline from his hands

dialogue: Mera muhafiz hai khuda, toh phir hai kaun joh mujhko utha sake ... teri kya aukaad hai, joh jahaan se mujhe mitta sake
englishDialogue: God is my guardian, so no one can kill me ... you don't have the status, to eradicate me from this world

dialogue: Teri dono life line khatam ho chuki hai ... ab teesri galati ki toh episode khatam
englishDialogue: Both your life lines are over ... if you make the third mistake then the episode will be over

dialogue: Lene ke baad dena toh padta hi hai bachchu
englishDialogue: My son, after taking you have to give

dialogue: Maut aankhon ke samne hoti hai na ... toh achchon achchon ki Gateway of India ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When death is front of the eyes ... then even the best of the best persons position, becomes like the Gateway of India

dialogue: Log apna paap dhone ke liye Haridwar jaate hai ... main toh khud Ganga ko tere pass leke aa raha hoon
englishDialogue: People go to Haridwar to get rid of their sins ... I'm myself bringing Ganga to you

dialogue: Main insaan par bharosa nahi karta ... technology mere liye kaafi hai
englishDialogue: I don't believe on human's ... technology is enough for me

dialogue: Dosti ki bhasha sabse alag hoti hai ... woh sirf dil ki baat sunti hai
englishDialogue: The language of friendship is different from all ... it listens only to the voice of heart

dialogue: Aapki umar aur aapke tajurbe se aapka rutba kahin badhkar hai
englishDialogue: Your status is bigger than your age and your experience

dialogue: It's not my hobby ... it's my passion
englishDialogue: It's not my hobby ... it's my passion

dialogue: Police waale mera naam sunke marte hai
englishDialogue: Cops die after hearing my name

dialogue: Do din, sirf do din deta hoon tujhe ... teesre din tera chautha hoga
englishDialogue: I am giving you two days, just two days ... otherwise there will be your death ceremony on the third day

dialogue: Jab tab Marcos kisi ko maarna nahi chahta, woh marta nahi ... aur jab maarna chahta hai, toh woh bachta nahi
englishDialogue: Until Marcos wants to kill someone, he doesn't die ... and when he wants to kill, then they cannot be saved

dialogue: I'm just a girl ... but with you I feel like a princess
englishDialogue: I'm just a girl ... but with you I feel like a princess

dialogue: Pyar kare toh mujhse kare ... is liye nahi kyun ki main usse pyar karta hoon
englishDialogue: She should love me for me ... not because I love her

dialogue: Zindagi mein jeet sirf ussi ki nahi hoti hai joh strong hota hai, tezz hota hai, chalaak hota hai ... anth mein jeet uski hoti hai joh apne upar vishvas kar sakta hai
englishDialogue: The ones who win in life aren't always the stronger, faster, clever ones ... in the end the one who wins is the one who believes in himself

dialogue: Is duniya mein do kisam ke log hote hai ... ek tumhare jaise joh cheezein banate hai aur ek mere jaise joh unhe bechte hai ... aur aaj ki duniya mein mere jaise log ke bina, tum jaise log kahin ke nahi hote
englishDialogue: In this world there are two types of people ... people like you who make things and people like me who sell those things ... and in today's world without people like me, people like you would be nowhere

dialogue: Is impossible pyar ko possible sirf tum hi bana sakte ho aur koi nahi
englishDialogue: This impossible love story can only be made possible by you and no one else

dialogue: Aankhen hai toh dekh le, nahi khulega gate ... aur bahut bookha pyasa hai, toh kahin aur jaake kha chocolate
englishDialogue: If you have eyes then see that this gate won't open ... and if you are hungry and thirsty a lot, then go somewhere else and eat a chocolate

dialogue: Akal shakal ke chakkar mein, jurm na ho sangeen ... hum toh mast vanar hai, kabhi na ho gangeen
englishDialogue: I hope no serious crime is committed in running behind the mind and the face ... I'm a happy monkey who will never be sad

dialogue: Madamji ko jeetne chale hai Dev Pratap ... saath hai Sanjeevani, khatam karenge paap
englishDialogue: Dev Pratap has left to win madam ... Sanjeevani is with him, and they'll finish the evil

dialogue: Power pehda karen hum log ... aur button dede un logo ke haath mein?
englishDialogue: We create the power ... and we should give the button to them?

dialogue: Rajneeti mein murde kabhi gaade nahin jaate ... unhe zinda rakha jaata hai ... taki time aane par woh bole
englishDialogue: In politics, the dead are never buried ... they are kept alive ... so that when the time comes, they can speak

dialogue: Aasmaan mein thookne waale ko shayad yeh pata nahin hai ... ki palat ke thook unhi ke chere par giregi
englishDialogue: The one who spits in the sky does not know ... that the spit in turn will fall on his face

dialogue: Karara jawaab milega!
englishDialogue: They will get a firm response!

dialogue: Joh humse pyar karte hai ... unka istamaal nahi kiya karte
englishDialogue: The people who love us ... we don't use them

dialogue: Raajneeti mein hamesha jeet ko maan milta hai
englishDialogue: Victory always gets the respect in politics

dialogue: Speed one terahertz, memory one zettabyte
englishDialogue: Speed one terahertz, memory one zettabyte

dialogue: Main dikhta ek insaan hoon par hoon ek machine
englishDialogue: I look like a human but I am a machine

dialogue: Manushya ki banayi hui do hi cheez kamaal ki hai ... ek main doosri tum
englishDialogue: Only two things made by humans are great ... one is me and other is you

dialogue: Kis liye lade jung, kis liye hai yeh hathyaar ... dushmano ko bhi bana de dost, aisa hai yeh pyar
englishDialogue: For whom should we fight, for whom are these weapons ... love is such a thing, that can turn enemies into friends

dialogue: Agar khud samne aa gaye toh bina dard ki maut doonga ... aur agar maine tumhe pakda toh woh maut badi khatarnak hogi
englishDialogue: If you come forward by yourself then I will give you a painless death ... but if I catch you then that death will be very dangerous

dialogue: Insaan ke marne ke liye jail se buri jagah aur aatma ke janam ke liye jail se achchi jagah duniya mein nahi hai
englishDialogue: In this world the jail is the worst place for a human to die and the best place for a spirit to be born

dialogue: Jab hum kisi zinda aadmi ke bare mein janane ki koshish karte hai toh uske janam se shuru karte hai ... aur jab kisi rooh ki bare mein janane ki koshish karte hai toh uske shareer ki mrityu se shuru karte hai
englishDialogue: When we try to find out about a living person then we start from their birth ... and when we try to find out about a spirit then we start from the death of their body

dialogue: Joh sapne dikhata hai woh sapno ko sach karne ki taqat bhi deta hai ... joh pyar karna sikhata hai woh pyar ko zinda rakhne ki himmat bhi deta hai
englishDialogue: The one who shows us the dreams also gives us the strength to make them true ... the one who teaches us how to love also gives us the courage to keep that love alive

dialogue: Subah hone se pehle andhera sabse ghana hota hai ... par woh andhera bhi subah ko rok nahi paata
englishDialogue: The darkness just before morning is the most dense ... but even that darkness can't stop the morning

dialogue: Joh sapne dikhata hai ... woh kabhi kabhi sapno ke saath neend bhi cheen leta hai
englishDialogue: The one who shows us the dreams ... sometimes he snatches the sleep along with the dreams

dialogue: Is raaste pe tumhe le jaana beshaq mere haath mein hai ... par vapas lana na tumhare haath mein hai, na mere
englishDialogue: It's definitely in my hands to take you on this path ... but coming back is neither in your hands, nor mine

dialogue: Life is not worth living ... till you don't have something to die for
englishDialogue: Life is not worth living ... till you don't have something to die for

dialogue: Joh shaap dene waala hai aur shaap paane waala hai woh toh duniya se chale jaate hai ... lekin shaap zinda rehta hai sadiyon tak ... generation after generation
englishDialogue: The one who gives the curse and the one who receives the curse do leave the world ... but the curse remains alive for many eras ... generation after generation

dialogue: Jeevan ko janne ke liye ... usse pehle jeena hoga
englishDialogue: To understand life ... you first have to live it

dialogue: Jeetne ke liye haarna bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To win, it is very important to lose

dialogue: Woh luck hi kya ... joh agli baar ka intezaar kare
englishDialogue: What good is the luck ... that has to wait for the next time

dialogue: I want to be defined by who I am ... not by what I own
englishDialogue: I want to be defined by who I am ... not by what I own

dialogue: Joh hai woh nahi hai ... aur joh nahi hai woh ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: The thing that is there, doesn't exist ... and the thing that is not there, can exist

dialogue: Itni dawaiyan kha raha hoon ki mera poora shareer ek chemist ki dukaan ban gaya hai
englishDialogue: I am eating so many medicines that my whole body has become a chemist shop

dialogue: Main ek pindari hoon ... ladna hamara karm hai, aur jeetna hamara dharm ... chahe woh desh ke liye ho, ya pyar ke liye
englishDialogue: I am a free army man ... fighting is my karma, and winning is my religion ... be it for country, or love

dialogue: Rajputana khoon mein itna ubaal hai ... ki agar aanch lag jaaye toh gori chamdi kaali padh jaaye
englishDialogue: The blood of a warrior has so much heat ... that if it catches fire then the white skin can burn and become black

dialogue: Main mere desh ke liye jaan de sakta hoon ... aur pyar ke liye jaan le sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I can give my life for my country ... and can take a life for love

dialogue: Hum sirf angrezon ka khoon peete hai
englishDialogue: I only drink blood of the Englishmen

dialogue: Agar mere desh ki taraf kisi ne aankh bhi uthayi ... toh Veer itni tabahi machayega joh aakaal aur bhukamp bhi nahi macha payenge
englishDialogue: If anyone even stares at my country ... then Veer will create so much destruction what even a famine and earthquake can't create

dialogue: Kamaan se nikla teer ... aur zabaan se nikli baat kabhi wapas nahi aati
englishDialogue: An arrow that leaves the bow ... and words that leave the mouth can never come back

dialogue: Jahan se bhi pakadta hoon ... paanch ser gosht nikaal leta hoon
englishDialogue: From wherever I'll hold you ... I'll remove 5 gms of flesh from there

dialogue: Kisi kisi chere par muskaan bahut achchi lagti hai
englishDialogue: A smile looks very good on some faces

dialogue: Kamzoron par taqat aazmana ... kamzoron ki taqat hai
englishDialogue: Applying power on weak people ... is the strength of weak people

dialogue: Hamara desh ek sone ki chidiya hai, jise aap log bech-bechkar, bech-bechkar apne pet mein dharna chahte ho ... phat jayega pet, mooh mein nahi aayegi chidiya ... kyun ki ab woh chidiya baaz ban chuki hai ... joh aapko noch-nochke, noch-nochke kha jayegi
englishDialogue: Our country is a golden bird which you guys have sold to feed your stomach ... your stomach will blow up, but this bird will not come in your mouth ... because now that bird has become an eagle ... who will tear you into pieces and eat you

dialogue: Aaj har lamha ek jeevan ki tarah jeeyenge
englishDialogue: Today we will live every moment like an entire life

dialogue: Inhe sirf todna aata hai bhook ke naam par, lalach ke naam par, bhasha ke naam par ... aur hum mein sirf batna aata hai dharm ke naam par, jaat ke naam par, raj ke naam par, raja ke naam par
englishDialogue: They only know to break in the name of hunger, in the name of greed, in the name of language ... and we only know how to divide in the name of religion, in the name of caste, in the name of rule, in the name of the king

dialogue: Pindari ka haath ... haath nahi loha hota hai
englishDialogue: The hand of a free army man is not a hand ... it is iron

dialogue: Ramchandra keh gaye Natwar se aaisa kalyug aayega ... dance bar mein raas rachega, casino mein lut jayega
englishDialogue: Lord Ram said to Natwar that such an age of vice will come ... where you'll dance in the dance bar, and you'll lose in the casino

dialogue: Jua mein jeetne ka koi formula nahi hota ... haan nahi harne ka ek formula hai ... (kya) ... jua mat khelo
englishDialogue: There is no formula to win in gambling ... but yes there is a formula for not losing ... (what) ... don't gamble

dialogue: Partnership sirf profit mein hi nahi ... loss mein bhi hoti hai
englishDialogue: A partnership happens not only in profit ... but in loss also

dialogue: Tumhare daddy drug dealer hai na? ... varna aaisi nasheeli cheez aur kaun bana sakta hai ... tumhe dekhte hi nasha chad gaya
englishDialogue: Your dad is a drug dealer right? ... or else who can produce such a highly intoxicating thing ... I am intoxicated by looking at you

dialogue: Lady luck se badkar koi luck nahi hota
englishDialogue: There is no luck bigger than lady luck

dialogue: Aapke daddy terrorist hai? ... varna aaisa sex bomb aur kaun bana sakta hai
englishDialogue: Is your dad a terrorist? ... or else who can produce such a sex bomb

dialogue: Bhikhari kitna bhi amir ho jaye, bheek maanga nahi chhodta ... vaise juari kitna bhi gareeb ho jaye, jua khelna nahi chhodta
englishDialogue: No matter how rich a beggar gets, he still doesn't let go begging ... just like that no matter how poor a gambler gets, he still doesn't let go gambling

dialogue: Insaaf ki laathi mein awaaz ho ya na ho ... timing badi zalim hoti hai
englishDialogue: Whether there is sound or not in the stick of justice ... it's timing is very cruel

dialogue: Sharaab bhi ajeeb cheez hai na ... dimaag band kar deti hai ... dil bolne lagta hai
englishDialogue: Alcohol is a very strange thing ... it closes the mind ... and the heart starts to talk

dialogue: Is tarah ki partyon mein kapde kya mainne rakhte hai ... jahan pe nasha chadne ke baad har koi apne kapde utaar deta hai
englishDialogue: Clothes don't matter in parties like these ... because everyone removes their clothes after getting intoxicated

dialogue: Mujhe samajh mein nahi aa raha hai ki main apni kismat pe hasun ... ya tumhari taqdeer par roun
englishDialogue: I don't know if I should laugh at my destiny ... or cry on your fate

dialogue: Pichla karza chukane ke liye hi toh agla karza maang raha hoon main
englishDialogue: I am asking for the next loan to pay-off my previous loan

dialogue: Models sirf tasveeron mein hi achchi dikhti hai ... woh bhi agar maine kheechi ho toh
englishDialogue: Models only look good in photos ... and that to only if I have clicked them

dialogue: Koi bhi aadmi kisi aurat ka naam yaad rakhne ke liye ... uske saath raat nahi guzarta hai
englishDialogue: No person spends a night with a woman ... to remember her name

dialogue: Don't start anything you can't finish
englishDialogue: Don't start anything you can't finish

dialogue: Ek chatt ke neeche rehne waale zaroori nahi ... kamre mein bhi saath mein rahe
englishDialogue: It's not necessary that people living under the same roof ... also live in the same room

dialogue: Suna hai ladkiyan tumhari zindagi mein film role ki tarah hoti hai ... role khatam, rishta khatam
englishDialogue: I've heard that girls are like a film role in your life ... once the role is over, the relationship is over

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi divorce mein shaadi se zyada sukoon milta hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes there is more peace in a divorce than that in a marriage

dialogue: Jahan sach na chale wahan jhoot sahi ... aur jahan haq na mile wahan loot sahi
englishDialogue: Say the lie where truth is not accepted ... and steal where you don't get your right

dialogue: Tu apne dimaag ko akal ka search warrant de ... aur agar phir bhi na maane toh gobar gas ka current de
englishDialogue: Give your head the search warrant for a brain ... and if it still doesn't agree then give it a current of methane gas

dialogue: Casino mein haseeno ke saath hum sabke paseeno ka paisa udake bhaag gaya
englishDialogue: He has blown away all our hard earned money with beautiful girls in the casino

dialogue: Bina dekhe, bina soche samjhe maine tujhe pyar kiya ... aur tune mere armaanon par dokhe ka vaar kiya
englishDialogue: I loved you blindly and without any thought ... and you attacked my wishes with deceit

dialogue: I love you ... do you love me? ... haan bolti toh you ... varna bahut hai in the queue
englishDialogue: I love you ... do you love me? ... are you saying yes ... or else there are many others in the queue

dialogue: Tum ladkiyan bhi na badi chalaak hoti ho ... jaanti sab ho lekin humse sunna chahti ho
englishDialogue: You girls are very smart ... you know everything but you want to listen from us

dialogue: London ka mausam aur London ki ladkiyan inka koi bharosa nahi hai ... yeh kabhi bhi rang badalte rehte hai
englishDialogue: The weather of London and the girls of London cannot be trusted ... they change their colours anytime

dialogue: Pyar mein sab kuch aasaan hota hai
englishDialogue: Everything is easy in love

dialogue: Tumhara saath chahiye zindagi bhar ke liye ... taki main tumhe itna pyar de sakon ... jitna is duniya mein hai hi nahi
englishDialogue: I need your companionship for the entire life ... so that I can give you so much love ... more than what is there in this world

dialogue: Main tumhara hoon aur hamesha rahoonga ... tum na meri thi aur na kabhi hogi
englishDialogue: I'm yours and I'll always be yours ... you were never mine and you'll never be mine

dialogue: Zindagi ka koi bharosa nahi hai ... lekin ek baat ka bharosa hai ... life insurance ka
englishDialogue: Life can't be trusted ... but there is one thing that can be trusted ... that is life insurance

dialogue: Haadse batakar nahi hote
englishDialogue: Tragedies don't inform and come

dialogue: Jis tarah Musalman ko pyari hai jumme ki namaz ... ussi tarah mujhe pyara hai jumme ko theater Delnaaz
englishDialogue: Just like the Friday prayer is important for a Muslim ... just like that I love theater Delnaaz on a Friday

dialogue: Jab tak rona dhona, sukh dukh hai tab tak maano zinda hai ... nahi toh saans toh chalegi lekin ehsaas mar jayega
englishDialogue: Until there is crying and sadness, till then understand that you're living ... without that you may be breathing but the feelings will die

dialogue: Jis maathe par ek baar kalank lag jaata hai ... wahan maang ka teeka shobha nahi deta
englishDialogue: A forehead that is marked with disgrace ... can't be adorned with a bindi (dot)

dialogue: Jahan satya hai wahan dharm hai ... aur jahan dharm hai wahan dhan hai
englishDialogue: Where there is truth there is religion ... and where there is religion there is money

dialogue: Mere liye Allah ka vardaan aur maata ka farmaan ... sab ek samaan hai
englishDialogue: For me the blessing of Allah and the order of goddess ... are all the same

dialogue: Kapdan par laga daag toh jaag aur sabun se mitt jaat hai ... par jawani par laga daag zindagi bhar nahi chutat hai
englishDialogue: The mark that is on the clothes can be erased with foam and soap ... but the mark that is on the youth will never go for life

dialogue: Bhuvan Panda gardan katwana pasand karta hai ... magar naak katwana asambhav
englishDialogue: Bhuvan Panda would prefer to get his neck slit ... but it's impossible for him to cut his dignity

dialogue: Zeher ka koi jaat nahi hota aur daru ka koi brand nahi hota ... daru chahe sasti ho chahe mehengi, nasha dono mein hota hai
englishDialogue: Poison has no caste and alcohol has no brand ... whether the alcohol is cheap or expensive, there is intoxication in both

dialogue: Bahar tumhari aunty bahut saare uncles ko lekar aayi hai
englishDialogue: Your aunt has bought a lot of uncles outside

dialogue: Kuch kaam aaise hote hai jin mein fayda yah nuksaan nahi dekha jaata ... bus unhe karna zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: There are a few things in which you don't look for profit or loss ... it is simply necessary to do them

dialogue: Mera intezaar toh gyarah mulkon ki police kar rahi hai lekin ... Don ko pakadna mushkil hi nahin ... namumkin hai
englishDialogue: Police from eleven countries are waiting for me but ... catching Don is not only hard ... it's impossible

dialogue: Don ke dushman ki sabse badi galati yeh hai ... ki woh Don ka dushman hai
englishDialogue: The biggest mistake of Don's enemy is that ... he is Don's enemy

dialogue: Mujhe do tarah ki ladkiyan pasand nahi aati ... ek woh joh mere pass aane mein bahut derr lagaye aur doosri woh joh bahut jaldi aa jaye
englishDialogue: I don't like girls of two types ... one who takes a lot of time to come to me and the other who comes to me very quickly

dialogue: Mujhe jahan pahunchna hai uske liye yeh raftaar bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: This speed is necessary for where I want to reach

dialogue: Log Don ko nahi ... duniya ko chhodte hai
englishDialogue: People don't leave Don ... they leave the world

dialogue: Mujhe junglee billiyan bahut pasand hai
englishDialogue: I like wild cats a lot

dialogue: Yeh tum janti ho ki yeh pistol khali hai ... main janta hoon ki yeh pistol khali hai lekin ... police nahin janti ki yeh pistol khali hai
englishDialogue: You know that this pistol is empty ... I know that this pistol is empty but ... police does not know that this pistol is empty

dialogue: Dil ki aawaz kaano se nahi dil se suni jaati hai
englishDialogue: The voice of the heart is heard from the heart, and not from the ears

dialogue: Dost nahi badalte ... waqt badal jaata hai
englishDialogue: Friends don't change ... time changes

dialogue: Haan main cheating karta tha, par sirf khel mein ... tune toh zindagi ko khel samajh ke mujhe cheat kar diya
englishDialogue: Yes I used to cheat, but only in a game ... but you've cheated me by considering life as a game

dialogue: Matlab nikal gaya toh pehchante hi nahi ... ladki kya mili hum mein jaante hi nahi
englishDialogue: Now that your work is done you don't even recognize me ... you've got the girl, so you don't even know me

dialogue: Yeh sach hai ki jagah ki dooriyan ... aksar dilon ki nazdikiyan ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: It is true that the distance between places ... often turns into the closeness of the hearts

dialogue: Paramparaon ki lakeerein jab dhundli padh jaati hai ... toh nayi lakeerein kheenchne se parhez nahi karna chahiye
englishDialogue: When the lines of traditions become blurred ... then you should not hesitate from pulling new lines

dialogue: Pyar mein waqt ki koi seema nahi hoti
englishDialogue: There is no limit of time in love

dialogue: Aksar yeh bhi hota hai ki jagah ki dooriyan ... rishton ko aur bhi mazboot bana deti hai
englishDialogue: Often it happens that the distance between places ... makes the relationships much more stronger

dialogue: Rangeen kapde pehenne se zindagi ke khoye rang vapas nahi aate
englishDialogue: Just by wearing colourful clothes the colour of life doesn't come back

dialogue: Kisi ko khush karne ke liye samjhauta karna insaan ki sabse badi kamzori hoti hai
englishDialogue: Compromising to make someone happy is the biggest weakness of a person

dialogue: After every sunset there's a sun rise ... ek naya din, ek nayi umeed, ek nayi shuruvat
englishDialogue: After every sunset there's a sun rise ... a new day, a new hope, a new start

dialogue: Beeta hua kal toh ek khwab hai ... uska na koi chehra hota hai na wajood hota hai ... sach toh sirf tumhara aaj hai aur tumhara aane waala kal
englishDialogue: The time that has passed is a dream ... it has no face and no existence ... only your present and your future is the truth

dialogue: Sirf saansein lene ko jeena nahi kehte
englishDialogue: Just breathing is not called as living

dialogue: Jis din main baap ban gaya na ... main apne bachche se chun chun ke gin gin ke badle loonga
englishDialogue: The day I become a father ... I will take proper revenge from my children one after the other

dialogue: Mere liye zindagi mein na pyar ki jagah badal sakti hai na dosti ki ... dono ki jagah alag alag hai ... lekin tumne to dosti mein hi pyar ki milavat shuru kar di
englishDialogue: Neither the place of love and neither the place of friendship can change for me ... both have different places ... but you've started to mix love with friendship

dialogue: Yeh kambakht mohabbat hai hi badi musibat waali cheez ... aksar imtehaan leti hai ... lekin khushiyan bhi deti hai
englishDialogue: This unfortunate love is a very troublesome thing ... often it takes a test ... but it also gives happiness

dialogue: Kisi bhi insaan ki zindagi mein woh din, woh pal, sabse zyada khushgawar hota hai ... jab uska beta uski zimedariyan baantne lage ... uski kursi par baithe
englishDialogue: In any person's life that day, that moment, is the most happiest ... when his son starts to share his responsibilities ... and takes his seat

dialogue: Bahu ko beti manna agar pagalpan hai, toh main pagal hoon ... uske aasoon pochna agar pagalpan hai, toh main pagal hoon ... uski andheri zindagi mein khushiyon ki roshni bharna agar pagalpan hai, toh haan main pagal hoon
englishDialogue: If considering a daughter-in-law as a daughter is madness, then I am mad ... if wiping her tears is madness then, I am mad ... if pouring the light of happiness in her dark life is madness, then yes I am mad

dialogue: Dil ke maamle mein dimaag ka istemaal nahi karna chahiye ... uljane badh jaati hai ... dil ke mamle mein dil ka istemaal karna chahiye
englishDialogue: You should not use your mind when it comes to the heart ... because problems will grow ... you should use your heart when it comes to the heart

dialogue: This is a race between man and machine ... he may have the better machine but I'm a better man
englishDialogue: This is a race between man and machine ... he may have the better machine but I'm a better man

dialogue: Kya yeh theek hai ki paramparaen banane waala insaan hi paramparaon ki bali chadta rahe ... paramparaen jeeye insaan marta rahe ... paramparaen badi zindagi kuch bhi nahi hai?
englishDialogue: Is it ok that the people who made the traditions are being killed by it ... traditions live and people keep dying ... traditions are big and life is nothing?

dialogue: Kya koi kisi se itna pyar kar sakta hai ki uski jaan lele?
englishDialogue: Can a person love someone so much that he can take that persons life?

dialogue: Dhokhe ke baad kisi na kisi ka marna zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: After a betrayal it is a must for someone to die

dialogue: Chori jiske naam se hoti hai ... loot bhi us hi ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: The name under which the robbery happens ... the stolen goods also belong to that person

dialogue: Shuruvat se dekhne ka shaunk hai mujhe ... chahe woh film ho yah chori
englishDialogue: I like to see from the start ... be it a film or a robbery

dialogue: Chor ko sirf chori karte hue pakda ja sakta hai ... na uske pehle, na uske baad
englishDialogue: A thief can only be caught while he is stealing ... not before that, not after that

dialogue: Is gun ki partner yeh goli hai ... kabhi dhokha nahin deti ... jahan jati hai jaan leke rehti hai
englishDialogue: This guns partner is this bullet ... it never betrays ... wherever it goes it takes a life

dialogue: Akela chor kisi ko dhokha nahin de sakta ... khud ko bhi nahin
englishDialogue: A single thief cannot betray anyone ... not even himself

dialogue: Joh pyar karta hai woh jaan leta nahin ... jaan deta hai
englishDialogue: One who loves does not take a life ... gives the life

dialogue: Insaan aur goli ki race mein ... jeet hamesha goli ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: In a race between a human and a bullet ... the bullet always wins

dialogue: Are you like checking me out?
englishDialogue: Are you like checking me out?

dialogue: Parchai bolti kahan hai ... sirf chalti hai chup chap
englishDialogue: Shadow does not talk ... it only walks silently

dialogue: Sikka tumhara par baazi meri
englishDialogue: The coin is yours but the game is mine

dialogue: Mera kaam choron ko pakadna hai ... unka shikaar karna nahin
englishDialogue: My job is to catch robbers ... not to hunt them

dialogue: Chor ki sachchai sirf ek chor jaan sakta hai
englishDialogue: Only a thief can know the truth of a thief

dialogue: Gusse se dekh rahi ho yah shakal hi aaisi hai
englishDialogue: Are you staring with anger or is your face like this only

dialogue: Challis saal ki shaadi shuda zindagi ke baad bhaagwaan ...  pati patni ko sirf goli maar sakta hai ... seetti nahi
englishDialogue: Oh my beloved wife, after 40 years of married life ... a husband can only fire a bullet at his wife ... he can't whistle at her

dialogue: Soone ke liye chaddar ki nahi ... neend ki zaroorat hai
englishDialogue: To sleep one doesn't need a blanket ... one needs sleep

dialogue: Hasne waalon ke saath toh duniya hasti hai ... lekin rone waala akele hi rota hai
englishDialogue: The world laughs with those who laugh ... but the one who cries, cries alone

dialogue: Sapno aur sachai mein bahut farak hota hai ... sapne toh ghar ke andar hote hai aur sachai toh darwaze pe dastak deti hai
englishDialogue: There is a lot of difference between dreams and reality ... dreams stay inside the house and reality knocks on the door

dialogue: Jab badle ki baat aati hai ... toh Dubai return Rana jail se bhi return aa sakta hai
englishDialogue: When it comes to revenge ... then Dubai return Rana can even return from jail

dialogue: Jab badi machli ko phaasna hai toh pehle choti machli ko phaanso ... badi machli khud-ba-khud chali aayegi
englishDialogue: When you want to catch a big fish then first catch a small fish ... the big fish will come by itself

dialogue: Yeh cricketeron waale naam safe nahi hote ji ... kal ko woh run banane band karega ... log jootiyan isko marenge
englishDialogue: These names of cricketers are not safe ... tomorrow if they stop scoring runs ... then people will hit him with shoes

dialogue: Tere har question ka agar dunga jawaab ... toh samajh le teri zindagi ho jayegi kharab
englishDialogue: If I answer all your questions ... then understand that your life will become a waste

dialogue: Mil gaya mauka ... maar de chauka
englishDialogue: You've got a chance ... make the most out of it

dialogue: Purane joh ho jaate hai bhav woh khaate hai ... is liye aksar hum naye ko aazmate hai
englishDialogue: Those who become old they have an attitude ... that's why I often try new people

dialogue: Jinhe woh aazmate hai, star woh ban jaate hai ... dilon mein zamaane ki, aag woh lagate hai
englishDialogue: Whoever he tries, they become stars ... and they burn the fire of the generation in the hearts of the people

dialogue: Idhar bhi barbaadi, udhar bhi barbaadi ... arre bedardi tu karle is se shaadi
englishDialogue: There is destruction here, there is destruction there ... have some sympathy and marry her

dialogue: Ehsaas badal jaane se taqdeer badal nahi jaati
englishDialogue: Destiny doesn't change when emotions change

dialogue: Teri zindagi mein latke hue the itne angoor ... aur Roma tu pakad ke lai yeh langoor
englishDialogue: Roma you had so many grapes hanging in your life ... and you've caught this monkey

dialogue: Har khoobsurati taarif ke liye nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Every beauty is not made for appreciation

dialogue: Kabu rakh apni jawani pe ... full stop lag gaya kahani pe
englishDialogue: Control your youth ... since there is a full stop on the story

dialogue: No if, no but ... keep your mouth shut!
englishDialogue: No if, no but ... keep your mouth shut!

dialogue: Humse door jaoge kaise, dil se hum mein bhulaoge kaise ... hum woh khushboo hai joh saason mein bastein hai, khud ki saason ko rok paoge kaise
englishDialogue: How can you stay away from me and go, how can your heart forget me ... I am that fragrance which lives in the breath, how will you stop your breath

dialogue: Kehte hai pyar mein neend udh jaati hai ... koi humse bhi mohabbat kare ... kambhakt neend bahut aati hai
englishDialogue: They say one can't sleep in love ... I wish someone loved me to ... bloody I am very sleepy

dialogue: Phool hoon gulaab ka chameli ka mat samajhna ... aashiq hoon aapka apni saheli ka mat samajhna
englishDialogue: Don't judge me as jasmine I am a rose flower ... don't judge me as your friends lover I am yours

dialogue: Tere dil mein meri saanson ko panaah mil jaye ... tere ishq mein meri jaan fanaa ho jaye
englishDialogue: If my breath found a place in your heart ... I can get destroyed in your love

dialogue: Bekhudi ki zindagi hum jiya nahi karte ... jaam doosron se cheenkar hum piya nahi karte ... unko mohabbat hai toh aakar izhaar karen ... peecha hum bhi kisika kiya nahi karte
englishDialogue: I don't live the life of the selfless ... nor do I grab and drink another's wine ... if she has love let her come and declare it ... I don't follow anyone

dialogue: Aag suraj mein hoti hai, jalna zameen ko padta hai ... mohabbat nigahein karti hai, tadapna dil ko padta hai
englishDialogue: The fire is in the sun, but the earth has to burn ... the eyes fall in love, but the heart has to suffer

dialogue: Bhool karke agar humse koi bhool hui ho, toh bhool samajhkar bhula dena ... lekin bhulana sirf bhool ko, galati se bhi hum mein na bhula dena
englishDialogue: If I have done any mistake unknowingly, then think of it as a mistake and forget it ... but forget only the mistake, don't forget me in error

dialogue: Pani se pyaas nah bhuji toh maikhane ki taraf chal nikla ... soocha shikayat karoon teri khuda se ... par khuda bhi tera aashiq nikla
englishDialogue: When I couldn't quench my thirst with water then I went towards the bar ... thought I would complain to God about you ... but even God turned out to be your lover

dialogue: Aisa laga khuda ne rakh diya hamare dil pe haath ... liya naam hamare unhone kuch aisi ada ke saath
englishDialogue: I felt as if God kept his hand on my heart ... when she took my name with such a style

dialogue: Dard se aankhen chaar kar lenge, hum bhi imtihaan de denge ... teri dosti ke khatir aye dost, hum dushmano se bhi pyar kar lenge
englishDialogue: I'll look at pain square in the eyes, even I will take the test ... for the sake of your friendship dear friend, I'll even love my enemies

dialogue: Jaan usse do joh apna dil tumhe de ... lekin apna guroor sirf us pe kurbaan karo ... joh tumhare pyar mein fanaa ho jaye
englishDialogue: Give your life for someone who gives his heart for you ... but sacrifice your pride only for someone ... who can perish in your love

dialogue: Agar andha hota, toh duniya ki sabse haseen cheez dekh nahi pata ... aap
englishDialogue: If I was blind, then I would not have seen the most beautiful thing in the world ... you

dialogue: Insaan ki khwaish ki koi inteha nahi ... do gaz zameen chahiye do gaz kafan ke baad
englishDialogue: There is no limit to a humans desire ... one needs two yards of land after two yards of shroud

dialogue: Tumhari khoobsurati ne khuda se khatta kara di ... kahin khud se nazar na lag jaye ... yunkar tumhe nazar na di
englishDialogue: God made a mistake on your beauty ... so that he doesn't cast the spell of bad luck on you ... he made you blind

dialogue: Sharaab peene de masjid mein bahetkar ghalib ... yah woh jagah dikha de jahan khuda na ho
englishDialogue: Let me sit in God's house and drink alcohol ... or else show me a place where God doesn't exist

dialogue: Adhoori saans thi, dhadkan adhoori thi, adhoore hum ... magar ab chaand poora hai falak pe ... aur ab poore hai hum
englishDialogue: My breathe was incomplete, my heartbeat was incomplete, I was incomplete ... but now there is a full moon in the sky ... and now I am complete

dialogue: Behti hai hoton ko seekar, pachtayengi aap ... ishq jaag uthta hai aksar, aaisi khamoshi ke baad
englishDialogue: You are sitting with your lips sealed, you will repent ... usually love rises, after such silence

dialogue: Na shehar dekho na biyabaan dekho ... khuda ka eklauta naam-o-nishaan dekho ... bas aankh uthao aur Rehan dekho
englishDialogue: Don't look at the city and the desert ... look at the only sign of God ... just look up and look at Rehan

dialogue: Hum aaj joh faisla karte hai ... wahi hamare kal ka faisla karega
englishDialogue: The decisions that we take today ... decide what our future will be

dialogue: Kaash mein oon ka gola hota ... aur unki ungliyon mein lipta hota
englishDialogue: I wish I was a roll of wool ... and I would have been tied up in her fingers

dialogue: Sahi aur galat ke beech faisla karna bahut aasaan hai ... lekin do sahi raasto mein se behtar chunana aur do galat raasto mein se munasif ... yahi hamari zindagi ke faisle karte hai
englishDialogue: It's easy to choose between right and wrong ... but to choose the better of two right paths and the worse of two wrong paths ... these things make the decisions of our lives

dialogue: Tujhe is bazaar ka dastoor main samjha nahi sakta ... bik gaya joh woh khareedar ho nahi sakta
englishDialogue: I cannot explain you the practice of this market ... one who gets sold, cannot be the buyer

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi ek aadmi ka sahi ... doosre ka galat ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the rightness of one person ... can become the wrongness of another

dialogue: Pyar kabhi kabhi aadat ban jaata hai ... lekin tum sirf ek aadat nahi ab meri zaroorat ban chuke ho
englishDialogue: Love sometimes can turn into a habit ... but you're not only a habit, you've become my necessity

dialogue: Romance time dekh karke todhi na aata hai ... romance bhi divorce ki tarah ho jaata hai bas
englishDialogue: Romance doesn't happen looking at the time ... romance also happens by itself, just like divorce

dialogue: Hum logon se yunhi nahi milte ... hum unhi se milte hai jinse hum mein milna hota hai
englishDialogue: We don't meet people just like that ... we only meet those people whom we are supposed to meet

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi dosti mohabbat ki jagah le leti hai ... aur phir mohabbat ke liye jagah hi nahin rehti
englishDialogue: Sometimes friendship takes over the place of love ... and then love has no place left

dialogue: Pati patni sirf bistar nahin baantte ... zindagi baantte hai
englishDialogue: Husband wife not only share the bed ... they share life

dialogue: Main tumse maafi maange ka haq toh kho chuka hoon ... par tumhe dua dena ka haq nahin khona chahta
englishDialogue: I have lost the right to apologize to you ... but I don't want to lose the right to bless you

dialogue: Alvida nahin ... alvida kehne se phir milne ki umeed mar jaati hai ... kya pata phir milen
englishDialogue: No bye ... saying bye kills the hope of meeting again ... who knows we might meet again

dialogue: Sochkar kaun shaadi karta hai?
englishDialogue: Who thinks and gets married?

dialogue: Khush rehte hain bachche jab saaf rehte hain kachche
englishDialogue: A child will be happy when clean is his nappy

dialogue: Ajnabiyon ki baat sun leni chahiye ... kabhi kabhi ajnabi apno se zyada jaante hain
englishDialogue: You should listen to strangers ... sometimes strangers know more than our near-ones

dialogue: Mohabbat ke zamaane guzar gaye janaab ... ab chote mote pyar se hi kaam chala lijiye aap
englishDialogue: Sir, the age of love is over ... you should now work it out with a small affair

dialogue: Main kisi se advice nahi leta ... lekin doosron ko advice dene ke liye hamesha tayaar rehta hoon
englishDialogue: I don't take advice from anyone ... but I am always ready to give advice to others

dialogue: Tumhe kis baat pe zyada gussa aata hai ... apni nakaamyabi se ... ya meri kaamyabi par?
englishDialogue: What gets you angry more ... your failure ... or my success?

dialogue: Main nakaamyab hoon yeh sach hai .... par jaanti ho, is ghar mein mujhse bhi nakaamyab kya hai? ... hamara rishta ... hamari shaadi
englishDialogue: It is true, I am unsuccessful ... but do you know, what is more unsuccessful in this house? ... our relationship ... our marriage

dialogue: Waqt ka matlab hota hai, ab ... pyar karna hai, toh ab ... maafi maangna hai, toh ab ... haath pakadna hai, toh ab
englishDialogue: The meaning of time is, now ... if you want to love, then now ... if you want to apologize, then now ... if you want to hold hands, then now

dialogue: Tumne mujhse shaadi ki hi nahin ... samjauta kiya hai
englishDialogue: You never married me ... you did a compromise

dialogue: Haddein jitni zyada hongi ... unke tootne ka darr bhi utna hi hoga

dialogue: Pyar toot jaye toh sirf dukh hota hai ... par vishvas toot jaye toh sab kuch khatam ho jata hai

dialogue: Tumhare intezaar mein aasoon bhi sookh gaye ... joh sapne sanjoye, sare toot gaye

dialogue: Hum dono ek doosre se kabhi door nahi reh sakte ... kyun ki hum ek doosre ke dil mein rehte hai, ek doosre ki dhadkan mein baste hai, yaadon mein jeete hai
englishDialogue: We both can never stay away from each other ... because we stay in each others heart, settle in each others heartbeat and live in each others memories

dialogue: Main tumhe bhool jaon, yeh mumkin nahi ... aur tum mujhe bhool jao, yeh main kabhi hone nahi doongi
englishDialogue: It is not possible that I'll forget you ... and I'll never let you forget me

dialogue: Bhujne ke saath joh khatam ho jaye woh hawas hoti hai ... par tripti ke baad jab pyas badh jaati hai ... woh pyar hota hai

dialogue: Pachtava bahut aasaan hai ... lekin prayashchit karna bahut mushkil

dialogue: Tumhe har haal mein guzre huye kal aur guzre huye pal ko bhoolna hoga

dialogue: Jis rishtey ko bandhan mein baandne ki zaroorat pade na ... woh rishta nahi kehlata ... aur jis rishtey ki neev vishvas ho ... us rishtey ko kisi bhi naam ki zaroorat nahi padti
englishDialogue: A relationship that needs to be tied up in a bond ... is not a relationship ... and a relationship that is built on trust ... that relationship doesn't need any name

dialogue: Jab koi apna hi dil todhta hai ... toh jeena bahut mushkil ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When someone dear to us breaks our heart ... then living becomes very difficult

dialogue: Arre baba wrong number hai toh uthati kaiko hai re?
englishDialogue: If its a wrong number then why do you pick it up?

dialogue: Amir aadmi pandhra minute mein apne kapde badalta hai, aadhe ghante mein apna ghar badalta hai, ek ghante mein apna dhanda badalta hai ... aur do ghante mein apni biwi badalta hai
englishDialogue: A rich man changes his clothes in 15 minutes, changes his house in half an hour, changes his business in an hour ... and in a couple of hours changes his wife

dialogue: Har dhoti pehenne waala Gandhi nahi hota
englishDialogue: Everyone who wears a loincloth is not Gandhi

dialogue: Iske mooh mein pehdaishi supari hai ... yeh totla hai
englishDialogue: He has a nut in his mouth since birth ... he stammers

dialogue: Yahan ki pani puri, poore Mumbai mein world famous hai
englishDialogue: The pani puri out here, is world famous in entire Mumbai

dialogue: Ek ladki ka diya hua dard ... doosri ladki hi mitta sakti hai
englishDialogue: The pain given by a girl ... can only be treated by another girl

dialogue: Delhi ki ladkiyan aaisi dress karti hai ... jaise har roz Diwali ho
englishDialogue: Girls from Delhi dress up as if ... it is Diwali everyday

dialogue: Dude, you're a man ... tujhe hamesha coffee peene ke mood mein hona chahiye ... it's what we do, it's our tradition, it's what men do
englishDialogue: Dude, you're a man ... you should always be in the mood to have coffee ... it's what we do, it's our tradition, it's what men do

dialogue: Pyar ka sabse bada side effect ... shaadi
englishDialogue: The biggest side effect of love is ... marriage

dialogue: Jab main tumhare saath bike pe chalti hoon ... toh phir dil aaise karta hai ki road kabhi khatam hi na ho ... bas tum aur main, main aur tum, chalte jaye chalte jaye ... aur manzil kabhi na aaye
englishDialogue: When I go on the bike with you ... then my heart wishes that the road never ends ... just you and me, me and you, keep going ... and the destination never comes

dialogue: Pehle police ka naam sunkar gunde bhaagte the ... ab police ka naam sunkar public bhaagti hai
englishDialogue: Before goons used to run by hearing the name of police ... nowadays the public runs by hearing the name of police

dialogue: Jab apun khada ... toh sarkar se bada!
englishDialogue: When I stand ... I'm taller than the government!

dialogue: Zindagi murdajali ka naam hai ... zinda dil kya khaak jeete hai
englishDialogue: Life is the name of apathy ... the people with enthusiasm hardly live their life

dialogue: Jiska dushman zinda hai, uski maut zinda hai ... jisne apne dushman ko maar diya, usne apni maut ko maar diya
englishDialogue: The one whose enemy is alive, his death is alive ... the one who has killed his enemy, that person has killed his death

dialogue: Hum kisi sarhad ko nahi mante ... hum kisi mulk ko bhi nahi mante ... hum sirf yeh jante hai ki uparwaale ne sirf ek hi zameen banayi hai ... aur us pe sarhaden insaan ne banayi hai
englishDialogue: We don't believe in any border ... we also don't believe in any country ... we only know that god has made only one earth ... and humans have made boundaries on it

dialogue: Shaadi is mind blowing ... sometimes blowing mind
englishDialogue: Marriage is mind blowing ... sometimes it blows your mind

dialogue: Pyar aur aulad ke bina insaan kabhi khush nahi rehta
englishDialogue: A person can never be happy without love and a child

dialogue: Tu apne crore pe, main apne road pe ... maaze karenge
englishDialogue: You be with your money, I'll be with my road ... we'll have fun

dialogue: Shivaji ke paas ek horse ka power tha, aur unka ghoda hawa ke saath baat karta tha ... tere paas athrah horse ka power hai, gear mein dhal aur bol ... Jai Maharashtra!
englishDialogue: Shivaji had the power of one horse and his horse would talk with the air ... you have 18 horsepowers, put the car in the gear and say ... Jai Maharashtra!

dialogue: Saala khud marna hai toh marr na ... doosre ki kaiko vaat lagata hai
englishDialogue: Bloody if you want to die, then die ... why are you screwing others

dialogue: Har koi subah nikalta hai soochke ki aaj kuch achcha hoga ... raat tak bas booch achcha beheta hai
englishDialogue: Everyone leaves in the morning thinking something good will happen today ... but till the night they only get screwed in a good way

dialogue: Tumhe lagta hai jab tak duniya nahi badlegi tum nahi badloge ... lekin sach toh yeh hai ki, jab tak tum nahi badalte tab tak duniya nahi badalne waali
englishDialogue: You think that until the world changes you won't change ... but the reality is that until you change, the world will not change

dialogue: Baniye ke bill ki tarah tumhari harkatein bhi bhadti ja rahi hai
englishDialogue: Your acts are also increasing like the grocers bill

dialogue: Mumbai nagariya, maya ki nagariya ... idhar har type ka aadmi milta hai ... aur har aadmi ka alag alag type se vaat lagta hai
englishDialogue: Mumbai city, the alluring city ... here you'll get a person of every type ... and every person gets screwed in various types of ways

dialogue: Yeh Bombay hai ... yahan time ka matlab hai paisa ... mujhe tees minute journey teen minute mein poori karni hai
englishDialogue: This is Bombay ... here time means money ... I want to complete a 30 minute journey in 3 minutes

dialogue: Isko toh electrician hona chahiye tha ... har baat pe fuse udhta hai saale ka
englishDialogue: He should have been an electrician ... bloody his fuse blows off on everything

dialogue: Main bhi wohi karta hoon joh upar waala kehta hai ... woh nahi joh yeh upar waale kehte hai
englishDialogue: I do what God tells me ... and not what these people above me tell me

dialogue: Hum gunde hai aur jab tak hum hamare andar ke gunde ko khatam nahi karenge ... tab tak samaaj mein gundagardi khatam nahi hogi
englishDialogue: We are goons and until we eliminate the goon within us ... till then rowdyism in the society will not end

dialogue: Sakht kanoon banane se nahi ... kanoon ka sakhti se paalan karne se hi atyachar kam honge
englishDialogue: Not by making stricter laws ... but injustice will reduce by following the laws in a strict manner

dialogue: Bimari aur jurm ... chupane se dono badte hai
englishDialogue: Disease and crime ... they both grow when you hide them

dialogue: Life mein kisi ka pyar kam nahi hota hai ... sirf hamari umeedein zyada hoti hai
englishDialogue: In life no one loves less ... it's just that our hopes keep increasing

dialogue: Yeh dharti roh rahi hai, yeh aasman roh raha hai ... nonsense yeh sab kya ho raha hai?
englishDialogue: The land is crying, the sky is crying ... this is nonsense, what's going on?

dialogue: When I'm good, I'm good ... when I'm bad, I'm better
englishDialogue: When I'm good, I'm good ... when I'm bad, I'm better

dialogue: Ab ishq waalon ki duniya hogi tehas-nehas ... jab ghar ghar pahunchega yeh MMS
englishDialogue: Now the world of lovers will get destroyed ... when this MMS (video message) will reach every house

dialogue: Kya cheez hai Mumbai, aamchi Mumbai ... woh vada pav ki chutney, woh Mahim ki phirni, woh local train ke dhakke, woh signal pe chakke ... woh traffic, woh kooda, woh kachra, woh auto taxi ka nakhra ... woh machi waali ka jhagda, woh bhel, woh pani-puri, woh ragda ... woh Wadala, woh Chakala, woh Bandra, kahin Sakku bai toh kahin Sandra ... woh aunty ka adda, saala main road pe hich khadda ... yaar jaisa bhi hai ... aamchi Mumbai toh aamchi hai yaar
englishDialogue: What a great place Mumbai is, our Mumbai ... the chutney of vada pav, the phirni (sweet) of Mahim, the pushing in the local trains, the eunuchs at a traffic signal ... the traffic, the garbage, the trash, the tantrums of rickshaw and taxi ... the fight with the fish lady, the bhel, the pani-puri, the ragda ... places like Wadala, Chakala, Bandra, somewhere there is the maid Sakku and somewhere there is Sandra ... the aunt's location, bloody the pothole on the main road ... my friend however it is ... our Mumbai is our own

dialogue: Zindagi par jitna shak karoge ... zindagi tumhe utna hi tang karegi
englishDialogue: The more you doubt life ... the more life will trouble you

dialogue: Yeh zindagi ke mele duniya mein kam na honge ... of course hum na honge, almost hum na honge, at the most hum na honge
englishDialogue: The fair's of life will not reduce in the world ... but of course we won't be there, almost we won't be there, at the most we won't be there

dialogue: Maine tujhko pyar kiya, tere baap ne mujhko peeta ... tann ki shakti, mann ki shakti Bournvita
englishDialogue: I loved you, and your father beat me up ... and Bournvita gives you strength for the body and the heart

dialogue: Begani shaadi mein Abdullah deewana ... begane shootout mein jaan mat gawana
englishDialogue: Just like an uninvited guest in a wedding ... don't lose your life in an unwanted shootout

dialogue: Le pakad khambha ... do ghoont mein tujhe dikhne lagegi Menaka aur Rambha
englishDialogue: Here, hold the alcohol bottle ... take two sips and you'll see Menaka and Rambha

dialogue: Draupadi ki saree keechna Dushasan ko pada bhari ... saree mein saree, Parag saree
englishDialogue: Dushasan was in big problem after pulling Draupadi's saree ... and Parag saree is the best amongst the saree's

dialogue: Shaadi chal raha hai ya saas bahu ka TV serial ... khatam hi nahi ho raha hai
englishDialogue: Is this a wedding going on or a TV serial about mother-in-law and daughter-in-law ... it's just not ending

dialogue: Majnu aur Romeo ko agar naukri doondni padti na ... toh pata chalta ki pyar karna bada aasaan hai ... naukri doondna bahut mushkil
englishDialogue: If Majnu and Romeo had to find a job ... then they would have realized that loving is more easy ... and finding a job is very difficult

dialogue: Apun Anna ... chaubees ghante chaukana!
englishDialogue: I'm Anna ... and I'm alert 24 hours!

dialogue: Humour achchi hai ... thoda sense daloge toh sense of humour ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: Your humour is good ... but add some sense to it then it will become sense of humour

dialogue: Aatma udh gayi chhodkar shareer purana ... didi tera devar deewana, kudiyon ko dale dana
englishDialogue: The soul flew off leaving the old body ... oh sister your brother-in-law is crazy, he keeps on flirting with women

dialogue: Usne kaha ki karna mujhe phone ... humne kaha hum aapke hai kaun?
englishDialogue: She asked to give her a phone call ... and I said who am I to you?

dialogue: Luca good, Luca bad, Luca not ugly ... baat yaad rehti hai usse pichli
englishDialogue: Luca is good, Luca is bad, Luca is not ugly ... and he remembers all the old things

dialogue: Maine kab kaha ki main Ram hoon ... arre main toh common hoon, sare aam hoon
englishDialogue: When did I say that I'm Ram ... I'm a common man in the middle of everything

dialogue: Jeene ka maqsad jab badla hota hai ... toh badla le lene ke baad jeene ka maqsad khatam ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When revenge becomes the purpose of living ... then after taking the revenge the purpose of living also ends

dialogue: Life mein profit se zyada kuch aur cheezein mainey rakhti hai
englishDialogue: There are a few more things other than profit that matter in life

dialogue: Kele aur tragedy kabhi single mein nahi aate
englishDialogue: Bananas and tragedies never come in singles

dialogue: Manzil tak pahuchne ke liye, apna maqsad haasil karne ke liye ... kabhi kabhi barso intezaar karna padta hai
englishDialogue: To reach your destination and to achieve your goals ... sometimes you have to wait for years

dialogue: Kehte hai waqt har zakhm bhar deta hai ... magar waqt hi mera zakhm hai
englishDialogue: It is said that time heals all wounds ... but time itself is my wound

dialogue: Shikaar par jaal is tarah phenka jaata hai ... ke usse bilkul khabar na ho
englishDialogue: You must throw the trap on the prey is such a way ... that he should not know about it at all

dialogue: Khoobsurati woh nahi hoti joh aaine mein dikhai de ... khoobsurati woh hoti hai joh aaine mein nazar na aaye
englishDialogue: Beauty is not what you see in the mirror ... beauty is what you can't see in the mirror

dialogue: Tum mujhe apne ghar se nikaal sakte ho, apne dil se nikaal sakte ho ... lekin apne zameer se tum yeh baat kaise nikaaloge ... ki tum dono mere gunehgaar ho
englishDialogue: You can remove me from your house, from your heart ... but how will you remove the fact from your conscience ... that you both are my culprits

dialogue: Cheez hamesha apni pasand ki leni chahiye ... doosro ki pasand ki nahi
englishDialogue: You should always buy things of your choice ... and not of others

dialogue: Tum duniya ki pehli aaisi khoobsurat aurat hogi ... joh apne aapko itna badsurat sabit karne pe tuli hui hai
englishDialogue: You are probably the first beautiful woman of this world ... who is trying to prove herself ugly

dialogue: Kaanon mein ho baali, naak mein nathni, gaale mein haar, kamar mein chaabiyon ka guchha, paon mein payal ... aur haan agar haathon mein ho kangana ... toh kahan jayega sajna?
englishDialogue: If you have earings in your ears, nose ring in your nose, necklace on your neck, keychain on your waist, anklet on your legs ... and yes bangles on your hand ... then where will your lover go?

dialogue: Shaadi tann ke bandhan se pehle mann ka bandhan hota hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is a bond of hearts before it is a bond of the bodies

dialogue: Yakeen aaye na aaye tumko lekin yeh haqeeqat hai ... mile ho jabse tum mujhko yeh duniya khoobsurat hai
englishDialogue: Whether you believe it or not, it's the reality ... since I've met you, this world looks beautiful to me

dialogue: Yaadein anth mein kiska haath pakadkar jaati hai maloom? ... maut ka
englishDialogue: Do you know in the end, memories leave holding whose hand? ... the hand of death

dialogue: Kisi bhi kahani mein ya upanyas mein ... apni zindagi ka anubhav aur tajurbe ka reflection dikhta zaroor hai
englishDialogue: In any story or novel ... you definitely see the experience of your life and the reflection of your experience

dialogue: Zindagi ke ek modh par jaakar log aksar yehi sochte hai kaash ... zindagi phir se jeene mil jaati
englishDialogue: Often on a junction in life people think and wish that ... hope they could get one more chance to live life

dialogue: Paisa, paisa ... sote ko jagaye paisa, rote ko hasaye paisa, kanoon banaye paisa, dharam ko nachaye paisa, barood bichaye paisa, sheharon ko jalaye paisa
englishDialogue: Money, money ... money wakes up the one sleeping, money brings a smile to the one crying, money creates the law, money makes faith to dance, money spreads gunpowder, money burns the cities

dialogue: Prem is prithvi ki amar bhavna hai ... prem jeevan deta hai aur jeevan is hi prem ki agni mein jalkar bhasma ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is an immortal emotion on this earth ... love gives us life and life itself burns in the fire of love and turns into ashes

dialogue: Jaam-e-mohabbat aankhon se hi pee lete hai dilwale ... ek nazar mein mujhko padhkar jee lete hai dilwale
englishDialogue: People in love drink the goblet of love through their eyes ... people in love live their life just by looking at me once

dialogue: Sikke ki jhankar aur uski chamak ... aadmi ko andha bana deti hai
englishDialogue: The jingling and shine of coins (money) ... makes a man blind

dialogue: Falsafi ko bahas ke andar khuda milta nahi ... dor ko suljha raha hoon aur sirah milta nahi
englishDialogue: A philosopher doesn't find God inside an argument ... I'm trying to untangle a thread but I'm not able to find it's end

dialogue: Aap toh aap hai, aap sab kuch hai ... aur toh aur hai, aur kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: You are yourself, and you are everything ... others are others, and others are nothing

dialogue: Dor bahut dor jahan tak nazar jaati hai ... samay ke saath saath yaadon ka ek safar ... samundra ki leharon ki tarah saath saath chalta hai ... saath saath chalta hai
englishDialogue: As far as the eyes can see ... a journey of memories moves together with time ... they move together just like the waves of the ocean ... they move together

dialogue: Tere honthon ka kaala til joh nashtar bankar chubta hai ... karoon kurbaan Samarkandon Bukhara iske badle mein
englishDialogue: The black mole on your lips pricks me like a knife ... I'll sacrifice even the holy cities for it

dialogue: Tum hamari sari daulat lootkar le jaate toh hum mein koi gham nahi hota ... tumne hamare pariwar ka pyar aur vishvas loota hai ... khoon kiya hai tumne hamari bhavnao ka
englishDialogue: Had you stolen all my money and left then I wouldn't have been sad ... but you have stolen the love and trust of our family ... you have murdered our emotions

dialogue: Hilna nahi ... hilega toh dobara life mein hilne ka chance nahi milega
englishDialogue: Don't move ... if you move then you won't get a chance in life to move again

dialogue: Dame ki bimari kuch aaisi hai jaise ghar aaya hua mehmaan ... aaj hai, kal nahi
englishDialogue: Asthma is like a guest in the house ... it's there today, but gone tomorrow

dialogue: Hilna nahi ... nahi toh goli maar maarke bina plastic surgery ke tumhara face bighad dega
englishDialogue: Don't move ... or else I'll shoot bullets and destroy your face without plastic surgery

dialogue: Insaan ka dimaag hi sab kuch hai ... joh jitna chala leta hai, utna paa leta hai
englishDialogue: The mind of a person is everything ... how much ever one uses it, that much he gets out of it

dialogue: Main jeeonga tumhare saath aur maroonga tumhari chahat mein
englishDialogue: I'll live with you and I'll die for your love

dialogue: Bombay ki public ko nahi jaanti hai aap ... maar maarke design badal deti hai
englishDialogue: You don't know the people of Bombay ... they'll beat you up and change your design

dialogue: Hum gareeb log hai na khali jeb se gareeb hote hai ... dil se bahut bade hote hai hum log ... magar yeh daulat waale saale dil se gareeb hote hai ... inke paas pyar mohabbat naam ki koi cheez nahi hoti, koi kadar nahi karte uski ... aur agar kadar karte hai toh sirf daulat ki
englishDialogue: We poor people are only poor from the pocket ... we are very big from the heart ... but these wealthy people are poor from the heart ... they don't have anything by the name of love, also they don't care for it ... and if they care for anything then that is money

dialogue: Imaandari kitni bhi bewakoof ho ... aakhir ek din uski tarakki zaroor hoti hai ... aur baimaani kitni bhi chalaak ho ... ek din usse jail mein zaroor jana padta hai
englishDialogue: No matter how foolish honesty is ... one day it definitely advances ... and no matter how smart dishonesty is ... one day it definitely has to go to the jail

dialogue: (Woh qurbani dega kaun?) - Dega kaun, dega kaun, dega kaun kya ... kamine tu dega qurbani!
englishDialogue: (Who will give the sacrifice?) - Who will give, who will give, what who will give ... bloody you will give the sacrifice!

dialogue: Jab aurat lachaar ho jaati hai toh pesha karne lagti hai ... aur jab mard kamzor ban jaata hai toh tum jaisa mujrim aur baimaan ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a woman becomes helpless then she sells herself ... and when a man becomes weak then he becomes a criminal and cheat like you

dialogue: Bata de haramzade ... nahi toh tadap tadapkar aur sisak sisakar marega tu
englishDialogue: Tell me you bastard ... or else you'll wriggle and moan and then die

dialogue: Yeh saala bhoolne ki aadat main kab bhoolunga
englishDialogue: When will I forget this habit of forgetting

dialogue: Agar hum in kutton ke haath lag gaye ... toh yeh kutte hum mein kutte ki maut maar dalenge
englishDialogue: If these dogs catch us ... then these dogs will kill us like dogs

dialogue: Insaan daulat ke liye apno ka khoon bhi baha deta hai
englishDialogue: A person can shed the blood of his own people for money

dialogue: Hamare business ka ek ussool hai ... ke rupiya do toh ginn ke do, rupiya lo toh ginn ke lo
englishDialogue: There is one rule in our business ... that count the money when you give, and count the money when you take

dialogue: Kaale jadoo ka asar insaano par hota hai ... hum jaise shaitaano par nahi
englishDialogue: Black magic can only affect humans ... not devils like us

dialogue: Sher ke panjon se hirni chhut sakti hai ... makari ke jaal se makhkhi chhut sakti hai ... magar Zantala ke haathon se ladki nahi chhut sakti
englishDialogue: A deer can escape from the tigers paws ... a mosquito can escape from the spiders web ... but a girl cannot escape from the hands of Zantala

dialogue: Pedh ke phal wohi khaata hai ... joh pedh ki daali par baitha hota hai
englishDialogue: Only the person who sits on the branch of a tree ... can eat the fruit from that tree

dialogue: Pyar ek aaisa rishta hai, ek anmol heera hai ... jise sirf pyar khareed sakta hai ... duniya ki koi daulat khareed nahi sakti
englishDialogue: Love is a relation, it's a priceless diamond ... which can only be bought with love ... no other money of the world can buy it

dialogue: Jab koi dushman dushmani ka chola pehenkar samne aata hai toh pehchana jaata hai ... lekin jab koi dushman apno ka chola pehenkar samne aata hai toh badhe badhe dokha khakar reh jaate hai
englishDialogue: When an enemy comes forward wearing the dress of an enemy then you can recognize him ... but when an enemy comes forward wearing the dress of one of your own then even the best of the best get tricked

dialogue: Ab yeh dard saha nahi jaye aur bin kahe bhi raha nahi jaye ... meri samajh mein kuch kuch aaye, machi hai kyun hai-hai ... pyare yahi toh ishq kehlaye
englishDialogue: Now I can't take this pain and I can't stay without saying it ... I do understand a little bit as to why you're worried ... this is what is called as love my friend

dialogue: Kabhi veerane the, abhi gul-o-gulzaar nazar aate hai ... badle badle dar-o-deewar nazar aate hai
englishDialogue: Earlier it was deserted, but now it looks like a flower garden ... and the doors and walls look different

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi jeetne ke liye kuch haarna bhi padta hai ... aur haar kar jeetne waale ko baazigar kehte hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes to win you must lose something ... and one who wins from a losing position is called a gambler

dialogue: Udne ki baat parinde karte hai ... tutte huye par nahi
englishDialogue: Birds talking about flying ... not broken wings

dialogue: Ab sailaab aayega Madan Chopra ... sailaab aayega
englishDialogue: Now flood will come Madan Chopra ... flood will come

dialogue: Burai milne mein nahi hai ... burai chup chupkar milne mein hai
englishDialogue: It is not bad to meet ... it is bad to meet in hiding

dialogue: Kitaabein mehbooba se behtar hoti hai ... atleast intezaar toh nahi karwarti
englishDialogue: Books are better than girlfriend ... atleast they don't make you wait

dialogue: Daud zindagi ka ho yah motor car ka ... maine kabhi haarna nahi seekha
englishDialogue: Whether it is a race of life or car ... I have never learnt to lose

dialogue: Naam badalne se ... insaan ka chehra aur uska jurm nahi badal jaata
englishDialogue: By changing the name ... the face and the crimes of a person do not change

dialogue: Tumhari haalat ek us aphahij jaisi ho gayi hai ... jisse chalne ke liye baisaakhi ki zaroorat toh hai ... lekin usse pakadne ke liye haath nahi hai
englishDialogue: Your condition has become of one like a handicapped person ... who needs crutches to walk ... but does not have the hands to hold that

dialogue: Maa bete ka bhavishya chunti hai, duayen chunti hai ... uske jism ke tukde nahi
englishDialogue: For a son a mother selects his future, selects his prayers ... but does not select the pieces of his body

dialogue: Tune mujhe power of attorney nahi ... apni taqdeer ka woh kohra panna de diya hai ... jis par main jab chahoon teri barbadi ka ithihaas likh sakta hoon
englishDialogue: You haven't given me the power of attorney ... you've given me a blank paper of your destiny ... on which whenever I want, I can write the history of your destruction

dialogue: Ab har cheez meri hai ... aur har cheez ka maalik main hoon
englishDialogue: Now everything is mine ... and I am the owner of everything

dialogue: Zindagi mein tu kabhi sukhi nahi ho sakta ... mere bachchon ki hai tera sukh chain sab kuch cheen legi ... tu tabha ho jayega ... yeh ek maa ki baddua hai
englishDialogue: In life you can never be happy ... the curse of my children will take away all your happiness and peace ... you will be destroyed ... this is a curse of a mother

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi bachcho ko samjhane ke liye khud bachcha banna padta hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes you have to become a kid to make kids understand

dialogue: Yehi toh problem hai aaj kal ke young logon ke saath ... kaam chor bann gaye ho, kaam chor
englishDialogue: This is the problem with young people of today ... you guys have become lazy, simply lazy

dialogue: Yeh ek aam aadmi ka khoon hai ... yeh jab behta hai, toh achche achchon ki kundli palat deta hai
englishDialogue: This is the blood of a common man ... and when it sheds, then it flips the horoscope of the best of the best people

dialogue: Agar yeh haath gunahon ke khaatme ke liye uthe ... toh inki pakad mein sabse pehli gardan teri hogi
englishDialogue: If these hands rise to end crimes ... then the first neck in its grip will be yours

dialogue: Main itni oonchai par khada hoon ... ki mujhe dekhne ke liye gardan itni oonchi uthani padti hai ... ki reed ki haddi toot jaati hai
englishDialogue: I am standing at such great heights ... that you will have to lift your neck up so high to see me ... that your backbone will break

dialogue: Yeh khoon gaur se dekh ... yeh khoon nahi tezaab hai tezaab ... zameen pe gira iska ek ek katra, ek jwalamukhi ko janam deta hai
englishDialogue: Look at this blood carefully ... this is acid and not blood ... every drop of it that falls on the ground, gives birth to a volcano

dialogue: Jab hum kisi ko retire karte hai toh woh seedha upar chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: When I retire someone then they go straight up (to god)

dialogue: Tera aakhri faisla meri adalat mein hone waala hai ... jahan ka vakil bhi main hoon, gawah bhi, judge bhi ... aur tujhe phasi dene waala jallad bhi
englishDialogue: Your last judgment is going to happen in my court ... where I'm the lawyer, I'm the witness, I'm the judge ... and I'm also the executioner who will hang you to death

dialogue: Tu ek aaisa shaitaan hai jisse upar waale ne galati se insaan ki shakal mein neeche bhej diya ho
englishDialogue: You are a devil which god has mistakenly sent down in the face of a human

dialogue: Aaj kal sunne mein aa raha hai ... ke vilayat se yeh maal aa raha hai, vilayat ko woh maal ja raha hai ... arre kisi ko hosh hai ki Bharat varsh kahan ja raha hai
englishDialogue: Nowadays we are hearing that ... this merchandize is coming from a foreign country, this merchandize is going to a foreign country ... but does anyone have the consciousness to understand where is India going

dialogue: Khel mein apni chaal ke saath saath dushman ki chaal pe bhi nazar rakhni chahiye
englishDialogue: In a game along with keeping an eye on your move, you should also keep an eye on the enemies move

dialogue: Tumhare aur hamare beech sirf ek hi cheez ka batwara ho sakta hai ... aur woh hai tumhare hisse ki maut
englishDialogue: Between you and me there is only one thing that can be divided ... and that is the death of your share

dialogue: Baap ke kandhe ke barabar jab bete ka kandha ho jaata hai ... toh woh baap ki zimmedari aur jawabdari dono ka bhoj uthane ke kabil ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When the shoulder of a son reaches his father's shoulder ... then he becomes capable of taking care of his father and his father's responsibilities

dialogue: Tu toh meri umeedon ka junction hai ... dil se dil ka relation hai, connection hai, attraction hai, action hai, reaction hai ... yane ki tu meri mohabbat ka main station hai
englishDialogue: You're the junction of my hopes ... you're the relation, connection, attraction, action, reaction from heart to heart ... which means you're the main station of my love

dialogue: Bambai mein kaam kam hota hai hartaalein zyada hoti hai ... kabhi taxi waalon ki hartaal, kabhi bus waalon ki hartaal, kabhi mill waalon ki hartaal ... aur kabhi hartaal ka kaaran na milne par hartaal ko practice karne ki hartaal
englishDialogue: In Mumbai less work gets done and more strikes do happen ... sometimes the taxi drivers are on strike, sometimes the bus drivers are on strike, sometimes the mill workers are on strike ... and sometimes when they don't have a reason to strike then they strike to practice for a strike

dialogue: Hamare raston par charon taraf petrol hi petrol bicha hua hai ... kaun, kab mauke ka fayda uthakar uspar jalti hui maachis uchaal de ... aur kis modh par hamari zindagi ka safar khatam ho jaye ... yeh hum bhi nahi jaante
englishDialogue: There is petrol sprayed everywhere on our path ... who, when will take benefit of the situation and throw a burning matchstick on it ... and on what turn our life will end ... even we don't know that

dialogue: Kal yeh inaam dekh sari duniya baimaan ho jayegi ... toh harjai ko yakeen hai, kal sari khudai be-imaan ho jayegi
englishDialogue: Looking at this prize, tomorrow the whole world will become dishonest ... hence the traitor is confident that tomorrow all the godliness will become foul

dialogue: Shaq ka kaante bahut zeharilay hote hai ... joh do dilon ke beech dooriyan bhi pehda kar dete hai aur dushmani bhi
englishDialogue: The thorns of suspicion are very poisonous ... they create a distance and enmity between two hearts

dialogue: Pehankar police ki yeh vardi hum ghalib tamasha-e-ahle-karam dekhte hai ... chaman ko ujhadte kahi baar dekha, par aaj is club ka hashar dekhte hai
englishDialogue: Wearing the police uniform I'm watching the entertainment of generosity ... I've seen a flower garden get destroyed many a times, but today I'm looking at the condition of this club

dialogue: Baimaani ke dhande mein imaandari se kaam nahi karne waalon ka anjaam bahut bhayanak hota hai
englishDialogue: Those who don't work honestly in the business of dishonesty have a very dangerous end

dialogue: Agar upar waale ne maut likhi hai toh zindagi kuch nahi kar sakti ... aur agar zindagi likhi hai toh maut kuch nahi kar sakti
englishDialogue: If god has written death then life can't do anything ... and if he has written life then death can't do anything

dialogue: Nishana meri pistol ka hi nahi ... meri dimaag ki soch ka bhi bahut pakka hai
englishDialogue: Not only the aim of my pistol is accurate ... but also the aim of the thoughts of my mind is accurate

dialogue: Is umar mein aaisa hi hota hai ... dil atak jaata hai, mamla khatak jaata hai aur neeyat phisal jaata hai
englishDialogue: Things like this happen at this age ... the heart gets stuck, the situation tumbles and the intention goes bad

dialogue: Musibaton ka saamna himmat se karna chahiye ... aasunyon se nahi
englishDialogue: You should face problems with courage ... not with tears

dialogue: Mera naam hai Ghorpade ... aur mere samne achche achche ghidpade
englishDialogue: My name is Ghorpade ... and even the best of the best fall in front of me

dialogue: Bhagwan jiske chehre pe aankhen nahi deta ... uske dil mein aankhen de deta hai
englishDialogue: When god doesn't give someone the eyes on their face ... then he gives them the eyes in their heart

dialogue: Agar mujhe woh heere nahi mile ... toh main tum dono ko zameen mein aadha zinda ghaadkar ... aadha hissa bomb se uda doonga
englishDialogue: If I don't get those diamonds ... then I'll bury half of both your bodies alive in the ground ... and blow the other half with a bomb

dialogue: Wafaadari par note ke dher lagata hoon ... toh gaddari pe gaddaron ke seene par maut ke medal bhi laga deta hoon
englishDialogue: When it comes to honesty, I give a lot of money ... and when it comes to dishonesty, I also give the medal of death on the chest of the traitors

dialogue: Deewane aashiq zindagi ka saath chhodte hai ... lekin haath nahi chhodte
englishDialogue: Lovers can leave the company of life ... but they don't leave the hand (of their lover)

dialogue: Jab jab dharti par paap badha ... tab tab uska vinaash karne ke liye swayam Krishna ne janam liya
englishDialogue: Whenever the sins have grown on earth ... then Lord Krishna by himself has taken birth to destroy them

dialogue: Jis tarah bina sone ke zevar nahi ban sakta ... us hi tarah bina pitte koi aashiq nahi ban sakta
englishDialogue: Just like you can't make an ornament without gold ... just like that you can't become a lover without being beaten up

dialogue: CID waale shaq ke dhaagon se hi yakeen ka ghar banate hai ... joh baad mein mujrim ke liye qaid khana ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: The people of CID (Crime Investigation Department) make their house of trust with the threads of suspicion ... which later becomes a jail for the criminal

dialogue: Manju ... mere khawabon ki rani, mere pyar ki nishani, meri mohabbat ki biryani
englishDialogue: Manju ... you are the queen of my dreams, the memento of my love, the biryani of my romance

dialogue: Kuch nashe aaise hote hai joh kiye nahi jaate ... ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: There are some intoxications that don't have to be done ... they happen by themselves

dialogue: Aadmi aur aadmi ki badnaami mein koi farak nahi hota ... aadmi pehda hota hai, badnaami janam leti hai ... aadmi bada ho jaata hai, badnaami bhi badi ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: There is no difference between a person and a person's humiliation ... when a person is born, even humiliation is born ... when a person becomes big, his humiliation also becomes big

dialogue: Ek dushman ko doosre dushman se lada dena chahiye ... nuksaan chahe kisi ka bhi ho ... fayda hamesha hamara hota hai
englishDialogue: You should make one enemy fight the other enemy ... no matter who loses ... we'll always profit

dialogue: Toote hue rishtey aur toote hue dhaage ko jaldi ma jodne ki koshish nahi karni chahiye ... gaanth padh jaye toh umar bhar chubti rehti hai
englishDialogue: You should not try to quickly connect broken relationships and broken threads ... if a knot gets formed then it hurts for the entire life

dialogue: Roh aur roh, zor zor se roh, tab tak roti raho ... jab tak tumri awaaz dharti aur akash ke beech ki har cheez ko hilla na de
englishDialogue: Cry and cry more, cry loudly, keep crying until ... your voice shakes everything in between in the ground and the sky

dialogue: Maut se woh log darte hai jinka zindagi se koi rishta ho ... mera toh sirf ek hi rishta hai ... jis se mujhe maut hi mila sakti hai
englishDialogue: The people who have a relationship with life are scared of death ... I have only one relationship ... and only death can make me meet with that

dialogue: Yahan koi kisi ke liye kuch nahi chhodta ... sab kisi na kisi ko chhodkar aage badh jaate hai
englishDialogue: Here no one leaves anything behind for someone ... everyone moves ahead leaving behind someone or the other

dialogue: Len-den mein pehle baad mein nahi hota ... is haath le, us haath de
englishDialogue: There is no before and after in an exchange ... take from one hand and give from the other hand

dialogue: Main gareebi ka woh nivala hoon ... joh amir ke gaale mein atak jaye toh uska halak cheer ke rakh de
englishDialogue: I'm that bite of poverty ... which if it gets stuck in the throat of a rich person then it tears apart his interiors
