dialogue: Ittihas yeh nahi dekhta kya sahi tha, kya galat ... kya mushkil tha, kya aasaan ... yaad toh yahi reh jaata hai ki kaun jeeta aur kaun haara
englishDialogue: History doesn't look at what was right and what was wrong ... what was hard and what was easy ... the only thing that gets remembered is who won and who lost

dialogue: Shaheedon ke mazaaron par diye zaroor jalte hai ... lekin unke gharon mein choolay tak nahi jalte
englishDialogue: Candles definitely light up on the shrine of martyrs ... but the stoves in their house don't light up

dialogue: Zindagi kisi ek ke ho jaane ka naam hai ... kisi ko lootne ka nahi ... kisi pe lut jaane ka naam hai
englishDialogue: Life is all about becoming of one person ... it's not about stealing from someone ... it's about dying for someone

dialogue: Maal hai aur malamaal bhi hai!
englishDialogue: She is gorgeous and rich as well!

dialogue: Mehfil lagi hai yahan mohabbat karne waalon ki ... koi lutta hai toh koi lootta hi hai ... dilon ke khel mein aksar kahin na kahin sheesha tootta hi hai
englishDialogue: There is a party here of people in love ... some lose and some only steal ... often in the game of hearts a mirror breaks somewhere or the other

dialogue: Zindagi maaze lene ka naam hai ... kuch dene ka naam hai ... aur bahut kuch lene ka naam hai
englishDialogue: Life is all about having fun ... it's all about giving something ... and it's all about taking a lot

dialogue: Deewane se deewangi ka sabak na poochna ... woh khud nahi jaanta ki woh deewana kyun hai
englishDialogue: Don't ask a lover about what he learned in craziness ... he himself doesn't know as to why he is crazy in love

dialogue: Tumhare haathon ke upar aur haath hai ... aur un haathon ke upar aur kahi haath hai ... aur in sab haathon ki dor mere haath mein hai
englishDialogue: There are hands above your hands ... and there are many more hands above those hands ... and the string of all those hands is in my hand

dialogue: Koi nahi hoga beghar jab talak zinda hai Amar ... maut jise dhoondti hai dar-badar, log usse kehte hai baazigar
englishDialogue: No one will be homeless until Amar is alive ... the person whom death is searching for door to door, people call him a gambler

dialogue: Bhagwan rehta hai mandir mein, woh uska ghar hai ... panchi rehte hai amber mein, kyun ki woh unka ghar hai ... amir aadmi rehta hai mehalon mein, kyun ki woh uska ghar hai ... toh phir itni badi duniya mein ek gareeb aadmi kahan rahega?
englishDialogue: God lives in the temple, because that's his house ... birds live in the sky, because that's their house ... a rich person lives mansions, because that's his house ... so where will a poor person live in this big world?

dialogue: Pyar ke khatir usko bhi chhodna padta hai ... jiske bina jee nahi sakte
englishDialogue: For love one has to also leave the person ... without whom we cannot live

dialogue: Shuruvat mein hi anth chupa hota hai
englishDialogue: The end is hidden in the start itself

movie: Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja
dialogue: Maut ka intezaar maut se kahin zyada bhayanak hota hai
englishDialogue: Waiting for death is much more scary than death itself

movie: Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja
dialogue: Mehnat, lagan aur akalmandi ke saath joh baimaani ki jaye ... us baimaani ka duniya ke tamaam imaandar milkar bhi kuch nahi bighad sakte
englishDialogue: The dishonesty that is done with hard work, dedication and smartness ... that dishonesty cannot be disrupted even by all the honest people of world together

dialogue: Tum woh badnaseeb aurat ho joh pati ke hote hue patni na ban saki ... aulad ke hote hue maa na ban saki ... nawasi ke hote hue nani na ban saki
englishDialogue: You're that unfortunate woman who inspite of having a husband couldn't become a wife ... who inspite of having a child couldn't become a mother ... who inspite of having a grand-daughter couldn't become a grandmother

dialogue: Mujhko meri awaaz sunai nahi deti ... kaisa yeh mere jism mein ek shor macha hai
englishDialogue: I'm not able to hear my own voice ... what kind of noise is there in my body

dialogue: Sirf siddhant ke bal par raajneeti nahi chalti ... iske liye stithi ko samajhna zaroori hai, samay ki chaal ko pehchanna zaroori hai
englishDialogue: Politics can't run only on the power of principles ... that's why it's important to understand the situation, it's important to recognize the game of time

dialogue: Raajneeti asambhav ko sambhav bana dene ki kala hai
englishDialogue: Politics is an art to make the impossible possible

dialogue: Sainik hona ek desh ka sipahi hona hi nahi hai ... sainik hona ek shahadat hai, ek qurbani hai, balidaan hai ... aur sainik ke ghar waale sainik se bhi badhe shaheed hote hai
englishDialogue: Being a soldier is not just being a warrior for the country ... being a soldier is a martyrdom, a sacrifice, an immolation ... and the family members of a soldier are biggers martyrs than the soldier

dialogue: Aap iske khandan ke baare mein nahi jaante ... iska par-dada 009, iska dada 008, iska baap 007  aur yeh zero zero chakka (006) hai
englishDialogue: You don't know about his family ... his great grandfather was 009, his grandfather was 008, his father was 007 and he is 006 (eunuch)

dialogue: Naino se naino ke teer chalte hai toh pakad mein nahi aate ... magar jab kisi ke liye honth kuch karate hai toh phool jadte hai
englishDialogue: When the eyes of two people connect then you can't catch them ... but when your lips make you do something for someone, then it's like flowers are falling

dialogue: Kisi ke liye acha karna kabhi bekaar nahi jaata
englishDialogue: Doing a good thing for someone never goes to waste

dialogue: Meri Sikhi sirf mere kesuyon mein nahi hai
englishDialogue: The qualities of me being a Sikh are not just in my hair

dialogue: Aurat woh khushboo hai joh aadmi ki zindagi ko mehka deti hai
englishDialogue: A woman is a fragrance that enhances the life of a man

dialogue: Aadmi pyar chahta hai, aadmi pyar karna chahta hai, pyar paana chahta hai
englishDialogue: A man needs love, he wants to love and he wants to win the love

dialogue: Sirf guru hi shishya ko sabak nahi sikha sakta ... waqt padne par shishya bhi guru ko sabak sikha sakta hai
englishDialogue: Only a teacher cannot teach a lesson to his student ... when the time comes, even a student can teach a lesson to his teacher

dialogue: Aurat nark ka dwar hoti hai
englishDialogue: A woman is the door to hell

dialogue: Agar aurat na hoti ... toh saare mard rishi hote, gyani hote
englishDialogue: If women didn't exists ... then all men would have been knowledgeable saints

dialogue: Apne ghar mein diya jalane ka matlab yeh nahi ke saare jag mein ujyala ho gaya
englishDialogue: Lighting a lamp in your house doesn't mean that the whole world is out of darkness

dialogue: Stree maya hai, moh hai, andhakar hai
englishDialogue: A woman is fascination, infatuation and darkness

dialogue: Duniya mein koi aisa insaan nahi hai jise kabhi galati na ho ... lekin sahi insaan woh hai joh sahi waqt par galati ka paschatap karle
englishDialogue: There is not a single person in this world who has not committed a mistake ... but a person becomes right only when they regret their mistake at the right time

dialogue: Ek ladki ke jazbaat ko theek se wohi samajh sakta hai ... jisne duniya dekhi hai, zindagi dekhi hai, zindagi ke utaar-chadao dekhe hai
englishDialogue: Only a person who has seen the world, seen life and seen the ups and downs in life ... can understand the emotions of a girl

dialogue: Apahij woh nahi jiska koi ang na ho ... apahij woh hai joh apne ang ka istamaal na kare ... doosron ki madad na karne wale haath apahij hai ... zulm ko dekhkar mudne wali aankh apahij hai ... maa baap ko chhodkar bhaagne wale paanv apahij hai
englishDialogue: Someone who doesn't have a body part is not a handicap person ... instead a person who doesn't use his body part is a handicap person ... the hands that don't help others are handicap ... the eyes that look at injustice and turn away are handicap ... the legs that leave their parents behind are handicap

dialogue: Laxmi samne se darshan dene ko tayaar hai ... aur aap joh hai line mein khade rehna chahte hai
englishDialogue: The goddess of wealth is herself ready to come in front of you ... and you want to stand in a line to see her

dialogue: Maine diya baalon ka balidaan aur you're acting like Irrfan Khan ... thoda toh overacting banta hai na
englishDialogue: I sacrificed my hair and you're acting like Irrfan Khan ... a little bit of overacting should be there

dialogue: Dare hue log aksar alfazon ke peeche chupte hai
englishDialogue: People who are scared often hide behind words

dialogue: Mauka hai, dastoor hai ... zakhaas raja, zakhaas rani aur raazi ... kyun na laga de Bollywood ki baazi
englishDialogue: We have the opportunity and the ritual ... a great king and a great queen both agree ... so why not play something from Bollywood

dialogue: Pyar cancer ki tarah hota hai ... bin bulaye aa jaata hai aur maarke chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is like cancer ... it comes without an invitation and it kills us and leaves

dialogue: Joh tera haal hai, woh mera haal hai ... haal se haal mila, taal se taal mila
englishDialogue: My condition is the same as yours ... let's unite in this condition of ours and dance together in rhythm

dialogue: Ek tarfa pyar ki taqat hi kuch aur hoti hai ... auron ke rishton ki tarah yeh do logon mein nahi bat'ti ... sirf mera haq hai ispe
englishDialogue: The power of one sided love is unique ... it doesn't get distributed into two, as it happens in the relationships of others ... only my right is there on it

dialogue: Sau andheron mein bhi roshan ho, us haqeeqat ki talash hai ... teri dehleez pe chhod aaye, us mohabbat ki talash hai ... jhukne ki ibaadat ko toh samjhe jahaan walon ... katne pe joh haasil ho, us jannat ki talash hai
englishDialogue: I'm looking for that reality which shines even in extreme dark conditions ... I' looking for that love which I left at your doorsteps ... people of the world, try to understand the prayer when one bows down ... I'm looking for that heaven which you attain after death

dialogue: Kuch zakhmon ke karz lafzon se ada nahi hote
englishDialogue: The debit of some wounds can't be fulfilled with words

dialogue: Mohabbat karna hamare bas mein nahi hai ... us mohabbat se door chale jaana ... woh hamare bas mein hai
englishDialogue: It's not within our control to fall in love ... but to go far away from that love ... is within our control

dialogue: Har shayara ko shaadi kar leni chahiye ... shohar achcha mile toh zindagi achchi kat jaati hai ... na mile toh shayari achchi ho hi jaati hai
englishDialogue: Every poetess should get married ... if you get a good husband then life is well spent ... if not, then atleast your poetry improves

dialogue: Rishton ki geeli zameen par log aksar phisal jaate hai
englishDialogue: People often slip on the wet floor of relations

dialogue: Jab pyar mein pyar na ho ... jab dard mein yaar na ho ... jab aansoon mein muskaan na ho ... jab lafzon mein zubaan na ho ... jab saansein bas yoon hi chale ... jab har din mein raat dhale ... jab intezar sirf waqt ka ho ... jab yaad us kambhakht ki ho ... kyun hoon main raahi jab woh hai kisi aur ki manzil ... dhadkano ne saath chhod diya ... ae dil hai mushkil, ae dil hai mushkil
englishDialogue: When you don't have love in your love ... when you don't have a friend in pain ... when you don't have a smile in your tears ... when you don't a voice in your words ... when your breaths are just breathing ... when the night sets in every day of yours ... when you only wait for time ... when you only remember that one person ... why am I a traveller when she's the destination for someone else ... my heartbeats have left me alone ... it's hard to live in love, it's hard to live in love

dialogue: Aasaan hai kya aisi mohabbat karna ... jiske badle mohabbat na mile
englishDialogue: It's not easy to be in love ... when you don't get love back in return

dialogue: Pyar mein junoon hai par dosti mein sukoon hai
englishDialogue: There is passion in love but there is peace in friendship

dialogue: Mujhe samjhane ki koshish mat karna ... kyun ki agar samjhaoge toh samajh jaaongi ... agar samajh gayi toh bikhar jaaongi
englishDialogue: Don't try to make me understand ... because if you try to make me understand, then I'll understand ... and if I understand, then I'll disseminate

dialogue: Main kisi ki zaroorat nahi ... khwaish banna chahti hoon
englishDialogue: I don't want to be someone's need ... I want to be someone's desire

dialogue: Agar baazi ishq ki baazi hai toh joh chahe laga lo ... dar kaisa ... agar jeet gaye toh kya kehna ... agar haare bhi toh baazi maat nahi
englishDialogue: If the bet is about love, then put whatever you want on the line ... why fear ... if you win, then nothing like it ... if you lose, then to you haven't lost the bet

dialogue: Ajeeb kahani hai pyar aur dosti ke rishtey ki ... pyar hamara hero, dosti hamari heroine
englishDialogue: The story of love and friendship is strange ... love is our hero and friendship is our heroine

dialogue: Kambhakt khayalon ne hi toh zinda rakha hai ... varna sawaalon ne kab ka maar diya hota
englishDialogue: Your memories have kept me alive ... or else the questions would've killed me long time back

dialogue: Log aksar kehte hai na ki dil aur dimaag ke beech mein dil ki sunni chahiye ... lekin jab dil toot jaata hai ... toh usse behtar advice toh dimaag hi deta hai
englishDialogue: People often say that when it comes to listening to your heart or your mind, listen to your heart ... but when a heart breaks ... then the mind is bound to give you better advice

dialogue: Love teda hai ... lekin us tede love mein bhi sukoon paana sirf kuch logon ko aata hai
englishDialogue: Love is crooked ... but only some people know how to find peace in that crooked love

dialogue: Khoobsurati toh dhal jaati hai ... personality toh maut ke baad bhi zinda reh jaati hai
englishDialogue: Beauty eventually fades away ... but personality stays alive even after death

dialogue: Jab main bhurji paratha khata hoon na ... toh joh khushi mehsoos hoti hai, mujhe woh wali feeling aa rahi hai ... you know jaise, dil ka pet bhar gaya ho
englishDialogue: When I eat scrambled eggs and flour bread ... then the happiness that I feel, I'm getting that feeling now ... you know like, the stomach of the heart is full

dialogue: Boyfriends na filmon ki tarah hote hai ... kuch time pass toh kuch blockbusters
englishDialogue: Boyfriends are like films ... some are just a time pass and some are blockbusters

dialogue: Kisi ne kabhi aapko suddenly chaata mara hai ... phaat ... us chaante ko ishq kehte hai ... aur woh chaanta aur zor se padta hai jab koi teesra aa jaata hai
englishDialogue: Has someone ever suddenly slapped you ... one tight slap ... that slap is called as love ... and you feel more hurt from that slap when a third person comes in between

dialogue: Rishtey ke alava aur bhi rishtey hote hai
englishDialogue: There are relationships other than a relationship

dialogue: Har successful aadmi ke peeche ek aurat ka haath hota hai ... lekin main yeh kehna chahti hoon ki ... ek kaamyab aurat ke peeche ek kaamyab aadmi ka haath hota hai
englishDialogue: Behind every successful man there is a woman ... but I want to say that ... behind every successful woman there is a successful man

dialogue: Na main kisi saanp se darti hoon na kisi seedi se ... I'm way above your snakes and ladders game
englishDialogue: I'm not scared of snakes nor ladders ... I'm way above your snakes and ladders game

dialogue: Zindagi mein jab ek darwaza band hota hai ... aur aapko lagta hai thak gaye, haar chuke ho ... toh sirf aur sirf aapki himmat aur shakti aapke liye kayi aur darwaze khol deti hai ... and that's what makes you discover the real you, the fighter in you
englishDialogue: When one door closes in life ... and when you think that you're tired and defeated ... then only your courage and your willpower can open many other doors for you ... and that's what makes you discover the real you, the fighter in you

dialogue: Aaj mera paas sab kuch hai lekin phir bhi kuch nahi hai
englishDialogue: Today I have everything but still I don't have anything

dialogue: Joh log kam bolte hai na ... un mein yaadon ka ek jwalamukhi bhara hota hai ... jis mein woh jalte rehte hai, jalte rehte hai
englishDialogue: People who speak less ... have a volcano of memories within them ... in which they keep on burning

dialogue: Ek boxer ka sabsa bada dushman hai reham ... joh tumhara opponent tumpar kabhi nahi karega
englishDialogue: The biggest enemy of a boxer is his mercy ... which your opponent will never do on you

dialogue: (Hum kyun nahi ek doosre ko I love you jaisi stupid baatein bolenge) ... Kyun ki phir sab emotional ho jaata hai, senty ho jaata hai aur masti ka the end ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: (Why won't we say stupid things like I love you to each other) ... Because then everything becomes emotional, everything becomes sentimental and the fun ends

dialogue: (Palatne nahi wala hai) ... Palatne ka wait toh 90's mein karte the log ... I was just checking out his a**
englishDialogue: (He's not going to turn around) ... people in the 90's used to wait for someone to turn around ... I was just checking out his a**

dialogue: Love na ek bungee jump hai ... dum hai toh kood pado ... safe landing ki koi guarantee nahi hai, toh safety ka socho hi mat ... jisne socha woh sochta hi reh gaya ... aur joh kooda woh udta hi raha
englishDialogue: Love is like a bungee jump ... if you have the courage then jump ... there is no guarantee of safe landing, hence don't think about safety ... the one who kept thinking, was left behind thinking ... and the one who jumped, kept on flying

dialogue: Pyar mein padna is like investing in mutual funds ... hum sabko lagta hai baad mein jab mature hoga na, tab return dega ... joh hum nahi sochte hai woh yeh hai ... ki investing in mutual funds is subject to market risk
englishDialogue: Falling in love is like investing in mutual funds ... we all think that it'll give us returns when it'll mature ... what we don't think is that ... investing in mutual funds is subject to market risk

dialogue: Jab kisi ko I love you bolo ya kisi ka dil todho ... dono mein koi shortcut nahi hota
englishDialogue: When you say I love you to someone or if you break their heart ... in both situations there is no shortcut

dialogue: Jab tak hawa mein ho befikar hoke udne ka maza lete raho ... shayad kabhi pair zameen pe padne ki zaroorat hi na pade
englishDialogue: Until you're in the air, have fun flying and being carefree ... may be you'll never have the need to put your feet on the ground

dialogue: Yeh joh forever wala rishta hota hai na ... yeh tum ladkiyon mein paidahishi hota hai ... sirf sahi bande ki entry ka intezar hota hai
englishDialogue: The relationship of forever ... is there in girls right from birth ... only the entry of a right person is needed

dialogue: Break-up ke dardiley dank se bachne ka ek hi upaai hai ... kabhi love ke jhoothe jaal mein padho hi mat ... if you won't hook-up, you won't break-up
englishDialogue: There is only one way to protect yourself from the painful bite of break-up ... never fall in the false trap of love ... if you won't hook-up, you won't break-up

dialogue: Aaya tha Dharam Paris aap sabko hasane ke liye ... lekin aisa nanga kiya ek ladki ne usse ... ab toh kache banyan bhi nahi bache vapas jaane ke liye
englishDialogue: Dharam had come to Paris to entertain you all ... but one girl made him completely naked ... now he doesn't even have underwear and banyan to go back

dialogue: Dilli wale dil ke mamle mein kamzor ho sakte hai ... dare ke mamle mein nahi
englishDialogue: People from Delhi might be weak at heart ... but not when it comes to a dare

dialogue: Tu Munna Bhai hoga lekin main Circuit nahi hoon ... tu Batman hoga lekin main Birdman nahi hoon ... tu hero hoga lekin ab main bhi hero hoon
englishDialogue: You may be Mr. Munna, but I'm not Mr. Circuit ... you may be Batman, but I'm not Birdman ... you may be a hero, but now even I'm a hero

dialogue: Kamata hoon Dirham mein lekin kharachta hoon rupai mein ... khata hoon inki lekin sunta hoon sirf Modi ji ki
englishDialogue: I earn money in Dirhams but I spend in Rupees ... I take money from these guys but I only listen to Narendra Modi

dialogue: (Mat piyo, it's killing you) - Bullets nahi maar payi ... yeh cigarette kya cheez hai
englishDialogue: (Don't smoke, it's killing you) - The bullets couldn't kill me ... this cigarette is nothing in front of it

dialogue: Yeh Arabiyon ka Dongri hai beta ... yahan shaanpatti sirf shaano pe jachti hai ... police waalon pe nahi
englishDialogue: This is the local area of Arabs ... here only the smart people look good acting smart ... not the police

dialogue: Wagah naam hai mera ... kyun ki na hoon main Hindustan ka, na Pakistan ka ... bas joh player game badal paaye hai ... peeche padh jaata hoon uski jaan ka
englishDialogue: My name is Wagah ... since I'm neither from India nor Pakistan ... only the player who can change the game ... I run behind his life

dialogue: Their father must be a baker because they have perfect buns
englishDialogue: Their father must be a baker because they have perfect buns

dialogue: Mere liye khoobsurati aam baat hai ... aur khoobsurat ladkiyan roz ki baat hai
englishDialogue: Beauty is just a normal thing for me ... and beautiful women are a regular thing for me

dialogue: It takes courage to love someone who doesn't love you
englishDialogue: It takes courage to love someone who doesn't love you

dialogue: Joh cheez jaan le sakti hai woh jaan bacha bhi sakti hai
englishDialogue: The thing that can take a life can also save a life

dialogue: They say love kills ... it actually does
englishDialogue: They say love kills ... it actually does

dialogue: Jis tarah se pyar mein hone ki koi wajah nahi hoti ... us hi tarah se pyar mein na hone ki bhi koi wajah nahi honi chahiye
englishDialogue: Like there is no reason behind being in love ... just like that there should be no reason for not being in love

dialogue: Pehle fan star ke peeche bhaagta tha ... ab star fan ke peeche bhaagega
englishDialogue: First the fan was chasing the star ... and now the star will chase the fan

dialogue: Connection bhi na kamaal ki cheez hai ... bas ho gaya toh ho gaya ... Wi-Fi, bluetooth se bhi zyada strong hai apna connection
englishDialogue: Connection is a very strange thing ... it just happens ... our connection is stronger than Wi-Fi and bluetooth

dialogue: Woh sirf star nahi hai ... duniya hai meri
englishDialogue: He's not just a star ... he's my world

dialogue: Joh aapko pyar karta hai uska dil todna bhi crime hi hai
englishDialogue: It's a crime to break the heart of the one who loves you

dialogue: Jab raaton ko taare ginne ka mann kare aur har taare pe mera naam bhunane ko dil kahe ... samajh lena pyar hai ... jab chalte chalte peeche mudne ka mann kare ... beedh mein, anjaane mein aankhen mujhe dhoonde lage ... samajh lena wohi pyar hai ... agar yakeen na ho toh yeh haath thaamkar dekh lo ... dhadkane wahin tham jaaye toh samajh lena yahi pyar hai
englishDialogue: When you feel liking counting the stars in the night and when you feel like writing my name on every star ... then understand that you're in love ... when you feel like looking back when you're walking forward ... when your eyes strangely search for me in the crowds ... then understand that you're in love ... if you don't believe me then hold my hand and see ... if your heartbeats stop right there, then understand that you're in love

dialogue: Mamla toh bahut sangeen hai, thodi ahtiyaad baratna ... par ek baat yaad rakhna, dil ka toh kaam hi hai dhadakna
englishDialogue: The matter is very serious, so be a little bit patient ... but remember one thing, it's the job of the heart to beat

dialogue: Joh maza apni pehchaan ke saath jeene mein hai ... woh kisi doosre ki parchai banne mein nahi
englishDialogue: The enjoyment that you get in living with your own identity ... you don't get that in living as someone else's shadow

dialogue: Joh kuch bhi usne kiya ... maine apni life mein cut, copy, paste kiya ... bas farak itna hai udhar woh star bana aur main uska fan
englishDialogue: Whatever he did ... I simply cut, copied, pasted that in my life ... the only difference is that he became a star there and I became his fan

dialogue: Akal ke saamne shakal haari jaati hai ... shakal ki nakal toh kar sakte hai ... lekin akal ki nakal bhi nakli hoti hai
englishDialogue: The face always loses to the mind ... you can imitate a face ... but even the imitation of a mind looks false

dialogue: Meri maa kehti hai khate waqt roti aur maarte waqt bandhe ginna ... bahut buri baat hai
englishDialogue: My mom says that, counting breads when you eat and people when you beat them ... is a very bad thing

dialogue: Kisi ne uske khilaf mooh khola na toh ho jaati hai ladai ... style marne ke chakkar mein maine agar kabhi haath khol diye toh beta ho jaati hai pitai
englishDialogue: If someone said anything against him then I found fight them ... and if I opened my arms with style then I would get beaten up

dialogue: Zara si chhu chappad ki na ... toh yeh milk chocolate waale thopde ko wrapper ke saath pichka doonga
englishDialogue: If you open your mouth even a little bit ... then I'll smash this milk chocolate like face of yours along with its wrapper

dialogue: Don't let the past blackmail your present ... to ruin a beautiful future
englishDialogue: Don't let the past blackmail your present ... to ruin a beautiful future

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi hum mushkil rasta sirf is liye chunte hai ... kyun ki humein lagta hai, important cheezein paane ke liye humein mushkil rasta apnana chahiye ... apne aap ko punish karna bahut zaroori samajhte hai ... but why, aasaan rasta kyun nahi chun sakte ... kya burai hai us mein ... khaas karke jab us mushkil ka saamna karne ke liye hum taiyaar hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes we choose a difficult path only because ... we feel that to attain important things we need to choose a difficult path ... we think that it's important to punish ourselves ... but why can't we choose a simple path ... what's wrong with that ... especically when we are not ready to face that difficult path

dialogue: Genius woh nahi hota jiske paas har sawaal ka jawab ho ... genius woh hota hai jiske paas har jawaab tak pahunchne ka patience ho
englishDialogue: A person who has the answer to every question is not a genius ... a genius is a person who has the patience to get to every answer

dialogue: Jab hum apne aap ko achchi tarah samajh lete hai ... toh doosre kya samajhte hai, it doesn't matter ... not at all
englishDialogue: When we understand ourselves well enough ... then it doesn't matter what others think about us ... not at all

dialogue: Albert Einstein ne kaha tha ... pagal woh hota hai joh roz roz same kaam karta hai ... magar chahta hai ki nateeja alag ho
englishDialogue: Albert Einstein had said that ... a person is mad when he does the same work everyday ... but still expects the result to be different

dialogue: Tum agar khulke ro nahi sakogi ... toh khulkar has kaise sakogi
englishDialogue: If you are not able to cry openly ... then how will you laugh openly

dialogue: Zindagi mein jab koi pattern banta ya koi aadat banti dikhai de na ... toh uske baare mein achchi tarah se sochna chahiye ... genius is about knowing when to stop
englishDialogue: In life when you see a pattern or a habit forming ... then you should think about that very carefully ... genius is about knowing when to stop

dialogue: Agar hum apni zindagi ka steering wheel apne haath mein nahi lenge na ... toh koi doosra driver seat par baith jayega
englishDialogue: If we don't take the steering wheel of our life in our own hands ... then someone else will sit on the driver's seat

dialogue: Zindagi ek jigsaw puzzle ki tarah hai ... mere jaise log us puzzle ke khoye hue tukde, sirf dhoondne aur jodne mein madad kar sakte hai ... par only you can complete the puzzle
englishDialogue: Life is like a jigsaw puzzle ... people like me can only help you in finding and connecting the puzzle pieces ... but only you can complete the puzzle

dialogue: We are all our own teachers in the school of life
englishDialogue: We are all our own teachers in the school of life

dialogue: I drink only on two occasions ... when I'm in love and when I'm not
englishDialogue: I drink only on two occasions ... when I'm in love and when I'm not

dialogue: Safe feel karne ke liye pehle saare dar mitana zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To feel safe you first need to remove all your fears

dialogue: Jeet mein toh har aadmi saath deta hai ... saathi toh woh hai joh haar mein bhi saath de
englishDialogue: Every person is on your side when you win ... a true companion is one who stays by your side even when you lose

dialogue: Khel koi bhi ho ... hum gareeb log ya toh jeette hai ... ya seekhte hai ... haarte kabhi nahi
englishDialogue: No matter what the game is ... we poor people either win it ... or learn from it ... but we never lose

dialogue: Teri aane waali zindagi ek sahi shot aur ek galat faisle ke beech mein tiki hui hai
englishDialogue: Your life's future is hanging between one right shot and one wrong decision

dialogue: Kafan mein pocket nahi hota aur upar account transfer nahi hota
englishDialogue: There is no pocket in a shroud and you can't transfer your (bank) account to heaven

dialogue: Tu alag alag pehda hota na ... toh aaj chaar paanch bhai behan hote tere ... tere pe chaar paiyye laga doon na ... toh Nano car lage
englishDialogue: If you were born separately ... then today you would've had 4 to 5 brothers and sisters ... if I'll put 4 wheels on you ... then you'll look like a Nano car

dialogue: Sharaab pilane wala banda acha hota hai ... lekin zaroorat se zyada sharaab pilane wala?
englishDialogue: The one who buys you a drink is a good person ... but the one who buys you many drinks, who knows?

dialogue: Banda joh hai na, ishq joh hai Katrina Kaif se kar sakta hai ... Mohammad Kaif se nahi
englishDialogue: A man can fall in love with Katrina Kaif ... not with Mohammad Kaif

dialogue: Insaan jab ek darwaza band kar deta hai ... tab uparwala sattar darwaze khol deta hai
englishDialogue: When a person closes one door ... then God opens seventy different doors for him

dialogue: Yeh duniya rokde pe chalti hai ... chahe woh undergarment se aaye ya underworld se
englishDialogue: This world runs on money ... it doesn't matter if it comes from undergarment or underworld

dialogue: Jis umar mein tujhe kabar ke bare mein sochna chahiye ... us umar mein tu lover banne ki soch raha hai
englishDialogue: In the age when you should think about a grave ... in that age you're thinking about becoming a lover

dialogue: Apna ghar bech de aur bina khidki wale kamre mein rehne ki aadat daal
englishDialogue: Sell your house and get used to living in a room without windows

dialogue: Time badal chuka hai ... aur desh bhi ... ab hum ghar mein ghuske maarte hai
englishDialogue: Time has changed ... and so has the country ... nowadays we go in their house and kill them

dialogue: Gut feeling, aggression, common sense ... yeh hai Mumbai police ka kaam karne ka tareeka
englishDialogue: Gut feeling, aggression, common sense ... this is how Mumbai police works

dialogue: Qayamat bhi kya cheez hai ... na dastak, na aaghaaz ... jab mann kiya sar uthake aa jaati hai aur sab jalakar raakh kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Disaster is also such a strange thing ... without any news or notification of coming ... it comes straight at us and burns everything to ashes

dialogue: Ek bas seene mein dil chahiye ... aap poori kaiyanaat se ladh padoge
englishDialogue: All you need is a heart in your body ... and you'll be ready to fight the entire universe with it

dialogue: Khuda ki barkat hai mohabbat ... mohabbat karo toh toot ke, bina khauf ke, bina sharm ke, bina soch ke ... agar jeet gaye toh kya kehna ... haare bhi toh baazi maat nahi
englishDialogue: Love is God's blessing ... if you love then do it to the fullest, without fear, without feeling shy, without thinking ... if you win then nothing like it ... and even if you lose, then still the battle is not lost

dialogue: Khud se azaadi toh sirf maut hi de sakti hai ... ya phir ishq
englishDialogue: Only death can free you from yourself ... or else love

dialogue: Pyar bhi ajeeb janwar hai ... chabuk taan do, bhookha maar do, zinda gaad do ... par kambakht baaz nahi aata
englishDialogue: Love is a strange kind of animal ... even if you hit it with a whip, keep it hungry and bury it alive ... but it still doesn't give up

dialogue: Yeh ishq nahi aasaan ... ya toh dooboge ya tairke nikloge
englishDialogue: Love is not an easy thing ... either you'll drown in it or you'll swim and pass it

dialogue: Agar meri kismat mein sirf khaak likha hai ... mujhe qubool hai ... agar yeh hi meri aakhri aah hai ... mujhe qubool hai ... qubool hai, qubool hai, qubool hai
englishDialogue: If there are only ashes written in my destiny ... then I accept it ... if this is my last sigh ... then I accept it ... I accept it, I accept it, I accept it

dialogue: Kuch cheezein apni jagah pe hi theek rehti hai ... door se dekh lo, aankhen sek lo ... haath lagao toh gayab ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Some things look good in their own place ... you can look at them from a distance and make your eyes happy ... but if you touch them, then they disappear

dialogue: Gaanv mein wow ... maska pav ... meow!
englishDialogue: Something wow in the village ... like butter and bun ... meow!

dialogue: Hum is baar shehar ki mem ke saath A-B-C-D nahi ... gaanv ki gori ke saath Ka-Kha-Ga ... Fa karenge
englishDialogue: This time we don't do A-B-C-D with a gorgeous city girl ... but with a beautiful village girl we'll do Ka-Kha-Ga ... and F**k

dialogue: Sapne mein matka ... reality mein jhatka ... upar wale tu kahan laake patka
englishDialogue: A pot in the dreams ... a jerk in reality ... oh god, where have you thrown me

dialogue: Duniya bhar ki masti tumhare pyar ki barabari nahi kar sakti ... aur aaj us hi pyar ki kasam khate hai ... mar jayenge par tumhe kabhi dhokha nahi denge
englishDialogue: All the entertainment of the world can't equal your love ... and today I swear on that love ... that I'll die, but I'll never cheat on you

dialogue: Joh aap kahoge woh karungi ... jahan aap bologe wahan karungi ... jaise aap kahoge waise karungi
englishDialogue: I'll do whatever you want ... I'll do it wherever you want ... I'll do it however you want

dialogue: Yahan honi chahiye thi kahani yeh poori ... marte waqt Ragini ki jawani thi adhoori ... koi bhi mard chalega usse, koi bhi dharam jaat ... Ragini ki atma ko chahiye bas suhagraat, suhagraat, suhagraat
englishDialogue: Here the story should have ended ... Ragini's youth was incomplete when she died ... any man of any religion would be good for her ... as Ragini's soul just wanted to have a nuptial night

dialogue: Banne chale the hum Shikari Shambu ... ab ghusenge bade bade bambu
englishDialogue: We wanted to become Shambu the great hunter ... but now big sticks will enter our rear end

dialogue: Jab woh choti thi toh gaud mein behatkar lollypop khati thi ... ab jab gaud mein behatti hai toh meri lolly, pop ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When she was small she used to sit in my lap and have a lollypop ... now when she sits in my lap, then my lolly pops

dialogue: Yeh duniya ka pehla bistar hai ... jahan saath soti meri biwi ki sister hai
englishDialogue: This must be the first bed of the world ... on which my sister-in-law sleeps with us

dialogue: Gaanv mein oow ... baasi pav ... what to do now!
englishDialogue: Oh hell, in the village ... stinking buns ... what to do now!

dialogue: Uske kuch kuch mein ... kuch nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: In his something something ... nothing happens

dialogue: Tu insaan nahi, junglee sand hai ... junglee sand nahi, gahde ki g*nd hai
englishDialogue: You're not a human, you're a wild buffalo ... forget a wild buffalo, you're a donkey's a**

dialogue: Uski ghadi mein har waqt sadhe chhe hi bajhe rehte hai
englishDialogue: The time is always 6:30 in his clock

dialogue: Tujhe dekh ke samajh mein aate hai saale ... ki saala gaali kaisi bane
englishDialogue: Rascal, looking at you now I know ... why brother-in-law is called a curse

dialogue: Haath hilaate reh gaya mardon ka mela ... lekin nahi aayi kabhi milan ki bela ... Ragini ne apni jawani ki bhook ko jhela ... lekin uske baap ne nahi khane diya ek bhi kela ... arre kela toh door na mili usse koi kakdi ... na kisi mard ki baahon mein kheli woh pakda pakdi
englishDialogue: The gathering of men was left waving their hands ... but the season of union never came ... Ragini handled the hunger of her youth ... but her dad didn't let her eat even one banana ... forget a banana, she didn't even get one cucumber ... and neither did she play catch me, in any man's arms

dialogue: Hum teen bhai the Ramsay brothers ... do gaye kaam se ... main bacha Ramsay
englishDialogue: We were three Ramsay brothers ... two of them have lost it ... I'm the only Ramsay remaining

dialogue: Maana ki yeh flashback ki story hai ... par kya yeh rhyming zaroori hai
englishDialogue: I agree that this is a story of flahsback ... but is this rhyming necessary

dialogue: Pad gayi mehangi yaaron joh sochi thi sasti ... ab toh jayegi yahan se sirf hamari asthi ... humein kisne kaha tha karne great grand masti
englishDialogue: What we thought was going to be cheap, turned out to be expensive ... now only our ashes will leave from here ... who asked us to have great grand fun

dialogue: Ek baar joh maine commitment de di ... toh yeh meri bhi nahi sunta
englishDialogue: Once I make a commitment ... then even my p*nis doesn't listen to me

dialogue: Ragini ki sundarta ke poore gaaon mein the charche ... apne khoon se likhe naujawano ne usse parche ... lekin rakhne apni beti se door har paap ... ghar ke darwaze pe khada tha uska baap
englishDialogue: The whole village was talking about Ragini's beauty ... young guys had written letters for her with their blood ... but to keep every sin away from her daughter ... her father was standing at her doorstep

dialogue: Abhe Pandu with a "G"
englishDialogue: Hey you a**hole

dialogue: Marne se pehle main chahta hoon ke mere pariwar ke saath ek family photo ho ... jiske neeche title hoga "Kapoor and Sons", since 1921
englishDialogue: Before dying I wish to have a family photo with my family ... on the bottom of which it will be written "Kapoor and Sons", since 1921

dialogue: Baba matlab note jhapat ... dikha jannat ka shortcut
englishDialogue: A religious saint means to jump on money ... by showing people the shortcut to heaven

dialogue: Desh do hi log chalate hai ... mahatma aur Gandhi ... mahatma woh jinke gunahon ka koi saboot na ho
englishDialogue: Only two people run this country ... a holy person and Mahatma Gandhi (money) ... a person is called holy when there are no proofs to his crime

dialogue: Yeh Global Baba ka kal kya hoga pata nahi ... lekin aaj iska bal global hai
englishDialogue: We don't know what will happen to Global Baba tomorrow ... but today his power is global

dialogue: Media, maaldaaron se aur babaon se ... jitna door rahe utna hi acha hai
englishDialogue: Media, rich people and religious saints ... the more distance you keep from them, the better it is

dialogue: Police wale do hi mauke par muft ki daawat dete hai ... ek baar tab jab usse apni vardi utarne ka khatra ho ... aur doosri baar jab usse sarkar se medal milne ki umeed ho
englishDialogue: A police officer gives a treat only under two circumstances ... one when he's concerned that he's going to loose his job ... and second when he has the hope of getting a medal from the government

dialogue: Global Godfather tak pahuncha doonga aap sabon arzi ... baki unki marzi
englishDialogue: I'll take your request to Global Godfather ... beyond that it's upto him

dialogue: Jab do akalmand ek doosre ko bewakoof banate hai ... toh is mein samay aur shabdh dono barbaad hote hai
englishDialogue: When two smart people try to make a fool out of each other ... then in that both time and words are wasted

dialogue: Murkhon ke mohalle mein sayano ka jhopda ... kahan se chalaye is duniya mein samajhdhari ka rokda
englishDialogue: Smart people have a hut in the colony of fools ... how can I use the currency of sense in this world

dialogue: Jantantra ka mantra yahi hai ... jiske saath janta us hi ka kaam banta
englishDialogue: The mantra of democracy is that ... the one who has people on his side, he's the one with power

dialogue: Robo hai tu robo, corporate robo ... tere hardware mein koi soft feelings hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: You're a robot, a corporate robot ... there are no soft feelings in your hardware

dialogue: Tere spaghetti jaise ghane lambe baal ... olives jaisi kaali kaali, actually not so kaali kaali aankhen ... baby corn jaisi nukeeli naak ... cherry tomatoes jaise laal laal gaal ... sliced bell pepper se bane honth ... jalapeno si teekhi zubaan ... chalti phirti pasta dish ho
englishDialogue: You have dense black hair like spaghetti ... black eyes like olives, actually not completely black ... sharp nose like baby corn ... red cheeks like cherry tomatoes ... lips made from sliced bell pepper ... spicy tongue like jalapeno ... you're a walking pasta dish

dialogue: Mera maqsad mehnat se bachna nahi ... meri mehnat faltu maqsad se bachke rehna hai
englishDialogue: My goal is not to stay away from hard work ... I work hard to stay away from useless goals

dialogue: Aurat ke liye mard woh hota hai joh jaanta hai ki woh mard hai ... woh nahi jisse apni chaddi ke andar ki cheez par vishvas kam ho ... aur usse cheek cheekar duniya ko batana pade ... ki main mard hoon, main mard hoon, main mard hoon
englishDialogue: For a woman a man is someone who knows he is a man ... and not someone who is not confident of what's inside his pants ... and he has to shout it out to the world that ... I'm a man, I'm a man, I'm a man

dialogue: Sugarfree biscuit jis mein sugar kam hai ... sugar waale biscuit se double mehenga ... slim milk jis mein doodh kam hai ... woh doodh waale milk se zyada mehenga hai ... kam khana zyada khane se expensive ho gaya hai
englishDialogue: Sugarfree biscuits which have less sugar ... are double the price of the sugar biscuits ... slim milk which has less milk ... is more expensive than regular milk ... eating less has become more expensive than eating more

dialogue: Main apni maa jaisa banna chahta hoon
englishDialogue: I want to become just like my mom

dialogue: Hota hai, aksar hota hai ... ishq mein aksar hota hai ... chot kahin lagti hai jakar ... zakhm kahin par hota hai
englishDialogue: It happens, often it happens ... in love often it happens ... you get hurt in one place ... and the wound emerges somewhere else

dialogue: Jab tak main is dhari pe zinda hoon ... meri talwar unki raksha karti rahegi
englishDialogue: Till the time I'm alive on this earth ... my sword will keep protecting them

dialogue: Sher dahaadte hai toh kaanpte huye geedhar girte hai ... hum toh woh hai joh sheron ke mooh mein haath daalke unke daant ginte hai
englishDialogue: When a lion roars then jackals shiver and fall down ... I'm someone who puts his hand in the mouth of a lion and counts his teeth

dialogue: Toofan kisi waqt ka mohtaj nahi hota ... unka toh jab mann kiya aaye aur tabahi machakar chale gaye
englishDialogue: A storm is never dependent on time ... it comes whenever it wants to and creates a catastrophe and leaves

dialogue: Apne pyar ko bachaye rakhne ke liye joh raaz hum dafan karne ki koshish karte hai ... woh dafan hote nahi ... bas intezar mein rehte hai ek aise waqt ke ... jab woh hamare pyar aur hamari zindagi ko tabah kar sakte hai
englishDialogue: The secrets that we try to bury to protect our love ... cannot be buried ... they only wait for one such moment ... when they can destroy our love and our life

dialogue: Pagal woh nahi hote hai jise bhoot dikhte hai ... pagal woh hote hai jise insaan nahi dikhte
englishDialogue: People who see ghosts are not mad ... instead people who don't see humans are mad

dialogue: Secrets are the enemy of love ... yeh baat samajhne ke liye bahut badi keemat chukayi hai maine
englishDialogue: Secrets are the enemy of love ... I've paid a very big price to understand this

dialogue: Tumhara music kisi aur ki music ki goonj nahi, tumhara apna hona chahiye
englishDialogue: Your music must be yours and not the echo of someone else'se music

dialogue: Tumhari awaaz bahut khoobsurat hai ... aur tumhare suron mein tumhari andar ki awaaz sunai deti hai
englishDialogue: Your voice is very beautiful ... and one can hear your inner voice in your singing

dialogue: Artist duniya se chale jaate hai ... lekin unka art unhe hamesha zinda rakhta hai
englishDialogue: Artist do leave the world ... but their art always keeps them alive

dialogue: Tumhare andar joh sangeet hai woh bahut kam logon ko naseeb hota hai
englishDialogue: The music that is inside you, only a few lucky people have that

dialogue: Dil tootne ki awaaz toh woh log hi sun paate hai ... jinka apna dil kabhi toota ho
englishDialogue: Only those people can hear the noise of a breaking heart ... who themselves have been heart broken in the past

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi zindagi mein aise modh aate hai ... ke insaan khud bhi nahi jaanta, woh kidhar ja raha hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes in life such turns come ... where a person himself doesn't come to know, as to where is he going

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi hota hai ke hum doosron ki pareshaniyan toh dekh lete hai ... par apno ka gham samajh nahi paate
englishDialogue: Sometimes we can understand what problems strangers have ... but we fail to understand the sorrow of our dear ones

dialogue: Deadly, dangerous ya Rocky ... is naam se mujhe woh jaante hai joh mujhe janana nahi chahte hai ... baaki sab ke liye, I'm just handsome
englishDialogue: Deadly, dangerous or Rocky ... people who don't want to know me, know me by these names ... for everyone else, I'm just handsome

dialogue: Kal ki baat karne waala kal nahi marta ... kal ki baat karne waala aaj marta hai ... sirf aaj ka sochne waale ke haathon ... aur main sirf abhi ki sochta hoon
englishDialogue: The one who talks about tomorrow, doesn't die tomorrow ... the one who talks about tomorrow, dies today ... only from the hands of the one who thinks about today ... and I only think about the present

dialogue: Tujhse kitni badi galati hui hai woh tujhe teri sazaa batayegi
englishDialogue: Your punishment will tell you how big a mistake have you done

dialogue: Aap logon ko bas peeth par vaar karna aata hai ... par hum Hindustaniyon ne kabhi peeth dikhana seekha hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: You guys only know how to attack behind the back ... but we Indians have never learnt how to turn our backs to someone

dialogue: Mashaal ek ho ya ek lakh ... sirf ek chingaari ki zaroorat hai usse jalane ke liye
englishDialogue: Whether there is one or millions of torches ... you only need one spark to ignite them

dialogue: Yeh lakeeran na badhi dheet hai ... mutthi mein toh band ho jaati hai par qaabu mein nahi aati
englishDialogue: These palm lines are very stubborn ... you can enclose them in your fist but you can't control them

dialogue: Na kar bandeya meri teri ... char dinan da phair hai duniya ... phir tu bhi mitti, main bhi mitti
englishDialogue: Don't do yours and mine ... life is nothing but four days long ... after that we both will turn into dust

dialogue: Begunah ko saza dena, begunah ko maut dena ... poori insaaniyat ko maut dena hai
englishDialogue: To punish an innocent person, to give death to an innocent person ... is like giving death to the entire humanity

dialogue: Khel khel mein, khel khel ke, khel khel yeh aa jayega ... haar jeet se, haar jeet ke, jeet haarna sikhayega ... khel khel mein
englishDialogue: You'll learn the game when you play the game ... when you win and lose, then winning will teach you losing ... when you play the game

dialogue: Zindagi aur shatranj mein yahi toh farak hai ... zindagi mein doosra mauka milta nahi ... yahan shatranj mein mil jaata hai
englishDialogue: This is the difference between life and a game of chess ... in life you don't get a second chance ... but here in the game of chess you get that

dialogue: Agar pyada badshah ke saath ladega ... toh bahut buri maut marega
englishDialogue: If a pawn will fight against the king ... then it will die a very dreadful death

dialogue: Maut toh ek din muayyan hai, neend kyun raat bhar nahi aati ... hum wahan hai jahan se humko bhi kuch hamari khabar nahi aati
englishDialogue: Death is destined to come one day, but why can't I sleep all night ... I'm in a place from where I myself don't get any news about me

dialogue: Russia mein, Russian ladki ke saath Russian vodka peene ki baat hi kuch aur hai
englishDialogue: Drinking Russian vodka in Russia, with a Russian girl is a wonderful experience

dialogue: Shatranj waqt ka khel zaroor hai yaara ... par usse khelna ka koi waqt nahi
englishDialogue: My friend, chess is a game that takes time ... but there is no set time when you can play it

dialogue: Jab tak meri saansein chalengi ... mera inteqam zinda rahega
englishDialogue: Until I breathe ... my revenge will stay alive

dialogue: Mere bayaan ka ek ek lafz ... Gita aur Ramayan ki tarah pavitra aur sach hai ... aur sach ke sivah kuch nahi hai
englishDialogue: Every word of my statement ... is pure and true like the Bhagavad Gita and the Ramayana ... and nothing but the truth

dialogue: Maut se kiski rishteydari hai ... aaj meri toh kal teri baari hai
englishDialogue: Death is not related to anyone ... today it is my turn and tomorrow it will be yours

dialogue: Gaadi mein aur biwi mein kya farak hai yaar ... chalte chalte gaadi bighad jaati hai, behte behte biwi bighad jaati hai
englishDialogue: My friend there is no difference between a car and a wife ... a car goes bad as you drive it and a wife goes bad just like that

dialogue: Ungli mat kar mere ko mohabbat ke beech mein ... nahi toh dafna doonga tere ko Juhu ke beach mein
englishDialogue: Don't come in between me and my love ... or else I'll bury you in Juhu beach

dialogue: Main tere saath lagane ko tayaar hoon saat chakkar ... kyun ki mera dil bechain hai tere dil se lene ko takkar
englishDialogue: I'm ready to take seven rounds with you (around the holy fire) ... because my heart is restless to clash with your heart

dialogue: Na main hoon nikamma, na tu hai nikammi ... shaadi karke hum dono banenge daddy aur mummy
englishDialogue: Neither I'm useless, nor are you useless ... we will get married and become daddy and mummy

dialogue: Vapas karde mera meter mujhko ... nahi toh ek jhappad mein bhej doonga Punjab tujhko
englishDialogue: Return my meter to me ... or else I'll send you to Punjab with one tight slap

dialogue: Hathyar uthane waala kabhi saahasi nahi hota ... kyun ki usse apne se zyada bharosa uske hathyar par hota hai ... job kabhi bhi dokha de sakta hai ... lekin aapka saahas, aapki taqat, aapko kabhi dokha nahi degi
englishDialogue: The one who uses a weapon is not courageous ... because he believes in his weapon more than himself ... which can betray him anytime ... but your courage, your strength, can never betray you

dialogue: Machhar agar neend mein bhi hamara khoon choosta hai ... toh hum usse maar dete hai ... magar yeh gunde hamare jaagte huye hamara khoon bahate hai ... aur hum kuch nahi karte
englishDialogue: If a mosquito sucks our blood even while we sleep ... then we kill him ... but these goons shed our blood even when we are awake ... and we don't do anything about it

dialogue: Petrol ka daam badta hai litre ke hisaab se ... auto waala kaise chalayega meter ke hisaab se
englishDialogue: The rate of petrol rises based on litre ... then how can a rickshaw driver charge based on the meter

dialogue: Main apne motape par is qadar hairaan ho gaya hoon ... bar bar aate jaate pareshaan ho gaya hoon
englishDialogue: I've become perplexed with my obesity ... I'm worried everytime when I come from here and there

dialogue: Niyam aur kanoon insaano ke liye hota hai ... insaan niyam aur kanoon ke liye nahi hote
englishDialogue: Rules and regulations are made for humans ... humans are not made for rules and regulations

dialogue: Galat ko galat na kehna ... sabse badi galati hai
englishDialogue: Not calling the wrong as wrong ... is the biggest mistake

dialogue: Makkai ki roti sambhar se khayenge ... Dharmendra Hema ke mafit hum bhi shaadi banayenge
englishDialogue: We will eat corn bread with lentil soup ... like Dharmendra and Hema we will also get married

dialogue: Tere liye yeh kehna bahut mushkil hai ... ki tu zyada gira hua baap hai ... ya zyada gira hua insaan
englishDialogue: When it comes to you, it is very hard to say ... whether you are a more bad father ... or a more bad person

dialogue: Khula paisa aur khuli aurat samne ho ... toh aadmi ka dimaag kaam karna bandh kar deta hai
englishDialogue: When when you have open money and an open woman in front of you ... then the mind of a person stops working

dialogue: Gun haath mein lene ke baad ... dil aur dimaag poori tarah se shikaar pe hona chahiye
englishDialogue: Once you take the gun in your hand ... your heart and mind should be completely on the prey

dialogue: Aadmi ko maarne ke liye ek hi goli kaafi hoti hai ... agar woh goli sahi jagah pe lage
englishDialogue: To kill a person you only need one bullet ... if that bullet hits the right spot

dialogue: Nasha sukoon deta hai, yeh bharm hai ... nasha maut deta hai, yeh sach hai ... zindagi se pyar karo aur nashe pe vaar karo
englishDialogue: Intoxication gives you peace, is a myth ... intoxication gives you death, is the truth ... love your life and attack the intoxication

dialogue: Power kisi ko bhi maar sakta hai
englishDialogue: Power can kill anyone

dialogue: Apne mulk ki hasti ko hargiz na mitne denge ... apne pyare jeevan mein yeh zehar na ghulne denge ... agar jeevan hai drugs ke shikanje mein ... toh tum ho maut ke panje mein
englishDialogue: Don't ever let the existence of your country be erased ... don't let this poison get mixed with your lovely life ... if life is in the hands of drugs ... then you are in the hands of death

dialogue: Neeli chatri waale, agar tu hai toh meri fariyad sun ... is duniya mein kahi ladkiyan hai ... ek toh, arre ek toh mere liye chun
englishDialogue: Hey you (God) with the blue umbrella, if you are there then listen to my complaint ... in this world there are so many girls ... atleast select one for me, atleast one

dialogue: Yeh aasoon joh hai na, beh jaye toh pani hai ... andhar reh jaye toh zehar hai
englishDialogue: These tears, if they flow away then they are like water ... but if they stay inside then they are like poison

dialogue: Tujhe chahiye desi ilaaj aur woh ilaaj karega yeh desi haath
englishDialogue: You need a local treatment and this local hand will do that treatment

dialogue: Tumhare aur mere beech hamesha ek foot ka fasla reh jaata hai ... jaanta hai kyun? ... kyun ki tu hamesha ek foot neeche se sochta hai (from the heart) ... aur main ek foot upar se (from the mind)
englishDialogue: There always remains a distance of one foot between you and me ... you know why? ... because you always think from one foot below (from the heart) ... and I think from one foot above (from the mind)

dialogue: Yeh pao kilo ka bheja bhi ajeeb cheez hai ... theek ho tab bhi takleef deta hai ... aur agar na theek ho, tab toh aur bhi takleef deta hai
englishDialogue: This quarter kilo brain is a strange thing ... it gives us problems when it's ok ...  and if it's not ok, then it gives us much more problems

dialogue: Service hai, salary hai, sapna hai ... settle ho ja
englishDialogue: You have a job, a salary, a dream ... now settle down

dialogue: Yeh kaunsi manzil hai, yeh kaunsa makaam hai ... aankhon mein koi chehra, hothon pe koi naam hai
englishDialogue: What destination is this, what route is this ... there is one face in the eyes, and another name on the lips

dialogue: Jitna tum karti ho mujhse pyar ... us mein 10% aur jodh lo yaar
englishDialogue: The amount of love that you have for me ... add 10% to that

dialogue: Aurat ke dil ke andar joh jhankkar uske har khwab ko dekh sake ... wohi uska asli haqdaar hota hai
englishDialogue: He who can peep into a woman's heart and read every dream of hers ... has the real right over that woman

dialogue: Dil ko rokta hoon toh aankhen bhatak jaati hai ... aankhen band karta hoon toh khwab bhatak jaate hai ... khwabon ko todta hoon toh yeh haath bhatak jaate hai
englishDialogue: When I stop my heart then my eyes wander ... when I close my eyes then my dreams wander ... when I break my dreams then these hands wander

dialogue: Dar pe phir sawaali aaya hai ... woh kis se pyar karti hai, yahi sawaal laya hai?
englishDialogue: The monger has come again at the doorstep ... with the question, who does she love?

dialogue: Usne dekha hi nahi apni hatheli ko kabhi ... us mein dhundli si kahin, meri bhi lakeer toh hai
englishDialogue: She has never noticed her palm ... in that somewhere lightly, there is even my line

dialogue: Raja ki ek rani thi, yeh kahani toh suni thi ... deewane ki ek deewani hai, yeh aaj ki kahani hai
englishDialogue: I've heard the story about the king who had a queen ... but a passionate guy had a passionate girl, that is the story these days

dialogue: Ishq ki chot ka kuch dil pe asar ho toh sahi ... dard kam ho ya zyada, magar ho toh sahi
englishDialogue: Let there be some effect on the heart from the wound of love ... be it less painful or more, but atleast it should be there

dialogue: Hoga, na jaane kaisa hoga ... kahin na kahin, koi na koi, uparwaale ne meri kismat mein bhi likha hoga
englishDialogue: There will be someone but I don't know how will he be ... god has written someone, somewhere in my destiny as well

dialogue: Pyar kabhi kabhi door hoke bhi itna paas hota hai ... aur kabhi paas hoke bhi kitna door ki mann usse dekhne ke liye itna tarasta hai jaise ... tapta reghistan baarish ki pehli boond ko tarasta hai ... kabhi bhaad ki tarah aata hai toh sab kuch baha le jaata hai ... kabhi os bankar girta hai, sab toot jaata hai ... par pyaas nahi bhujti ... aaisa anokha hota hai pyar
englishDialogue: Sometimes love being so far is still so close to us ... and sometimes being so close is still so far from us, that the heart yearns to see to her just like ... a hot desert yearns for the first drop of rain ... sometimes it comes like a flood and takes away everything with it ... sometimes it falls like a dewdrop and everything breaks ... still the thirst doesn't end ... that's how unusual love is

dialogue: Andhere mein insaan pal do pal ke liye tehar toh sakta hai, aaram kar sakta hai ... par zindagi jee nahi sakta
englishDialogue: In darkness a person can stand for a moment or two, he can relax ... but he cannot live his life over there

dialogue: Pyar ko pyar mein pade bina samjha nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: You cannot understand love without falling in love

dialogue: Log pyar ko kahan kahan talash nahi karte hai ... par pyar apne aashiqon ko khud dhoond leta hai
englishDialogue: People search for love in so many places ... but love itself finds its lovers

dialogue: Haan mera dil keh raha hai main sar se leke paon tak, tere sandali badan pe mohabbat likh doon ... mera dil keh raha hai main tere surkh taraste hoton ki lali pe, apne labon ki shabnami shararat likh doon ... haan mera dil keh raha hai tere pajeb ki jhankar pe, tere bahon ki chandan haar pe, apni bechaini ki halat likh doon ... mera dil keh raha hai tere uljhe kesu savar in aankhon ke aaine mein, tera dulhan sa roop niharon ... is mahekti zameen ki sej pe apne armano ki chahat likh doon, mohabbat likh doon, mohabbat
englishDialogue: Yes my heart is saying that I want to write my love from head to toe on your body, which is so fragrant of sandalwood ... my heart is saying that let my drops of dew play a mischief upon your ochered dripping wet lips ... yes my heart is saying that I want to write about my restless condition on the chime of your anklets, on your arms so fragrant of sandalwood ... my heart is saying that I want to caress your tangled hair, I want you mirrored in my eyes resplendent as a bride ... I want to write my desires on this fragrant soil, I want my love etched, etched in

dialogue: Yeh modern shaadi hai ... court mein jake dastakhat karo shaadi, dastakhat karo talaak ... woh din bhi door nahi ki dastakhat karte hi bache pehda ho jayenge
englishDialogue: This is a modern marriage ... by signing in the court you can get married, by signing you can get a divorce ... that day is not far away when children will be born just by signing

dialogue: Duniya badi baawari, patthar pujan jaye ... ghar ki chakki koi na puje, jaako piso khaye
englishDialogue: The world is crazy, it worships stones ... but no one worships the grinding stone of the house, which grinds and gives us bread

dialogue: Shakahari bhojan khane se dil, dimaag aur aatma teeno shaant rehte hai
englishDialogue: By eating vegetarian food your heart, mind and soul all three remain at peace

dialogue: Pothi padh padhkar jag mua, pandit bhaya na koi ... dhai aakhar prem ka, padhe so pandit hoye
englishDialogue: Reading the scriptures doesn't make you wise ... but the one who reads the two and a half letters of love, becomes wise

dialogue: Jin gharon par Allah meherbaan hota hai ... wahan betiyan paida hoti hai
englishDialogue: Girls are born in those houses ... where God has his blessings

dialogue: Jeena koi majboori nahi, ek maqsad hai
englishDialogue: To live is not an obligation, it is a purpose

dialogue: Harra rang aur bhagwa rang, green and saffron ... Hindustan ke jhande ka ek hi hissa hai ... usse ek hissa hi rehna chahiye ... poora jhanda banne ki koshish nahi karni chahiye
englishDialogue: The colours green and saffron ... are a part of the Indian flag ... they should remain as a part only ... they should not try to become the complete flag

dialogue: Asli imaan sirf mohabbat hai
englishDialogue: Only love is a true religion

dialogue: Bimaari ko chupane se rog kam nahi hota ... badh jaata hai
englishDialogue: Hiding the sickness doesn't reduce the disease ... it increases it

dialogue: Insaaniyat is duniya se bas laapata si ho gayi hai
englishDialogue: Humanity has simply vanished from this world

dialogue: Hasee nahi hai toh is duniya mein kuch bhi nahi hai ... haste raho, haste raho, haste raho
englishDialogue: If there is no laughter then there is nothing in this world ... keep laughing, keep laughing, keep laughing

dialogue: Chhot toh budhape ki hoti hai ... ek baar lag jaye, toh dard marte dam tak hota hai
englishDialogue: The wound of old age is very bad ... once you get it, then the pain lasts until you die

dialogue: Dard jitna zyada hota hai ... cheenkh utni hi lambi hoti hai
englishDialogue: The more the pain is ... the longer the scream is

dialogue: Duniya mein saharon ki sabhi ko zaroorat hoti hai ... kisi ke pyar se badkar duniya mein koi sahara nahi hota
englishDialogue: Everyone needs support in this world ... and no support in this world is bigger than the love from someone

dialogue: Kalam ki taqat talwaar se zyada hoti hai
englishDialogue: The power of a pen is more than the power of a sword

dialogue: Maa ki bad-dua bhi dua bankar lagti hai
englishDialogue: Even the bad wishes of a mother come along as good wishes

dialogue: Woh mere paas hota hai goya ... jab koi doosra nahi hota
englishDialogue: He is around me much the same as ... when no one else is around me

dialogue: Yeh kyun, kya, kahan ke uljhan mein kyun pade ... bas yeh kya kam hai ki hum sab hai aur saath hai
englishDialogue: Why should we worry about why, what, where ... isn't it enough that we are all there and together

dialogue: Soz jab dil mein utar aata hai ... nagma aankhon se nazar aata hai
englishDialogue: When passion comes into the heart ... then you can see music through the eyes

dialogue: Khushkismati sirf ek baar darwaza khatkhatati hai ... lekin badkismati tab tak darwaza khatkhatati hai jab tak darwaza khul na jaye
englishDialogue: Good luck only knocks on the door once ... but bad luck keeps knocking on the door until that door opens

dialogue: Izzat koi patni ko diya hua koi necklace nahi hai, college mein diya hua koi certificate nahi hai, locker mein chupakar rakhi koi jewellery nahi hai ... joh gava dene se chali jaati hai
englishDialogue: Respect is not a necklace that you give to a wife, its not a certificate that you give in college, its not a jewellery that you hide in the locker ... which you lose it when it goes away

dialogue: Sukh aur dukh wohi samajh sakta hai jispar beetti hai
englishDialogue: Happiness and sadness can only be understood by the one who goes through it

dialogue: Joh log khudse nahi darte ... yeh samaaj ussi se darta hai
englishDialogue: People who are not scared of themselves ... this society is scared of them

dialogue: Ek umar si jee rahi ho, magar adhoori ... agar woh mil jaye, toh zindagi ho jaye poori
englishDialogue: I am living since long, but incomplete ... if I get him, then my life will be complete

dialogue: Kal tak joh ajnabi tha, dil aaj ussi ko chahta hai ... zindagi dene waale tujhpe, mar jaane ko jee chahta hai
englishDialogue: The one who was a stranger until yesterday, today the heart loves him ... oh god I wish to give my life for you

dialogue: Kyun mere pyar ka tum imtehaan lete ho ... tum meri jaan ho, kyun meri jaan lete ho
englishDialogue: Why are you taking an exam of my love ... you are my love, why are you taking my life

dialogue: Insaan ka is duniya mein aana is baat ka signal hai ... ke koi hai joh sirf uski khatir is duniya mein aaya hai
englishDialogue: The existence of a human in this world is a signal that ... there is someone who has come in this world just for them

dialogue: Life mein doosron ke liye itna karna ... ki kabhi kam na pade
englishDialogue: If life do so much for others ... that it should never be less

dialogue: Humne tumhari yaad mein ro roke tub bhar diye ... aur tum bewafaa aaye aur usmein naha ke chal diye
englishDialogue: I have filled up tubs crying and remembering you ... and you cheated by coming and taking a bath in it

dialogue: Jinke paas pyar ki daulat ho ... unhe kabhi gareeb nahi samajhna chahiye
englishDialogue: Those who have the wealth of love ... you should never consider them poor

dialogue: Naya aashiq purane sharaabi ki tarah hota hai ... har jagah usse botal nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: A new lover is like an old alcoholic ... he sees a bottle everywhere

dialogue: Mumbai shehar dikhave ka shehar hai ... yahan jiske paas gaahi ho, uski gaadi fatafat chalti hai
englishDialogue: The city of Mumbai is a city of flaunting ... here one who has a car, moves faster

dialogue: Ek mujrim kanoon se bhaag sakta hai ... lekin doosre mujrim se nahi
englishDialogue: A criminal can run from the law ... but not from an other criminal

dialogue: Aaj apna pehla mulaqat, khane ke liye daal bhat ... khana khale aaj mere saath, khana khale bill ka kya baat
englishDialogue: Today is our first meeting, we have lentil rice to eat ... eat with me today and don't worry about the bill

dialogue: Tum toh un jaali noton se bhi zyada jaali nikle ... joh bazaar mein chalte hai
englishDialogue: You turned out to be more counterfeit than counterfeit money ... which runs in the market

movie: Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hai
dialogue: Joh log maaf kar dete hai na woh kabhi udhas nahi hote
englishDialogue: People who forgive never feel sad

movie: Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hai
dialogue: Gaon ki shudh hawa khai hai maine, cigarette ha dhuan nahi ... faulad ka seena hai mera, haddiyon ka pinjra nahi
englishDialogue: I've taken in fresh air of the village and not the smoke from a cigarette ... my body is made from steel and it's not a cage of bones

dialogue: Bahut soch samajh kar samajh samajh kar samajhdari ke saath hum dono milke duniya ko kuch aaisa samjhayenge ... ke soch samajh kar samajh samajh kar samajhdari ke saath duniya bhi yeh samajh jayegi ... ke soch samajh kar samajh samajh kar samajhdari ke saath hum dono ki samajhdari saath saath chal rahi hai ... aur soch samajh kar samajh samajh kar samajhdari ke saath hum dono ko joh bahut pehle kar dena chahiye tha ... woh soch samajh kar samajh samajh kar samajhdari ke saath hum dono ne baad mein kiya ... magar kiya zaroor ... samajh rahi hai na main kya samjhana chah raha hoon?
englishDialogue: After thinking a lot, understanding and with wisdom we two will make the world understand ... that after thinking, understanding and with wisdom this world will also understand ... that after thinking, understanding and with wisdom our mutual understanding is walking together ... and that after thinking, understanding and with wisdom what we two should have done long time back ... that after thinking, understanding and with wisdom was done by us later ... but it was done ... you are understanding right what I am trying to say?

dialogue: Joh karte hai woh bolte nahi ... joh bolte woh karte nahi ... joh garajte hai woh baraste nahi ... joh baraste hai woh garajte nahi ... lekin main karoonga bhi, bolunga bhi, garjunga bhi, barsunga bhi
englishDialogue: The people who do, don't talk ... the people who talk, don't do ... the people who shout, don't act ... the people who act, don't shout ... but I'll do, I'll talk, I'll shout, I'll act

dialogue: Aap log isse poochiye, iske dhadakte dil se poochiye ... zameen se poocho, aasman se poocho, hawaon se poocho, fizaon se poocho, andheron se poocho, ujalon se poocho, chaand se poocho, sitaron se poocho, aandhi se poocho, toofan se poocho ... mujhe se poocho, mere baap se poocho, isse poocho, iske baap se poocho, mere ghar ke char char cartoon se poocho ... arre main kehta hoon aur toh aur in pattiyon se poocho, in pattiyon ke peeche jalti hui battiyon se poocho, is bikhare hue kaleen se poocho, girre hue tambu se toote hue bamboo se poocho ... poocho us zarre zarre tinke tinke se kitna pyar kiya hai main ne isse?
englishDialogue: You people should ask her, ask her beating heart ... ask the ground, ask the sky, ask the wind, ask the atmosphere, ask the darkness, ask the brightness, ask the moon, ask the stars, ask the squall, ask the storm ... ask me, ask my father, ask her, ask her father, ask the four cartoons in my house ... infact I am saying that you should ask these leaves, ask the lights that are behind these leaves, ask this strewn carpet, ask this fallen shelter and broken bamboo ... ask every little thing and every drop how much have I loved her?

dialogue: Maine tujhe dhoonda yahan vahan sara jahan kahan kahan kahan ... tu mujhe mili yahan yahan yahan?
englishDialogue: I looked for you here, there, everywhere ... and I found you here, here, here?

dialogue: Woh ek ko pakadti hai, doosre ko lipatti hai, teesre ko dekhti hai ... aur chauthe ko chedti hai
englishDialogue: She holds onto one, she hugs the second one, she looks at the third one ... and she teases the fourth one

dialogue: Hum court mein dimaag se lade hai toh Baazigar ka Shah Rukh Khan hoon ... mukka laat se lade hai toh Judwaa ka Salman Khan hoon ... aur jazbaat se lade hai toh Sarfarosh ka Aamir Khan hoon
englishDialogue: If I fight in the court with my brain then I'm Shah Rukh Khan from Baazigar ... if I fight with my hands and legs then I'm Salman Khan from Judwaa ... and if I fight with my emotions then I'm Aamir Khan from Sarfarosh

dialogue: I feel every day is a valentine day ... every hour is a valentine hour ... every minute is a valentine minute ... every second is a valentine second
englishDialogue: I feel every day is a valentine day ... every hour is a valentine hour ... every minute is a valentine minute ... every second is a valentine second

dialogue: Aksar log safar mein humsafar ban jaate hai
englishDialogue: Often people become soulmates in a journey

dialogue: Is naari ki aaisi tarkari banata hoon ... ke sarkari gaadi mujhe izzat se lene aaye
englishDialogue: I will smash this woman such that ... the government vehicle will come to pick me up with respect

dialogue: Na rahega bambu, na rahega tambu ... na rahega tent, aur na hogi engagement
englishDialogue: Neither there will be a bamboo, nor there will be a shelter ... neither there will be a tent, nor there will be any engagement

dialogue: Main haddi nahi hoon hadda hoon ... apne daddy ka dadda hoon ... divorce karane ka adda hoon
englishDialogue: I'm not a bone, I'm the real deal ... I am the father of my father ... and the place for getting divorce

dialogue: Is boyfriend ko usne pehle se bhi zyada lift diya aur pehle se bhi zyada bada gift diya
englishDialogue: She has giving this boyfriend more lift and a much bigger gift than the previous one

dialogue: Abbe teri patni hai ki batate vade ki chutney hai ... jis tarah se chutney har thali mein batti rehti hai, har batate vade ko patti rehti hai ... us tarah se tumhari patni ka har station pe boyfriend hai yaar
englishDialogue: Is she your wife or the chutney with potato fritter ... just like the chutney keeps flowing in every plate and sticks to every potato fritter ... just like that your wife has a boyfriend on every station

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi hoothon ka kaam aankhen kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the work of the lips is done by the eyes

dialogue: Aankhon ne kar diya kaam tamaam ... kya hai aap ka shubh naam?
englishDialogue: The eyes destroyed the work ... what is your good name?

dialogue: Auron se poora fees leta hoon ... magar tum se pachas ki jagah tees leta hoon
englishDialogue: I take full fees from others ... but from you I am taking 30 instead of 50

dialogue: Meri apni khud ki ek personal biwi hai
englishDialogue: I have one personal wife of mine

dialogue: Itni beizzati maine zindagi mein ek saath kabhi nahi jheli hai
englishDialogue: I have never handled so much disrespect at once in life

dialogue: Tum mard zaat ke naam pe ek dhabba ho ... dhabba toh kya dhabba ke abba ho
englishDialogue: It is a shame to call you a man ... infact you are the father of shamelessness

dialogue: Darke bhaag jaane waale darpok hote hai ... par binah wajah maar peet karne waale bahadur nahi ... ullu-ke-patthe hote hai
englishDialogue: People who are scared and who runaway are cowards ... but people who fight for no reason are not strong ... they are fools

dialogue: Saala kharcha pani todh pani kare apun ... aur maal pani le jaye yeh saala
englishDialogue: Bloody we do all the hard work ... and this bloody guy takes all the money

dialogue: Bata kya lega ... thanda, chai garam ... Bacardi, beer, rum
englishDialogue: Tell me what will you have ... cold drink, hot tea ... Bacardi, beer, or rum

dialogue: Every Sunday is not a day
englishDialogue: Every day is not a Sunday

dialogue: Saaya andhere mein saath chhod deta hai ... aur naseeb bure dino mein saath chhod deta hai
englishDialogue: A shadow leaves us during darkness ... and destiny leaves us during bad days

dialogue: Ladkiyon ka asli ghar unka mayka nahi ... unka sasural hota hai
englishDialogue: The real home of women is their husbands house ... not their parents house

dialogue: Insaan is duniya mein insaan bankar rahe ... yahi uske liye kaafi hai
englishDialogue: It is more than enough ... if a human lives as a human in this world

dialogue: Jis baap ki char jawan betiyan bin biyahi ghar mein baithi rahe ... us baap ki misaal us laash ki tarah hoti hai ... jisko na jalaya ja sakta hai, na dafnaya ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: A father who has four young unmarried daughters sitting in the house ... the example of that father is like that of a dead body ... which can't be cremated, and neither can it be buried

dialogue: Kutte ko ghee aur chor ko izzat ... kabhi hazam nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Clarified butter for a dog and respect for a thief ... can never be digested

dialogue: Beti ki shaadi baap ke liye swarg jaane ki seedi hoti hai
englishDialogue: The marriage of a daughter is the ladder for a father to go to heaven

dialogue: Chehra dil ka aaina hota hai
englishDialogue: The face is the mirror of the heart

dialogue: Har daaku mein ek Valmiki hota hai
englishDialogue: Inside every dacoit there is a saint

dialogue: Yeh Baburao ka style hai
englishDialogue: This is Baburao's style

dialogue: Saala, rakh diya toh bhi baat karta hai
englishDialogue: Bloody I put him down, but he is still talking

dialogue: Kutriya saala, dekh ke number dial kar!
englishDialogue: Bloody dog, look at the number when when you dial!

dialogue: Woh main mast tel mein fry karke, woh main kha gaya
englishDialogue: That, I nicely deep fried it in oil and ate it

dialogue: Utha le re baba, utha le ... mereko nahi re, in dono ko utha le
englishDialogue: Lift it up God, lift it up ... not me, lift these two up

dialogue: Devi ka prasad mandir mein milta hai ... garage mein nahin
englishDialogue: You'll get God's sacrament in the temple ... not in a garage

dialogue: Pehle mereko yeh samjha ki ... isko samjhana kya hai
englishDialogue: First explain to me ... what I need to explain to him

dialogue: Agar subah subah sandaas jana hai toh singer banna padega
englishDialogue: If you want to go to the toilet early morning then you will have to become a singer

dialogue: Sunday ko aa ... Sunday ko mast naha do ke aa
englishDialogue: Come on Sunday ... Take a nice clean shower on Sunday and come

dialogue: Meri kundli mein khoon likha hai ... maloom hai na?
englishDialogue: There is a murder written in my horoscope ... you know right?

dialogue: Pressure aa gaya ... pressure aa gaya ... haai pressure aa gaya
englishDialogue: Pressure has come ... pressure has come ... oh pressure has come

dialogue: Chai se zyada saala kitli garam hai
englishDialogue: The kettle is hotter than the tea

dialogue: Meri nazar mein teri haisiyat is paan ke barabar hai ... jisse jab chahun chabakar, tookh sakta hoon
englishDialogue: Your status in front of me is that of a betel leaf ... which I can chew and spit anytime I want

dialogue: Barsega pani aur hum sab nahayenge ... promotion ki khushi mein nachenge gayenge
englishDialogue: It will rain and we all will shower in that ... and we shall dance and sing in the joy of promotion

dialogue: Is aurat ke mann mein chupa hai paap ... bachche ka woh padosi hai baap
englishDialogue: There is evil hiding in this woman's heart ... the father of her child is the neighbour

dialogue: Mai ke doodh aur majboor insaan ke aasunyon mein milavat nahi hovat hai
englishDialogue: There is no adulteration in mother's milk and the tears of a helpless person

dialogue: Insaan jab janam lene waala hota hai toh uske duniya mein aane ka paata pehle se hi chal jaata hai ... lekin maut ke aane ki khabar kisi ko nahi hoti
englishDialogue: When a human is going to be born then we know beforehand that he is coming into this world ... but no one knows when will death come

dialogue: Dukh jab zindagi ka hissa ban jaye ... toh usse haskar gale laga lena chahiye
englishDialogue: When sadness becomes the part of your life ... then you should hug it laughingly

dialogue: Jis tarah aag lakdi ko jalakar raakh kar deti hai ... ussi tarah gussa insaan ki akal ko nighal jaata hai
englishDialogue: Just like fire burns wood into ashes ... just like that anger gulps the mind of a person

dialogue: Politics aur underworld mein agar opposition na ho ... mazaa hi nahi aata
