englishDialogue: If there is no opposition in politics and underworld ... then there is no fun

dialogue: Dushman agar taqatwar ho ... toh usse talwar se nahi balki dimaag se maarna chahiye
englishDialogue: If the enemy is strong ... then you should kill him with your mind and not a sword

dialogue: Ek ladki ki aabroo sheeshay ki tarah nazuk hoti hai ... is par ek badnaami ka chota sa patthar bhi gir jaye ... toh tootkar chaknachur ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: The honour of a girl is as weak as a mirror ... even if one small stone of disgrace falls on it ... then it breaks into pieces

dialogue: Dukh mein peeyo daru, sukh mein peeyo soup ... ameer aadmi ki party mein, gareeb aadmi chup
englishDialogue: Drink alcohol when you're sad, drink soup when you're happy ... a poor man stays quiet in a rich man's party

dialogue: Swarg mein uparwaala premiyon ki jodi banata hai ... aur yahan dharti par unhe milata hai
englishDialogue: God makes the pairs of lovers in heaven ... and he makes them meet here on earth

dialogue: Jodi toh hoti hai gajar aur mooli ki ... red and white absolutely bright ... log kahenge dekho inka pyar, inka laad ... just like a salad
englishDialogue: Carrots and radish form a great pair ... red and white absolutely bright ... people will say look at their love, their affection ... is just like a salad

dialogue: Vardi ko khel aur kanoon ko rakhail samajhne waalon ko ... Jwala maarta nahi, maar deta hai
englishDialogue: The people who think the uniform is a game and the law is their mistress ... Jwala doesn't hit them, he kills them

dialogue: Dukh ke baad sukh hi aata hai aur raat ke baad savera
englishDialogue: After sadness comes happiness and after night comes morning

dialogue: Nabhe crore Hindustan ki janta ko tabah karne waalon ko tabah karne ke liye ... sirf ek Hindustani kafi hai
englishDialogue: To destroy the people who want to destroy 90 crore Indians ... we only need one Indian

dialogue: Aye main Shankar dada ... baat karne nahi ka zyada ... poora ka poora aadmi ka kar doonga aadha
englishDialogue: I'm Shankar the boss ... don't talk to much ... or else I'll make a full person into half

dialogue: Khubsoorati saadgi mein hi hai
englishDialogue: Beauty lies within simplicity

dialogue: Tumhe dekhne ke liye mujhe in aankhon ki zaroorat nahin hai
englishDialogue: To see you I don't need these eyes

dialogue: Aadmi ke paas taqat ke saath saath dimaag ka hona bahut zaroori hai ... aur jiske paas dono cheezein hoti hai usse kehte hai complete man
englishDialogue: It's very important for a man to have brains along with strength ... and the one who has both is called a complete man

dialogue: Samundar kitna hi bada kyun na ho kisi ki pyaas nahi bhuja sakta ... aur kuvaan kitna hi chota kyun na ho ... pyaas bhujane ke liye kuven ke pani ki hi zaroorat padti hai
englishDialogue: No matter how large the ocean is, it can't quench your thirst ... and no matter how small a well is ... to quench your thirst you need the water of the well

dialogue: Phooti hui taqdeer aur tezz dimag bahut hi khatarnak combination ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: The combination of bad luck and a sharp mind can be very deadly

dialogue: Bhagwan ke saath khel, sentimental hai maaf kar dega ... bhai mental hai, cheerke rakh dega
englishDialogue: Play with god, he will forgive you since he is sentimental ... I'm mental and I'll tear you apart

dialogue: Teen cheezon ki wajah se rishtey bante bighadte hai ... aapke dil mein kya hai, aapki kismat mein kya hai aur aapki jeb mein kya hai
englishDialogue: Because of three things relationships are made or destroyed ... what is in your heart, what is in your destiny and what is in your pocket

dialogue: Kayi baatein is chewing gum ki tarah hoti hai ... jab tak mooh mein rehti hai achcha lagta hai ... bahar aate hi pareshani ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: Many things are like this chewing gum ... until they stay in the mouth it feels good ... and when they come out they become a problem

dialogue: Jahan paisa hota hai wahan jurm hai ... jahan jurm hota hai wahan khauff ... aur jahan khauff hota hai wahan mere jaisa mujrim
englishDialogue: Where there is money there is crime ... where there is crime there is fear ... and where there is fear there are criminals like me

dialogue: Haath mein pistol lekar joh jeete hai ... unka anth pistol hi likhti hai
englishDialogue: Those who live with a pistol in their hand ... their end is written by the pistol itself

dialogue: Aaj tumhe maut sirf dekhni hi nahi ... mehsoos bhi karni padegi
englishDialogue: Today you'll have to not only see a death ... but also feel it

dialogue: Shuruvat unhone ki thi ... anjaam main doongi
englishDialogue: They started it ... but I'll give it the end

dialogue: Jaise daur badalte hai, mausam badalte hai ... vaise hi har kutte ke din badalte hai
englishDialogue: Just like trends and weather change ... just like that the days of every dog change

dialogue: Yeh sach hai ki maine tumse jhoot kaha ... par yeh bhi sach hai ki maine tumse mohabbat ki hai
englishDialogue: It's true that I lied to you ... but it's also true that I've loved you

dialogue: Waqt, jihad aur maut ... kisi ka intezar nahi karta
englishDialogue: Time, holy war and death ... don't wait for anyone

dialogue: Neki aur badi mein, haiwaniyat aur insaaniyat mein, kehar aur Kashmir mein kya zinda rahe ... yeh tumhe tay karna hai ... sirf tumhe
englishDialogue: Between kindness and selfishness, between inhumanity and humanity, between fear and Kashmir what will stay alive ... you have to decide ... only you

dialogue: Pathan ko toh sirf do hi baatein aati hai ... hadh se zyada pyar aur behadh nafrat
englishDialogue: A Pathan knows only two things ... love beyond limits and hatred beyond limits

dialogue: Jahan satya hai wahan vijay hai
englishDialogue: Where there is truth, there is victory

dialogue: Dhanda shuru karne se pehle teri jahan jahan bhi pahunch hai na, un sabse meri report manga lena ... agar kisi ek ne bhi mere area mein dhanda shuru karne ki salah di na tujhe ... toh vardi ki kasam tere dhande ka ribbon kaatne main khud aaonga
englishDialogue: Before starting your business, collect my report from everyone whom you can reach ... and even if one person gives you the advice of opening your business in my area ... then I swear on my uniform that I'll myself come to cut the ribbon of your business

dialogue: Zindagi mein sirf ek hi aadmi se daro ... jise maut ka darr nahi
englishDialogue: In life fear only one person ... the one who has no fear of death

dialogue: Jis din police aur fauj tum logon ki rakhail ban jayegi na ... us din yeh saara mulk ek randikhana ban jayega ... aur jaise chakle chalte hai na ... ussi tarah tum is desh ko bech daloge
englishDialogue: The day the police and the military will become a mistress of people like you ... that day this entire country will turn into a brothel ... and just like pimps move around ... just like that you guys will sell this country

dialogue: Rishwat dene waale se zyada bada gunehgar rishwat lene waala hai
englishDialogue: A person who takes bribe is a bigger criminal than the one who gives bribe

dialogue: Main apne area mein pehle gair kanooni dhande band karta hoon ... aur phir dhande karne waalon ko
englishDialogue: First I shut down the illegal businesses in my area ... and then the people who run them

dialogue: Woh itna kamina hai ki faltu mein apni arthi par bhi nahi letega
englishDialogue: He's so shrewd that he won't lie on his bier for nothing

dialogue: Hamara har jawaan ek nuclear bomb hai
englishDialogue: Our every soldier is a nuclear bomb

dialogue: Mere desh ke liye mera jazba, meri vardi mein nahi ... meri ragon mein daud raha hai
englishDialogue: My passion for my country, is not in my uniform ... it is running in my veins

dialogue: Itni laashen bicha doonga ... ki log Jallianwala Bagh ko bhool jayenge
englishDialogue: I will spread so many dead bodies ... that people will forget Jallianwala Bagh

dialogue: Yeh business waale kisike dost nahi hote ... yeh sirf paise ke dost hote hai
englishDialogue: These businessmen are not friends with anyone ... they are only friends with money

dialogue: Kutta paalo, billi paalo, yahan tak ki saanp paalna ... par galatfahmi mat paalna
englishDialogue: Nourish a dog, nourish a cat, infact even nourish a snake ... but don't nourish a misunderstanding

dialogue: Rajneeti mein sabse ahem cheez hoti hai timing
englishDialogue: In politics timing is the most important thing

dialogue: Humse garmi aur garibi bardaasht nahin hoti
englishDialogue: I cannot tolerate heat and poverty

dialogue: Puttar, puttar, puttar ... now you give me uttar
englishDialogue: Son, son, son ... now you give me the answer

movie: Raja Ko Rani Se Pyar Ho Gaya
dialogue: Soyi hui kismat ko jagana ... wohi himmat ka kaam hai
englishDialogue: To wake up your sleeping destiny ... is something that needs courage

movie: Raja Ko Rani Se Pyar Ho Gaya
dialogue: Sapno ki duniya mein safalta pana aasaan hai ... par asli zindagi mein mushkil
englishDialogue: It's easy to achieve success in the world of dreams ... but hard in real life

dialogue: Duniya mein kitni hai nafratein ... phir bhi dilon mein hai chahatein ... mar bhi jaaye pyar waale ... mitt bhi jaaye yaar waale ... zinda rehti unki mohabbatein
englishDialogue: There is so much hatred in the world ... but still there is love in the hearts ... even if the people you love die, and your friends disappear ... their love always remains alive

dialogue: Main aaj bhi usse utni hi mohabbat karta hoon ... aur is liye nahi ki koi aur nahi mili ... par is liye ki usse mohabbat karne se fursat hi nahi milti
englishDialogue: Till today I love her the same ... not because I didn't find anyone else ... but because I don't have time left after loving her

dialogue: Izzat darr se nahi ... mohabbat se jeeti jaati hai
englishDialogue: Respect is won with love ... not with fear

dialogue: Mohabbat bhi zindagi ki tarah hoti hai ... har mod aasaan nahi hota, har mod par khushi nahi hoti ... par jab hum zindagi ka saath nahi chhodte ... phir mohabbat ka saath kyun chhodein
englishDialogue: Love is like life ... every corner is not easy, every corner doesn't bring happiness ... but when we don't leave life alone ... then why should we leave love alone

dialogue: Mohabbat mein shartein nahi hoti ... toh afsoos bhi nahi hona chahiye
englishDialogue: There are no conditions in love ... hence there should be no repenting

dialogue: Zindagi pyar dene aur pyar lene ka naam hai ... aur kuch nahi
englishDialogue: Life is about giving and receiving love ... and nothing else

dialogue: Koi pyar kare toh tumse kare, tum jaise ho waise kare ... koi tumko badal ke pyar kare, toh woh pyar nahi woh sauda kare ... aur saheba, pyar mein sauda nahi hota ... right?
englishDialogue: One should love you, the way you are ... if someone tries to change you in love, then its not love but a compromise ... and darling, one doesn't compromise in love ... right?

dialogue: Maine aaj tak sirf ek hi ladki se mohabbat ki hai ... aur zindagi bhar sirf us hi se karta rahoonga
englishDialogue: To date I have only loved one girl ... and I will keep loving only her throughout my life

dialogue: Mohabbat bahut khoobsurat hoti hai ... toh kya hua agar woh apne saath thoda sa dard laati hai
englishDialogue: Love is very beautiful ... so what if it brings a little bit of pain with it

dialogue: Jab choti choti baaton mein hum haste the rote the, tabse tumse pyar kiya hai ... jab bin mausam barsaaton mein hum jhoom jhoom ke gaate the, tabse tumse pyar kiya hai ... jab chup chupke aadhi raaton mein chatt pe taare ginte the, tabse tumse pyar kiya hai ... ab toh khud bhi bhool chuka hoon main ki kabse tumse pyar kiya hai ... bas itna hi keh sakta hoon main ...  ki sirf tumse, tum hi se pyar kiya hai
englishDialogue: I love you since we used to laugh and cry on small small things ... I love you since we used to dance and sing in the off-seasonal rains ... I love you since we used to count the stars in the middle of the night from the terrace ... now I have myself forgotten since when I have been in love with you ... but I can only say that ... I love you and I only love you

dialogue: Mohabbat aur sangeet ka bahut gehra rishta hai ... kyun ki dono ka janam dil se hota hai ... aur dono ki kismat bhi dil ke kehne par nirbhar hai
englishDialogue: Love and music have a very deep relationship ... because both are born from the heart ... and the fate of both also relies on the heart

dialogue: Aap zindagi ki har jung jeette chale aaye ... par zindagi ke saare sahare haarte chale gaye
englishDialogue: You kept winning all the battles of life ... but kept losing all the supports in life

dialogue: Main yahan par surya ki roshni itni tezz kar doonga ... ki woh aadmi joh pachaas saalon se surya ko ghoorta aa raha hai ... us he bhi apni palkein jhukani hogi
englishDialogue: I will make the rays of the sun so strong here ... that the man who has been staring at the sun for 50 years ... even he will have to lower his eyelids

dialogue: Har badi kamyaabi ke peeche ... ek bahut bada balidaan hota hai
englishDialogue: Behind every big success ... there is a very big sacrifice

dialogue: Duniya mein kitni hai nafratein ... phir bhi dilon mein hai chahatein ... jao kehdo is jahan se, is zameen se, aasman se ... rok na sakenge ab yeh mohabbatein
englishDialogue: There is so much hatred in the world ... but still there is love in the hearts ... go and say to the world, to the land, to the sky ... that they will not be able to stop this love

dialogue: Main har din dua karta hoon ki mujh jaisi kismat kisi ki bhi na ho
englishDialogue: I pray everyday that no one should have a fate like mine

dialogue: Kuch rishton ki taqdeer sirf dosti tak hi likhi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Some relationships are only destined to be friends

dialogue: Tere labon pe inkaar hai, mere labon pe ikraar hai ... haan yahi toh hai sab nishaaniyan, haan issi ka naam toh pyar hai
englishDialogue: There is no on your lips, there is yes on my lips ... these are all the signs, this is what is called as love

dialogue: Jhooth ko sach banane ke liye saboot ki zaroorat hoti hai ... sach toh khud ek saboot hai
englishDialogue: You need proof to turn a lie into the truth ... but truth by itself is a proof

dialogue: Woh bache jinke mummy pappa nahi hote na ... God ke sabse special bache hote hai
englishDialogue: Those kids who don't have parents ... are the most special kids of God

dialogue: Pyar ki aahuti hi pyar ko amar bana deti hai
englishDialogue: The sacrifice of love makes love immortal

dialogue: Bahut khoobsurat hai aankhen tumhari ... bana dijiye inko kismat hamari ... usse aur kya chahiye zindagi mein ... jisse mil gayi hai mohabbat tumhari
englishDialogue: Your eyes are very beautiful ... turn them into my destiny ... what else does he need in life ... the one who has got your love

dialogue: Hamere baad mehfil mein afsane bayan honge ...  baharen humko dhoondengi, na jaane hum kahan honge
englishDialogue: Stories will be told in the party after I'm gone ... the spring season will be looking for me, and I don't know where I'll be

dialogue: Meri nigaah ne yeh kaisa khawab dekha hai ... zameen pe chalta hua mehtab dekha hai
englishDialogue: What dreams have my eyes seen ... I've seen a moon walking on the ground

dialogue: Yeh businessman bade matlabi hote hai ... inka hasna ya rona business hota hai, inka bolna ya khamosh rehna business hota hai, inka yaad rakhna business hota hai, bhool jana business hota hai
englishDialogue: These businessmen are very selfish ... their laughing or crying is business, their talking or staying quiet is business, their remembering something is business, their forgetting something is business

dialogue: Hum businessman kisi ko maarte hai toh business ke liye ... aur kisi ko zinda rakhte hai toh business ke liye
englishDialogue: If we businessmen kill someone then it's for business ... and if we keep someone alive then it's for business

dialogue: Kya haath paya hai, saare ke saare devi devtaon ka saath hai ... rahu ketu ka ghulam hai, wahan shani ka kya kaam hai
englishDialogue: What a great hand you have, you have the support of all gods and goddesses ... the planet of Rahu is a slave of the planet of Ketu, and there is no use for the planet of Shani over there

dialogue: Harne ka risk lekar jeetne mein ... mujhe zyada maaza aata hai
englishDialogue: Taking the risk of losing and then winning ... gives me more pleasure

dialogue: Kamyaabi ki bhi ek keemat hai
englishDialogue: Even success has a value

dialogue: Imaandari insaan ko footpath pe leke jaati hai
englishDialogue: Honesty takes a human onto the sidewalk

dialogue: Yere yere pausa, tula deto paisa ... paisa saala khota, paus aala motha
englishDialogue: Oh rain do come, I'll give you money ... the money was bloody fake, and the rain came fast

dialogue: Tum kya leke aaye the ... aur kya leke jaoge
englishDialogue: What did you bring ... and what will you take and go

dialogue: Lambe khel mein chote mohron ki zaroorat nahi hoti
englishDialogue: In a long game small pawns are not needed

dialogue: Daru peena buri baat hai ... peeke bottal ko mauke padh chhod dena ... aur buri baat hai
englishDialogue: Drinking alcohol is bad ... but leaving the bottle on the spot after drinking ... is even worse

dialogue: Na moh, na maya, na mamta ka bandhan ... bus anand hi anand
englishDialogue: I don't have endearment, illusion and affection ... I only have happiness

dialogue: Aaj ke jeevan ka doosra naam hai ... rokda, paisa, maal
englishDialogue: The other name for today's life is ... cash, money, wealth

dialogue: Jis din police ki vardi ka saath pakda ... us din darr ka saath chod diya
englishDialogue: The day I took company of the police uniform ... the same day I left the company of fear

dialogue: Yeh looteri sarkar ki police hai
englishDialogue: This police is of the thug government

dialogue: Main aise loktantra mein vishvas nahi karta ... joh gareebon ki izzat karna nahi jaanta
englishDialogue: I don't believe in a democracy ... which does not know how to respect the poor

dialogue: Agar system kaam na kare, toh usse theek karna chahiye ... usse todhkar kisi ka fayda nahi
englishDialogue: If the system doesn't work, then you should correct it ... no one will benefit from breaking it

dialogue: Bandook ki nali se kabhi koi solution nahi milta
englishDialogue: A solution is never found from a guns barrel

dialogue: Yeh ladki nahi hai ... barah bor ka kartoos hai jisne mujhe dishkiyaon kar diya hai
englishDialogue: She is not a girl ... she is 12 mm bullet who has killed me

dialogue: Khemgadh ka cheetah hoon ... shikaar par hi jeeta hoon
englishDialogue: I'm a cheetah from Khemgadh ... and I live off my prey

dialogue: Bachpan mein chewing gum khakar baat nahi kar pate the ... aur ab paan khakar baat nahi kar pa rahe hai
englishDialogue: In childhood you couldn't talk properly because of the chewing gum in your mouth ... and now you can't talk properly because of the betel leaves in your mouth

dialogue: Kya aap believe karte hai love at first sight mein ... yah main dobaara ghoom ke aao?
englishDialogue: Do you believe in love at first sight ... or should I walk by again?

dialogue: Test drive mere saath aur ghar le jao meri best friend ko
englishDialogue: You test drove with me and you're taking my best friend home

dialogue: Social service hai tumhari smile ... dekho dekho tension kam ho rahe hai duniya mein
englishDialogue: Your smile is a social service ... look the tensions of the world are reducing

dialogue: Bahut logon ne mujhe use kiya hai ... but I have to say you're the best
englishDialogue: A lot of people have used me ... but I have to say you're the best

dialogue: Hot ho tum .... arre darr lagta hai mujhe ki kahin touch ho gayi toh jal na jaon main
englishDialogue: You're hot ... and I am scared that if I touch you then I might get burnt

dialogue: You really hate me na? ... and i love that
englishDialogue: You really hate me right? ... and i love that

dialogue: Jee lenge hum ... is gham ko bhi pee lenge hum
englishDialogue: I will live ... and I will endure this pain also

dialogue: Postcard shot hai tumhari aankhen ... perfect ... khwaab dikha deti hai logon ko ... joh bhi inhe dekhta hai apne aap ko dhoondta hai in mein
englishDialogue: Your eyes are a postcard picture ... perfect ... it makes people dream ... and whoever sees them tries to find himself in them

dialogue: Ek level ke baad insaan nahi ... daaru bolne lagti hai
englishDialogue: After a certain level a person doesn't do the talking ... the alcohol does

dialogue: Saala itna pressure, itna pressure ... cooker jaise feel kar raha hoon main ... tarkaari pak rahi hai andar
englishDialogue: Bloody I have so much pressure, so much pressure ... that I am feeling like a cooker ... and vegetables are cooking inside of me

dialogue: Everything that's in the house is on the house
englishDialogue: Everything that's in the house is on the house

dialogue: If I slept with you, you also slept with me
englishDialogue: If I slept with you, you also slept with me

dialogue: Mard khana banaye toh kala hai ... aurat banaye toh uska farz hai
englishDialogue: When a man cooks it's an art ... when a woman cooks it's her duty

dialogue: Mere favorite subject mein fail hoke ... doosre subject mein pass hone ka kya fayda
englishDialogue: Failing in my favorite subject and ... passing in the other subject is of no use

dialogue: Pehli baar ... ek hi baar aata hai
englishDialogue: First time ... comes only once

dialogue: Friends hum khud chunte hai ... lekin love hum mein chunta hai
englishDialogue: We ourselves select our friends ... but love selects us

dialogue: Sochne samajhne se sab milta hai ... par pyar toh bas aise hi ho jaata hai ... aise hi bina zaroorat ke zaroorat ban jaata hai ... aise hi aankhon ke raaste dil mein direct utar jaata hai
englishDialogue: By thinking you get everything ... but love happens just like that ... just like that it becomes a necessity without being a necessity ... just like that it goes into the heart via the eyes

dialogue: Tum mere saath hona nahi chah rahe ho ... aur mujhe saath hone nahi de rahe ho
englishDialogue: You don't want to be with me ... and you are not letting me be with you

dialogue: Main tumhe chhod kar toh gayi ... par bhool nahi payi
englishDialogue: I left you ... but I couldn't forget you

dialogue: Jab tum film dekh rahi thi ... toh main sirf tumhe dekh raha tha
englishDialogue: When you were watching the film ... I was only watching you

dialogue: Main dost se pyar kiya aur tumne pyar se dosti ki
englishDialogue: I loved a friend and you did friendship with your love

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi life mein aaisa lagta hai ki hum sach-much udh sakte hai ... aaisa lagta hai ki yeh ek mauka sirf hamare liye banaya gaya hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes in life you feel as if you can really fly ... it feels as if this one opportunity is only made for us

dialogue: Saath chalna hoga ... zinda ya murda
englishDialogue: You will have to come with me ... alive or dead

dialogue: Jis mohabbat mein deewangi na ho ... woh mohabbat hi nahi
englishDialogue: The love which does not have obsession ... is not love

dialogue: Dushman se pyar karna gaddari hai
englishDialogue: It is unfaithful to fall in love with the enemy

dialogue: Exam ke sawaal ka jawab toh har koi deta hai ... lekin asli hero woh hai joh zindagi ke jawab de
englishDialogue: Anyone can give the answer to a question of the exam ... but the real hero is one who has the answers to life

dialogue: Karun toh kya karun ... software mein salary soft hai ... hardware bahut hard hai ... real estate mein real gunde bhare hai ... construction mein salary kam hai ... faltu naukri karoonga toh ghar waale shaadi karayenge
englishDialogue: What should I do ... the salary in software is soft ... hardware is very hard ... there are real goons in real estate ... the salary is less in construction ... and if I do a useless job then my family will get me married

dialogue: Generally hamari generation ke log plan karke kaam karte hai ... lekin mere jaise smart log kaam karte karte plan kar lete hai
englishDialogue: Generally people of my generation plan and then do the work ... but smart people like me plan as we do the work

dialogue: Cigarette packet par warning hoti hai ki usse peene waala maut ko gale laga raha hai ... lekin meri baat alag hai ... main direct maarta hoon, lekin warning kabhi nahi deta
englishDialogue: There is a warning on the cigarette packet, that the person smoking it is hugging death ... but I'm different ... I kill directly and never give a warning

dialogue: Jaise daane daane par khane waale ka naam likha hota hai ... vaise hi ek goli par tera naam likha hai ... aur woh goli meri bandook mein hai
englishDialogue: Just like on every bite of food, the name of the person who will eat it is written ... just like that there is a bullet on which your name is written ... and that bullet is in my gun

dialogue: Logic koi nahi maanta, sabko magic chahiye ... issi liye toh yahan scientist ke bajay baba famous hai
englishDialogue: Nobody believes in logic, everyone wants magic ... that's why here saints are more famous than scientists

dialogue: Mujhe darr se darr nahi lagta
englishDialogue: I am not fearful of fear

dialogue: Paisa kamane mein time lagta hai ... churane mein nahi
englishDialogue: It takes time to earn money ... not to steal it

dialogue: Mujhe koi pakad nahi sakta ... main woh ret hoon jisse mutthi mein jitna kasoge ... woh utni hi phisalti jayegi
englishDialogue: No one can catch me ... I am like sand, the more you squeeze it in your hand ... the more it will escape

dialogue: Tum heroineno ko jab pyar mile toh career chahiye ... jab career mile toh pyar chahiye
englishDialogue: You heroines want a career when you get love ... and want love when you get a career

dialogue: Shohrat jitna deti hai ... usse kahin zyada humse cheen leti hai
englishDialogue: Whatever wealth gives us ... it snatches much more from us

dialogue: Confidence ke saath bolo na ... toh film industry jhoot ko bhi sach maan leti hai
englishDialogue: If you say with confidence ... then the film industry will even believe a lie to be the truth

dialogue: Yeh film industry hai ... yahan yah toh manipulate kar lo ... yah ho jao
englishDialogue: This is film industry ... here either you manipulate ... or get manipulated

dialogue: Sambhar ka pata nahi ... lekin aapko yeh rasam follow hi karni padegi
englishDialogue: I don't know about lentil soup ... but you will have to follow this custom

dialogue: Kyun thak re ho?
englishDialogue: Why are you getting tired?

dialogue: Sirf oye oye karne se koi chela guru nahi ho jaata ... aur sirf bhaukne se koi kutta kamina nahi ho jaata
englishDialogue: Just by saying oye oye a student doesn't become a teacher ... and just by barking a dog doesn't become a swine

dialogue: Najayaz are born out of love ... real sons out of duty
englishDialogue: Illegitimate kids are born out of love ... real sons out of duty

dialogue: George Michael ka pata nahi ... but have faith in me
englishDialogue: I don't know about George Michael ... but have faith in me

dialogue: You have bloody piles in your brains
englishDialogue: You have bloody piles in your brains

dialogue: Dine, wine, maaro me line ... I am free after nine ... place is yours or mine?
englishDialogue: Dine, wine, and hit on a girl ... I am free after nine ... place is yours or mine?

dialogue: Maine mobile shaadi ka bureau khola hai ... engagement ke liye ek dabao ... shaadi ke liye do dabao ... aur doobara shaadi karne ke liye apna pehla biwi ka gala dabao
englishDialogue: I have opened a mobile marriage bureau ... press 1 for engagement ... press 2 for marriage ... and to get remarried press the neck of your first wife

dialogue: Langoors have my angoors
englishDialogue: Monkeys have my grapes

dialogue: Jab mere baap ki hatti hai na ... meri bahut phatti hai
englishDialogue: When my dad goes crazy ... then I get scared

dialogue: BBC ka pata nahi ... but I've got news for you
englishDialogue: I don't know about BBC ... but I've got news for you

dialogue: Ek chumma tu mujhko udhar dede ... badle mein Middlesex Trafalgar Square lele
englishDialogue: Loan me a kiss ... and instead take the Trafalgar Square in Middlesex

dialogue: Maine tumhare naam ki Daler ka toh pata nahi ... mehndi laga li hai
englishDialogue: I am not sure about Daler ... but I've applied henna in your name

dialogue: Shakahari ke pet mein machchi ... aai shapat kai tari hai gochi
englishDialogue: A fish in a vegetarian's stomach ... I swear on my mom, something is strange

dialogue: Slumdog ka pata nahi ... lekin yeh kisi millionaire ka ghar lagta hai
englishDialogue: I don't know about Slumdog ... but this looks like a millionaire's house

dialogue: Yeh mera baap hai ... aur main iska paap hoon
englishDialogue: This is my father ... and I am his sin

dialogue: Beauty beauty beauty ... beti beti beti
englishDialogue: Beauty beauty beauty ... daughter daughter daughter

dialogue: Aasmaan se gire aur khajuraho mein atke
englishDialogue: I fell from the sky and got stuck in an erotic sculpture

dialogue: Jin sar pe ho Waheguru ji ka haath ... woh banate hai London ko Dhobi Ghat
englishDialogue: Those who have the hands of God on them ... they turn London into Dhobi Ghat

dialogue: Mithai ki dukaan mein mirchi hai ... aai shapat kai tari gochi hai
englishDialogue: There is spice in a sweet shop ... I swear on my mom, something is strange

dialogue: Lagta hai dieting tumne shuru ki thi ... band karna bhool gaye
englishDialogue: Looks like you started to diet ... but forgot to end

dialogue: Badtameez, malik ke hote hue ... ek driver gadi chalayega
englishDialogue: You mannerless, with the boss being present ... why will the driver drive the car

dialogue: Chillar ka pata nahi ... lekin mujh mein change aa gaya hai
englishDialogue: I don't know about coins ... but there has been a change in me

dialogue: Aaisi maar khayega ... phir kabhi susu na kar payega
englishDialogue: I will hit him in such a place ... that he will never be able to pee

dialogue: Tanker bhar khoon hai body mein
englishDialogue: I have a tanker load of blood in my body

dialogue: Unka hisaab unse, tera tujhse
englishDialogue: Their account with them, your account with you

dialogue: Lo lag gayi law and order ki
englishDialogue: Law and order is now ruined

dialogue: Kamina mere haath aa jaata na ... keema bana deti uska
englishDialogue: If I would have got hold of that rascal ... I would have made minced meat out of him

dialogue: Tumko yaad kar karke haath dukh gaya hamara
englishDialogue: My hand has started to pain remembering you

dialogue: Hindustan mein jab tak cinema hai ... log chutiye bante rahenge
englishDialogue: In India until cinema is there ... people will keep becoming fools

dialogue: Yeh dhande mein do cheezo pe kabhi bharosa nahi karna chahiye ... ek toh khud se pehda hone waale khauf pe ... aur doosra kisi ke saath pe
englishDialogue: In this business you should never trust two things ... one the fear that is born within you ... and second the company of anyone

dialogue: Beta tumse nah ho payega
englishDialogue: You won't be able to do it my son

dialogue: Kaam kaam kaam ... subah dophar shaam
englishDialogue: Work work work ... morning afternoon evening

dialogue: Kissing ka best part kiss hone se theek ek pal pehle ka hota hai ... jab pata nahin ki kiss hogi yah nahin ... kiss hogi toh kaisi hogi
englishDialogue: The best part of kissing is the moment right before the kiss ... when you don't know if the kiss will happen or not ... and if it happens then how will the kiss be

dialogue: Din mein karobaar ... raat ko gharbaar
englishDialogue: Work and all during the day ... home and all during the night

dialogue: Pyar ishq mohabbat ... duniya ka sabse aakhri aur khatarnak nasha hai
englishDialogue: Love love love ... is the worlds last and most dangerous intoxication

dialogue: Us swarg se kya lena jismein tum nahin ... aur us nark se kya darna jismein tum saath ho
englishDialogue: There is nothing to do with the heaven in which you are not there ... and there is nothing to be scared about the hell in which you are together

dialogue: Itni shiddat se wahi nafrat kar sakta hai ... jisne mohabbat bhi itni shiddat se ki ho
englishDialogue: Only someone who loves you with such passion ... can hate you with such passion

dialogue: Yeh duniya pyar ki sirf baatein karti hai ... chalti jung pe hai
englishDialogue: This world only talks about love ... it runs on war

dialogue: Joh pagal na karde woh ishq hi kya
englishDialogue: What love is it, if it doesn't make you go mad

dialogue: Sirf ek hi shikayat hai apne khoon ke rang se ... iska rang mere ehsaas ki tarah gehra nahin
englishDialogue: I have just one complain with the color of my blood ... its color is not as dense as my feelings

dialogue: Har jism ki ek expiry date hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every body has an expiry date

dialogue: Joker jiska hua ... baazi uski
englishDialogue: Whoever has the Joker ... wins the game

dialogue: Joker pehle bhi kisi rang ka hissa nahi tha ... aage bhi nahi hoga ... joker apne hi rang mein rangega
englishDialogue: The joker was never a part of any suite ... and moving forward it won't be either ... the joker has its own color

dialogue: Main har din maut ko gale lagaonga
englishDialogue: I will hug death everyday

dialogue: Hamari line mein kismat sirf ek baar dokha deti hai
englishDialogue: In our line destiny can only betray once

dialogue: Done done London karo ji
englishDialogue: Let us say yes in London style

dialogue: Zindagi toh har roz jaan leti hai ... bomb toh sirf ek baar lega
englishDialogue: Life kills you everyday ... a bomb will kill you just once

dialogue: Yadhaash bhi kitni ajeeb cheez hoti hai ... kis cheez ko poori zindagi bhoolne ki koshish karo, woh bhoolti nahi ... kabhi ek choti si cheez yaad karne ki koshish karo, toh yaad nahi aati
englishDialogue: Memory is such a strange thing ... when you try to forget a thing your whole life, you can't forget it ... and when you try to remember a small thing, you can't remember that

dialogue: Har din ek dua maangti hoon ... ke shayad ek din tum mujhe maaf kardo
englishDialogue: Everyday I pray for one thing ... that may be one day you will forgive me

dialogue: Har ishq ka ek waqt hota hai ... woh hamara waqt nahi tha ... par iska yeh matlab nahi ki woh ishq nahi tha
englishDialogue: Every love has its own time ... that time was not ours ... but that doesn't mean that the love itself wasn't there

dialogue: Baarishon mein bedhadak tere nachne se ... baat baat pe bewajah tere roothne se ... choti choti teri bachkani badmashiyon se ... mohabbat karoonga main ... jab tak hai jaan, jab tak hai jaan
englishDialogue: Your dancing freely in rains ... your getting angry on small things for no reason ... your small and childish mischiefs ... I will love them all ... as long as I live, as long as I live

dialogue: Teri aankhon ki namkeen mastiyan ... teri hasi ki beparwah gustakhiyan ... teri zulfon ki lehrati angdaiyan ... nahi bhoolunga main ... jab tak hai jaan, jab tak hai jaan
englishDialogue: Your eyes, mischievous and saline ... you laughter, an airy insolence ... your hair, it waves undone ... I will not forget ... as long as I live, as long as I live

dialogue: Bomb se zyada zakhm toh zindagi deti hai ... har mod par koi dhokha, koi dard ... toh jab zindagi ke khatron se bachne ke liye koi bomb suit nahi pehanta ... toh maut se bachne ke liye kya pehanna
englishDialogue: Life gives more wounds than a bomb ... on every turn there is betrayal, pain ... now since no one wears a bomb suit to protect from the dangers of life ... then why should one wear it to protect from death

dialogue: Joh khud khush na ho ... woh auron ko khushi kabhi nahi de sakta
englishDialogue: One who himself is not happy ... can't give happiness to others

dialogue: Tu saath hokar bhi saath nahi hoti ... ab toh rahat mein bhi rahat nahi hoti
englishDialogue: You are not with me even when you are with me ... now I can't find peace, in peace itself

dialogue: Tum na gali ki gundi ho!
englishDialogue: You are a rowdy girl from the street!

dialogue: Tera haath se haath chodna ... tera saayon ka rukh modna ... tera palat ke phir na dekhna ... nahin maaf karoonga main ... jab tak hai jaan, jab tak hai jaan
englishDialogue: Your hand slipping away from mine ... your shadows turning away from me ... you not turning back to see again ... I will not forgive ... as long as I live, as long as I live

dialogue: Har din uski zindagi ki dua maang leti hoon ... aur har din khud thodi marr leti hoon
englishDialogue: Everyday I pray for his life ... and everyday I myself die a little

dialogue: Tere jhoothe kasme vaadon se ... tere jalte sulagte khwabon se ... teri beraham duaon se ... nafrat karoonga main ... jab tak hai jaan, jab tak hai jaan
englishDialogue: Your false swears and promises ... your burning and smoldering dreams ... your heartless wishes ... I will hate them all ... as long as I live, as long as I live

dialogue: Tumhari yeh hasi, yeh masti, yeh gaaliyan agar bandh ho gayi na ... toh is duniya ka bahut nuksaan hoga
englishDialogue: If your laughter, your mischief, your curse stop ... then this world will suffer a big loss

dialogue: Joh dil jeette hai woh kabhi haarte nahi
englishDialogue: Those who win hearts can never lose

dialogue: Ya toh inhe mujhe maarna hoga ... ya phir haarkar tujhe mere paas bhejna hoga
englishDialogue: Either he (God) has to kill me ... or else he has to lose and send you to me

dialogue: Koi dua mat maangna ... sirf pyar karna mujhe
englishDialogue: Don't pray for me ... only love me

dialogue: Har chah ko intezaar hai tumhara, bas maangne ki derr hai ... chah bhi chahti hai tumhe, bas paane ki derr hai
englishDialogue: Every wish is waiting for you, you just have to ask for it ... even the wish wants you, you just have to get it

dialogue: Dil, dimaag aur body mein fight chal raha hai
englishDialogue: There is a fight going on between the heart, mind and body

dialogue: Kissing handshake se zyada hygienic hai
englishDialogue: Kissing is more hygienic than a handshake

dialogue: Yah toh top pe raho ... nahi toh chup raho
englishDialogue: Either stay on the top ... or keep quiet

dialogue: Saari baatein har ek ko nahi batayi jaati
englishDialogue: Everything is not meant to be said to everyone

dialogue: Ab mere paas khushiyan nahi, sirf gham hi gham hai ... ab mere paas logon ki bheed nahi, sirf akelapan hai
englishDialogue: Now I only have sorrow and no happiness ... now I only have loneliness and not people around me

dialogue: Khuda humko aaisi khudai naa de ... ke apne sivah aur kuch dikhai naa de
englishDialogue: Oh God don't give me the virtue where ... I don't see anything other than me

dialogue: Woh pyar joh hum apne aap se nahi, balki aurron se karte hai ... jab hum sirf apne liye hi nahi, aurron ke liye bhi jeete hai ... woh raaz hai, jiska naam zindagi hai
englishDialogue: The love that we have not just for us, but for others also ... the life that we live not only for us, but for others also ... that is the secret, which we call as life

dialogue: Meri zindagi, meri khushiyan sab mera career hai
englishDialogue: My life, my happiness is my career

dialogue: Film wohi kamyab hoti hai ... joh dil se banayi jaye ... akal se nahi
englishDialogue: Only those films are successful ... which are made from the heart ... not from the mind

dialogue: Filmon mein acting karna mera pesha hai ... meri pehchaan nahi
englishDialogue: To act in films is my profession ... not my identity

dialogue: Science jism ko jaanta hai ... aatma ko nahi
englishDialogue: Science knows the body ... not the soul

dialogue: Don't angry me!
englishDialogue: Don't make me angry!

dialogue: Jisne bhi yeh socha ki main dar gaya ... woh saala arthi pe apne ghar gaya
englishDialogue: Whoever thought that I got scared ... that person went home on a bier

dialogue: Naam sunte hi pichwaade mein bhukamp aa gaya na?
englishDialogue: Doesn't it feel like an earthquake in your ass listening to the name?

dialogue: Joh main bolta hoon woh main karta hoon ... joh main nahi bolta woh main definitely karta hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever I say I do ... whatever I don't say I definitely do that

dialogue: Sau saal zinda rehne ke liye sau saal ki umar zaroori nahi ... sirf ek din mein aaisa kaam kar jao ... jisse duniya tumhe sau saal tak yaad rakhe
englishDialogue: To live for 100 years you don't need to be 100 years old ... do something in one day ... so that the world remembers you for 100 years

dialogue: Main nahi darta ... maut darti hai mujhse
englishDialogue: Im not scared ... death is scared of me

dialogue: Apun ka fatka char sau chalis ka jhatka
englishDialogue: My shot is like a 440 volts shock

dialogue: Meri sirf ek hi khawaish hai ... jab maut mere samne aaye tab main darra hua na lagon ... bas mera haath meri mooch ko taav de raha ho aur mere chehre par ek muskurahat ho
englishDialogue: I have only one wish ... that I should not be scared when death comes in front of me ... and instead my hand should be raising my moustache and there should be a smile on my face

dialogue: Pyar karne ke liye pechaan ki nahi ... dil ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: You don't need to know someone to fall in love ... you need a heart

dialogue: Saale jahan Amol Palekar banna chahiye ... wahan Shakti Kapoor banjata hai
englishDialogue: Bloody where you should become Amol Palekar ... you become Shakti Kapoor

dialogue: Aurat ka khaas khayal do hi umar ma bahut rakhna padta hai ... ek jab uski umar hovat hai satrah, tab saala badh jaata hai khatra ... aur jab aurat hovat hai tees, oo saali ban javat hai cheez
englishDialogue: You have to take special care of a woman at two ages ... once when she turns 17, since she becomes dangerous then ... and second when she turns 30, since she becomes hot then

dialogue: Tereko jab gussa aata hai tu chilata hai ... main udata hoon
englishDialogue: You shout when you get angry ... I blow things

dialogue: Dekh ke darr gaya ... ya darr ke dekh raha hai?
englishDialogue: Are you scared after looking ... or are you looking at me scared?

dialogue: Joh bura kaam karte hai ... darr unki nas nas mein hota hai
englishDialogue: Those who do evil things ... are always scared

dialogue: Oye faulad ki aulad
englishDialogue: Hey you son of steel

dialogue: Sachche police officer ki vardi bhi apni duty nibhati hai
englishDialogue: Even the uniform of a true police officer fulfills its duty

dialogue: Agar bada player banna hai ... to risk bhi badi leni padti hai
englishDialogue: If you want to become a big player ... then you have to take big risks

dialogue: Retire sirf police waale hote hai ... chor nahi
englishDialogue: Only cops retire ... not thieves

dialogue: Gaadiya videshi look mein achchi lagti hai ... aur foreigners hamesha Indian sanskar mein achche lagte hai
englishDialogue: Cars look good with foreign looks ... and foreigners always look good with Indian cultures

dialogue: Ek police waale ka dimaag bhaagte bhaagte thakar jab behat jaata hai ... ek shatir chor ka dimaag wahan se daudna shuru karta hai
englishDialogue: When the mind of a cop relaxes after getting tired from running around ... from there the mind of a smart thief starts running

dialogue: Joh zyada aage chalta hai usse yeh pata nahi chalta ... ki kab uske peeche poori game palat gayi ho
englishDialogue: One who walks ahead a lot does not know ... when the whole game changes behind him

dialogue: Tumhari expiry date khatam ho gayi hai
englishDialogue: Your expiry date has passed

dialogue: Aakhri twist villian ka nahi ... hamesha hero ka hota hai
englishDialogue: The last twist does not belong to the villian ... it always belongs to the hero

dialogue: Main Krishna hoon is liye chamatkar karta hoon ... chamatkar karta hoon is liye Krishna nahin hoon
englishDialogue: I am Krishna that's why I do magic ... not because I do magic I am Krishna

dialogue: Jahan dharm hai na, wahan satya ke liye jagah nahi hai ... aur jahan satya hai truth hai, wahan dharm ki zaroorat hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Where there is religion, there is no space for truth ... and where there is truth, there is no need for religion over there

dialogue: Jaise ek bakht bhagwan ke bina adhoora hota hai ... waise hi bhagwan bhi ek sachche bakht ke bina adhoora hota hai
englishDialogue: Like a devotee is incomplete without God ... just like that even God is incomplete without a true devotee

dialogue: Maine sirf insaan banaya ... aur insaan ne yeh jaat, paat, dharm, mazhab ka dhanda shuru kiya
englishDialogue: I only made humans ... and humans started this business of caste, religion, etc.

dialogue: Main sab dharmon ka aadhar karta hoon ... aur kisi bhi dharm mein maanta nahin
englishDialogue: I respect all religions ... and don't believe in any religion

dialogue: Mazhab insaanon ke liye banta hai ... mazhab ke liye insaan nahi bante
englishDialogue: Religion is made for humans ... human is not made for religion

dialogue: Sachchi baat hoti hai na woh sharaab se bhi zyada kadvi lagti hai
englishDialogue: The truth is more bitter than alcohol

dialogue: Aap hum mein bhool jao, hum mein koi gham nahi ... jis din humne aapko bhula diya, samajh li jiyega is duniya mein hum nahi
englishDialogue: I don't have a problem if you forget me ... but you understand that I'm no more in this world, the day I forget you

dialogue: Khuda ne jab tujhe banaya hoga, ek suroor uske dil mein aaya hoga ... socha hoga kya doonga tohfe mein tujhe, tab ja ke usne mujhe banaya hoga
englishDialogue: When God must have created you, a passion must have come in his heart ... he must have thought what could he give you as a gift, and then he must have created me

dialogue: Unhe humse shikayat hai ki hum har kisi ko dekh kar muskurate hai ... nasamajh hai woh na samajhe ... ke hum mein toh har chehre mein woh hi nazar aate hai
englishDialogue: She has a complaint against me that I smile when I see anyone ... she is silly and doesn't understand that ... I see her face in every face

dialogue: Na jaagte hue khwab dekha karo, na chaho usse jise paa na sako ... pyar kahan kisi ka poora hota hai, pyar ka pehla akshar adhoora hota hai
englishDialogue: Don't dream while you're awake, don't love someone you can't get ... no one's love ever gets completed, the first letter of love itself is incomplete

dialogue: Deewane hai aapke is baat se inkaar nahi, kaise kahen ki hum mein aapse pyar nahi ... kuch toh kasoor hai aapki adaon ka, akele hum hi gunehgaar nahi
englishDialogue: I'm mad about you and I don't deny that, how can I say that I don't love you ... there is some fault of your style too, since I am not the only culprit

dialogue: Mohabbat ka matlab ikraar nahi hota, sirf kisi ko dekhna pyar nahi hota ... yun toh milte hai roz mohabbat-e-pehgham, mohabbat hai zindagi baar baar nahi hota
englishDialogue: Love doesn't mean to confess, love is not just looking at someone ... I do get love letters everyday, but love is life and it doesn't happen everyday

dialogue: Dil mein na sahi kadmo mein sahi, jagah toh di usne ... aye Allah tera lakh shukar hai, kahin se toh shuruvat ki usne
englishDialogue: So what if it's not in her heart, atleast she gave me the space in her feet ... thank you oh God, atleast she started from somewhere

dialogue: Woh aag hi kya joh lag ke badhe nahi, woh nasha hi kya joh sarr pe chadhe nahi ... nahi banta tab tak koi sachcha aashiq, jab tak ishq mein usko do chaar padhe nahi

dialogue: Uske banaye har haseen chehre se ishq karna hai ... aakhir marne ke baad kal usko mooh bhi toh dikhana hai

dialogue: Dil mila hai ishq karne ke liye, bas itna samajh li jiye ... ek se karna hai yah gyarah se, woh khud hi teh kar li jiye

englishDialogue: This whole world ... is from a sperm

englishDialogue: What do you think that Lord Krishna will come to save you ... he had come in the Mahabharata ... he won't come in this India

englishDialogue: I asked you to turn the lamp on to eliminate the darkness of my life ... but you burnt me and brought light in your life

englishDialogue: By changing the look a person doesn't change

englishDialogue: The relationship between husband and wife is like the two wheels of a chariot ... even if one wheel breaks then it becomes hard for the chariot to move

englishDialogue: I'll give you such a kick on your backside ... that I'll make it into a super duper bumper

dialogue: Din mein sirf chaubees ghante hote hai aur kaam ek sau chaubees

dialogue: Jis manushya ka bank mein bahut rupaiya ho uske hridhay mein bhagwan hote hi nahi hai ... uske hridhay mein toh noton ki gaddiyan hoti hai jinse woh kabaddiyan khelta hai
englishDialogue: A person who has a lot of money in his bank doesn't have god in his heart ... instead he has bundles of cash in his heart with which he plays kabaddi

dialogue: Jaise hi fasal pak jaye toh rakhwaale ki zaroorat hoti hai ... vaise hi ladki jawan ho jaye toh gharwaale ki zaroorat hoti hai

dialogue: Gyan aur agyan mein antar hi kya hai ... kewal ek akshar ka ... lekin arth mein satyug aur kalyug ka sa bedh hai
englishDialogue: What is difference between educated and uneducated ... only of one syllable ... but there is a difference of the golden age and the iron age in the meaning of it

dialogue: Jab koi apradh vichar kiye bina kiya jaata hai ... usse bhool kehte hai ... lekin vichar ke saath kiya hua apradh ... nishchit apradh hi kehlata hai
englishDialogue: When a crime is committed without being thought ... then it's called a mistake ... but a crime that is committed after being thought ... is definitely called a crime

englishDialogue: In this universe no human is completely wise ... Lord Brahma creates the world, Lord Vishnu protects it and Lord Shiva destroys it

dialogue: Jiske mann mein vasna ho ... woh har kisi ko vasna ke adhin samajhta hai

dialogue: Karam karna manav ka dharam hai ... aur uska phal dena bhagwan ke haath mein hai

dialogue: Yeh charon aur phaili hui dharti par rehne waale logon ki kewal ek hi jaat hai ... manushya jaat
englishDialogue: All the people that are spread everywhere on this earth have only one caste ... and that is the caste of humanity

dialogue: Aankhon se ojhal hone ka dukh toh aadmi sehan kar sakta hai ... kyun ki us mein jeevan ki ek dhara behti rehti hai ... lekin jeevan jab mrityu ka roop dharan kar leta hai ... toh sari ashaon ka anth ho jaata hai

dialogue: Is sansar mein bheek le lo magar udhaar kabhi mat lo ... kyun ki bheek leke aadmi ek baar zaleel hota hai ... magar udhaar maangke subah shyam zaleel hota hai

dialogue: Joh bhi kaam mile usse kar lena chahiye ... kaam koi chota nahi hota ... chota hota hai aadmi, uska dil, uski kartoot

dialogue: Badi tedhi hai yeh duniya ... yahan haqdaar ko bhi apna haq bheek ki tarah maangna padta hai ... anpad naukri maangne jaye toh usse degree lane ke liye kehte hai ... degree lekar jaye toh waseela lane ke liye kehte hai ... aur waseelay ke liye kisi ke paas jaye toh rishvat maangte hai

dialogue: Aksar desi aankhon par videshi chasma lagane se ... dimaag mein charbi chad jaati hai

dialogue: Jab tab ungli tedhi na karo, dibbe mein se ghee nahi nikalta ... aur jab tak tedha rasta na pakdo, bhigda hua sahi raste par nahi aata
englishDialogue: Until you twist your finger, the clarified butter doesn't come out from the tin ... and until you adopt the crooked path, a twisted person doesn't come on the right track

englishDialogue: I'm that counterfeit coin ... which looks like 1 Anna but it works like 1 Rupee

dialogue: Jis ghar sansar ki gaadi udhaar ke paiyon pe chalti hai ... woh subah shyam puncture hoti chali jaati hai

englishDialogue: Put one bullet and leave five slots empty ... take an aim and fire ... the one who wins lives, and the one who loses dies

dialogue: Baap ka joota agar bachche ke paon mein aa jaye ... toh phir woh bachcha nahi reh jata
englishDialogue: If the fathers shoes fit into the sons feet ... then he is not a kid anymore

dialogue: Sharafat ki chaddar oodne ke liye shareer nahin ... ek sharif atma chahiye
englishDialogue: To wear the sheet of honesty one does not need a body ... one needs a honest soul

englishDialogue: By drawing blood hatred increases ... a decision is not made

dialogue: Jis tarah har jurm ka ek daag hota hai ... us hi tarah begunahi ka ek saboot bhi hota hai

dialogue: Desh premee mara nahi karte ... amar ho jate hai
englishDialogue: Lovers of a country do not die ... they become immortal

englishDialogue: Son, your mom died of a disease ... but don't let India catch this disease

dialogue: Wahin ruk jao ... nahi toh bandook ki is kalam se tum logon ke seeno par maut ka naam likh doonga
englishDialogue: Stay right there ... otherwise I'll write the name of death on your chests with this pen of the gun

dialogue: (Kaun ho tum?) ... Zulm ke andhere mein kanoon ki roshni ko jalakar ... masoomon ko zindagi dekar ... zaalimon ko maut ki neend sulaane waala ... inspector Ranjit Kumar
englishDialogue: (Who are you?) ... The one who starts the light of law in the darkness of injustice ... the one who gives life to the harmless ... and the one who gives the sleep of death to the evil people ... I'm inspector Ranjit Kumar

dialogue: Yeh rishtey toh pehda hone se pehle hi uparwaala muqadar ki kitaab mein likh deta hai ... us likhai ko badalna hamare bas ki baat nahi hai
englishDialogue: God writes our relationships in the book of destiny even before we are born ... and it's not in our hands to change what's written in that

dialogue: Dukh aur sukh ki tarah galatiyan bhi aadmi ke muqadar mein likhi hoti hai ... galatiyan karke joh pachtata hai wohi insaan kehlata hai
englishDialogue: Like sadness and happiness, even mistakes are written in the destiny of a person ... and the one who repents after committing a mistake is called a human

dialogue: Sher ke mooh ko jab insaan ka khoon lag jaata hai ... tab usse kisi aur janwar ke shikaar mein mazaa hi nahi aata hai ... issi tarah ek baar jurm ki kamai khoon mein utar jaaye ... toh halaal ki kamai khane mein mazaa hi nahi aata hai
englishDialogue: Once a tiger gets to taste human blood ... then he doesn't enjoy hunting animals any more ... just like that once the income of crime enters our blood ... then the we don't enjoy the income of honesty

dialogue: Is duniya mein izzat ki nahi, balki daulat ki zaroorat hoti hai ... aur daulat jiske paas hoti hai, izzat khud-ba-khud aakar uski chaukhat pe apna sar jhuka deti hai
englishDialogue: You need money and not respect in this world ... because respect automatically comes and bow downs on the door of those who have money

dialogue: Main daulat ke maidaan mein gareeb zaroor hoon ... lekin imaandari aur sharafat ke maindaan mein bahut zyada amir hoon
englishDialogue: I may be poor on the grounds of money ... but on the grounds of honesty and righteousness, I'm very rich

dialogue: Main jitni muddat tak jail mein rahoonga ... apne dil mein nafrat ka zehar ikhatta karta rahoonga ... aur jab jail se chootunga toh us zehar se tumhare poore khandan ko jalakar khaakh kar doonga
englishDialogue: While I'll be in the jail ... I'll keep collecting the poison of hatred in my heart ... and when I'll come out of the jail then with that poison I'll burn your entire family into ashes

dialogue: Apne aadmiyon se kaho ke bandookein phenk de ... nahi toh goli chalegi Naagraj ... aur teri khopdi mein itna bada suraag ban jayega ... jiske andar naag apna bil banayega
englishDialogue: Tell your people to throw their guns ... or else Naagraj the bullet will fire ... and there will be such a big hole in your skull ... that a snake will make its home there

dialogue: Duniya mein sirf ek hi sambandh hai ... pati patni ka sambandh, joh jeete jee toot nahi sakta ... baki saare rishtey toh aasmaan mein badalon ki tarah hote hai ... joh hawa ek jhaunke se toot jaate hai
englishDialogue: There is only one relationship in this world ... the relationship of a husband and wife, which can never break while they are alive ... all other relationships are like the clouds in the sky ... which break with a gust of the wind

dialogue: Jiski zaroorat ho usse gale laga lo ... aur jiski zaroorat nahi hai uska gala kaat dalo
englishDialogue: Embrace the person whom you need ... and cut the throat of the person whom you don't need

dialogue: Suraj raat ko nikal sakta hai ... farishtey jhooth bol sakte hai ... chaand aag barsa sakta hai ... magar Ranjit Kumar apne desh ko, apne kanoon ko dokha de ... yeh kabhi nahi ho sakta, kabhi nahi ho sakta
englishDialogue: The sun can come out in the night ... the angels can lie ... the moon can erupt fire ... but Ranjit Kumar cheats his country and his law and order ... that can never happen, never happen

dialogue: Bachpan mein baap ke kahe huye kadve shabd ... aane waali zindagi mein shakkar ghol dete hai
englishDialogue: The sour words that a father says during his child's childhood ... do add sugar into his future life

dialogue: Ab ke hum bichade toh shayad kabhi khwabon mein mile ... jis tarah sookhe hue phool kitaabon mein mile
englishDialogue: If we separate now then may be we will meet in dreams ... just like dried flowers are found in books

dialogue: Jin labon ko yeh muskurahat mili hai, un labon ka ... jis haseen chehre ko yeh lab mile hai, us chehre ka ... jis chehre ko yeh badan mila hai, us badan ka ... jis badan ko yeh rooh mili hai, us rooh ka ... dono aalam mein koi jawab nahi hai
englishDialogue: The lips that have this smile, those lips ... the beautiful face that has these lips, that face ... the body that has this face, that body ... the soul that has this body, that soul ... there is nothing like these things in both the worlds

dialogue: Aaj toh bas main aur tum, tum aur main ... darmiyan kuch na rahe, agar rahe toh pyar rahe
englishDialogue: Today it's just me and you, you and me ... nothing should be in between us, and if there has to be something then it must be love

dialogue: Unko aata hai pyar pe gussa ... humko gusse pe pyar aata hai
englishDialogue: She gets angry when it comes to love ... and I love it when she gets angry

dialogue: Kal mila waqt toh zulfein teri suljha doonga ... aaj uljha hoon halaat ke suljhane mein
englishDialogue: Tomorrow if I get time then I'll make your hair ... today I'm busy in fixing the situation

dialogue: Meri jaan tujhe mere haathon marna hai ... usko yaad karle jisse yaad karna hai
englishDialogue: You have to die from my hands ... so remember whomever you want to remember

dialogue: Do mithiyan galaan kar kudiye haske sadde naal ... arre saath khade hum dono lagte hai Sohni Mahiwal
englishDialogue: Talk with me smilingly for a short while ... we both standing together look like great lovers

dialogue: Us rakshas ki di hui maut tumhari di hui zindagi se kahi behtar hogi ... woh ek baar ki maut hogi ... lekin tumhari di hui zindagi ke har pal main ek maut marta raha hoon
englishDialogue: Death by that devil will be better than the life that you've given me ... that death will come to me at once ... but in the life that you've given me, I die every moment

dialogue: Sabhi insaan ek jaise hi toh hote hai ... wahi do haath, do paun, aankhen, kaan, chehra ... sabke ek jaise hi toh hote hai ... phir kyun koi ek, sirf ek aaisa hota hai ... joh itna pyara lagne lagta hai ... ke agar uski liye jaan bhi deni padhe ... toh haste haste di ja sakti hai
englishDialogue: Every person is the same ... two hands, two legs, eyes, ears, face ... everyone has the same ... then why is it that there is someone, only one ... whom we adore so much ... and for whom if we have to give our life ... then we can do that laughingly

dialogue: Humne saanp ko doodh pilaya ... par hum doodh pila sakte hai, toh uska sar bhi kuchal sakte hai
englishDialogue: I have fed milk to a snake ... but if I can feed milk then I can also crush its head

dialogue: Prem toh woh rog hai joh aasani se lagta nahi ... aur jab lag jaata hai na ... phir kabhi mitta nahi
englishDialogue: Love is a disease that doesn't come easily ... and when it comes ... then it never goes away

dialogue: Reet rivaaz insaan ki sahuliyat ke liye banaye jaate hai ... insaan reet rivaazo ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: Customs and rituals are made for the ease of humans ... humans are not made for customs and rituals

dialogue: Sab taqdeer ka khel hai ... yeh kabhi apno ke haathon rulati hai ... toh kabhi gairon ke haathon rulati hai
englishDialogue: Everything is a game of destiny ... sometimes our dear ones make us cry ... and sometimes strangers make us cry

dialogue: Shaadi do jismon ka mel nahi ... do aatmaon ka milan hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is not the union of two bodies ... it's the union of two souls

dialogue: Blessing in disguise ... makes man healthy, wealthy and wise
englishDialogue: Blessing in disguise ... makes man healthy, wealthy and wise

dialogue: Bada aadmi agar banna ho ... toh choti harkatein mat karna
englishDialogue: If you want to become a big man ... then stop doing small things

dialogue: Kagazaat par dastakhat main hamesha apne kalam se karta hoon
englishDialogue: I always sign papers with my own pen

dialogue: Aap badhe nahin hue hain ... amir hue hain, sirf amir ... aapki tijori toh badhi ho gayi hai lekin aapka dil bahut hi chota ho gaya hai
englishDialogue: You have not grown up ... you have become rich, just rich ... your locker has become big but your heart has become very small

dialogue: Log toh budhe hokar naukri se retire hote hain ... lekin aap toh mujhe rishtey se retire kar rahen hain
englishDialogue: People retire from a job once they get old ... but you are retiring me from relationships

dialogue: Tum mujhe naukar hone se kya retire karoge ... main khud tumhe malik hone se retire karta hoon
englishDialogue: What will you retire me from the servants post ... I myself am retiring you from bosses post

dialogue: Agar zindagi mein bada banna hai toh ek baat yaad rakho dost ... apni taqdeer ke vidhaata khud bano
englishDialogue: My friend, if you want to become big in life then remember one thing ... you yourself should become the Lord of your destiny

dialogue: Agar main chor hoon toh mujhse chori karane waale tum ho ... aur agar main mujrim hoon toh mujhse jurm karane waale bhi tum ho
englishDialogue: If I am a robber then you are the one who made me do the robbery ... and if I am a criminal then you are also the one who made me do the crime

dialogue: Bina maqsad fight nahi karna ... aur agar maqsad mil jaye toh peeche nahi hatna
englishDialogue: Don't fight without a reason ... and when you have a reason then don't backup

dialogue: Hum ladta nahi, ladwata hai ... hum karta nahi, karwata hai ... hum maarta nahi, marwata hai
englishDialogue: I don't fight, I make others fight ... I don't do things, I make others do ... I don't kill, I get others killed

dialogue: Nahi chahiye yeh imaarate ... jinke banane mein pani ki jagah gareebo ka paseena mila ho
englishDialogue: I don't want these buildings ... which are built using the sweat of the poor people instead of water

dialogue: Mard log haath se ladte hai ... chaku se nahi
englishDialogue: Men fight with hands ... not with a knife

dialogue: Naya naya hosh hai aur naya naya josh hai
englishDialogue: You have a new character and a new spirit

dialogue: Crime ki duniya mein ek baar entry lene ke baad ... dobara ruksat hona namumkin hai
englishDialogue: Once you enter in the world of crime ... then it is impossible to leave

dialogue: Yeh ishq nahi asaan, itna hi samajh lijiye ... ek aag ka dariya hai, aur doob kar jaana hai
englishDialogue: Just understand that, love is not easy ... it is a sea of fire, and you have to go drown in it

dialogue: Insaan ki achchai aur burai ... ameeri aur gareebi ke palhade mein toli jaati hai
englishDialogue: The good and bad of a person ... is measured on the scale of rich and poor

dialogue: Kehte hai sapne mein kisi ko mara hua dekho ... toh uski umar badh jaati hai
englishDialogue: It is said that when you see someone dead in a dream ... then their life becomes long

dialogue: Jeete aur marte toh janwar bhi hai ... magar insaan woh jiski zindagi ka koi maqsad ho ... aur marna woh joh kisi ke kaam aaye
englishDialogue: Even animals live and die ... but a human is someone whose life has a meaning ... and death should be something that can be of use to someone else

dialogue: Rajneeti aur dharam yeh do aaise shastra hai ... jisse koi bhi bandhan kaate ja sakte hai, todhe ja sakte hai
englishDialogue: Politics and religion are two such weapons ... with which you can cut and break any relationship

dialogue: Deshwasi ke seene se goli paar nahi hoti ... vapas jaati hai
englishDialogue: A bullet cannot pass through the chest of a patriot ... it returns back

dialogue: Dharam afeem ki woh goli hai ... jisse sari janta ko mast rakha ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: Religion is that pill of opium ... with which you can keep all the people happy

dialogue: In buson ka yahi chakkar hai ... time par aati hai, time par jaati hai
englishDialogue: These buses have the same issue ... they come on time and they leave on time

dialogue: Tum aaise ulloo ke patthe ke saath kaise shaadi kar sakti ho?
englishDialogue: How can you marry such a fool?

dialogue: For your naughtiness ... I will eat a papad and you will get a jhapad
englishDialogue: For your naughtiness ... I will eat a papadum and you will get a slap

dialogue: Is revolver ki che ki che goliyan tere seene mein maut ki keel banakar tokh doonga
englishDialogue: I'll smash the 6 bullets of this revolver in your body like the nails of death

dialogue: Na sode ke saath, na pani ke saath ... main toh peeyunga apni rani ke saath
englishDialogue: Not with soda, neither with water ... I'll drink with my queen

dialogue: Jaise daane daane par khane waale ka naam likha hota hai ... vaise hi meri har goli par marne waale ka naam hota hai
englishDialogue: Just like on every bite of food is written the name of the person who will eat it ... just like that on every bullet of mine is written the name of the person who will die from it

dialogue: Aurat chahe maa ho, behen ho ya beti ho ... uske bhagya mein rona hi likha hai ... woh chahe bhagwan ko bhi janam de ... uske naseeb mein aasoon hi aasoon hai
englishDialogue: Whether a woman is a mother, a sister or a daughter ... crying is written in her destiny ... and even if she gives birth to god ... she still will have tears in her fate

dialogue: Police ki naukri karne ke liye jigar ispat ka aur badan faulad ka banana padta hai
englishDialogue: To do the job of police you need to have the courage of steel and a strong body

dialogue: Vishvas ek bahut hi nazuk sheesha hota hai ... ek baar toot jaye toh dobara judta nahi
englishDialogue: Trust is a very brittle mirror ... once it breaks then it can never be fixed

dialogue: Apradh agar pataal ke andheron mein bhi chup jaye ... toh bhi sazaa peecha karte hue wahan pahunch jaati hai
englishDialogue: Even if crime hides in the darkness of the underworld ... still punishment will follow it and get there

dialogue: Zulm aur atyachar se tum mere shareer ko khatam kar sakte ho ... lekin insaaf aur nyay ke liye pukarti hui meri aatma ki awaaz nahi daba sakte
englishDialogue: You can finish my body with injustice and oppression ... but you can't suppress the voice of my soul calling for justice and equity

dialogue: Aayenda kabhi aaisi harkat ki ... toh bina khaal ke gadhe ki tarah saare sansar mein ghoomte hue nazar aaoge
englishDialogue: If you ever do such a thing again ... then you'll be seen wandering around the entire world like a donkey without skin

dialogue: Prem sachchai hai ... is sachchai ko aaj tak na koi maar saka hai aur na koi maar sakega
englishDialogue: Love is the truth ... no one till date has been able to kill this truth and no one will ever be able to

dialogue: Har majboor aurat meri maa lagti hai
englishDialogue: Every helpless women is my mother

dialogue: Aurat ko aur saari ko sambhalna bahut mushkil kaam hai
englishDialogue: It is a very difficult task to handle women and a saari

dialogue: Hamari duniya mein pehla mauka hi aakhri mauka hota hai ... chahe jeene ka ho, chahe marne ka
englishDialogue: In our world the first chance is the last chance ... be it of living or dying

dialogue: Dukh ek aaisi cheez hai ... usse jitna mehsoos karoge, woh utna hi badega
englishDialogue: Sorrow is one such thing ... the more you feel it, the more it grows

dialogue: Us kamine ko main dhoondkar aaisi sazaa doonga ... ki us sazaa ke naam se maut tak kaanp uthegi
englishDialogue: I will find and punish that scoundrel in such a way that ... even death will tremble with the name of that punishment

dialogue: Paap aur jurm ... na toh dharam maaf karta hai, na samaaj aur na hi kanoon
englishDialogue: Sins and crimes ... are not forgiven by religion, by society and neither by the law

dialogue: Jis din nazar aaoge na ... us din tumhari zindagi ko sametkar maut ki chaadar mein lapet doonga
englishDialogue: The day I see you ... that day I will assemble your life and roll it into the bedsheet of death

dialogue: Farz ko nibhate huye jeena hi hamare jeevan ka karz hai
englishDialogue: It is the loan of our life to keep living by fulfilling our duty

dialogue: Kanoon mujrim ke saath kabhi haath nahi milata ... uske haathon mein hathkadiyan pehnata hai
englishDialogue: The law never shakes a hand with the criminal ... it puts on the handcuffs on his hands

dialogue: Sabhi badhe hote hai ... magar koi apne badhon se bada nahi hota
englishDialogue: Everyone grows up ... but no one can become bigger than their elders

dialogue: Sawaal ke jawaab mein sawaal nahi kiya jaata
englishDialogue: You shouldn't ask question when answering a question

dialogue: Khane ka shaunk aapko bhi hai, khane ka shaunk mujhe bhi hai ... ghumne ka shaunk aapko bhi hai, ghumne ka shaunk mujhe bhi hai ... gappe ladane ka shaunk aapko bhi hai, gappe ladane ka shaunk mujhe bhi hai ... aur sabse zyada important baat yeh hai ... ki hasne ka shaunk aapko bhi hai aur hasne ka shaunk mujhe bhi hai
englishDialogue: You love to eat and I love to eat also ... you love to go around and I love to go around also ... you love to talk and I love to talk also ... and the most important thing is that ... you love to laugh and I love to laugh also

dialogue: Jinhe ulfat ki khushiyan mil sake woh shaunk se lele ... hum mein chhodo hum toh apni kismat aazma behte
englishDialogue: Those who can get the happiness of love, get it ... but leave me alone since I have tried my luck

dialogue: Pyar aur dard ki koi seema nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Love and pain has no boundaries

dialogue: Pyar mein dil ki baat dil mein nahi rakhni chahiye ... keh zaroor deni chahiye
englishDialogue: In love you shouldn't keep what's in your heart in the heart ... you should definitely say it out

dialogue: Mohabbat ke paas business sense hi toh nahi hoti ... tabhi toh woh fayde aur nuksaan ke bare mein nahi sochti ... issi liye aam taur pe har love story tragedy par hi khatam hoti hai
englishDialogue: Love doesn't have a business sense ... that's why it can't think about profit and loss ... and that's why usually every love story ends with a tragedy

dialogue: Jis tarah zameen par pair rakhe bagair insaan chal nahi sakta ... us hi tarah mujrim kanoon se bhaag sakta hai, lekin bach nahi sakta
englishDialogue: Just like a person can't walk without putting his feet on the ground ... just like that a criminal can run from the law, but he cannot escape

dialogue: Mohabbat ko samajhna hai toh pyare khud mohabbat kar ... kinare se kabhi andaaz-e-toofan nahi hota
englishDialogue: If you want to understand love and then fall in love yourself ... because you cannot get the sense of the storm from the shore

dialogue: Kya ishq ka khoon kisi sahukar ke paan ki pichkari hai ... kya tumhari zindagi zindagi, hamari zindagi bimari hai ... tumhara khoon khoon, hamara khoon pani hai ... tumhara naam naam, hamara naam gaali hai ... tum karo zulm toh woh sarkari hai ... aur hum kare fariyad toh woh gaddari hai
englishDialogue: Is the blood of love like a rich mans spit from eating betel leaves ... is your life life, and mines is a sickness ... is your blood blood, and mines water ... is your name name, and mines a curse ... if you do injustice then it's legal ... and if I make a complaint then it's unfaithful

dialogue: Is duniya mein do tarah ka keeda hota hai ... ek woh joh kachre se uthta hai ... aur doosra woh joh paap ki gandhgi se uthta hai ... kachre waala keeda insaan ko beemar kar deta hai ... magar paap ki gandhgi ka keeda saare samaaj ko beemar kar deta hai
englishDialogue: There are two types of bugs in this world ... one that rises from the trash ... and other that rises from the filthiness of sin ... the bug from the trash makes people sick ... but the bug from the filthiness of sin makes the entire society sick

dialogue: Yeh khoon bhi saali badi ajeeb cheez hai ... apne nikle toh dard hota hai ... lekin doosre ke nikle toh mazaa aata hai
englishDialogue: Blood is a very strange thing ... it pains when we are bleeding ... but if someone else is bleeding then it is fun

dialogue: Hosh mein aa zaalim gareeb jaagne waala hai ... tayaar raho bhaiyo ab yeh khujane waala hai
englishDialogue: Come to your senses you ruthless person because the poor is about to wake up ... be ready my friends he is now going to scratch

dialogue: Aaisi maut marenge ... ki ek baar maut ko bhi paseena aa jayega
englishDialogue: We will kill you in a way that ... at least once, even death will be sweating

dialogue: Makkari ki mitti se janam lene waale gaddari ke paude
englishDialogue: You traitorous plant born from the mud of deceitfulness

dialogue: Mohabbat mitt nahi sakti zamaane ke sataane se ... ke suraj bhuj nahi sakta paani mein dubaane se
englishDialogue: Love cannot be erased by the harassment of the world ... and the sun doesn't go dark when it drowns in the water

dialogue: Yahan gaddari ki sazaa sirf maut hoti hai ... maut
englishDialogue: Here the punishment of traitorship is only death ... death

dialogue: Ungliyaan kaant dene se haath nahi kat jaata
englishDialogue: By cutting fingers the whole hand does not get cut

dialogue: Hum nahi teer aur talwar se marne waale ... katal karna hai toh ek tirchi nazar kafi hai
englishDialogue: I won't die with the arrow and sword ... if you want to kill me then only one look is needed

dialogue: Baghavat mein teen kisam ke log hote hai ... pehla taqat ke zor pe zulm karne waala atyachari ... doosra us atyachari ke khilaf awaaz uthane waala krantikari ... aur teesra in dono ki situation ka fayda uthane waala mere jaisa vyapari
englishDialogue: There are 3 kinds of people in a revolution ... one who does the injustice based on power ... second the revolutionist who raises his voice against the atrocity ... and third is a businessman like me who takes the benefit of the situation these two are in

dialogue: Kachre ke keede ko maarne ke liye Flit bazaar mein milta hai ... magar paap ke keede ko maarne waala Flit saala bana hi nahi hai aaj tak
englishDialogue: You get Flit in the market to kill the bugs from the trash ... but to kill the bugs of sin, bloody there is no Flit that has been made till today

dialogue: Shanti shanti ... do minute shanti ... uske baad kranti
englishDialogue: Silence silence ... two minutes of silence ... and then you can revolt

dialogue: Insaan ke bheetar se shaitan janam leta hai ... wafaadar ke khoon se baaghi pehda hota hai
englishDialogue: A demon rises from within the human itself ... and a rebel rises from within the faithful

dialogue: Apne mooh ki kamaan se shabdon ke tootte huye teer mat choda kar
englishDialogue: Don't fire the broken arrow of words from the bow of your mouth

dialogue: Bachpan ki buri aadatein aur buri baatein insaan ko bura bana deti hai
englishDialogue: The bad habits and bad things of childhood make a person into a bad one

dialogue: Ladki ki khoobsurati shareer ko dhakne mein hai ... shareer ki numaish karne mein nahi hai
englishDialogue: The beauty of a girl is in covering her body ... not in exposing her body

dialogue: Badalo hat jao dedo raah jaane ke liye ... ke Laila aa rahi hai Majnu se ishq farmaane ke liye
englishDialogue: Move over the clouds so that there is a path ... because Laila is coming to make love to Majnu

dialogue: Hum taaliyan sun sakte hai ... magar gaaliyan nahi sun sakte hai
englishDialogue: I can hear claps ... but I can't hear cursing

dialogue: Saale buzdili ki gaud mein pale geedad ki sauteli aulad
englishDialogue: Bloody you stepson of a jackal grown in the lap of cowardness

dialogue: Is duniya mein jis kisi ko tarakki ki seedi se upar chadna hota hai na ... usse na anpadh jahil hona chahiye ... aur na hi anpadh aur jahilon se koi rishta rakhna chahiye
englishDialogue: In this world a person who wants to climb the ladder of success ... he must not be uneducated and ignorant ... and neither must he keep any relationship with the uneducated and ignorant

dialogue: Shayaron ki mehfil mein jaate hai toh shayar ho jaate hai ... aur koi apne se tagda mil jaye toh kayar ho jaate hai ... zindagi ki gadi mein fit kardo toh tyre ho jaate hai ... aur agar bandook mein fit kardo toh fire ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: When we go in a party of poets then we become a poet ... and if we get someone stronger than us then we become cowards ... if you fit us in the car of life then we become tyres ... and if you fit us in a gun then we get fired

dialogue: Sitaron se aage jahaan aur bhi hai ... abhi ishq ke imtihan aur bhi hai
englishDialogue: There is a world beyond the stars ... and there are still more examinations left in love

dialogue: Maine is duniya mein bahut saare logon ko daulat aa jaane ke baad apna ghar badalte dekha hai, halaat badalte dekha hai, kapde badalte dekha hai ... maa baap badalte kisi ko nahi dekha hai
englishDialogue: I have seen a lot of people in this world who have changed their house, changed their conditions, changed their clothing after getting money ... but I've never seen anyone changing his parents

dialogue: Bansuri ke chhed ungliyon se chupakar jaise sur nikalte hai ... apne zakhmon ko muskurahat se chupakar duniya mein khushi baatna shuru ki jiye
englishDialogue: Just like you hide the holes in a flute with your fingers to create a tune ... just like that hide your wounds with your smile and start spreading happiness in this world

dialogue: Daulat se tu mahal khareed sakta hai, gaadiyan khareed sakta hai, chaaplusi karne waale dost khareed sakta hai ... magar gaaliyon mein duayen dene waala yeh baap nahi khareed sakta
englishDialogue: With money you can buy a mansion, you can buy cars, you can buy friends who butter you ... but you can't buy a father who prays for you, even when he scolds you

dialogue: Abhe bewakoofi ke laltern se nikalne waale andhere
englishDialogue: Hey you darkness coming out from the lamp of foolishness

dialogue: Agar bete ka kadh baap se ooncha ho jaaye toh beta apne baap ka baap nahi hota hai ... woh saala bete ka beta hi hota hai
englishDialogue: If a son grows taller than his father, then the son doesn't become the father of his father ... he remains as a son only

dialogue: Sachai woh diya hai, jisse agar pahad par jala do ... toh roshni toh bahut kam door tak karta hai ... magar dikhta bahut door se hai
englishDialogue: Truth is that lamp, which when you light on a mountain ... it gives very less light ... but you can see it from far away

dialogue: Maut se kya darna, usse toh aana hai ... do din ki hai zindagi, hum mein apna farz nibhana hai
