englishDialogue: Why should one be scared of death, it has to come ... life is of a couple of days, and we have to obey our duty

dialogue: Khudkhushi karne ke liye insaan ka pagal hona bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: It is very important for a person to be mad to commit suicide

dialogue: Aapne yeh toh suna hoga ki ghee tedhi ungli se nikalta hai ... magar shayad yeh nahi suna ki sach bandh mukke se nikalta hai
englishDialogue: You must have heard that you can extract clarified butter with a twisted finger ... but you must have not heard that you can extract the truth with a fist

dialogue: Insaan ki majboori ... ussoolon ke zanjeeron ko kachche dhaago ki tarah todh deti hai
englishDialogue: The helplessness of a man ... can break the shackles of his principles just like a weak thread

dialogue: Duniya mein har bimaari ka koi na koi ilaaj hai ... magar shaq ka koi ilaaj nahi
englishDialogue: Every disease in this world has a cure ... but suspicion has no cure

dialogue: Yeh duniya rishto ke naam maangti hai
englishDialogue: This world will ask a name for relationships

dialogue: Mujrim nishaano ka nishaana ban jaata hai ... ya de jaata hai, ya le jaata hai
englishDialogue: A criminal becomes a target of targets ... either he gives, or he takes

dialogue: Aadmi pahad se girkar toh uth sakta hai ... magar apni nazaron se girkar nahi
englishDialogue: A man can get up after falling from a mountain ... but he can't if he falls in his own eyes

dialogue: Duniya mein koi bhi ussool itna mazboot nahi hota ... jisse pareshani, takleef aur bhook todh nahi sakti
englishDialogue: No principle in this world is so strong that ... it can't be broken by problems, troubles and hunger

dialogue: Yahan tum hukum dene nahi ... lene aaye ho
englishDialogue: You have come here not to give instructions ... but to follow them

dialogue: Joh kachche dhaago ki tarah toot jaaye ... woh ussool nahi, kamzor iraadein hote hai
englishDialogue: Things that break like weak threads ... are not principles, they are weak intentions

dialogue: Pyar puja ke barabar hota hai
englishDialogue: Love is the same as worship

dialogue: Bhagwan ke prasad ko na karna paap hai
englishDialogue: It is a sin to reject God's blessing

dialogue: Zindagi complications ka combination hai
englishDialogue: Life is a combination of complications

dialogue: Gussa karne wali maa se gumrah karne wala baap kabhi bada nahi hota
englishDialogue: A mother who scolds is always bigger than a father who misguides

dialogue: Gareeb ko sirf roti ka sapna dekhna chahiye ... pyar ka nahi
englishDialogue: A poor man should only dream about food ... not about love

dialogue: Kutte ko darwaaze ke bahar hi baithna chahiye ... aur aadmi ko ghar ke andar hi
englishDialogue: Dogs should sit outside the house ... and humans should be inside

dialogue: Agar pati achcha na ho, toh aulad ke bharose jee sakte hai ... aur agar aulad galat raaste par chalne lage, toh pati ke bharose jee sakte hai
englishDialogue: If your husband is not good, then you can live trusting your child ... and if the child starts to walk on the wrong path, then you can live trusting your husband

dialogue: Woh log bhi is duniya mein nahi rahe ... joh dharm ki deewar khadi karke pyar ke aade aaye
englishDialogue: People who built the wall of religion and came in the path of love ... don't exists anymore in this world

dialogue: Main wapas zaroor aaonga ... aur uss din aakhri baar teri photo chapegi ... zinda nahi murda
englishDialogue: I will definitely comeback ... and that day your picture will be published for the last time ... not as living, but dead

dialogue: Apan jab se pehda hua hai ... tab se yeh sadak hi apna ghar hai aur yeh footpath hi apna bistar
englishDialogue: Since I was born ... this road has been my house and this footpath has been my bed

dialogue: Anjaam unka wahi hoga joh tu chahta hai ... lekin hoga vaise jaise hum chahte hai
englishDialogue: Their end will be as you want ... but it will happen as I want

dialogue: Awaaz toh teri ek din main neechi karoonga ... sher ki tarah garajne waala ... billi ki zabaan bolega
englishDialogue: One day I will lower your voice ... someone who roars like a tiger ... will talk like a cat

dialogue: Ek baar aasman se giri hui bijliyan vapas laut sakti hai ... toofan apna rukh badal sakta hai ... lekin is Sher Khan ka faisla kabhi nahi badal sakta
englishDialogue: For once the lightning that falls from the sky can go back ... a storm can change its path ... but the decision made by Sher Khan will never change

dialogue: Ek pahaad ka naam hai Sher Khan ... aur pahaad na kisi ke samne chalkar jaate hai ... na kisi ke samne jhukte hai
englishDialogue: Sher Khan is the name of a mountain ... and a mountain doesn't go to anyone ... and neither does it bow down in front of anyone

dialogue: Apne guroor ko zinda rakhne ke liye ... hamari masoom mohabbat par apni dushmani ka aaisa koi kila mat bandiye ... jiski buniyaad aapko khoon ki nadiyon par rakhni padhe
englishDialogue: To keep your pride alive ... don't tie any fort of animosity on our innocent love ... the foundation of which you have to lay on the rivers of blood

dialogue: Hamare dil mein chupe nafrat ke angaaron aur hawa na de ... varna tu is aag mein jalkar raakh ho jayega
englishDialogue: Don't blow the embers of hatred hidden in my heart ... or else you will you burn into ashes in this fire

dialogue: Joh khoon peena jaante hai ... woh aasoon bhi pee jaate hai
englishDialogue: Those who know how to drink blood ... they can drink tears also

dialogue: Beti ke rishtey kaanch ka khilona nahi hote ... jinse dil bahel gaya aur todkar ghar ke bahar phek diya
englishDialogue: The relations of a daughter are not like toys made from glass ... which can be broken and thrown out of the house, once you are done with it

dialogue: Jab hamari tarah pachpan ke ho jaoge ... toh aaisa bachpan ka sawaal nahi karoge
englishDialogue: When you turn 55 years old as me ... then you won't ask such a childish question

dialogue: Talwaron se khelne waale motiyon se khelne lage ... toh unki taqaton ko zung lag jaata hai
englishDialogue: If people who play with swords play with pearls ... then their strength gets rusted

dialogue: Sabse pehle apni akad aur apni zid ki jhadon ko aag laga ... varna dukhon ke aaise badal mandrayenge ... ke is ghar mein aasoonyon ke sailaab aa jayenge
englishDialogue: First burn the roots of your attitude and stubbornness ... or else the clouds of sorrow will hover over you ... and there will be a flood of tears in this house

dialogue: Jis tarah reghistaan mein pyasa, ek ek boond pani ke liye tadap tadapkar apna dum todhta hai ... ussi tarah Fateh Khan hamare inteqam se tadap tadapkar apni ek ek saans todega
englishDialogue: Just like a thirsty person dies with agony for a single drop of water in the desert ... just like that Fateh Khan will agonize and die bit by bit from my revenge

dialogue: Sher Khan woh heera hai, joh gale se lag jaaye toh haar hai ... aur gale se utar jaaye toh talwar hai
englishDialogue: Sher Khan is that diamond, which is like a necklace when he hangs on your neck ... and like a sword when he comes down from the neck

dialogue: Aan ke samne jaan ki keemat kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: Life has no value in front of honour

dialogue: Duniya hum mein kehti hai Salman Khan ... hum aapko kis naam se pukarein meri jaan?
englishDialogue: The world calls me Salman Khan ... what should I call you my love?

dialogue: Bandookon aur talwaaron se sirf insaanon ka khoon behta hai ... faisle nahi hote
englishDialogue: Guns and swords can only shed the blood of humans ... they cannot be used to make decisions

dialogue: Khoon bahane se rishtey tootte hai
englishDialogue: Relationships break when blood flows

dialogue: Stall ka pachees, balcony ka pachaas ... ek ticket bacha hai, baki sab khallas
englishDialogue: Rs.25 for stall, Rs.50 for balcony ... only one ticket is left, everything else is sold out

dialogue: Jurm aur dharam ka dhanda darr ke bal pe hi toh chalta hai
englishDialogue: The business of crime and religion runs on the basis of fear

dialogue: Meri maa ka ek ek aasoon teri chitta ka angaar banega ... aur teri sau sau cheekhen mere pita ki ek ek cheekh ka muhafaza degi
englishDialogue: Every tear drop of my mother will turn into the ember of your pyre ... and hundreds of your screams will pay the price for every scream of my father

dialogue: Tu utne din hi zinda hai jitne din tak main jail mein hoon ... meri azaadi ka pehla din teri zindagi ka aakhri din hoga
englishDialogue: You will only stay alive for the days that I'm in jail ... the first day of my release will be the last day of your life

dialogue: Taqat jism ki nahi hoti, taqat haddiyon ki nahi hoti ... taqat irradon ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: Strength of the body doesn't matter, strength of the bones doesn't matter ... what matters is the strength of the intentions

dialogue: Mera beeta hua kal, mera aaj aur mera aane waala kal ... teeno par khoon ke dastakhat hai ... kal mere haathon ek khoon hua tha ... aaj main ek ek din apni nazaron mein nafrat bharkar ek aur khoon karne ki taqat jutta rahi hoon ... aur kal mere haathon ek aur khoon hoga
englishDialogue: My past, my present and my future ... all three have the signature of blood on them ... yesterday I killed someone with my hands ... today one day at a time I'm filling hatred in my eyes and collecting the strength to kill one more person ... and tomorrow I'll kill one more person with my hands

dialogue: Chal padhe jidhar bhi ek pag ... chal padhe hazaron pag ussi aur ... gadh gayi jidhar bhi ek drishti ... gahd gaye hazaron drig ussi aur
englishDialogue: The direction in which one leg moves ... thousands of legs start moving in that direction ... where one vision gets stuck ... over there thousands of eyes have got stuck

dialogue: Jab ek ki doosre se ranjish ho, usse dushmani kaha jaata hai ... aur jab do yodha mil jaye, usse jung ka elaan
englishDialogue: When there is animosity between two people, it's called as enmity ... and when two knights unite, it's called the announcement of a war

dialogue: Maut roz toh nahi aati, sirf ek baar aati hai ... aur uska din aur samay bhagwan muqarar karta hai ... darwaaze pe cheekne waala dushman nahi
englishDialogue: Death doesn't come everyday, it just comes once ... and god decides the day and time for that ... not the enemy who shouts on your door

dialogue: Gunehghar aur mujrim ka rishta ya kanoon se hota hai ... ya phir bandook ki goli se
englishDialogue: A culprit or a criminal is either related to the law ... or a bullet from a gun

dialogue: Main goli aur boli dono zubaane jaanta hoon
englishDialogue: I know the language of bullet and words both

dialogue: Aaj main tujhe tab tak maaroonga ... jab tak tu apni arthi par letne ke kaabil nahi ho jaata
englishDialogue: Today I'll keep hitting you ... until you are in a condition to lie down on your pyre

dialogue: Dimaag ki charbi ke saath saath main badan ki charbi bhi nikal deta hoon
englishDialogue: Along with removing attitude from the brain, I also remove the fat from the body

dialogue: Kisse, kab aur kaise ... is jahan se doosre jahan mein bhejna hai ... is baat ka faisla main karta hoon
englishDialogue: Who, when and how ... has to be sent from this world to another world ... I take that decision

dialogue: Noton ki gaddiyan mooh mein lekar bhaunkne waalon ki ... hum mein koi parwah nahi
englishDialogue: Those who bark with a bundle of money in their mouth ... we don't care about them

dialogue: Zindagi ke imtehan mein aaise mauke bhi aate hai ... jab insaan ko sachchai chupani padti hai
englishDialogue: In the exam of life some situations come ... where a person has to hide the truth

dialogue: Jis din sahi mauka mila main us haramzade ko barbaad kar doonga ... aur phir log meri izzat karenge, mere paas kursi hogi, taqat hogi ... kanoon mera ghulam hoga aur kanoon ki devi meri rakhail
englishDialogue: The day I get the right opportunity I'll destroy that bastard ... and then people will respect me, I'll have the position, the power ... the law will be my slave and lady of the law will be my mistress

dialogue: Kanoon tere haathon ka khilona hai ... khoon karna tera pesha hai ... gharon ko barbaad karna tera karam hai ... duniya mein makkari phailana tera dharam hai ... tu laathi se nahi goliyon ke dum par is duniya mein jee raha hai
englishDialogue: The law is a toy in your hands ... killing someone is your occupation ... destroying homes is your deed ... spreading cunningness is your religion ... and you're living in this world on the basis of a bullet and not a stick

dialogue: Tum kya apne aap ko Mughal-e-Azam, hum log ko Anarkali samajhta hai be ... kitna nacha raha hai?
englishDialogue: Do you think you are a royal king and we are salves ... how much are you making us dance?

dialogue: Yeh cheating nahi hai ... yeh setting hai
englishDialogue: This is not cheating ... this is setting

dialogue: Khuda ke karam se, ishwar ki krupa se aur public ki demand se
englishDialogue: By Gods grace, generosity and by public demand

dialogue: Vaise toh main ek frustated aadmi hoon ... meri story ka pata nahi hai ... finance ka thikana nahi hai ... hero date nahi de raha hai ... heroine keh rahi hai ki main poore kapde pehnungi
englishDialogue: I'm a frustrated person ... I don't know where my story is ... I don't know about my finances ... the hero is not giving any date ... the heroine is saying she will wear full clothes

dialogue: Yeh duniya jhoot ke paiyon par chalne waali woh gaadi hai ... jis mein petrol ki jagah gareebon ke armaan jalte hai
englishDialogue: This world is a car that runs on the wheels of lies ... which burns the hopes of the poor people rather than petrol

dialogue: Vishvas vaade ke daldal ki zameen par khadi dhue ki woh deewar hai ... jispe na toh koi insaan reh sakta hai aur naa hi koi sachai ki keel thok sakta hai
englishDialogue: Trust is a wall of smoke that is standing on the ground of a bog of promise ... on which no person can stand and neither can anyone put a nail of truth on it

dialogue: Bheek maange se aadmi zaleel aur zaar hota hai ... aur nikal jaye jis phool se khushbo, woh phool bekaar hota hai
englishDialogue: By begging a person becomes humiliated and shameful ... and the flower which has lost its fragrance, that flower is useless

dialogue: Is shehar ki barsaat ka, neta ki baat ka aur producer ki zaat ka ... kabhi bharosa nahi karna chahiye ... kyun ki yeh sab jhoot bechte hai
englishDialogue: You should never trust the rain of this city, the words of a politician and the persona of a producer ... because all of these sell lies

dialogue: America jis galeban mein phool daalta hai ... Russia jis galeban mein haar daalta hai ... tumne us galeban pe haath daala?
englishDialogue: The neck on which America puts flowers ... the neck on which Russia puts a garland ... you put your hands on that neck?

dialogue: Mujhe dokha dene waala mujhe nahi balki ... apni zindagi ko dokha de jaata hai ... is duniya ko aakhri salaam keh jaata hai
englishDialogue: The people who betray me don't cheat me ... they betray their life ... and they give their last salute to life and go away

dialogue: Is duniya mein aadmi joh sochta hai woh hota nahi ... aur joh hota hai woh usne socha nahi hota
englishDialogue: In this world whatever a person thinks that doesn't happen ... and whatever happens that he has not even thought of

dialogue: Jinka maal pakda jaata hai ... unki maut unki zindagi ko pakad leti hai
englishDialogue: Those who get their merchandise caught ... their death catches up to their life

dialogue: Bahar jinki hoti hai puja ... andhar se woh aadmi hota hai duja
englishDialogue: The people who are worshipped from the outside ... they are someone else from the inside

dialogue: Sabse zyada pasand mujhe yeh doori hai ... kyun ki agar ye doori na ho ... toh tumhare kareeb aane ka bahana na mile
englishDialogue: I love this distance the most ... because if this distance isn't there ... then I won't have a reason to come near you

dialogue: Kuch log ret par likhe naamo ki tarah hote hai ... hawa ka ek hi jhoka jinhe udha deta hai
englishDialogue: Some people are like names written on the sand ... with one gust of wind they blow away

dialogue: Yeh zaroori nahi ki tum ek behtar samaaj mein pehda ho ... zaroori yeh hai ki doosro ko tum ek behtar samaaj dekar vida lo
englishDialogue: It is not necessary that you must be born in a good society ... but it is necessary that you give others a better society

dialogue: Joh ajnabi desh mein soo gaya ... uska sab kuch kho gaya
englishDialogue: One who sleeps in a foreign country ... loses everything

dialogue: Mere mann ko bhaya ... main kutta kaat ke khaya
englishDialogue: My heart liked it ... and so I cut the dog and ate it

dialogue: Humse ladne ki himmat toh jutta loge ... par kaminapan kahan se laoge?
englishDialogue: You will accumulate the courage to fight against me ... but from where will you get the sneakiness?

dialogue: Haath mein bandook lekar apne aap ko bahadur samajhna utna hi aasaan hai ... jitna kisi nihatte ko buzdil samajhna
englishDialogue: It is easy to consider a weaponless person as a coward ... as easy as it is to consider yourself a brave person by simply holding a gun in your hand

dialogue: Jung koi bhi ho, nateeja kuch bhi ho ... ek sipahi apna kuch na kuch kho hi deta hai
englishDialogue: Be it any war, be it any outcome ... a soldier loses something or the other

dialogue: Ab kachoo nahi hona hai ... sirf rona hi rona hai
englishDialogue: Now nothing will happen ... you simply have to cry and cry

dialogue: Cancer se zyada khaufnak bimari toh aapki ragon mein daud rahi hai ... nafrat ki bimari, shaq ki bimari
englishDialogue: A disease much more dangerous than cancer is running in your veins ... the disease of hatred, the disease of suspicion

dialogue: Janwar jab adamkhor ban jaye ... toh uski chamdi udherkar deewar par chipka di jaati hai
englishDialogue: When an animal turns ferocious ... then you strip his skin out and hang it on the wall

dialogue: Main ek baar kehta hoon ... sau baar samajh lena
englishDialogue: I say it once ... but you need understand that 100 times

dialogue: Maa baap apni aulad ke maathe par chamakta chand dekhne ki tammana karte hai ... aur aulad maa baap ke maathe par badnaami ka daag laga diya karti hai
englishDialogue: Parents wish to see the shining moon on the forehead of their children ... and children apply the mark of disgrace on the forehead of their parents

dialogue: Aapko malum hai aurat ki izzat kya hoti hai? ... ek sheeshay ki tarah, toot jaye toh judta nahi ... ek phool ki tarah, todh diya toh murjha jaata hai
englishDialogue: Do you know what is the honour of a woman? ... it's like a mirror, which cannot be fixed once it breaks ... it's like a flower, it wilts if you break it

dialogue: Naam hai mera Hatela Hitler ... meri makkari ke samne Hitler bhi ban jaata hai butler
englishDialogue: My name is Hatela Hitler ... and in front of cunningness even Hitler becomes a butler

dialogue: Mere haath mein maut ki rekha hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: I don't have the line of death in my hand

dialogue: Agar maine chey goliyan chalai hai toh teri kismat ... aur agar maine paanch goliyan chalai hai toh meri kismat
englishDialogue: If I have fired six bullets then it is your luck ... and if I have fired five bullets then it is my luck

dialogue: Baimaani ka dhanda bhi main imaandari se karta hoon
englishDialogue: I even do the business of cheating with honesty

dialogue: Yeh bandook, tu nishana ... yeh goli, tera seena
englishDialogue: This gun, and you're the target ... this bullet, and your chest

dialogue: Guzarta hua waqt bade se bade masle ko suljha deta hai
englishDialogue: Passing time solves even the biggest of the problems

dialogue: Aurat zindagi mein sab kuch baant sakti hai ... apna mangalsutra nahi
englishDialogue: A woman can share everything in life ... but not her wedding necklace

dialogue: Meri maa ne kaha tha ... ki jab bhi koi buzurg tum par haath uthaye, toh uska jawab muskurakar dena
englishDialogue: My mom had said ... whenever an older person raises their hand on you, then reply to that with a smile

dialogue: Aaj tak mujhe tum jaisi koi ladki dikhi hi nahi ... dikhi hai toh mili hi nahi ... mili nahi toh baat bani hi nahi ... baat bani nahi toh baat aage badhi hi nahi ... isliye main zindagi mein peeche reh gaya
englishDialogue: Till today I have not seen a girl like you ... if seen then I've never met ... if I've never met then the point is never made ... if the point is never made then the point has never moved ahead ... that's why I was left behind in life

dialogue: Daulat ka kya hai, woh toh aati jati rehti hai ... magar beti toh ghar ki izzat hai ... aur izzat ek baar chali jaye toh woh laut kar vapis nahi aaya karti
englishDialogue: Who cares for wealth, it comes and goes ... but daughter is the honor of the house ... and once honor goes away then it never comes back

dialogue: Yeh andhere mein hazaar volt ke jhatke kyun de rahi ho? ... mere dil mein na jaane kaise kaise bulb jal uthe
englishDialogue: Why are you giving thousand volt shocks in the dark? ... I'm not sure what different kinds of bulbs are lighting up in my heart

dialogue: Ek juari ki haar ya jeet ka faisla tab hota hai ... jab woh apne saare patte khol deta hai
englishDialogue: The decision of win or lose for a gambler happens ... only when he opens all his cards

dialogue: Haraam ki daulat, zabardasti ka pyar aur ganda badbudar khana ... in teeno ka ek hi hashar hona chahiye ... inhe uthakar kachre ke dabbe mein phek dena chahiye
englishDialogue: Unlawful wealth, forceful love and dirty stinky food ... these three things must be treated in one way only ... they must be picked up and thrown in a thrash can

dialogue: Zara hum mein bhi batting karne do yaar ... taki hum bhi batayein ki ball stadium ke bahar kaise jata hai
englishDialogue: Let me also bat please ... so that even I can show how the ball goes out of the stadium

dialogue: Ummeed ka diya toh zindagi ka diya bujhne ke baad hi bujhta hai
englishDialogue: The lamp of hope only blows out after the lamp of life blows out

dialogue: Log toh aasteen mein saanp paalte hai ... lekin tum toh aasteen ke bichhoo nikle
englishDialogue: People foster a snake in their arm ... but you turned out to be a scorpion in the arm

dialogue: Uski wajah se mera blood pressure, pressure cooker ki mafik itna upar chad jata hai ... ki chaaro taraf se seetiyan bajne lagti hai
englishDialogue: Because of him my blood pressure goes higher like as in a pressure cooker ... that from all four sides I keep whistling

dialogue: Mann mein itna loud baat karoge toh awaaz toh aayegi na
englishDialogue: If you'll talk so loudly inside your heart then the voice will be heard

dialogue: Lehron ke saath toh koi bhi tair leta hai ... par asli insaan woh hai joh lehron ko cheerkar aage badta hai
englishDialogue: Anyone can swim with the waves ... but a real person is someone who can tear apart the waves and move ahead

dialogue: Haddi toh toot kar phir bhi jud jati hai ... lekin aadmi ki izzat, uska atmasaman ek baar toot jaye na toh phir kabhi nahi judta
englishDialogue: Bones can be fixed if they break ... but if the human honor or dignity breaks then it can never be fixed

dialogue: Ladenge toh khoon bahega ... nahi ladenge toh yeh log khoon choos lenge
englishDialogue: If we fight we will shed blood ... but if we dont fight then these people will suck our blood

dialogue: Dimaag? ... mutton ki dukaan pe batees rupaiy kilo bikta hai bheja
englishDialogue: What brain? ... it sells at the mutton shop for Rs.32 a kilo

dialogue: Tareef us khuda ki jisne hum sabko banaya hai ... zara aapko yeda banaya, humko teda banaya hai
englishDialogue: Praise the lord who has created all of us ... he has made you slightly mad and made me crazy

dialogue: Paapiyon ka anth karne waale tumse pehle bhi kahi avtaar le chuke hai ... lekin is dharti par na paap khatam hua hai aur na hi paapi
englishDialogue: People before you who have tried to end the sinners have taken many a forms ... but neither has sin ended on this earth nor have the sinners

dialogue: Aaj ke yug mein sache insaan ki koi keemat nahi hai ... wafaadari ki koi keemat nahi hai ... imaandari ki koi keemat nahi hai
englishDialogue: In today's age there is no value of a honest person ... there is no value of loyalty ... there is no value of honesty

dialogue: Dil aur mandir ek jaise hote hai ... nah mandir se koi murat hatai ja sakti hai ... aur na hi dil mein basi hui surat bhulai ja sakti hai
englishDialogue: A heart and a temple are like each other ... an idol cannot be removed from a temple ... and neither can a face settled in the heart be forgotton

dialogue: Bade bade khatarnako ki nak kaat kar apne jeb mein rakh li hai
englishDialogue: I have cut the nose of very dangerous people and kept it in my pocket

dialogue: Jab bhi mera khoon behta hai ... toh mujhe meri maa ke rone ki awaaz sunai deti hai ... aur joh maa ko rulata hai ... main usse nahi chhodta, chahe woh mard ho yah aurat
englishDialogue: Whenever I bleed ... then I hear the crying voice of my mother ... and the one who makes a mother cry ... I don't leave him, whether he is a man or a woman

dialogue: Maarkar lashein aaisi gandi jagah pehkoonga ... jahan janwar bhi marna pasand nahi karte
englishDialogue: I will kill and throw the dead bodies in such a dirty place ... where even animals don't like to die

dialogue: Teri maut bankar aaya hoon ... teri laash girakar jaoonga
englishDialogue: I have come as your death ... and I will drop your dead body and go

dialogue: Glass mein sharab daalne waala bada nahi hota ... bada toh woh hota hai jiske glass mein sharab daali jaati hai
englishDialogue: The person who pours alcohol in the glass is not a big person ... the person in whose glass alcohol is poured, is the big person

dialogue: Aaj ke baad aane waala har pal ... tum dono ke dil ki dhadkan par hathoda bankar barsega
englishDialogue: After today every moment that comes for both of you ... it will fall as a hammer on your heartbeats

dialogue: Sar se pair tak toh hum khud hi bure hai ... hamare liye buri khabar kya ho sakti hai
englishDialogue: I am myself bad from head to toe ... there can't be any bad news for me

dialogue: Aaj main tujhe aaisa tamasha dikhaonga ... ki duniya ke saare villian zulm karna bhool jayenge
englishDialogue: I will show you such an entertainment today ... that all the villians of the world will forget cruelty

dialogue: Yeh khoobsurat rishteydari ke peeche ... makkari aur chaalbazi ke sivah kuch nahi hota
englishDialogue: Behind this beautiful relationship ... there is nothing but deceitfulness and canniness

dialogue: Jiska saara shehar dushman ho ... usse dosti karne ka hum mein koi interest nahi
englishDialogue: One who has the entire city as his enemy ... I have no interest in befriending him

dialogue: Tu toh us pagal kutte ki tarah bhaukne laga hai ... jisse pagal hone ke baad charon taraf se maut nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: You have started to bark like the mad dog ... who sees death everywhere after going mad

dialogue: Tu toh khoon is tarah karta hai jaise bachche khilona todh dete hai ... bus fark itna hai ki woh khilona todhne ke baad rote hai aur tu khoon karne ke baad hasta hai
englishDialogue: You kill just like kids break toys ... the only difference is that they cry after they break the toy and you laugh after you kill

dialogue: Maut ko aane ke liye patta nahi poochna parta
englishDialogue: Death does not have to ask for the address before it comes

dialogue: Jahan faulaad bhi kaam nahi aata, wahan kali kaam aati hai ... apne husn ki chamak se, dushman ko andha banati hai
englishDialogue: Where a man of steel is of no use, there a girl can be of use ... she uses the shine of her body, to turn the enemy blind

dialogue: Jab rishta zindagi mein aata hai ... toh saath aankhon mein aasoon aur dil mein dard lekar aata hai
englishDialogue: When a relationship comes in life ... then it brings tears in the eyes and pain in the heart with itself

dialogue: Agar ek kadam bhi badaya ... toh doosra kadam zameen pe rakhne se pehle hi hawa mein kaat di jayega
englishDialogue: If you move even one step ... then your leg will be cut in the air before you put your second step on the ground

dialogue: Ek foot ki lohe ki nalli aur dedh inch ki barood ki goli ... oont ke mooh mein jeera lagta hai
englishDialogue: A foot of an iron barrel and a 1.5 inch bullet of gunpowder ... looks like a cumin seed in a camel's mouth

dialogue: Tum meri nazaro mein itne gir gaye ho ... jahan tak meri nazar bhi nahi pahunch sakti
englishDialogue: You have lost your respect from me to such a level ... where even my eyes can't see you

dialogue: Aadmi pahad ki choti se girkar khada ho sakta hai ... magar kisi ki nazar se girkar nahi khada ho sakta
englishDialogue: A man can stand up after he falls from a mountain top ... but he cannot stand up after he falls in the eyes of someone

dialogue: Jinko aata tha gussa kutte pe kabhi ... unko kutte pe pyar aata hai abhi
englishDialogue: Someone who got angry seeing a dog in the past ... now loves a dog

dialogue: Teri nigahon ka salaam kabul kare, meri nigahon mein woh nafasat nahi ... tujhse mila loon nazar toh magar, mere dil ki shayad yeh aadat nahi
englishDialogue: To accept the welcome of your eyes, my eyes don't have that sophistication ... I'll look into your eyes but, may be my heart doesn't have that habit

dialogue: Main aayi toh thi tumhe phasane, par khud hi tumhare pyar mein phas gayi ... tumhe qaid karne ke liye jaal bichaya tha maine, aur khud hi qaidi ban gayi
englishDialogue: I had come to trick you, but I myself got tricked in your love ... I had laid a trap to catch you, but I myself got trapped in it

dialogue: Samundar ki khamoshi apne andar bahut bade toofan ko chupaye hoti hai
englishDialogue: The silence of the ocean hides a very big storm within it

dialogue: Ek aurat akeli hoti hai ... lekin zalim samaaj ko yeh nahi bhoolna chahiye ... ki ek talwar bhi akeli hoti hai
englishDialogue: A woman can be alone ... but the cruel society shouldn't forget that ... even a sword is alone

dialogue: Kitna pyar hai tumhari aankhon mein ... jin mein wafaa ki jhalak nazar aati hai ... jin mein dokhe ka zehar nahi, pyar ka amrit hai
englishDialogue: There is so much love in your eyes ... in which I can see the sight of loyalty ... in which there is the holy water of love and not the poison of cheating

dialogue: Maine tujhe joh izzat di, tune usse meri buzdilli samjha ... maine tujhe joh maan diya, tune uska bahut gumaan kiya ... lekin sach toh yeh hai ki tu kisi izzat ke layak hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: The respect that I gave you, you thought that was my cowardness ... the admiration that I gave you, you were very proud of that ... but the truth is that you don't deserve any respect

dialogue: Aadmi ko apni haisiyat ke andar rehna chahiye ... doosron ki daya par jeene ko jeena nahi kehte
englishDialogue: A person should stay within his limits ... living on someone else's sympathy is not called as living

dialogue: Hamare yahan shaadi ka bandhan sirf pati patni ke beech nahi hota ... poore parivar ke saath hota hai
englishDialogue: In our place the bond of marriage is not only between the husband and the wife ... it's between the entire families

dialogue: Koi bhi jhoot itna mahaan nahi hota ki jiske samne sar jhukaya jaye
englishDialogue: No lie is so big that we need to bow down our head in front of it

dialogue: Pollution, population aur corruption ... yeh teeno bimaariyan kaput beton ki tarah is desh ko kha jayegi
englishDialogue: Pollution, population and corruption ... these three illnesses will eat this country like unworthy sons

dialogue: Chandni raat, haathon mein haath ... peeche se padi baap ki laat
englishDialogue: It was a moonlit night, her hand was in my hand ... and from behind her father kicked me

dialogue: Is desh mein vakil aur barrister toh sirf auraton ko hi hona chahiye
englishDialogue: In this country only women should be lawyers and barristers

dialogue: Itihaas badalne waale ka naam, kabhi itihaas mein nahin hota hai
englishDialogue: One who changes history, you won't find their name in history

dialogue: Kasam khakar aagaya hai inteqam ka yeh angaraa ... bajaonga aaj teri maut ka nakaraa
englishDialogue: The fire of revenge has taken a vow ... to play the drums of your death today

dialogue: Main gareebo ke liye hero hoon ... aur tum jaise logon ke liye villain ... naam hai mera Shankar, hoon main Gunda No.1
englishDialogue: I am a hero for the poor ... and a villain for people like you ... my name is Shankar and I am Goon No.1

dialogue: Mera naam hai Chutiya ... aachoon aachoon ki khadi karta hoon main khatiya
englishDialogue: My name is Chutiya ... I straighten the cot of very smart people

dialogue: Zyada badbad karke, apni zindagi mein maut ki gadbad mat kar
englishDialogue: Don't talk to much rubbish, and disorder the death in your life

dialogue: Marne ke baad bhi unki botiyan ... dard se tadapti rahengi
englishDialogue: Even after dying their body chops ... will wriggle with pain

dialogue: Main un logo ki gundagiri ko maut ki woh vardi pehnaonga ... jise kafan kehte hai, kafan
englishDialogue: I'll make their rowdyism wear a uniform of death ... which is called shroud, shroud

dialogue: Main hoon jurm se nafrat karne waala ... sharifon ke liye jyoti, gundon ke liye jwala
englishDialogue: I am someone who hates crime ... light for the noble, flames for the goons

dialogue: Mera naam hai Bulla ... rakhta hoon khulla
englishDialogue: My name is Bulla ... I keep it open

dialogue: Hum janwaron ka nahin ... insaanon ka shikaar karte hai
englishDialogue: I don't hunt animals ... I hunt humans

dialogue: Hamare samne tumhari wahi aukaad hai ... joh kainchi ke samne kapde ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: Your status in front of us is the same ... as the status of cloth in front of scissors

dialogue: Tujhe banakar maut ke mooh ka nivala ... tere seene mein gaad doonga main maut ka bhala
englishDialogue: After I make you into morsel for death ... I will pierce the spear of death in your chest

dialogue: Dholak toh hijre bajate hain ... aur jab mard bajane par aata hai ... toh dunka bajata hai
englishDialogue: Tabor is played by eunuchs ... when a man comes to play ... he plays the drums

dialogue: Bheegi hui cigarette kabhi jalegi nahin ... aur yeh tay hain ki ... teri maut ki tarikh kabhi talegi nahin
englishDialogue: A wet cigarette will not light ... and it is definite that ... your date of death will not get delayed

dialogue: Roti hoti hai khane ke liye ... aur boti hoti hai chabane ke liye
englishDialogue: Bread is there to be eaten ... and chop is there to be chewed

dialogue: Tere andhar aag bhar degi yeh goli ... phir tu phaad dega uski choli
englishDialogue: This pill will build fire within you ... then you will tear her bodice

dialogue: Supari ka sauda noton se nahin ... laashon se hoga
englishDialogue: The deal for killing will not be done with money ... it will be done with dead bodies

dialogue: Gundagiri aur netagiri dono ek hi baap ki do harami aulad hai
englishDialogue: Rowdyism and politics both are bastards from the same father

dialogue: Jab yeh kapda kafan bankar kisi ko lipat jata hai na ... tab usse dafan hona hi parta hai
englishDialogue: When this cloth wraps around someone as a shroud ... then that person has to be buried

dialogue: Mera naam hai Ibu Hatela ... maa meri chudail ki beti, baap mera shaitan ka chela ... khayega kela?
englishDialogue: My name is Ibu Hatela ... my mother is a daughter of a bitch, my father is a servant of satan ... want to eat a banana?

dialogue: Mera naam hai Pote ... joh apne baap ke bhi nahi hote
englishDialogue: My name is Pote ... and not even my father trusts me

dialogue: Mera naam hai Lambu Aata ... saale ko doonga maut ka chaata
englishDialogue: My name is Lambu Aata ... I will give him the slap of death

dialogue: Lashein is tarah se tapkengi ... jaise nanne munne bachche ki noni se pishaab tapakta hai ... tap tap
englishDialogue: Dead bodies will fall just like ... pee drips from a baby boys penis ... tip tip

dialogue: Khada kar diya hai mera ... gusse se ek ek baal khada kar diya hai
englishDialogue: You have made mine stand ... with anger you have made each one of my hair stand

dialogue: Pehle tere maathe par hai maut ka sehra sajne waala ... phir meri gundagardi ka hai dunka bajne waala
englishDialogue: First death will decorate on your forehead ... then the drums of my rowdyism will be played

dialogue: Face Sonali, taange Raveena aur aankhen Karishma
englishDialogue: Her face is like Sonali, legs are like Raveena and eyes are like Karishma

dialogue: Jis tarah train ke aane par station kaapne lagta hain na ... ussi tarah mere khauf ka bhukaar, tum sab ko kaapne par majboor kar dega
englishDialogue: The way a station shivers when a train arrives ... just like that the fear of my fever, will force you all to shiver

dialogue: Gundagiri ko khatam karne ke liye ... mujhe gunda banna padega
englishDialogue: To end rowdyism ... I'll have to become a rowdy

dialogue: Badshah ki behen ho ya fakir ki beti ... ek na ek din aati hai mard ke neeche bajane ke liye seeti
englishDialogue: Whether it is the sister of a king or the daughter of a beggar ... there comes a day when she comes to a man to blow the whistle

dialogue: Jal gaya hai badan teri behen ka ... kar bandobast ab Lambu Aata ke kafan ka
englishDialogue: Your sister's body has been burnt ... now make preparations for the shroud of Lambu Aata

dialogue: Desh ke dushman tera hoga mooh kaala ... aaj Bulla ka janaza hai uthne waala
englishDialogue: The enemy of the country your face will be made black ... because today Bulla's funeral will be taken out

dialogue: Uparwaale ne daulat aur khane ka muqaddar alag alag kaagazon pe likha hua hai ... jisko daulat zyada deta hai uska khana kam kar deta hai ... jisko khana zyada deta hai uski daulat kam kar deta hai
englishDialogue: God has written the destiny of money and food on different papers ... the one who has a lot of money doesn't have a big appetite for food ... the who has a big appetite for food doesn't have a lot of money

dialogue: Yeh ladki hai ya qayamat ... arre yeh sapna hai ki haqeeqat
englishDialogue: Is she a girl or a goddess ... is this a dream or reality

dialogue: Jahan meri maa nahi ... wahan mera bhagwan nahi
englishDialogue: The place where my mother is not there ... over there my god is not there

dialogue: Hindustani namak ki taqat hi kuch aur hai ... rupayon ki laalach aur maut ka darr bhi Hindustaniyon ko gaddari karne pe majboor nahi karta
englishDialogue: The power in the Indian salt is something else ... even the greed for money and the fear of death can't compel Indians to cheat

dialogue: Kadi se kadi milti hai toh ek zanjeer banti hai ... aaiye hum sab milkar ek zanjeer banaye ... tadbeer se in badnaseebon ki taqdeer banaye
englishDialogue: When a link connects with a link a chain is made ... come let's all connect and make a chain ... let's make the destiny of these unfortunate people with some planning

dialogue: Goli chalate waqt na tum mujhse kahoge ki mujhe maaf kardo ... aur na main tumse kahoongi ki mujhe maaf kardo
englishDialogue: When I fire the bullet you don't ask me for forgiveness ... and neither will I ask you for forgiveness

dialogue: Ek nadaan dost se achcha hai ek chalaak dushman
englishDialogue: A smart enemy is better than a naive friend

dialogue: Aurat 420 nahi, 840 hai ... aur mera aurat malum hai 1680
englishDialogue: Women are not 420 (cheaters), they are 840 ... and you know my wife is 1680

dialogue: Desh se badhkar koi nahi hai ... na rishtey, na naate, na sambandh, na koi bandhan ... iski mitti se mohabbat mera imaan hai, wafaadari mera karam ... is dharti ka dushman chahe bahar ho ya andar, chahe apna hi khoon ho ... uska sarvanash kar dena hi mera dharam hai, mera imaan hai, mera farz hai, meri puja hai ... mujhe yeh kasam hai, mujhe yeh kasam hai, mujhe yeh kasam hai
englishDialogue: Nothing is bigger than the country ... not relationships, not affinity, not connections, not any bonds ... loving it's soil is my faith and honesty is my duty ... whether the enemy of this soil is outside or inside, even if it's our own blood ... it's my religion, it's my faith, it's my duty, it's my prayer to destroy them ... I swear for that, I swear for that, I swear for that

dialogue: Desh ki aan ke samne kisi ki jaan ki keemat kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: The value of anyone's life is nothing in front of the pride of our country

dialogue: Ab koi gandi harkat tumne ki ... toh faisla panchayat nahi ... main karoonga
englishDialogue: If you do any more dirty things ... then the village council won't give the judgement ... I will

dialogue: Hamari bardaasht ko hamari kamzoori mat samajhna
englishDialogue: Don't consider my tolerance as my weakness

dialogue: Main apno se badhon ki ya apne barabar waalo ki baat sunta hoon
englishDialogue: I only listen to people elder than me or people equal to me

dialogue: Zevar toh ladkiyon ka gehna hai ... aur yahan ladke pehan ke ghoomte hai
englishDialogue: Earrings are jewelry for girls ... and here boys are wearing it and roaming around

dialogue: Karna hai, toh karna hai
englishDialogue: If we have to do it, we have to do it

dialogue: Mumbai ka king kaun? ... Bhiku Mhatre
englishDialogue: Who is the king of Mumbai? ... Bhiku Mhatre

dialogue: Poochne ke liye zinda rehna zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: To ask, it is important to be alive

dialogue: Mauka sabhi ko milta hai
englishDialogue: Everyone gets an opportunity

dialogue: Agar maarna ho ... toh bolne ki zaroorat kya hai?
englishDialogue: If we want to kill ... then what is need to tell?

dialogue: Apne dhande mein wohi jeetta hai ... joh pehla haath marta hai
englishDialogue: The one who wins in our business ... takes the first hand

dialogue: Hum unke darr se fayda hai ... maut se nahin
englishDialogue: We benefit when they are scared ... not when they are dead

dialogue: Politician sabse bada bhai hai
englishDialogue: Politician is the biggest goon

dialogue: Ek gaya apan ke dhande mein ... to sab jaayega
englishDialogue: If one goes in our business ... then all will go

dialogue: Joh jung aadmi teer aur talwar se nahi jeet pata ... aurat us jung ko apne aasoonyon se jeet leti hai
englishDialogue: The war that a man cannot win with arrows and swords ... a woman can win that war with her tears

dialogue: Main ek zeharelay saanp par bharosa kar sakta hoon ... tum par nahi
englishDialogue: I can trust a poisonous snake ... but not you

dialogue: Yeh ghulami ka patta gale se nikaal kar phek do ...  aur Hindustan ke badshahat ka taj peheno
englishDialogue: Take out this belt of slavery from the neck and throw it away ... and wear the crown of the king of India

dialogue: Woh aaye hamare ghar mein, khuda ki kudrat hai ... kabhi hum unko, kabhi apne ghar ko dekhte hai
englishDialogue: She came to my house, it is God's nature ... sometimes I see her and sometimes I see my house

dialogue: Bambai se zindagi wapas nahi jati ... sirf maut jati hai
englishDialogue: From Bombay a life cannot go back ... only death can

dialogue: Woh burbakh galti kiya, trailer dikha diya usko ... lekin nau se barah ka show abhi baki hai
englishDialogue: That fool did a mistake and I showed him the trailer ... but the show from 9 to 12 is still there

dialogue: Main chahta hoon Hindustan ka har aadmi jiye toh sher ki tarah jiye ... varna pehda hote hi marr jaye
englishDialogue: I want that every man of India should live like a tiger ... or else die itself when he is born

dialogue: Jab koi mujhe challenge karta hai ... toh meri ragon ka khoon double raftar se daudne lagta hai ... aur main woh kar jata hoon joh upar waala bhi karne se darta hai
englishDialogue: When anyone challenges me ... then the blood in my veins starts to run at double its speed ... and I do something that even the God is scared to do

dialogue: Apna haath jeb mein rakh lo ... kahin aisa na ho ki meri nazar lag jaye ... aur tumhara haath dhad se alag ho jaye
englishDialogue: Keep your hands in the pocket ... because if I cast the spell of bad luck ... your hands will be separated from you

dialogue: Is daari ki safedi pe mat jao janam ... tel toh abhi itna baki hai is dil ke andhar ... ki Bambai ka samundar sharma jaye
englishDialogue: Don't go on the whiteness of this beard ... there is still so much oil in my heart ... that even the sea of Bombay will be embarrassed

dialogue: Surya purab ke bajaye paschim se nikal sakta hai ... reghistaan mein phool khil sakte hai lekin woh ... kabhi nahi hoga joh tum chahte ho, understand!
englishDialogue: The sun can rise from the west instead of the east ... a flower can blossom in a desert but ... the thing that you want will never happen, understand!

dialogue: Apne aadmiyon se kaho bandookein phek de ... varna tumhari arthi par rone ke liye koi bachega nahi
englishDialogue: Tell your men to throw away the guns ... otherwise no one will be left to cry on your bier

dialogue: Tumhari territory sirf char foot ki hai, joh is shehar se shuru ho karke issi shehar mein dum todh deti hai ... lekin hum army waalon ki territory Himalaya ki bulandi se shuru hokar Ganga sagar ki kok tak jati hai
englishDialogue: Your territory is only 4 foot, which starts in this city and ends in this city itself ... but the territory of army men like us, starts from the top of Himalayas and goes till where the Ganges river ends

dialogue: Aapke chabuk ne mujhe itne zakhm nahi diye ... jitna ki badnaami ke uss daag ne
englishDialogue: Your whip did not give me as many wounds ... as many as, that mark of disgrace gave me

dialogue: Tum is desh ke un naujawan mein se ho ... joh uthe toh aasman ko muthi mein lele
englishDialogue: You are one from those young men of this country ... who when stands captures the sky in the hand

dialogue: Kisi bhi desh ki suraksha bandookon aur topon se nahi ki jati ... aur nahi atom bomb aur machine gunon se jung jeeti jati hai ... jung jeetta hai insaan mazbood iraadon se
englishDialogue: A country cannot be protected by guns and tanks ... and neither can a war be won by atom bombs and machine guns ... a war is won is by strong intensions of humans

dialogue: Koi bhi apni jagah se ek kadam bhi nahi hilega ... varna kadam baad mein rakhoge jaan pehle jayegi
englishDialogue: No one will even move a step from their place ... otherwise your step will come later and you will die first

dialogue: Maa apni kokh se bachche janam toh de sakti hai ... lekin usse apna naam nahi de sakti ... baap ke naam ki mohar chahiye hoti hai usse zindagi ki har kadam pe
englishDialogue: A mother can give birth to a child from her womb ... but she cannot give him her name ... a father's name stamp is needed by him on every step of life

dialogue: Najayaz hote hai woh log ... joh najayaz kaam karte hai, najayaz baat karte hai, aur tumhari tarah najayaz sochte hai
englishDialogue: Illegitimate are those people ... who do illegitimate things, who talk illegitimately, and think illegitimately like you

dialogue: Paida hue bachche par najayaz jayaz ki chaap nahi hoti ... aulad sirf aulad hoti hai
englishDialogue: A child that is born doesn't have the mark of illegitimate or legitimate ... a child is simply a child

dialogue: Yeh khoon ke rishtey hai ... insaan na inhe banata hai, na hi todh sakta hai
englishDialogue: These are blood relations ... a person neither makes them, nor can he break them

dialogue: Dhan daulat toh aag ki tarah hoti hai ... insaan chahe toh usse ghar ka chula jala le ... chahe toh uss ghar pe aag laga de
englishDialogue: Wealth and money is like fire ... a person can burn the house grill with that ... or he can burn the house with that

dialogue: Jhoot insaan ka zyada der tak saath nahi deta
englishDialogue: A lie does not take the side of a person for long

dialogue: Oh tu rail gaddi vich paida hui thi? ... jab dekho Rajdhani Express ki tarah bhaagti hui nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: Were you born in a train? ... since you are always seen running around like the Rajdhani Express

dialogue: Maine kisi devta ko nahi dekha ... par tumhe dekh ke aaisa lagta hai ki woh tumse alag nahi hoga
englishDialogue: I have never seen any god ... but after seeing you, I feel that he is not going to be much different than you

dialogue: Woh is duniya se alag toh nahi ... lekin unka pyar is duniya se alag hai
englishDialogue: He is not different than anyone in this world ... but his love is different than anyone in this world

dialogue: Aapki nazaron mein paisa pyar aur bhagwan dono se bada hai ... aap samajhte hai joh madhurta paison mein hai woh Sharda ke sitar mein, Vishnu ke shank mein nahi ... aap samajhte hai joh sundarta paison mein hai woh Rati ki surat mein nahi, swarg ki jhanki mein nahi ... paise mein joh pavitatra hai woh Ganga ke pani mein nahi, Savitri ke daman mein nahi ... paise mein joh taqat hai woh maa ke aashirwad mein nahi, devtaon ke zubaan mein nahi ... satya, shiv, sundar sab paisa hai ... jiske paas paisa hai woh raja aur jiske paas paisa nahi woh Raju?
englishDialogue: In your eyes money is bigger than love and god ... you think that the sweetness that exists in money, doesn't exists in the sitar of Sharda and the shell of Vishnu ... you think that the beauty that exists in money, doesn't exists in the face of Rati and in the glimpse of heaven ... the purity that exists in money, doesn't exists in the water of Ganges (river) and in the lap of Savitri ... the power that exists in money, doesn't exists in the blessing of a mother and in the words of gods ... and that money is truth, god and everything ... the one who has money is a king and the one who doesn't have money is Raju?

dialogue: Is sansar mein koi kisi ka malik nahi aur koi kisi ka naukar nahi ... sabka malik ek hai woh upar waala ... hum sab ussi ke naukar hai
englishDialogue: In this world no one is a boss of anyone and no one is a servant of anyone ... there is only one boss, the God ... and we all are his servants

dialogue: Joh dil ke kareeb hote hai na ... unke rang, roop aur mahek kabhi nahi jaate
englishDialogue: Those who are near to the heart ... their colour, appearance and fragrance never goes away

dialogue: Aankh ke andhe ko toh phir bhi thikana mil jaata hai ... akal ke andhe ko koi thikana nahi milta
englishDialogue: A person blind from the eye will still find a place ... but a person blind from the mind will find no place

dialogue: Pyar chhal nahi ... tyag hai, tapasya hai, pooja hai, prarthana hai, ibaadat hai, ardaas hai
englishDialogue: Love is not cheating ... it is sacrifice, it is meditation, it is worship, it is a prayer, it is admiration, it is a request

dialogue: Pehle paisa insaan ke haath ki mail hua karta tha ... aur aaj insaan ke haath mail mein paisa dhoondte hai
englishDialogue: First money used to be the dirt on a man's hand ... and now the hands of humans try to find money in dirt

dialogue: Amiron ke gharon ki deewaron mein roshni aane ke liye bahut si khidkiyan hoti hai ... magar gareeb ke ghar mein toh roshni tabhi aati hai ... jab us bechare ke ghar ki deewar girti hai
englishDialogue: The houses of the rich people have a lot of windows for light to come in ... but the house of a poor man gets light only when ... a wall of his house falls

dialogue: Dil left mein hota hai magar hamesha right hota hai
englishDialogue: The heart is on the left but it is always right

dialogue: Pyar karne waalon ko pyar khud apna falsafa batata hai
englishDialogue: Love tells its own philosophy to people in love

dialogue: Har taj sarr ke liye hota hai ... lekin har sarr taj ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: For every crown their is a head ... but for every head there ain't a crown

dialogue: Aapne insaan banaya achcha kiya, dil banaya bahut bura kiya ... aapne duniya banayi achcha kiya, magar aapne paisa banaya bahut bura kiya
englishDialogue: You (god) did a good job by making humans, but you did a very bad job when you made the heart ... you did a good job by creating the world, but you did a very bad job when you made money

dialogue: Agar hum mile toh hamara muqaddar ... aur na mile toh hamari taqdeer
englishDialogue: If we meet then it's our destiny ... and if we don't then that's our fate

dialogue: Oye guess kar ... chawani doonga
englishDialogue: Take a guess ... I'll give you 25 paise

dialogue: Taqdeer badi dokhebaaz hai ... pehle burre patte baantati hai aur jab sab kuch haar jaate hai toh ache patte deti hai
englishDialogue: Destiny is very deceitful ... first it deals bad cards to us and when we lose everything then it gives good cards to us

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi bade punya karan ke liye chota paap karna padta hai
englishDialogue: To do a great right we must do a little wrong

dialogue: Tum logon ko na chitta ki aag milegi ... na dharti maa ki godh
englishDialogue: You guys will not get the fire for your pyre ... and neither the lap of the motherland

dialogue: Tumhare seene mein joh dil hai woh Hindustani hai ... aur Hindustani dil awaara nahi hota ... yeh chahta toh sari duniya ko hai, lekin mitta kisi Hindustani par hai
englishDialogue: The heart that you have within you is of an Indian ... and an Indian heart is not a tramp ... it loves the entire world, but it dies only for an Indian

dialogue: Main contract lete waqt paisa dekhta hoon ... paise dene waale ko nahin
englishDialogue: When I take a contract I look at the money ... and not at the person who pays

dialogue: Aaj ke zamaane mein sher sirf do hi jagah hifazat se reh sakte hai ... ek circus mein aur doosra chidiya ghar mein
englishDialogue: In today's age a tiger can live safely only in two places ... one in a circus and other in a zoo

dialogue: Mera ussool hai ... aadmi khatam, kaam khatam
englishDialogue: My rule is ... man finished, work finished

dialogue: Main contract sirf khoon karne ka leta hoon ... mohabbat ke khel khelna ka nahi
englishDialogue: I take a contract only for killing ... not for playing love games

dialogue: Insaan mar jaate hai ... magar awaazein kabhi nahin marti
englishDialogue: Humans do die ... but voices never die

dialogue: Joh desh ke liye jaan dete hai woh shaheed kehlate hai ... joh desh ke liye jaan lete hai woh kaatil nahi ... soldier kehlate hai
englishDialogue: People who give their life for their country are called martyrs ... and people who take lives for their country are not called killers ... they are called soldiers

dialogue: Desh ki raksha karne ki shapat lekar desh ko lootne waalo ... tumhare jism par is vardi ka hona is vardi ka apmaan hai
englishDialogue: Robbers like you who steal from the country after taking an oath to protect to the country ... are a disgrace to the uniform on your body

dialogue: Hindustan mein badhe buzurgh ... mubarakbad nahi aashirwad dete hai
englishDialogue: Elders in India ... give blessings, not congratulations

dialogue: Woh vidhva suhagan se oonchi hoti hai ... jiska pati desh ki aan par shaheed hota hai
englishDialogue: A widow whose husband becomes a martyr for the country ... is bigger than a married woman

dialogue: Kaam loafer ke aur baatein soldier ki
englishDialogue: You behave like an idler and talk like a soldier

dialogue: Josh mein kaam karne waale yah toh mitti ke neeche hote hai ... yah lakdiyo ke upar
englishDialogue: Those who work in excitement go either under the ground ... or on wooden sticks

dialogue: Toop aur tanko se khelne waale fauji ... police ke tamancho se darra nahi karte
englishDialogue: Soldiers who play with tanks ... are not scared of police pistols

dialogue: Suraj ke aakash mein doobne se log nahi soote ... sarhado par jab hum jaagte hai, tab desh chain ki neend sota hai
englishDialogue: People don't sleep when the sun drowns in the sky ... the country sleeps peacefully when we stay awake on the borders

dialogue: Kapde Rita ke aur baatein Sita ki
englishDialogue: You are wearing clothes of Rita and talking like Sita

dialogue: Is bazaar mein log bikte hai, zameer bikta hai ... shareer toh shareer, yahan atmaon ke bhi saude hote hai
englishDialogue: In this market people are sold, the conscience is sold ... forget the body, even the deals of the soul are done here

dialogue: Yahan koi kisi se pyar nahi karta ... sab zaroorat ke rishtey hai ... rishton ki zaroorat kisi ko nahi
englishDialogue: Here no one loves anyone ... all relationships are there just for the sake of being there ... no one has the need for a relationship

dialogue: Kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho ... kaise bataon main tumhe tum dhadkanon ka geet ho, jeevan ka tum sangeet ho, tum zindagi, tum bandagi, tum roshni, tum taazgi, tum har khushi, tum pyar ho, tum preet ho, manmeet ho ... aankhon mein tum, yaadon mein tum, saanson mein tum, aahon mein tum, neendon mein tum, khwaabon mein tum ... tum ho meri har baat mein, tum ho mere din raat mein, tum subaah mein, tum shyaam mein, tum soch mein, tum kaam mein ... mere liye paana bhi tum, mere liye khona bhi tum, mere liye hasna bhi tum, mere liye rona bhi tum aur jaagna sona bhi tum ... jaaon kahin, dekhon kahin, tum ho wahan, tum ho wahin ... kaise bataon main tumhe tum bin toh main kuch bhi nahi ... kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho
englishDialogue: How can I tell you who you are to me ... how can I tell you that you are the song of my heartbeats, you are the music of my life, you are my life, you are my devotion, you are my light, you are my freshness, you are my every happiness, you are my love, you are my affection, you are my soulmate ... you are in my eyes, you are in my memories, you are in my breath, you are in my sighs, you are in my sleep, you are in my dreams ... you are in every word of mine, you are in my days and nights, you are in my morning, you are in my evening, you are in my thoughts, you are in my work ... for me gaining is also you, for me losing is also you, for me laughing is also you, for me crying is also you and waking up and sleeping are also you ... wherever I go, wherever I look, you are there, you are right there ... how can I tell you that I am nothing without you ... how can I tell you who you are to me

dialogue: Destiny bahut beraham hoti hai ... yeh apne doston se mooh pherne par aur dushmanon se baat karne par majboor kar deti hai
englishDialogue: Destiny is very cruel ... it compels us to turn our backs on our friends and talk to our enemies

dialogue: Kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho ... yeh joh tumhara roop hai, yeh zindagi ki dhoop hai ... chandan se tarsha hai badan, behti hai jis mein ek agan ... yeh shokhiyan, yeh mastiyan, tumko hawaon se mili, zulfein ghataon se mili ... hooton mein kaliyan khil gayi, aankhon ko jheele mil gayi ... chehre mein simti chandni, awaaz mein hai ragini ... sheeshe ke jaisa ang hai, phoolon ke jaisa rang hai, nadiyon ke jaisi chaal hai, kya husn hai, kya haal hai ... yeh jism ki rangeeniyan, jaise hazaaron titliyan, baahon ki yeh golaiyan, aanchal mein yeh parchaiyan ... yeh nagriyan hai khwaab ki, kaise bataon main tumhe haalat dil-e-betaab ki ... kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho
englishDialogue: How can I tell you who you are to me ... this beauty of yours, is life's sunshine ... your body is chisled from sandalwood, in which a flame is wavering ... this brilliance, this naughtiness, you've gotten from the winds, you've got your hair from the clouds ... on your lips the buds have blossomed, your eyes have found the lakes ... your face has the shining moonlight, your voice has the melody ... your body is like glass, your colour is like flowers, your walk is like a river, what a beauty, what a condition ... the colorfulness of your body, is like thousands of butterflies, the roundness of your arms, is the shadow from your scarf ... these are the cities of dreams, how can I tell you the condition of my anxious heart ... how can I tell you who you are to me

dialogue: Chal lekar apni naav chale, chandan chandani ke gaon chale ... indradhanush ki behti dhara, uske paar teesra kinara ... is safar mein aur koi nahi, yeh safar hai bas mera tumhara ... ab kis dastak ka hai intezar, jab tumhe pukarta ho pyar aur samne ho sapnon ka sansar ... chal lekar sapnon ki naav chale, chandan chandani ke gaon chale
englishDialogue: Let's take our boat and go to the village of sandalwood and moonlight ... the flowing stream of the rainbow and the third shore behind it ... this journey is just ours and no one else ... now you are waiting for what, when love is calling you and the world of dreams is in front of you ... let's take our boat and go to the village of sandalwood and moonlight

dialogue: Auraton par kabhi yakeen mat karna ... mardon ke liye woh maut hoti hai ...  kubool kare toh shohar banakar maarti hai ... thukra de toh deewana banakar
englishDialogue: Don't ever trust women ... they are death for the men ... if they accept you then they will kill you as a husband ... and if not then as a lover

dialogue: Yeh bangla, yeh jaidaat sab kuch cheena ja sakta hai ... paas rehta hai toh sirf apna wajood
englishDialogue: This bungalow and property all can be snatched ... the only thing that remains with us is our identity

dialogue: Ek fauji ke liye har lamha, har samna ... ek ladai hai
englishDialogue: For a soldier every moment, every meeting ... is a battle

dialogue: Har koi degree diploma le, engineer banne koi zaroori nahi ... Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Zakir Hussain ko koi nahi poochta ... tumhari degree kya hai?
englishDialogue: It is not necessary that everyone takes a degree or diploma and becomes an engineer ... no one asks Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Zakir Hussain ... what is your degree?

dialogue: Koi bhi hunar, koi bhi kala, koi bhi sammaan joh paise mein tabdeel na ho na ... uske peeche zindagi zayaa karna bilkul bekaar hai
englishDialogue: Any talent, any skill, any recognition that can't be converted into money ... you should not waste your life behind it

dialogue: Kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho ... kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum dharam ho, mere liye imaan ho ... tum hi ibaadat ho meri, tum hi to chaahat ho meri ... tum hi mera armaan ho, takta hoon main har pal jisse tum hi to voh tasveer ho, tum hi meri taqdeer ho ... tum hi sitaara ho mera, tum hi nazaara ho mera ... yudhyan mein mere ho tum, jaise mujhe ghere ho tum ... purab mein tum, paschim mein tum, uttar mein tum, dakshin mein tum, saare mere jeevan mein tum, har pal mein tum, har chin mein tum ... mere liye rasta bhi tum, mere liye manzil bhi tum, mere liye saagar bhi tum, mere liye saahil bhi tum ... main dekhta bas tumko hoon, main sochta bas tumko hoon, main jaanta bas tumko hoon, main maanta bas tumko hoon, tum hi meri pehchaan ho ... kaise bataon main tumhe, devi ho tum mere liye, mere liye bhagwaan ho ... kaise bataon main tumhe mere liye tum kaun ho
englishDialogue: How can I tell you who you are to me ... how can I tell you that for me you are religion, for me you are the conscience ... you are my prayer, you are my desire ... you are my wish, you are the picture at which I keep looking every moment, you are my destiny ... you are my star, you are my sight ... you are in my battles, as if you are shielding me ... you are in the east, you are in the west, you are in the north, you are in the south, you are in my entire life, you are in every moment, you are in every instant ... for me you are also the road, for me you are also the destination, for me you are also the ocean, for me you are also the shore ... I only see you, I only think about you, I only know you, I only believe in you, you are my identity ... how can I tell you, you are a goddess for me, you are god for me ... how can I tell you who are you to me

dialogue: Hamare haathon mein itni hararat hai ... ki kisi bhi jism ko tarashkar Taj Mahal bana de ... aur unhi haathon mein itna barood thoosa hai ... ke mazboot se mazboot killay ko bhi todh de
englishDialogue: I have so much warmth in my hands ... that I can convert anyones body into Taj Mahal ... and in the same hands I have so much gunpowder ... that they can break the strongest of the forts

dialogue: Main yeh nahi janta ki yeh kahan likha hai ... ki ek aurat mard se zyada pyar de sakti hai
englishDialogue: I don't know where is it written ... that a woman can give more love than a man

dialogue: Reaction zyada, action zero
englishDialogue: There is more reaction and zero action

dialogue: Masle hal hote hai pyar se, vishvas se, aman se
englishDialogue: Problems are solved with love, with trust, with peace

dialogue: Is desh mein insaaf kachhue ki chaal chalta hai
englishDialogue: In this country justice moves at the pace of a tortoise

dialogue: Neta, sadhu, mafia ... gum ki tarah chipke hue hai hamare desh ke shareer se
englishDialogue: Politicians, saints, mafia ... are stuck to the body of our country like glue

dialogue: Ab khel hoga ... lekin mohre unke honge aur chaal hamari hogi
englishDialogue: Now we'll play the game ... but the pawns will be theirs and the ploy will be ours

dialogue: Duniya mein har dharm ke liye alag alag desh hai ... koi Hindu rashtra hai, koi Muslim, koi Isai ... sirf hamara Hindustan ek aaisa desh hai ... jiske dil mein har dharm ke logon ke liye jagah hai
englishDialogue: In this world for every religion there is a different country ... some are Hindu countries, some are Muslim, some are Christian ... but our India is one such country ... which has a place for people of every religion in its heart

dialogue: Takleefein hi aadmi ko mazboot banati hai
englishDialogue: Pains make a man tougher

dialogue: Abhi mera haath tere sar pe hai ... agar yeh haath utarkar gardan pe aa gaya na, toh tera maut ban jayega ... agar yeh haath gardan se aur neeche aa gaya na, toh na zindagi rahegi na maut
englishDialogue: My hand is now on your head ... if this hand comes down on your neck, then it will become your death ... and if this hand comes down more from the neck, then you'll neither live nor die

dialogue: Aaj tune is dua dene waale dil ki bhi bad-dua le li ... aur ab tujhe koi nahi maaf karega
englishDialogue: Today you have taken a curse even from a heart that wishes good things ... and now no one will forgive you

dialogue: Isse pehle ke kuch netaon ne toh sirf yeh desh becha hoga ... magar yeh woh hai joh is desh ka balatkar kar dega
englishDialogue: Some politicians before him have only sold this country ... but he is someone who will rape this country

dialogue: Pyar jab bagawat par utar aata hai ... toh koi taqat usse nahi rok sakti ... na insaan ki, na kudrat ki
englishDialogue: When love comes down to revolution ... then no power can stop it ... not of a human, and neither that of god

dialogue: Hum tumhe aaisi maut denge ... ki log kutte ko bhulakar tumhari maut ki misaal diya karenge
englishDialogue: I will give you such a death ... that people will forget the dog and they will give examples of your death

dialogue: Kuch dard aaise bhi hai jinse tum waqif nahi ... aaise dard jisse Tina ki toh kya ... insaan ko khud apni pehchan tak bhula dete hai
englishDialogue: There are some pains that you are not aware of ... the pains from which forget Tina ... any person will forget his own identity

dialogue: Main yahan dosti karne aaya hoon ... ghulami karne nahi
englishDialogue: I have come here to make friends ... not to be a slave

dialogue: Pyar karne waale kisi ke mana karne par kab ruke hai ... yeh dil toh pagal deewana hai, yeh toh pyar karega ... yeh na kabhi dara hai duniya se, na kabhi darega
englishDialogue: Lovers have never stopped when someone has said them no ... this heart is crazy, and it will love ... this heart has never been scared, and it will never be scared of this world

dialogue: Saat lakh kya, saat crore kya ... main toh saat janamon mein bhi uski ek muskaan na bechun
englishDialogue: Forget 7 lakhs, forget 7 crores ... I won't even sell her one smile for the next 7 life's

dialogue: Agar daayen baayen ke chakkar mein nishana chook gaya ... toh main aapko tadapne ka mauka bhi nahi doonga
englishDialogue: If you miss the target in trying to aim for the right or the left ... then I won't even give you the chance to wriggle

dialogue: Jisse dekho sharif aadmi dhoondta hai ... kyun ki ek sharif aadmi ki wajah se dus badmaashon ka ghar chalta hai
englishDialogue: Everyone is looking for a honest person ... because the houses of ten wicked people depends on one honest person

dialogue: Joh pyar karte hai woh sar jhukakar nahi sar uthakar baat karte hai
englishDialogue: People in love talk with their heads held high and not by bowing their heads down

dialogue: Jitna woh Negi ko tarsayega ... utna hi Negi usse tadpayega
englishDialogue: The more he tantalizes Negi ... that much more Negi will make him wriggle

dialogue: Gurrao mat ... hamare samne joh gurrate hai ... hum unki khaal udhadwakar us mein bhusa bharwa dete hai
englishDialogue: Don't growl ... those who growl in front of me ... I rip their skin off and I fill chaff in them

dialogue: Meri teen baatein yaad rakhna bete ... sachai se kabhi mooh modna nahi, zulm ke aage kabhi jhukna nahi, dil ki pehli awaaz sunna ... kyun ki pehli awaaz parmatma ki hoti hai ... bad mein shaitan bolta hai
englishDialogue: Remember these 3 things my son ... never turn your face against the truth, never bow down in front of injustice, listen first to your heart ... because the first voice is that of god ... and then the devil speaks

dialogue: Pyar mein khud pe barchiyan chale toh koi gham nahi ... magar pyar ko koi gaali de toh uska taitwa nikaal ke junglee kutton ko daal do
englishDialogue: There is no problem if we ourselves get speared in love ... but if someone curses our love then you should cut his throat and feed it to wild dogs

dialogue: Aadmi ke vichaar aur harkaton ka shehar ya jungle se koi sambandh nahi hota ... aur na hi ameeri gareebi se koi vasta
englishDialogue: A persons thoughts and deeds have no relationship to the city or jungle ... and neither does it have any connection with being rich or poor

dialogue: Bahut kuch paane ke chakkar mein kabhi kabhi insaan sab kuch kho beheta hai
englishDialogue: In trying to achieve a lot a human sometimes loses everything

dialogue: Jab bhook lagti hai na toh pet yeh nahin poochta ... ki yeh roti imaandari ki hai ya baimaani ki
englishDialogue: When one is hungry then the stomach doesn't ask ... whether this bread is from honesty or cheating

dialogue: Yeh duniya bahut buri hai, bahut buri hai ... joh bhi deti hai bura banane ke baad hi deti hai
englishDialogue: This world is very bad, very bad ... whatever it gives, it gives only after one becomes bad

dialogue: Jis tarah mazab-e-islam mein haraam hai suvar khana ... jis tarah hindu dharam mein paap hai gaye khana ... in sabse bada gunaah hai ... mard hokar kisi aurat ke jism ki kamai khana
englishDialogue: Just like eating a pig is sinful in the religion of Islam ... just like eat a cow is sinful in the religion of Hinduism ... a bigger crime than all of these is ... being a man and living of a woman's body

dialogue: Is desh ki mitti ke ghar kahi baar toote hain ... magar is desh ki mitti ka mard kabhi nahin toota hai
englishDialogue: Houses made from the soil of this country have broken many a times ... but man made from the soil of this country has never broken

dialogue: Tu police waala nahin bhadwaa hai ... joh kanoon ko rundi banakar gundon ke haathon mein bechta hai
englishDialogue: You are a pimp not a cop ... who sells the law as a prostitute into the hands of goons

dialogue: Gunday ka sirf ek hi ussool hota hai ... ki uska koi ussool nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: A goon has only one rule ... that he has no rules

dialogue: Main sher ke mooh me haath dalkar uske pet se antariyan nikal leta hoon
englishDialogue: I can put my hand into the mouth of the tiger and remove the flesh from his stomach

dialogue: Sachchai ke liye kisi bhi cheez ko kurbaan kiya ja sakta hai ... magar kisi bhi cheez ke liye sachchai ko kurbaan nahin kiya ja sakta
englishDialogue: For the truth anything can be sacrificed ... but not for anything can the truth be sacrificed

dialogue: Sach toh yahi hai Sir ... ki aaj kal log sach darr darr kar hi bolte hain
englishDialogue: Sir the truth is that ... today people are scared to say the truth

dialogue: Main yahan karobaar karne behta hoon ... desh seva nahin
englishDialogue: I am here to do business ... not service to the country

dialogue: Saanp ko aadha maarke chhod do toh woh aur khatarnak ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: If you leave the snake half dead then it becomes more dangerous

dialogue: Budh, Ashok aur Gandhi ke is desh mein rehne waale hum log ... ahinsa ke pujari zaroor hain ... magar buzdil nahin
englishDialogue: We the people living in the country of Budh, Ashok and Gandhi ... are definitely preachers of non-violence ... but we are not cowards

dialogue: Ek baar teri file open ho gayi na ... toh sab kuch close ho jayega
englishDialogue: Once your file opens ... then everything will get closed

dialogue: Agar shatranj ki baazi jeetni ho ... toh usse dus dimaag se nahi, ek dimaag se khelna chahiye
englishDialogue: If you want to win the game of chess ... then play it with one brain, and with not 10 brains

dialogue: Dole dole mera bhi dil dole ... isse pehle ki meri joote bole ... tu patli gali hole
englishDialogue: My hearts is singing ... but before my shoes talk ... you get out from here

dialogue: Tumhare jism mein main itne chhed kar doonga ... ki marne ke baad bhi saale basuri ki tarah bajhte rahoge
englishDialogue: I will make so many holes in your body ... that bloody even after dying you will play like a flute

dialogue: Joh doosro ko tapkane ki himmat rakhte hai ... un mein khud bhi tapakne ka kaleja rehta hai
englishDialogue: Those who have the courage to kill others ... they also have the courage to die

dialogue: Insaan jhoot bol sakta hai ... lekin uske ungliyon ke nishaan jhoot nahi bol sakte
englishDialogue: A person can lie ... but his fingerprints can't lie

dialogue: Kal tak main supari leta tha doosro ko khatam karne ke liye ... lekin aaj maine apne aap ko supari di hai tujhe khatam karne ke liye
englishDialogue: Until yesterday I used to take money to kill others ... but today I've given myself money to kill you

dialogue: Duniya mera ghar hai, bus stand mera adda hai, jab mann kare aa jana, Raju mera naam hai ... aur pyar se log mujhe bulate hain ... coolie no. 1
englishDialogue: The world is my house, the bus stand is my joint, come whenever you want, my name is Raju ... and with love people call me ... coolie no. 1

dialogue: Tu coolie hai coolie hai coolie hai coolie hai!
englishDialogue: You are a porter a porter a porter a porter!

dialogue: Bungle mein rahenge ... gadi mein ghumenge ... noton pe sooenge
englishDialogue: We will stay in a bungalow ... go out in a car ... sleep on money

dialogue: Yahan par garmi bahut zyada hai ... main apni AC BC DC car mein jaakar beheta hoon
englishDialogue: It is very hot here ... I'll go and sit in my AC BC DC car

dialogue: Poornta se pal pal jeene ko hi asli jeevan kehte hai ... aur poornta se jeene waalon ke liye kabhi maut nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Living every moment to the fullest is called true life ... and the one who lives to the fullest never dies

dialogue: Jab ek aurat kisi ko apne dil mein basa leti hai ... toh phir baaki ki rasme toh sirf duniya ke liye reh jaati hai
englishDialogue: When a woman accepts someone in her heart ... then all other customs are completed just to show to the world

dialogue: De shiva var mohe, shubh karman se kabhoo na hatton ... na daroon bairi sauh jab chahe ladoon, nishchay kar apni jeet karoon
englishDialogue: Oh power of god give me this boon, that I may never shirk from doing good deeds ... that I shall not fear when I go into combat, and be victorious with determination

dialogue: Insaan ka itna sach bolna bhi acha nahi ... ki uski zubaan ko rokne ke liye uski saanson ko bandh karna pade
englishDialogue: A person saying the truth always is also not good ... because it may become necessary to end his breathe in order to stop his words

dialogue: Apna vasiyat nama banakar rakho ... kyun ki maut kisi bhi waqt tumhare ghar ka darwaza khatkhata sakti hai
englishDialogue: Prepare and keep your will ready ... because death can knock on the door of your house anytime

dialogue: Humne dekhe hai bahut dushmani karne waale ... waqt ki har saans se darne waale ... jiska haami hai khuda, kaun usse maar sake ... hum nahi bomb aur barood se marne waale
englishDialogue: I have seen many people who are enemies ... people who are scared with every breathe of time ... one who has the support of god, who can kill him ... I am not someone who will die with bombs and gunpowder

dialogue: Koi kabil ho toh hum shaan-e-watan dete hai ... dhoondne waalon ko duniya bhi nayi dete hai
englishDialogue: If someone is deserving then I will give my great country to him ... and if you look properly then I will also give you a new world

dialogue: Rajneeti mein goonge aur behre bankar raho ... toh raj karoge
englishDialogue: In politics if you stay dumb and deaf ... then you will rule

dialogue: Jab vichar ka deep bhuj jaata hai ... toh aachar andha ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: When the candle of thinking blows off ... then mannerism becomes blind

dialogue: Kaise kaise aaise vaise ho gaye, aaise vaise kaise kaise ho gaye ... kal joh the chamche hamare, aaj woh leader ho gaye
englishDialogue: How did crazy people turn into this ... people who used to flatter me till yesterday, today they have become leaders

dialogue: Tum jaise kamine chand logon ko chand mahino ke liye toh bewakoof bana sakte hai ... lekin sab logon ko hamesha ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: Scoundrels like you can cheat a few people for a few months ... but not everyone and forever

dialogue: Azaadi ek lamha nahi ... ek silsila hai
englishDialogue: Independence is not a moment ... it is a continuation

dialogue: Aaj tak main soochti rahi ki aap mujhe bahut pyar karte hai ... meri khushi ke liye aap apni khushiyo ka gala ghoont sakte hai ... lekin aaj mujhe pata chala ki aap apni khushi ke liye mera bhi gala ghoont sakte hai
englishDialogue: Until today I thought that you love me a lot ... and that you could sacrifice your happiness for my happiness ... but today I came to know that you can even squeeze my neck for your own happiness

dialogue: Kambakht yeh neend ki goli sula toh deti hai ... lekin lori nahi sunati
englishDialogue: The sleep pill will put you to sleep ... but it won't sing a lullaby

dialogue: Jis darakht ki jadh mein saanp ka bil ho ... parinde uski shaakon par ghosla nahi banate
englishDialogue: The root of a tree that has a snake hole ... birds don't make a nest on its branches

dialogue: Paap ki umar bahut lambi hoti hai ... lekin paapi ki umar bahut choti
englishDialogue: The life of a sin is very long ... but the life of a sinful person is very short

dialogue: Aap itne mohtaj nahi ki aaisi roti na kama sako ... joh imaandari ke aate se bani ho aur sachchai ki aanch par pakki ho
englishDialogue: You're not that dependent that you can't earn a bread ... which is made from the dough of honesty and baked on the flame of truth

dialogue: Apni hi karni ka phal hai naiki aur ruswaiyan ... aap hi ke sang chalengi aap ki parchaiyan
englishDialogue: Virtue and stigma are the results of our own deeds ... your shadows will walk only with you

dialogue: Sher ke kharrate bhaukte hue kutte se zyada khatarnak hote hai
englishDialogue: The snores of a tiger are more dangerous than a barking dog
