dialogue: Apne gusse ki botal pe shanti ka dhakan lagale ... nahi toh kisi phatake ki tarah udh jayega
englishDialogue: Put the cap of peace on your bottle of anger ... or else you'll blow up like a fire cracker

dialogue: Mujrim us saanp ki tarah hota hai joh bhook lagne par apne bachche tak nighal leta hai
englishDialogue: A criminal is like a snake which will even swallow its own children when it is hungry

dialogue: Kanoon ki jung jazbaat ke barood se nahi ... sabooton ke hathyar se ladi jaati hai
englishDialogue: The battle of the law is not fought with the gunpowder of emotions ... it's fought with the weapon of proofs

dialogue: Jab pata na ho ki kahan hai engine ... na khareedo aaisi gaadi pyare Indian ... issi liye kehta hoon "Be Indian, Buy Indian"
englishDialogue: When you don't know where is the engine ... then my fellow Indian don't buy that car ... and that's why I say "Be Indian, Buy Indian"

dialogue: Ek aadmi aakha duniya se lad sakta hai ... magar ek aurat ka nafrat ke aage haar jaata hai
englishDialogue: A man can fight with the entire world ... but he loses in front of the hatred from a woman

dialogue: Is vardi mein bahut garmi hoti hai ... is liye samajhdar officer rishvat ke cheeton se isse thanda karte rehte hai ... varna yeh pehanne waale ko jala deti hai
englishDialogue: This uniform has a lot of heat in it ... that's why a sensible officer keeps it cool with the droplets of bribery ... or else it will burn the person wearing it

dialogue: Paisa woh sabun hai joh badnaami ke har daag ko doh sakta hai
englishDialogue: Money is that soap which can erase every mark of infamy

dialogue: Is vardi ke andar barood se bana hua jism hai ... agar us jism ne aag pakad li toh woh dhamaka hoga ki ... tere jism ke chitre cheetiyan tak nahi dhoond payengi
englishDialogue: Inside this uniform there is a body made from gunpowder ... and if this body catches fire then there will be such an explosion ... that even the ants won't be able to find the pieces of your body

dialogue: Chola badal lene se aadmi ka charitra nahi badal jaata
englishDialogue: By changing clothes a person's character doesn't change

dialogue: Main jis peshe mein hoon na ... wahan mere sirf dushman hai, dost koi bhi nahi
englishDialogue: The business that I am in ... I have only enemies there, no friends

dialogue: Main sirf ek zubaan samajhta hoon ... Hindustani
englishDialogue: I understand only one language ... Hindi

dialogue: Hamare haath wahan tak pahunchte hai ... jahan aaj tak science bhi nahi pahunch pai
englishDialogue: My hands can reach those places ... where not even science has reached till date

dialogue: Is shehar mein sikka sarkar ka zaroor chalta hai ... magar raj apna hai
englishDialogue: The government surely runs this city ... but I rule it

dialogue: Agar koi mujhse pooche ki is duniya mein mera sabse bada dushman kaun hai ... toh main kahoonga tu ... sabse zyada nafrat main kisse karta hoon ... toh main kahoonga tujhse
englishDialogue: If someone asks me that in this world who is your biggest enemy ... then I will say you ... whom do I hate the most ... then I will say you

dialogue: Der se mila hua insaaf khud ek na-insaafi hai
englishDialogue: Justice that is received late is injustice in itself

dialogue: Main crorepati, tu arabpati ... baki sab chai ki pati
englishDialogue: I am rich, you are super rich ... and all others are tea leaves

dialogue: Lohe se jab sheesha takrata hai toh ... uske itne tukde ho jaate hain ki ghinna mushkil ho jata hai
englishDialogue: When a glass hits against iron then ... it shatters into so many pieces that it becomes hard to count

dialogue: Badla jitna itminan se liya jaaye ... utna hi uska mazaa badh jaata hai
englishDialogue: The slower you take the revenge ... that much more fun it becomes

dialogue: Aaj tak aaisa koi amir pehda nahi hua ... joh kanoon ka maalik ban sake
englishDialogue: Till date there has not been a rich person born ... woh can become the boss of the law

dialogue: Baarish ki chand boondein padhi toh, machi is tarah dhoom ... sabi jawan dil, sabi haseen dil gaye nashe mein jhoom
englishDialogue: When a few drops of the rain fell, then there was such great fun ... every young person, every beautiful person went crazy with enjoyment

dialogue: Meri mohabbat ek chutki bhar sindoor ki mohtaj nahi
englishDialogue: My love is not dependent on one pinch of vermilion

dialogue: Suraj ki pehli kiran aapke bunglay aur mere ghar pe barabar ki roshni dalti hai
englishDialogue: The Sun shines it first rays equally on your bungalow and my house

dialogue: Atma toh pehle hi kisi aur ki ho gayi hai ... reh gaya yeh shareer, isse bhagwan ko arpan kar dete hai
englishDialogue: My soul is already someone else's ... whats left is this body, lets offer that to God

dialogue: Tumhare shareer ke pedh par ... jawani ka naya phool khil gaya
englishDialogue: On the tree of your body ... a new flower of youth has blossomed

dialogue: Doctor sirf ilaaj kar sakta hai ... mareez ki tamanna puri nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: A doctor can only do the treatment ... he cannot fulfill a patients wish

dialogue: Kuch log baaton ki nahi laaton ki zabaan samajhte hai
englishDialogue: Some people understand the language of kicks and not of the words

dialogue: Joh cheez bikti nahi hai ... usse main cheen leta hoon
englishDialogue: The item that is not for sale ... I snatch that away

dialogue: Maa ka dil sab kuch jaanta hai ... bete ka sukh, bete ka dukh ... sab kuch usse pehle se hi maloom hota hai
englishDialogue: The heart of a mother knows everything ... happiness of her son, sadness of her son ... it knows everything before hand

dialogue: Main tum jaise logon ke saath sauda nahi karta ... sirf faisla karta hoon
englishDialogue: I don't make a deal with people like you ... I only take decisions

dialogue: Apno se jhoot bolna ... apne aap ko bilkul akela kar dena hai
englishDialogue: Lying to our own people ... is making yourself completely alone

dialogue: Main kudrat ki jayaz aulad hoon jisne mujhe sab kuch diya hai ... yeh dhoop, yeh chaun, yeh zameen, yeh aasmaan sab kuch ... bas nahi mila toh sirf ek municipality ka birth certificate nahi mila
englishDialogue: I'm a legal child of nature who has given me everything ... this sunshine, this shade, this ground, this sky, everything ... if I haven't got one thing, then that is a birth certificate from the municipality

dialogue: Insaani rishton ko kayam rakhne ke liye kabhi kabhi jhoot bolna bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To maintain human relationships sometimes it becomes very important to lie

dialogue: Iske tukde tukde karke poore gaon mein prasad ki tarah baant do
englishDialogue: Cut him into pieces and distribute them into the whole village

dialogue: Aaj ke is kalyug mein ... tumhara bhagwan bhi is shaitan se darta hai
englishDialogue: In this modern era ... even your God is scared of this satan

dialogue: Zindagi ek paheli hai ... kabhi dushman, kabhi saheli hai
englishDialogue: Life is a riddle ... sometimes it is an enemy, sometimes it is a girlfriend

dialogue: Darye us bhagwan se ... sabse badi goli hoti hai uske paas joh bewaqt chalti hai
englishDialogue: Be scared of God ... he has the biggest bullet which gets fired anytime

dialogue: Jung ke maidan mein ladne wala har sipahi barabar hota hai
englishDialogue: Every soldier fighting on the war field is equal

dialogue: Kharbuja, kharbuje ko dekh kar rang badalta hai
englishDialogue: A cantaloupe changes color when it sees a cantaloupe

dialogue: Sher ke shikaar ki tamanna uman har shikari karta hai ... magar har shikari ki yeh tamanna puri nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Every hunter wishes to hunt a tiger ... but this wish of every hunter is not fulfilled

dialogue: Hamare yahan toh yamdoot bhi hamari ijaazat ke bina nahi aa sakta
englishDialogue: At my place even the messenger of God of death cannot come without my permission

dialogue: Jis saanp ko barso doodh pilaya ... ussi ne khandan ki izzat ko dasa
englishDialogue: The snake whom we fed milk for years ... he himself bit the family

dialogue: Chot lagegi toh hi mazboot ho jaoge
englishDialogue: You will get stronger only when you get a wound

dialogue: Doobi hui kashti se kinara poochte ho, bete?
englishDialogue: Son, you're asking for the shore from a sunken ship?

dialogue: Shikast humne kabhi dekhi nahi ... jeet-e-jee hum kabhi mare nahi
englishDialogue: I have never seen defeat ... livingly I have never died

dialogue: Zalalat ka joh kaanta mere dil mein gadh gaya hai ... uski chubhan mujhe zindagi bhar tadpaati rahegi
englishDialogue: The thorn of disgrace that is buried in my heart ... the sting of that will torment me for life

dialogue: Humne tumhe paal poskar is din ke liye bada nahi kiya tha ... ki humse sawal jawab karne ki jurrat karo
englishDialogue: I didn't raise you for this day ... where you dare to ask a question to me

dialogue: Sample pesh karo ... naacho, gaao, seena cheerke dil dikhao, jaan ki baazi lagao, dekha na suna aaisa sapna jagao ... hamara dil behlao
englishDialogue: Show me the sample ... dance, sing, open and show me your heart, put your life on the line, ignite the dream which is never seen nor heard of ... entertain me

dialogue: Pyar woh nasha hai jis mein chain kho jaata hai, hosh udh jaata hai, neend gayab ho jaati hai ... kisi ko milne ki, chune ki, kehne ki, sunne ki, kisi ko apna banane ki, kisi ka ho jaane ki khawaish hoti hai, jeene ko mann karta hai ... pyar woh andhrooni bahaar hai jis mein kalpana ke phool khilte hai, kavita ko sur milte hai, chahaton ke mele lagte hai, kisse mehakte hai, kah-kahe lagte hai, karaar milta hai ... pyar woh insaani karishma hai jis mein aane waale kal ko wajah milti hai, guzre hue kal ko wajood milta hai, anjaan logon ka dil milta hai, soone safar ko sahil milta hai
englishDialogue: Love is that intoxication in which you lose your peace of mind, you lose your senses, your sleep disappears ... you wish to meet someone, touch someone, say to someone, listen to someone, make someone yours, to become of someone, and to live ... love is that incomplete spring season in which the flowers of imagination blossom, the poems get their tunes, the fairs of romance are set, the stories create a fragrance, laughing happens, and you get satisfaction ... love is that human magic in which the future gets a purpose, the past gets an existence, the hearts of strangers connect, and the lonely journey finds the destination

dialogue: Bhook hai, thakaan hai, dard ki pehchaan hai ... dushman jahaan hai, mann bhi pareshaan hai
englishDialogue: I'm hungry, I'm tired, I have the understanding of pain ... the world is my enemy, and my heart is disturbed

dialogue: Yahan tel bhi hai, adalaton mein bail bhi hai ... Kashmir aur Taj Mahal ke saath, suna hai Tihar jail bhi hai
englishDialogue: Here there is oil, and there is bail in the courts also ... along with Kashmir and Taj Mahal, I've heard there is also Tihar jail

dialogue: Kya nahi hai mere paas? ... dekhne mein hero body hai fit, jahan bhi main niklon main superhit ... manner mein style hai, killer sa smile hai, rehta hoon tip-top, niklon toh traffic stop ... society ki shaan hoon, party ki jaan hoon, dancer hoon, dashing fighter hoon, smashing jaanta hoon, heart lover hoon fantastic
englishDialogue: What is it that I don't have? ... in looks I have a fit hero body, I'm super hit wherever I go ... I have style in my manners, I have a killer smile, I stay tip-top, there is a traffic stop when I go out ... I'm the pride of the society, I'm the life of a party, I'm a dancer, I'm a dashing fighter, I know how to smash, and I'm a fantastic lover of the heart

dialogue: Bandook pakad lene se buzdil bahadur nahi ban jaata ... aur apun darr nahi jaata
englishDialogue: By holding a gun a coward doesn't become courageous ... and neither do I get scared

dialogue: Qayamat ki raat ko hum ghoomne ko nikle ... lal chaand nikla hum choomne ko nikle ... arre bhigdi hai apni toh aadat kuch itni ... aadhi raat aafat ko dhoondne ko nikle
englishDialogue: On the night of doomsday we went out to roam around ... the red moon was out and we left to kiss it ... our habits are so bad that ... we left in the middle of the night to find trouble

dialogue: Palak jhapakte paasa palat jaata hai, palak jhapakte baazi bighad jaati hai, palak jhapakte kismat badal jaati hai, palak jhapakte pralay aa jaati hai ... jab palak jhapakti hai toh us pal ke liye aadmi soo jaata hai ... aur soona maut ke barabar hota hai
englishDialogue: In the blink of an eye the sides revert, in the blink of an eye the game gets spoilt, in the blink of an eye luck changes, in the blink of an eye catastrophe comes ... when a person blinks his eyes then for that moment he sleeps ... and sleeping is the equivalent of death

dialogue: Humse zabaan ladata hai, hum hi ko kanoon sikhata hai ... chal issi baat par nikaal paise, bachkar jayega kaise ... chal ho ja mushtaid nahi toh aath din ki qaid
englishDialogue: You're arguing with us, you're teaching us the law ... come on now take out the money, because you can't escape ... come on get ready or else you'll be in jail for 8 days

dialogue: Watan pe mitne waalon ki yun khatam nahi hoti kahaniyan ... hum mein toh phir bhi yaad rakhegi duniya, nahi rahengi tumhari nishaaniyan
englishDialogue: The stories of people who die for their country don't end ... the world will still remember me, but your traces won't even survive

dialogue: Yeh na samajhna ki samne koi murdaar khada hai ... kehte hai jisse Chauhan yeh tumhara baap khada hai
englishDialogue: Don't think that someone weak is standing in front of you ... the one who is called as Mr. Chauhan is your father and he is standing in front of you

dialogue: Duty nibhate hai hum issi liye hum hum hai, varna haramkhor kehlate ... rishvat khate mujrimon se aur rishvatkhor kehlate
englishDialogue: I fulfill my duty and that's why I am who I am, or else I would have been called useless ... and I would have taken bribe and would have been called someone who takes bribe

dialogue: Mehnat se mile daulat toh Allah ki rehmat hai ... mile haraam ki toh shaitan ki laanat hai ... peeth par maarkar apno ke khanjar joh mile daulat ... arre woh laanat hai, woh laanat hai, woh laanat hai
englishDialogue: If you earn money by hardwork then it's a blessing of Allah ... if you get it for free then it's a curse from the devil ... if you get money by stabbing your dear ones on the back with a knife ... then it's a curse, it's a curse, it's a curse

dialogue: Main hoon aag ka dariya na ulfat ka geet ... yugon se nibhaye joh Raghukul ke reet ... mitta doonga is jag se zulm ka andhera ... main roshni ka aashiq mera naam Raghuveer
englishDialogue: I'm a sea of fire and not a love song ... the one who has followed the customs of ancient dynasty for years ... I'll erase the darkness of cruelty from this world ... I'm a lover of light and my name is Raghuveer

dialogue: Raajneeti ke rath ko wohi ghode keenchte hai ... jinki aankhon pe wafaadari ki patti bandhi ho
englishDialogue: Only those horses pull the chariot of politics ... who are blindfolded by honesty

dialogue: Jhoot ke kaale badal suraj ko kitna bhi dhak le ... ek din ujaala hokar hi rahega
englishDialogue: No matter how much the dark clouds of lies cover the sun ... one day there will be brightness

dialogue: Khoon jaise apna rang nahi badalta ... vaise hi khoon apne khoon ke sar ki jhooti kasam nahi khaata
englishDialogue: Like blood doesn't change its colour ... just like that blood can't make a false promise in the name of its own blood

dialogue: Teri har saans ke peeche maut bankar khada hoon main
englishDialogue: I'm standing like death behind every breath of yours

dialogue: Main jab bhi koi khel khelta hoon ... hamesha uska ek patta bahar chhodkar aata hoon
englishDialogue: Whenever I play any game ... I always leave one card of that outside

dialogue: Yeh crorepati hai, yeh arabpati hai ... magar aaise rehte hai jaise chai ki patti hai
englishDialogue: He is rich, he is super rich ... but he lives as if he is tea powder

dialogue: Hamare is kaale dhande mein zindagi aur maut ka khel toh chalta hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: The game of life and death keeps going on in our illegal business

dialogue: Jin logon ki zindagi ka koi maqsad hota hai ... unhe aurat ki duniya se door rehna chahiye
englishDialogue: People who have a goal in life ... they must stay away from the women's world

dialogue: Na surat, na huliya, na shakal ... aur ladki ko kehta hai pyar karne bahar chal
englishDialogue: Niether a good face and neither a good body ... and you say to a girl, let's go outside to make love

dialogue: Yam hai hum ... hum hai Yam!
englishDialogue: God of death is me ... I am the God of death!

dialogue: Shehar mein shanti aur nagriko ki hifasat karna mera farz hai ... yahi meri duty aur yahi mujhpar meri vardi ka karz hai
englishDialogue: It is my job to maintain peace in the city and to protect the people ... this is my duty and this is the loan on me from my uniform

dialogue: Aadhi raat ko bulana, subah tak zaroor aaonga yeh meri arz hai ... shehar mein shanti aur nagriko ki seva karna mera farz hai
englishDialogue: Call me in the middle of the night, and I will definitely come till morning ... it is my duty to maintain silence in the city and to serve the people

dialogue: Bhagwan sansar mein har jagah har ghadi nahi reh sakta ... is liye usne apne badle ghar ghar mein maa ko pehda kiya hai
englishDialogue: God cannot be present on this universe in every place and at every moment ... hence instead of him he created a mother in every house

dialogue: Choro se maal bachane ke liye dukaan ko taala lagaya ja sakta hai ... lekin dokhebaazo se bachna bahut hi mushkil hai
englishDialogue: To protect merchandise from the theives you can lock a shop ... but it is very hard to protect from cheaters

dialogue: Yeh sharab ka pehla usool hai ... jiski piyo sharab, uska hi ghar karo kharab
englishDialogue: This is the first rule of alcohol ... whose alcohol you drink, you should spoil their house

dialogue: Cheena jhapti, loot-mar, atyachar, brashtachar, balatkar ... aaisa koi paap nahi joh is manav ne nah kiya ho
englishDialogue: Snatching, stealing, torture, corruption, rape ... there is no sin that this person has not done

dialogue: Humri ek choti si behna, chhod rahi hai aaj humra angna ... uski shaadi hai humpe udhaar, karoonga main uski shaadi bar-bar, lagatar, hazaar-bar
englishDialogue: My little sister is leaving our house today ... I owe her the wedding, and I will get her married many a times, thousand times

dialogue: Main dadaon ka dada hoon aur gundo ka gunda hoon ... yeh sansar meri dharti aur main iska jhanda hoon
englishDialogue: I am the biggest goon and big daddy ... this universe is my land and I am it's flag

dialogue: Yeh shehar jahanum hai, narak hai aur hum hai is shehar ka Yamraj ... kisko, kahan aur kab maarna hai ... yeh hum decide karoonga
englishDialogue: This city is hell, misery and I am the God of death of this city ... who, where and when has to die ... I will decide that

dialogue: Udaasi ka sirf ek sur hota hai, jisse pakadkar main jeeti rahi hoon ... aur gusse ka bhi ek hi sur hota hai, jisse pakadkar tum jee rahe ho ... magar zindagi mein saat sur hote hai ... kya hum in saaton suron ko pakadkar nahi chal sakte
englishDialogue: Sadness has only one tune, on which I am living ... and anger also has only one tune, on which you are living ...  but life has seven tunes ... why can't we catch these seven tunes and walk together

dialogue: Tum agar saath ho toh kisi cheez se darr nahi lagta ... darrta hoon toh sirf tumhe khone se
englishDialogue: If you are with me then I am not scared of anything ... I am only scared of losing you

dialogue: Nafrat ki is duniya mein mohabbat shayad sabse bada jurm hai
englishDialogue: Love is the biggest crime in this world of hate

dialogue: Bahut auratein dekhi jinke liye jaan di jaa sakti hai ... pehli baar ek aaisi ladki dekhi jiske liye jaan li jaa sakti hai
englishDialogue: I have seen many women for whom one can give their life ... but for the first time I am seeing a woman for whom a life can be taken

dialogue: Police na kisise mohabbat karti hai, na nafrat karti hai ... hum sirf duty karte hai
englishDialogue: The police doesn't love anyone and neither does it hate anyone ... we only do our duty

dialogue: Aap hasti hai ... toh ghungroo bajhte hai
englishDialogue: When you laugh ... it sounds like the ankle bells

dialogue: Mard ki zillat aurat ke balatkaar se zyada sharamnak hoti hai
englishDialogue: Humiliation for a man is more shameless than the rape of a woman

dialogue: Bhayanak sapno ko bhool jaana ... achchi baat nahi
englishDialogue: To forget dreadful dreams ... is not a good thing

dialogue: Seedhe ghar jaoge yah ... haspatal hokar jaoge
englishDialogue: Do you want to go home straight ... or do you want to go via the hospital

dialogue: Halaat insaan ko shaitaan bana deta hai ... magar devta nahi
englishDialogue: Situations can turn a man into evil ... but not a deity

dialogue: Dimaag kharch karne se ... dimaag kam nahi hota
englishDialogue: Using your brain ... does not diminish it

dialogue: Bachchon mein zid achchi lagti hai, auraton mein shaandar lagti hai, badshahon mein bereham lagti hai ... magar iski yeh zid kaisi hai reh?
englishDialogue: Stubbornness looks good in children, looks ravishing in women, looks ruthless in kings ... but what is your stubbornness like?

dialogue: Dard itna meetha bhi ho sakta hai ... yeh aaj pata chala
englishDialogue: Pain can be this sweet ... I came to know that today

dialogue: Aadmi zabaan se kuch kehta hai ... dimaag se kuch aur sochta hai ... aur dil kuch aur hi chahta hai
englishDialogue: A person says something from his mouth ... thinks something else from his mind ... and his heart wants something else altogether

dialogue: Agar halaat ke ghulam banoge na, toh duniya tumhe kutta samajhkar laat maregi ... lekin agar halaat ko apna ghulam banaoge na, toh duniya tumhe sher samajhkar salaam karegi
englishDialogue: If you become a slave to the conditions, then the world will kick you like a dog ... but if you make the conditions as your slave, then the world will salute you like a tiger

dialogue: Kal shyam aur thi, aaj shyam aur hai ... kal thikaane aur the, aaj manzil aur hai
englishDialogue: Yesterday evening was different, today evening is different ... yesterday the location was different, today the destination is different

dialogue: Woh tujhe mil jayegi ... tere dil ki kali khil jayegi
englishDialogue: You will get her ... and the flower in your heart will blossom

dialogue: Joh chala gaya usse bhool ja ... joh aa raha hai usse pyar kar
englishDialogue: Forget the one who is gone ... love the one who is coming

dialogue: Mohabbat aur jurrat kya cheez hai, yeh tu kya janega kasai ... yeh deewana bankar rahega, tumhara permanent jamai
englishDialogue: What is love and dare, you won't know that butcher ... this crazy person will become your permanent son-in-law

dialogue: Is duniya mein har insaan ko khud ladna padta hai ... khud haarna aur khud hi jeetna padta hai
englishDialogue: In this world every person has to fight by themselves ... he himself has to lose and he himself has to win

dialogue: Aasoon kamzor logon ke zevar hote hai
englishDialogue: Tears are the jewels of weak people

dialogue: Bhaage hamare dushman meri jaan, hum mein rukna hoga ... hamari mohabbat ke aage, in kamino ko jhukna hoga
englishDialogue: Let our enemies run, we will stay ... these losers will have to bow down in front of our love

dialogue: Is duniya mein kisi bhi cheez ko haasil karne ke liye teen tarike ki power chahiye ... money power, political power, muscle power
englishDialogue: To acquire anything in this world you need 3 types of power ... money power, political power, muscle power

dialogue: Ghalib na mara tha, na mara hai, na marega ... kyun ki aashiq ka bachcha na sudhra hai, na sudhrega
englishDialogue: The poet never died, is not dead and will not die ... because a lover has never changed and will never change

dialogue: Pareshani aur takleefon se joh door ho, woh hum hai ... jiske sar par aapka haath ho, usse kya gham hai
englishDialogue: I am a person who stays away from troubles and problems ... and the one who has your blessing has nothing to worry about

dialogue: Gundon se nipatne ke liye fauj ki nahi, himmat ki zaroorat padti hai
englishDialogue: To deal with goons one needs to have courage, not an army

dialogue: Zindagi mein insaan do hi baar gehri neend sota hai ... maut ki gaud mein yah maa ke aanchal mein
englishDialogue: In life a person sleeps deeply only twice ... in the lap of death or in the lap of a mother

dialogue: Tann pe jitne kapde hai ... ussi ko main apna kafan maanke chalta hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever clothes I have on my body ... I roam around believing that is my shroud

dialogue: Jisne bhi mooh dikhane ki jurrat ki ... uski mulaqat maut se hogi
englishDialogue: Whosoever tries to show their face ... they will meet with death

dialogue: Maine usse kitna yaad kiya ... yeh toh meri yaadash ko bhi yaad nahi
englishDialogue: How much I remembered her ... that even my memory doesn't remember

dialogue: Paraye ko gale lagana aasan hota hai ... par apnana bahut mushkil
englishDialogue: It is easy to hug strangers ... but it is very difficult to make them as our own

dialogue: Meri pistol mein ek adalat bethti hai ... kartoos ko sirf gunahgar ke taraf jaane ki ijaazat hai
englishDialogue: A court sits inside my pistol ... and the bullet only has the permission to go towards the guilty

dialogue: Mere us aakhri gunah ke baad tumhe sabooton aur gawahon ke jhamele mein nahi padna padega ... kyun ki us din gunahgar Deva khud banega aur gawah bhi Deva hi banega ... jurm bhi mera hoga aur sazaa bhi main tay karoonga ... apne gale mein sooli bhi daloonga aur jallad bhi main hi khud banooga
englishDialogue: After that last crime of mine you won't have to run behind proofs and witnesses ... because that day Deva himself will become the guilty and also Deva will become the witness ... the crime will be mine and I'll decide the punishment ... I'll put the hangman's knot around my neck and I'll myself become the executioner

dialogue: Is waqt tum jis glass ke andar khade ho ... woh bulletproof zaroor hai, lekin patthar proof nahi
englishDialogue: The glass behind which you are standing at the moment ... is definitely bulletproof, but it's not stone proof

dialogue: Deva ki adalat mein sazaa jitni der se milti hai ... maut utni hi dardnak hoti hai
englishDialogue: The later the punishment you get in Deva's court ... that much more painful the death is

dialogue: Tumhe chaubees ghante ki mahulat di ... jeena chahte ho toh aakar mujhe us aadmi ka naam bata dena ... varna tumhari is bachi-kuchi zindagi ko pacheesva ghanta dekhna naseeb nahi hoga
englishDialogue: I'll give you 24 hours ... if you want to live then come and tell me the name of that person ... or else your remaining life will not be able to see the 25th hour

dialogue: Mere farz mein itna faulaad hai ... ki us mein pistol bhi ban jayegi aur hathkadi bhi
englishDialogue: There is so much steel in my duty ... that I can make a pistol and also handcuffs from it

dialogue: Usse kahin kuch ho gaya toh saara khoon kheenchkar teri nasson mein itna barood bhar doonga ... ki tu zindagi bhar jalta rahega
englishDialogue: If something happens to her then I'll pull all the blood out and fill so much gunpowder in your veins ... that you will burn for your entire life

dialogue: Main tumhe us darje ka gunahgar maanta hoon ... ki ek hi jagah rehkar, ek hi waqt tum dus gunah kar sakte ho
englishDialogue: I believe that you are a criminal to that extent ... where being in one place and at the same time you can commit 10 crimes

dialogue: Kuch reet jagat ki aaisi hai ... har ek subah ki shyam hui ... tu cheez hai kya, tera naam hai kya ... Rekha, Hema tak yahan badnaam hui
englishDialogue: Some customs of the world are such that ... every morning has an evening ... what are you, what is your name ... even Rekha and Hema have been defamed here

dialogue: Tum gaye kya jag hua andha kuaan ... rail chhuti reh gaya keval dhuaan
englishDialogue: The world became a dark well after you left ... and after the train left only the smoke was remaining

dialogue: Joh maachis teeli ki aag mein haath jala behette hai ... unhe suraj ki aag se hookah nahi sulghana chahiye
englishDialogue: The people who burn their hand in the fire of a matchstick ... they should not smoke the hookah from the fire of the sun

dialogue: Kab se tadap raha tha deedar ke liye ... aankhen taras gayi apne yaar ke liye
englishDialogue: Since so long I've been waiting for your sight ... my eyes are yearning for my beloved

dialogue: Upar waale ne tere liye sirf teen manzilein banayi hai ... pehda hone se pehle teri maa ke pet mein ... marne ke baad chitta par ... aur jab tak tu zinda rahegi tu hamari banke rahegi
englishDialogue: God has only made three stories for you ... first the womb of your mother before you were born ... then your pyre after you die ... and until you're alive you'll remain as mine

dialogue: Tumhare pyar mein dil bekarar kab se hai ... ab aa bhi jaao, mujhe intezar kab se hai
englishDialogue: My heart is restless in your love since a long time ... please come, I've been waiting for you since a long time

dialogue: Har mumkin pehle namumkin hi hota hai ... aur har haqeeqat pehle khwaab hi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Everything possible is initially impossible ... and everything real is initially a dream

dialogue: Aap kamai mein joh maza hai na ... woh maza na baap kamai mein hai, na paap kamai mein hai
englishDialogue: The enjoyment that you get from earning money by yourself ... you don't get that enjoyment from the money received from your father or the money earned from evil things

dialogue: Apni halat bayaan karoon kaise ... yaad ka saanp dil ko dasta hai ... aahatein goonjti hai kaano mein ... meri aankhon mein koi basta hai ... main tumhe dhoondne kahan jaaon ... koi manzil na koi rasta hai ... meri baahein tumhari manzil hai ... dil musafir hai, pyar rasta hai ... waqt aankhon mein tham gaya jaise ... ek paal ek saal lagta hai ... mere khwaabon ki saans toot na jaaye ... aa bhi jaao ki aas toot na jaaye
englishDialogue: How should I describe about my condition ... the snake of memories bites me ... the sounds echo in my ears ... someone has settled in my eyes ... where should I go searching for you ... there's no path and no destination ... my arms are your destination ... the heart is a traveller and love is the path ... time has stopped in my eyes ... one moment feels like one year ... I hope the breath of my dreams doesn't break ... please come, my hopes are about to break

dialogue: Main jab naachta hoon na ... toh pair floor par nahi, haseeno ke dil par padte hai
englishDialogue: When I dance ... then my feet don't step on the floor, they step on the hearts of beautiful women

dialogue: Mohabbat ki nahi jaati ... karayi bhi nahi jaati ... mohabbat toh bas khud ba khud ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Love is not something that is done ... it's not something that can be got done ... love simply happens by itself

dialogue: Joh humri marzi ke bagair, humre ilaake ki zameen pe apna kadam rakhta hai ... woh apne kadmon pe nahi, balki doosron ke kandhon pe lautke jaata hai
englishDialogue: The one who lays his feet on the grounds of my territory, without my permission ... he leaves on the shoulders of others and not on his own feet

dialogue: Badhon ka yarana karane ke liye ... choton ka pyarana bahut zaroori hai
englishDialogue: To create friendship between the elders ... it's important to get the youngsters to be in love

dialogue: Phatte hue kapde toh sille jaate hai ... lekin gayi hui izzat vapas nahi aati hai
englishDialogue: Torn clothes can be stitched ... but lost respect never comes back

dialogue: Saale tune bhi dushmani ki laash par khoob dosti ka kafan pehnaya hai
englishDialogue: Bloody you've well applied the shroud of friendship on the dead body of enmity

dialogue: Lagata hai tumhari aankhon mein soovar ka baal hai
englishDialogue: It seems like there is a hair of a pig in your eyes

dialogue: Baat jab sadak tak pahunch jaati hai ... toh ghar ke andhar jhankne ki zaroorat nahi padti
englishDialogue: When the issue comes on the road ... then there is no need to peek inside the house

dialogue: License bandook ka nahi ... bandook chalane waale ki himmat ka hona chahiye
englishDialogue: There should be a license for the courage of the person firing the gun ... not of the gun itself

dialogue: Khanna koi ganna nahi jisse choos kar koi bhi uska juice pee jaye
englishDialogue: Khanna is not a sugarcane which anyone can suck on it and drink it's juice

dialogue: Woh bhookhi pyasi nahi hai, uska pet bhar gaya hai ... mohabbat ki hawa khake, ishq ka sharbat peke
englishDialogue: She is not hungry and thirsty, her stomach is full ... by eating the air of love and drinking the drink of romance

dialogue: Mujhe maut se na daraiye ... main sar par kafan bandh kar hi yahan aaya hoon
englishDialogue: Don't scare me with death ... I've come here wearing a shroud on my head

dialogue: Woh jeb toh maine kabhi silvahi hi nahi ... jis mein daulat ke alava aur bhi kuch rakha jaye
englishDialogue: I haven't got stitched a pocket ... in which you can keep something else other than money

dialogue: Umar ka rog jism ko lagta hai jigar ko nahi
englishDialogue: The illness of age applies to the body, not to the heart

dialogue: Aurat ki izzat heere ke haar se zyada keemti hoti hai
englishDialogue: The honour of a woman is more expensive than a diamond necklace

dialogue: Tumhare Jagatpal uncle ne zindagi ka bhoj kam aur laashon ka bhoj zyada uthaya hai
englishDialogue: Your Jagatpal uncle has picked up more weight of dead bodies than that of life

dialogue: Jinke haath khud khoon se range ho ... woh doosron par ungli nahi uthate
englishDialogue: Those who have their hand painted with blood ... they don't point fingers at others

dialogue: Duniya mein abhi tak kisi government ne aaise note nahi banaye ... joh ek baap se uske bete ko khareed le
englishDialogue: No government in this world has made such notes ... which can buy a son from his father

dialogue: Duaon se swarg aur narak ke faisle hote hai ... kanoon ke nahi
englishDialogue: Only the decisions of heaven and hell are made with prayers ... not the decisions of law

dialogue: Jurm ki chataan ko kranti ki lehren takra takrakar todh deti hai
englishDialogue: The waves of revolution crash and break the mountain of crime

dialogue: Jab samne waala garam hota hai na ... toh khud ko naram rehne ka
englishDialogue: When the person in front of you is hot ... then you should be soft

dialogue: Ab tak tum is vardi ki ahmiyat ko samajh nahi paye ho ... kyun ki tum ek aaise dimak ho jisne is police station ki deewaron ko itna khokla kar diya hai ... ki koi mamuli sa ladka isse todh sakta hai
englishDialogue: Until now you have not understood the importance of this uniform ... because you are such a termite who has made the walls of this police station so hollow that ... any ordinary boy can break it

dialogue: Ab tak tera muqabla buzdilon se hua hai ... jab samna is mard se hoga na ... toh teri yeh sher banne ki galatphami door ho jayegi
englishDialogue: Until now you have only contested with cowards ... now when you come across this man ... then your misunderstanding of being a tiger will go away

dialogue: Paap ka ghinauna rang main teri aankhon mein dekh raha hoon ... yeh rang maut ka elaan hai ... tu hi nahi, tujh jaise har paapi ka anth ab bahut hi nazdeek hai
englishDialogue: I can see the disgusting colour of sin in your eyes ... this colour is the announcement of death ... and not only you, but the end of every sinful person like you is near

dialogue: Padhe likhe logon ke saath mein hai na, kabhi likha padhi ka kaam nahi karna chahiye
englishDialogue: You should never do the business of paperwork, with educated people

dialogue: Main jaanta tha ek na ek din yeh ladka meri izzat ki bajjiyan talega ... woh bhi mitti ke tel mein
englishDialogue: I knew it that one day this boy will fry and destroy my dignity ... and that to with kerosene

dialogue: Bookh aaisi cheez hai joh achche achchon ki zid ko bhula deta hai
englishDialogue: Hunger is something that breaks the stubbornness of even the best of the best

dialogue: Zindagi jeene ka mazaa tab aata hai ... jab maut ki ungliyan thamkar bhaga jaye
englishDialogue: The fun in living life comes ... when we run holding the fingers of death

dialogue: Zindagi mein toofan aaye, qayamat aaye ... magar kabhi dosti mein daraar na aane paye
englishDialogue: Whether a storm or a disaster comes in life ... a gap in friendship should never come

dialogue: Zindagi mein jab sirf ek hi raasta bacha ho ... toh kya galat aur kya sahi ... koi mainey nahi rakhta
englishDialogue: In life when there is only one path left ... then what is wrong and what is right ... doesn't matter at all

dialogue: Kuch log aaise hote hai joh pehli baar milne pe bhi ajnabee nahin lagte
englishDialogue: Some people don't feel like strangers even when we meet them for the first time

dialogue: Jab zindagi ki gaadi ishq ke platform par jaakar atak jaye ... toh uss gaadi mein thoda sa shaadi ka petrol dal dena chahiye ... toh gaadi aage badh jati hai
englishDialogue: When the car of life gets stuck on the platform of love ... then you should add some petrol in that car ... to make that car moving ahead

dialogue: Main tujhe maroonga nahi ... main tujhe aaisi sazaa doonga ki tu roj marega
englishDialogue: I won't kill you ... I will give you such a punishment that you'll die daily

dialogue: Agar mohabbat ka mausam theek nahi raha toh yeh apne apne ghar jayenge ... aur agar mohabbat ka mausam theek raha toh phir yeh gana gayenge
englishDialogue: If the weather of romance is not good then they will go to their own houses ... and if the weather of romance is good then they will sing a song

dialogue: Sirf khoon ke rishtey se koi bhai nahi ho jata ... bhai ek adarsh hota hai, mujrim nahi ... bhai Ram hota hai, Ravan nahi
englishDialogue: Just by the relation of blood one does not become a brother ... a brother is a role model, not a criminal ... a brother is lord Ram, not Ravan

dialogue: Bambai ki sari ladkiyan tere do by do dil mein bhari padi hai
englishDialogue: All the girls of Mumbai are filled in your two by two heart

dialogue: Haq usko hota hai jiska kabza hota hai
englishDialogue: The right belongs to the person who has the possession

dialogue: Joh talwaron se bach jaate hai ... woh aksar phoolon se kat jaate hai
englishDialogue: People who escape from the swords ... usually they get cut by the flowers

dialogue: Joh cheez mujhe nahi milti ... main usse barbaad kar deta hoon
englishDialogue: The thing that I cannot get ... I destroy it

dialogue: Itna bada jhoot mat bol ... ki jhoot bhi sharminda ho jaye
englishDialogue: Don't say such a big lie ... that even the lie gets embarrassed

dialogue: Aurat maryam bankar zindagi de sakti hai ... toh chandi bankar zindagi le bhi sakti hai
englishDialogue: If a woman can become Mother Mary and give birth ... then she can also become a fierce Goddess and take life

dialogue: Teri maut hi mere zakhmon ka ilaaj hai
englishDialogue: Your death is the remedy to my wounds

dialogue: Yeh sirf ek safed sari nahin ... ek vidhwa ka gehna hai
englishDialogue: This is not just a white sari ... it is an ornament of a widow

dialogue: Main joh bhi kaam karta hoon ... apni sharton pe hi karta hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever work I do ... I only do it on my own terms

dialogue: Ek aurat apne seene mein agar daya aur mamta ka sagar rakhti hai ... toh nafrat ki aaisi aag bhi rakhti hai ... jiski choti si chingaari kisiko bhi jalakar rakh kar sakti hai
englishDialogue: If a woman keeps an ocean of compassion and affection in her heart ... then she also keeps the fire of hatred ... and even a small spark of which can burn anyone into ashes

dialogue: Sansar ne aurat ko maa ke roop mein dekha hai, bahen ke roop mein dekha hai, beti ke roop mein dekha hai ... magar chandi ke roop mein nahi dekha
englishDialogue: The universe has seen a woman in the form of a mother, in the form of a sister, in the form of a daughter ... but has never seen in the form of a fierce Goddess

dialogue: Tumhare liye sindoor ki keemat chahe kuch bhi na ho ... magar yeh ek suhagan ke liye anmol hai
englishDialogue: The value of vermilion for you may be nothing ... but for a married woman it is priceless

dialogue: Aurat ki sehan-shakti dharti ki tarah hoti hai ... joh har zulm seh leti hai, magar jab uske khroad ka jwalamukhi phatta hai ... toh woh sabko tabah kar deti hai
englishDialogue: The endurance of a woman is like the ground ... it bears every injustice, but when the volcano of her anger erupts ... then she destroys everyone

dialogue: Mera farz is vardi ka mohtaj nahi hai ... yeh vardi toh mehaz ek mayaan hai jis mein main apne farz ki talwar mehfooz rakhta hoon
englishDialogue: My duty is not dependent on my police uniform ... this uniform is just a scabbard in which I keep the sword of my duty secured

dialogue: Jis din kisi ghar ki deewaron ke kaan nikal aate hai ... us din us ghar ki buniyaad mein dimak lag jaati hai
englishDialogue: The day the walls of a house get their ears out ... that day termites enter the foundation of that house

dialogue: Shaadi karne ka sirf ek hi faiyda hai ... ki agar aadmi markar narak mein bhi jaaye ... toh lagta hai swarg mein aa gaya
englishDialogue: There is only one advantage of getting married ... that even if a person goes to hell after dying ... then it feels like heaven

dialogue: Tum gareeb ki izzat cheen sakte ho ... uski kismat nahi
englishDialogue: You can steal the dignity of a poor person ... but not his destiny

dialogue: Pati ek bank balance hota hai, ek tijori hota hai ... jis mein se paise nikaal nikaalkar gehne banwao, sareeyan khareedo, mauj karo mauj ... lekin unka dil rakhne ke liye kabhi unka sar dabao, kabhi unke pair dabao ... haala ki dil toh karta hai ki unka gala dabao, taaki jhanjhat hi khatam
englishDialogue: A husband is like a bank balance, like a vault ... from which you remove money and make jewellery, buys sarees, and have fun ... but to keep their heart sometimes we have to massage their head, their legs ... when we wish that we could simply press their neck, so that the problem is over once and for all

dialogue: Achchi soorat bhi kya buri shai hai ... jisne daali buri nazar daali
englishDialogue: A good looking face is also a bad thing ... whoever looks at it, looks with an evil eye

dialogue: Aadmi ke dil aur maut ka koi bharosa nahi hai ... kab, kispar, kis waqt aa jaye time nikalke ... bata nahi sakta
englishDialogue: A person's heart and death cannot be trusted ... when, on who, and at what time they come ... you can't say that

dialogue: Duniya ke rachaita Brahma ne har insaan ka bhagya likhkar hi usse is duniya mein bheja hai ... sukh aur dukh uske zaroori ang hai ... is baat ko samajhkar joh jeeye us hi ka naam zindagi hai
englishDialogue: Lord Brahma has written the destiny of every person that comes in this world ... happiness and sadness are important parts of it ... and those who understand that and live, know the real definition of life

dialogue: Duniya mein bhale aadmi sirf do hai ... ek woh joh mar gaya aur doosra woh joh abhi pehda hi nahi hua
englishDialogue: There are only two good people in this world ... one who has died and second who has not yet been born

dialogue: Mussal dekha mussal ... masal ke rakh doonga
englishDialogue: Have you seen my muscles ... I will smash you up

dialogue: Sab cheez time to time honi chahiye
englishDialogue: Everything must happen time to time

dialogue: Bhabhi hogi teri aur shaadi hogi meri
englishDialogue: She'll be your sister-in-law and I will get married

dialogue: Jab dil tootta hai toh uska asar seedha dimag par hota hai
englishDialogue: When the hearts breaks it directly affects the mind

dialogue: Crime master Gogo naam hai mera ... aankhen nikaal kar gotiyaan khelta hoon main
englishDialogue: My name is crime master Gogo ... I remove eyes and play marbles with them

dialogue: Shakal se to bidi ke kharkhane ka mazdoor lagta hai ... saala choosa hua aam
englishDialogue: From his face he looks like a laborer from a cigarette factory ... bloody sucked mango

dialogue: Jab tum Prem se milogi, toh Prem ke prem mein prem deewani ho jaogi ... meri premika
englishDialogue: When you will meet Prem, then you will fall in love with Prem ... my beloved

dialogue: Abhe kaika tu yaar ... bhaad mein gaya tera pyar
englishDialogue: What friend and you ... to hell with your love

dialogue: Yeh aap idhar idhar kya dekh rahe hain ... udhar idhar dekhiye, udhar idhar
englishDialogue: Why are you seeing here and here ... see there and here, there and here

dialogue: Galti se mistake ho gaya
englishDialogue: A mistake caused this mistake

dialogue: Bread ka baadshah aur omelet ka raja ... Bajaj ... hamara Bajaj
englishDialogue: The Mogul of bread and the King of omelet ... Bajaj ... our Bajaj

dialogue: Hilna nahin, hilna nahin ... nahin toh hila ke rakh doonga
englishDialogue: Don't move, don't move ... otherwise I will shake you up

dialogue: Bas guru, ab toh kardo Wah Wah productions shuru
englishDialogue: Enough master, now start Wah Wah productions

dialogue: Aapne bataya nahin aaj mera birthday hai
englishDialogue: You didn't tell me that today is my birthday

dialogue: Aap purush hi nahi ... mahapurush hai!
englishDialogue: You are not a man ... you're a great man!

dialogue: Aaya hoon, kuch to loot kar jaunga ... khandani chor hoon main, khandani ... Mogambo ka bhatija, Gogo
englishDialogue: Now that I have come, I will steal something and go ... I am from a family of thiefs ... I am Mogambo's nephew, Gogo

dialogue: Do dost ek pyale mein chai piyenge ... isse dosti badti hai
englishDialogue: Two friends will drink tea from one cup ... by doing so friendship grows

dialogue: Teja main hoon ... mark idhar hai
englishDialogue: I am Teja ... here is the mark

dialogue: Main Teja hoon kyun ki mera naam bhi Teja hain
englishDialogue: I am Teja because my name is also Teja

dialogue: Jab koi bachcha nahin sota, to uski maa kehti hai ki ... soja soja soja nahin toh Gogo aa jayega
englishDialogue: When a child does not sleep, then the mom says ... sleep sleep sleep otherwise Gogo will come

dialogue: Yeh Teja Teja kya hai ... yeh Teja Teja
englishDialogue: What is this Teja Teja ... this Teja Teja

dialogue: Main woh bala hoon, joh tum sabko kaccha chaba jaon ... aur dhakaar bhi na loon
englishDialogue: I am a person, who can chew you guys raw ... without taking a burp

dialogue: Mere naye pilan ke mutabik
englishDialogue: According to my new plan

dialogue: Shabash mere cheeteh ... shabash!
englishDialogue: Great work my cheetah ... great work!

dialogue: Woh joh hai woh main hoon ... aur main joh hoon woh woh hai
englishDialogue: She is what I am ... and I am what she is

dialogue: Dhak ki tiki, dhak ki tiki, dhak ki tiki ... dhaa!
englishDialogue: Let's dance, let's dance, let's dance ... dance!

dialogue: Bure waqt se badi khatarnak koi cheez nahi hai is duniya mein
englishDialogue: There is nothing more dangerous in this world than bad time

dialogue: Kagaz phadne se likhai mitt sakti hai lekin sachai nahi
englishDialogue: By tearing paper you can only erase the writing and not the truth

dialogue: Main jis file ko kholta hoon na ... woh mujrim ko jail mein bandh karne ke baad hi bandh karta hoon
englishDialogue: The file that I open ... closes only after I lock the criminal in jail

dialogue: Raajneeti ke mandi mein joh sabse sasti cheez bikti hai ... woh hai police
englishDialogue: The cheapest thing that sells in the market of politics ... is police

dialogue: Gunahghar us waqt tak mashoor rehta hai jab tak police dheel deti hai ... lekin jab police kanoon ki rassi kheenchti hai toh bade bade mujrimon ke gale mein phasi ka phanda hota hai
englishDialogue: A criminal remains famous until the police let's him lose ... but when the police pulls the rope of law then even the biggest of the criminals have gallows around their neck

dialogue: Aankh ka andha toh laathi ka sahara lekar tedhe-medhe raaston par bhi chal sakta hai ... lekin akal ka andha seedhe raaste par bhi thokar ka jaata hai
englishDialogue: A person blind from the eye can walk on a broken path with the support of a stick ... but a person blind from his mind stumbles even on a straight path

dialogue: Hum hai police ki naak ke baal, insaaf ki dhaal, havaldar Bankelal ... chal do rupai nikaal
englishDialogue: I'm a hair from police's nose, an armour of justice, I'm Sergeant Bankelal ... now come on give me two rupees

dialogue: Jab hum pehda hue the toh raat ke barah bajhe the ... aur raat ke barah bajhe sirf shaitan pehda hua karte hai
englishDialogue: It was 12 in the night when I was born ... and at 12 in the night only devils are born

dialogue: Main bhi kitna harami hoon, dono taraf dhol bajhata hoon ... udhar se maal kamata hoon, idhar se naam kamata hoon
englishDialogue: I'm such a scoundrel since I bang the drum from both sides ... from there I make money and from here I make my name

dialogue: Yahan ki fikar wahan ka khayal rakha hai ... badi ada se dono jahan sambhal rakha hai
englishDialogue: I've taken care of things over here and there ... with a lot of style I've taken care of both the worlds

dialogue: Doobara is basti mein Baba Bhatti jab aayega toh zulm ki woh haddi bankar aayega ... joh tumhare gale mein aaise phasegi ... ki na tum usse nighal sakoge, na tum usse ughal sakoge
englishDialogue: Whenever Baba Bhatti will return into this colony then he will come as a bone of cruelty ... which will get stuck in your throat in such a way that ... neither you'll be able to swallow it, nor you'll be able to spit it out

dialogue: Meri fitrat hai goongo se bulvana, bhairon ko sunane ke liye majboor kar dena aur jhooton ki zubaan se sach ughalvana
englishDialogue: It's in my nature to make dumb people speak, compel deaf people to hear and to remove the truth from the mouth of those who lie

dialogue: Pachees se tees baras tak ki umar ka pyar ... pukhta, sanjeeda, kisi bade maidan ke seene par behte hue dariya ki tarah gambhir aur shaant hota hai ... aur bees se ekkees ki umar mein ... kisi oonchi pahadi se girta hua apsar ki tarah gungunata hua, athkeliyan sa karta hua ... aur pandra se solah ki umar mein ... paakh, bechain, apne ird-gird ki har cheez se laparwah ... bilkul aapki tarah
englishDialogue: The love between the age of 25 to 30 ... is mature, serious, intense and calm like the sea sitting on a big ground ... and the love at the age of 20 to 21 ... is like water singing, playing and falling from a tall mountain ... and the love at the age of 15 to 16 ... is pure, restless, careless of the things around it ... just like you

dialogue: Hum mein toh apno ne loota, gairon mein kahan dum tha ... meri kishti thi doobi wahan, jahan pani kam tha
englishDialogue: My own people robbed me, others did not have the courage ... my boat drowned in a place, where the water was less

dialogue: Yeh desh sirf do hi logon pe hasta hai ... hijhron par aur hum policewaalon par ... kyun ki nah hi woh kuch kar sakte hai, aur nah hi hum kuch kar sakte hai
englishDialogue: This country only laughs on two people ... on eunuchs and on policemen like us ... because neither they can do anything, and neither can we do anything

dialogue: Dilwale toh bahut dekhe, lekin pyar mein joh pagal ho jaye ... aise dilwale ko aaj pehli baar dekha
englishDialogue: I have seen many hearty people, but someone who will go mad in love ... that hearty person I am seeing for the first time

dialogue: Hum Hindustani policewaale jahanum tak us shaksh ka peecha nahi chhodte ... joh is vardi ki beizzati karta hai
englishDialogue: We Indian policemen follow a person all the way to hell ... who humiliates this uniform

dialogue: Yeh aankhen, yeh chehra, yeh noor ... insaan ho ya pari ho tum
englishDialogue: These eyes, this face, this beauty ... are you a human or a fairy

dialogue: Mujhe aaina na dikhao, ismein koi pagal nazar aata hai ... yeh main nahin, ismein sara jahan nazar aata hai
englishDialogue: Don't show me the mirror, I see some mad person in it ... it's not me, I see the whole world in it

dialogue: Pyar toh usne kiya, humne to bas dillagi ki
englishDialogue: He fell in love, I just did pleasantry

dialogue: Mohabbat mere dost, aag bhi lagati hai un dilon ko ... jin mein mohabbat ke chirag jalte hai
englishDialogue: Love my friend, puts fire in those hearts ... in which the lamps of love light

dialogue: Yeh duniya hum mein milne nahi degi ... lekin main bhi ab is duniya ko jeene nahi doonga
englishDialogue: This world will not let us meet ... but even I won't let this world live

dialogue: Main bahar dhamki dekar aaya hoon ki joh aadmi pehle andar aayega ... main uski taange todh doonga
englishDialogue: I have given a warning outside that the person who comes in first ... I will break his legs

dialogue: Amir toh duniya mein nafrat hi faylata hai ... par gareeb pyar laata hai
englishDialogue: The rich spread hatred in the world ... but the poor bring love

dialogue: Uska toh main aisa hashar karoonga ... ki sunne waalo ki rooh kaanp uthegi
englishDialogue: I will treat him in such a way ... that the soul of the people who hear about it will tremble

dialogue: Daulat itni daulatmand nahi joh sacha pyar khareed sake
englishDialogue: Money is not that wealthy that it can buy true love

dialogue: Ekka bhale hi sabse bada ho ... magar rani hamesha raja ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: Even if the ace is the highest card ... but still the queen always belongs to the king

dialogue: Falak ko zid hai jahan bijliyan girane ki ... hum mein bhi zid hai wahin apna aashiyan banane ki
englishDialogue: Where the sky is stubborn to throw lightning ... even I'm stubborn to make my mansion over there

dialogue: Judai ke dard ka mol kabhi chukaya nahi ja sakta ... usse sirf samjha jaata hai
englishDialogue: You can never pay a price for the pain of separation ... you can only understand it

dialogue: Main tumhe bada aadmi samajhta tha ... magar tum sirf amir nikle ... main tumhe apna bhai samjha ... magar tum sirf is shehar ke bhai nikle
englishDialogue: I considered you as a big person ... but you only proved to be rich ... I considered you as my brother ... but you turned out to be a rowdy person for this city

dialogue: Humne wahan apna khoon bahaya jahan tera pasina nikla ... bade bhai se bhi badhkar samjha tujhe ... par saale tu toh bada kamina nikla
englishDialogue: I shed my blood where you were sweating ... I considered you even bigger than a big brother ... but bloody you turned out to be a big rascal

dialogue: Isne tumhe dekha angle badal badalke ... aur tumne isse maara sandal badal badalke
englishDialogue: He looked at you from different different angles ... and you hate him with different different sandals

dialogue: Jhoot ek vaishaya ki tarah hai ... jisse lakh parde mein rakho, magar uski asliyat nahi chupti
englishDialogue: A lie is like a prostitute ... no matter how much you keep it behind the curtain, you cannot hide it's reality

dialogue: Woh copy hi kya jiska koi cover na ho ... aur woh ladki hi kya jiska koi lover na ho
englishDialogue: What good is a book which doesn't have a cover ... and what good is a girl who doesn't have a lover

dialogue: Woh mooch hi kya jisse phera na jaye ... aur woh husn hi kya jisse cheda na jaye
englishDialogue: What good is a mustache which is not turned ... and what good is a beautiful body which is not teased

dialogue: Jhoot ke haathon se khodi gayi kabar mein sachchai dafnayi nahi jayegi
englishDialogue: Truth will not be buried in a grave which is dug by the hands of a lie

dialogue: Court ka ghar mein deri hai ... magar Bandra aur Andheri nahi
englishDialogue: Delays are there in a court house ... but it doesn't have Bandra and Andheri in it

dialogue: Log kehte hai khoobsurat ladkiyan jab jhoot bolti hai ... toh aur bhi khoobsurat lagti hai
englishDialogue: People say that when beautiful girls lie ... then look more beautiful

dialogue: Kyun ... hum aapke hain kaun?
englishDialogue: Why ... who am I to you?

dialogue: Aaj pehli baar koi ladki ... hamari car ke front seat pe behti hai
englishDialogue: Today for the first time a girl ... is sitting on the front seat of my car

dialogue: Zindagi ki khasiyat hai yeh kabhi jhukti nahi ... saanse ruk jati hai magar zindagi rukti nahi
englishDialogue: It is the specialty of life that it never bows down ... breathe stops but life never stops

dialogue: Roop rang mein gori ho chahe kaali ho ... khushnaseeb woh jija hai jiski saali ho
englishDialogue: Whether she is fair or dark ... fortunate is a man who has a sister-in-law

dialogue: Bane chahe dushman zamana hamara, salamat rahe dostana hamara ... na bechre marke bhi hum doston, hum mein dosti ki kasam doston ... pata koi pooche toh kehte hai hum, ek dujhe ke dil mein rehte hai hum ... nahi aur koi thikana hamara, salamat rahe dostana hamara
englishDialogue: Even if the world is our enemy, may our friendship be immortal ... friends we won't be separated even after we die, swear on our friendship ... if someone ask for our address we say, we live in each other's hearts ... we have no other place, may our friendship be immortal

dialogue: Jab hum aapse kuch poochna chahe toh aap hum mein rokti hai ... aur jab chup ho jaye toh tokti hai
englishDialogue: When I try to ask you something you stop me ... and when I keep quiet you invoke me

dialogue: Arre kaka main toh kaka ban gaya
englishDialogue: Oh uncle, I have become an uncle

dialogue: Jab tumhari bhatakti hui rooh tumhare mulk pahunche ... toh ek ek shaitan se kehna ki dobara hamare desh ki taraf aankhen uthane ki jurrat na kare
englishDialogue: When your lost soul reaches your country ... then tell each and every devil that they better don't dare to even look at our country

dialogue: Uthho jawaan-e-watan, bandhe huye sar se kafan ... uthho dakkhan ki aur se, Gang-o-Jaman ki aur se ... Punjab ke dil se uthho, Satluj ke sahil se uthho ... awaaz do hum ek hai, hum ek hai, hum ek hai
englishDialogue: Rise up the youth of the country, let's tie a shroud on our head ... rise from the south, rise from the rivers of Ganga and Jamuna ... rise from the heart of Punjab, rise from the banks of Satluj ... and shout that we are one, we are one, we are one

dialogue: Yeh thappad tune mujhe nahi apni naukri ke mooh par maara hai ... apne khandan ke ek ek aadmi ki khushiyon par maara hai ... apni zindagi par maara hai
englishDialogue: You did not slap me but instead you've slapped your job ... you've slapped the happiness of each and every member of your family ... you've slapped your life

dialogue: Ek baar jab rishtey kho jaate hai ... toh woh dhoondne se bhi nahi milte
englishDialogue: Once a relationship is lost ... then you can't find it even by searching for it

dialogue: Girte hain sher savaar hi maidan-e-jung mein ... woh tiflya kya girega joh ghutno ke bal chale
englishDialogue: Only fighters who rides the tigers in a battlefield have a chance of falling ... but cowards who choose to walk on their knees will never fall

dialogue: Jahan kanoon ke haath pahunchne mein der ho jaye ... wahan kanoon ki laat pahunch jaya karti hai
englishDialogue: Where the hands of the law take time to reach ... there the legs of the law reach in time

dialogue: Jitni himmat mujh mein goli chalane ki hai ... usse kahi zyada himmat goli khane ki hai
englishDialogue: The amount of courage that I have to fire a bullet ... much more than that I have the courage to take a bullet

dialogue: Sher jab ghayal ho jaata hai ... toh shikari ke liye maut ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: When a tiger gets wounded ... he then becomes death for the hunter

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein dushman khatam nahi hote ... mehmaano ki tarah ek jaata hai toh doosra chala aata hai
englishDialogue: Enemies never end in our business ... like guests one goes and another one comes along

dialogue: Tutisha ka record hai ... uske tamachon ke nishaan gaal par se mitt jaate hai ... lekin dimaag par se nahi mittate
englishDialogue: It's a record of Tutisha ... that the marks from his slaps may get erased from the cheeks ... but they can't be erased from the mind

dialogue: Kutte ki tarah jeene ki aadat padhi hai sabko
englishDialogue: Everyone has become habituated to live life as a dog

dialogue: Aa gaye meri maut ka tamasha dekhne
englishDialogue: So you have come to see the scene of my death

dialogue: Saale apne khud ke desh mein ek sui nahin bana sakte ... aur hamara desh todne ka sapna dekhte hain
englishDialogue: Bloody they can't make a needle in their own country ... and they dream of destroying our country

dialogue: Yeh Musalman ka khoon yeh Hindu ka khoon ... bata is mein Musalman ka kaunsa Hindu ka kaunsa, bata!
englishDialogue: This is a Muslim's blood and this is a Hindu's blood ... now tell me which one is Muslim's and which one is Hindu's, tell me!

dialogue: Upar waala bhi upar se dekhta hoga toh usse sharam aati hogi ... sochta hoga maine sabse khoobsurat cheez banayi thi, insaan ... neeche dekha toh sab keede ban gaye ... keede!
englishDialogue: Even God must be ashamed when he sees from the top ... he must be thinking that he made the most beautiful thing, human ... and when he saw down they all became bugs ... bugs!

dialogue: Hum bhale hi upar waale ko alag alag naam se pukarte hai ... lekin hamara dharam ek hai mazhab ek hai ... insaniyat
englishDialogue: We may call God with different different names ... but our religion is one ... humanity

dialogue: Tumse toh woh vaishyan achchi hoti hai joh bechti zaroor hai, magar apna jism bechti hai ... apne desh ko, apni aatma ko, apne imaan ko nahi bechti
englishDialogue: A prostitute is better than you because even though she sells, she sells her body ... and not her country, not her soul, not her dignity

dialogue: Hum tumhe aaise jalayenge ... ke tere chahne waalo ko Ganga mein bahane ke liye teri raakh bhi naseeb nahi hogi
englishDialogue: I will burn you in such a way that ... your near ones will not even get your ashes to put them in the river Ganga

dialogue: Insaaf nahi mangne se milta hai aur nahi cheenne se ... aaj toh insaaf bikta hai, sirf bikta hai
englishDialogue: You don't get justice by asking and neither by snatching ... today justice is sold, only sold

dialogue: Tumhare napaak kadam aage mat badaoo ... todhkar tumhare gaale mein pehna denge
englishDialogue: Don't bring your unholy feet forward ... we will break them and wear them on your necks

dialogue: Kuch parinde aaise bhi hote hai joh halaat ke pinjre mein qaid toh hote hai magar majboor nahi hote ... unki baazuon mein itni taqat hoti hai ki woh pinjra samet udh jaate hai
englishDialogue: There are some birds who are locked in the cage of situation, but they are not helpless ... they have so much strength in their wings that they fly away with the cage itself

dialogue: Kathin pariksha mein pass ho jaana meri buri aadat hai
englishDialogue: It is my bad habit to pass in tough exams

dialogue: Jab dus kamine marte hai toh ek kutta pehda hota hai ... jab sau kutte marte hai toh ek soovar pehda hota hai ... aur jab ek hazaar soovar marte hai toh ek bhadwa pehda hota hai ... aur jab ek lakh bhadwe marte hai tab tujh jaisa ek ganda neta pehda hota hai
englishDialogue: When 10 assholes die then one dog is born ... when 100 dogs die then one pig is born ... when 1000 pigs die then one pimp is born ... and when 100,000 pimps die then one dirty politician like you is born

dialogue: Yeh bhashan nahi yeh meri warning hai ... aur meri warning tumhare is cigarette case ke upar likhi hui warning ki tarah nahi ... jisse tum bhoolkar cigarette ke kash lagaya karte ho ... meri warning kanoon ke kitaab ke us full stop ki tarah hai ... jiske baad kuch bhi karne ya sochne ki jagah nahi bachti
englishDialogue: This is not a speech, it's my warning ... and my warning is not like the warning that is written on your cigarette case ... which you forget and smoke the cigarette away ... my warning is like the full stop in the book of law ... after which there is no room left to do or think anything

dialogue: Agar tu ghar mein chupa raha toh chuhe ki maut maara jayega ... aur agar bahar nikal aaya toh geedar ki maut ... bol tujhe kaunsi maut chahiye?
englishDialogue: If you hide inside the house then you'll die a mouse's death ... and if you come out then you'll die a jackal's death ... which death do you want?

dialogue: Log toh sirf rupaiya aur izzat par daaka dalte hai ... magar tumne hamare vishvas par daaka daala hai
englishDialogue: People only steal money and honour ... but you have stolen our trust

dialogue: Joh log waqt ke dhaare mein kagaz ki naav ki tarah beh jaate hai ... unhe ek mamuli si lehar bhi dooba deti hai
englishDialogue: Those who flow away like a paper boat in the stream of time ... they get drowned even with a small wave

dialogue: Vidyarthi woh hote hai joh vidya ka arth nikaalte hai ... magar aap log toh vidya ki arthi nikaal rahe hai
englishDialogue: Students are those who find out the meaning of knowledge ... but you guys are taking the life out of knowledge

dialogue: Mere nasson mein khoon ke saath saath barood bhi behta hai ... aur aaj tujhe is barood ke dhamake bhi sunne padenge
englishDialogue: Gunpowder also flows in my veins along with blood ... and today you'll have to hear the blasts of this gunpowder

dialogue: Aadmi ke paas jis prakaar ka astra shastra ho ... ussi prakaar ka yudh ladna chahiye ... tabhi usko safalta milti hai
englishDialogue: The kind of weapons that a person has ... he should fight a war of that kind itself ... only then he gets success

dialogue: Main tumhare jism ko vardi ki jagah zakhmon ka libaaz pehna doonga ... aur phir tum dard se itna tadpoge ke uske baad maut ko bhi chakhoge toh yahi kahoge ke ... maaza nahi aaya
englishDialogue: Instead of this uniform I'll put the attire of wounds on your body ... and then you'll flutter so much with pain that after that even if you taste death, then you'll say ... it wasn't fun

dialogue: Duty ek aaisi cheez hai joh kabhi kabhi rote huye bhi nibhani padti hai
englishDialogue: Duty is one such thing, sometimes that you have to fulfill even if you are crying

dialogue: Imaandari woh ganja sar hai jispar noton ke baal kabhi ugh hi nahi sakte ... thodi si baimaani ki tel ki malish karte rehna chahiye
englishDialogue: Honesty is a bald head on which the hairs of money can never grow ... hence you should always do some oil massage of cheating

dialogue: Woh shaadi hi kya teri dawat nahi jis mein ... aur woh aag hi kya teri soorat nahi jis mein
englishDialogue: What good is a wedding that doesn't invite you for the feast ... and what good is the fire that doesn't have your face in it

dialogue: Zaat duniya mein sirf do tarah ki hoti hai ... ek woh joh aasoon peeta hai, ek woh joh khoon peeta hai ... ek woh joh insaaniyat ko aabad karta hai, ek woh joh insaaniyat ko barbaad karta hai
englishDialogue: There are only two types of caste in the world ... one that drinks the tears, and other that drinks the blood ... one that flourishes humanity, and other that destroys humanity

dialogue: Joh imaandaron se gaddari karega ... woh gaddaron se imaandari karega
englishDialogue: One who cheats with honest people ... he will be honest with cheaters

dialogue: Tumhe is baat ka koi haq na pahunchta ki police ki farz ki Ganga joh ki kanoon ki Gangotri se nikalti hai ... usse tum apni gandi aadaton ke gutter mein dal do
englishDialogue: You have no right to put into gutter of your bad habits ... the Ganga river of police duty which passes through the Gangotri town of law

dialogue: Main nafrat ke mohron se dushmani ka shatranj ussi ki bisaat pe khelonga ... aur aaisi maat doonga, aaisi maat doonga ki maut bhi roo padegi
englishDialogue: I will play game of enmity with the pawns of hatred on his chess board ... and I will defeat him in such a way, that even death will cry

dialogue: Gundon ka rakhail kabhi gareebon ka rakhwaala nahi ban sakta
englishDialogue: A mistress of goons can never be the protector of the poor

dialogue: Jab logon ki bahaduri baanjh ho jaati hai ... tabhi Kapali jaise gunde pehda hote hai
englishDialogue: When the courage of people becomes sterile ... then goons like Kapali are born

dialogue: Tum meri zindagi mein full stop toh kya comma bhi nahi laga sake ... lekin main tumhari zindagi mein full stop zaroor lagaonga
englishDialogue: You couldn't even apply a comma in my life, let go a full stop ... but I will definitely apply a full stop in your life

dialogue: Har woh kadam joh kanoon todne ke liye aage badega ... main usse apahij kar doonga
englishDialogue: Every step that comes forward to break the law ... I will make that step handicapped

dialogue: Tum ghadi ki keemat toh jaante ho ... magar waqt ki keemat nahi jaante
englishDialogue: You know the value of a watch ... but you don't know the value of time

dialogue: Chola aur kursi badal jaane se aadmi ki janam kundli nahi badalti
englishDialogue: By changing the clothes and seat, a person's birth horoscope doesn't change

dialogue: Agar aap log yeh chahte hai ... ki aap logon ki khuddi ko mittane ke liye agar gundon ki khudai bhi aa jaye aur mitta na sake ... toh aap logon ko khuddar banna padega
englishDialogue: If you people want that ... even if the godliness of goons tries to erase your self respect and is not able to do it ... then you people will have to become self dependent

dialogue: Jab shehar ki taqdeer harami ho jaati hai ... tab Kapali jaisa ek haramzada pehda hota hai
englishDialogue: When the destiny of a city goes bad ... then a bastard like Kapali is born

dialogue: Galatfahmi mein jeene waale ... asliyat mein mar jaate hai
englishDialogue: Those who live in misapprehension ... die in reality

dialogue: Vasuli mein hum rupaye nahi ... samne waale ke maathe par pasine ki boondein ginte hai
englishDialogue: I don't count money when it comes to recovery ... I count the number of drops of sweat on the person in front of me

dialogue: Hum hai maut ki woh express ... duniya jise kehti hai Madam X
englishDialogue: I'm that express of death ... which the world calls as Madam X

dialogue: Main uske jism par itne zakhm kar doonga ... ki sirf zakhm hi zakhm nazar aayenge ... jism nahi
englishDialogue: I'll make so many wounds on her body ... that only wounds will be seen ... and not her body

dialogue: Shikaar ke waqt sherni jis zameen par apne khunkhar panje rakhti hai ... us zameen ko bhi uske chalne ka ehsaas nahi hota ... ehsaas tab hota hai jab shikaar kiya hua khoon zameen par bikhar jaata hai
englishDialogue: During the time of hunting the place where the tigress puts her dangerous claws ... even the ground there doesn't feel her walking ... but the ground feels it when the blood of the prey spreads around

dialogue: Hamari saanson ki awaaz sunkar toh maut ke farishtay bhi gabrakar bhaag jaate hai
englishDialogue: Listening to the sound of my breathing even the angels of death get scared and run away

dialogue: Koi hum mein maarkar hamara anth kya karega ... mitne waale nahi hai hum, koi hamara khaatma kya karega ... zindagi ko apni qaid mein liye ghoomte hai hum ... koi zindagi se hum mein juda kya karega
englishDialogue: No one can kill me and put me to an end ... I'm not someone who can be erased, no one can put me to an end ... I roam around keeping life in my captivity ... no one can separate me from life

dialogue: Yeh kanoon ke woh baap hai joh apni duty ko apni gaud mein jhula jhulakar, usse pyari pyari lori sunakar sula dete hai ... aur aapke noton ka pankha banakar usse thandi thandi hawa dete hai
englishDialogue: He is that father of the law who cuddles his duty in his arms, sings a lullaby to put it to sleep ... and makes a fan out of your money bills to blow cold air on it

dialogue: Humse dushmani modh lekar tumne zehareelay bichhoo ka dank apne shareer mein gaadh liya hai ... aur bichhoo ke dank se aadmi marta nahi hai ... zindagi bhar tadapta aur sisakta rehta hai ... tum bhi jab tak jeeoge tadapte aur sisakte hi rahoge
englishDialogue: By making me your enemy you have buried the bite of a poisonous scorpion in your body ... and a person doesn't die from the bite of a scorpion ... he just wriggles and flounders for his entire life ... and even you will wriggle and flounder until you are alive

dialogue: Kanoon hamari giraftari ka plan baad mein banata hai ... hum usse todne ke raaste pehle hi bana lete hai
englishDialogue: Before the law plans about my arrest ... I create a way of breaking that

dialogue: Jab bhi hamare samne koi bewakoof akalmandi ka taj pehenne ki jurrat karta hai ... toh taj toh uske haathon mein hota hai magar pehenne ke liye uska sar nahi hota
englishDialogue: Whenever a fool tries to wear the crown of smartness in front of me ... then he may have the crown in his hands but he won't have the head to wear it

dialogue: Hamare paas duniya par nazar rakhne waali itni aankhen hai ... jitni shayad aasman par sitaare bhi na ho
englishDialogue: I have so many eyes to keep a watch on the world ... that may be there are not even that many stars in the sky

dialogue: Dimaag ki aankh se dekhne waale ... chehre ki aankhon ka bahut kam istamal karte hai
englishDialogue: Those who look from the eyes of the brain ... very rarely use the eyes of the face

dialogue: Jis tarah yamraj ko sirf yamlok hi dekh sakta hai ... ussi tarah Madam X ki shakal bhi sirf uska apna samraj hi dekh sakta hai ... joh bhi hamari jhalak dekhne ki jurrat karta hai ... woh jalkar aaise dhuan ho jaata hai ki na zameen ko uski khaak milti hai, na hawaon ko uski raakh
englishDialogue: Just like only the place after death can see the god of death ... just like that the face of Madam X can only be seen by her kingdom ... the one who tries to get my glimpse ... he turns into smoke in a way that, neither the ground gets his body nor the air gets his ashes

dialogue: Yeh maut bhi kitni ajeeb cheez hai ... insaan usse mehsoos karte hi, zindagi ke aanchal mein chanchal balak ki tarah tadapne lagta hai
englishDialogue: Death is such a strange thing ... the moment a person feels it, he starts to wriggle like a playful child in the lap of life

dialogue: Dobara agar koi chaal chalne ki koshish ki toh main nahi bolunga ... meri AK47 bolegi
englishDialogue: If you try to play another ploy then I won't speak ... my AK47 (gun) will speak

dialogue: Barood ke dher par beth kar aag ka khel nahi khelte
englishDialogue: One should not play the game of fire when sitting on a pile of gunpowder

dialogue: Aankhen andar ka haal bata deti hai ... sirf padne wali nazar honi chahiye
englishDialogue: Eyes tell you the condition within ... one only needs a vision to read it

dialogue: Mujrim maa ke pet se janam nahin leta ... usse janam deta hai tumhara kanoon, tumhari police
englishDialogue: A criminal is not born from a mothers womb ... your law, your police gives birth to him

dialogue: Yeh toh aapne lakh rupaiye ki baat kahi haan
englishDialogue: The point you have said is worth one lakh Rupees

dialogue: Is desh ke shehar shehar, gaon gaon mein, yahan tak ki ghar ghar ke andar nashe ko pohchane ki lagan honi chahiye hum mein
englishDialogue: We should have the dedication to get intoxication into every city, every town in fact every home of this country

dialogue: Najayaz kaam karna meri aadat nahi
englishDialogue: I don't do illegitimate things

dialogue: Waqt sabse bada marham hota hai
englishDialogue: Time is the biggest medicine

dialogue: Apno ko milne ke liye time nikalna padta hai
englishDialogue: One has to find time to meet near ones

dialogue: Shayad aaj tak aisa koi mila hi nahin ... jise main apne zakhm dikha sakon
englishDialogue: May be I didn't find anyone till today ... to whom I could show my wounds

dialogue: Hamari tarakki ke raaste mein joh bhi aayega uski zubaan band karni hogi ... rupaiyon se nahin toh goli se
englishDialogue: Whoever comes in between the path to our success we need to keep them quiet ... if not by money then by a bullet

dialogue: Mard ko abaad bhi aurat karti hai aur barbaad bhi aurat karti hai
englishDialogue: A man succeeds because of a woman and a man gets destroyed because of a woman

dialogue: Bakra khud kasai ke ghar ke samne jaakar kathak karne laga ... toh use kaun bacha sakta hai?
englishDialogue: If the goat himself goes and dances in front of the slaughterer's house ... then who can save him?

dialogue: Mujhe duniya ka sabse daulatmand aur sabse shaktishali insaan banna hai
englishDialogue: I want to become the most richest and the most powerful man of the world

dialogue: Insaan ki sabse badi guarantee uska apna zameer hota hai
englishDialogue: The biggest guarantee of a human is his own conscience

dialogue: Ek baar jab main faisla kar leta hoon toh, joh sochta hoon woh karta hoon ... joh chahta hoon woh paata hoon
englishDialogue: Once I make a decision, I do whatever I think ... I achieve whatever I want

dialogue: Tumhari gardan ke naap ka phanda tayyar kar liya hai maine
englishDialogue: I have prepared a hangman's knot for the size of your neck

dialogue: Chaal pe chaal chalne ki meri aadat hai
englishDialogue: It is my habit to play ploy after ploy

dialogue: Wahi jam jao, varna iski laash postmortem ke bhi layak nahi rahegi
englishDialogue: Stay right there, otherwise his dead body will not be even in a condition for postmortem

dialogue: Kal ke baad is mulk ke nasal ki ragoon mein khoon nahin ... hamara becha hua zehar daudega
englishDialogue: From tomorrow blood won't be running in the veins of the breed of this country ... our sold poison will be running

dialogue: Hume sirf ek take milta hai, sirf ek take ... aur agar uss ek take mein hamse koi galati ho jati hai ... toh maut ke samne zindagi ghutne take deti hai
englishDialogue: We only get one take, just one take ... and if we do a mistake in that one take ... then life bends down on its knees in front of death

dialogue: Pata nahin kis gali kis nukkad kis chaurahe par ... kis goli kis chaku par mera naam likha hai
englishDialogue: I don't know in which lane, which corner, which crossing ... on which bullet, which knife my name is written

dialogue: Pyar ki bhasha toh achche achche patthar dilon ko phigla deti hai
englishDialogue: The language of love can melt the biggest of the stone hearted people

dialogue: Film ho ya haqeeqat ... jab ladkiyo ko bachana hota hai ... toh hero hi aata hai
englishDialogue: Be it a film or reality ... when it comes to saving girls ... only the hero comes

dialogue: Raat ki samasya ... insaan ko raat ko hi suljhani chahiye
englishDialogue: The problems of night ... must be solved in the night itself

dialogue: Inspector saab kanoon aur farz ke rakhwaale baad mein banna ... pehle dil ke rakhwaale bano
englishDialogue: Mr. Policeman you should become the protector of law and duty ... after you become the protector of the heart

dialogue: Sachchai ke aasoon se dil pighla karte hai ... tum jaise patthar nahi
englishDialogue: The tears of truth can melt hearts ... not stones like you

dialogue: Tum ek achche khandan ki bigdi hui nasamajh aulad ho
englishDialogue: You are a silly and aimless child belonging to a good family

dialogue: Chaand se maathe par chaandi jaise pasina kyun?
englishDialogue: Why are you sweating on your moon like forehead?
