dialogue: Zindagi woh zalim imtehan hai joh bagair ittala diye aa jaata hai ... aur manhoos haadse bagair ijazat zindagi ko apni lapet mein le lete hai
englishDialogue: Life is that ruthless exam which comes without any notification ... and inauspicious events take life in their arms without any permission

dialogue: Yeh zindagi thode aasoon aur thodi hassi se milkar bani hai ... aankh se tapke hue har aasoon mein aane waali khushi ki kiran chupi hai ... jeevan ka sangeet chupa hai
englishDialogue: Life is made with a combination of little tears and little laughter ... in every teardrop that falls from the eyes there is hidden a ray of happiness ... there is hidden the music of life

dialogue: Yeh toh sirf hamare yaar hai ... aur hum janam jaat se hi gaddar hai
englishDialogue: They are only our friends ... and we are traitors since birth

dialogue: Hum business karne se pehle aadmi aur maal dono ki khabar nikaal lete hai
englishDialogue: I check the background about the person and goods both before I do business with them

dialogue: Waise zinda rehne ka mujhe bhi koi shauk nahi ... aakhri safar tumhare saath hi sahi
englishDialogue: Even I have no interest in living anymore ... so why not make my last trip with you

dialogue: Dukh chupane ke kamaal ko hassi kehte hai
englishDialogue: A magical way of hiding sorrow is called laughter

dialogue: Zakhm bhar bhi jaye ... magar nishaan baki reh jaate hai
englishDialogue: Even if the wounds fill up ... the marks stay over

dialogue: Pyar karna koi kamaal nahi hai ... kamaal toh yeh hai ki doosre tumse pyar karne par majboor ho jaye
englishDialogue: To love is not a big thing ... the big thing is when others are compelled to love you

dialogue: Sharaab ek aaisi cheez hai ... joh ameeron ka shaunk aur gareebon ki zaroorat hai
englishDialogue: Alcohol is one such thing ... that is a hobby of the rich and necessity of the poor

dialogue: Mohabbatein karna aur mohabbaton ko jeetna ... yeh toh hamara kaam hai
englishDialogue: To love and to win love ... is my work

dialogue: Dil se nikli awaaz dil tak zaroor pahunch jaati hai
englishDialogue: A sound from the heart definitely reaches a heart

dialogue: Jab dillagi dil ki lagi ban jaati hai ... toh patthar dil bhi pighal jaate hai
englishDialogue: When pleasantry turns into love ... then even the stone hearted people melt

dialogue: Roohein toh kamzarf aur buzdil insaanon ki kaapti hai
englishDialogue: Only the souls of ungenerous and the cowards shiver

dialogue: Train mein safar kiya, plane mein safar kiya, caron mein safar kiya ... magar kisi bhi safar ka itna mazaa nahi aaya jitna in baahon ke safar mein aa raha hai
englishDialogue: Traveled in a train, traveled in a plane, traveled in cars ... but no journey was as much fun as this journey in your arms is

dialogue: Pyar ka badla pyar aur dosti ka badla dosti ... yeh mera usool hai
englishDialogue: Revenge of love is love and revenge of friendship is friendship ... this is my rule

dialogue: Main kaam ko puja maanta hoon ... aur kaam karne wali jagah ko swarg
englishDialogue: I believe that work is worship ... and the workplace is heaven

dialogue: Zindagi aur maut ka faisla toh uparwaale ki kalam se hua karta hai ... aap jaise rayeeso ki bandook se nahi
englishDialogue: The decision between life and death happens with the pen of God ... not with the gun of rich people like you

dialogue: Kichad uchhalne par kichad hi milta hai
englishDialogue: If you splash on mud you will get mud only

dialogue: Ghoda jitna bhi adyal ho ... uspar savari karne ka utna hi mazaa aata hai
englishDialogue: The more the horse is restive ... the more is the fun to ride on it

dialogue: Chaddi mein kar dena, dhoti mein kar dena ... magar raaste mein kabhi nahi karna
englishDialogue: Do it in your shorts, do it in your loincloth ... but never do it on the road

dialogue: Naukar maalik par ehsaan nahi ... sirf namak ka farz ada karta hai
englishDialogue: A servant does not do a favor on his boss ... he only fulfills his duty

dialogue: Is dharti par aisa koi ghoda paida nahi hua ... jiski savari main nahi kar sakta
englishDialogue: There is no horse born on the face of this earth ... whom I cannot ride

dialogue: Joh insaan wafaadar aur gaddar mein fark nahi samajh sakta ... woh maalik hone ke layak nahi ho sakta
englishDialogue: One who does not understand the difference between faithful and traitor ... is not worthy of being a boss

dialogue: Bhairav Singh jahan jata hai ... tabaahi ka toofan aata hai
englishDialogue: Wherever Bhairav Singh goes ... there comes a storm of destruction

dialogue: Buzurgo ka aashirwad hi duniya ki sabse badi daulat hai
englishDialogue: The blessings of elders is the biggest wealth in the world

dialogue: Kichad toh kisi bhi sabun se dhul sakta hai ... lekin tumhare dimaag mein joh amiri ka kichad bhara hai na ... woh kisi sabun se nahi dhul sakta
englishDialogue: Mud can be washed by any soap ... but the mud of riches that is stuffed in your mind ... cannot be washed with any soap

dialogue: Aajkal logon ko aisa accountant chahiye ... joh hisaab barabar bhi rakhe aur zaroorat aane par hisaab barabar bhi kar sake
englishDialogue: Nowadays people want such an accountant ... who can keep the accounts properly and also when the time comes, can fix the accounts

dialogue: Zindagi sirf do paon se bhaagti hai ... aur maut hazaaron haathon se uska rasta rokti hai
englishDialogue: Life runs only on two legs ... and death blocks its way with a 1000 hands

dialogue: Jisne tumhari maang ka sindoor mittaya hai ... tumhari kasam main usse is duniya se mitta doonga
englishDialogue: The one who has erased the vermilion from your hair partition ... I swear on you that I will erase him from this world

dialogue: Gareebon ke haath ki bani hui cheez ameeron ko achchi nahi lagti
englishDialogue: Rich people don't like the things that are made by the hands of poor people

dialogue: Kisi mazloom aurat ki izzat bachane ke liye main apni jaan de bhi sakta hoon ... aur kisi ki jaan le bhi sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I can give my life to save the honour of a victimized woman ... and I can even take the life of someone

dialogue: Aurat ke haath mein churi aur bandook bilkul achchi nahi lagti
englishDialogue: A knife and a gun don't look good at all in a woman's hand

dialogue: Meetha khoon kadva mizaaj
englishDialogue: Sweet blood but sour temperament

dialogue: Jab main tujhe maaronga ... toh teri awaaz ki goonj sare shehar ko sunai degi
englishDialogue: When I kill you ... then the sound of your voice will be heard by the entire city

dialogue: Joh shikaar khud chalkar sher ki gaar mein aata hai ... woh achchi tarah janta hai ki sher ke daant kaise todhe jaate hai
englishDialogue: A prey that himself walks into the region of the tiger ... knows exactly how to break the teeth of the tiger

dialogue: Joh ghar se kafan baandkar nikalte hai ... woh apna nahi dushman ka naam yaad rakhte hai
englishDialogue: Those who leave the house wearing a shroud ... they remember their enemies name and not theirs

dialogue: Jinki aankhon mein manzilon ke khwab hote hai ... woh shikast aur haar ki baatein nahi kiya karte
englishDialogue: Those who have the dreams of destinations in their eyes ... they don't talk about defeat and losing

dialogue: Jinhe tum aasoon samajhkar pochna chahti ho ... woh aasoon nahi tezaab hai
englishDialogue: The things that you want to wipe thinking they are tears ... it is infact acid and not tears

dialogue: Mera rasta kaante ki koshish mat karna haraamzade ... varna main tumhari zindagi ki lakeerein kaat doonga
englishDialogue: Don't try to cut my path you scoundrel ... or else I'll cut the lines of your life

dialogue: Jis shareer mein barso se nafrat aur inteqam ka barood sulagh raha hai ... usse choone ki bhi koshish mat karna ... cheetre udh jayenge tum sab logon ke
englishDialogue: The body in which the gunpowder of hatred and revenge is burning since a long time ... don't even try to touch it ... you guys will be blasted into pieces

dialogue: Yeh teri khushkismati hai ke mere haath bandhe huye hai ... varna inhi haathon se tera kaleja nikalkar tere halak mein thoos deta
englishDialogue: It is your good luck that my hands are tied up ... or else with these hands itself, I would have removed your liver and shoved it up your throat

dialogue: Tera kehar toh zehar bankar meri ragon mein daud raha hai ... jis din yeh lava phatega ... tera naam-o-nishaan tak mitta dega
englishDialogue: Your fear is flowing in my veins like poison ... but the day this lava erupts ... even your name will be erased

dialogue: Baar baar vaar karoonga uspar aur har vaar mein usse til til maroonga
englishDialogue: I'll attack him multiple times and in every attack I'll kill him a bit

dialogue: Zameen aasman ek karloge tab bhi tumne maut se koi nahi bacha sakta ... kyun ki Diwan ke aankh mein jab khoon utarta hai ... toh usse sirf khoon dikhai deta hai
englishDialogue: Even if you unite the ground and the sky then also no one will be able to save you from death ... because when blood rolls down into the eyes of Diwan ... then he can only see blood

dialogue: Yahan koi aa nahi sakta ... aur agar aa jaye toh apni marzi se jaa nahi sakta
englishDialogue: No one can come here ... and if they come then they can't go by their own wish

dialogue: Main tumhara woh hashar karoonga ... ki nazar milane ki toh kya ... nazar churane ke bhi kabil nahi rahoge
englishDialogue: I'll make your condition such that ... forget thinking about looking into the eyes ... you won't even be able to take your eyes away

dialogue: Itne tukde kar doonga ... ke usse doobara janam dene ke liye ek baar bhagwan bhi sooch mein padh jaye
englishDialogue: I will cut him into so many pieces ... that for once even god will get confused whether to reincarnate him or not

dialogue: Bekarari hadh se badh jaye usse sada kehte hai ... aur vaada karke derr se aane ko ada kehte hai
englishDialogue: When excitement rises above the limit it is called forever ... and making a promise and coming late is called style

dialogue: Sachchai ki ladai mein marne waala hamesha zinda rehta hai
englishDialogue: A person who dies in the fight for truth, always remains alive

dialogue: Purani sharaab ki tarah ... purani dosti ka bhi ajeeb nasha hai
englishDialogue: Just like old wine ... even old friendship has strange intoxication

dialogue: Aao ji aao ji aaj sadke, yaaro ke yaar aaye hai ... pilao ji pilao inhe aaj jee bhar ke, saat samundar paar aaye hai
englishDialogue: Come over everyone, my dear friend has arrived ... make him drink as much as he can, since he has from overseas

dialogue: Sirf goggles imported hain ... aankhen nahin
englishDialogue: Only the goggles are imported ... not the eyes

dialogue: Sach aur jhoot sirf dekh ke nahi jana ja sakta ... uske liye dil ki kasauti chahiye
englishDialogue: Truth and lie is not only known by seeing ... one needs a test of heart for that

dialogue: Darna meri fitrat nahin
englishDialogue: It is not my nature to get scared

dialogue: Mujhe apna bhavishya malum hai
englishDialogue: I do know my own future

dialogue: Badle ki is bhavna ko mann se nikaal do ... yeh woh khel hai joh shuru ho jaye toh khelne waale khatam ho jaate hai ... par khel khatam nahi hota
englishDialogue: Remove the feelings of revenge from your heart ... it is that game which once it starts, then the players will end ... but the game will not end

dialogue: Naale ka ganda pani kabhi Gangajal nahi ban sakta
englishDialogue: The dirty water from the gutter can never become the holy water from the river Ganges

dialogue: Phir kabhi udhar nazar aaya ... toh kisi ko nazar nahi aayega
englishDialogue: If I ever see you there ... then you won't be seen to anyone

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi dushman ki zindagi ... uski maut se zyada faydemand hoti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the life of an enemy ... is more beneficial than his death

dialogue: Politics mein right aur wrong nahi hota ... politics mein manzil hi sab kuch hai ... rasta chahe koi bhi ho
englishDialogue: There is no right or wrong in politics ... in politics the destination is everything ... no matter what the path is

dialogue: Chunaav aur politics akal ka khel hai ... umeedvaar chahe koi bhi ho ... agar uske peeche akal hai, organization hai, planning hai toh woh zaroor jeetta hai
englishDialogue: Elections and politics is a mind game ... no matter who the candidate is ... if he has brains, an organization and planning behind him, then he will definitely win

dialogue: Zindagi ki university mein aaj tumhara pehla imtihan hai ... agar pass ho gaye toh degree ki jagah maal hi maal hai ... aur agar fail ho gaye toh inaam mein police ki goliyan ya jail
englishDialogue: Today is your first exam in the university of life ... if you pass then instead of a degree you'll get a lot of money ... and if you fail then as a prize you'll get bullets from police or jail

dialogue: Jab hamari dharti par raat utarti hai toh paap jaag uthta hai ... insaan shaitan ka roop dharan kar leta hai ... aur lagta hai shayad subah kabhi na ho
englishDialogue: When night falls on our world then sin awakens ... humans take the guise of a devil ... and it feels like morning will never come

dialogue: Tumne is waqt aaise aadmi ka haath pakad rakha hai ... jiske apne haathon mein sivah lakeeron aur kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: You have held the hand of such a person at this moment ... who has nothing but the lines of destiny in his hand

dialogue: Kisi aadmi ki aukaat janane ke liye ... uske jooton par hi ek nazar dalna kaafi hai
englishDialogue: To know the status of a person ... one look at his shoes is more than enough

dialogue: Aaise kahi badan hote hai jinka paseena scent se bhi zyada khushbudar hota hai
englishDialogue: There are so many bodies whose sweat has more fragrance than a perfume

dialogue: Apna paseena boyega toh sona ughayega
englishDialogue: If you sow your sweat then you will reap gold

dialogue: Apne maathe se paseena poch ... agar tere gande paseene ki ek boond bhi is dharti par gir gayi ... toh is dharti se anaaj ughna band ho jayega
englishDialogue: Wipe the sweat from your forehead ... even if a single drop of your dirty sweat falls on this soil ... then this soil will stop growing crops

dialogue: Gareeb ki beti jis pal bhoj ban jaati hai na ... usse rukhsat kar dete hai
englishDialogue: The moment a poor man's daughter becomes a liability ... then she is married to someone

dialogue: Zindagi mein log mohabbat ke sahare jeete hai ... main aapki nafrat ke sahare jeeonga
englishDialogue: In life people live with the help of love ... I will live with the help of your hatred

dialogue: Zinda hai woh log joh maut se takrate hai ... murdon se bhattar hai woh log joh maut se gabrate hai
englishDialogue: People who stand against death are alive ... people who are scared of death are worse than the dead

dialogue: Sukh toh bewafa hai ... chand dino ke liye aata hai aur chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: Happiness is unfaithful ... it comes for a few days and goes away

dialogue: Aaj unke kadam is taraf kya aaye ... lagta hai fiza mein bahaar aa gayi
englishDialogue: Today he stepped towards me ... it seems as if spring is in the air

dialogue: Tawaif ki zindagi kothe pe shuru hoti hai ... aur kabristan mein khatam hoti hai
englishDialogue: The life of a prostitute starts in a brothel ... and ends in a graveyard

dialogue: Izzat woh daulat hai ... joh ek baar chali gayi toh phir kabhi haasil nahi ki ja sakti
englishDialogue: Respect is that wealth ... which cannot be regained once it goes away

dialogue: Zindagi ka agar sahi lufz uthana hai na ... toh maut se khelo
englishDialogue: If you want to really enjoy life ... then play with death

dialogue: Na maut aati hai, na tum aati ho ... par Zohra Bai tum bahut achcha gaati ho
englishDialogue: Death doesn't come, neither do you ... but Ms. Zohra you sing very well

dialogue: Agar nazarein khoobsurat ho ... toh har cheez khoobsurat lagti hai
englishDialogue: If one has beautiful eyes ... then everything looks beautiful

dialogue: Pyar mein woh gehrai hai ... jiske samne samundar bhi qatra malum hota hai ... pyar karne waalon ka dil itna bada hota hai ... ki sari kainath bhi uske samne zharra malum hoti hai
englishDialogue: Love is so deep that ... even the ocean looks like a drop in front of it ... and people in love have such a big heart ... that the whole universe seems small in front of it

dialogue: Taqdeer hi ki baat hai ... kuch logon ko umeed nahi hoti aur unhe khoya hua pyar mil jaata hai ... kuch log umeed lagaye behte hote hai aur unhe pyar milne se pehle hi kho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Destiny is such that ... some people don't have hopes but they regain their lost love ... and some people have hopes but they lose their love even before they get it

dialogue: Talwar ki ladai talwar se, pyar ki ladai pyar se, aur bekaar ki ladai sarkar se
englishDialogue: A sword fights with a sword, love fights with love, and a jobless person fights with the government

dialogue: Insaan joh nahi hai wohi dikhane ka dhong karta hai ... joh shareef nahi hai woh sharafat ka dhong karta hai ... buzdil bahadur hone ka dhong karta hai ... dil mein lalach hota hai aur zabaan se mohabbat ka dhong karta hai ... aur kabhi dil mein mohabbat hoti hai toh zabaan se anjaanepan ka dhong karta hai
englishDialogue: A human tries to pretend what he is not ... one who is not honest pretends to be honest ... a coward pretends to be a brave person ... a person who has greed in his heart pretends to have love in his words ... and sometimes you have love in your heart but you pretend to be strangers

dialogue: Abhi aaye, abhi behte, abhi daaman sambhala hai ... tumhari jaun jaun ne hamara dum nikala hai
englishDialogue: You just came, you just sat, you barely settled down ... and every bit of you has made me go crazy

dialogue: Insaan ki mitti mein dhong mila hua hai ... mitti ko dhong ke pani se hi ghoondkar, maalik ne insaan banaya hai
englishDialogue: A human body has fakeness mixed in it .... God has made humans by mixing the water of fakeness with the human body

dialogue: Makaan ooncha banane se ... insaan ooncha thodi ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Just by building a big house ... a person doesn't become big

dialogue: Aaisa diya aashirwad, ki teri chokri ka ghar ho gaya aabaad ... aur tera sadaa ke liye barbaad
englishDialogue: I gave such a blessing that your daughter's house will be blessed ... and your house will be destroyed forever

dialogue: Dil ke tootne ki awaaz nahi hoti ... magar usse zalzale aa jaate hai, aasman phat jaate hai, duniya tabaah ho jati hai
englishDialogue: When a heart breaks there is no sound ... but with that earthquakes come, the sky tears apart, the world gets destroyed

dialogue: Aankh joh dekhe dhokha khaye ... dil joh andha wohi raah batlaye
englishDialogue: Whoever sees through the eyes gets betrayed ... follow your blind heart which shows the path

dialogue: Sach darrawana nahi hota, ghinawana nahi hota ... sach toh hamesha shubh hota hai
englishDialogue: The truth is not scary, it is not hideous ... the truth is always auspicious

dialogue: Pyar, khansi aur khushi ... chupaye se chupte hai kya
englishDialogue: Love, cough and happiness ... cannot be kept hidden

dialogue: Khwab zindagi se kai zyada khoobsurat hote hai
englishDialogue: Dreams are much more beautiful than life

dialogue: Main paanch lakh ka sauda karne aaya hoon ... aur meri jeb mein paanch phooti kaudiyaan bhi nahin hai
englishDialogue: I have come to make a deal of 5 lakhs ... and I don't even have 5 pennies in my pocket

dialogue: Mujhse paanch minute na milkar ... aapne apna paanch lakh ka nuksaan kiya hai
englishDialogue: By not meeting with me for 5 minutes ... you have incurred a loss of 5 lakhs

dialogue: Mere zakhm jaldi nahin bharte
englishDialogue: My wounds don't heal fast

dialogue: Jisne pachees baras apni maa ko har roz thoda thoda marte dekha ho ... usse maut se kya darr lagega
englishDialogue: One who has seen his mother die little little everyday for 25 years ... what will death scare him

dialogue: Imaandaro ke saath imaandari ... baimaano ke saath baimaani
englishDialogue: Honesty with the honest ... cheating with the cheaters

dialogue: Mere paas apne baap dada ki daulat ki nahi ek pai hai, aur nahi mujhe chahiye ... mere paas agar kuch hai toh apni maa ka diya hua aashirwaad
englishDialogue: I haven't inherited a penny from my father or grandfather, and neither do I want it ... if I have anything, then that is the blessing from my mother

dialogue: Agar suddenly ek saath sab kuch theek ho jaaye ... toh life bahut boring ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: If suddenly everything becomes alright ... then life becomes boring

dialogue: Punjabi mother-in-law se khatarnak kuch bhi nahi hota hai is duniya mein
englishDialogue: There is nothing more dangerous in this world than a Punjabi mother-in-law

dialogue: Story mein hero ho ya na ho ... story hero honi chahiye
englishDialogue: The story may have a hero or not ... the story itself must be a hero

dialogue: Budhi ho ya jawaan ... melodrama is duniya ki sari auraton ke khoon mein hota hai
englishDialogue: Be it old or young ... all the women of this world have melodrama in their blood

dialogue: Makhan sirf khaya jaata hai ... lagaya nahi jaata
englishDialogue: Butter is only meant to be eaten ... not to be applied

dialogue: Jali ko aag kehte hain, bhuji ko raakh kehte hain ... jis raakh se barood bane, usse Vishwanath kehte hain
englishDialogue: Burning flames is called fire, after burning what is left is called ash ... and the ash used to make gunpowder, is called Vishwanath

dialogue: Vishwanath us cheez ka naam hai joh gareebi aur insaaniyat se pyar karta hai ... aur aap jaise rakshasho pe vaar karta hai
englishDialogue: Vishwanath is the name of a person who loves poverty and humanity ... and the one who attacks devils like you

dialogue: Akalmand apni akal se daulatmand ban sakta hai ... magar daulatmand apni daulat se akalmand nahi ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: A wise man can become rich using his mind ... but a rich man cannot become wise using his wealth

dialogue: Ek mujrim ka waqt achcha ho sakta hai ... lekin uska anth nahi
englishDialogue: A criminal can have good moments ... but not a good end

dialogue: Abhi bhi char goliyan baaki hai ... do tere gande dil ko cheerne ke liye ... aur do teri makaar khopdi ke paar karne ke liye
englishDialogue: There are still four bullets left ... two to tear apart your dirty heart ... and two to go through your cunning mind

dialogue: Aapke mahenge suit se mahenge ittar ki khusboo aa rahi hai ... magar uske andhar chupe aadmi se paise ki badbu aa rahi hai
englishDialogue: The fragrance of an expensive perfume is coming from your expensive suit ... but the man inside it is stinking from money

dialogue: Pasand aaya toh dil mein ... nahi toh dimaag mein bhi nahi
englishDialogue: If I like it then it's in my heart ... or else it's not even in my mind

dialogue: Main ek hi baar bolta hoon ... kyun ki doosri baar sunne ke liye tu nahi hoga
englishDialogue: I only say it once ... because you won't be there to hear it for the second time

dialogue: Na commitment, na appointment ... only punishment!
englishDialogue: No commitment, no appointment ... only punishment!

dialogue: It's my way ya skyway
englishDialogue: It's my way or the skyway

dialogue: Me criminally good!
englishDialogue: I'm criminally good!

dialogue: Honth hai ya vacuum cleaner ... zabaan toh vapas dede
englishDialogue: Are these lips or a vacuum cleaner ... atleast give me my tongue back

dialogue: Mujhe bahut darr lagta hai apne aap se aur apne gusse se
englishDialogue: I'm very scared of myself and my anger

dialogue: Pehle daru peeta tha, maar peet karta tha ... toh Singham tha ... maine isse sab kuch chhudake chewing bana diya
englishDialogue: First he used to drink alcohol, he used fight ... then he was Singham (lion) ... I made him leave all that and turned him into a chewing gum

dialogue: Saala jisne daru banaya hai uska putla banana chahiye
englishDialogue: We should make a statue of the person who invented alcohol

dialogue: Meri kundli mein likha tha ki main foreign shift ho jaonga ... yeh nahi pata tha ki main yahin se hi lift ho jaonga
englishDialogue: It was written in my horoscope that I'll shift to a foreign country ... but I didn't know that I'll die over there

dialogue: First love jitna special hota hai na ... utna hi painful first heart break hota hai
englishDialogue: How much special first love is ... that much painful the first heart break is

dialogue: Thappad aaise hi hote hai ... jab expect karo toh nahi milte hai ... aur jab na expect karo toh bijli ki tarah lapak ke padte hai
englishDialogue: Slaps are like that only ... when you expect them, then you don't get them ... and when you don't expect them, then they come at you like lightning

dialogue: Jab insaan Doordarshan dekhne par utar aata hai ... toh samajh lo all is not well
englishDialogue: When a person starts watching Doordarshan ... then understand that everything is not well

dialogue: Dil tootne ka ek side effect yeh bhi hota hai ... ki bill bhi choot jaate hai
englishDialogue: One side effect of a heart break is also that ... even the bills get left behind

dialogue: Zindagi bhi na ladkiyon ki tarah unpredictable hoti hai ... kab mood change ho jaye keh nahi sakte
englishDialogue: Life is unpredictable like girls ... you can't say when the mood changes

dialogue: Jeb mein paise ho na ho ... log coffee peena kabhi nahi chhodenge
englishDialogue: Whether people have money in their pocket or not ... they will never leave drinking coffee

dialogue: Paise ho na ho ... pyar apna jugaad nikaal hi leta hai
englishDialogue: Whether money is there or not ... love will find it way

dialogue: If there is love ... toh tees rupaye aur ek cup coffee enough hai happiness ke liye
englishDialogue: If there is love ... then Rs. 30 and one cup of coffee is enough for happiness

dialogue: Life at sixty end nahi hoti ... start hoti hai
englishDialogue: Life doesn't end at sixty ... it starts there

dialogue: Agar aaj jeete na toh hamesha ke liye haar jaoge
englishDialogue: If you win today then you'll lose forever

dialogue: Pyar kha lenge, pyar pehen lenge ... pyar petrol tank mein bhar kar gaadi chala lenge
englishDialogue: We will eat love, we will wear love ... we will fill love in the petrol tank and drive the car

dialogue: Oh hotness ... kha jaun tereko?
englishDialogue: You are very hot ... can I eat you?

dialogue: Humayun's Tomb ho ya Taj Mahal ... mera bhi love in monuments ki tarha rock solid rahega centuries and centuries tak
englishDialogue: Just like Humayun's Tomb and Taj Mahal ... my love will also be rock solid like these monuments for centuries and centuries

dialogue: Paise nahi toh kya hua ... pyar toh hai unlimited
englishDialogue: So what if I don't have money ... I have unlimited love

dialogue: Uski market value kam hogi lekin ... character is priceless
englishDialogue: His market value may be less ... but his character is priceless

dialogue: Pyar kabhi kam na karna sanam ... har kami hum gawara kar lenge
englishDialogue: My love just don't ever love me less ... I'll bear every other limitation

dialogue: Khali jeb Romeo type tevar achche nahi lagte
englishDialogue: This Romeo type attitude doesn't look good with empty pockets

dialogue: Yeh chilled nahi child beer hai
englishDialogue: This is child's beer, not chilled beer

dialogue: Woh yeh soochte hai ki tum kuch jaanti ho ... par woh yeh nahi jaante ki tum kuch nahi jaanti
englishDialogue: They think that you know something ... but they don't know that you don't know anything

dialogue: Main toh roz yeh maankar nikalta hoon ki ... yeh mera aakhri din hai
englishDialogue: I leave everyday thinking that ... this is my last day

dialogue: Joh desh ke liye ladte hai ... unki maut ka countdown unki pehli saans ke saath shuru ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Those who fight for their country ... the countdown of their death starts with their first breath

dialogue: In aankhon mein gaur se dekh ... na toh in mein marne gham hai, na maut ka khauff ... sirf garv hai
englishDialogue: Look properly in these eyes ... neither there is the sorrow of dying, nor there is the fear of death ... there is only pride in it

dialogue: Kripya apni kursi ki peti bandh lijiye
englishDialogue: Please fasten your seat belts

dialogue: Terrorism ke business mein recession nahi hota
englishDialogue: In the business of terrorism there is no recession

dialogue: Election circus ki tarah hota hai ... jahan pe joker sirf time pass ke liye hota hai ... ticketein khareedi jaati hai sher ko dekhne ke liye
englishDialogue: Election is just like the circus ... where the joker is there just for time pass ... tickets are bought to see the tiger

dialogue: Trailer hit toh picture hit ... aur gaana hit toh picture super hit
englishDialogue: If the trailer is a hit then the movie is a hit ... and if the song is a hit then the movie is a super hit

dialogue: Is desh ki population ke mann ke andar sirf frustration hai ... system ki is constipation se bahar yeh situation hai ki har jagah saturation hai ... public yeh jaanna chahti hai ki is intoxication ka justification kya hai ... right to information hai lekin us par objection hai ... police ke power hai lekin uska limitation hai ... jiske paas designation hai uske paas intention nahi aur jiske paas suggestion hai uske paas position nahi ... aaise mein janta kya kare yeh mera question hai
englishDialogue: There is only frustration in the hearts of the population of this country ... the situation outside the constipation of the system is that, there is saturation everywhere ... the public wants to know what is the justification for this intoxication ... there is right to information but there is an objection on that ... the police has power but it also has limitations ... the one who has the designation doesn't have the intention and the one who has the suggestion doesn't have the position ... so in this case what should the people do, is my question

dialogue: Vote dena usko chahiye joh sabse zyada pasand ho ... par dena padta hai usse joh sabse kam napasand ho
englishDialogue: We need to vote for someone whom we like the most ... but unfortunately we have to vote for someone whom we dislike the least

dialogue: Aadmi bura kaam is liye karta hai kyun ki uske dil ke andar achhai ka darr nahi hota ... jis din iske andar ki burai achhai se darne lagegi ... us din se har bura kaam karne se pehle yeh dus baar sochega
englishDialogue: A person does evil things because there is no fear of virtue in him ... the day the evil within him starts to fear his virtue ... from that day onwards, before doing anything evil he will think 10 times

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi burai ka anth burai khud hi kar daalti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes evil itself ends what is evil

dialogue: Mujhe tumse tumhari cash value ke liye nahi tumhari apni value ke liye shaadi karni hai ... tumhari friendship ki value, tumhari beauty ki value, tumhari hassi ki value
englishDialogue: I want to marry you not for your cash value, but for your own value ... for the value of your friendship, for the value of your beauty, for the value of your laughter

dialogue: Maine kausa expect-hich kiya ke mujh jaise pede ko tum jaisi rasmalai milegi
englishDialogue: When did I expect that a sugar ball like me will get a dessert like you

dialogue: Chaand chahoon na chakora, na falak ka tukda ... noor chahoon na main hoori, na pari sa mukhda
englishDialogue: I don't want the moon or the birds, and neither do I want a piece of the sky ... I don't want the divine light or the beauty from paradise, and neither do I want a face like fairy

dialogue: Body ka kya hai ... aaj dubli kal moti ... thinking mein-hich honi chahiye na beauty
englishDialogue: What is it about the body ... today it's slim tomorrow it'll be fat ... but there should be beauty in the thought itself

dialogue: Hamari country mein jab tak black nahi diya toh naya ghar nahi khareed sakte ... dahej nahi diya toh shaadi nahi hoti
englishDialogue: In our country until you give black money you can't buy a new house ... and if you don't give dowry then a marriage can't happen

dialogue: Main yeh nahi keh raha ki mere saath apni sari zindagi bitao ... kisse chahiye life long commitment? ... bas ek ek din karke jeeyenge ... na baad ka soochenge, na pehle ka yaad rakhenge ... bas aaj ko sambhalenge aur kya pata shayad aaise hi poori zindagi kat jayegi
englishDialogue: I'm not saying that spend your entire life with me ... who wants life long commitment? ... we'll live one day at a time ... we won't think about the future, nor will we remember the past ... we'll just take care of the present and who knows may be just like that we'll spend the entire life

dialogue: Pyar picturon mein hi achcha lagta hai ... extra baatein edit kar dete hai
englishDialogue: Love only looks good in movies ... they edit the extra stuff

dialogue: Hum har jagah bas apne aapko dhoondte hai ... aur agar woh mil jaye toh phir usse sambhal ke rakh lena chahiye
englishDialogue: We just keep looking for ourselves everywhere ... and if we find ourself then we should keep it safely

dialogue: Ladka ladki bhaagkar gale milte hai, toh milne de ... slow motion hone de, sunset hone de, gaane bajhte hai toh bajhne de ... main toh kehta hoon ki dono puppy lete hai toh lene de
englishDialogue: If a boy and a girl run and hug each other, then let them do it ... let there be slow motion, let there be a sunset, if songs are playing then let them play ... infact I'm saying if they are kissing then let them do it

dialogue: Har kahani ka happy ending ho sakta hai ... agar sahi waqt par end kardo toh
englishDialogue: Every story can have a happy ending ... if you end it at the right time

dialogue: 99% kahaniyan "I Love You" pe khatam ho jaati hai ... pata hai kyun? ... it's the beginning of the end
englishDialogue: 99% stories end on "I Love You" ... you know why? ... because it's the beginning of the end

dialogue: Barah aur char ke beech mard chutya jaata hai ... over commit karta hai, senti ho jaata hai, rote dhote kahin bhi mooh maar leta hai ... basically dimag se nahi patloon se soochne lagta hai
englishDialogue: In between 12am and 4am a man goes crazy ... he over commits, he becomes sentimental, cryingly he goes for anything ... basically he thinks from within his pants and not from his mind

dialogue: Badlaav maapa nahi ja sakta ... sirf mehsoos kiya jaata hai
englishDialogue: Change cannot be measured ... it can only be felt

dialogue: I'm risk free ... main guarantee ke saath aata hoon
englishDialogue: I'm risk free ... I come with guarantee

dialogue: Is duniya ka har ladka bachkana hai, har ladki insecure hai aur hum sab real life mein cheezy hai
englishDialogue: Every guy in this world is childish, every girl is insecure and in real life we all are cheezy

dialogue: Agar jigar ki jagah jigar hai aur jigar mein dum hai ... toh rok le aake
englishDialogue: If you have courage in the right place and if you have the guts in your courage ... then try to stop me

dialogue: Hum gunday hai ... na aaj tak kisi ke haath aaye hai ... aur na aayenge
englishDialogue: We are goons ... no has been able to catch us to date ... and neither will anyone be able to

dialogue: Hum toh falak ke taare the ... zameen pe aaye toh pehchaan payi, mazhab paya, rang paya, zubaan payi ... hum nikle the jannat dhoondne ... par har modh pe, har makaam pe, nafrat jung aur sarhad payi ... par apne tevar ka sikka ek din chalega zaroor ... khoon ubaal marega zamana badlega zaroor ... khud ko buland karenge ... rab ke bandhe hai hum ... gunday the, gunday hai, gunday rahenge hum
englishDialogue: We were the stars from the sky ... when we came to the earth we got an identity, religion, colour, language ... we had left to find the heaven ... but on every turn, on every destination, we found hatred war and borders ... but the coin of our attitude will work one day ... the blood will boil and the world will change ... we will make ourselves strong ... we are the messengers of God ... we were goons, we are goons and we will remain goons

dialogue: Sabse bada kalakar toh woh hai ... usne itni badi duniya banai ... phir is duniya mein hazaron log banaye, hazaron logon ke haathon mein karodon lakeerein kheench di ... sukh ki, dukh ki, izzat ki, pyar ki, sab likh daala saala ... lekin woh mujhse itna pyar karta hai ki usne mere haath mein sirf ek lakeer kheenchi, sirf ek ... kaali kismat ki kaali lakeer
englishDialogue: He (god) is the biggest artist ... he made such a big world ... then he made thousands of people in this world, he drew millions of lines on the hands of thousands of people ... of happiness, of sadness, of respect, of love, he wrote everything ... but he loves me so much that he drew only one line on my hand, only one ... which is the black line of bad luck

dialogue: Yeh tevar hamare khoon mein hai ... tere bhaukane se kuch nahi hoga
englishDialogue: We have this attitude in our blood ... and you barking will not make a difference

dialogue: Pistol ki goli aur laundiya ki boli jab chalti hai ... toh jaan dono mein hi khatre mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: When bullets from a gun or words from a girl fire ... then there is a danger for life in both

dialogue: Chori ke dhande mein joh maal le jaye na ... maal bhi uska, dhanda bhi uska
englishDialogue: In the business of stealing one who takes the goods ... the goods belong to him, and so does the business

dialogue: Lakeerein bahut ajeeb hoti hai ... khaal pe khich jaye toh khoon nikaal deti hai ... aur zameen pe khich jaye toh sarhadein bana deti hai
englishDialogue: Lines are very strange ... when they are drawn on the skin then it removes blood out ... and when they are drawn on the land then it makes borders

dialogue: Yeh tasveer shuru zaroor usne ki hai ... lekin ismein aakhri rang main bharoonga
englishDialogue: He has started this painting ... but I will fill the last color in it

dialogue: Hum gunday hai ... ek baar jiske saath jee liye ... marte bhi ussi ke saath hai
englishDialogue: We are goons ... once we live with someone ... then we die with them also

dialogue: Aksar har desh badi samasyayen suljhane ke chakkar mein yeh bhool jaata hai ... ki uski kitni badi keemat uske apne logon ko chukani padti hai
englishDialogue: Often every big country in solving their problems forgets that ... how big a price does it's own people have to pay for that

dialogue: Kismat ki ek khaas baat hoti hai ... ki woh palatti hai
englishDialogue: Luck has one important aspect ... that it changes

dialogue: Chhot khaya hua dost dushman se zyada khatarnak hota hai
englishDialogue: A wounded friend is more dangerous than a enemy

dialogue: Chaal hum chalenge ... sheh bhi hum denge ... aur maat bhi hum denge
englishDialogue: We will play the ploy ... we will also give the check ... and we will also give the check and mate

dialogue: Mera maatha garam hai, doodh ki tarah ubal jaata hoon ... aaj ubloonga nahi ... phatoonga
englishDialogue: My brain is hot and I boil like milk ... but today I won't boil ... I will blast

dialogue: Joh cheez kismat mein nahi hoti ... woh dhoondne se bhi nahi milti
englishDialogue: Things that aren't in your destiny ... you won't get them even on searching

dialogue: Ahankar ki aag tezaab se zyada khatarnak hoti hai ... ek baar jala de toh nishaan seedha aatma pe jake lagta hai
englishDialogue: The fire of pride is more dangerous than acid ... once it burns you then the marks appear straight on the soul

dialogue: Woh chahegi jiska banna ... arre wohi banega Rajesh Khanna
englishDialogue: The one she choses to be with ... he will become Rajesh Khanna

dialogue: Main tujhe cheer ke rakh doonga ... aur is baat pe mere dost angootha lagva le
englishDialogue: I'll rip you apart ... and my friend, take my signature for getting that done

dialogue: Ho aap vardi waale ... par aapke tevar hai gundo waale
englishDialogue: You're a police officer ... but your attitude is like that of a goon

dialogue: Hum poore Calcutta ke ... poora Calcutta hamara
englishDialogue: I'm completely from Calcutta ... and the entire Calcutta is mine

dialogue: Bomb phatke aur phaadke chala gaya
englishDialogue: The bomb ripped and tore apart everything

dialogue: Hum kanoon hai ... saala apni aukaat pe aa jaye toh kahin bhi ghus sakta hai aur kisi ko bhi todh sakta hai
englishDialogue: I'm the law ... if I come to my position then I can enter anywhere and I can break anyone

dialogue: Roti ke bina insaan chaar hafte jee sakta hai, pani ke bina chaar din aur hawa ke bina shayad chaar minute ... lekin umeed ke bina insaan chaar second bhi nahi jee sakta hai
englishDialogue: A person can live for 4 weeks without food, 4 days without water and may be 4 minutes without air ... but a person can't even live for 4 seconds without hope

dialogue: Kismat badi kutti cheez hai ... saali kabhi bhi palat jaati hai
englishDialogue: Destiny is a bitch ... bloody it can change anytime

dialogue: Duniya mein do tarah ke log hote hai ... winners and losers ... lekin zindagi har loser ko woh ek mauka zaroor deti hai ... jis mein woh winner ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: In this world there are two types of people ... winners and losers ... but life definitely gives every loser that one chance ... in which he can become a winner

dialogue: Haaro toh haaro ... par izzat mat utaaro
englishDialogue: If you lose that's fine ... but don't lose your respect

dialogue: Dance na ek puja hai ... dance ek art hai art
englishDialogue: Dance is worship ... dance is an art

dialogue: Madar ... chhod na yaar!
englishDialogue: Mother ... just forget it!

dialogue: Jitni khushi aapko hamare yahan aane se ho rahi hai ... usse kahin zyada dukh hamare jane pe hoga
englishDialogue: The amount of happiness that you have by us coming here ... more than that sadness you will have when we go from here

dialogue: Kismat bahut hi sahi cheez hai ... agar iraadon mein dum ho toh saali palat hi jaati hai
englishDialogue: Luck is a very good thing ... if your intentions are strong then it definitely turns

dialogue: Saat minute, saat minute hai tumhare paas ... aaj is stage pe kaise dance karna hai yeh main tumko nahi batayegi ... kya malum aaj ke baad hum sab saath mein hoyenge ki nahi hoyenge ... aaisa chance milenga ki nahi milenga ... lekin aaj agar is team ka har ek dancer apni zindagi ka best dance karenga na ... toh aai shapath yeh saat minute tumse koi nahi cheen sakta ... gods bhi nahi
englishDialogue: You have 7 minutes ... today I won't tell you guys how to dance on this stage ... who knows whether we'll be together or not after today ... whether we'll get a chance like this or not ... but today if every dancer of this team does their best dance ... then I swear on my mother that, no one will be able to steal these 7 minutes from you ... not even god

dialogue: Badi badi fights mein aaisi choti choti maar toh lagti rehti hai
englishDialogue: In big big fights such small small injuries do happen

dialogue: Maut uske liye bahut choti sazaa hai ... insaaf toh tab hoga jab woh maut ke liye tadapega aur usse maut nahi milegi
englishDialogue: Death is a very small punishment for him ... justice will be done when he will cry for death and he won't get death

dialogue: Nandu Bhide ... dimaag mein keede!
englishDialogue: Nandu Bhide ... bugs the brain!

dialogue: No Hindustani, suit Armani ... ek thappad khani, mooh pe barah baj jaani
englishDialogue: This suit is not Indian, it's Armani ... one slap I'll give you and your face will frown

dialogue: Ladkiyon ko IQ nahi CQ chahiye ... "Cool Quotient"
englishDialogue: Girls don't want IQ (Intelligence Quotient), they want CQ ... "Cool Quotient"

dialogue: Kaun kambhakt bardaash karne ko pitta hai ... hum toh pitate hai ki roz yahan aa sake ... maar kha sake, bhav gira sake
englishDialogue: Who the hell wants to get beaten to bear the pain ... I get beaten so that I can come here everyday ... so that I can get hit and then drop the price

dialogue: Don't fear come near ... put my jawani ka scooter in third gear
englishDialogue: Don't fear come near ... put the scooter of my youth in third gear

dialogue: Aap jaisa koi meri zindagi mein aaye ... toh mere bachche ka baap ban jaye
englishDialogue: If someone like you comes in my life ... then he will become the father of my child

dialogue: Tumhare vital stats kya hai?
englishDialogue: What are your vital statistics?

dialogue: Hum pagal nahi hai ... hamara dimaag kharab hai
englishDialogue: We are not mad ... it's just that our mind is crazy

dialogue: Ram banaye jodi ... gadhe ko mil gayi ghodi
englishDialogue: God makes the pairs ... and the donkey got the mare

dialogue: Kya house hai, kya blouse hai, kya aapka koi spouse hai?
englishDialogue: What a house, what a blouse, do you have a spouse?

dialogue: Keeda makoda ... bin tel ka pakoda!
englishDialogue: You pest ... you fritter made without oil!

dialogue: Is duniya mein sirf do cheezein famous hai ... Bruce Lee ka karate aur Ashok Kumar ke parathe
englishDialogue: There are only two things famous in this world ... the karate of Bruce Lee and flatbreads made by Ashok Kumar

dialogue: Aadmi dimaag se budha hota hai ... shareer se nahi
englishDialogue: A person grows old from his mind ... not from his body

dialogue: Lagta hai iske style ki maa bahen ho chuki hai
englishDialogue: Looks like his style has got screwed

dialogue: Aap ek business machine se shaadi karne ja rahi hai
englishDialogue: You are going to get married to a business machine

dialogue: Main apne papa ka eklauta mistake hoon
englishDialogue: I'm the one and only one mistake of my father

dialogue: Ladki khoobsurat ho aur Scooty par ho toh pyar ho jaata hai ... aur jab ladki badsurat ho aur Mercedes mein ho toh pyar jhak marke karna hi padta hai
englishDialogue: If the girl is beautiful and on a Scooty (moped) then you'll fall in love ... and if the girl is ugly and in a Mercedes then you'll have to fall in love

dialogue: Yeh dhai kilo haath nahi, sade-teen kilo ka haath hai ... yeh jispar padta hai na ... woh uthta nahi, uth hi jaata hai
englishDialogue: This is not a 2.5 kg hand, it's a 3.5 kg hand ... and the person on whom this hand falls ... forget getting up, he infact dies

dialogue: Indians sab cheez mein best hai ... kissing mein bhi Indians hi best hai ... kabhi Emraan Hashmi ka naam nahi suna?
englishDialogue: Indians are the best in everything ... even in kissing Indians are the best ... haven't you heard about Emraan Hashmi?

dialogue: Why fart and waste it ... when you can burp and taste it
englishDialogue: Why fart and waste it ... when you can burp and taste it

dialogue: Confidence khel mein jaan zaroor dalta hai ... lekin overconfidence jaan le leta hai
englishDialogue: Confidence definitely puts life into a game ... but overconfidence kills

dialogue: Risk aur opportunity ke beech mein hi toh chance milta hai ... aur joh us chance ke saath romance karta hai ... wohi asli raja kehlata hai
englishDialogue: You get a chance between risk and opportunity ... and the one who does romance with that chance ... is called a true king

dialogue: Life is paise ki tarah hai ... bas ek baar kharch kar paoge
englishDialogue: Life is like money ... you can only spend it once

dialogue: Main paidahishi 420 hoon, jamoora nahi ... kartab dikhake haath nahi failata ... jaal failata hoon aur phir us jaal pe maal
englishDialogue: I am a born cheater, not a sidekick ... I don't spread my hands after a show ... I spread a trap and then I collect money in that trap

dialogue: Kheeche huye kaan se mila hua gyan ... hamesha yaad rehta hai
englishDialogue: The lesson that you learn when your ears are pulled ... is remembered forever

dialogue: Takleef mein saath dene waale ko bhale ek baar bhool jao ... lekin takleef dene wale ko kabhi mat bhoolna
englishDialogue: For once you may forget the person who helped you in your problem ... but never forget the one who gave you the problem

dialogue: Bachana woh seekhta hai joh zyada kamana nahi jaanta
englishDialogue: The one who learns to save doesn't know how to earn more money

dialogue: Dosti pani hai aur paisa tel ... dono ko kabhi mix nahi karte
englishDialogue: Friendship is water and money is oil ... you should never mix them

dialogue: Dimaag jitna thanda ... badla utna meetha
englishDialogue: The calmer your mind is ... the sweeter the revenge will be

dialogue: Mujhe Vardha se badla lena hai ... lekin usse maarke nahi ... usse zinda rakhke
englishDialogue: I want to take revenge from Mr. Vardha ... but not by killing him ... by keeping him alive

dialogue: Kismat choti si bachchi hai ... usse hide & seek khelna pasand hai
englishDialogue: Luck is a small girl ... who likes to play hide & seek

dialogue: Jeb mein Laxmikant ho toh life Pyarelal ban hi jaati hai
englishDialogue: When you have money in your pocket then life becomes happy

dialogue: Chitta mein shareer jalta hai ... karz nahi
englishDialogue: A body burns in a pyre ... not the loan

dialogue: Jab main galati karta hoon toh main sorry kehta hoon ... aur jab meri wife galati karti hai toh main sorry kehta hoon
englishDialogue: I say sorry when I am at fault ... and I say sorry when my wife is at fault

dialogue: Main chahti hoon ki tum chaho ki tum na jao
englishDialogue: I want that, you should want that, you shouldn't go

dialogue: Doosron ke bachche aur kutton ke saath khelna sabko achcha lagta hai
englishDialogue: Everyone likes to play with babies and dogs of other people

dialogue: Zindagi mein aksar kuch zyada paane ki chah mein ... hum woh kho dete hai joh hamare paas hai
englishDialogue: Often with the wish to achieve more in life ... we lose what we have

dialogue: Baby ki zimmedari uthana toh door ... main toh baby ko hi nahi utha pa raha tha
englishDialogue: Forget carrying the babies responsibility ... I wasn't even able to carry the baby

dialogue: Biwi apne pati ke bina reh sakti hai ... par apni bai ke bina nahi
englishDialogue: A wife can live without her husband ... but not without her maid

dialogue: Shaadi se zyada khatarnak hote hai ... shaadi ke side effects
englishDialogue: More dangerous than a marriage ... are the side effects of marriage

dialogue: Ek fool hi shaadi ko foolproof banane ki sooch sakta hai
englishDialogue: Only a fool can think of making a marriage foolproof

dialogue: Birthday ka funda kuch aaisa hai ... aap khud isse agar value na do toh no problem ... lekin agar aapki family usse value na de ... big problem
englishDialogue: The concept of a birthday is such that ... it's no problem if you give it no value ... but if your family doesn't give it some value ... then it's a big problem

dialogue: Apni khushiyon ke liye kabhi kisi pe depend mat karna
englishDialogue: Never depend on anyone for your happiness

dialogue: Jab solution paas nahi toh problem se door raho
englishDialogue: Stay away from the problem until you are close to a solution

dialogue: Happy married life ke liye chote chote jhoot bolne padte hai
englishDialogue: You have to say small lies for a happy married life

dialogue: Jitna dum aapke ek haath mein nahi hai ... utna dum hamari ek ungli mein hai
englishDialogue: The amount of power that you don't have in one hand of yours ... we have that much power in one finger of ours

dialogue: Jab ghee seedhi aur tedhi dono ungliyon se na nikle ... toh beech ka rasta apnana padta hai
englishDialogue: When you can't remove clarified butter using both a straight and a crooked finger ... then you should adopt the middle solution

dialogue: Jab main phodna shuru karoonga na ... toh iski koi guarantee nahi hai ki kya kya phutega
englishDialogue: When I start breaking things ... then there is no guarantee what all will break

dialogue: Mujhe sudhaarte sudhaarte ... sudhaarne waale bighad gaye
englishDialogue: In trying to improve me ... the people who were trying to improve me became bad

dialogue: Unko pakadne ke liye pehle unki sooch ko pakadna hoga
englishDialogue: To catch them we first need to catch their thinking

dialogue: Jism ke x-ray ka toh suna tha ... lekin aap toh character ka bhi kar lete hai
englishDialogue: I had heard about the x-ray of a body ... but you can do that even for a character

dialogue: Zindagi se bhaagte bhaagte ek modh aaisa aata hai ... jab aage badne se pehle aapko rukna padta hai
englishDialogue: When you run behind life there comes a turn ... when you have to pause before you move ahead

dialogue: Kuch log sapno ke peeche bhaagte hai kyun ki woh unhe sach karna chahte hai ... lekin kuch log sapno ki peeche is liye bhaagte hai kyun ki unhe apni sachai se bhaagna hota hai
englishDialogue: Some people run behind their dreams since they want to make them true ... but some people run behind their dreams since they want to run away from their truth

dialogue: Sahi direction mein utha har kadam ... apne aap mein ek manzil hai ... after all life is all about the next step
englishDialogue: Every step that moves in the right direction ... is a goal in itself ... after all life is all about the next step

dialogue: Agar koi music feel kar sakta hai ... then anybody can dance!
englishDialogue: If someone can feel music ... then anybody can dance!

dialogue: We dance to express ... not to impress
englishDialogue: We dance to express ... not to impress

dialogue: Galatiyan sabse hoti hai ... but life is all about a second chance
englishDialogue: Everyone commits mistakes ... but life is all about a second chance

dialogue: Sache dil se ki gai har koshish ... kisi bhi haar jeet se badi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every attempt that is done with a true heart ... is bigger than losing or winning

dialogue: Is janam mein bauji toh kya, khud Bajrangbali bhi aa jaye ... toh woh bhi mujhe tumse shaadi karne se nahi rok sakte
englishDialogue: In this life forget dad, even if lord Hanuman comes ... then even he will not be able to stop me from marrying you

dialogue: Sab sukh lahe tumhari sharna, tum rakshak kahu ko darna ... sankat hate mite sab peera, joh sumrai Hanumat balbeera
englishDialogue: All the happiness rests under your grace, when you're the protector then there is no fear ... all dangers and pains disappear, for anyone who remembers the brave Lord Hanuman

dialogue: Hum Bajrangbali ke bakht hai ... mar jayenge lekin jhoot nahi bolenge
englishDialogue: I'm a devotee of Lord Hanuman ... I'll die but I won't lie

dialogue: Jiske dil mein Ram base ho ... uske liye koi bhi cheez asambhav nahi hai
englishDialogue: The one who has Lord Ram in his heart ... nothing is impossible for him

dialogue: Nafrat badi aasani se bik jaati hai ... lekin mohabbat
englishDialogue: Hatred can be sold very easily ... but not love

dialogue: Upar waale ne insaan ke shareer mein nau chhed kiye hai ... do kaan ke, do naak ke, do aankh ke, ek mooh ka ... baki ke do tu jaanta hai ... sapne mein bhi galat socha na, dusva chhed kar doonga
englishDialogue: God has made 9 holes in a human body ... two for the ear, two for the nose, two for the eyes, one for the mouth ... and you know the remaining two ... now even if you think wrong in your dream, then I'll make the 10th hole

dialogue: Ghar mein hai bas chhe hi log ... chaar deewarein, chatt aur main ... raat sahuli ek saheli, gora chitta din hai dost ... ghar mein hai bas chhe hi log ... tehelne nikle tanha parchai, main bhi uske peeche chaloon ... neele ambar ke kagaz par panchi hokar chitra banoon ... indradhanush ki tirchi daali par chipki geeli geeli aus ... ghar mein hai bas chhe hi log ... chaar deewarein, chatt aur main
englishDialogue: There are only six people in the house ... four walls, the roof and me ... the night is my girlfriend, and the fair day is my buddy ... there are only six people in the house ... the saddened shadow is going for a walk, and I'm going behind it ... may I become like a bird in a picture on the canvas of the blue sky ... and like a moist dew drop on a branch under the rainbow ... there are only six people in the house ... four walls, the roof and me

dialogue: Force kisi ke baap ki jagir nahi hai ... force ki apni ek dignity hai ... us dignity ko barkarar rakhna hamari zimmedari hai
englishDialogue: The force is not a property of someone's father ... the force has it's own dignity ... and to maintain that dignity is our responsibility

dialogue: What you perceive is your reality, what I perceive is my reality ... there is no reality as such ... there are only perceptions
englishDialogue: What you perceive is your reality, what I perceive is my reality ... there is no reality as such ... there are only perceptions

dialogue: Gandhiki jab tak deewar par the humne haar pehnaye ... note par aa gaye, humne jeb mein daal liye
englishDialogue: Until Mahatma Gandhi was on the wall we used to put a garland around him ... now he's come on money, and we have put him in our pockets

dialogue: Force se zyada, joh log force mein hai woh important hote hai ... aur hamara system hamesha joh log is kaam ke liye bane hai, unko nazar andaz karke ... un logon pe kaam saunpte hai, joh us kaam ke maaine bhi nahi jante
englishDialogue: More than the force itself, the people who are in the force are important ... and our system always ignores the people who are made for that kind of work ... and it gives the responsibility of that work to those people, who don't even understand the value of that work

dialogue: Once a cop, always a cop!
englishDialogue: Once a cop, always a cop!

dialogue: Ek shehar mein do gangs nahi honi chahiye ... varna doosri gang ka istamal koi teesra karta hai
englishDialogue: There shouldn't be two gangs in the city ... or else a third gang uses the second gang

dialogue: Isse kehte hai politics ... har cheez ka sahi waqt par, sahi dhang se istamal karne ka hunar hona chahiye ... joh achcha chal raha hai usse bhigaadna aana chahiye ... joh bhigad raha hai usse sudhaarna aana chahiye
englishDialogue: This is called as politics ... in which you need to have the talent to use everything at the right time and in the right manner ... you should know how to spoil things that are going well ... and you should know how to improve things that are going bad

dialogue: Log kehte hai apne dushman ko maaf kar dena chahiye ... main bhi yahi maanta hoon ... lekin unhe tadpa tadpake maarne ke baad
englishDialogue: People say that you should forgive your enemy ... I also agree with that ... but after killing them with pain and agony

dialogue: Har jung border par nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Not every war happens on the border

dialogue: Mil jaate hai kuch officers hum mein todhe pagal, todhe adhiyal ... jinke dimaag mein sirf desh aur desh bhakti ghumti rehti hai ... yeh desh ke liye marna nahi chahte, balki jeena chahte hai ... taki aakhri saans tak desh ki rakhsha kar sake
englishDialogue: We do get some officers who are a little mad, a little stubborn ... in whose mind only country and patriotism keeps moving ... these people don't want to die for their country, instead they want to live ... so that they can protect their country till their last breath

dialogue: Main kuch bhi kar sakta hoon!
englishDialogue: I can do anything!

dialogue: Main joh bhi karta hoon ... khud ke liye karta hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever I do ... I do it for myself

dialogue: Abhi toh apan small se large hua hai ... abhi patiala hona baki hai
englishDialogue: I have just turned from small into large ... I still have to become extra large

dialogue: Picture jab housefull hota hai na ... toh ticket us-hich ko milta hai jiski manager tak pehchan ho
englishDialogue: When a movie becomes housefull ... then only the one who knows the manager gets a ticket

dialogue: Footpath pe sangemarmar chadhane se woh Taj Mahal nahi ho jaata ... footpath hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: If you put marble on a footpath then it doesn't become into a Taj Mahal ... it still remains as a footpath

dialogue: Tere paas khone ke liye kuch nahi tha ... mere paas tha hamara naam
englishDialogue: You had nothing to lose ... but I had our name to lose

dialogue: Yahan sadak par bheek mil jaati hai, chokri mil jaati hai ... naukri waukri nahi milti
englishDialogue: Here on the road you'll get money if you beg, you'll also find a girl ... but you won't find a job

dialogue: Lakshmi darwaaze par hoti hai aur badnaseeb insaan mooh dhone gaya hota hai ... lekin yahan toh saala yeh hugne gaya tha
englishDialogue: An unlucky person goes to wash his face when the goddess of wealth is on his door ... but here this rascal was gone to do potty

dialogue: Apne dukhon ka khadhhar road ab khatam hone jarela hai ... aur khushiyon ka flyover aane jarela hai
englishDialogue: The broken road of our sadness is about to end ... and the flyover of our happiness is about to come

dialogue: Baba ki godh mein ghus ja tel laga ke ... bhootni ke chale aate hai taang uthake yahan pe
englishDialogue: Apply oil and sit in Baba's lap ... crazy people come here lifting their leg up

dialogue: Hum shareef kya hue ... poori duniya hi badmash ban gayi
englishDialogue: Right when I became noble ... the whole world turned naughty

dialogue: Dil toh har kisi ke paas hota hai ... lekin sab dilwale nahi hote
englishDialogue: Everyone has a heart ... but not everyone is big-hearted

dialogue: Aaj ek baad mujhe apna chehra mat dikhana ... jaan le loonga
englishDialogue: Don't ever show me your face again ... I'll kill you

dialogue: Dhokha mere saath hua hai ... joh karna hai main hi karoonga
englishDialogue: I've been cheated ... whatever needs to be done, I'll do it

dialogue: Insaan apni family ke bina jee nahi sakta ... unke liye kuch bhi kar sakta hai ... phir duniya usse matlabi kahe ya khudgarz
englishDialogue: A person cannot live without his family ... he can do anything for them ... then it doesn't matter if the world calls him selfish or egocentric

dialogue: Har pariwar mein kuch aaise raaz hote hai ... joh na khule toh hi behtar hai
englishDialogue: There are some secrets in every family ... which are better if they remain a secret

dialogue: Rajneeti note chaapne ki machine hai
englishDialogue: Politics is a machine to print money

dialogue: Pahad ki choti se girke bach sakte hai aap ... lekin ghagre ki chapet mein aake bachna mushkil hai
englishDialogue: You can be saved after falling from the top of a mountain ... but it's hard to be saved after coming into the grip of a skirt

dialogue: Jin logon ko sar uthakar jeene ki aadat hoti hai ... unhe kabhi kabhi bhagwan ke darbar mein sar jhuka lena chahiye
englishDialogue: Those who have the habit of living with their head held high ... they should sometimes bow their head down in god's court

dialogue: Aasunyon se keh do ab aankhon se behna chhod de ... in labon se keh do ab khamosh rehna chhod de ... apni chingari ki loh ko jalao doston ... dil mein joh barood hai usse jalao doston
englishDialogue: Tell the tears to stop flowing from the eyes ... tell the lips to stop being quiet ... ignite the spark in you my friends ... burn the gunpowder that is there in your heart my friends

dialogue: Ek masoom aadmi neta ke liye apni jaan dene ko tayaar hota hai ... lekin azaadi ke baad aaj tak kya kisi neta ne apne ek aam aadmi ke liye jaan di hai?
englishDialogue: An innocent person is willing to give his life for a politician ... but since independence till today has ever a politician given his life for an innocent person?

dialogue: Ghodi jab race mein daudti hai na toh beech raaste mein nahi rukti ... manzil tak daudti hai ... chahe phir woh race jeete ya hare
englishDialogue: When a mare runs in a race then she doesn't stop in the middle ... she runs till the end ... no matter if she wins or loses the race

dialogue: Na Sikh, na Isai, na Hindu, na Musalman ... sirf insaan
englishDialogue: Not a Sikh, not a Christian, not a Hindu, not a Muslim ... I'm just a human

dialogue: Treta mein chaas mile aur Dvapar mein ghee ... Kalyug mein chai mile so bana banake pee
englishDialogue: We got buttermilk in Treta-Yuga (old era) and clarified butter in Dvapara-Yuga (middle era) ... nowadays in the Kali-Yuga (modern era) we get tea, so let's make it and drink that

dialogue: Nanga aadmi aur dhakki hui lal batti ... inki izzat nahi hoti
englishDialogue: A naked person and a concealed red light ... they both don't get any respect

dialogue: Hum jaison ke marne pe hazaaron saikadon log kanda dene aayenge ... aur aap jaise bikau police waale ki arthi uthane ke liye chaar log bhaade pe bulane padenge
englishDialogue: When people like me die thousands of shoulders will come to lift my bier ... and to lift the bier of venal police officers like you we'll have to hire four people

dialogue: Tum bhi mujhse pyar karti ho bahut pyar, lekin kahogi nahi ... tadapogi mere bagair lekin jataogi nahi ... mere paas aana chahti ho, seene se lagke rona chahti ho, dil mein rehna chahti ho lekin rahogi nahi ... lekin main tumhari tarah nahi hoon ... main toh reh hi nahi sakta yeh kahe bina ki mujhe tumse ishq hai
englishDialogue: You also love me very much, but you won't say that ... you'll wriggle without me but you won't show that ... you want to come to me, you want to hug me and cry, you want to stay in my heart but you won't stay ... but I'm not like you ... I can't live without saying that I love you

dialogue: Dard kam hota hai khushi dene se ... dukh kam hota hai sukh dene se
englishDialogue: Pain reduces by giving joy ... sadness reduces by giving happiness

dialogue: Hum kisi aur se pyar tabhi kar sakte hai ... jab hum apne aap se karna chhod de
englishDialogue: We can love someone else only when ... we stop loving ourselves

dialogue: Yahi toh kiya hai tum jaise mardon ne hum jaisi auraton ke saath ... kabhi kook mein hi maar dala toh kabhi pehda hote hi ... yeh kaisi ajeeb parampara hai tum logon ki ... sab kuch tumhare naam ka ... maang meri sindoor tumhare naam ka, gala mera mangalsutra tumhare naam ka, kalai meri chudiyan tumhare naam ki ... yahan tak ki kook meri, khoon mera, doodh mera aur bacha tumhare naam ka ... sab kuch tumhare naam ka ... phir yeh batao aakhir tumhare paas kya hai mere naam ka?
englishDialogue: This is what men like you have done to women like me ... sometimes you kill us when we are in the womb and sometimes just after we are born ... what kind of tradition you guys have ... where everything is in your name ... the hair parting is mine but the vermilion powder is in your name, the neck is mine but the wedding necklace is in your name, the wrist is mine but the bangles are in your name ... infact even the womb, blood, milk all are mine but the child is in your name ... everything is in your name ... now tell me what do you have in my name?

dialogue: Main jeena nahi janti ... jeena sikha sakti hoon
englishDialogue: I don't know how to live ... but I can teach how to live

dialogue: Pyar ek zimmedari hai jisse sirf taqdeer waale uthaya karte hai
englishDialogue: Love is a responsibility which only the lucky people take

dialogue: Sache pyar ki kahani ka koi anth nahi hota
englishDialogue: The story of true love has no ending

dialogue: Insaan ki shaksiyat aur jazbaat uske kaam mein nazar aati hai
englishDialogue: The personality and feelings of a person can be seen in his work

dialogue: Kisi bhi ladai mein haarta woh nahi joh girta hai ... balki woh joh girke uthta nahi hai
englishDialogue: In any fight a person who falls doesn't lose ... but the one who falls and doesn't get up loses

dialogue: Ek vaishya bhi sex ke paise nahi leti ... sex ke baad bistar chhodke jaane ke paise leti hai
englishDialogue: Even a prostitute doesn't charge money for sex ... she charges money to leave the bed after sex

dialogue: Doobara yeh galati mat karna ... varna agli baar pachtaane ka mauka bhi nahi milega
englishDialogue: Don't do this mistake again ... or else the next time you won't even get an opportunity to repent for it

dialogue: Jaan jaaye lekin sambhog hone na paaye
englishDialogue: You're ready to lose your life but you won't let the intercourse happen

dialogue: Agar koi bhi cheez poore dil se ki jaaye ... toh uska nateeja hamesha khoobsurat hi hota hai
englishDialogue: If you do anything with your complete heart at it ... then the outcome of that will always be beautiful

dialogue: Tumhe pata hai parindo aur insaano mein kya farak hota hai ... parindo ko sone ke liye jitni jagah chahiye hoti hai ... utna hi bada ghosla banate hai ... aur insaan apne aashiyane se kabhi khush nahi hota ... usse aur bada banana chahta hai
englishDialogue: Do you know what's the difference between birds and humans ... the amount of space that birds need to sleep ... they make their nest only that much bigger ... but humans are never happy with their mansions ... they want to make them bigger and bigger

dialogue: I don't f*ck for money!
englishDialogue: I don't f*ck for money!

dialogue: If you're not with me ... you're against me
englishDialogue: If you're not with me ... you're against me

dialogue: Behind every fortune there is a crime
englishDialogue: Behind every fortune there is a crime

dialogue: Yahan sabka ek hi takia-kalaam hai ... hazaar ke note pe Bapu ko salaam hai
englishDialogue: Here everyone has the same catch-phrase ... they salute Mahatma Gandhi who is on the Rs.1000 note

dialogue: Neend na mashooka ki tarah hoti hai ... waqt na do toh bura maanke chali jaati hai
englishDialogue: Sleep is like a girlfriend ... if you don't give time to it, then it gets upset and leaves

dialogue: Sharafat ki duniya ka kissa hi khatam ... ab jaisi duniya vaise hum
englishDialogue: Let's end the story of the world of innocence ... now I'll be just like the world is

dialogue: Rishton mein bharosa aur mobile pe network na ho toh log game khelne lagte hai
englishDialogue: If there is no trust in between relationships and no network on a mobile then people start playing games

dialogue: Mohabbat hai is liye jaane diya ... zidd hoti toh baahon mein hoti
englishDialogue: I let her go since she is my love ... had she been my stubbornness then she would have been in my arms

dialogue: Teri amma ne jiske baare mein nahi bataya main tera woh baap hoon
englishDialogue: I'm that father of yours about whom your mother probably didn't tell you

dialogue: Aaj kal shareef sirf woh hota hai jiske mobile mein password nahi hota hai
englishDialogue: Nowadays only those people are honest who don't have a password on their mobile phone

dialogue: Har cheez ki keemat hoti hai ... pata sirf yeh karna hota hai ki kise aur kaise khareedna hai
englishDialogue: Everything has a price ... the only thing you have to do is find out who and how do we buy them

dialogue: Tu toh sarkari naukri ki tarah ho gaya hai ... badi mushkil se milta hai ... woh bhi kismat waalon ko
englishDialogue: You have become like a government job ... you've become hard to be found ... and only lucky people find you

dialogue: Yeh zindagi badi ajeeb hai ... joh kabhi nahi hua hota hai woh kabhi na kabhi zaroor ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Life is very strange ... what has never happened that also happens sometime or the other

dialogue: Zindagi sabko imaan bachakar jeene ki luxury nahi deti hai ... naa hi sahi ya ghalat mein sahi choose karne ki azaadi ... zindagi baar baar aapko aaise modh pe laake khada karti hai ... jahan yeh tai karna mushkil ho jaata hai ki jaan bachaye ya imaan
englishDialogue: Life doesn't give everyone the luxury to save their faith ... neither does it give the freedom to choose the right thing between right and wrong ... life brings you many a times on such a turn ... where it becomes difficult to decide whether to save your life or your faith

dialogue: Ek mard pita banta hai bache ke pehda hone ke baad ... magar ek aurat tabhi maa banti hai jab bacha uske garb mein aata hai
englishDialogue: A man becomes a father after the child is born ... but a woman becomes a mother right when the child is conceived in her womb

dialogue: Rokda rokde ko kheenchta hai ... rokda jab rokde se milta hai toh aur rokda pehda karta hai
englishDialogue: Money attracts money ... when money connects with money then it gives birth to more money

dialogue: Kuch log umar ke saath badhte hai aur kuch log bighadte hai
englishDialogue: Some people grow with age and some people turn bad

dialogue: Bhagwan ke bharose mat baithye ... kya pata bhagwan humre bharose baitha ho
englishDialogue: Don't sit and wait around for God to do something ... who knows God is probably waiting for us to do something

dialogue: Shandar, zabardast, zindabad!
englishDialogue: Splendid, amazing, live long!

dialogue: Tohar ko itna chahte hai, itna chahte hai, itna chahte hai, itna chahte hai, itna chahte hai ... kitna chahte hai ka batayen ... seena cheer ke  dikhayen Bajrangbali jaisa?
englishDialogue: I love you so much, love you so much, love you so much, love you so much, love you so much ... how should I tell you how much I love you ... should I tear apart my heart like Lord Hanuman?

dialogue: Jab tak todenge nahi ... tab tak chhodenge nahi
englishDialogue: Until I break it ... till then I won't leave it

dialogue: Itna pyar karte hai, itna pyar karte hai tohra ke ... itna ki koi pahad rok na sake ... itna ke aasmaan mein samaa na sake ... itna ki koi soch bhi na sake
englishDialogue: I love you so much, I love you so much ... that no mountain can stop me ... that it can't fit in the sky ... that no one can even think about it

dialogue: Shudh shakahari, dal bhaat tarkaari ... sab maal sarkari
englishDialogue: It's pure vegeterian, lentil soup and rice ... and it everything belongs to the government

dialogue: Main woh Raghuram Rathod nahi joh kanoon ke dayire mein rehkar nainsaafi bardasht karega ... main woh Mr. X hoon joh kanoon todkar insaaf karega
englishDialogue: I'm not Raghuram Rathod who will stay within the limits of law and tolerate injustice ... I'm Mr. X who will break the law and do justice

dialogue: Joh tha jalkar khaak ho gaya, ab sirf ek saaya hoon ... Mr. X naam hai mera, tumhari maut bankar aaya hoon
englishDialogue: Whatever I had got burnt into ashes, now I'm only a soul ... my name is Mr. X and I've come as your as death

dialogue: Agar shaitan chupkar kaam kar raha hai ... toh bhagwan ko bhi chupkar kaam karna hoga
englishDialogue: If the devil is hiding and doing his work ... then even god will have to hide and do his work

dialogue: Arjun ko toh Krishna ki zaroorat hamesha padti hai ... lekin kabhi kabhi Krishna ko bhi Arjun ki zaroorat padti hai
englishDialogue: Arjun always needs help from Lord Krishna ... but sometimes even Lord Krishna needs help from Arjun

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi insaaf karne ke liye nainsaafi karni padti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes to do justice you have to do injustice

dialogue: Death aur shit ... yeh do cheezen kisi ko, kahin bhi, kabhi bhi aa sakti hai
englishDialogue: Death and shit ... these two things can come to anyone, anywhere, anytime

dialogue: Insaan ka emotion uska motion ke saath juda hua hai
englishDialogue: The emotion of a person is connected with his motion

dialogue: Haram ka paisa jab aata hai na ... toh insaan harami ban jata hai
englishDialogue: When illegal money comes along ... then a person becomes a bastard

dialogue: Jaise bajhti hai ghanti ... vaise hai meri pyari pyari aunty
englishDialogue: The way a bell rings ... just like that my aunt is sweet

dialogue: Koi hum mein sant kehta hai, koi kehta hai farishta, koi kehta hai guru, toh koi kehta hai bhagwan ... lekin hum toh hai sirf ek insaan
englishDialogue: Some call me a saint, some call me an angel, some call me a teacher, and some call me god ... but I'm just a human

dialogue: Hum aaise baap hai joh dushmanon ke liye akele hi kaafi hai
englishDialogue: I'm such a father who is himself more than enough for the enemies

dialogue: Hum mein maarna apne aap ko maarne ke barabar hai
englishDialogue: Killing me is the equivalent of killing yourself

dialogue: Agar desh mein srishti ke seva karna paap hai ... toh yeh paap hum aakhri saans tak karte rahenge
englishDialogue: If it's a sin in the country to serve the universe ... then I'll commit this sin till my last breathe

dialogue: Insaan ki pehchaan kapdon se nahi ... karam jogi aur gyan jogi hone se hoti hai
englishDialogue: A person is not valued by his clothes ... he is valued by his deeds and his knowledge

dialogue: Ho prithvi saaf ... mitte rog abhishaap!
englishDialogue: Clean planet earth ... to remove diseases and curses!

dialogue: Har family mein problem hai ... par woh khush naseeb hai jinki family hoti hai
englishDialogue: In every family there are problems ... but those who have a family are lucky

dialogue: Kisi ke haath chalte hai toh kisi ke pair ... hamare dono chalte hai
englishDialogue: Some people move their hands and some move their legs ... I can move both

dialogue: Saari shikayatein ek saath likhva dijiye ... mooch, shirt, tie, pant, underwear, banyan, kuch mat chhodiye ... dhajjiyan udha dijiye ... lekin pyar nahi karta, yeh mat likhvaiye
englishDialogue: Note down all your complaints against me ... moustache, shirt, tie, pant, underwear, banyan, don't leave anything ... tear me apart ... but don't say that I don't love you

dialogue: Ravan ke saare paap karenge zero ... maryada purushottam hamare hero
englishDialogue: He will turn the sins of Ravana into zero ... our great Lord Ram as a hero

dialogue: Tumhe roothne ka poora haq hai ... lekin tumhe manane ka adhikaar mujhse koi nahi cheen sakta
englishDialogue: You have the full right to be upset ... but no one can snatch the right to coax you from me

dialogue: Sacha pyar honthon pe nahi, aankhon mein basta hai ... aur aapke pyar ki sachai aapki aankhen saaf bata rahi hai
englishDialogue: True love resides in the eyes and not on the lips ... and your eyes are clearly telling the truth of your love

dialogue: Rishton mein ek baar daraar padh jaaye ... toh zindagiyan lag jaati unhe bharne mein
englishDialogue: Once a dividing line is formed between relationships ... then multiple life's are needed to fill them up

dialogue: Raat is the best time of the day
englishDialogue: Nightime is the best time of the day

dialogue: Bahar Nana Patekar, andar Amol Palekar!
englishDialogue: You're Nana Patekar from outside and Amol Palekar from inside!

dialogue: Hum insaan hamesha kisi aur ki zindagi churake jeena chahte hai ... yeh fitrat hai hamari
englishDialogue: We humans always want to steal someone else's life and live that ... that's our nature

dialogue: Main sochti hoon ki kya tum sach mein woh ho joh log kehte hai ... ya log joh kehte hai tum woh banne ki koshish kar rahe ho
englishDialogue: I'm thinking whether you are indeed that person what people say you are ... or what people say, you are trying to be that

dialogue: Log kehte hai ki kal main apni zindagi badal doonga, lekin kar nahi paate ... mera kal aa gaya hai, lekin hum chahe jitna badal jaye ... hum mein apne beete huye kal ki keemat deni padti hai
englishDialogue: People say that tomorrow I'll change my life, but they are unable to do it ... my tomorrow has come, but no matter how much we change ... we have to pay the price of our past

dialogue: Baatein jhooti ho sakti hai ... kahaniyan nahi
englishDialogue: Conversations can be lies ... but not stories

dialogue: Ek achchi tasveer woh hoti hai joh poori kahani bata sake ... aur ek achchi kahani woh joh ek tasveer mein sama sake
englishDialogue: A good picture is the one that tells the whole story ... and a good story is the one that can be enclosed in one picture

dialogue: Zindagi ka asli shor uski khamoshiyon mein hi phassa hua milta hai kahin
englishDialogue: The real noise of life is found stuck somewhere in its silence
