dialogue: Joh baat hum mein samajh mein nahi aati ... woh hum mein sunai bhi nahi deti
englishDialogue: The things that we don't understand ... we don't even hear those things

dialogue: Yeh awaaz ek kutte ke mooh se bhi achchi lagegi
englishDialogue: This voice will sound good even from a dog's mouth

dialogue: Jab hum kisi cheez ko bahut, bahut, bahut, bahut, bahut chahte hai na ... toh woh mil hi jaati hai
englishDialogue: When we love something very much ... then we do get it eventually

dialogue: Hai koi pani joh chadti hai whiskey ke bina ... pani needs whiskey ... whiskey mein zaroorat nahi kiski
englishDialogue: Is there any water that intoxicates without whiskey ... water needs whiskey ... whiskey doesn't need anything

dialogue: Mujhse pehle zero, baad mein bhi zero ... bas beech mein hero ... kyun ki zero ke peeche ek hero hota hai
englishDialogue: You were a zero before me, and will be a zero after me ... it's just that you are a hero in between ... because behind a zero there is a hero

dialogue: Mere paas botal hai, glass hai, pani hai, pyas hai, chakna hai, chicken hai ... par meri daru kiske paas hai yaar?
englishDialogue: I have a bottle, a glass, water, thirst, snacks, chicken ... but who has my alcohol?

dialogue: Har partnership mein hamesha ek partner ka talent doosre partner se thoda zyada hota hai
englishDialogue: In every partnership the talent of one partner is slightly more than the other one

dialogue: Jab audio ki vajah se video chalta hai ... usko picture kaise bula sakte hai ... it is not picture, it is mixture
englishDialogue: When a video runs based on it's audio ... then how can you call it a picture ... it's not a picture, it's a mixture

dialogue: Mujhe apne talent se zyada apni chahat pe bharosa tha
englishDialogue: I had more confidence on my passion than I had on my talent

dialogue: Is desh ki sabse badi problem population nahi, bhrashtachar nahi, gareebi nahi ... is desh ki sabse badi problem hai baatein
englishDialogue: The biggest problem of this country is not population, is not corruption, is not poverty ... the biggest problem of this country are the gossips

dialogue: Sach is the world's most powerful idea!
englishDialogue: Truth is the world's most powerful idea!

dialogue: Mamuli aadmi jab bada banta hai toh bada banta hai ... lekin ek handicap aadmi jab bada banta hai toh legend ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: When an ordinary person becomes big then he becomes big ... but when a handicap person becomes big then he becomes a legend

dialogue: Ishq-e-phillum, junoon-e-phillum, dard-e-phillum, davaa hai phillum, dua hai phillam ... salaam-e-phillum, salaam-e-phillum, salaam-e-phillum
englishDialogue: Films are my love, films are my passion, films cause pain, films themselves are the medicine, films are a blessing ... I salute to films, I salute to films, I salute to films

dialogue: Jab pani whiskey ke bina badh sakta hai ... toh soch whiskey pani ke bina kitna chad sakti hai
englishDialogue: When water can rise without whiskey ... then think how much can the whiskey intoxicate without water

dialogue: Jao jake film industry se poocho ki woh hum mein dhoondne mein itne late kyun ho gaye ... jao jake duniya waalon se poocho ki woh hamari awaaz sunane mein itne late kyun ho gaye ... jao jake sapno se poocho ki woh sach hone mein itne late kyun ho gaye
englishDialogue: Go and ask the film industry as to why was it so late in finding me ... go and ask the people of the world as to why were they so late in hearing my voice ... go and ask the dreams as to why were they so late in becoming a reality

dialogue: Pyar ek aaisi faltu cheez hai jisse apna keemti waqt dene par bhi ... return mein ek second hand gadhi bhi nahi milti
englishDialogue: Love is such a useless thing, which even after you give your precious time to it ... in return you don't even get a used watch

dialogue: Whiskey suddenly stop karne se liver ko shock mein heart attack ho sakta hai ... so no whiskey very risky
englishDialogue: If you suddenly stop whiskey then the liver can go in a shock and get a heart attack ... so no whiskey is very risky

dialogue: Kyun ki desh apni khud ki tandurusti ki raksha nahi kar sakta ... mujh jaise aadmi ko keetanu mittane padte hai ... naam hai Lifeboy, kaam hai desh ki tandurusti
englishDialogue: Since a country is not able to take care of it's own health by itself ... a person like me has to get rid of the insects ... my name is Lifeboy and my work is to take care of the country's health

dialogue: Save it for the Friday in the theatre ... taali bajegi everyday and later
englishDialogue: Save it for the Friday in the theatre ... there will be clapping everyday and later

dialogue: Woh mera landlord hai ... insaan ko land se lord ke paas pahunchta hai
englishDialogue: He is my landlord ... he takes a person from the land to the lord

dialogue: Twenty20 mein runs aur zindagi mein paisa ... aana zaroori hai ... kaise aa raha hai no one bothers
englishDialogue: Runs in Twenty20 cricket and money in life ... it's important that they come ... no one bothers how do they come

dialogue: Ab sharafat gayi tel lene!
englishDialogue: Now I don't care about honesty!

dialogue: Sahi kaam karna zaroori hai ... lekin yeh ensure karna zyada zaroori hai ki aapke saath koi galat kaam na kar sake
englishDialogue: It's important to do the right thing ... but it's more important to ensure that no one else can do wrong with you

dialogue: Adhoora kuch nahi chhodta main ... sharaab ho ya hisaab
englishDialogue: I don't leave anything incomplete ... be it alcohol or account

dialogue: Chidiyon se main baaz ladaun ... gidderon se main sher banaun ... sawa lakh se ek ladaun ... tabhe Gobind Singh naam kahaun
englishDialogue: I make the sparrows fight with the hawks ... I make lions out of wolves ... when one fights against many ... only then he is called as Gobind Singh (Guru)

dialogue: Ladkiyon ko nakhun sirf rang lagane ke liye nahi bhadana chahiye ... koi chhede toh uske chehre ko noch lena chahiye
englishDialogue: Girls should grow their nails not only to colour them ... but also to use it to scratch the face of someone who teases them

dialogue: Koi bole Ram-Ram, koi khudaye, koi sevegosaiya, koi alaye ... rab ko manne ke tarike aur jagah alag alag ho sakte hai ... par rab ka ghar ek hi hota hai
englishDialogue: Some say hail Lord Ram, some say hail Allah ... there can be many different ways and places to believe in God ... but God has only one house

dialogue: Singh jahan pair rakhta hai ... woh ilaaka uska ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Wherever Mr.Singh puts his feet ... that area becomes his

dialogue: Jhand fakeer, soovar ki aulaad, marjha saale kamine ... thank you!
englishDialogue: Worthless beggar, son of a pig, go and die you rascal ... thank you!

dialogue: Wahi kahani phir ek baar ... Majnu ne liye kapde phaad ... maar tamasha beech bazar
englishDialogue: It's the same story once again ... Mr. Majnu rips his clothes ... and total entertainment in the middle of the market

dialogue: Hum apne baare mein joh bhi kahenge jhoot kahenge ... aur jhoot ke sivah kuch nahi kahenge
englishDialogue: Whatever we say about us we will lie ... and we will say nothing but the lie

dialogue: Tu wohi hai joh subah ko office jaata hai aur shaam ko ghar aata hai ... boss ki daant khata hai aur kisi ko nahi batata hai
englishDialogue: You're the one who goes to office and comes home in the evening ... the one who gets a scolding from his boss and doesn't tell anyone

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi mere dil mein khayal aata hai ... itni zor se aata hai ki pant mein hi ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes a thought comes in my mind ... it comes with such a force that I pee in my pants

dialogue: Reebok nahi toh reebokey sahi
englishDialogue: If you didn't get the original Reebok (shoes) then you're alright with the duplicate

dialogue: Hum thode bewafaa kya hue ... aap toh badchalan ho gaye
englishDialogue: I became slightly dishonest ... and you became totally immoral

dialogue: Rishtey tab bante hai jab rishton ko sambhal ke rakha jaata hai
englishDialogue: Relationships are made when you maintain relations

dialogue: Chehre ki khushi, dil ki hassi, sharm-o-haya ... tujhpe vaar aaye hai tere deewane, jaane kya kya
englishDialogue: The happiness on the face, the smiling of the heart, the shyness ... who knows what all have your lovers lost in your love

dialogue: Hasratein Lucknow, basratein Kanpur ... surmayi hai Bareilly, aur kaatilana hai Rampur
englishDialogue: I desire for Lucknow, and live in Kanpur ... Bareilly is like kohl, and Rampur is killer

dialogue: Sex ... kaunsa sex? ... pichle baar 2013 mein Bhai Dooj ke time mein hua tha yeh
englishDialogue: Sex ... what sex? ... the last time we did it was in 2013 during the Bhai Dooj festival

dialogue: Dilli ka aadha pollution toh aashiqon ke wajah se ho raha hai
englishDialogue: Half the pollution in Delhi is due to lovers

dialogue: Adrak ho gaya yeh aadmi ... kahin se bhi badh raha hai
englishDialogue: This man has turned into ginger ... he is growing from anywhere

dialogue: Jhand kar diya hai meri zindagi ki!
englishDialogue: You have destroyed my life!

dialogue: Bata diye hai toh unki mardangi ko chhot lag jayegi ... aaise jahil hai mardangi ko sperm count se naapte hai
englishDialogue: If I tell him then his manlihood will be hurt ... he is such an ignorant person that he measures his manlihood with his sperm count

dialogue: Koi umeed bar nahi aati, koi soorat nazar nahi aati ... maut ka aana toh ek din mo-ayeeyan hai, neend kyun raat bhar nahi aati
englishDialogue: There is no hope to be found, there is no resolution to be sought ... death is destined to arrive one day, but why does sleep fail to come all night

dialogue: Hamari colony ki toh nikkar waali ladkiyon ne hum mein propose kiya hai ... tumhari wajah se humne mana kar diya sabko
englishDialogue: Girls from my colony who wear shorts have proposed me ... but I rejected all of them because of you

dialogue: Are you Salman Khan joh commitment issues chal rahe hai?
englishDialogue: Are you Salman Khan that you have commitment issues?

dialogue: Jab apne hi ghar mein ghumshuda naujawan ladka tanhaiyon sargoshiyan karta dikhai de ... jab kisi se baat karte hue uske alfaaz uska saath dene se inkar karde ... kisi ki yaad uski masroofiyat ban jaaye toh samjho ... he is in love
englishDialogue: When a young guy is seen lost and whispering alone in his own house ... when talking to someone his own words refuse to take his side ... when the memories of someone become his occupation then understand that ... he is in love

dialogue: Mummy daddy meri shaadi karva rahe hai ... Sunday ko ladke waale ghar aa rahe hai ... meri baraat mein tum bhi aao ... koi pyara sa tofha lao ... jee na jalao
englishDialogue: Mom and dad are getting me married ... the guy's family is coming to my house on Sunday ... you also come in my wedding procession ... bring some lovely gift ... and don't hurt my heart

dialogue: Yeh daur patthar khane waale Majnu ka nahi ... yeh daur us aashiq ka hai joh apni mehbooba ke liye seene par goliyan kha jaye
englishDialogue: This era doesn't belong to lover's who get pelted by stones ... this era belongs to lover's who can take a bullet in their body for their lover

dialogue: Aag, pani aur Bhaiji ke saath nahi khelna ... aag jalata hai, pani doobata hai aur Bhaiji tadpata hai
englishDialogue: Never play with fire, water and Bhaiji ... the fire will burn you, the water will drown you and Bhaiji will agonize you

dialogue: Kutte kabhi sher ka shikaar nahi karte ... sher jab dahadta hai toh kutte bhaukana bhool jaate hai
englishDialogue: Dogs never hunt a tiger ... and when a tiger roars then dogs forget about barking

dialogue: Joh Bhaiji ka parda phaash karta hai ... Bhaiji uske pet ka parda phaad dalta hai
englishDialogue: The one who exposes Bhaiji ... Bhaiji tears apart the curtain of his stomach

dialogue: Tujhe aaisi maut doonga ... ki teri kriya-karam ke liye tujhe kisi cheez ki zaroorat na padhe
englishDialogue: I will give you such a death ... that you won't need anything for your cremation

dialogue: Tujhe imaandari ki khujli lag gayi hai ... zindagi bhar khujate khujate mar jayega ... lekin haath tere kuch nahi aayega
englishDialogue: You have itching from honesty ... you'll itch for your entire life and die ... but you'll get nothing in your hands

dialogue: Janbaaz kalakaron se nahi hai duniya khali ... is mard ke liye bajao ek baar zordar taali
englishDialogue: The world is not short of brave performers ... now clap your hands loudly for this man

dialogue: Insaan toh waqt ki tarah hota hai ... badalte hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: A human is like time ... he keeps changing

dialogue: Log pyar mein zindagi haar jaate hai, aap ek inkaar se haar gaye?
englishDialogue: People lose their life in love, and you're losing from one rejection?

dialogue: Zindagi toh dhoop chaon ki tarah hoti hai ... is mein agar bure log hai, toh achche log bhi hote hai
englishDialogue: Life is like sunlight and shade ... if there are bad people in it, then there are good people as well

dialogue: Ek maa jise doodh pilati hai ... uske saaye tak ko pehchanti hai
englishDialogue: A mother who feeds her child milk ... knows even the shadow of him

dialogue: Alla re alla inspector Bhinde alla ... haath mein leke kanoon ka tala
englishDialogue: Inspector Bhinde has come ... with the lock of the law in his hands

dialogue: Jis bete ke sar par apni maa ka aashirwad ho ... usse tum jaise shaitan toh kya bhagwan bhi nahi maar sakte
englishDialogue: The son who has the blessings of his mother on his head ... even god can't kill him, let alone a devil like you

dialogue: Prem ki koi seema nahi hoti aur naa hi uska koi wazan hota hai ... prem ka koi hisaab kitaab nahi hota ... is liye toh kehte hai ki prem hi ishwar hai aur ishwar hi prem
englishDialogue: Love doesn't have any boundaries and neither can you weigh it ... also love doesn't have any accounts ... that's why it's said that love is god and god is love

dialogue: Mujhpe aaisa aarop ... ab dekh mera prakop
englishDialogue: Such an allegation is put on me ... now see my fury

dialogue: Tum kya samajhte ho kanoon koi khilona hai, mujrimon ke samne bauna hai? ... arre ab toh wohi hoga joh hona hai
englishDialogue: Do you think the law is a toy, a dwarf in front of criminals? ... now only that will happen what is suppose to happen

dialogue: Atyachari, durachari ... tu jaanta hai main hoon bal-brahmachari
englishDialogue: You oppressive, vicious person ... you know that I'm a celibate

dialogue: Janam ka pata nau mahine pehle chal jaata hai ... magar marne ka pata nau second pehle bhi nahi chalta
englishDialogue: The birth of a human is known nine months in advance ... but the death of a human is not even known till the last nine seconds of life

dialogue: Kriya karam ka samaan koi bhi khareed ke laye ... magar kaam uske aata hai jiska waqt aaya ho
englishDialogue: It doesn't matter who buys the stuff needed for a funeral ... but it's only useful for someone whose time has ended

dialogue: Baap, baap hota hai ... beta dus janam lene ke baad bhi baap ka baap nahi ban sakta
englishDialogue: A father will always be a father ... even if a son goes through ten rebirths, but still he won't become the father of his father

dialogue: Supari ka paisa kha jaane wale ko ... Shiva supari ki tarah kha jaata hai
englishDialogue: The one who steals the money given for a killing job ... Shiva eats him up like a betalnut

dialogue: Main apne shikaar ko kabhi sote hue nahi maarta ... jagakar maarta hoon ... taki marte waqt usse shikayat na rahe ke maine usse apni zindagi bachane ka mauka nahi diya
englishDialogue: I never kill my prey while he's sleeping ... I kill him after waking him up ... so that while dying he doesn't have a complaint that I didn't give him the opportunity of saving his own life

dialogue: Duniya ki nazar mein mare hue log kabhi zinda nahi hote ... varna zindagi khud pareshaan ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: In the eyes of the world the dead people don't come back ... otherwise life itself gets distressed

dialogue: Rasam nibhane ke liye havan mein ghee dalna hi padta hai ... lekin phir ussi aag se ghar bhi jalaya ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: To follow the procedure one has to add clarified butter to the homa (ritual) ... but with that same fire one can burn the house down also

dialogue: Mohabbat reet rivaaz nahi maanti ... aur na hi woh lafzo ki mohtaj hai
englishDialogue: Love does not believe in customs and traditions ... and neither is it dependent on words

dialogue: Yeh daulat bhi kya cheez hai ... jiske pass jitni bhi aati hai ... kam hi lagti hai
englishDialogue: Money is so strange ... no matter how much one gets ... it just doesn't seem enough

dialogue: Main markar bhi na mar saka ... aur na hi jeekar jee sakta hoon
englishDialogue: I did not die even after being dead ... and neither can I live being alive

dialogue: Waqt ke aage kisi ki nahi chalti ... isliye waqt par hi chod dijiye
englishDialogue: No one can be over time ... hence leave it to time itself

dialogue: Hum us desh ke waasi hai jis desh mein Ganga behti hai ... aur jis desh mein bahu apne saas sasur ke samne sar par pallu daal ke rehti hai
englishDialogue: I am from the country where the Ganga (river) flows ... and from the country where a daughter-in-law wheres a veil on her head in front of her mother-in-law and father-in-law

dialogue: Wah, kya saas ho tum ... abhi tak bahu ke haath ki mehandi nahi chhooti ... aur tumne apna rang dikhana shuru kar diya
englishDialogue: Wow, what a mother-in-law you are ... the henna on your daughter-in-laws hand has not yet gone ... and you have started to show your colors

dialogue: Aye buddhe ... pet mein aant nahi hai, mooh mein daant nahi hai ... chumma lega?
englishDialogue: You old man ... you don't have tripes in your stomach, you don't have teeth in your mouth ... and you want a kiss?

dialogue: Tu mera dulha toh kya ... kisi ka dalaal banne ke layak bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Forget being my bridegroom ... you are not even worth becoming a broker for anyone

dialogue: Khud laat marte ho aur mujhe gadha kehte ho?
englishDialogue: You yourself kick and you call me a donkey?

dialogue: Aaj ke baad woh jagega toh maa kahega, soyega toh maa kahega, jeeyega toh maa kahega ... aur marega tab bhi maa kahega
englishDialogue: From today when he wakes up he will say mother, when he sleeps he will say mother, when he lives he will say mother ... and when he dies then to he will say mother

dialogue: Maine bhi tum logon ka tel nahi nikaal diya ... toh main bhi apne baap ki beti nahi
englishDialogue: If I don't remove oil from you guys ... then I am not a daughter of my father

dialogue: Hum toh gulaab lene gaye the ... yahan toh guldasta hi haath mein aa gaya
englishDialogue: I was trying to get a rose ... but the whole bouquet came in my hand

dialogue: Malik banna hai toh kheto mein kaam kar ... kyun ki asli khazana kitaabon mein nahi, zameen mein chupa hai beta
englishDialogue: Son, if you want to become a boss then work in the farms ... because the real treasure is not hidden in the books, it is in the ground

dialogue: Saabit kar diya tune aaj ... ki mujh jaisi nagin ki kokh se ... tujh jaisa sapola hi paida ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: Today you proved it ... that from the belly of a snake lady like me ... only a baby snake like you can be born

dialogue: Itna roye, itna roye ... laga jaise municipality ka gutter phat gaya ho
englishDialogue: He cried so much, so much ... that it felt as if a municipality gutter broke

dialogue: Lalach ki zameen par daulat ki fasal kabhi nahi ughti
englishDialogue: The crop of money never grows on the land of greed

dialogue: Daulat insaan ki zaroorat hoti hai ... lekin agar woh kamzori ban jaye, toh phir musibat ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: Money is a persons necessity ... but if it becomes his weakness, then it turns into problems

dialogue: Pyar mohabbat ka rishta ... kisi pabandi ka mohtaj nahi hota
englishDialogue: The relationship of love ... is not dependent on any limitation

dialogue: Kehte hai gusse mein ladki ki khubsoorati aur badh jaati hai
englishDialogue: It is said that a girl looks more beautiful when she is angry

dialogue: Adhikar maange se nahi milta ... usse cheenna padta hai
englishDialogue: You don't get your right by asking ... you have to snatch it

dialogue: Shaitaan chahe mahal mein rahe yah jhopde mein ... woh shaitaan hi kehlata hai
englishDialogue: Whether a devil resides in a mansion or a hut ... he is still called a devil only

dialogue: Girne waala gehrai thodi dekhta hai
englishDialogue: The one who falls does not see the depth

dialogue: Daulat ki jung mein toh sab jayaz hai
englishDialogue: Everything is fair in the war of money

dialogue: Haai is ada pe kaun na mar jaye khuda ... ke ladte hai aur haath mein talwar bhi nahi
englishDialogue: Oh god who will not die on this style ... she fights and she doesn't even have a sword in her hand

dialogue: Sharaab peena bahut zaroori hai ... varna zindagi adhoori hai
englishDialogue: Drinking alcohol is very important ... or else life is incomplete

dialogue: Tune ek kadam bhi aage badhaya toh talwarein chal jayengi ... aur tere is saathi ki choti choti botiyan banke hawa mein bikhar jayengi
englishDialogue: Even if you move one step forward then the swords will be used ... and your partner will be cut into pieces and he'll be scattered in the air

dialogue: Insaan dil ke haathon majboor hai ... aur dil ke haathon kyun majboor hai woh sirf dil jaanta hai ... kyun ki dil, dil hi toh hai
englishDialogue: A human is compelled by his heart ... and only the heart knows as to why he is compelled by his heart ... because the heart is nothing but a heart

dialogue: Bada kamzarf hota hai woh pyar ... joh apne buzurgon ka khoon bahakar ... apne pyar ke maathe par tilak laga de
englishDialogue: That love is highly ungenerous ... which sheds the blood of its elders ... and applies a dot on the forehead of their love

dialogue: Kya cheez hai yeh aansun bhi ... aaisa lagta hai jaise barson ka bhukhaar joh mann mein bhara hua tha ... in do qatre aansuyon mein behke nikal gaya
englishDialogue: Tears are such a strange thing ... it feels that the fever that was accumulated for years in this heart ... that has flown out with these two tears

dialogue: If you want to be what you want to be ... be what you want to be ... and to be what you want to be ... believe what you want to be
englishDialogue: If you want to be what you want to be ... be what you want to be ... and to be what you want to be ... believe what you want to be

dialogue: Tera bhi jawaab nahi uparwaale ... chokri na mili, naukri mil gayi ... stree na mili, istree mil gayi
englishDialogue: God you're great ... I didn't find a girl, but I found a job ... I didn't find a woman, but I found an iron

dialogue: Mere liye Lakshmi Devi, Saraswati Devi, Durga Devi, Kali Devi, duniya ki har devi joh hai ... woh hai insaaf ki devi
englishDialogue: For me goddess Lakshmi, goddess Saraswati, goddess Durga, goddess Kali, every goddess of the world ... is the goddess of justice

dialogue: Mujh jaise vakil se kabhi mat lena panga ... varna kapde pehne rahoge aur duniya samjhegi nanga
englishDialogue: Don't you ever confront a lawyer like me ... or else you'll be wearing clothes but the world will consider you naked

dialogue: Mere bedroom ka darwaza bhi meri tarah romantic hai ... ladki andar aa jaye aur jab tak romance poora na ho ... tab tak khulta hi nahi hai
englishDialogue: The door of my bedroom is romantic like me ... once a girl comes in and till the romance is not over ... it doesn't open until then

dialogue: Aaj agar samaaj se apradh ko khatam karna hai toh usse jadh se mitana hoga ... us pedh ko hi kaatna hoga jispar apradh ke phal pehda hote hai ... aur woh pedh tu hai
englishDialogue: Today if we want to end crime in the society then we'll have to eradicate it from its roots ... we'll have to cut the tree on which the fruits of crime grow ... and you are that tree

dialogue: Jab main tumse pehli baar mili thi, main nahi jaanti thi ki tum kaun ho ... lekin jab tumhe dekha toh aise laga jaise ... tumhara hi intezaar tha
englishDialogue: When I met you for the first time, I didn't know who you were ... but when I saw you I felt as if ... I was waiting for you

dialogue: Aakhri chand second hi toh haar aur jeet ka faisla karte hai
englishDialogue: The last few seconds make the decision between winning and losing

dialogue: Jis insaan ne pehli baat jhoot se shuru ki ho ... usse kisi aur ko jhoota kehne ka koi haq nahi hai
englishDialogue: The person who started the first conversation with a lie ... he has no right to call someone else a liar

dialogue: Ye mauka haath se mat jaane dena ... jhappi maar ke pappi le lena
englishDialogue: Don't let this opportunity go by ... hug her and take a kiss

dialogue: Ek ek kona toh sabke paas hai ... magar ladki kisi ko bhi nahi milti
englishDialogue: Everyone has one corner ... but no one has a girl

dialogue: Itna mat sooch ... sooch gehri ho jaaye ... toh faisle kamzor ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: Don't think so much ... if the thoughts become deep ... then the decisions become weak

dialogue: Faanoos banke jiski hifaazat hawa kare ... woh shama kya bhuje jise roshan khuda kare
englishDialogue: When a lamp gets protection from the wind ... then no one can blow the candle that is lit by God

dialogue: Jahil ki baaton ka jawaab ... khamoshi hota hai
englishDialogue: The reply to an uneducated persons question ... is silence

dialogue: Chaudwee ka chaand ho ya aaftab ho ... joh bhi ho tum khuda ki kasam lajawab ho
englishDialogue: Are you the full moon or the sun ... whatever you are, I swear to God, you are stupendous

dialogue: Cheel ki chaunch mein angoor, khuda ki kudrat ... pehlu-e-hoor mein langoor, khuda ki kudrat
englishDialogue: The presence of a grape in the beak of a vulture, is Gods act ... and a monkey inside a human, is also Gods act

dialogue: Chuha sher ka mooch ke baal se khelne ka himmat tabhi karta hai ... jab sher lohe ka zanjeer mein jakda hua ho
englishDialogue: A mouse dares to play with the whiskers of a tiger only when ... the tiger is tied up in iron shackles

dialogue: Pyar ka teer waqt ka mohtaj nahi hota
englishDialogue: The arrow of love is not dependent of time

dialogue: Sar zameen-e-Hindustan, as-salaam alaykum ... mera naam Badshah Khan hai ... ishq mera mazhab, mohabbat mera imaan ... mohabbat, jiske liye Farhad ne pahadon ka seena cheer kar dhood ka dariya baha diya ... mohabbat, jiske liye Majnu ne seharaon ki khaakh chaani ... ussi mohabbat ke liye Kabul ka yeh pathan sar zameen-e-Hindustan se mohabbat ka khair maangne aaya hai ... aazmayish kadi hai, imtihan mushkil, lekin hausla buland ... jeet hamesha mohabbat ka hua hai ... sadiyon se yehi hota aaya hai, yehi hoga ... khuda gawah hai!
englishDialogue: O land of India, my salutations to you ... my name is Badshah Khan ... love is my religion, love is my belief ... it's love, for which Farhad tore the heart of mountains to create a river of milk ... it's love, for which Majnu searched everywhere in the desert ... this pathan of Kabul has come to ask the land of India to grant him that same love ... the test is tough, the exam is difficult, but the hopes are high ... love has always won ... that has been happening since ages, and the same will continue ... God is a witness to that!

dialogue: Mere haath lohe ki zanjeer se nahi ... dosti ke dhaage se banda hai
englishDialogue: My hands are not tied with the shackles of iron ... they are tied with the thread of friendship

dialogue: Waqt aur kismat badalne mein derr nahi lagti
englishDialogue: It doesn't take long for time and fate to change

dialogue: Jin musafiron ki manzilein alag alag ho jaye ... woh saath saath nahi chala karte
englishDialogue: When the destination of the travelers becomes different ... then they don't travel together

dialogue: Dil ke zakhm, dawao se nahi bharte
englishDialogue: The wounds of the heart, don't heal with medicines

dialogue: Taqdeerein badalne ke liye ... ek lamha bhi kaafi hota hai
englishDialogue: To change destinies ... even a single moment is enough

dialogue: Darr aur dehshat ki eenton par hi daulat ka jhanda lehraya jaata hai
englishDialogue: The flag of money flies on the bricks of fear and terror

dialogue: Lambe lambe baal Bengal ke, sudol jism UP ka, gora rang Kashmir ka, kali kali aankhen Madras ki ... aaisa lagta hai jaisa pura Hindustan ek hi soorat mein sama gaya ho
englishDialogue: She has long hair from Bengal, beautiful body from UP (Uttar Pradesh), fair colour from Kashmir, black eyes from Madras ... it looks like the whole of India is collected in one person

dialogue: Yeh woh shehar hai jahan sasta khoon aur mehanga pani hai ... apni pyaas bhujane ka hai toh apne aasoon se bhuja ... aasoon pee aur jee
englishDialogue: This is a city in which blood is cheap and water is expensive ... if you want to fulfill your thirst then do that with your tears ... drink your tears and live

dialogue: Maine aasoon bechkar daulat nahi kamai ... joh aasoon dekhkar daulat luta doon
englishDialogue: I am not going to shell my wealth looking at the tears ... since I haven't sold my tears to make my wealth

dialogue: Jab kuch karne aur na karne dono mein hi risk ho ... toh kuch karna hi achcha hota hai
englishDialogue: When there is a risk in both doing and not doing something ... then it's better to do something

dialogue: Shyam hote hi tanhaiyan mujhe til-til maarne lagti hai ... aaise mein agar koi saathi saath na ho, toh aasoon bhi gale mil-mil behne lagte hai
englishDialogue: When the sun sets my loneliness starts to kill me slowly slowly ... and if someone is not with me at that time, then my tears start to flow drop by drop

dialogue: Saanp apne dushman ki tasveer apni aankhon mein utaar leta hai ... Bond apne dushmanon ka nishaan apne baazu saja leta hai ... apna apna style hai
englishDialogue: A snake prints the photo of his enemy in his eyes ... and Bond decorates the mark of his enemies on his hand ... everyone has their own style

dialogue: Kaali billi bhi agar mera rasta kaat jaye toh mujhe kuch nahi hoga ... balki woh mar jayegi
englishDialogue: Nothing will happen to me even if a black cat cuts my path ... instead the cat will die

dialogue: Tumne mere bhai ke jism se jitne khoon ke katre bahaye hai ... main tumhare jism ko cheerkar utne hi hisson mein baant doonga
englishDialogue: The number of blood drops that you have shed of my brother ... I'll cut and distribute that many pieces of your body

dialogue: Ek maa ki fariyad jab woh dil cheerkar, aasunyon se nahakar nikalti hai ... toh joh cheez aag aur tezaab se jalti ... usse jala deti hai
englishDialogue: When the appeal of a mother comes out tearing the heart and bathing in tears ... then it can even burn the thing ... which doesn't get burnt by fire and acid

dialogue: Khoobsurat ladkiyan aur machliyan ek jaisi nahi hoti ... unhe pakadne ke liye kuch aaisi chaalein chalni padti hai, jisse woh pakad mein aa jaye ... aur agar woh na aaye toh khud unke paas jaana padta hai
englishDialogue: Pretty girls and fishes are not the same ... you have to play some smart moves to catch them, so that they come in captivity ... and if they themselves do not come then we ourselves have to go to them

dialogue: Peetal par sone ka pani chadene se ... peetal sona nahi ban jaata
englishDialogue: By applying a gold coating on brass ... brass doesn't turn into gold

dialogue: Jaako raakhe saaiya maar sake na koi ... aur jaako maare saaiya usse bacha sake na koi
englishDialogue: No one can harm the one who is protected by god himself ... and the one whose life god is supposed to take, no one can save him

dialogue: Main sirf teri jaan lena nahi chahta ... main yeh chahta hoon ki tu tadap tadapkar mare ... guzarne waala har pal tujhse kahe ki yamdoot tere peeche peeche aa rahe hai
englishDialogue: I don't just want to take your life ... I want that you should suffer and die ... and every moment that passes by should tell you that the god of death is coming behind you

dialogue: Parampara ko na koi talwar kaat sakti hai, na koi aag jala sakti aur na waqt badal sakta hai
englishDialogue: Tradition can't be cut by any sword, it can't be burned by any fire and neither can time change it

dialogue: Jab main aankhen bandh karti hoon aapki tasveer mere samne aati hai ... jab main saans leti hoon aapki khushboo aati hai ... jab main soo jaati hoon aap mere sapno mein aa jaate hai
englishDialogue: When I close my eyes then your picture comes in front of me ... when I breath then your fragrance comes ... when I sleep then you come in my dreams

dialogue: Dosti do tareekon se hoti hai ... ya toh bachpan mein saath khelen ho ... ya sirf pehli mulaqat mein
englishDialogue: Friendship can happen in two ways ... either if you have played together in childhood ... or else in the first meeting

dialogue: Band karo yeh yudh ... is yudh ki jeet mein bhi haar hai aur haar mein bhi haar hai
englishDialogue: Stop this battle ... there is a loss in winning this battle and there is loss in losing as well

dialogue: Tawaif aur titli mein koi farak nahi hota ... titli bhi ek phool par nahi tikti aur tawaif ek mard par
englishDialogue: There is no difference between a prostitute and a butterfly ... a butterfly doesn't stick to one flower and a prostitute doesn't stick to one man

dialogue: Ek aurat jab tak maa nahi banti ... woh adhoori rehti hai
englishDialogue: Until a woman becomes a mother ... she remains incomplete

dialogue: Agar sharifon ki betiyon ke liye pati ka ghar puja ka mandir hai ... toh tawaifon ki betiyon ke liye toh pati ka ghar na jaane kitne mandiron ki pujaon ka phal hai
englishDialogue: If for the daughters of honest people their husbands house is a temple for worship ... then for the daughters of prostitutes their husbands house is a fruit from many a prayers from many a temples

dialogue: Pyar ke mamle mein aur khane ke mamle mein ... doosre ki marzi mein apni marzi ki taang nahi adana chahiye
englishDialogue: When it comes to love and food ... you should not force your wishes upon the wishes of others

dialogue: Haai gul-e-gulzar, jaan-e-bahar ... vaise kaafi ho vazandar
englishDialogue: You are the flower of my garden, spring of my life ... but you're quite heavy

dialogue: Shukriya toh gairon ka ada kiya jaata hai ... apno ka nahi
englishDialogue: You should say thanks to strangers ... not your own people

dialogue: Degree se sirf certificate milta hai ... akal nahi
englishDialogue: A degree only gets you a certificate ... not the brains

dialogue: Agar main chota kaam karoonga na ... toh chota hi ban kar reh jaonga
englishDialogue: If I do small work ... then I will remain small

dialogue: Is Bambai shehar mein jhagda karne se sar phoote na phoote ... lekin mohabbat karne se dil tootne ka guarantee
englishDialogue: In the city of Mumbai when you fight, your head might break ... but if you fall in love, your heart is guaranteed to break

dialogue: Saatve asmaan ko choone ki koshish karte karte ... yeh main pataal mein pahunch gaya hoon
englishDialogue: In my attempt to touch the skies ... I have reached the hades

dialogue: Sachai aur imaandari ki buniyaad par jhoot aur fareb ka mahal bahut dino tak nahi tik sakta ... woh gir jaata hai
englishDialogue: The mansion of lie and cheat cannot stand for long on the foundation of truth and honesty ... it will fall eventually

dialogue: Sunday ke baad monday, rupaye ke char ande ... khaye kisi aur ne dande, ab raj kar rahe hai mushtande
englishDialogue: After sunday comes monday, you get 4 eggs with one rupee ... someone was hit by the sticks, and the big people are ruling

dialogue: Phatte huye joote ke chedh se us paar dekhoge na, haqeeqat nazar aayegi ... joota bada duniya choti nazar aayegi ... kismat phatke haath mein aa jayegi
englishDialogue: When you see from the hole in a shoe sole, then you will see the truth ... the shoe will look big and the world will look small ... and your fate will become a reality

dialogue: Assi tussi piyange lassi
englishDialogue: You and I shall drink buttermilk

dialogue: Sadak pe tamasha karne waala aur dekhne waala ... dono ka taqdeer kharab hai
englishDialogue: People who performs on the street and people who watch that ... both have bad fate

dialogue: Yeh duniya banane waala apni hi duniya mein aakar besahara ho gaya ... tu kis khet ki mooli hai?
englishDialogue: Even the creator of this world became helpless when he came in this world ... then who the hell are you?

dialogue: Hindu ko namaskar nahi bolega, Musalman ko salaam nahi karega, Christian ko good morning nahi bolega ... kyun ki apan yahan language ka lafda karne nahi aiyla
englishDialogue: I will not say welcome to the Hindu, I will not salute to the Muslim, I will not wish good morning to the Christian ... because I haven't come here to cause any language issues

dialogue: Aaise naukri kaise milegi bhai ... is ulti duniya ko sar ke bal khade hokar dekhoge toh seedhi nazar aayegi ... apni arzi par wazan nahi rakha, hawa mein udh jayegi
englishDialogue: How can you get a job like this ... this upside down world will appear straight if you stand on your head ... and if you don't put weight (money) on your application then it will fly away

dialogue: Jab mujhpar koi haath uthata hai toh mera sar phir jaata hai ... aur jab mera sar phir jaata hai toh main saamne waale ki duniya phira deta hoon
englishDialogue: When someone raises their hand on me then my mind spins ... and when my mind spins then I spin the world of the person who attacks me

dialogue: Maa ki mamta aulad ki zindagi ke liye amrit hai ... lekin jab woh mamta andhi ho jaye toh zehar ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: A mother's love is a divine syrup for the life of her child ... but when that love becomes blind, then it turns into poison

dialogue: Jawaani ki pasand ko tajurba aur dil ki pasand ko dimaag agar tol le ... toh thokar nahi lagti
englishDialogue: If experience balances the choice of youth and the mind balances the choice of the heart ... then you don't stumble

dialogue: Hum jurm ki duniya ka colonel hoon
englishDialogue: I am colonel of the world of crime

dialogue: Bazaar mein behti tawaif aur aapke kanoon ke rakhwaalon mein koi fark nahi hai ... fark hai toh sirf itna, ki woh apna jism bechti hai aur yeh apna imaan
englishDialogue: There is no difference between a prostitute sitting in the market and your people who protect the law ... and if there is a difference then it is only that, she sells her body and they sell their dignity

dialogue: Aadmi naujawan ho yah meri tarah tajurbekar ... raat ko aurat se jhagde mein kabhi nahi jeet sakta
englishDialogue: Whether a man is young or experienced like me ... at night he cannot win against a woman in a fight

dialogue: Bura joh kaam karta hai woh manzil se bhatakta hai ... kamina lakh baande boriyan, magar ek din atakta hai
englishDialogue: One who does bad things wanders away from the destination ... and no matter how many bags a scoundrel packs, but one day he gets stuck

dialogue: Yahan Punjabi hai, Gujarati hai, Marathi hai, Bangali hai ... lekin Hindustani koi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Here we have Punjabi, we have Gujrati, we have Marathi, we have Bengali ... but there is no Indian

dialogue: Mere mooh se nikla har lafz ... heere se zyada keemti hai
englishDialogue: Every word that comes out of my mouth ... is more expensive than a diamond

dialogue: Meri toh na usse Hello hai na Hi hai ... na jaan hai na pehchaan hai ... na dua hai na salaam hai
englishDialogue: I don't have any Hello or Hi with him ... neither do I know him either ... and neither do I pray or salute for him

dialogue: Har jagah mera hi number pehle aata hai
englishDialogue: My number comes first everywhere

dialogue: Maana ki kismat ne hara diya hai dost, par itne toh gunehgar nahi hum ... mare ek sipahi ki maut, kya iske bhi haqdar nahi hum
englishDialogue: I agree that I've lost due to luck, but I'm not such a culprit ... who doesn't even have the right to die a soldier's death

dialogue: Bechkar imaan kamai daulat toh insaan kya ... namak khaya jis watan ka, ussi ka na hua toh Musalman kya
englishDialogue: What good is a person who has made money by selling his honesty ... if you're not true to the country that gives you food, then you're not a Muslim

dialogue: Dong kabhi wrong nahi hota!
englishDialogue: Mr. Dong is never wrong!

dialogue: Jisne dil pe zakhm khaye ho, woh is zakhm se kya gabrayega ... peeye ho jisne khoon ke aasoon, kya woh is khoon se mar jayega
englishDialogue: The one whose heart is wounded, won't be scared of this wound ... the one who has drank tears of blood, won't die from this blood

dialogue: Apne matlab ke vaaste humne aasmano se kuch nahi maanga ... humne gulshan ki khair maangi hai koi takht-o-taj nahi maanga
englishDialogue: I've never asked the sky anything for myself ... I've asked for good wishes of the garden and not some throne or crown

dialogue: Badalne waali hum cheez nahi ... arre hum mard hai, koi kameez nahi
englishDialogue: I'm not someone who will change ... I'm a man and not a shirt

dialogue: Jab jab koi Dong jaisa kamina apne napaak irradon ke liye ... aatankwad ki talwar lekar Hindustan mein tahalka machayega ... toh Hindustani sipahi bhi uske mulk mein jakar ... uske tahalke ka jawab ussi tahalke se denge
englishDialogue: Whenever a rascal like Dong for his putrid intentions ... will use the sword of terrorism to create a sensation in India ... then even the Indian soldiers will go in his country ... and will create a sensation in response to his sensation

dialogue: Kaante sirf zakhm de sakte hai ... khushboo nahi de sakte
englishDialogue: Thorns can only give wounds ... not fragrance

dialogue: Abhi aaye, abhi behte, abhi daaman sambhala hai ... tumhari aulad bhi kya yaad karegi, ki chacha ne kya dum nikala hai
englishDialogue: You just came, you just sat, you barely settled down ... but your child will remember, what great uncle do they have

dialogue: Ladkon se agar ladna hai toh ladakpan mein aana hi padega ... pachpan se nikalkar bachpan mein aana hi padega
englishDialogue: If you want to fight with the boys then you will have to come in your boyhood ... from the age of 55 you will have to come in your childhood

dialogue: Har tasveer ek lamhe ko giraftar kar leti hai
englishDialogue: Every photo captures a moment in time

dialogue: Insaan ke jeevan ko tasveeron ka ek caravan samjho ... saikado tasveeron ka caravan
englishDialogue: Consider the life of a person as a caravan of photos ... a caravan of many photos

dialogue: Apna toh ussool hai ... pehle laat, phir baat, uske baad mulaqat
englishDialogue: My rule is ... first kick, then talk, and then meet

dialogue: Hum kisi se bhi, kisi waqt bhi, kahin bhi mil sakte hain ... hamara jab dil chahe
englishDialogue: I can meet anyone, anytime, anywhere ... whenever I want to

dialogue: Hum tumhe woh maut denge ... joh na to kisi kanoon ki kitaab mein likhi hogi ... aur na hi kabhi kisi mujrim ne soochi hogi
englishDialogue: I will give you such a death ... which is not written in any books of law ... and neither would have ever been imagined by anyone guilty

dialogue: Hamari zabaan bhi hamari goli ki tarah ... dushmanon se seedhe baat karti hai
englishDialogue: Just like my bullet, my tongue also ... talks straight to my enemies

dialogue: Hum aankhon se soorma nahin churate ... hum aankhen hi chura lete hain
englishDialogue: I don't steal color from the eyes ... I steal the eyes themselves

dialogue: Na talwaar ki dhaar se, na goliyon ki bauchaar se ... banda darta hai toh, sirf parvar digaar se
englishDialogue: Neither the sharpness of a sword, nor the rain of bullets ... the only thing that scares me, is the might of God

dialogue: Yeh commando bada khatarnaak hai ... tumhara baap hai
englishDialogue: This commando is very dangerous ... he is your father

dialogue: Yeh toh laal mirch hai teekhi teekhi ... haath lagao toh haath jale ... mooh lagao toh mooh jale ... dil lagao toh dil jale
englishDialogue: She is red chilly, spicy spicy ... touch it and it will burn the hand ... eat it and it will burn the mouth ... love it and it will burn the heart

dialogue: Joh bhaari nah ho ... woh dushmani hi kya
englishDialogue: If it ain't heavy ... then that enmity is not great

dialogue: Maratha marta hai yah maarta hai
englishDialogue: A Marathi man either dies or kills

dialogue: Apna toh ussool hai ... pehle mulaqat, phir baat, aur phir agar zaroorat pare toh laat
englishDialogue: My rule is ... first meet, then talk, and then if needed kick

dialogue: Tujhe aaisi maut maroonga ... ki teri paapi atma agle saat janam tak, kisi doosre shareer mein ghusne ke pehle kaanp uthegi
englishDialogue: I will kill you in such a way ... that for the next 7 lives your sinful soul, will shiver before entering another body

dialogue: Kaunsa kanoon, kaisa kanoon ... yeh kanoon toh chand mujrimon ki rakhail ban behta hai
englishDialogue: Which law, what law ... this law has become a mistress of a few criminals

dialogue: Sache police ki ya toh maut hoti hai ... ya toh suspend kiya jaata hai
englishDialogue: A real policeman either dies ... or he gets suspended

dialogue: Pandra sau ki naukri karne waala ... ek din tujhe dedh sau ka kafan pehnayega
englishDialogue: A person who does his job for Rs.1500 ... one day will make you wear a shroud of Rs.150

dialogue: Yeh Delhi bas mooh hai is liye batar-batar karti rehti hai ... yeh karna hai, yeh hona chahiye, hum mein dikhana hai ... bas dil ko tasalli dene ke liye achcha lafz hai Delhi
englishDialogue: Delhi has a mouth and hence it keeps on talking ... we have to do this, this should be done, we have to show that ... Delhi is simply a good word to make your heart feel satisfied

dialogue: Hamara yeh pesha shatranj ki bisat se kam nahi ... chote se chote mohre ko maarne ke liye hum mein dekhna padta hai ... ki uska vazir kaun hai, badshah kaun hai
englishDialogue: Our business is nothing less than a chessboard ... where even to kill a small pawn we have to see ... who is his minister and who is his king

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi kahin ruk jana hi achcha hota hai ... varna manzil peeche reh jaati hai aur insaan aage nikal jaata hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes it is good to stop somewhere ... or else the person moves ahead and the destination stays behind

dialogue: Gussa insaan ka sabse bada dushman hai ... jisse gusse par kabu nahi, woh kisi cheez par kabu nahi rakh sakta ... gussa insaan ki akal ko kha jaata hai
englishDialogue: Anger is the biggest enemy of a person ... the one who can't control his anger, he won't be able to control anything else ... anger eats the brain of a person

dialogue: Aaj main apni hukumat ki adaalat ka gawah bankar, vakil bankar, judge bankar ... tum jaise khoon ka sauda karne waale saudagar ko sazaa deta hoon ... sazaaye maut
englishDialogue: Today I'll become the witness, the attorney, the judge of my rule ... and I'll give the punishment of death for people like you who do the business of blood ... the punishment of death

dialogue: Prem ki sabse badi kushalta yeh hai ... ki is mein lene waala bhi kuch deta hai aur dene waala bhi kuch paata hai
englishDialogue: The biggest proficiency of love is that ... in this the one who takes gives something and the one who gives gets something

dialogue: Main us haramzade ko aaisi bhayanak maut doonga ... ki kaali duniya ka har mujrim gaddari ke naam se kaanp uthega
englishDialogue: I'll give that bastard such a scary death ... that every criminal in the black world will shiver from the name of traitor

dialogue: Bandar ka gurda hamesha bandar ke andar hota hai
englishDialogue: The kidney of a monkey is always within the monkey

dialogue: Main khatam toh khel khatam
englishDialogue: If I am over, then the game is over

dialogue: Bhigada toh kuch nahi ... lekin bana zaroor sakta hai ... meri kismat
englishDialogue: He has not ruined anything ... but he can make something ... my destiny

dialogue: Waqt waqt ki baat hai ... aur mera waqt badal raha hai
englishDialogue: It is matter of time to time ... and my time is changing

dialogue: Tumhare aur maut ke beech ... meri pistol se nikli sirf ek goli ka faasla reh gaya hai
englishDialogue: The distance between you and death ... is only that of a bullet fired from my pistol

dialogue: Ajgar kisse, kab aur kahan nighal jaata hai ... yeh toh marne waale ko bhi pata nahin chalta
englishDialogue: Who, when and where does a python swallow ... that not even the person dying knows

dialogue: Meri shaadi ho chuki hai, magar maut se
englishDialogue: I am married, but with death

dialogue: Jab bhi hum koi khel khelte hai ... toh saare mohron ko apni ungliyon par nachate hai
englishDialogue: Whenver I play any game ... I make all the pawns dance on my fingers

dialogue: Arre yeh lo ... aa gaye kalyug ke kanhaiya
englishDialogue: There it is ... here comes lord Krishna of the modern era

dialogue: Vishwa mein unhi atmaon ko puja jaata hai ... joh shanti ke marg par chalte hai

englishDialogue: My name is love and I'm crazy for a beautiful body ... sometimes I'm a bee, sometimes a bulbul bird, sometimes a moth ... it's due to me that the beauties have fallen in love ... they have grace and style due to me ... when beautiful people take my name ... then they hold their heart with both hands ... but still I roam around feeling lonely ... I'm a sea, but I roam around being thirsty

englishDialogue: Your fate is erased when you die ... but may be it will change if you stay alive

englishDialogue: One who turns copper into gold, one who finds a diamond in the rough, one who turns his fate into a sword, one who teaches death to live ... there are some people who live with pride and keep trying with their life ... to win is their nature, when luck is their weapon

dialogue: Jua khelne ka mazaa tab aata hai ... jab samne waale ka luck mazboot ho
