dialogue: Lagale zor jitna teri taqdeer mein hai ... dushman ko rokna hamari fitrat mein hai
englishDialogue: Try as much as you can with your luck ... but it is my habit to stop my enemy

dialogue: Waqt ki fitrat khol de kismat ... khud pe bharosa hai toh aazmaa le apna luck
englishDialogue: It is the habit of time to open up destiny ... and if you trust yourself, then try your luck

dialogue: Insaan ka iraada aur uski taqdeer ... bolke nahi badalte
englishDialogue: A person's intention and his destiny ... change without any notice

dialogue: Majboori ek hi baar hoti hai ... agli baar nahi, kabhi nahi
englishDialogue: You can be compelled once ... not the next time, never

dialogue: Kuch patte aaise khulte hai ... joh khelne waale ko hi pack kar dete hai
englishDialogue: Some cards open in a way that ... it packs the person playing the game

dialogue: Ek toh hotel thanda, dhanda manda, upar se tu zaleel bandha
englishDialogue: First of all there is no one in the hotel, the business is slow, and on top of that you're a humiliating person

dialogue: Zindagi ek echo sound ki tarah hoti hai ... isse jis tarah sawaal pocha jaye na ... us tarah mudkar jawab bhi mil jaata hai
englishDialogue: Life is like an echo sound ... the type of question you ask to it ... that kind of answer you'll get back in return

dialogue: Arrey duniya waalon ne toh chand tak ko nahi chhoda ... toh ek abla besahara aurat ko kya chhodenge ... duniya ki ungliyan uspar uthti rahengi aur aurat ka dum ghutta rahega
englishDialogue: People of the world have not left the moon alone ... then how will they leave an helpless woman alone ... the fingers of the world will keep pointing at her and she will keep suffocating

dialogue: Bhagwan ko milne ke liye log mandiron mein jaate hai, apne bag mein uski tasveer rakhte hai, gadi mein photo tangte hai ... lekin apne dil mein usko koi nahi rakhta hai
englishDialogue: To meet God people go to the temple, they keep his picture in their bag, they hang his picture in the car ... but nobody keeps him in the heart

dialogue: Himmat marne ke liye nahi, jeene ke liye chahiye
englishDialogue: One does not need courage to die, one needs it for living

dialogue: Duniya pehle se hi ek masterpiece hai ... uske baare mein paitings banane se achcha hai ... uski hifazat karo, usse pyar karo
englishDialogue: The world already is a masterpiece ... rather than making paintings of it ... its better if we protect it, love it

dialogue: Bura joh dekhan main chala, bura na milya koye ... joh mann khoja apna, toh mujhse bura na koye
englishDialogue: When I searched for the bad, I didn't find any ... and when I searched in my heart, I found no one worse than me

dialogue: Insaan ke har achche burre karam ka natija, kisi aur ko bhugatna parta hai
englishDialogue: For every good and bad deed of a human, someone else goes through the consequences

dialogue: Galat waqt mein insaan galat faisla leta hai
englishDialogue: A person takes a wrong decision when his time is not right

dialogue: Jo hoga ... jab hoga ... aap sabko hila dega
englishDialogue: Whatever happens ... whenever it happens ... it will shake all of you

dialogue: Terrorism aur revolution mein bahut farak hai ... woh log desh ke khilaf hai, hum log system ke
englishDialogue: There is a lot of difference between terrorism and revolution ... those people are against the country, and we are against the system

dialogue: Sarkar ke paas bahut paisa hai, hathyar hai, logan hai ... hamare paas sirf junoon hai
englishDialogue: The government has a lot of money, weapons, people ... but we only have passion

dialogue: Happiness is good health and a bad memory
englishDialogue: Happiness is good health and a bad memory

dialogue: Shaadi ke do golden rules yaad rakho ... rule no. 1 aaisa kuch mat karo jisse tumhare partner ko dukh ho ... rule no. 2 agar karo bhi toh kisi ko pata mat lagne do
englishDialogue: Remember the two golden rules of marriage ... rule no.1 don't do anything that will make your partner sad ... rule no. 2 even if you do something then don't let anyone come to know about it

dialogue: Well behaved women, rarely make history
englishDialogue: Well behaved women, rarely make history

dialogue: Jab bhi main tumhe taqleef mein paonga ... sabse pehle main apna haath badaonga
englishDialogue: Whenever I find you in a problem ... I'll be the first one to give you a hand

dialogue: Kehte hai kehne waale ishq karna aasaan nahi ... koi humse bhi toh pooch kar dekhe-e-zaalim ... aage chalna aur peeche mudhkar na dekhna bhi aasaan nahi
englishDialogue: People who say, say that loving is not easy ... oh please but someone ask me too ... even walking ahead and not looking behind is not easy either

dialogue: Achche waqt ki ek kharabi hai ... achcha waqt khatam ho jaata hai ... lekin bure waqt ki ek achchai hai ... ke woh bhi khatam ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Good time has one bad thing ... that good time comes to an end ... but bad time has one good thing ... that even that comes to an end

dialogue: Achche waqt mein koi bhi khush reh sakta hai ... aadmi woh hai joh bure waqt mein khush rahe na rahe ... lekin doosron ko khush rakhe
englishDialogue: Anyone can stay happy in good times ... but a person is someone who may be happy or not in bad times ... but he keeps others happy

dialogue: Jab husband wife chup chap khana kha rahe ho ... toh samjho there is trouble
englishDialogue: When a husband and a wife are eating food silently ... then understand that there is trouble

dialogue: Lamhon ko toh guzarna hoga, aandhi ko toh chalna hoga ... main ek khayal hoon mujhe jaane do, khayal ka haath kaun pakadta hai
englishDialogue: Moments will have to pass by, the storm will have to move on ... I'm a thought let me go, no one holds the hands of a thought

dialogue: Na hai shikwa kisi ko kisi se yahan, na hai kisi pe kisi ka zor ... jinko apna samajhte hai hum aksar, wahi nikalte hai koi aur
englishDialogue: No one here has a complaint against anyone, and neither does anyone have control over someone ... often whom we consider our own, they are the ones who turn out to be someone else

dialogue: Pyar badi hi khoobsurat cheez hai ... lekin pyar akele todhi aata hai ... apne saath complications bhi lekar aata hai
englishDialogue: Love is a beautilful thing ... but love doesn't come alone ... it brings complications with it

dialogue: Jinke table pe churi kaante ki awaaz kam aur hasne baatein karne ki awaaz zyada ho ... woh log sukhi hote hai
englishDialogue: A table of people where there is less noise of the knife and the fork, and more noise of laughing and talking ... those people are happy

dialogue: Yahan Melbourne mein kisi ke pass kaam ke liye time ho ya na ho ... lekin pyar ke liye yahan sabke pass time hai
englishDialogue: Here in Melbourne whether one has time for work or not ... but here everyone has time for love

dialogue: Bandh ghadi bhi chaubees ghante mein do baar sahi waqt dikhati hai
englishDialogue: In 24 hours even a clock not running shows the correct time twice

dialogue: Is duniya mein har cheez ka ilaaj hai ... lekin shaq ka ilaaj NASA ke pass bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: In this world there is a cure for everything ... but even NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration) doesn't have a cure for suspicion

dialogue: Mazak jitna bhi badhda ho ... log uspe utna hi zyada haste hai
englishDialogue: The more awful a joke is ... that much more people laugh on it

dialogue: Nobody forgets how to love ... even if love forgets them
englishDialogue: Nobody forgets how to love ... even if love forgets them

dialogue: Pyar pyar hota hai ... and we should all refuse to live without love
englishDialogue: Love is love ... and we should all refuse to live without love

dialogue: Joh maarte hai na ... woh baat nahi karte
englishDialogue: Those who hit ... don't talk

dialogue: Hum sab Gita toh padhte hai ... lekin Mahabharat ladne se darrte hai
englishDialogue: We all read the Bhagavad Gita ... but we are scared of fighting the Mahabharata

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein leader agar kamzor par jaye ... toh ussike chokre goli maarke uski jagah le lete hai
englishDialogue: In our business if the leader becomes weak ... then his boys shoot him and take his place

dialogue: Hamare line mein reham nahi hai
englishDialogue: In our business there is no mercy

dialogue: Udhaar lene waale ko ek saal bhi ek din ke barabar lagta hai ... lekin udhaar dene waale ko ek din bhi saal bhar ke barabar lagta hai
englishDialogue: A year feels like a day for the one who takes the loan ... and a day feels like a year for the one who gives the loan

dialogue: Log Mumbai ko sapno ka shehar kehte hai ... yahan par har ek ke sapne poore hote hai
englishDialogue: People call Mumbai as the city of dreams ... over here everyone's dream gets fulfilled

dialogue: Aam aadmi ki rai kabhi aam nahi hoti
englishDialogue: The opinion of a common man can never be common

dialogue: Kuch baatein reh jaati hai ankahi ... joh na kahun karo us par yakeen
englishDialogue: Some conversations get left behind unsaid ... so believe in what I don't say

dialogue: Shahenshahon ke taqt aam aadmi ke kandhon pe hi khade hote hai
englishDialogue: The thrones of kings stand on the shoulders of the common man

dialogue: (Tum karte kya ho vaise?) - Main apne dad ke paise kharch karta hoon
englishDialogue: (By the way what do you do?) - I spend my dad's money

dialogue: Goals paane ki khushi tabhi mehsoos hoti hai ... jab usse kisi ke saath share kar sako
englishDialogue: You feel the happiness of achieving goals ... when you can share that with someone

movie: Short Kut: The Con Is On
dialogue: Uska cash bhi bounce hota hai
englishDialogue: Even his cash payment bounces

movie: Short Kut: The Con Is On
dialogue: Jis chot se main zakhmi hua hoon ... ussi chot se ladunga
englishDialogue: The wound that has injured me ... I will fight with that wound

movie: Short Kut: The Con Is On
dialogue: Tum kisi ka kaam chura sakte ho ... lekin uska hunar, uski kabiliyat nahi
englishDialogue: You can steal someone's work ... but not their talent and their potential

movie: Short Kut: The Con Is On
dialogue: Zubaan mooh mein rakhne ke liye hoti hai ... tu kyun deta rehta hai logo ko yaar?
englishDialogue: Promises should be kept inside the mouth ... why do you keep giving it to people?

movie: Short Kut: The Con Is On
dialogue: Life mein hai na ... sab kuch ekdum shortcut mein hona chahiye
englishDialogue: In life ... everything should be done with a shortcut

dialogue: Baimaani hi tikau shaadi shuda jeevan ki chaabi hai
englishDialogue: Lying is the key to a stable married life

dialogue: Kamyab insaan wahi hota hai joh zindagi ke ahem faisle dil se nahi ... dimaag se leta hai
englishDialogue: A successful person is one who takes the important decisions of life from the mind ... and not from the heart

dialogue: I go out on all dates ... Sundates, Mondates all dates up till Saturdates
englishDialogue: I go out on all days ... Sunday, Monday all days up till Saturday

dialogue: Passion toh woh hai joh har pal tumhari life ko meaning deta hai
englishDialogue: Passion is something which gives the meaning to every moment of your life

dialogue: Zindagi mein romance aate hi zindagi kitni magical ho jaati hogi na?
englishDialogue: Life probably becomes so magical once romance comes into life?

dialogue: Insaan hi insaan ka sabse bada dushman hai ... insaan hi insaan pe zulm karta hai, usse lootta hai, uska ghar ujhaad deta hai
englishDialogue: A human is the biggest enemy of a human ... a human is the one who does injustice on humans, steals him, destroys his home

dialogue: Gareeb ka jab bheja phirta hai na ... toh usse andook bandook kuch nahi dikhai deti ... chalao goli!
englishDialogue: When the mind of a poor person goes crazy ... then he can't see any guns ... come on shoot me!

dialogue: Yeh fareban baaton ki machine gun ghumakar ... mere dil, dimaag aur gurde ka chindiyan bana diya
englishDialogue: These cheaters spun the machine gun of talks ... and made pieces of my heart, brain and kidney

dialogue: Badi achchi baat hai ... din mein bhi raat hai ... chalo Allah hamare saath hai
englishDialogue: It's alright ... there is night even during the day ... and Allah is with us

dialogue: Bekaar mein nakko seena taan ... bolo mohabbat ki zubaan
englishDialogue: Don't widen your chest for no use ... just speak the language of love

dialogue: Makkaron se kabhi mat daro ... daro toh apne aap se ... aur daro toh dar darke zinda rehne se
englishDialogue: Never fear cunning people ... if you want to fear then fear yourself ... and if you want to fear then fear from living in fear

dialogue: Kya khoob pehghaam aapne hai pesh kiya ... hatheli ka hai mail daulat, kya liya aur kya diya
englishDialogue: What a great message you have given ... money is dust of the hand, what have you taken and what have you given

dialogue: Batlaiye kya cheez hoon jisse jahan mehake hai ... lakh sambhalo magar baar baar behake hai ... ishq hai naam uska jisse jahan mehake hai ... tere sandeshe mein joh bulbul ki tarah chehke hai
englishDialogue: Tell me what is the thing with which the world gets it's fragrance ... no matter how much you take care of it but still it's intoxicated ... love is the name with which the world gets it's fragrance ... and it's chirping like a bulbul in your message

dialogue: Saanp ke bil mein ghuskar zeharilay phanon se dushmani nahi lete ... varna khoon ke saath zehar bhi dil mein ghus jayega
englishDialogue: You don't enter a snakes hole and build enmity with the poisonous fangs ... or else along with blood even poison will enter your heart

dialogue: Apna toh aaisa-hich hai ... lade bagair apun zero aur ladke apun hero
englishDialogue: I'm like this only ... without fighting I'm a zero and with fighting I'm a hero

dialogue: Apan dada hai gareebon mein fakeeri ka ... lafdebaazon mein vasooli ka ... dada logon mein dadagiri ka
englishDialogue: I'm the boss of poverty for the poor people ... I'm the boss of recovery for the problematic people ... I'm the boss of rowdyism for the rowdy people

dialogue: Sau din chor ke toh ek din thanedaar ka ... sau din zalim ke toh ek din mazloom ka
englishDialogue: After 100 days of a thief there comes a day for the cop ... after 100 days of a cruel person there comes a day for the victim

dialogue: Log aasman se girkar bhi bach jaate hai ... aur marne waale hawa ke jhaunke se girkar mar jaate hai
englishDialogue: People escape even after falling from the sky ... and people who have to die, die simply even with the fall from a gust of wind

dialogue: Agar aapne aainda hum mein aap kehkar nahi pukara ... toh hum aapko aaisa girra hua shabd kehkar pukarenge ... ki aap zindagi bhar apni hi nazaron se girre rahenge
englishDialogue: If moving forward you don't call me with respect ... then I'll call you with such a dirty word ... that for your entire life you'll feel ashamed in your own eyes

dialogue: Mujhe gaali do, mujhe maaro, chaho toh mere jism se khaal alag kardo ... lekin mujhe apne rishtey se alag mat karo
englishDialogue: Curse me, hit me, and if you want separate my skin from my body ... but don't separate me from your relation

dialogue: Main tolta pehle hoon aur bolta bad mein hoon
englishDialogue: I weigh first and then I speak

dialogue: Mangal ke samne joh zabaan chalata hai ... Mangal uski taqdeer ki linen mitta deta hai
englishDialogue: The one who talks in front of Mangal ... Mangal erases the lines of their destiny

dialogue: Aurat ke daman par agar ek baar daag lag jaata hai ... toh Ganga ka pavitra jal bhi usse nahi dho sakta
englishDialogue: Once there is a mark on a woman's reputation ... then even the pure water from Ganges river can't clean it off

dialogue: Mangal ka rasta joh rokta hai ... Mangal uske liye maut ka darwaza khol deta hai
englishDialogue: The one who blocks Mangal's path ... Mangal then opens the door of death for him

dialogue: Chalo dhabe mein sab kuch milega ... mutton kadi, alu badi, maa ki daal raita naal, fry machhi bachut achchi, shami kabab lajawab, paneer palak ... chalo balak
englishDialogue: Let's go to the roadside restaurant, you'll get everything ... mutton curry, potato vegetable, mother's lentil soup with yogurt, very good fried fish, great shami kabab, cottage cheese in spinach ... let's go my son

dialogue: Bacha apni maa ki maar khake bada hota hai ... lekin apni maa ko maarne waala bacha tabah hota hai
englishDialogue: Children grow up getting smacked by their mother ... but a child who hits his mother gets destroyed

dialogue: Khoon bahana bahut aasaan hai ... lekin khoon ko bachana bahut mushkil hai
englishDialogue: It's very easy to shed blood ... but it's very hard to save your blood

dialogue: Jis aulaad ke saath maa ka aashirwad aur baap ki dua ho ... woh haathon se nahi laaton se bhi kaam chala sakte hai
englishDialogue: A child that has the blessings of his mother and the prayers of his father ... forget his hands, he can even work with his legs

dialogue: Chhoton ko badhon ke samne cigarette nahi peeni chahiye ... aur taqatvar ko kamzor pe zulm nahi karna chahiye ... is liye agar koi cigarette peeye toh usse bhuja do ... aur koi zulm kare toh usse mitta do
englishDialogue: Younger people should not smoke a cigarette in front of their elders ... and strong people should not do injustice on the weak ... hence if someone smokes a cigarette then blow it off ... and if someone does injustice then simply erase them

dialogue: Tere teer-e-neemkash ko koi mere dil se pooche ... yeh khalish kahan se hoti joh jigar ke paar hota ... joh nigah ki thi zalim toh phir aankh kyun churai ... wohi teer kyun na maara joh jigar ke paar hota
englishDialogue: Someone should ask my heart about your half drawn arrow ... where would this pain have come from if it had pierced through my body ... why did you look away from me after looking into my eyes ... why didn't you fire the arrow that would have pierced through my body

dialogue: Muskurate hue yun aaye woh maikhane mein ... ruk gayi saans chalakte hue paimaane mein
englishDialogue: She came smiling into the bar in such a way that ... my breath stopped in the spilling goblet

dialogue: Is safar mein isse khoobsurat ghatna aur kya ho sakti hai ... ki tera haath, haath mein aa gaya ... chirag raah mein jal uthe
englishDialogue: In this journey there cannot be a more beautiful event than this ... where your hand comes in my hand ... and the lamps on the road start to glow

dialogue: Josh mein koi burai nahi lekin usse hosh ke dariye mein hona chahiye
englishDialogue: There is nothing bad with passion but it must stay within the limits of awareness

dialogue: Kanoon ka sipahi, kanoon ki raksha ke liye jab kanoon ke dariye se bahar nikalta hai ... toh woh sar pe kafan bandkar nikalta hai
englishDialogue: When a soldier of the law, steps out of the limits of the law to protect the law ...  then he leaves with a shroud tied on his head

dialogue: Ab na woh zalim rahenge na zulm rahega ... na kanoon se khilwar karne waale woh gaddar rahenge ... ab sirf kanoon rahega
englishDialogue: Now neither will those cruel people remain nor will their cruelty ... neither will the traitors remain who play with the law ... now only the law will remain

dialogue: Khuda toh sabko bacha sakta hai ... lekin jiska khuda na ho, usse koi nahi bacha sakta
englishDialogue: God can save everyone ... but the one who doesn't believe in god, no one can save him

dialogue: Hindustan par hukumat ek afsar ki nahi, kisi minister ki nahi, in Jamaal Sen jaise darindo ki nahi ... Hindustan par hukumat hai in masoom bachchon ki, Hindustan par hukumat hai Hindustani awaam ki, Hindustan par hukumat hai hum Hindustaniyon ki
englishDialogue: India is not ruled by an officer, a minister, not even devils like Jamaal Sen ... India is ruled by these innocent children, India is ruled by its people, India is ruled by Indians

dialogue: Kanoon aur kanoon ke rakhwaalon ko saboot ki zaroorat us waqt tak padti hai, jab tak woh kanoon ki hadhon mein rehte hai ... lekin jis waqt woh kanoon ki hifazat ke liye un hadhon se bahar nikal jaate hai, toh phir saboot ki nahi ... goliyon ki zaroorat padti hai
englishDialogue: The law and the people who protect the law need a proof, until they stay within the limits of the law ... but when they cross those limits to protect the law, then they don't need a proof ... they need bullets

dialogue: Is duniya mein dard bahut hai aur baatne waale haath bahut kam hai ... phir bhi aagaaz hai yeh jisse anjaam tak nibhana hai ... khoon hai jab tak ragon mein, har zulm ko mitana hai
englishDialogue: There is a lot of pain in this world and very few hands that want to share that ... but still this is a start that we have to fulfil till its end ... until we have blood running in our veins, we have to erase every cruel act

dialogue: Aaj hum iska boti ka tukda tukda karke ... iska khoon ka ek ek boond choos loonga
englishDialogue: Today I will chop his body into pieces ... and I will suck every drop of his blood

dialogue: Aaj humne tarakki ka pehla seedhi par kadam rakh liya hoon ... aur bahut jaldi itna oonchai pe pahunch jaonga ... ke humko dekhne ke liye tumko aakash ka baadal hatana padega
englishDialogue: Today I have stepped on the first step of advancement ... and very soon I will reach such great heights ... that to see me you will have to move the clouds in the sky

dialogue: Is zameen se kabhi nafrat mat karna ... kyun ki aadmi jab oonchai se ludakta hai ... toh usse neeche is hi zameen par aana padta hai
englishDialogue: Never hate the ground ... because when a man falls from the top ... then he has to come down on this ground itself

dialogue: Imaandari se chori karne mein ... chori pakdi nahi jaati
englishDialogue: When you steal with honesty ... then you don't get caught

dialogue: Main pehle sirf kal hi ki soochta tha ... aur ab bahut door ki soochne laga hoon
englishDialogue: Earlier I only used to think about tomorrow ... and now I think very far

dialogue: Beizzati ki chhat ke neeche jeene se behtar hai ... ke insaan bina chhat ke izzat se jiye
englishDialogue: Rather than living under the roof of humiliation ... it is better that a person lives with respect without any roof

dialogue: Patni ka gawaar hona pati ke liye bhagwan ki dein hoti hai
englishDialogue: An uneducated wife is a God's gift for the husband

dialogue: Kuch baatein patthar ke lakeer se zyada gehri hoti hai ... patthar toot jaata hai lekin lakeerein nahi mitne paati
englishDialogue: Some things are deeper than the lines of a stone ... the stone can break but the lines cannot be erased

dialogue: Aaj ke baad humri bahen ko aaisa ungli se bhi chua na ... toh saala maar maarke, maar maarke tumra pura hadi pasli hum todh doonga ... aur aaisa todhonga saala ki duniya ka kauno haspatal mein tumra ilaaj nahi ho sakega
englishDialogue: After today if you even touch my sister with a finger ... then I will hit you and break your bones ... and I will break them such that no hospital in this world will be able to treat you

dialogue: Hafta lete lete police waalon ki ungliyan itni ghis gayi hai ... ki unmein na hathkadi lagane ki taqat hai aur na trigger dabane ki
englishDialogue: By taking bribes the fingers of police have worn out so much that ... they don't have the strength to tie handcuffs and neither to press the trigger

dialogue: Jis din mujhe thoos saboot mil gaya ... tumhari zindagi ka aakhri panna main likhonga
englishDialogue: The day I get sound evidence ... I will write the last page of your life

dialogue: Aadmi ke do haath toh hote hai magar neta banane ke baad ... ek haath ekdum lamba aur ek haath ekdum chota ho jaata hai ... woh lambe haath se vote kheenchta hai aur chote haath se note deta hai
englishDialogue: A person does have two hands but after becoming a politician ... one hand becomes very long and the other hand becomes very short ... with the long hand he pulls the votes and with the short hand he gives away money

dialogue: Aapke aasoon mera dard ban jayenge ... aur aapki takleefien meri pareshaniyan kehlayengi
englishDialogue: Your tears will turn into my pain ... and your problems will be called as my worries

dialogue: Haath chhodke baat kar varna yamdoot ke hawale kar doonga
englishDialogue: Leave my hand alone and talk or else I'll send you to the god of death

dialogue: Main un netaon mein se nahi hoon joh vote lene ke liye note baantte hai ... aur vote mil jaane ke baad noton mein ulajh jaate hai
englishDialogue: I'm not one of those politicians who give away money to buy votes ... and who after getting the votes get engrossed in money

dialogue: Aadmi jisko joh samajhta hai woh woh nahi hota ... aur joh hota hai woh nazar nahi aata ... aur joh nazar aata hai woh usse kuch alag hi hota hai
englishDialogue: What a person thinks what someone is, they are not that ... and what he is, that can't be seen ... and what you see, he is totally different than that

dialogue: Barson imaandari ka dhong karte rehte ho ... aur mauka milte hi aaisi baimaani karte ho ki shaitan bhi sharma jaye
englishDialogue: You keep pretending to be honest for years ... and the moment you get a chance you cheat in such a way that even the devil will feel shy

dialogue: Shama bujhao ki sailaab-e-noor aaya hai ... ya phalak se koi tara hi utar aaya hai
englishDialogue: Blow the candle since the flood of lights has come ... or is it that some star has come down from the skies

dialogue: Chaddaron par lage hue daag toh saaf kiye ja sakte hai ... lekin dil pe lage hue daag kabhi nahi mitaye ja sakte
englishDialogue: The stains on a bedsheet can be erased ... but the stains on a heart can never be erased

dialogue: Tujh jaise third class aadmi ke liye ... third degree treatment ki zaroorat hai
englishDialogue: For a third class person like you ... a third degree treatment is necessary

dialogue: Tum jaise raees pyar karte nahi ... pyar khareedtein hai
englishDialogue: Rich people like you don't fall in love ... they buy love

dialogue: Aaj main tujhe kisi adaalat mein pesh karne ke liye giraftar nahi karoonga ... aaj main tujhe uss upar waale ki adaalat mein pahunchaonga jahan tujh jaise haraamzadon ka faisla ... bagair behas ke hota hai
englishDialogue: Today I will not arrest you to present you in any court ... today I will send you to the court of God where decisions on bastards like you ... are taken without any discussions

dialogue: Woh roj raat ko naye ghat ka pani peeti hai
englishDialogue: Every night she drinks water from a new mountain

dialogue: Zulm karne waale aur zulm sehne waale dono ... aakhir mein hamesha ek ho jaate hai
englishDialogue: The one who does the injustice and the one who bears the injustice ... in the end they both always become one

dialogue: Tumhari jagah koi kabil officer hota toh FIR - First Information Report hoti ... Fake Information Report nahi
englishDialogue: If there was a capable officer instead of you he would have made a FIR - First Information Report ... and not a Fake Information Report

dialogue: Jua mein juari haarta hai ... patta nahi
englishDialogue: In gambling a gambler loses ... not the card

dialogue: Sabse gehra zakhm wohi log de sakte hai ... joh khud gehri chot khaye huye hai
englishDialogue: Only those people can give deep wounds ... who themselves have deep wounds

dialogue: Taash ki gaddi bhale hi bees rupaye ki ho ... lekin uspar jua karodon ka kehla jaata hai
englishDialogue: So what if the pack of cards is for Rs.20 ... the bet played on it is for millions

dialogue: Aap aur hum uttar aur dakshin ki tarah do dishayen hai ... joh kabhi nahi mil sakti
englishDialogue: You and I are like the two ways of north and south ... which can never meet

dialogue: Sharaab aur daulat in do cheezon ka nasha aaisa hi hota hai ... ki jisse insaan gir hi jaata hai
englishDialogue: Alcohol and money, the intoxication from these two things ... is such that a person falls down

dialogue: Agar tumne khoon se khelne ki koshish ki ... toh khoon ki dhara tumhare shareer se bahegi ... mere shareer se nahi
englishDialogue: If you try to play with blood ... then the stream of blood will flow from your body ... not from my body

dialogue: Kutte kamine tu mujhse bachkar nahi ja sakta ... main tujhe dhoond nikaloonga, main tujhe pataal se bhi dhoond nikaloonga ... aur main tujhe dhoondkar tera kaleja cheer doonga, main tera pet phaad daloonga ... haramzade tu mujhse bachkar nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: You can't escape from me you bloody dog ... I'll find you, I'll even find you from the world below the earth ... and after I find you I'll tear apart your throat and rip your stomach ... you can't escape from me you bastard

dialogue: Jaldi se chalte bano varna aaisi laat maaroonga ki football ki tarah goalpost se latakkar ... baar baar goal hote rahoge
englishDialogue: Get out from here quickly or else I'll give you such a kick that you'll hang from the goalpost like a football ... and you'll be goaled again and again

dialogue: Khatron se khelna hamara business hai, hamara karobar hai ... hamare paas maut ki factory hai ... hum maut banate jaate hai aur society mein bechte jaate hai
englishDialogue: Playing with danger is our business, it's our trade ... we have a factory of death ... we keep making death and we keep selling it in the society

dialogue: Agar doobara tumne hum dono ki zindagi mein phir se koi gadbad karne ki koshish ki ... toh maar maarkar tumhari shakal aaisi bighad doonga ... ki museum waale bhi apne showcase mein nahi rakhenge
englishDialogue: If you even try to create a problem in both our lives again ... then I'll beat you up and damage your face such that ... even the people of the museum won't keep it in their showcase

dialogue: Aaj kanoon ki chhat tumhare sar pe hai is liye tum apni zehareeli zubaan ki dank se hum mein dass rahe ho ... lekin beta jis din yeh chhat gir jayegi aur pata chalega ki yeh sirf tumhari chaal thi ... us din tumhari zubaan ko hum alakh se ukhadkar gandi naali mein phek denge
englishDialogue: Today since the roof of the law is on your head that's why you are biting us with your poisonous tongue ... but my son the day this roof falls and we'll come to know that this was your plot ... that day I'll cut your tongue from your mouth and throw it away in a dirty gutter

dialogue: Jab tak main uska khoon nahi kar loonga ... na mujhe neend aayegi, na mujhe maut aayegi
englishDialogue: Until I kill him ... I won't be able to sleep, and neither will death come to me

dialogue: Insaan aur insaaniyat ka toh main paidahishi dushman hoon ... mera bas chale toh main insaaniyat ka khoon aaise nichhod loon ... jaise log kisi phal mein se uska ras nichhod lete hai
englishDialogue: From birth I am the enemy of humans and humanity ... if I had the power then I'll squeeze the blood out of humanity in a way like ... people squeeze the juice out of a fruit

dialogue: Is duniya mein suraj ko mutthi mein chupana aasaan hai ... lekin ek baar jurm karke usse hamesha ke liye chupana namumkin hai
englishDialogue: In this world it's easy to hide the sun in your fist ... but it's impossible to commit a crime and hide it forever

dialogue: Tu apno ka nahi, tere desh ka hi gaddar nahi ... balki gaddaron ka bhi gaddar hai ... aur tujh jaise gaddar ko zinda rehne ka koi haq nahi hai
englishDialogue: You are a traitor not only to your near ones, but also your country ... infact you are the greatest traitor of all ... and a traitor like you has no right to live

dialogue: Yeh meri himmat kahan ki main aapse shikva karoon ... aap hona chahte hai bewafaa, ho jahiye ... aapke kadamon par laakar rakh di hai dil aur jaan ... meri mohabbat ki duniya ke khuda ho jahiye
englishDialogue: I don't have the courage to complain against you ... if you want to become unfaithful, then so be it ... I have kept my heart and life in your feet ... please become the god of my love life

dialogue: Us intezaar se kya gila joh tere deedar pe khatam ho
englishDialogue: I have no complaints against the wait that ends with your sight

dialogue: Isse mujhpar vishvas tha ... aur mujhe iske vishvas pe vishvas tha
englishDialogue: She believed in me ... and I believed in her belief

dialogue: Yaadon par pehre nahi bichai ja sakte
englishDialogue: You cannot put guard against memories

dialogue: Hum toh ek katra hai maum ka ... hum mein khud mein shamil karlo ... aag banado, apni saanson ki garmi se hamare jism ko bhar do ... hum mein rooh tak jala do ... is kadar barso aaj humpar ... hamari barso ki pyaas bhuja do
englishDialogue: I am one drop of wax ... take me within you ... turn me into fire, fill my body with the heat of your breath ... burn me till my soul ... and pour on me today in a way that ... my thirst of ages is satisfied

dialogue: Ek baap agar apne bete ki zindagi ka pehla kadam uthane mein uski madad kar sakta hai ... toh wahi beta apne baap ke aakhri kadam uthane mein usse sahara kyun nahi de sakta?
englishDialogue: If a father can help a son to take his first step in life ... then why can't the same son support his father to take his last step in life?

dialogue: Joh bachche apne maa baap ko pyar nahi de sakte, sahara nahi de sakte, maan samaan nahi de sakte ... unhe main kabhi maaf nahi karta
englishDialogue: The kids who cannot give love, support and respect to their parents ... I can never forgive them

dialogue: Tum ho toh hum hai ... hum hai toh sab kuch hai ... varna kuch nahi, kuch bhi nahi
englishDialogue: I am because of you ... and if we are there then everything is there ... otherwise there is nothing, absolutely nothing

dialogue: Tumhare bagair toh hum sirf jee rahe the ... dil ne dhadakna toh uss din shuru kiya jis din aap hum mein mili
englishDialogue: Without you I was only living ... my heart started beating the day I met you

dialogue: Pyar hi toh woh jaado hai ... joh umar bhar jawan banaye rakhta hai
englishDialogue: Love is that magic ... that keeps us young all our life

dialogue: Maa baap zindagi ke pedh ki jadh hai
englishDialogue: Parents are the roots of the tree of life

dialogue: Aap ghanti bajaye na bajaye ... aapke kadmo ki aahat se mere dil ki ghanti pehle se baj jati hai
englishDialogue: Whether you ring the bell or not ... the bell in my heart rings first by the sound of your feet

dialogue: Tumhari aankhon se tumhara dil dikhta hai ... jis mein meri tasveer chupi hui hai
englishDialogue: From your eyes your heart can be seen ... in which my picture is hidden

dialogue: Hota toh sabke paas hai ... magar dimaag wahi joh waqt pe kaam aajaye
englishDialogue: Everyone has it ... but the sharp mind is the one that comes handy at the right time

dialogue: Sab bikta hai ... daam barabar hona chahiye
englishDialogue: Everything sells ... it's just that the price must be right

dialogue: Usse haath milane ke baad ... haath ka ungliyan check karna zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: After shaking hands with him ... it is necessary to check the fingers on your hand

dialogue: Dil ki lagi mein dhadkano pe ikhtiyar nahi hota ... ishq woh jalwa hai joh pardanasheen nahi hota
englishDialogue: In love you don't have any control over your heartbeats ... love is that magic which can't be hidden

dialogue: Sab kuch jhoot ho sakta hai ... lekin mera pyar jhoota nahi hai
englishDialogue: Everything can be a lie ... but my love for you is not a lie

dialogue: Khaas samay par khaas kaam ke liye khaas insaan ko dhoond lena meri khaasiyat hai
englishDialogue: It is my speciality to find the right person for the right job at the right time

dialogue: Aankhen joh dekhti hai ... woh hamesha sach nahi hota
englishDialogue: Whatever the eyes see ... is not always the truth

dialogue: Yeh ahtiyad zaroori nahi sabhi ke liye ... ghadi ghadi ki khabar rakhna, do ghadi ke liye
englishDialogue: It is not necessary for everyone ... to keep the track of time just for a couple of moments

dialogue: Jab mazaa lena ho toh main logon ko bulata hoon ... jab khabar leni ho toh main logon tak jaata hoon
englishDialogue: When I want to have fun then I call people ... and when I want to meet them then I go to them

dialogue: Pehle main insaan ko pasand karta hoon ... phir uske kaam ko
englishDialogue: First I like a person ... and then I like his work

dialogue: Choti choti jagahon par choti choti baatein ... kaafi important hoti hai
englishDialogue: Small small things in small small places ... are very important

dialogue: Tum aur main alag kahan hai ... dil bhi ek hai, dhadkan bhi ek hai aur awaaz bhi ek hai
englishDialogue: You and I are not separate ... our heart is one, our heartbeat is one and our voice is one

dialogue: Main maaronga ... toh mar jayega
englishDialogue: If I hit ... then you'll die

dialogue: Aabhari bahut bhari shabd hai ... aksar logo ko jhuka deta hai
englishDialogue: Indebted is a very heavy word ... it usually bends people

dialogue: Mainu Delhi nahi le jana ... mera chitta singhasan yahin banana ... mera mooh dushman var rakhna jab mainu aag lagana ... humne nahi seekha dushman ko peeth dikhana ... mere shastra mere saath sulana ... amrit kande taar da mere mooh vich paana ... "Bole So Nihal" da nara lagana ... main markar bhi ladunga, mera bhog na paana
englishDialogue: Don't take me Delhi ... make the throne for my pyre right here ... keep my face pointing towards the enemy when you burn me ... I haven't learnt to show my back to the enemy ... keep my weapons next to me ... put the holy water in my mouth ... keep shouting "Bole So Nihal" (whoever utters, shall be fulfilled) ... I'll fight even after dying, don't have the death ceremony for me

dialogue: Khwaab kabhi na poora hoga dushman ke armaan ka ... dekhen kaise paar kare woh border Hindustan ka
englishDialogue: The dream of the enemies desire will never be fulfilled ... let' see how can they cross the border of India

dialogue: Mazloomon ke liye dhaal hai hum, dushmanon ke liye kaal hai hum ... awaaz se duniya tharaye, woh Guru Gobind Singh ke lal hai hum
englishDialogue: I'm armour for the victims, I'm time for the enemies ... the world shakes with my voice, I'm that son of Guru Gobind Singh

dialogue: Kes, kach, kada, kirpan, kangha, Sikhon ka nishan ...  dhoondte reh jaoge nakshe mein Pakistan
englishDialogue: Hair, inner shorts, iron bangle, knife and comb are the signs of Sikhs ... you guys will keep looking for Pakistan on the map

dialogue: Dushmani aur nafrat se zameen par lakeerein kheenchi ja sakti hai ... dilon par nahi
englishDialogue: With enmity and hatred you draw lines on the ground ... not on the hearts

dialogue: Soora so pehchaniye, joh lade deen ke heth ... purja purja kat mare, kabu na chhode khet
englishDialogue: The one who is brave, he fights for the justice of everyone ... he may get cut into pieces and die, but he won't leave the battlefield

dialogue: Yaad rakhna ki duniya ke kisi kone mein ek aadmi hai joh bahut khush hai ... kyun ki tum khush ho
englishDialogue: Remember in some corner of the world there is a person who is very happy ... because you are happy

dialogue: Agar main uthata toh tum jaag jaati ... agar tum jaag jaati toh chali jaati ... aur agar chali jaati toh main itna kareeb se tumhe kab dekhta
englishDialogue: If I'd woke you up then you would have awakened ... if you would have awakened then you would have left ... and if you would have left then I wouldn't have been able to see you from so close

dialogue: Mujhe andhar aane ke liye mat kehna ... tumhe na nahi keh paonga ... andhar bhi nahi aa paonga
englishDialogue: Don't ask me to come inside ... I won't be able to say no to you ... neither would be able to come inside

dialogue: Mujhe nahi malum business kaise hota hai ... magar pyar toh aaise hi hota hai
englishDialogue: I don't know how business is done ... but love is done this way only

dialogue: Rishtey bante hai ... khatam nahi hote
englishDialogue: Relationships are made ... they don't end

dialogue: Pehle tum door thi aur main pass aana chahta tha ... ab tum pass ho par door jana meri majboori hai
englishDialogue: First you were far away and I wanted to come near ... now you are near and I'm compelled to go far away

dialogue: Guzre hue pal laut kar nahi aate ... bas yaadein chhod jaate hai
englishDialogue: Time never comes back ... it just leaves behind memories

dialogue: Jab dil se dil ki raah milti hai ... toh ek doosre ki pasand napasand sab pata chalta hai
englishDialogue: When the path of the hearts connect ... then you come to know about each others likes and dislikes

dialogue: Dil ka rishta zabardasti se joda nahi jaata ... bas ban jaata hai, yun hi apne aap
englishDialogue: The relationship of hearts cannot be connected with compulsion ... it gets connected just like that, by itself

dialogue: Har rishtey ki ek seema hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every relationship has a boundary

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi hadsa itna bada hota hai ... ki uske samne zindagi bahut choti ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes an incident is so big that ... life becomes very small in front of it

dialogue: Life mein paise kamane ke alava kuch daan punya ka bhi kaam kiya karo ... aatma ke liye acha hota hai
englishDialogue: In life other than earning money you should do some donations as well ... it is good for your soul

dialogue: Zakhm ilaaj se bharta hai aur dard baantne se halka hota hai
englishDialogue: A wound fills by treating it and the pain gets lighter by sharing it

dialogue: Shikayat karne se problem ka solution nahi milta hai
englishDialogue: By complaining you don't get the solution to a problem

dialogue: Business karne ke liye tumhare pass sari duniya padi hai ... phir tum meri choti si duniya ko apna business kyun banana chahte ho
englishDialogue: To do business you have the entire world ... then why do you want to make my small world as your business

dialogue: Cheese bolne se angrezi smile aati hai ... paneer bolne se Indian muskurahat aati hai
englishDialogue: By saying cheese you get an English smile ... by saying paneer (cottage cheese) you get an Indian smile

dialogue: Tu gaadi plane ki speed se chalata hai aur pyar bhail-gaadi ki speed se karta hai
englishDialogue: You drive a car at the speed of a plane and you love at the speed of a bullock cart

dialogue: Har thokar ko aage badne ki seedi banani chahiye ... iraade aur mazboot ho jaate hai ... na milne waali cheez bhi mil jaati hai
englishDialogue: We should make every stumble as a step to move forward ... your intentions become more stronger ... and you also get the things that you weren't supposed to get

dialogue: Main toh sirf tumhari tasveer hi kheench raha tha ... tum toh meri film utaar rahi ho
englishDialogue: I was only taking your photo ... but you are shooting a film on me

dialogue: Hum kutton se baat nahin karte!
englishDialogue: I don't talk to dogs!

dialogue: Zindagi mein agar kisi ne mere liye dua ki ho ... toh woh bhi tujhe lag jaye
englishDialogue: In life if anyone has prayed for me ... then that prayer also may come to you

dialogue: Bootiyan nochne waala geedar ... gala phadne se sher nahin ban jaata
englishDialogue: A jackal who chews bones ... does not become a tiger by shouting

dialogue: Khoon jab bolta hai toh maut ka tandav hota hai
englishDialogue: When the blood talks then there is a dance of death

dialogue: Dada toh is duniya mein sirf do hain ... ek upar waala aur doosre hum
englishDialogue: There are only two leaders in this world ... one God and second me

dialogue: Hum tumhe aisi maut maarenge ... tumhari aane waali nasalon ki neend bhi uss maut ke khauf se udh jayegi
englishDialogue: I will kill you in such a way ... that even the sleep of your future generations will run away by the scare of that

dialogue: Duniya mein mard lakh imaandar hoga toh sadak pe padhe hue pachaas yah sau rupaiy ki note chhod dega ... lekin ek akeli, jawaan, anaath ladki ko koi nahi chhodta
englishDialogue: In this world if a man is highly honest then he will leave a 50 or 100 Rupees note laying on the road ... but he will not leave a single, young, orphan girl

dialogue: Rana ki maut itni choti nahi ... joh tumhari mutthi mein ho
englishDialogue: Rana's death is not that small ... that it can come inside your fist

dialogue: Bazaar ke kisi sadak chaap darzi ko bulakar apne kafan ka maap de do
englishDialogue: Call a cheap tailor from the market and order the size of your shroud

dialogue: Telephone uthakar khamosh rehna mardo ka kaam nahi hai
englishDialogue: Staying quiet after picking up the telephone is not the work of men

dialogue: Badle ki aag woh pyas hai joh kisi doosre ke peene se nahi bhujti ... aur toofan ko kisi aur sahare ki zaroorat nahi padhti
englishDialogue: The fire of revenge is such a thirst, that doesn't go away by someone else taking it ... and storms don't need the support of anyone else

dialogue: Suna hai Bambai shehar mein insaan aur haivaan ... dono ko chupne ki jagah milti hai
englishDialogue: I have heard that in Mumbai city humans and satans ... both can find a place to hide

dialogue: Yeh toh sher ki guffa hai ... yahan agar tumne karvat bhi li toh samjho maut ko bulava diya
englishDialogue: This is a tigers cave ... here if you move then understand that you are calling death

dialogue: Rana karz aur farz dono ko ... ek hi nazar se nibhata hai
englishDialogue: Rana obeys loan and duty both ... with the same view

dialogue: Dushmani aur dosti agar ghaadi na ho ... toh us mein koi rang nahin aata
englishDialogue: If enmity and friendship are not dense ... then it does not have any color

dialogue: Hamare kaan na nahin sun sakte ... agar na sunle ... toh hamare kaanon se angaray nikalne lagte hain
englishDialogue: My ears cannot hear a no ... if they hear a no ... then ember starts to come out from my ears

dialogue: Hamare dhande mein aasunyon ke saath koi rishta nahin hota
englishDialogue: In our business we don't have any relationship with tears

dialogue: Baaton ki talwar se gardan nahin katti
englishDialogue: The sword of talking does not cut the neck

dialogue: Seva, adarsh aur desh bhakti ki bhavna agar kitaabon mein hi bandh rahi ... toh phir hamare desh ki hasti bhi duniya ke kagazi naksho mein reh jayegi
englishDialogue: If the feelings of service, idolism and patriotism remain closed inside books ... then the existence of our country will also remain in the paper maps of this world

dialogue: Hum uss sipahi ki tarah hai ... jiske haath mein sirf mayan hai ... talwar nahi
englishDialogue: We are like those soldiers ... who only have the scabbard in their hand ... not the sword

dialogue: Hum mein amiron ki taqat ka nahin ... garibon ki kamzori ka ehsaas hai
englishDialogue: I have feelings for the weakness of the poor ... not for the strength of the rich

dialogue: Police ki vardi aur khoon ki garmi aadmi ko bada khuddar bana deti hai
englishDialogue: The police uniform and the warmth of blood makes a man very egoistic

dialogue: Hamare phone ke baad interview nahin hota ... letter of appointment seedha milta hai
englishDialogue: After my phone call there is no interview ... directly comes a letter of appointment

dialogue: Gunaah ke samundar ki koi bhi machli ... tumhare jeevan ke pavitra nadi mein kabhi nahi aayegi
englishDialogue: No fish from the sea of crime ... will ever come in the holy river of your life

dialogue: Hausle se har kaam mumkin hai ... hausle se insaan apni taqdeer jaise chahe waisi bana sakta hai
englishDialogue: With encouragement every task is possible ... with encouragement a human can create his destiny as desired

dialogue: Zindagi ek natak hi toh hai, lekin zindagi aur natak mein farak hai ... natak ko jahan chaho, jab chaho badal do lekin ... zindagi ke natak ki dor toh upar waale ke haath mein hai
englishDialogue: Life is one drama, but there is a difference between life and drama ... a drama can be changed wherever and whenever ... but the string of the drama of life is in the hands of God

dialogue: Is duniya ke tum pehle aur aakhri badnaseeb kamine hoge ... jiski na toh arthi uthegi aur na kisi kandhe ka sahara ... seedhi chitta jalegi
englishDialogue: You will be the first and last unfortunate rascal of this world ... whose bier will not be lifted and will not have any support of shoulders ... straight the pyre will burn

dialogue: Marte toh sirf bekasoor hai ... kusoorwar toh hamari tarah aaish karte hai
englishDialogue: Only innocent people die ... the guilty have fun like us

dialogue: Rana na pyase pehda hue the ... aur na hi pyase marenge
englishDialogue: Rana was not born thirsty ... and neither will he die thirsty

dialogue: Rana ki shatranj ka ghoda a-dai ghar nahin chalta ... seedhe raja ko marta hai
englishDialogue: In Rana's chess the knight does not move two and a half squares ... it directly kills the king

dialogue: Gunaah chupane se gunehgaar nahi chup sakta
englishDialogue: A criminal cannot hide by hiding the crime

dialogue: Unke mujhpar itne ehsaan hai ... ki agar main apni chamdi ka joota banakar bhi unhe pehnata ... toh bhi kam hota
englishDialogue: I owe him big time ... that even if I make a shoe from my skin and give it to him ... then to it will be less

dialogue: Adalat toh sirf saboot par faisla karti hai
englishDialogue: The court gives its decision only based on the proof

dialogue: P.C. Mathur jisse dushmani karta hai ... uski jhadon ko khood kar hamesha ke liye khatam kar deta hai
englishDialogue: When P.C. Mathur enemies someone ... he digs their roots and finishes them forever

dialogue: Aasoon bahane se dil toh halka ho jayega lekin gham ka bhoj halka nahi hota
englishDialogue: By crying your heart will lighten but the weight of sorrow doesn't get any lighter

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi dosti nibhane ke liye ... doston ke saath thodi dushmani bhi karni padti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes to fulfill friendship ... you also have to become a small enemy of your friend

dialogue: Haraam ka maal kamane ke baad aadmi sirf do hi jagah pe milta hai ... daru ke canistar mein yah rundi ke bistar mein
englishDialogue: After earning unlawful money a man can only be found in two places ... in the alcohol drums or in the bed of a prostitute

dialogue: Khoon ka rishtaa khoon bahake hi khatam kiya jaa sakta hai
englishDialogue: Blood relationship can only be ended by shedding blood

dialogue: Agar toofan ka raasta badalna mushkil ho jaye ... toh apna raasta badal lena chahiye
englishDialogue: If it gets difficult to change the path of the storm ... then one must change their path

dialogue: Tum sach ko sapna samajhke bhula dena chahti ho ... lekin main us sapne ko sach karna chahta hoon
englishDialogue: You want to consider the truth as a dream and forget it ... but I want to make that dream a reality

dialogue: Kehte hai jungle mein naya janwar aaye toh ... sabse pehle sher ko saalam karna padta hai
englishDialogue: It is said that when a new animal comes in the jungle ... then firstly he has to salute the tiger

dialogue: Cocaine ... yeh safed aur masoom dikhne waala powder, sirf naujawaan logon ko hi maut ke mooh tak nahi pahunchata ... balki is mein itna dum hai ... ki yeh kisi desh ki sarkar ko gira bhi sakta hai aur sarkar bana bhi sakta hai
englishDialogue: Cocaine ... this innocent looking white powder, not only does take young people to the mouth of death ... but it also has the power ... to topple the government of any country and also to create one

dialogue: Samaaj ko police waisi hi milti hai jaisa ki samaaj khud hota hai
englishDialogue: The society gets the police exactly the way the society is

dialogue: Hamari chai bahut kadvi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Our tea is very bitter

dialogue: Kanoon kamzor nahi hai ... kamzor hai hum
englishDialogue: The law is not weak ... we are weak

dialogue: Bhaari mistik ho gaya Sir ... ekdum blunder ho gaya
englishDialogue: Sir it was a big mistake ... a total blunder

dialogue: Humse galti hua hai ... magar hum galat aadmi nahin hai
englishDialogue: I have made a mistake ... but I am not a wrong person

dialogue: Baat ka devta nahi hai yeh ... laat ka bhoot hai yeh
englishDialogue: He is not a god of words ... he is a devil of kicks

dialogue: Hamare saath zindagi ka ek din jeena ... hazaaron saalon ki taqleefon ke barabar hota hai
englishDialogue: Living one day of your life with me ... is equal to a 1000 years of suffering

dialogue: Tum logon se baat-cheet karne ke liye hum mein lafzon ki nahi ... goliyon ki zubaan sikhayi jaati hai

englishDialogue: The computer did not make humans ... the humans made the computer ... that's why what a mind can do, a computer can't

englishDialogue: Oh god if you wish then hang me ... oh god burn me 100 times in hell ... but my lover calling me her elder ... oh god don't make me see that day

dialogue: Jis insaan ko maa ki mamta naseeb nahi hui ... us jaisa koi badnaseeb nahi
englishDialogue: A person who doesn't get the motherly love ... there is no one as unfortunate as him

dialogue: Yahi hai zindagi apni, yahi hai bandagi apni ... ki unka naam aaya aur gardan jhuk gayi apni ... na bhut khane ko jaate hai, na kaabe mein bhatakte hai ... jahan tum paon rakhte ho, vahan hum sar patakte hai ... hum ishq ke maaron ka itna hi fasana hai ... rone ko nahi koi, hasne ko zamana hai
englishDialogue: This is my life, this is my prayer ... that my head bowed down when his name came up ... neither does he go to the temple of idols, neither does he roam in god's house ... where you keep your feet, I hit my head over there ... that's the story of people in love like me ... there is no one to cry for us, and the world is there to laugh on us

dialogue: Achcha dost aur achchi patni ... kismat waalon ko hi milti hai
englishDialogue: A good friend and a good wife ... only lucky people get them

englishDialogue: A person who becomes a prey of weakness and falls ... that person is not a person

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy

dialogue: Tu khelta hoga toofano se, humne toh toofan paale hai ... joh darte hai so marte hai, hum markar jeene waale hai

englishDialogue: It is snowing and there is no drink in my hand ... make me drink ... I have nothing to do

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy
dialogue: Pyar baantoge pyar milega ... nafrat baantoge nafrat milegi
englishDialogue: You will get love if you share love ... and you will get hatred if you share hatred

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy
dialogue: Jis din hamara sar ghum gaya na ... toh yahan par kabristan hi kabristan honge
englishDialogue: The day my head spins ... there will only be graveyards here

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy
dialogue: Chehre toh aksar dokha dete hai ... sach toh aaine bola karte hai
englishDialogue: Faces usually are deceptive ... the mirror says the truth

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy
dialogue: Jinke irrade buland ho ... woh sadko ki nahi, aasmano ki baatein karte hai
englishDialogue: Those who have solid intentions ... they talk about the skies and not the ground

movie: The Hero: Love Story of a Spy
dialogue: Halaat bahut chote hote hai ... lekin insaan bahut bada
englishDialogue: Situations are very small ... but people are very big

dialogue: Jis dhan ke liye aap duniya se dokha kar rahe hai, apne azeezon se, apne doston se dokha kar rahe hai, apne saathiyon se dokha kar rahe hai ... ussi dhan ke haathon aap khud bhi dokha khayenge
englishDialogue: The money for which you are cheating the world, your dear ones, your friends, your colleagues ... you'll be cheated by the hands of that money

dialogue: Rupaiya kya hai? ... mitti ki tarah ek bejaan aur bekaar cheez hai ... lekin jis tarah mitti mein mehnat ka beejh ugaye bagair paidawar nahi ho sakti  ... ussi tarah rupaiya ke saath jab tak mehnat ka mel nahi hoga ... duniya mein kabhi koi tarakki nahi kar sakega
englishDialogue: What is money? ... a lifeless and useless thing like soil ... but just like you can't grow anything until you plant the seeds of hard work in the soil ... just like that until money is combined with hard work ... no one in this world will be able to succeed

dialogue: Insaan patthar ki chot seh sakta hai ... lekin yeh buri nazar ke vaar se bachna bahut mushkil hai
englishDialogue: A person can bear the wound from a stone ... but it's very hard to escape from the attack of an evil eye

dialogue: Insaan apne maa baap ke naam se nahi ... apne ghuno se achcha ya bura samjha jaata hai
englishDialogue: A person is considered to be good or bad because of his qualities ... not because of the names of his parents

dialogue: Agar woh bechara ek din kaam par nahi jaata ... toh us bechare ke ghar mein chula nahi jalta ... aur jis din chula nahi jalta ... uska pet jalta hai, uski aatma jalti hai
englishDialogue: If that helpless person doesn't go to work for one day ... then the stove in his house doesn't burn ... and the day when the stove doesn't burn ... his stomach and his soul burns

dialogue: Agar aaj hum sab aapas mein milkar aur apne kaam ko apna dharam samajhkar kare ... toh kal hamara desh bhi duniya ke sare mulkon ke aage apna sar ooncha karke khada ho sakega
englishDialogue: Today if we all get together and do our work thinking it's our duty ... then tomorrow even our country will stand with its head held high in front of other countries from the world

dialogue: Mohabbat kisi ke kehne se nahi ki jaati aur na kisi ke hukum se todi ja sakti hai
englishDialogue: Love is not done when someone says about it and neither is it broken by someones order

dialogue: Pet ki awaaz ke samne aatma aur parmatma dono ki awaaz gayab ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: The noise from the soul and god both run away in front of the noise from the stomach

dialogue: Kisi insaan ka yun khatam hona achcha nahi ... khatam toh honi chahiye uski burai, uska chotapan, uski khudgarzi
englishDialogue: A person shouldn't end like this ... what should end is his evilness, his littleness, his selfishness

dialogue: Hum toh sirf yeh chahte hai sethji ... ki hamara aur aapka amir ya garib ka rishta na rahe ... malik ya mazdoor ka rishta na rahe ... balki hum dono ke darmiyan ek insaan aur insaan ka rishta kayam ho
englishDialogue: Boss, the only thing we want is that ... you and us don't have a relation of rich and poor ... don't have a relation of boss and worker ... instead we should have a relation of a human and a human in between us

dialogue: Agar usne apna rasta nahi badla toh majboor hokar hum mein apna rasta badalna hoga ... aur woh rasta khoon ke darya se hoke guzrega
englishDialogue: If he does not change his path then we'll be compelled to change our path ... and that path will pass through the sea of blood

dialogue: Yeh joh vote hai na yeh kagaz ka tukda nahi hai ... ki dabbe mein daala aur chal diye ... yeh vote tumhare parivar, tumhare desh, uski unnati ki parchi hai ... yeh toh do dhaari talwar hai joh dono taraf se kaatti hai ... theek jagah pade toh desh khushal aur galat jagah pade toh desh ka satyanash
englishDialogue: A vote is not a piece of paper ... that you put in a box and move on ... a vote is a paper for the betterment of your family, your country ... it's a double edged sword which cuts from both sides ... if it falls in the right place then the country is happy and if it falls in the wrong place then the country is destroyed

dialogue: Jab raajneeti pesha ban jaati hai, vyapar ban jaati hai ... toh kursi desh se badi ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When politics becomes a profession, becomes a business ... then the position becomes bigger than the country

dialogue: Hamare desh mein samajwad kahan hai ... hamare desh mein toh afsarwad hai, jaat-paatwad hai, kursiwad hai ... arre samajwad toh tab aayega jab aap apne vote ki taqat mehsoos karenge
englishDialogue: Where is socialism in our country ... in our country there is officership, there is racism, there is politics ... socialism will come when we feel the power of our vote

dialogue: Woh log mujhe toh maar sakte hai lekin meri awaaz ko nahi kuchal sakte ... meri awaaz croreon mazdooron ki awaaz bankar un zalimon ke kaano se takrayegi ... mere khoon ke ek ek boond se hazaron lakhon croreon Kranti Kumar pehda honge ... joh is dharti se zulm, anyay aur baimaani ke rakshas ko hamesha hamesha ke liye khatam kar denge ... kranti hogi, poorn kranti, sampoorn kranti!
englishDialogue: Those people can kill me but they can't kill my voice ... my voice will become the voice of millions of workers and it will hit against the ears of those cruel people ... with every drop of my blood millions of Kranti Kumar's will be born ... who forever will end the devils of cruelty, injustice and cheating from this earth ... there will be a revolution, a complete revolution

dialogue: Zulm aur anyay ke khilaaf pehle hamesha ek hi awaaz uthti hai, ek hi haath uthta hai ... aur phir dheere dheere sarfaroshon ka caravan tayaar ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Always first one voice rises against cruelty and injustice, one hand rises ... and then slowly slowly a caravan of passionate people becomes ready

dialogue: Jab tak tum jaise log is desh mein zinda hai ... tab tak sach bolne waalon ka dum ghutta rahega, hinsa ka gala dabta rahega ... lekin mere jeete jee main yeh nahi hone doonga ... main tum logon ke haath kaat daalonga aur gala ghoot doonga
englishDialogue: Until people like you are living in this country ... till then people who say the truth will suffocate, and the neck of violence will be pressed ... but I won't let that happen until I'm living ... I'll cut your hands and squeeze your neck

dialogue: Tumhari jaan mere liye bahut keemti hai ... magar meri jaan mere liye, tumhari jaan se zyada keemti hai
englishDialogue: Your life is very precious to me ... but my life for me, is much more precious than your life

dialogue: Kabab mein haddi toh suna tha ... yeh saala poora bakra kahan ghus aaya
englishDialogue: I had heard about bones mixed with meat ... how come this whole goat came along

dialogue: Waqt, mauka, nazaqat, halat ... kuch toh dekh kar aaya karo?
englishDialogue: Time, opportunity, fragility, condition ... at least check something before you come?

dialogue: Goli maar maarke ek ek aadmi ki laash ko sadak pe us tarah phekenge ... jaise juari jua khelte table pe taash ke patte phekta hai
englishDialogue: I will shoot each and every one and throw their dead body on the road ... just like a gambler throws the cards on the table when he is playing

dialogue: Mera kaam tumhe sarkari mehmaan banana hai
englishDialogue: My work is to make you a guest of the government

dialogue: Shera ki suvar ki khopdi mein lomdi ki tarah chalaak dimag hai ... pahad khodkar chuha nikaal leta hai ... kabar khodkar murda nikaal leta hai ... aur aatma ka gala dabakar parmatma ka pata nikaal leta hai
englishDialogue: Shera is pig headed but he has a smart mind of a fox ... he can dig a mouse from within a mountain ... he can dig a dead body from the grave ... and he can press the neck of a soul and find out the address of God

dialogue: Zameen aur aasman ke beech jitni bhi cheezein hai ... mujhe dekh kar unki rooh fanaa ho jaati hai ... aag ghabrakar baraf ho jaati hai ... aur baraf ghabrakar pani
englishDialogue: All the things that exists between the ground and the sky ... their soul gets scared when they see me ... also fire gets scared and turns into ice ... and ice gets scared and turns into water

dialogue: Tum jaisi auraton ke pair ke neeche swarg hota hai ... aur aaj kal ki auraton ke pair ke neeche sandal ... joh sadak pe kam aur mardon ke sarr pe zyada chalti hai
englishDialogue: Women like you have heaven beneath your foot ... but women of today have a sandal under their foot ... which is used less on the road and more on the head of men

dialogue: Jab khud ke latakne ki baari aati hai na ... toh chehra khud-ba-khud latak jaata hai
englishDialogue: When your chance of hanging comes ... then the face automatically hangs down by itself

dialogue: Pichle janam mein tum zaroor maachis ki dibiya rahe hoge ... is liye is janam mein baatein kam aur mooh se chingaariya zyada nikalte ho
englishDialogue: You definitely must have been a matchbox in your last life ... because in this life there are more sparks coming out of your mouth than words

dialogue: Apun bhi apni marzi ka maalik hai ... apne mood ka badshah hai
englishDialogue: I am the boss of my wish ... and I am the king of my mood

dialogue: Kyun meri Kashmir jaisi zindagi ko Kurukshetra banane pe tuli ho?
englishDialogue: Why are you trying to ruin my Kashmir like life into a battlefield?

dialogue: Is aadmi ki parchai bhi kisi pe padh jaye na ... toh wahi marr jaye ... itna zehareela hai yeh
englishDialogue: If the shadow of this person falls on someone ... then he will die right there ... that is how much poisonous this person is

dialogue: Papaya jaisa chehra, chikoo jaisi aankhen, tarbuj jaisa badan ... ladki hai yah fruit ki tokri?
englishDialogue: Your face is like papaya, your eyes are like sapodilla, your body is like water melon ... are you a girl or a fruit basket?

dialogue: Jab aulaad jawaan ho jaati hai na ... tab naukrani ki nahi ... bahurani ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: When a son becomes young ... then the house doesn't need a maid ... it needs a daughter-in-law

dialogue: Joh bhi apni zubaan nahi kholta hai ... main uske bheje ka dhakan khol deta hoon
englishDialogue: Whoever does not open their mouth ... I open the lid of their brains

dialogue: Jis tarah cigarette peene ke baad tukde ko phek diya jaata hai ... uss hi tarah kaam khatam ho jaane ke baad chamcho ko khatam kar deta hai Shera
englishDialogue: Just like after smoking the cigarette the bud is thrown away ... just like that Shera kills the ass-kissers after the work is done

dialogue: Pehle main tumhare pyar mein deewani thi ... aaj main tumhare izzat ki deewani ho gayi
englishDialogue: First I was crazy in your love ... today I have become crazy of your honor

dialogue: Mujhe bhi giraftaar kar lo na ... pyar ki hathkadi lagakar dil ke lock up mein qaid kar lo na
englishDialogue: Arrest me also ... put the handcuff of love on me and imprison me in the lock up of the heart

dialogue: Mere haath kanoon se zyada lambe hai ... jahan mera haath ja sakta hai, wahan kanoon ka haath nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: My hands are longer than the hands of the law ... where my hands can reach, the hands of the law can't reach

dialogue: Siyasat ki duniya mein maa, baap, bhai, behen, beti, damad koi kuch nahi hota ... kyun ki aadmi jab upar uthna chahta hai, tab yeh sab rishtey aur jazbaat bojh bankar usse neeche ghaseet lete hai
englishDialogue: In the world of politics there is no mother, father, brother, sister, daughter, son-in-law ... because when a man wants to rise, then all these relations and emotions burden him and pull him down

dialogue: Chal maafi maang nahi to sar, pair, mooh sab ek design ka bana doonga ... maafi maang!
englishDialogue: Apologize or else I will make your head, legs, face of the same design ... apologize!

dialogue: Neta jab tak giraftar nahi hota usse naam nahi milta ... logon ki humdardiyan nahi milti
englishDialogue: Until a politician gets arrested he does not get fame ... he does not get sympathy from people

dialogue: Agar tum mein se kisi ne apni jagah se hilne ki koshish ki ... toh tumhare tukdo ko sukhe patton ki tarah hawa mein uda doonga
englishDialogue: If anyone amongst you tries to move from your place ... then I will blow your pieces like dry leaves in the air

dialogue: Main toh apne us dafnaaye huye kal ko kabr se wapas nikaalne ja raha hoon
englishDialogue: I am going to remove my buried past from the grave

dialogue: Maine duniya mein bade baimaan dekhe ... lekin aap logon ke takkar ka ek bhi nahi mila
englishDialogue: I have seen many scoundrels in this world ... but none were to the extent as you guys are

dialogue: Mooch ka baal nikla nahi, shuru ho gaya haram kaari karne
englishDialogue: Your hair of mustache is not even out, and you've already started bastardness

dialogue: Kaun bewakoof hoga, joh aapka mazaak uda karke apne mazaak ka mazaak udayega
englishDialogue: Who will be a fool, who will make fun of his fun after making fun of you

dialogue: Maa ka khoon chaatne wali kutte jaisi zabaan se main apna naam nahi sunana chahta
englishDialogue: I don't want to hear my name from a dogs mouth who licks a mothers blood

dialogue: Auraton ke shareer ka sauda karke daulat kamane waale log toh maine dekhe the ... lekin apni maa ka sauda karne waala dalaal maine apni zindagi mein pehli baar dekha hai
englishDialogue: In my life I have seen people who make money by selling womens body ... but for the first time in my life I am seeing a broker who deals by selling his mother

dialogue: Har aadmi ka kuch na kuch daam hota hai ... daam dedo, aadmi tumhara
englishDialogue: Every person has a price ... pay the price and the person is yours

dialogue: Main marke bhi maroonga nahi ... tumhare andar zinda rahoonga
englishDialogue: I won't die even after dying ... I'll stay alive within you

dialogue: Halaat, kismatein, insaan, zindagi ... waqt ke saath saath sab badal jaata hai
englishDialogue: Situation, luck, human, life ... with time everything changes

dialogue: Agar naali ke keeday ko duniya bhar ka sabun ikattha karke bhi saaf kiya jaye, usko dhoya jaye ... toh bhi woh gande ka ganda hi rahega
englishDialogue: If you collect all the soap in the world and wash and clean a bug from the gutter ... still he will remain dirty

dialogue: Itna maroonga, itna maroonga ki gali gali bheek maangti phiregi teri mundi
englishDialogue: I'll hit you so much that your head will roam around begging on the streets

dialogue: Main aapke ek ek paap, ek ek jurm ka pata lagaonga ... aur jab tak police aapko adalat nahi le jaati aur adalat aapko jail nahi bhejti ... main likhunga, main chaapunga
englishDialogue: I'll find out about every sin, every crime of yours ... and until the police takes you to the court and the court sends you to the jail ... I'll write and I'll print

dialogue: Maut zindagi ki har tasveer ka doosra rukh hai ... karam ache kiye ho toh maut achi milti hai ... pani ki tarah gale se utar jaati hai ... aur agar tumhare jaise karam bure kiye ho toh maut bhi buri hi milti hai ... ek sookhi roti ke tukde ki tarah gale mein atak jaati hai ... neeche nahi utarti
englishDialogue: Death is the other side of every picture of life ... if you have done good deeds then you get a good death ... it slides down the throat like water ... and if you have done bad deeds then you also get a bad death ...   it gets stuck in the throat like a dry piece of bread ... it doesn't go down

dialogue: Insaan ke yeh do haath sirf do haath nahi hote balki uski poori zindagi hoti hai ... inhi do haathon se woh roti kamata hai, roti pakata hai aur roti khata hai
englishDialogue: The two hands of a person are his entire life and not just two hands ... with these two hands he earns food, cooks food and eats food

dialogue: Paapi pet ka sawaal do dhari talwar hota hai ... joh dono taraf kaatta hai
englishDialogue: A hungry stomach is a two edged sword ... which cuts from both sides

dialogue: Yeh duniya khel madari ka, chalaki ka, hoshyari ka ... jeevan ki bansi par dukh ka dumroo dekho deta kaisi taal hai ... bol madari kiske liye yeh behroopiye ka haal hai ... paapi pet ka sawaal hai
englishDialogue: This world is a game of a street performer, of smartness, of advertency ... look the drums of sadness play a nice tune with the flute of life ... so tell me you street performer why are you impersonating ... it's because I need to feed my stomach

dialogue: Pyar ka naam hai judaai ... yahi judaai pyar ka inaam bhi hai aur pyar ki sazaa bhi
englishDialogue: The name of love is separation ... this separation is the award of love and also the punishment of love

dialogue: Tab tak mere samne mat aana jab tak meri aankhen na kamzor ho jaye
englishDialogue: Don't come in front of me until my eyes become weak

dialogue: Dhan ko, hukumat ko mutthi mein rakhkar raj karne waale ameeron ko agar khatam kar diya jaye ... toh is duniya se ameeri aur gareebi ka farak hamesha hamesha ke liye khatam ho jayega
englishDialogue: If you kill the rich people who rule by keeping money and government in their hand ... then the difference between the rich and the poor will end forever from this world

dialogue: Ishwar hazar gunah karne ke baad maaf kar deta hai ... lekin ek baar maa ka dil dukhao toh woh kabhi maaf nahi karta
englishDialogue: God forgives you even if you commit 1000 crimes ... but he will never forgive you, if you make your mother sad even once

dialogue: Ban gaya main bhi mazdoor aaj se ... aaj chutti hai, kaam karoonga kal se
englishDialogue: From today even I have become a worker ... today is a holiday, so I'll work from tomorrow

dialogue: Nahi dalenge hum haath izzat pe tumhari ... pehnayenge mangalsutra yahi khwaish hai hamari
englishDialogue: I won't raise my hand on your honour ... but it's my wish to make you wear a wedding necklace

dialogue: Agar baazuon mein imaan ki taqat, dilon mein sachai aur zubaan pe "Inquilab Zindabad" ka naara hai ... toh zindagi ki har maqsad hamare kadamon mein hoga
englishDialogue: If you have the strength of faith in your arms, truth in your hearts and the words of "Long Live The Revolution" in your voice ... then every goal of life will be in our feet

dialogue: Kiya aaj maine akalmandi ka kaam ... ticket lottery ka liya aur paya inaam ... sunke tum log hoge khushi se naach ... inaam mein mile mujhe rupai paanch
englishDialogue: Today I did something smart ... I bought a lottery ticket and won a prize ... you guys will dance with happiness when I tell you that ... I got Rs. 5 as the prize

dialogue: Jab insaan jawan hota hai toh usse samaaj aur society ki parvah hoti hai ... shaadi ke baad usse biwi bachon ki fikar hoti hai ... aur budhape mein toh sare parivar ki ... yahi toh insaan ki kamzori hai, yahi jeevan sangram hai ... jis mein rakht aur maas ka sangharsh nafrat aur mohabbat ke saath zindagi bhar chalta rehta hai
englishDialogue: When a person becomes young then he is worried about community and society ... after marriage he is worried about wife and kids ... and in old age about the whole family ... this is the weakness of humans, this is the fight of life ... in which blood and flesh keeps struggling with hatred and love for the entire life

dialogue: Bachche ka pet kharab hua toh usko julaab dena ... badhe ke dimaag kharab hua toh usko sharab dena
englishDialogue: If a child has upset stomach then you should purge him ... and if the mind of an adult goes crazy then you should give him alcohol

dialogue: Bacha tha ek hi dost, uski bhi ho rahi hai shaadi ... yahan har mandap se ladki bhaagti hai, isse kehte hai barbaadi
englishDialogue: Only one friend was left, and now even he is getting married ... with me every girl is running away from the wedding, and that's called as destruction

dialogue: Jabse dekha hai maine is daas ko ... na Shakespeare ko padha hai na Kalidas ko
englishDialogue: Since I've seen this sad person ... I haven't read poems by Shakespeare and neither Kalidas

dialogue: Baandha na mangalsutra maine kabhi kisi ko ... tum ghabrao ya chillao, baandhonga main tumhi ko
englishDialogue: I've never tied a wedding necklace on someone ... you may be scared and shouting, but I'll tie it on you only

dialogue: Janam tera is duniya mein kabhi nahi hoga ... main shaadi nahi karoonga, tu paida kaise hoga?
englishDialogue: You will never be born in this world ... because I won't get married, so how will you be born?

dialogue: Vishvas mat karna ispe, naqli hai iska jhanda ... kabhi kutte ke pet se nikla hai murgi ka unda?
englishDialogue: Don't trust him, his flag is not real ... has ever an egg of a chicken come out from the stomach of a dog?

dialogue: Keechri uttare huye zeharilay saanp ko dekhkar reham khana ... aur paschatap ka dhong rachane waale zalim ko maaf karna jurm hai
englishDialogue: To have mercy on a poisonous snake ready to attack ... and to forgive a cruel person acting like he has remorse is a crime

dialogue: Gabrana mat ab main loogna iski jaan ... isse gilori banake khaonga jaise ho Banarasi paan
englishDialogue: Don't worry now I'll take his life ... I'll make him into prepared betel nut and eat him as if it's a betel leaf from Banaras

dialogue: Bina shaadi karvaye aap marne chale ... bandook haath mein li nahi jung ladne chale
englishDialogue: Without getting me married you want to die ... you hardly took the gun in your hand and you want to fight a war

dialogue: Samundar ko reghistan mein badalna aur inquilab ki samadhi banana ... kisi ke bas mein nahi hai
englishDialogue: To turn an ocean into a desert and to make a cenotaph of revolution ... is out of the reach of anyone

dialogue: Buddhoo samajhke karta hai meri maskari ... gusse mein aaonga toh kar donga teri kir-kiri
englishDialogue: You're teasing me thinking I'm a fool ... but if I get angry then I'll beat you up

dialogue: Jab tak yeh daulat sirf chand mutthi bhar logon ke haathon mein talwar bankar rahegi ... tab tak khudgarzi zinda rahegi
englishDialogue: Up until money stays with a few people like a sword ... till then selfishness will stay alive

dialogue: Bhoolkar bhi paise nahi deta mera baap ... kaise khareedon kaise padhon koi kitaab
englishDialogue: My father doesn't give me money no matter what ... so how can I buy and read any book

dialogue: Tum aadmi mamuli nahi bahut azeem ho ... agar yeh Anarkali hai toh tum uske Salim ho
englishDialogue: You're not ordinary, you're great ... if she is Anarkali then you're her Salim

dialogue: Hamari jebon mein bhale hi daulat ki garmi na ho ... lekin hamare khoon mein bahut garmi hai, bahut jaan hai is mein ... tum logon ki tarah aircondition kamron mein bahetkar hamara khoon jam nahi gaya
englishDialogue: Our pockets may not be hot with money ... but our blood is very hot and it has a lot of life in it ... our blood has not dried up unlike people like you who sit in an aircondition room

dialogue: Yeh insaan nahi hai ... yeh toh machine hai ... aaisi machine joh sirf note chaapti hai aur note khaati hai
englishDialogue: He is not a human ... he is a machine ... a machine that prints money and that eats money

dialogue: Sharaab ki botal pe agar main label ki tarah chipak gaya hoon ... toh is label ko chipkane waale aap hai
englishDialogue: If I am stuck as a label on an alcohol bottle ... then you are the person who stuck this label

dialogue: Kalakar sirf taarif ka bhooka hota hai ... paise ka nahi
englishDialogue: A performer is only hungry of appreciation ... not of money

dialogue: Aaj itni bhi maisir nahi maikhane mein ... jitni hum chhod diya karte the paimane mein
englishDialogue: Today there is not even that much alcohol in the bar ... how much I used to leave over in a glass

dialogue: Main ek kalakar hoon ... makkar nahi
englishDialogue: I am a performer ... not a slicker

dialogue: Jigar ka dard upar se kahin malum hota hai? ... ki jigar dard upar se nahin malum hota hai
englishDialogue: Can you see the pain of the heart from outside? ... you cannot see the pain of the heart from outside

dialogue: Aaj ki duniya mein agar zinda rehna hai ... toh duniya ke button apne haath mein rakhne parte hai
englishDialogue: If you want to survive in today's world ... then one should have the buttons of the world in the hand

dialogue: Aap bhi itna samajh le mujhko samjhane ke baad ... aadmi majboor ho jaata hai dil aane ke baad
englishDialogue: You better understand this after making me understand ... a man gets compelled once love comes along

dialogue: Aaj kal ke daud mein hasi ki phasal ughti kahan hai
englishDialogue: In today's age the harvesting of a smile does not happen

dialogue: Jinka apna dil toota hota hai ... woh auron ka dil nahi todha karte
englishDialogue: Those who have a broken heart ... they don't break the heart of others

dialogue: Mooche ho to Nathulalji jaise ho ... varna na ho
