englishDialogue: If you have a mustache then it should be like Mr.Nathulal's ... or else you shouldn't have it

dialogue: Jisne pee nahi whiskey ... kismat phoot gayi uski
englishDialogue: Who doesn't drink whiskey ... will have a broken destiny

dialogue: Duniya ke samne haath nahi jodhte ... warna kaam nikal jaane ke baad duniya waale haath todh dete hai
englishDialogue: Don't fold your hand in front of the world ... otherwise once the work is over then the people of this world will break those hands

dialogue: Sharaabi ko sharaabi nahi toh kya pujari kahoge ... gehun ko gehun nahi toh kya jwari kahoge
englishDialogue: If you don't call alcoholic an alcoholic then what will you call him, a priest ... if you don't call wheat a wheat then what will you call it, sorghum

dialogue: Vaade aksar toot jaate hai ... koshishien kamyab ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Promises usually do break ... efforts do get successful

dialogue: Samundar mein tairne waale ... kuon aur talaabon mein dupkiyan nahi lagaya karte
englishDialogue: Those who swim in the ocean ... don't dive in the wells and the lakes

dialogue: Tofha dene waale ki neeyat dekhi jaati hai ... tofhe ki keemat nahi dekhi jaati
englishDialogue: You should see the intention of the person giving the gift ... not the price of the gift

dialogue: Aapne mujhe woh sab diya jise bazar se khareed ke ek ghar mein sajaya ja sakta hai ... magar woh sukh kabhi nahi diya jise ek dil mein sajaya ja sake
englishDialogue: You gave me everything that can be bought from the market and can be used to decorate a house ... but you never gave me the happiness that can be used to decorate a heart

dialogue: Dar badar sarr patakne se bhala kya hoga ... wahi hoga joh taqdeer mein likha hoga
englishDialogue: There is no point in banging your head everywhere ... whatever is written in destiny will happen

dialogue: Hamari zindagi ka tambu teen bambuon pe khada hua hai ... shayari, sharaab aur aap
englishDialogue: The tent of my life is standing on three sticks ... poems, alcohol and you

dialogue: Inki taarif kya karen ... yeh toh sarr se paun tak taarif hi taarif hai
englishDialogue: How should I praise him ... he is from head to toe a praise himself

dialogue: Talwar woh hathyar hai joh dost ke haath mein ho toh usse badkar koi dost nahi ... aur agar yahi talwar dushman ke haath lag jaye toh usse bura koi dushman nahi
englishDialogue: A sword is a weapon which when is held by a friend then there is no bigger friend than him ... and if the same sword is held by an enemy then there is no bigger enemy than him

dialogue: Jinki ragon mein Rajputi khoon hota hai ... unke jism par dushman ke diye hue ghaav toh hote hai ... lekin unki talwar kafan ki tarah kori nahi hoti
englishDialogue: Those who have royal blood in their veins ... they do have the marks given by the enemy on their body ... but their sword is not as clean as a shroud

dialogue: Ek sacha musalman wafaa ke naam par jaan tak kurbaan kar deta hai ... magar gaddari ka taj pehenkar jee nahi sakta ... chahe us mein Kohinoor ka heera hi kyun na jada ho
englishDialogue: A true Muslim can give up his life in the name of loyalty ... but he will not be able to live wearing a crown of betrayal ... even if it has the Kohinoor diamond on it

dialogue: Meri zindagi ek saaz ban gayi hai ... aur iske har taar par sirf tumhare hi pyar ka geet gaya ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: My life has become a musical instrument ... and on every string of it, only the song of your love can be played

dialogue: Joh zanjeeron mein jakde hote hai woh hamesha gaddar nahi hote ... aur joh oonchi kursiyon par behte hote hai woh hamesha wafaadar nahi hote
englishDialogue: Those who are tied in shackles are not always traitors ... and those who sit on high chairs are not always faithful

dialogue: Aapke liye main zehar ko dhood ki tarah pee sakta hoon ... lekin apne khoon mein aapke liye dushmani ke keeday nahi paal sakta
englishDialogue: For you I can drink poison as if it's milk ... but I cannot nurture the insects of enmity against you in my blood

dialogue: Mera dil us mandir ki tarah hai jis mein ek baar joh murti bitha di jaati hai ... zindagi bhar ussi ki pooja ki jaati hai
englishDialogue: My heart is like a temple in which once you place an idol ... then it's worshipped for the entire life

dialogue: Sachai ki ek hi zaat hoti hai, ek hi nasal hoti hai ... sachai darbar mein bhi wohi hoti hai, bazar mein bhi wohi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Truth has only one species, only one race ... the truth is the same in a court and the same in a market

dialogue: Ujhde hue gulshan mein dekho aaj kaliyan khil gayi ... ek ko chahte the hum aur do do mil gayi
englishDialogue: Today flower buds have blossomed in an abandoned garden ... I was wishing for one and I got two

dialogue: Rajput ladki apne pyar ko keemti heeron ki tarah dil ki tijori mein band karke rakhti hai ... aur upar laga rehta hai sharam ka fauladi taala ... joh kabhi tootta hai toh sirf maut ke hathodon se tootta hai
englishDialogue: A royal girl keeps her love locked in the valut of her heart like expensive diamonds ... and on top of that there is a metal lock of shyness ... which can only be broken by the hammer of death

dialogue: Jisne mere bhai ka khoon bahaya hai ... main usse uske khoon mein nehlake rakh doonga
englishDialogue: The one who has shed my brother's blood ... I'll make him bathe in his own blood

dialogue: Baadshahat bhaichare ko nahi dekhti
englishDialogue: Kingship knows no kinship

dialogue: Behisaab power ya beshumar paisa ... in dono mein se mujhe ek toh chahiye
englishDialogue: Outrageous power or abundant money ... I need either one of the two

dialogue: Apno ki keemat sapno se zyada hoti hai
englishDialogue: The value of family is greater than dreams

dialogue: Ladaiyan sasti nahi hoti ... aur agar sasti hoti toh har koi nahi ladh leta
englishDialogue: Battles are not cheap ... if they were cheap then everyone would fight

dialogue: Khoon aur pasina neeche ki taraf behte hai ... magar paisa upar ki taraf
englishDialogue: Blood and sweat flow downwards ... but money flows upwards

dialogue: Pasina bahane se kai achcha hai khoon bahao ... apna nahi doosro ka
englishDialogue: It is better to shed blood than sweat ... not your own but of others

dialogue: Empires ki neev laashon par hi rakhi jaati hai
englishDialogue: The foundation of empires is built on dead bodies

dialogue: Brahman bhuka toh Sudama, samjha toh Chanakya aur rootha toh Ravan
englishDialogue: If a priest is hungry then he is Sudama, if he understands then he is Chanakya and if he is angry then he is Ravana

dialogue: Aaisi koi harkat mat karna jisse hamara apmaan ho ... kahin bhaura gaye, toh pehle maar maarke badan ko dard denge ... phir maar denge
englishDialogue: Don't do anything that will dishonor me ... if I get mad, then I will give your body a lot of pain by hitting you ... and then I'll kill you

dialogue: Jab hum aayenge garmi thodi badh jayegi ... pata chal hi jayega
englishDialogue: When I'll come it will get a little hot ... you'll come to know

dialogue: Kya karen badi buri aadat hai hamari ... nark ke darwaaze ke samne khade hokar paap karte hai
englishDialogue: What to do with this bad habit of mine ... I stand in front of the doors of hell and commit a sin

dialogue: Hamari goli jaan nahi leti boss ... doosro ke andhar janwar jaga deti hai
englishDialogue: My bullet doesn't kill ... it awakens the animal inside others

dialogue: Chalo hum toh bhool jaye ... par yeh gussa hai ki maanta nahi
englishDialogue: I will forget ... but this anger of mine doesn't listen

dialogue: Maa ne kaha tha beta kabhi kisi ka dil nahi todna ... toh humne dil ko chhodke baki sab toda
englishDialogue: Mom had said that never break anyone's heart ... so leaving the heart I broke everything else

dialogue: Hamare yahan badla lene ki parampara hai ... koi corporate culture nahi hai ... ki agli deal mein purane nuksaan ko adjust kar lenge
englishDialogue: We have a tradition here to take revenge ... it ain't a corporate culture ... where we can adjust the old loss in the next deal

dialogue: Jab galati karna zaroori ho jaye ... toh maafi pehle se hi maang leni chahiye
englishDialogue: When it becomes necessary to commit a mistake ... then you should apologize before hand

dialogue: Goli chalane ke liye plan nahi ... jigra chahiye
englishDialogue: To fire a bullet you don't need a plan ... you need courage

dialogue: Aap hum mein support kariye, hum visphot karenge
englishDialogue: You support me, and I will explode

dialogue: Jahan na pahunche rail gaadi wahan pahunche bail gaadi ... jahan na pahunche bail gaadi wahan pahunche Marwadi
englishDialogue: A bullock cart can reach where a train can't ... and a Marwadi can reach where a bullock cart can't

dialogue: Don't underestimate the power of a common man
englishDialogue: Don't underestimate the power of a common man

dialogue: (Meri dictionary mein impossible ka shabd hi nahi hai) ... Acha ... kahan se khareedi aaisi bakwaas dictionary?
englishDialogue: (My dictionary doesn't have the word impossible in it) ... Alright ... from where did you buy such an useless dictionary?

dialogue: Tu don ki nahi ... donkey ki ladki hai
englishDialogue: You are not a daughter of a don ... you are a daughter of a donkey

dialogue: Chutti manane nikla tha ... tumne meri chutti kar di
englishDialogue: I had left for a vacation ... and you made me go crazy

dialogue: Yeh car nahi, bekaar hai ... dhikaar hai
englishDialogue: This is not a car, it is useless ... it is a waste

dialogue: It is very good to be important ... but it is more important to be good
englishDialogue: It is very good to be important ... but it is more important to be good

dialogue: Hum log jahan pe khadi hoti na ... station wahin se shuru hoti
englishDialogue: Wherever we people stand ... the station starts from there

dialogue: Aye hanger pe tange huye kaale kapde
englishDialogue: Hey you black clothing hanging on a hanger

dialogue: Dhood ka jaala Burnol bhi phook phook ke lagata hai
englishDialogue: One who is burnt by milk even applies Burnol after blowing

dialogue: Sirf insaan galat nahi hote ... waqt bhi galat ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: Not only can humans be wrong ... even the time can be wrong

dialogue: Zinda laane ki zaroorat nahi ... murde bhi chalenge
englishDialogue: No need to get them alive ... dead is also fine

dialogue: Galatiya bhi rishto ki tarah hoti hai ... karni nahi padti ... ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: Mistakes are like relations ... you don't have to do them ... they just happen

dialogue: Trigger kheench ... mamla mat kheench ... khinch gaya na toh bahut takleef doonga
englishDialogue: Pull the trigger ... don't pull the matter ... if it gets pulled then I will give you a lot of suffering

dialogue: Yeh mulk toh meri maa hai ... aur Mumbai shehar meri mashooka
englishDialogue: This country is my mother ... and the city of Mumbai is my love

dialogue: Tum logon ke saath soti ho aur main logon ko sulata hoon
englishDialogue: You sleep with people and I make people sleep forever

dialogue: Bikte toh sabhi hai ... kuch paiso se kuch jazbaat se
englishDialogue: Everyone sells ... some for money and some for emotions

dialogue: Aaj joh kahani khatam kar di hai humne ... isse sunaane waale toh bahut honge ... darr toh yeh hai ki, shayad isse sunne waala koi nahi hoga
englishDialogue: Today the story that we have finished ... there will be many to tell it ... but I am scared that, may be there will be no one to listen to it

dialogue: Duayen apno ke liye li jaati hai
englishDialogue: We pray for our loved ones

dialogue: Jitne saare log ... utni kamzoriya
englishDialogue: The more the people ... the more the weaknesses

dialogue: Koi bhi mission mera ya tumhara nahi ... desh ka hota hai
englishDialogue: No mission is either yours or mine ... it is of the country

dialogue: Kashmir na koi le sakta hai aur Kashmir na koi de sakta hai ... Kashmir mein bus teen din aur do raat ka honeymoon package ho sakta hai
englishDialogue: No one can take Kashmir and no one can give Kashmir ... the only thing that can happen in Kashmir is a three day and two night honeymoon package

dialogue: Pyar agar pant hai toh dosti chaddi hai ... pant agar phat bhi jaye toh chaddi izzat bachati hai
englishDialogue: If love is the pant then friendship is the underwear ... even if the pant rips off then the underwear saves the humiliation

dialogue: When you can't change the girl ... change the girl
englishDialogue: When you can't change the girl ... change the girl

dialogue: Agar tum safed saree mein laal bindi lagakar aa jao ... toh maa kasam ambulance lagogi
englishDialogue: If you come wearing a white sari and a red bindi ... then swear on my mom you will look like an ambulance

dialogue: Woh mili mujhse Heer ki tarah ... taste mein thi woh kheer ki tarah ... aur dil ke paar hui woh teer ki tarah
englishDialogue: She met me like she was Heer ... she tasted like she was a pudding ... and she entered my heart like she was a arrow

dialogue: Wife ne poocha husband se, ke sach kaho kitno ke saath soye ho? ... husband bola, soya toh bus tumhare saath, baki sehkadon ke saath jaga poori raat
englishDialogue: A wife asked her husband, tell me the truth with how many have you slept? ... the husband said, I have only slept with you, but with many others I was awake all night

dialogue: Aurat bhi kya cheez hai ... kuch kaho toh mooh phula leti hai ... aur kuch karo toh pet phula leti hai
englishDialogue: What a thing a woman is ... if you say anything then her face swells ... and if you do anything then her belly swells

dialogue: Buddies you are my chaddies
englishDialogue: Buddies you are my shorts

dialogue: Maine bhari mehfil mein sher maara ... toh sherni vidhva ho gayi
englishDialogue: I said a poem in a big crowd ... and the tigeress became a widow

dialogue: Pachaas pachaas kos door jab raat ko gaon mein baap jagta hai ... toh beta bolta hai ki - "dad soo ja varna mere jaisa ek aur aa jayega"
englishDialogue: Fifty miles away in a village when a father is awake in the night ... then the son says to him - "sleep or else one more like me will come"

dialogue: Ibtada-e-ishq hai, rota hai kya ... toilet paper hai, dhota hai kya?
englishDialogue: It's the beginning of love, why do you cry ... there is toilet paper, do you want to wipe with that?

dialogue: Na suhaag hai na raat hai, phir bhi suhaagraat ka scene nazar aata hai ... believe it or not, har kutte ka din aata hai
englishDialogue: Neither there is a wedding nor is it night, but it still looks like a scene of the nuptial night ... believe it or not, every dog has its day

dialogue: Chahe marr hum jaye phir bhi marham lagake jayenge ... dost ke dil se utar ke nahi, dost ke dil mein utar ke jayenge
englishDialogue: Even if I die I will apply the ointment and go ... and when I go I won't break my friends heart, I will get in my friends heart and go

dialogue: Madhuri ki muskaan, Juhi ka jadoo, Sridevi ki shararat ... aur dhaki hui Mallika Sherawat
englishDialogue: She has the smile of Madhuri, the magic of Juhi, the mischief of Sridevi ... and she is covered Mallika Sherawat

dialogue: Life mein teen cheezo ko kabhi underestimate nahi karna chahiye ... love, sex aur dokha
englishDialogue: Never underestimate 3 things in life ... love, sex and betrayal

dialogue: When I am good I am good ... when I am bad I am even better
englishDialogue: When I am good I am good ... when I am bad I am even better

dialogue: Hum toh ghante hai lekin woh khatre ki ghanti hai ... saali China ka maal hai nah guarantee hai na warranty hai
englishDialogue: I am nothing but she is the bell of danger ... bloody she is the China stuff which has no guarantee and no warranty

dialogue: Bomb woh thi blast main ho gaya ... bina ruke kisi station par yeh slow train bhi fast ho gaya
englishDialogue: She was the bomb and I got blasted ... without stopping on any station this slow train became a fast one

dialogue: Is vidya ke mandir mein ... yahan vidya ki murat hai toh wahan vidya ka bhashan hai ... magar afsoos is baat ka hai ki hamare paas "Dirty Picture" ki Vidya Balan nahi hai
englishDialogue: In this temple of knowledge ... here we have an idol of knowledge and there we have a lecture on knowledge ... but unfortunately we don't have Vidya Balan from the movie "The Dirty Picture"

dialogue: Early to bed and early to rise ... makes your girlfriend go with other guys
englishDialogue: Early to bed and early to rise ... makes your girlfriend go with other guys

dialogue: Yeh Seema woh hai jiski koi seema nahi ... aur yeh Seema woh hai jiske character ka koi bima nahi
englishDialogue: She is that Seema who has no limits ... and she is that Seema who has no insurance of her character

dialogue: Kiss ki nahi hoti koi classes ... it's just a hit with the masses
englishDialogue: There are no classes for kiss ... it's just a hit with the masses

dialogue: Ek minute ki value kisi ek olympic runner se pooch ... ek minute ki value toaster mein jalte hue slice se pooch ... unatees minute ke baad delivery karne waale pizza boy se pooch
englishDialogue: Ask the value of a minute to an olympic runner ... ask the value of a minute to the slice which is burning in the toaster ... and to the pizza boy who delivers after 29 minutes

dialogue: Yeh shakal se H20 hai aur akal se H2SO4 hai
englishDialogue: He is H2O (water) by face and H2SO4 (sulfuric acid) by brains

dialogue: Yeh chaand bhi kya ghazab dhahta hai ... bachpan mein mama aur jawani mein apne hi bachche ki amma nazar aata hai
englishDialogue: How amazing is the moon ... in childhood it looks like my mother and in youth it looks like the mother of my child

dialogue: Tu hi Seema ka sacha He-man hai ... tune chaddi bahar nahi pehni toh kya hua ... tu hi uska Superman hai
englishDialogue: You are the true He-man of Seema ... so what if you haven't worn your underwear outside ... you are her Superman

dialogue: Har ladka soft drink ki botal ki tarah hota hai ... dimag ki jagah upar dhakan hota hai
englishDialogue: Every boy is like the bottle of soda ... instead of a mind they have a cap on the top

dialogue: Dono ka blood group bhi ek hi hai ... isliye nahi ki dono judwaa hai ... isliye ki dono ek doosre ka khoon chooste rehte hai
englishDialogue: They both have the same blood group ... not because they are twins ... but because they keep sucking the blood of each other

dialogue: You're the one jispe atka hai mann
englishDialogue: You're the one on whom my heart is stuck

dialogue: Aaj se main tera kambal tu meri razai ... main tera Honda tu meri Hyundai ... main tera langot tu meri neck tie ... main tujhe salaam karta hoon bhai
englishDialogue: From today I am your blanket and you are my quilt ... I am your Honda and you are my Hyundai ... I am your loincloth and you are my neck tie ... I salute you my brother

dialogue: Ek dost ne ek dost ko yun peeta ... tann ki shakti, mann ki shakti senorita
englishDialogue: One friend was beaten by another friend ... oh Miss, it is the strength of the body and the strength of the heart

dialogue: Ki gal hai? ... life mein koi girl hai?
englishDialogue: What's the matter? ... is their a girl in life?

dialogue: Physically maro line toh tabhiyat ekdum fine
englishDialogue: When you hit on someone physically then health becomes perfectly fine

dialogue: What Raniji can't ... I can!
englishDialogue: What Raniji can't ... I can!

dialogue: Apne dil ke detergent se saare gile shikve saaf kar dijiye
englishDialogue: Wipe all the complaints using the detergent of your heart

dialogue: Bande hain hum uske, hum pe kiska zor ... umeedo ke suraj, nikle chaaron aurr ... iraade hai fauladi, himmati har kadam ... apne haatho kismat likhne, aaj chale hain hum
englishDialogue: I am God's man, who could dare to defy me ... the Sun of hopes, is out in all directions ... my intentions are solid, and there is courage in every step ... I have set forth today, to write my own destiny

dialogue: Maskarre ka khel dhokhe ka khel hota hai ... jis mein audience ko lagta hai ki jeet unki ho rahi hai ... lekin jeette hum hai, hamesha
englishDialogue: The game of comedy is a game of deceit ... in which the audience thinks that they are winning ... but instead I win, always

dialogue: Joh duniya ko namumkin lage ... wahi mauka hota hai ... kartab dikhane ka
englishDialogue: What the world thinks is impossible ... that is the right opportunity ... to show your stunts

dialogue: Hoshyari, tarkieb aur dokha ... teeno mil jaaye toh log usse jadoo samajhte hai
englishDialogue: When smartness, plan and deceit all three come together ... then people think it's magic

dialogue: Chor aur police ki sirf dushmani hoti hai
englishDialogue: There can only be enmity between a thief and a cop

dialogue: Aaye toh the sharafat se ... lekin jayenge toh dhoom machake
englishDialogue: I came here with honesty ... but I'll go with a bang

dialogue: Asli jeet badle ki nahi ... sapne ki hoti hai
englishDialogue: Revenge never has true victory ... but dreams do

dialogue: Kaam ka soocho ... Kamasutra ka nahi
englishDialogue: Think about work ... not about Kamasutra

dialogue: Dimaag apan ka hai jaise kismis ... chota par meetha ... zyada chalayega toh ghis jayega
englishDialogue: My brain is like raisins ... small but sweet ... if I use it more then it will wear away

dialogue: Maafi sazaa se badhke hoti hai
englishDialogue: Apology is bigger than punishment

dialogue: Ya toh chori nahi hogi ... ya chor nahi hoga
englishDialogue: Either there won't be a robbery ... or either the robber won't live

dialogue: Chor ki kismat hamesha police ke haathon mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: The fate of a robber always lies in the hands of the police

dialogue: Paisa khuda nahi hai ... par khuda kasam, khuda se kam bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: Money is not God ... but swear on God, it is not less than God either

dialogue: Apun ko apna shakal aur kirdaar mein koi confusion nahi hai ... apun jaisa kamina dikhta hai ... waisa hich hai
englishDialogue: I have no confusion in between my look and my role ... the way I look like a scoundrel ... I am exactly a scoundrel

dialogue: Mereko apna naam bahut bada karke janeka hai
englishDialogue: I have to make my name very big before I go

dialogue: Aaropi ke khilaaf chargesheet pehle pakki karta hoon ... haath baad mein dalta hoon
englishDialogue: First I confirm the chargesheet against the alleged ... and then I put my hands on him

dialogue: Yakeen aur shak mein zara sa hi fasla hai ... koi shak?
englishDialogue: There is only a small gap between belief and suspicion ... any doubts?

dialogue: Pehle bada upar jaata hai ... phir chota bada ban jaata hai ... simple
englishDialogue: First the big man dies ... then the small man becomes the big man ... it's simple

dialogue: Department tereko promotion dega ... pan retire main karega tereko
englishDialogue: The department will give you a promotion ... but I will get you retired

dialogue: Raah se bhatakne ki bhool hote hi ... zindagi saath chhodna shuru kar deti hai
englishDialogue: When you commit the mistake of going down the wrong path ... then life starts to leave you alone

dialogue: Agar ek ladki ne zakhm diya hai na ... toh marham sirf doosri ladki laga sakti hai
englishDialogue: If one girl has given you the wound ... then only an other girl can apply the ointment

dialogue: I keel dead peepal!
englishDialogue: I kill dead people!

dialogue: Love is loveless ... I am jobless
englishDialogue: Love is loveless ... I am jobless

dialogue: Yeh love bhi kya cheez hai ... ek doosre se ek shabd bhi na kehna aur tab bhi ek doosre ke itne kareeb hona ... us khamoshi ka kuch aur hi mazaa hai
englishDialogue: Love is such a strange thing ... where without saying even a word people are close to each other ... that silence has it's own fun

dialogue: Beauty ko samajhne ke liye usse dekhna padta hai
englishDialogue: To understand beauty you first have to look at it

dialogue: Alpha males ke beech mein agar ek ambitious woman ko apni jagah banani hai na ... toh thoda bahut alpha woman banna parta hai
englishDialogue: In between alpha males if an ambitious woman wants to create her space ... then she has to be a little bit of an alpha woman

dialogue: Aurat jab ho jaye khunkhar ... kha jaye sari duniya maare na dhakaar
englishDialogue: When a woman turns ferocious ... she eats the whole world and doesn't even burp

dialogue: Dard hum mein nahi ... hum dard ko chunte hai
englishDialogue: The pain doesn't select us ... we select the pain

dialogue: Duniya ka sabse khatarnak janwar insaan hi hota hai
englishDialogue: The most dangerous animal in the world is a human

dialogue: Kutta, kutta hi rehta hai chahe kitna hi wafaadar ho jaaye ... malik nahi banta
englishDialogue: A dog remains a dog no matter how faithful he becomes ... he doesn't turn into a master

dialogue: Agar kisi ki zindagi ka bhoj badhana ho ... toh apna poora aitbaar uske kandhon par daal do
englishDialogue: If you want to increase the burden in someone's life ... then put all your trust on their shoulders

dialogue: Mera aur is duniya ka ajeeb rishta hai ... we both hate each other equally
englishDialogue: The world and me have a strange relationship ... we both hate each other equally

dialogue: Kamzori duniya ki sabse badi bimari hoti hai
englishDialogue: Weakness is the biggest disease in the world

dialogue: Khuda ko manaa nahi, jaana jaata hai
englishDialogue: You don't believe in God, you try to know him

dialogue: Shareer nashvar hai ... aatma amar hai
englishDialogue: The body is mortal ... and the soul is immortal

dialogue: Jiski mrityu ka samay nahi aata ... usse koi nahi maar sakta
englishDialogue: Until the time of death comes ... no one can kill that person

dialogue: Nyay aur dharam ke liye yudh karna hinsa nahi ... veerta hai
englishDialogue: To battle for justice and your duty is not violence ... it is courageous

dialogue: Burai mein taqat jitni bhi ho ... uska antim sanskar achchai hi karti hai
englishDialogue: No matter how much strength the evil has ... its funeral rites are done by the good only

dialogue: Marte toh woh hai joh janam lete hai
englishDialogue: People die only if they are born

dialogue: Insaan hona meri kamzori nahi meri taqat hai ... kyun ki mere paas hai har baap ka aashirwad aur har bache ka pyar
englishDialogue: To be human is my strength, not my weakness ... because I have the blessing of every father and the love of every child

dialogue: Haath chote ho toh kya hua ... himmat badi honi chahiye
englishDialogue: So what if your hands are small ... your courage should be big

dialogue: Is vansh ka koi ansh nahi rehne doonga main
englishDialogue: I will not leave any person of this generation alive

dialogue: Darr ka business is the best business
englishDialogue: The business of scare is the best business

dialogue: Insaan ko kabhi ishwar banne ki koshish nahi karni chahiye
englishDialogue: A human should never try to be God

dialogue: Joh har haath ko haath aur har kisi ka saath deta hai ... wohi toh Krrish hai
englishDialogue: One who gives a hand to everyone and stands by everyone ... is Krrish

dialogue: Jagah bhi sahi hai aur waqt bhi ... iraada shayad galat hai
englishDialogue: The place and time are both right ... may be my intention is wrong

dialogue: Tumhara face football se tennis ball kyun ban gaya?
englishDialogue: Why did your face turn from a football into a tennis ball?

dialogue: Dhoop zindagi deti hai
englishDialogue: Sunlight gives life

dialogue: Joh kisi ki aasoon ki jagah muskurahat lata hai ... wohi toh hai Krrish
englishDialogue: The one that brings a smile on someone instead of tears ... is Krrish

dialogue: Logon ko thoda marne do ... aur zyada darne do
englishDialogue: Let people die a little ... but let them be scared a lot

dialogue: Shaadi saath janamon ka bandhan hota hai ... maine toh apni galatiyon ka quota aadhe janam mein hi poora kar diya ... bas ab baki ke sade-che janam sirf tumhe pyar dena chahta hoon
englishDialogue: Marriage is a bond of 7 rebirths ... I've finished the quota of my mistakes in half a life itself ... now I only want to give you love for the remaining 6.5 rebirths

dialogue: Mard hai na ek aurat ke saath bore ho jaata hai ... aurat bore nahi hoti ... aur jab mard bore ho jaata hai toh uske joh hormones hai na usko attack karne lagte hai
englishDialogue: A man gets bored with one woman ... but a woman doesn't get bored ... and when a man gets bored then his hormones start to attack him

dialogue: Hormones ko koi farak nahi padta aadmi hai ya aurat hai ... discrimination na tum jaise log karte ho society mein
englishDialogue: Hormones don't care if it's a man or a woman ... it's people like you who discriminate in the society

dialogue: Dosti ek aaisa rishta hai joh insaan khud banata hai ... baki sab rishtey toh apne aap hi ban jaate hai
englishDialogue: Friendship is a relation that a person makes himself ... all other relations are made by themselves

dialogue: Baap baap hota hai ... maa maa hoti hai ... lekin zaroorat padne par dost maa, baap, bhai, behen, sab kuch ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: A father is a father ... a mother is a mother ... but if needed then a friend can become a mother, father, brother, sister, everything

dialogue: Agar thaan lenge na ... toh phad denge!
englishDialogue: If we decide that we have to do it ... then we will kill it!

dialogue: Hum jis raaste ko apnate hai ... woh utna hi important hai jitni hamari manzil
englishDialogue: The path that we take ... is also as important as our destination is

dialogue: Maal chahiye chokha ... toh note karo ji mota
englishDialogue: If you want good merchandize ... then you need to shed good money

dialogue: Jab tab main apne sapno ke saath poori tarah khel na loon ... unhe bechta nahi
englishDialogue: Until I am completely done playing with my dreams ... I don't sell them

dialogue: Paisa hi aapka dharm hai ... aur bazaar aapki morality
englishDialogue: Money is your religion ... and the market is your morality

dialogue: Uski jeet ko main apni jeet mein badal doonga
englishDialogue: I will make his victory into mine

dialogue: Race hamesha meri thi aur meri hi rahegi ... kyun ki main is race ka sabse purana khiladi hoon
englishDialogue: The race always was and will remain mine ... because I am the oldest player of this race

dialogue: A for apple, B for be quiet ... nahi toh C for chata
englishDialogue: A for apple, B for be quiet ... or else it will be C for clout

dialogue: Agar life ka one third hissa sokar ki guzarna hai ... toh akele hi kyun?
englishDialogue: If one third of one's life is to be spent sleeping ... then why do it alone?

dialogue: Badla jitna purana hota hai ... utna hi khatarnak hota hai
englishDialogue: The older the revenge ... the more dangerous it gets

dialogue: Aaj meri wajah se tumhari ek achchi aadat chute jayegi ... zinda bachchne ki
englishDialogue: Today because of me you will lose a good habit ... the habit escaping death

dialogue: Mujhe aaise mard bahut pasand hai ... jinke baare mein main yeh nahi samajh paati ... ki woh tezz zyada hai yah good looking
englishDialogue: I love men of the type ... about whom I don't understand ... whether they are more intelligent or more good looking

dialogue: Men are many, but money is money!
englishDialogue: Men are many, but money is money!

dialogue: Sabar ka phal meetha hota hai, aur usse bhi zyada meetha hota hai ... sabere ka phal
englishDialogue: Patience is rewarding, but far more rewarding is ... morning fruit

dialogue: Hum jaise purane paapi agar bhagwan ko pyare hone lage ... toh uske reputation ka kya hoga
englishDialogue: If experienced sinful people like us die ... then God's reputation will go bad

dialogue: Ab mujhe life mein khushi chahiye ... khud-khushi nahi
englishDialogue: Now I want happiness in life ... not suicide

dialogue: Main paisa ghode par nahi ... jockey par lagata hoon
englishDialogue: I don't bet on the horse ... I bet on the jockey

dialogue: Nazar teer par nahi ... nishaane par honi chahiye
englishDialogue: The eye must not be on the arrow ... it must be on the target

dialogue: Upar waale ne tumhe aage aur peeche bahut kuch diya hai ... lekin upar kuch nahi diya hai
englishDialogue: God has given you a lot in the front and in the back ... but he has not given you anything on the top

dialogue: Achchi neend = achchi soch = achcha jeevan
englishDialogue: Good sleep = good thinking = good life

dialogue: Sapna dekhna gunah nahi hai ... sapne mein gunah karna nisangik hai ... sapna na dekhna sangeen apradh hai ... sapne mein gunah karna zaroori hai
englishDialogue: Dreaming is not a crime ... it's natural to a commit in your dream ... not dreaming is a serious crime ... it is necessary to commit a crime in your dream

dialogue: Duniya mein shohrat, paisa bahut hai ... magar neend ki kami hai
englishDialogue: The world is full of fame, money ... but there is lack of sleep

dialogue: Bali hamesha bakre ki di jaati hai ... sher ki nahi
englishDialogue: A sacrifice is always given of a goat ... not of a tiger

dialogue: Paapiyo se binti karo, samjhao ... agar woh phir bhi na maane, toh sabki bhalai ke liye ... talwar uthao
englishDialogue: First you request sinners and make them understand ... if they still don't agree then for the good for everyone ... pick up the sword

dialogue: Sardar jab dushman ko pakad leta hai na ... toh uski haddiyan tad-tadane lagti hai
englishDialogue: When a Sikh catches his enemy ... then his bones start to tremble

dialogue: Is duniya mein gham bahut hai ... aur baantne waale haath bahut kam
englishDialogue: There is a lot of sadness in this world ... but the hands that share that are very few

dialogue: Aam aadmi de andhar bhi bhoot rehnda hai ... usse bahar mat aane do ... bahar aa gaya na toh siyapa peh jayega
englishDialogue: Even a common man has a ghost inside him ... don't let it come out ... if it comes out then there will be chaos

dialogue: Zinda wohi hai joh jhukta hai ... akadte toh sirf murda hai
englishDialogue: Those who bow down are alive ... only dead people are adamant

dialogue: Duniya burri is liye nahi hai kyun ki burre logon ke haath mein taqat hai ... duniya burri is liye hai kyun ki achche log ek saath milkar apni taqat ka sahi istamal nahi karte
englishDialogue: The world is not evil because evil people have the power ... the world is evil because good people don't make right use of their powers collectively

dialogue: Pyar ki kahani jahan bhi kahi jaati hai ... dard ki lakeerein seena cheer jaati hai
englishDialogue: Wherever the story of love said ... the lines of pain tear apart the body

dialogue: Jab haath kaatne ka waqt aayega na ... toh tumko haath uthane ka mauka bhi nahi milega
englishDialogue: When the time comes to cut your hand ... then you won't even get the chance to raise your hand

dialogue: Jab yeh haath kisi par desi tarike se padta hai na ... toh aadmi gendh ki tarah boundary se nahi ... stadium se bahar chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: When this hand falls on someone in the Indian style ... then that person flies like a ball not only behind the boundary ... but also out of the stadium

dialogue: Sadde vich Gandhi bhi hai, Patel bhi hai ... teh thoda Bhagat Singh bhi hai
englishDialogue: There is Gandhi in me, there is Patel in me ... and there is a little bit of Bhagat Singh also in me

dialogue: Hai bahut andhyar, suraj nikalna chahiye ... ho kisi tarah se bhi, mausam badalna chahiye
englishDialogue: It is very dark, the Sun must come out ... no matter which way, but the weather must change

dialogue: Hum Bhudev hai ... bhooton ka dev!
englishDialogue: I am Bhudev ... the God of death!

dialogue: Aaj raqeeb ko pila di hai tune sharaab ... un dekhna usse kaise nikalti hai aag
englishDialogue: Today you have made your caretaker drink alcohol ... now watch how fire comes out of him

dialogue: Choti choti baaton se bade kahan ho jaoge ... patli galiyon se nikloge toh khuli sadak par aaoge
englishDialogue: You won't get big with small talks ... and only when you come out of the small streets, you'll reach the open road

dialogue: Agar meri behen ki khushi ki taraf aankh uthayi na ... toh tere kandhe par kabhi gardan bhi thi ... pata nahi chalega
englishDialogue: Even if you look towards the happiness of my sister ... then the fact that you had a head on your shoulders ... you won't even know that

dialogue: Jiska danda ooncha ... uska janda ooncha
englishDialogue: Whoever has the tallest stick ... their flag stays higher

dialogue: Itna khoon ka aasoon rulayenge tumko ... ki zindagi khatam ho jayega ... aasoon nahi
englishDialogue: I will make you weep so many tears of blood ... that your life will end ... but not your tears

dialogue: Asli power dil mein hoti hai!
englishDialogue: The real power lies within the heart!

dialogue: Logon ke pairon mein chakkar hota hai ... mere dimaag mein hai
englishDialogue: People have a swirl in their legs ... I have it in my mind

dialogue: Kehte hai shaadi mein agar pyar banaye rakhna hai toh do cheezein bahut zaroori hoti hai ... pati ki haar aur heeron ka haar
englishDialogue: It is said that if you want to maintain the love in a marriage then two things are very important ... a husbands defeat and a necklace of diamonds

dialogue: Khushiyan kisi ki mohtaj nahin hoti, dosti yunhi ittefaq se nahin hoti ... kuch toh maine honge is pal ke, warna yunhi aapse mulaqat nahin hoti
englishDialogue: Happiness does not depend on anything, friendship does not happen by chance ... there might some reasons to this moment, otherwise we wouldn't have met just like that

dialogue: Maut se zyada khoobsurat entertainment koi nahin
englishDialogue: There is no other entertainment more beautiful than death

dialogue: Usse door se hi taakta raha ... bas yunhi waqt kaatta raha ... na jaane kyun nigahen thami rahi ... bas uske chehre par hi jami rahi ... kabhi chand samajhkar kabhi chandni ... hum usse dekhte rahe tehzeeb se ... par kabhi socha na tha unka deedar hoga inte kareeb se
englishDialogue: I kept staring at her from a distance ... I was spending my time just like that ... I don't know why my eyes got stuck ... but they were focused on just her face ... sometimes like the moon and sometimes like the moonlight ... I kept looking at her in a good manner ... but I had never thought that I will see her this closely

dialogue: Kisi sharif ke kaminepan ko dekhne mein joh mazaa aata hai na ... woh kisi harami ke haramipan mein nahi
englishDialogue: The enjoyment that you get in watching the sneakiness of a honest man ... you don't get that in the bastardy behavior of a bastard

dialogue: To know, that you don't know ... is very important
englishDialogue: To know, that you don't know ... is very important

dialogue: If you lie, you die!
englishDialogue: If you lie, you die!

dialogue: Kitni baar kaha hai ... aaish kar, ishq mat kar
englishDialogue: How many times have I told you ... have fun, don't fall in love

dialogue: Humne itne paap kiye hai na ... ki agar Ganga mein dupki laga di ... toh Ganga maiya kisi aur ke paap nahi doh payegi
englishDialogue: We have committed so many sins ... that if we take a dip in the river Ganges ... then the river Ganges will not be able to rinse anyone elses sins

dialogue: When jatt full tight ... is full right
englishDialogue: When a Sikh is drunk ... then he is completely right

dialogue: Main tujhko dekhte hi samajh gaya si ... tere andhar genius ke bacteria maujood hai
englishDialogue: The moment I saw you I knew that ... the bacteria of a genius is inside you

dialogue: Joh aadmi taqat se nahi harta ... woh emotion se harta hai
englishDialogue: A person who cannot lose on strength ... loses on emotion

dialogue: Main udna chahta hoon, daudna chahta hoon, girna bhi chahta hoon ... bus rukna nahi chahta
englishDialogue: I want to fly, I want to run, I even want to fall ... I just don't want to stop

dialogue: 22 tak padhai, 25 pe naukri, 26 pe chokri, 30 pe bachche, 60 pe retirement ... aur phir maut ka intezaar ... dhat aaisi ghisi piti life thodi jeena chahta hoon
englishDialogue: Study till 22, job at 25, girl at 26, kids at 30, retirement at 60 ... and then wait for death ... who wants to live such a boring life

dialogue: Tumhari smile kitni dangerous hai pata hai? ... mere paas dil hota na, teri smile pe pakka aa jaata
englishDialogue: Do you know how dangerous your smile is? ... if I had a heart, then I would have definitely lost it on your smile

dialogue: Mujhe tumse pyar ho jayega ... phir se
englishDialogue: I will fall in love with you ... again

dialogue: Tumhare jaisi ladkiyan flirting ke liye nahi ... ishq ke liye bani hai
englishDialogue: Girls like you are not made for flirting ... they are made for love

dialogue: Tum pehle bhi itni khoobsurat thi ... yah waqt ne kiya koi haseen sitam?
englishDialogue: Were you this beautiful earlier too or ... did time do a beautiful injustice?

dialogue: Shaadi is dal chawal for pachaas saal till you die ... arre life mein thoda bahut keema pav, tangdi kabab, hakka noodle bhi hona chahiye nah?
englishDialogue: Marriage is lentil rice for 50 years till you die ... there should be a little bit of minced mutton with bread, chicken drumsticks and hakka noodles in life, right?

dialogue: Yaadein mithai ke dibbe ki tarah hoti hai ... ek baar khula toh sirf ek tukda nahi kha paoge
englishDialogue: Memories are like a box of sweets ... once it opens then you can't eat just one piece

dialogue: Ishq meri sehat ke liye achcha nahi hai
englishDialogue: Love is not good for my health

dialogue: Shaadi ke basic concept mein hi jhol hai
englishDialogue: The basic concept of marriage itself has a catch

dialogue: Badtameezi ek bimaari hai ... aaisi bimaari joh dheere dheere waqt ke saath budhape mein badal jaati hai ... main kehta hoon jab tak budhapa nahi aata ... todhi badtameezi hi kar lete hai
englishDialogue: Bad manners is a disease ... a disease which slowly over time changes into old age ... but I'm saying that until old age comes ... let us behave with bad manners

dialogue: Husn ka mazaak na uda ... kahin husn ke haathon tera mazaak na ban jaaye ... manchala hai, khoobsurat hai, magar ladka hai tu ... tujhe ladkon aur mardon mein fark kaun samjhaye
englishDialogue: Don't make fun of beauty ... may you not get insulted by the hands of beauty ... you're free spirited, you're handsome, but still you're a boy ... who can make you understand the difference between a boy and a man

dialogue: Yeh shokhi, yeh adaayen, yeh baankpan ... inki keemat bhala duniya tay kar sakti hai kya ... achcha chal itna bata teeno ka milake package mein kuch kam karti hai kya
englishDialogue: This vividness, this grace, this jolliness ... how can the world put a price on these ... ok, atleast tell me if you can reduce the price if I take all three as a package

dialogue: Yeh nigahen nashtar, yeh honth kausar ... meri aagosh mein hosh bhi behosh hoga ... ab bhi waqt hai nikal lo bhailog ... nahi toh kal subah afsoos hoga
englishDialogue: These eyes are like a knife, these lips are like a river ... in my embrace even senses will become unconscious ... you still have time friends to leave now ... otherwise youll regret it tomorrow morning

dialogue: Pichwade mein itni goli maroonga ... ki uske bachche pittal ke paida honge
englishDialogue: I will shoot so many bullets in his ass ... that his kids will be born of brass

dialogue: Aaj agar maut khud mere aur uske beech khadi ho jaaye na ... toh main maut ko bhi maar doonga
englishDialogue: Today even if death stands between me and him ... then I will kill death also

dialogue: Na courat, na kacheri, na appeal, na date ... direct sazaa
englishDialogue: No court, no judiciary, no appeal, no date ... direct punishment

dialogue: Kutta kitna bhi khatarnak ho jaaye ... sher ki nahi le paata
englishDialogue: No matter how dangerous a dog gets ... he cannot take on a tiger

dialogue: Kabhi bal se toh kabhi chhal se ... kitno ki Lanka dhai hai ... par is shehar ki hawa mein kuch ajeeb se garmai hai ... is liye purane paintere chhod, ab yahan akal ladane ki baari aayi hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes with strength and sometimes with tricks ... I have burnt so many Lanka's ... but there is some strange warmth in the air of this city ... that's why leaving old tricks alone, it is the turn to use brains here

dialogue: Yeh kaminapan mere sivah kaun karega?
englishDialogue: Who will do this sneakiness other than me?

dialogue: Nishana lagane ka maaza tab aata hai ... jab shikaar daud raha ho ... khade hue insaan ko maarna aaise hai ... jaise mele mein gubaare phodna
englishDialogue: To take an aim is fun ... when the prey is running ... killing a person who is standing ... is like blowing balloons in the fair

dialogue: Yahan par koi halka nahi mootta
englishDialogue: No one pees here lightly

dialogue: Joh na kar paye bandook ki goli ... woh kar jaye bas ek meethi boli
englishDialogue: What the bullet of a gun can't do ... that can be done by flattery

dialogue: Zindagi aur maut aankh mein choli ka khel hai ... par Pritam Singh jab khele toh baki sab fail hai
englishDialogue: Life and death is the game of hide and seek ... but when Pritam Singh plays then everyone else fails

dialogue: Pritam Singh zinda rehne ka ek mauka sabko deta hai ... joh maan le toh theek, varna upar jaake rota hai
englishDialogue: Pritam Singh gives everyone one chance to stay alive ... one who agrees is OK, or else he goes up and cries

dialogue: Na koi marta hai, na koi maarta hai ... yeh main nahi kehta, Gita mein likha hai
englishDialogue: No one dies, no one kills ... I don't say this, it is written in the Bhagavad Gita

dialogue: Sawaal yeh nahi hai ki tum ughloge ya nahi ... sawaal yeh hai ki hum ughalwana jaante hai
englishDialogue: The question is not that you will talk or not ... the question is that do we know how to make you talk

dialogue: Zindagi ek taraf se khali kar deti hai ... toh doosri taraf se bhar bhi toh deti hai
englishDialogue: Life makes us empty from one side ... but then it also fills us up from the other side

dialogue: Everything is planned!
englishDialogue: Everything is planned!

dialogue: Main ittefaq se koi kaam nahi karta
englishDialogue: I don't do any work by coincidence

dialogue: Daal mein thoda sa pani dalo, phir usse garam karo ... phir thoda sa apni khoobsurati ka namak, apni shararat ki mirchi aur apne masoomiyat ki malai dal do ... aur mohabbat ke makhan ka tadka laga do ... aisi daal banegi ki daal toh daal, saath mein main tumhe bhi kha jaaonga
englishDialogue: Put a little water in the pulses, then heat it up ... then put a little salt of your beauty, spice of your mischief and cream of your innocence ... then garnish it with the butter of your love ... with that such great pulses will be ready, that I will eat you along with the pulses

dialogue: Akalmand aadmi mein ek bahut badi bewakoofi hoti hai ... woh apne sivah sari duniya ko bewakoof samajhta hai
englishDialogue: A wise man has one big foolishness in him ... he thinks that the whole world is foolish except him

dialogue: Khuli talwar aur bhari hui bandook ... khule mein nahi rakhte
englishDialogue: An uncovered sword and a loaded gun ... should not be kept in the open

dialogue: Magarmach ke mooh se shayad gosh ka tukda nikalna aasaan hai ... lekin Baburao jisko apne daanton mein daboch le na ... usse na toh aaj tak koi chhuda paya hai aur na chhuda payega
englishDialogue: It may be easier to pull out a piece of meat from a crocodile's mouth ... but the one who Baburao catches with his teeth ... no one till today has been able to free him and neither anyone will be able to free him

dialogue: Tera ek ek aasoon mere liye bada bada samundar hai
englishDialogue: Each and every tear drop of yours is a big ocean for me

dialogue: Kya bachon ki tarah cricket khel rahe ho? ... khelna hai toh mere kaale kaale lambe baalon se khel ... mere reshmi dupatte ke aanchal se khel ... mere khwabon mein aakar mere khayalon se khel
englishDialogue: Why are you playing cricket like the kids? ... if you want to play then play with my black long hair ... play with the edge of my silky scarf ... come in my dreams and play with my thoughts

dialogue: Jis din tu mere hatthe chad gaya ... samajhna us hi din tu sooli par chad gaya
englishDialogue: The day you come in my hands ... understand that, that day you will be hanged

dialogue: Tumne toh bina petrol ke mere dil mein woh aag laga di hai ... jisse samundar bhi nahi bujha sakta
englishDialogue: Even without petrol you've started that fire in my heart ... which even the ocean can't extinguish

dialogue: Kiski nass mein kitna khoon hai ... yeh khooni bhediya achchi tarah jaanta hai
englishDialogue: Who has how much blood in their veins ... a killer wolf knows that very well

dialogue: Aaj main teri khaal hi nahi ... khaal ka ek ek baal bhi noch daloonga
englishDialogue: Today not only your skin ... I'll rip out every hair on your skin as well

dialogue: Jab zindagi mein pehli baar koi kisi ko I love you bolta hai na ... kya lagta hai ... aaisa lagta hai ki ek bottle daru aang ke andar ghus gaya ho ... aur daru bhi aaisa jis mein mithaas bhi hai aur nasha bhi
englishDialogue: When someone says I love you to someone for the first time ... then it feels so good ... it feels as if a bottle of alcohol has entered in the body ... and that kind of alcohol in which there is sweetness and intoxication as well

dialogue: Is duniya ke andar apne pyar ka gala ghontana bahut mushkil hai ... magar joh aadmi apun ko pyar karta hai ... uska dil todna bahut paap hai
englishDialogue: In this world it's very hard to squeeze the neck of your love ... but the one who loves us ... it's a very big sin to break their heart

dialogue: Kisi aaise aadmi ke saath din guzaro ... joh raatein tumhari yaad mein guzarta ho
englishDialogue: Spend your days with a person ... who spends his nights in your memories

dialogue: Yeh aag hoti hi aaisi hai ... sab kuch jala deti hai ... fark bas itna hai ki kahin dikhai deti hai aur kahin nahi dikhai deti
englishDialogue: Fire has this characteristic ... it burns everything ... the only difference is that somewhere it can be seen and somewhere it can't be seen

dialogue: Ek tanhai doosre tanhai ka saath deti hai
englishDialogue: One loneliness always supports another loneliness

dialogue: Yudh ka ek hi niyam hota hai ... vijay!
englishDialogue: War has only one rule ... victory!

dialogue: Prem ek ghaav hai joh na jeene deta hai aur na marne deta hai
englishDialogue: Love is a wound that doesn't let you live and neither let's you die

dialogue: Main tumse prem karta hoon, kewal tumse ... tumhare sivah na kuch chahta hoon, na kuch sochta hoon ... jabse tumko dekha hai sab badal sa gaya hai, main badal sa gaya hoon ... kuch samajh nahi aata ... na kehta toh pagal ho jaata
englishDialogue: I love you and only you ... I don't want anything else other than you and neither do I think about anything else ... since I've seen you everything has changed, I've kind of changed ... I don't understand anything ... and I would have gone mad if I didn't tell you all this

dialogue: Ek vaishya kabhi kisi ka bhala nahi kar sakti ... woh sirf gharon ko todh sakti hai
englishDialogue: A prostitute can never do good for anyone ... she can only break homes

dialogue: Arre wah laddoo... tere pyar ki tarah meethe aur mere dil ki tarah naram
englishDialogue: Oh wow sweets ... sweet as your love and soft as my heart

dialogue: Dhuk toh muft mein milte hai ... lekin sukh ki keemat toh deni hi padti hai
englishDialogue: Sorrow comes free of cost ... but for happiness one has to pay the price

dialogue: Ghar waalon ke aasoon pochne ka ek hi tarika hai ... ki hamare aasoon nahi nikle
englishDialogue: There is only one way to wipe the tears of family members ... that our tears should not shed

dialogue: Maa chahe vaishya ho ya kisi ghar ki bahu ... maa sirf maa hoti hai
englishDialogue: Whether a mom is a daughter-in-law or a prostitute ... a mother is a mother

dialogue: Aurat ke ek nahi teen janam hote hai ... pehla jab woh kisi ki beti bankar is duniya mein aati hai ... doosra jab woh kisi ki patni banti hai ... aur teesra jab woh maa banti hai
englishDialogue: A woman is born not once but thrice ... first when she comes in this world as a daughter ... second when she becomes a wife to someone ... and third when she becomes a mother

dialogue: Pyar mein aur photograph mein koi farak nahi hai ... dono andhere mein develop hote hai
englishDialogue: There is no difference between love and photographs ... they both develop in darkness

dialogue: Zindagi mein kuch banana hai, kuch hasil karna hai toh sabse important cheez hai discipline ... discipline ke bina aadmi apne destination tak nahi pahunchta
englishDialogue: In life if you want to become something, achieve something then the most important thing is discipline ... without discipline a person cannot reach his destination

dialogue: Yeh duniya haarne waalon ka kabhi saath nahi deti
englishDialogue: This world never stands by the people who lose

dialogue: Mujhe yakeen hai ki main sirf is liye janma hoon ... ki tumse pyar kar sakun ... tum sirf is liye, ki ek din meri ban jao
englishDialogue: I am certain that I am only born so that ... I can love you ... and you so that, one day you can become mine

dialogue: Pyar sooch samajh kar nahin kiya jaata ... bas ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Love is not done with thought and understanding ... it just happens

dialogue: Ya toh dosti gehri hai ... ya yeh photo 3D hai
englishDialogue: Either this friendship is strong ... or this photo is 3D

dialogue: Perfection ko improve karna mushkil hota hai
englishDialogue: It is hard to improve on perfection

dialogue: Mujhe achchi filmein bilkul pasand nahin
englishDialogue: I don't like good films

dialogue: Hum cake khane ke liye kahin bhi jaa sakte hai
englishDialogue: To eat cake, we people can go anywhere

dialogue: Aaj Pooja, kal koi dooja
englishDialogue: Today Pooja, tomorrow someone else

dialogue: Jab maa baap pyar ke khilaaf hote hai toh pyar ke dushman nahi ... balki pyar ko aur mazboot karte hai
englishDialogue: When parents are against love then they are not the enemies of love ... instead they make the love more stronger

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi koi baat hum mein galat lagti hai ... aur kuch samay baad wohi hum mein sahi lagti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes what we feel is wrong ... after sometime it feels right to us

dialogue: Kabhi na kabhi, kahin na kahin yeh deewana maara jayega ... sheeshay mein dil ke utara jayega
englishDialogue: Someday, somewhere you'll fall in love ... and you'll be locked into the bottle of the heart

dialogue: Main zindagi mein sab kuch baant sakti hoon par tumhe nahi ... tum sirf mere ho, sirf mere
englishDialogue: I can share everything in life except you ... you are only mine, only mine

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi kismat maut se pehle pahunch jaati hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes luck comes before death comes

dialogue: Main sapne nahi dekhta ... khud ek bura sapna hoon
englishDialogue: I don't see dreams ... I am myself a bad dream

dialogue: Tere chehre pe mujhe maut dikhai de rahi hai
englishDialogue: I can see death on your face

dialogue: Shikaar ka mazaa tabhi aata hai ... jab woh jald se pakad mein na aaye
englishDialogue: The fun of hunting comes only when ... the prey does not get captured quickly

dialogue: Aap jaise log dua karte hai ... ki mujhse kabhi mulaqat na ho
englishDialogue: People like you pray that ... they never meet me

dialogue: Aatank ka woh bazaar lagaonga ki charo taraf hamare barood honge
englishDialogue: I will open the market of terror such that everywhere our gunpowder will be there

dialogue: Tune bahut badi bhool ki hai ... jiska afsoos karne ke liye tu zinda nahi rahega
englishDialogue: You've done a very big mistake ... for which you won't live to regret it

dialogue: Kisi bhi terrorist ko pakadne ke liye duty nahi ... junoon ki zaroorat hai ... junoon
englishDialogue: To catch any terrorist you don't need duty ... you need passion ... passion

dialogue: Kabhi akkha, kabhi adha, kabhi pauwa bhi peete hai ... agar phokat ki mil jaye, toh matka bhi peete hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes full, sometimes half, sometimes I also drink a quarter ... if it's free, then I can drink the whole pot also

dialogue: Yeh khilona nahi ... maut ka pehghaam hai
englishDialogue: This is not a toy ... it's a carrier of death

dialogue: Hamara Hindustan zindabad tha, zindabad hai, aur zindabad rahega!
englishDialogue: Our Hindustan has lived long, is living long, and will live long!

dialogue: Agar main apne biwi bachchon ke liye sar jhuka sakta hoon ... toh main sabke sar kaat bhi sakta hoon
englishDialogue: If I can bow down my head for my wife and son ... then I can also cut everyone's head

dialogue: Ek kagaz par mohor nahi lagegi ... toh kya Tara Pakistan nahi jayega?
englishDialogue: If one paper doesn't get stamped ... then Tara won't go to Pakistan?

dialogue: Barsaat se bachne ki haisiyat nahin ... aur goli baari ki baat kar rahe hai aap log
englishDialogue: You don't have the capacity to save yourself from the rain ... and you're talking about firing bullets

dialogue: Agar aaj ye jatt bighad gaya ... toh sehkadon ko le marega
englishDialogue: If this Sikh goes mad today ... then he will die taking several others

dialogue: Itne tukde karoonga ki pehchana nahi jayega
englishDialogue: I'll cut you into so many pieces that you won't be recognized

dialogue: Koi kahe jheel, koi kahe jharna, koi dilruba tujhko ... main bekhauf keh deta hoon, husn ka khuda tujhko
englishDialogue: Some call you a lake, some call you a waterfall, some call you sweetheart ... I say it fearlessly, you are the God of beauty

dialogue: Khudai bhi jhukti hai mere yaar ke samne ... koi tik nahi sakta mere pyar ke samne
englishDialogue: Even godliness can bend in front of my friend ... and no one can stand in front of my love

dialogue: Jab sooch mein ek peedhi ka antar aa jaye ... toh dono ko apne raaste alag  alag kar lene chahiye
englishDialogue: When there is a generation gap in thinking ... then both should separate their paths

dialogue: Is tarah pyar ka izhaar nahi hota ... joh do kadam saath chale woh yaar nahi hota ... pyar karne waale kaaton pe chalte hai ... joh aa jaye sholay toh sholon mein jalte hai ... kyun tujhe mere pyar par aitbaar nahi hota ... agar dilon mein sacha pyar nahi hota ... toh yeh duniya nahi hoti, yeh sansar nahi hota
englishDialogue: Love can't be expressed this way ... one who walks two steps together is not a friend ... people in love walk on thorns ... and if embers come along then they burn in embers ... why don't you trust my love ... and what if the hearts didn't have true love ... then this world and universe would have not been there

dialogue: Sukh baatne se badhta hai ... dukh apnane se, dukh kam hota hai
englishDialogue: Happiness spreads by sharing it ... and sadness reduces by accepting it

dialogue: Zindagi aur kuch nahi sirf ek rishtaa hai ... joh in rishton ko todh deta hai, woh apno tak ko kho deta hai ... aur joh in rishton ko nibha leta hai, insaan toh kya bhagwan ko bhi paa leta hai
englishDialogue: Life is nothing but a relationship ... those who break this relationship, they lose even their own people ... and those who fulfill this relationship, achieve not only humans but God also

dialogue: Hamare bandhan ke samne maine maatha teka hai ... ghutne nahi teke hai
englishDialogue: I have bowed my head in front of our bond ... not my knees

dialogue: Jab tum mere paas nahi hote toh mera dil nahi lagta ... aur jab pass hote ho toh mera jee nahi bharta
englishDialogue: When you aren't near me then I feel lonely ... and when you are near me then I don't get satisfied

dialogue: Teri aankhen hai jheel, jharno ka hai tujh mein jadoo ... bas ek nazar dekhkar tujhko, mera dil hota hai bekabu
englishDialogue: Your eyes are a lake, you have the magic of waterfalls ... once I see you, my heart becomes uncontrollable

dialogue: Aaj rishto ne mere haath baand diye ... varna kasam se tujhe khoon ke aasoon rulata
englishDialogue: Today relations have tied my hands ... otherwise I swear I would have made you cry tears of blood

dialogue: Businessman woh hota hai joh poori imaandari ke saath ... apne waqt, apne hunar, apni kaabiliyat ka sauda karne ke baad muhafza kamata hai
englishDialogue: A businessman is one who with all his honesty ... uses his time, his talent, his potential on a trade and then earns money

dialogue: Maalik ke ghar pe andhera karke ... kabhi kisi mazdoor ke ghar mein roshni nahi aa sakti
englishDialogue: By darkening the employers house ... no laborer can ever get light in his house

dialogue: Suna tha rishtey insaano ko ek doosre se jodhte hai ... lekin mere rishton ne toh mujhe bilkul hi todh kar rakh diya
englishDialogue: I had heard that relations connect each other together ... but my relations have broken me altogether

dialogue: Oh meri jumma kitna tarsayegi de de chumma
englishDialogue: Oh my sweetheart how much will you trouble me for a kiss

dialogue: Maine tum par vishvas kiya ... aur tumne ussi vishvas ki neev mein zehar dal diya
englishDialogue: I trusted you ... and you added poison in the foundation of that trust

dialogue: Zindagi mein kuch rishtey aaise hote hai ... jahan insaan ko maaf karna padta hai

dialogue: Yeh ghar mera hai ... is ghar mein bole hue mere har alfaaz kanoon ke barabar hai

dialogue: Ek kamyab businessman wahi hota hai ... jis mein faisla lene ki ek shamta ho
englishDialogue: A successful businessman is one ... who has the capability to take decisions

dialogue: Aye sangdil sanam, sahenge hum tera har sitam ... sanam teri kasam, hum dil de chuke sanam

dialogue: Yeh baazi hum haar chuke hai ... lekin is jung mein jeet hamari hogi

dialogue: Tere haathon ke kangan mein dil mera atka ... toot jayega zaalim agar degi isse jhatka
englishDialogue: My heart is stuck in the bangles on your hand ... if you shake them then it will break

dialogue: Beta jab jawan ho jaata hai toh woh apne baap ke swabhiman ko ... abhiman samajhne lagta hai
englishDialogue: When a son becomes a young man he thinks his fathers self respect ... is his pride

dialogue: Zameen par rhengne waala saanp toh insaano ko kabhi kabhi chhod deta hai ... lekin tum aasteen mein palne waale woh saanp ho ... jisne kisiko nahi bhaksha
englishDialogue: A snake that crawls on the ground also leaves a person sometimes ... but you are a snake that fosters in the arm ... and who has never forgiven anyone

dialogue: Rishta todne waale sab kuch kho dete hai ... jodne waale hamesha aabad rehte hai
englishDialogue: Those who break relationships lose everything ... and those make relationships are always happy

dialogue: Tu meri Bobby hai, tu meri Noorie hai, tu meri Julie hai ... oh meri jaan tujh pe yeh dil kurbaan
englishDialogue: You are my Bobby, you are my Noorie, you are my Julie ... oh my sweetheart I will sacrifice my heart for you

dialogue: Tum bhool gaye ki ninyaanve ki sankhya par ek aaisa saanp behta hai ... jiske kaatne se khiladi itne neeche gir jaata hai ... ke phir uske pass wapas upar uthne ki koi gunjaish nahi rehti
englishDialogue: You've forgotten that on the number 99 there is such a snake sitting ... which when bites, the player falls all the way down ... that then he does not have any scope to rise again

englishDialogue: I'll strip him like a pencil ... I'll cut him into pieces ... I'll feed his pieces to the dogs and I'll feed the dogs to the cats

dialogue: Abhe Chambal ghaati se bagaye hue C-grade ke daku!
englishDialogue: Hey you C-grade dacoit on the run from the mountains of Chambal!

englishDialogue: Even if we don't get a one time meal, even if we don't have clothes on our body, even if we don't have a roof on our head ... but when it comes to the pride of our country ... then we put our lives forward for it

dialogue: Hum haath milana bhi jaante hai, haath ukhaadna bhi ... hum Gandhiji ko bhi poojte hai, Chandra Shekar Azad ko bhi ... main bhi pehle pyar se samjhata hoon, phir hathyar se
englishDialogue: We know how to shake hands and also to break them ... we worship Gandhi and also Chandra Shekar Azad ... and I also try to explain with peace first and then with a weapon

dialogue: Shikaari apne shikaar ke saath dosti nahi karta
englishDialogue: A hunter doesn't befriend his prey

dialogue: Saanp ke bil mein haath wohi daalta hai ... joh uske zehar ka todh jaanta ho

dialogue: Mere liye maa aur mulk ek hai
englishDialogue: Mother and country are the same for me

dialogue: Tere shareer ke haddiyo ke itne tukde karoonga ... ki teri aane waali nasal tak is dard ko mehsoos karegi
englishDialogue: I will break the bones of your body into so many pieces ... that even your coming generations will feel the pain

dialogue: Maut apna raasta nahi badalti ... joh bhi uske raaste mein aata hai, chala jaata hai
englishDialogue: Death does not change its path ... whoever comes in its way, goes away

dialogue: Jiski nasson mein imaandari ka khoon daud raha ho ... jiska dil desh ke liye dhadakta ho ... uska josh kabhi thanda nahi padh sakta
englishDialogue: People who have honesty running in their blood ... people whose heart beats for their country ... their passion can never become cold

dialogue: Mujhse dosti karoge toh uski poori keemat milegi tumhe ... aur agar dushmani karoge toh uski keemat chukani padegi
englishDialogue: If you make me your friend then you will get the full value for it ... and if you make me your enemy then you will have to pay the price for it

dialogue: Jab tak kamyabi ki khushi baantne waala koi apna na ho ... toh us kamyabi ki khushi ka maqsad hi kya hai
englishDialogue: Until you have someone of your own to share the happiness of your success ... the happiness from that success has no motive

dialogue: Upar se hum hain saath saath ... aur andhar se hum aapke hai kaun

dialogue: Oh paaji tussi kamaal ho, tussi great ho ... oh tussi toop ho toop, tussi zindagi di hope ho hope
englishDialogue: Oh brother you are wonderful, you are great ... you are a tank, you are the hope of life

dialogue: Bypass mein kabhi kabhi aadmi pass bhi ho jata hai
englishDialogue: In a bypass (operation) sometimes a person passes away

dialogue: Jua mein hamesha jeetkar hi nahi ... kabhi kabhi haarkar bhi zyada paisa kamaya ja sakta hai
englishDialogue: In gambling you not only make money by winning ... sometimes you can make more money by losing

dialogue: Kisi aur ko badalne ke liye ... khud ko badalna zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: To change someone ... it's important that we ourselves change

dialogue: Pyar karne waale kabhi naraz nahi hote ... sirf rooth jaate hai aur roothon ko manana padta hai

dialogue: Keh diya na ... bas keh diya!
englishDialogue: I said it ... means I said it!

dialogue: Oh ji jhappiyan tak te theek hai ... par pappiyan bhi marte rhende hai mainu
englishDialogue: It was ok till hugging ... but he keeps kissing me as well

dialogue: Paisa toh har koi kama leta hai ... lekin izzat kamana sabke bas ki baat nahi

dialogue: Zindagi mein agar kuch banna ho, kuch haasil karna ho, kuch jeetna ho ... toh hamesha dil ki suno ... aur agar dil bhi koi jawab na de toh aankhen band karke apni maa aur papa ka naam lo ... phir dekhna har manzil paar kar jaoge, har mushkil aasaan ho jayegi ... jeet tumhari hogi, sirf tumhari
englishDialogue: In life if you want to become something, achieve something, win something ... then always listen to your heart ... and if your heart doesn't reply to you then close your eyes and take the name of your mom and dad ... then see you will achieve everything, everything that is hard will become easy ... victory will be yours, just yours

dialogue: Dosti ke alava bhi kuch rishtey hote hai ... kuch rishtey joh hum samajhte nahi ... kuch rishtey joh hum samajhna nahi chahte ... kuch rishtey jinka koi naam nahi hota, sirf ehsaas hota hai ... kuch rishtey jinki koi deewar nahi hoti, sarhad nahi hoti ... aaise rishtey joh dil ke rishtey hote hai, pyar ke rishtey hote hai, mohabbat ke rishtey hote hai
englishDialogue: There are some relations other than friendship ... some relations that we understand ... some relations that we don't want to understand ... some relations that don't have a name, they just have a feeling ... some relations that don't have a wall, don't have a boundary ... the relations that are of the heart, the relations that are of love, the relations that are of the romance

dialogue: Lucknow da kurta, Pathani salwar ... tab lage mard, varna lage bekaar
englishDialogue: The shirt should be from Lucknow, the pant should be Pathani ... only then a man looks a man, or else he looks useless

englishDialogue: To go to the prom with me you all have to be brilliant in three departments ... and that is good looks, good looks and good looks

englishDialogue: Why is it that sometimes ... family members become strangers

englishDialogue: Why is it that sometimes ... even strangers feel like family

dialogue: Arre return shiturn karne hai toh khareedte vareedte kyun ho?
englishDialogue: If you have to return then why do you buy?

dialogue: No drinking, no smoking ... no der se aana aur yahan se jitna jaldi ho chale jaana
englishDialogue: No drinking, no smoking ... no coming late and leave from here as soon as possible

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi ghar ke bachche ... ghar ke badhon ko sahi raaste dekha dete hain
englishDialogue: Sometimes the children of the house ... show the right path to the elders of the house

dialogue: Ek da vada dil aur duje de vade vade bill
englishDialogue: One has a big heart and other has big big bills

englishDialogue: By apologizing no one becomes small or big ... but the one who forgives has a big heart

dialogue: Bade mazaaki ho ... bade mazaaki ho
englishDialogue: You are very jovial ... you are very jovial

englishDialogue: Early morning this Madonna has started

dialogue: Vade log vadi vadi baatein
englishDialogue: Big people big big talks

dialogue: Badhon ka gussa badhon ka pyar hota hai
englishDialogue: The anger of elders is their love

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Bahut hi jald is sadak par joh sabse bada bangla hoga woh Raj Malhotra ka hoga ... jis building mein tumhara office hai, uske top floor ke upar joh sabsa bada office hoga woh Raj Malhotra ka hoga ... aur joh signal par sabse badi gaadi rukegi woh Raj Malhotra ki hogi ... aur tum toh achchi tarah se jaante ho ki Raj Malhotra main hoon
englishDialogue: Very soon the biggest bungalow on this street will be Raj Malhotra's ... the building in which your office is there, the biggest office that will be there on its top floor will be Raj Malhotra's ... the biggest car that will stop on the signal will be Raj Malhotra's ... and you know it very well that I'm Raj Malhotra

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Zindagi mein bada aadmi banne ka sapna maine dekha hai ... usse saakar karne ke liye joh keemat chukani padegi woh bhi main hi chukaonga
englishDialogue: I'm the one who has dreamt about becoming a big person in life ... and hence I'll be the one who pays the price that is needed to fulfill that dream

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Main zindagi hoon toh Sona saansein ... main agar dil hoon toh Sona dhadkan ... main agar pyaas hoon toh Sona pani ... main agar phool hoon toh Sona khushboo ... main agar dard hoon toh Sona aaahhh
englishDialogue: If I'm life then Sona is breaths ... if I'm the heart then Sona is heartbeat ... if I'm thirst then Sona is water ... if I'm a flower then Sona is fragrance ... if I'm the pain then Sona is the cry

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Chand biwiyan drawing room mein pade hue us TV ki tarah hoti hai ... unko jab on karo purana program chal raha hota hai ... tum toh internet ho ... jab on karta hoon, ek nayi site dikhai deti hai
englishDialogue: Few wives are like the TV sitting in the drawing room ... whenever you turn them on they are playing some old program ... but you're the internet ... whenever I turn you on, I see a new site

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Sachchai ke liye koi bhi cheez chhodi ja sakti hai ... magar kisi bhi cheez ke liye sachchai ko chhoda nahi ja sakta
englishDialogue: You can give up anything for the truth ... but you can't give up the truth for anything

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Bhagwan na swarg se jode banakar dharti pe bhejta hai ... aur insaan usse todhkar joh paap karta hai na ... usse talaq kehte hai
englishDialogue: God makes couples in heaven and sends them to earth ... and the sin that humans commit by breaking them ... is called as divorce

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Abhe oye cold drink ke khali botal ke mudhe hue straw ... gissi hui Kolhapuri chappal!
englishDialogue: Hey you twisted straw of an empty cold drink bottle ... worn out Kolhapuri sandal!

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Aap toh ja rahi hai magar main aapki zindagi mein bhudape ki tarah aaonga ... joh ek baar aata hai aur uske baad aata hi jaata hai
englishDialogue: You are going but I'll come in your life like old age ... which once it comes then after that it keeps on coming

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Haath unhi ke jalte hai joh aag bhujane ki koshish karte hai ... aag jalane waalon ke haath kabhi nahi jalte
englishDialogue: Only the people who try to eliminate the fire burn their hands ... the people who start the fire never burn their hands

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Kyun be sukhe hue chuare ... baasi udad ke papad!
englishDialogue: Hey you dry dates ... papadum made from stinking lentil!

movie: Kyo Kii Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
dialogue: Hospital mein chloroform ki jagah agar tere kapde soongah diye ja na ... toh patient coma mein chala jayega
englishDialogue: In the hospital instead of chloroform if we use your clothes to smell ... then the patient will go in coma

dialogue: Khichdi ke hai dost char ... dahi, papad, mirchi, aachar
englishDialogue: Porridge has four friends ... curd, papadum, pepper, pickle

dialogue: Jahan chanda hoga wahan chakori hogi ... jahan thali hogi wahan katori hogi ... aur jahan tu hoga wahan main hongi
englishDialogue: Where there is moon there will be a bird ... where there is a plate there will be a bowl ... and where you're there, I'll be there

dialogue: Har aurat hamaar maiyya hai aur hum maiyya ka sauda nahi karat
englishDialogue: Every women is my mother and I don't trade my mother

dialogue: Roti kamane ke liye aurat ghar se nikli nahi ... ki tankha dene waala har aadmi usse apne baap ka maal samajhta hai
englishDialogue: A woman barely steps out from her house to earn a living ... and every man who pays her the salary considers her to be his father's property

dialogue: Joh koi zulm ke khilaaf awaaz uthawat hai ... wohi insaan hai, wohi zinda hai
englishDialogue: The one who raises their voice against injustice ... is a human, and is alive

dialogue: Jab chahe chuna lagaye ragad ke khaye ... ab khud pe baat aayi toh kare hai hai ... arre bhoya pedh babool ka toh aam kahan se khaye
englishDialogue: Whenever you wanted you duped and ate ... and you are crying now that it has come on you ... if you have sowed the seeds of an acacia tree then how can you get mangoes

dialogue: Mere vichaar purane zaroor hai lekin ... aapke vichaar gande aur giraune hai
englishDialogue: My thoughts are definitely old ... but your thoughts are dirty and nasty

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Kutta chahe bunglay mein rahe yah gali mein, doodh piye ya naale ka pani ... uski dum seedhi nahi hoti ... kyun ki basically woh kutta hai
englishDialogue: Whether a dog lives in a bungalow or in the streets, whether he drinks milk or the gutter water ... his tail doesn't become straight ... because basically he is a dog

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Aslam bhai ko joh raag patti deta hai na ... usko Aslam bhai malam patti deta hai
englishDialogue: The one who acts smart with rowdy Aslam ... rowdy Aslam smashes him up

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Chande mein aur dhande mein Aslam bhai ke liye sab dharam samaan hai
englishDialogue: For rowdy Aslam, donation and business are both like his religion

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Aadmi purani cheezon se ughta jaata hai ... aur nayi cheezon se uthta jaata hai
englishDialogue: People get bored of old things ... and they get excited with new things

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Public ne hero ko bhai bante bahut dekha ... ab public bhai ko hero bante dekhegi
englishDialogue: The public has seen a hero becoming a rowdy person a lot ... now the public will see a rowdy person becoming a hero

movie: Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
dialogue: Joh alag dikhta hai ... wahi aaj kal bikta hai
englishDialogue: The one who looks different ... nowadays only he sells

dialogue: Aadmi agar achche mann aur lagan se kaam kare ... toh nothing is impossible
englishDialogue: If a man works with a clean heart and devotion ... then nothing is impossible

dialogue: Bhook lagegi toh aam ke pedh ke upar chadkar aamiya kha lenge ... pyaas lagi toh kuaan se pani pee lenge ... neend lagi toh peepal ke pedh ke neeche soo lenge ... aur aapka yaad aaya toh chup-chap akele mein ro lenge
englishDialogue: If I feel hungry then I'll climb on a mango tree and eat mangoes ... if I feel thirsty then I'll drink water from the well ... if I feel sleepy then I'll sleep under the fig tree ... and if I miss you then I'll cry when I'm alone

dialogue: Budhapa bahut buri cheez hoti hai ... aur usse bhi bura hota hai budhape mein akelapan
englishDialogue: Old age is a very bad thing ... and even worse than that is loneliness in the old age

dialogue: Ajeeb hai na yeh insaani rishtey ... jitna suljhane ki koshish karo utne hi ulajhte jaate hai
englishDialogue: Human relationships are so strange ... the more you try to solve them the more they get complicated

dialogue: Pehle din inkaar kiya ... duje din iqraar ki ... teeje din pyar kiya
englishDialogue: First day she denied ... second day she agreed ... third day she fell in love

dialogue: Jab pyar karne waale apne jazbaato ko dabakar ... rishto ko koi doosra naam dete hai ... toh kabhi na kabhi, kahin na kahin jazbaat phoot phootke rone lagte hai
englishDialogue: When people in love suppress their emotions ... and give an alternate name to their relations ... then at some point and at some place those emotions cry a lot

dialogue: Is duniya mein aaisa koi nahi bacha jisse kabhi na kabhi, kahin na kahin, kisi na kisi se mohabbat na hui ho ... aur us mohabbat mein kuch mile toh kuch bhichad gaye ... par unki mohabbat hamesha zinda rahi hai
englishDialogue: In this world there is no one person left who has never been in love sometime, somewhere and with someone ... and in that love sometimes they meet and sometimes they separate ... but their love always remains alive

dialogue: Tum jaisi ladkiyan jab pyar mein padti hai na ... toh great love stories banti hai
englishDialogue: When girls like you fall in love ... then great love stories are made

dialogue: Duniya mein yun aana, duniya se yun jaana ... aao toh le aana, jao toh de jaana ... yaadein, yaadein, yaadein
englishDialogue: Come in this world, go from this world ... get when you come, leave behind when you go ... memories, memories, memories

dialogue: Ghar ki izzat sanskaro par khadi hoti hai ... daulat ke dherro par nahi
englishDialogue: The respect of the house stands on culture ... not on stacks of money

dialogue: Public stage par aate hi shaitan bhi devtaon ki tarah bolne lagta hai
englishDialogue: On a public stage even a devil speaks like the God
