dialogue: Ishwar ko matlab se nahi ... dil se puja jaata hai
englishDialogue: You don't pray to God for a reason ... you pray by the heart

dialogue: Badhon se baat badhe hi kiya karte hai
englishDialogue: Only elders talk to the elders

dialogue: Joh maa baap apne bachchon ke kyun aur kab ka jawab nahi de sakte ... woh kabhi unke dost bhi nahi ban sakte
englishDialogue: Parents who cannot answer the whys and the whens of their children ... they can never become their friends

dialogue: Jiska dil gham ki tanhaiyon mein ujadh gaya ho ... woh bahar se kitna hi sehatmand lagta ho, lekin andar se toh bimaar hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: The one whose heart is destroyed in the loneliness of sorrow ... no matter how healthy he looks from the outside, but from inside he is sick

dialogue: Joh sacha pyar karte hai woh zindagi bhar ke liye naraaz nahi hote ... kuch derr ke liye rooth jaate hai
englishDialogue: Those who are truly in love they are not angry for the entire life ... they just get upset for some time

dialogue: Aao ab hum laut chale apne logon mein, apni basti mein ... jahan pyar hai, apnapan hai, sukoon hai
englishDialogue: Come let's go back to our own people, in our own colony ... where there is love, there is oneness, there is peace

dialogue: Bhagwan chadawe se nahi ... chadane waale ki neeyat se khush hota hai
englishDialogue: God doesn't get pleased by the offerings ... he gets pleased by the intentions of the person who is offering

dialogue: Ek bachcha anath ashram mein palkar bada ho sakta hai ... baap mar jaye toh maa ke sahare jee sakta hai ... lekin ek aurat ka pati chala jaye toh woh kiske sahare aur kaise jeeti hai ... woh takleef main samajhta hoon
englishDialogue: A child can grow living in an orphanage ... he can live with the support of his mother if his father dies ... but if the husband of a woman goes away then the support on which she lives and how she lives ... I understand that pain

dialogue: Prem ki aag dono taraf lagi ho toh jalti rehti hai ... varna bhuj jaati hai
englishDialogue: The fire of love burns only if it's on both sides ... or else it extinguishes

dialogue: Sau chaand bhi chamkenge toh kya baat banegi ... tum aaye ho toh is raat ki aukaad banegi
englishDialogue: When 100 moons will shine then it'll be a great thing ... since you've come this night will have some value

dialogue: Chehra mera tha, nigaahein uski ... khamoshi mein bhi woh baatein uski ... mere chehre pe ghazal likhti gayi ... sher kehti hui aankhen uski
englishDialogue: It was my face and his eyes ... his conversations even in the silence ... writing a poem on my face ... were his eyes reciting a verse

dialogue: Ab ke hum bichre toh shayad kabhi khwabon mein mile ... jis tarah sookhe hue phool kitaabon mein mile
englishDialogue: If we separate now then may be we'll meet in the dreams ... just like dry flowers are found in a book

dialogue: Prem ke do hi roop hote hai ... kisi ko apna kar lena ya kisi ka ho jaana
englishDialogue: Love has only two forms ... you either make someone yours or you become theirs

dialogue: Hamari zindagi ke do pehlu hai ... ek adhikar ka doosra kartavya ka ... ek ke bina doosra mumkin nahi
englishDialogue: Our life has two sides ... one of right and other of duty ... any one of them is not possible without the other

dialogue: Dard agar insaan ke apne daire mein rahe toh saha ja sakta hai ... magar joh dard doosron ka dard ban jaye ... usse apno mein baant lena hi behtar hota hai
englishDialogue: If the pain stays within the limits of a person then it can be beared ... but the pain that becomes pain for others ... it's better to share that with your dear ones

dialogue: Apna toh sidhaant hai shaan se jeeyo aur shanti se ludhak jao
englishDialogue: It's my principle to live with pride and to die quietly

dialogue: Zindagi ki raftar jitni tezz hai ... traffic utni hi rukavatein daal deta hai ... kai baar raaste badalne padte hai ghar pahunchne ke liye
englishDialogue: The faster the speed of life is ... the traffic puts that many blocks ... many a times you have to change my path to reach home

dialogue: Tumhara nishana toh chook gaya aur ab humne is goli par tumhara naam likh diya hai ... aur jis din yeh goli hamari bandook se chalegi ... hamara nishana nahi chookega
englishDialogue: You missed the target and now I've written your name on this bullet ... and the day this bullet fires from my gun ... I won't miss the target

dialogue: Yeh chehre ki rangat gulabi gulabi ... yeh mausam ki halat sharabi sharabi ... mera dil machalke keh raha hai ... something, something, something, something
englishDialogue: Your pink coloured face ... this alcoholic condition of the weather ... my heart is jumping around and saying ... something, something, something, something

dialogue: Nadaani mein tumne joh kadam uthaya hai ... woh sirf tumhe hi nahi, poore khandan ko ek aaise modh par le aaya hai ... jahan se har raasta barbadi aur zillat ki taraf jaata hai
englishDialogue: The step that you have taken in ignorance ... that has brought not just you, but the whole family to such a turn ... from where every road goes towards destruction and humiliation

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi dil jodne ke liye dil todna padta hai ... aur dil todkar jodne waale ko ... pata nahi kya kehte hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes to join hearts one has to break a heart ... and one who joins hearts after breaking it ... is called, I don't know what

dialogue: Jinki zindagi choti hoti hai ... unhe bade bade vaade nahi karne chahiye
englishDialogue: Those who have a short life ... should not make big big promises

dialogue: Badshah ke paas badshah nahi aayega toh kya ghulam aayega
englishDialogue: If a king won't get a king then, will he get a jack or what

dialogue: Shandaar jagahon par jaana aur jaandaar logon se dosti karna ... mera shaunk hai
englishDialogue: To go to fabulous places and to make friends with high hearted people ... is my hobby

dialogue: Yeh aadmi hai ki mutton ki dukaan
englishDialogue: Is he is person or a mutton shop

dialogue: Premika banna bahut aasan hai ... biwi banna utna hi mushkil hai
englishDialogue: The become a lover is very easy ... but to become a wife is very hard

dialogue: Nasha chahe kitna hi zyada kyun na ho ... ek din utarta zaroor hai
englishDialogue: No matter how intoxicated one is ... one day they do become sober

dialogue: Patni har cheez ka batwara bardaash kar sakti hai ... lekin apne pati ka nahi
englishDialogue: A wife can tolerate sharing everything ... but not her husband

dialogue: India mein woh bahut kuch hai joh America mein nahi ... sirf hum jaison ko dikhta nahi hai
englishDialogue: There is a lot in India that you don't have in America ... it's just that people like us aren't able to see it

dialogue: Har nakamyab aadmi ke andar ek kavi chupa hi hota hai ... aur har kamyab kavi doosri sab cheezon mein nakamyab rehta hai
englishDialogue: Inside every unsuccessful man there is a hidden poet ... and every successful poet is unsuccessful in everything else

dialogue: Jis din tu isse zindagi dega ... main isse maut doonga, maut, sirf maut!
englishDialogue: The day you give him life ... I will give him death, death, only death!

dialogue: Tum saans leti ho, toh mera dil dhadakta hai
englishDialogue: When you breath, then my heart beats

dialogue: Agar main marr gaya toh tu jee gaya ... agar main jee gaya toh tu marr gaya
englishDialogue: If I die then you'll live ... if I live then you'll die

dialogue: Bahadur toh sab hote hai ... main zara sa lucky hoon
englishDialogue: Everyone is courageous ... I am a little lucky

dialogue: Har baimaan aur bure aadmi ke seene mein khauff bhar dena chahta hoon main
englishDialogue: I want to fill fear in the chest of every cheater and bad person

dialogue: Agar ye sach hai ... toh main isse jhoot sabit kar doonga
englishDialogue: If this is the truth ... then I will prove this to be a lie

dialogue: Hum amir is liye hain ki kyun ki ... hum mein gareebon ko gareeb banaye rakhne ki technique aati hai
englishDialogue: We are rich because ... we know the technique of keeping the poor, poor

dialogue: Humne chidiya ka naksha manga tha, chidiye ke ghosle ka nahi
englishDialogue: I had asked for the map of the bird, not of the birds nest

dialogue: Prayashchit insaan ke paapo ko mitta deta hai ... woh buzdil hote hai joh apne paapo ko mittane ke bajaye khud ko mitta dete hai
englishDialogue: Remorse erases the sins of a person ... but those who erase themselves instead of their sins are cowards

dialogue: Jeet ki khushi zahir karna achi baat hai ... lekin maghroor hona munasib nahi
englishDialogue: It's good to show happiness when you win ... but it's not right to be arrogant

dialogue: Dobara agar isne mere beete hue kal mein jhaankne ki koshish ki ... toh isse aane waala kal dekhna naseeb nahi hoga
englishDialogue: If he tries to peek into my past once again ... then he won't be lucky enough to see his future

dialogue: Main "gaa" bajhata hoon toh "saa" bajhta hai, main "paa" bajhata hoon toh "maa" bajhta hai ... yane ki main kuch bhi bajha saku, usse pehle meri bajh jaati hai
englishDialogue: When I play "gaa" then it sounds like "saa", when I play "paa" then it sounds like "maa" ... basically I get screwed even before I play anything

dialogue: Teri zulfon ke pech-o-kham teri zindagi se kam nahi ... jitni sawariye utni ulajhti chali jaati hai
englishDialogue: The tresses in your hair is nothing less than your life ... the more you untangle it the more it gets complicated

dialogue: Jab tak tum jaisi auraten is dharti par zinda hai ... kalyug mein bhi satyug zinda rahega
englishDialogue: Until women like you are alive on this earth ... even the golden age will be alive in the iron age

dialogue: Koi rishta pakka nahi hota ... maut aati hai toh pakke se pakka rishta bhi kachi maati ki tarah toot jaata hai
englishDialogue: No relationship is firm ... when death comes then even the firmest relationship breaks like a fragile pot

dialogue: Kom toh bas ek hai ... insaan ki
englishDialogue: There is only one caste ... which is humanity

dialogue: Tum logon ne mere pe vishvas kiya aur maine tumhare saath vishvasghat kiya ... tum logon ne meri jai-jai-kaar ki aur maine tumhari peeth mein chura bhaunka
englishDialogue: You people trusted me and I betrayed you ... you people hailed me and I stuck a knife on your backs

dialogue: Thoda roothegi, thoda cheekhegi, thoda chilayegi ... dil kehta hai ek din haseena maan jayegi
englishDialogue: She will sulk a little, scream a little, shout a little ... but the heart says that one day she will agree

dialogue: Tareef toh us khuda ki hai jisne yeh jahan banaya ... jisne aapko ladki waala aur hum mein ladke waala banaya
englishDialogue: Let's praise the lord who has created this world ... and who has made you on the brides side and us on the grooms side

dialogue: Yeh duniya gham toh deti hai, lekin sharikh-e-gham nahi hoti ... aur is duniya mein kisi ke door jaane se na, mohabbat kam nahi hoti
englishDialogue: This world gives you sorrow, but it doesn't participate in that sorrow ... and in this world just by someone going far away, the love doesn't decrease

dialogue: Joh kaam maine itni umar mein nahi kiya ... tune itni si umar mein kar liya?
englishDialogue: The work that I haven't done in so many years ... you have done that in such a small age?

dialogue: Maine tumhe samjha tha badam, nikle moongphali ... ab bol Jai Bajrang Bali aur todh us tapori ki nali
englishDialogue: I thought you were an almond, but you turned out to be peanut ... now say Jai Bajrang Bali (pray to god) and break that rowdy persons head

dialogue: Aap achche achchon ko hila daalte hai ... naak ke baal jala daalte hai
englishDialogue: You shake even the best of the people ... and burn the hair in their nose

dialogue: Main tumhari pungi bajaonga!
englishDialogue: I will destroy you!

dialogue: Roshanara beti hai ek Musalman ki ... jisse pehchaan hai apne imaan ki ... pyar toh kya jaan tak loota doongi ... mujhe kasam hai apne Hindustan ki
englishDialogue: Roshanara is a daughter of a Muslim ... who knows her faith ... forget love, I'll even give my life ... I swear on my India

dialogue: Woh toh meri saanson mein hai, meri dhadkanon mein hai, meri aankhon mein hai, mere khwabon mein hai ... sach toh yeh hai ke mera dil unke paas hai aur unka dil mere paas
englishDialogue: He is in my breathe, in my hearbeats, in my eyes, in my dreams ... the truth is that he has my heart and I have his heart

dialogue: Woh khudgarz joh jung chahte hai unka kuch nahi jaata ... tabah toh woh log hote hai ... jinki subah roti ki talash mein shuru hoti hai aur raat thakaan ke bistar par
englishDialogue: The selfish people who want a war don't lose anything ... but the people who start their day in search of food and their night on the bed of tiredness ... are the ones who get destroyed

dialogue: Hamare liye sona hai hamare kheton mein leharti faslein ... apne bachche ke liye ek maa ki chaati mein umarti hui mamta ... bhai ke kalai ke liye ek behen ke rakhi ka pyar ... ek patni ke liye uski maang mein damakta sindoor ... pyar, mohabbat aur rishton ka yeh sona kabhi dokha nahi de sakta ... is liye Bharat sone ki chidiya tha, hai aur hamesha rahega
englishDialogue: Gold for us is the growing crops in our fields ... the motherly love within a mother for her child ... the thread of sisterly love for her brother wrists ... the vermilion that is shining on a wife's forehead ... this gold of affection, love and relations will never betray us ... that's why India was, is and will always remain a golden bird

dialogue: Maut ka sadma toh insaan bardasht kar leta hai ... lekin jab koi apna kho jaata hai toh usse paane ki tadap ko bardasht nahi kar paata
englishDialogue: A person can bear the trauma of death ... but he cannot bear the tormenting that he goes through in finding a loved one who is lost

dialogue: Politics naukri nahi hai ... business hai, bahut bada business
englishDialogue: Politics is not a job ... it's a business, a very big business

dialogue: Pichle pachaas saalo mein hamare desh ne sirf mantri aur minister paida kiye hai ... ek neta paida nahi kiya
englishDialogue: For the last 50 years our nation has only produced politicians and ministers ... it has not even produced a single leader

dialogue: Is generation ke paas sawal bahut hai ... jawab koi nahi
englishDialogue: This generation has a lot of questions ... but no answers

dialogue: Har koi yahi toh chahta hai meri tarah ... ki uski zindagi mein koi ek aaisa aaye joh ussi ke liye soche, ussi ke sapne dekhe, ussi ke liye jeeye aur dua kare
englishDialogue: Everyone wants this just like me ... that someone should come in their life who thinks for them, dreams about them, lives for them and prays for them

dialogue: Agar marne ke baad bhi zinda rehna hai ... toh doosron ko zindagi dena seekho
englishDialogue: If you want to stay alive after dying ... then learn to give life to others

dialogue: Ho jaoge majboor tum bhi kuch is tarah ... Ranjhe ki mohabbat mein Laila thi jis tarah
englishDialogue: You'll get compelled in such a way ... just like how Laila was in the love of Ranjha

dialogue: Kya sher farmaya hai aapne ... Majnu ki jagah Ranjhe ko chipkaya hai aapne
englishDialogue: What a great verse you said ... but you mentioned Ranjha instead of Majnu

dialogue: Yeh ladkiyan bhi na yaar sab samajhti hai ... par pata nahi hum ladkon ko kya samajhti hai
englishDialogue: These girls understand everything ... but I don't know what do they think, what we boys are

dialogue: Is desh mein ussi ki jeet hoti hai ... jisse is desh ki mitti ki sugandh ka pata ho
englishDialogue: Only that person wins in this country ... who knows the smell of the soil of this country

dialogue: Bechain ho rahe hai woh sheron ke dhahadon se ... gira diye jaoge tum in pahadon se
englishDialogue: She is getting restless by the roars of the tiger ... and you will be pushed down from the mountains

dialogue: Aapka haath hai ya hathoda ... aapke hisse ko kis hadse ne toda
englishDialogue: Is it your hand or a hammer ... but which incident broke your part

dialogue: Logon ne rab ko rab kaha hai ... lekin maine apne yaar ko rab kaha hai
englishDialogue: People have called god as god ... but I have called my friend as my god

dialogue: Yahan main hi vaakil hoon, main hi judge hoon aur main hi jallad
englishDialogue: Here I am the lawyer, I am the judge and I am the executioner

dialogue: Joh aadmi hamara kaam nahi kar sakta ... us aadmi ko hum kisi kaam ke layak nahi chhodte
englishDialogue: A person who can't do my work ... I leave that person incapable of doing any other work

dialogue: Hum chahe bandhan mein bandhe na bandhe ... jazbaat ka rishta toh dil se hai
englishDialogue: Whether we're tied in a bond or not ... the relationship of emotions is with the heart

dialogue: Bachpan ki mohabbat ko dil se na juda karna ... jab yaad meri aaye milne ki dua karna
englishDialogue: Don't separate the love of childhood from your heart ... whenever you remember me, pray that we meet soon

dialogue: Ladki apne dil ki baat aankhon se keh deti hai
englishDialogue: A girl says whatever is in heart through her eyes

dialogue: Jisse hum jhagadte hai ... pyar bhi toh sabse zyada ussi ko karte hai
englishDialogue: The one with whom we fight ... we love them the most

dialogue: Agar kisika dukh baatna hi chahte ho ... toh kaam kuch aisa karo ... ke doosro ki zindagi mein khushi aaye
englishDialogue: If you want to share someones sorrow ... then do such a work ... which brings happiness in others life

dialogue: Tumne aurat ko samjha nahi bhaiya ... woh andhero se nahi darti ... jab woh faisla kar leti hai toh mann mein vishvas ka diya jalakar ... usse apni maang ka sindoor bana leti hai
englishDialogue: Brother you have not understood a woman ... she is not scared of darkness ... when she makes a decision then she ignites the lamp of faith in her heart ... and turns it into vermilion of her hair parting

dialogue: Aadmi ko subah jaldi uthna chahiye ... varna saare kaam adhoore reh jate hai
englishDialogue: One must get up early in the morning ... or else all work gets pending

dialogue: Jitna sukh saath rehne mein hai ... utna alag rehne mein nahi
englishDialogue: Living together gives more happiness ... than living separate

dialogue: The family that prays together, eats together ... stays together
englishDialogue: The family that prays together, eats together ... stays together

dialogue: Bhabhijaan, aap hum mein apnaye na apnaye ... hum aapko mooh dikhayi mein mile hai
englishDialogue: Sister-in-law whether you treat me as your own or not ... I have come to you as a wedding gift

dialogue: Insaan ki pehchaan tann se nahi ... mann se ki jati hai
englishDialogue: A person not known by his body ... he is known by his heart

dialogue: Satta milne par pyare se pyara insaan bhi apne rang badal leta hai
englishDialogue: On getting power even the most lovable person changes their color

dialogue: Joh kaam aaj poore nahi hue woh kal poore honge ... har subah apne saath asha ki ek nayi kiran lekar aati hai
englishDialogue: The work that was not finished today will be finished tomorrow ... every morning gets with itself a new ray of hope

dialogue: Zindagi mein kuch gham aaise bhi hote hai ... jinse insaan ka rishta zindagi bhar ka hota hai
englishDialogue: In life there are some sorrows ... with which a person has a relationship for the entire life

dialogue: Pati woh hota hai jise patni parmeshwar samajhkar poojti hai ... ek kamzor aur besahara aurat par zulm karne waala pati nahi ... rakshas kehlata hai
englishDialogue: A husband is someone whom a wife worships as god ... and a person who does injustice on a weak and helpless woman is not called a husband ... but he is called a devil

dialogue: Aurat ka dil atyachar se nahi ... pyar se jeeta jaata hai
englishDialogue: A woman's heart is won with love ... and not with oppression

dialogue: Aurat jis aadmi ka daaman chhodkar bhaagna chahe ... woh mard nahi namard hota hai
englishDialogue: When a woman wants to leave and run away from the company of a man ... then that man is not a man

dialogue: Ghayal sher aur taqatwar dushman ka shikaar karne mein bahut mazaa aata hai
englishDialogue: It's great fun to hunt a wounded tiger and a powerful enemy

dialogue: Jab time palti ho jaata hai na ... toh bete ko baap banne mein time nahi lagta
englishDialogue: When the time changes ... then it doesn't take time for the son to become the father

dialogue: Tees din hai tumhare paas ... ek-a-tees ve din mein agar tum is shehar ki hadh mein bhi nazar aaye ... toh duniya ki hadh se bahar nikaal kar phenk doonga
englishDialogue: You have 30 days ... if on the 31st day you are seen within the city limits ... then I will throw you out from the limits of the world

dialogue: By God, dil garden garden ho gaya!
englishDialogue: By God, I'm exhilarated!

dialogue: Yeh kaun hai yaar ... chalu episode mein commercial break ki tarah beech mein aa jata hai
englishDialogue: Who is this person? ... he is coming in between like a commercial break in a running episode

dialogue: Bachpan se aaj tak maine kabhi Holi nahi kheli ... magar ab kheloonga khoon ki Holi
englishDialogue: I've never played Holi all my life ... but now I will play Holi with blood

dialogue: Main bure kaam zaroor karta hoon ... lekin waise nahin ki insaaniyat ko mujhpe sharm aa jaye
englishDialogue: I definitely do bad things ... but not those that make humanity feel ashamed of me

dialogue: Maut ka khauf zinda logon ko ho sakta hai ... laashon ko nahi
englishDialogue: Only the living people fear death ... not dead bodies

dialogue: Jis rishte ki buniyaad jhoot hai, fareb hai ... usse ret par bane mahal ki tarah dasna hi hoga
englishDialogue: A relationship that is founded on lies, deceit ... has to collapse like a castle made with sand

dialogue: Mohabbat aisa cancer hai joh ... achche khase aadmi ko tadpa tadpa kar maar dalta hai
englishDialogue: Love is such a cancer which ... kills a perfect person with torture

dialogue: Sirf pyar hamesha rehta hai ... dard nahi
englishDialogue: Only love stays forever ... not the pain

dialogue: Mahabharat ho yah Ramayan ... har jung ki buniyaad mein aurat hai
englishDialogue: Whether it is Mahabharata or Ramayana ... woman is the cause for every war

dialogue: Yeh ball ko hole mein dalta hai ... main life ko hole mein dalta hoon
englishDialogue: He puts the ball in a hole ... I put the life in a hole

dialogue: Cancer ke mareez ka ilaaj ho sakta hai magar ... mohabbat ke maare ka nahi
englishDialogue: A cancer patient can be treated but ... not a lover

dialogue: Agar aapne adam khor sher nahin dekha ... khoon peene wala bhediya nahin dekha ... toh isse dekhiye, isse
englishDialogue: If you haven't seen a ferocious lion ... if you haven't seen a blood drinking coyote ... then look at him

dialogue: Insaani khaal mein khada yeh shaksh ... insaani ghost ko noch noch kar khane waala woh khatarnak cheetah hai ... jisne duniya har jurm chatkare le lekar kiya hai ... hatya, loot, balatkaar
englishDialogue: This person standing in the facade of a man ... is a dangerous cheetah who eats the human flesh bite by bite ... has enjoyed committing every crime of the world ... murder, robbery, rape

dialogue: Joh markar zinda hote hai ... unki zindagi haramzadi ho jaati hai ... joh na aasani se marti hai aur na hi kisiko aasan maut maarti hai
englishDialogue: People who live after being dead ... their life becomes that of a bastard ... which doesn't die easily and neither does it kill anyone with ease

dialogue: Is desh ke gaddaron ko anjaam tak pahunchana ... yahi meri zindagi ka maqsad hai
englishDialogue: To bring the traitors of this country to their end ... is the purpose of my life

dialogue: Jab ek fauji ki khopdi garam ho jaati hai toh woh apni hadh hi kya ... dushman ki sarhad bhi paar kar jaata hai
englishDialogue: When the mind of a soldier goes crazy then forget his limits ... he even crosses the border of his enemy

dialogue: Chori se liya gaya chumma ... zindagi ki sabse haseen cheez hoti hai
englishDialogue: A kiss that is stolen ... is the most beautiful thing in life

dialogue: Tum jaise gaddaron ka anth ek alag andaz se hoga
englishDialogue: The end of traitors like you will be very different

dialogue: Jab zindagi aapke samne saare darwaze bandh kar deti hai na ... tab sharafat aur gundagiri mein zyada kuch farak nahi reh jaata
englishDialogue: When life closes all the doors in front of you ... then hardly any difference is left between honesty and rowdyism

dialogue: Ek laawaris ko roti ki bheek di jaati hai pyar ki nahi ... usse zillat milti hai lekin apni sachai ko badalne ka mauka nahi milta
englishDialogue: A derelict can be given food if he begs but not love ... he gets humiliation but not a chance to change his truth

dialogue: Na toh mujhe maafi maangni aati hai na hi pyar karna aata hai ... mujhe toh sirf koshish karni aati hai
englishDialogue: Neither do I know how to apologize nor do I know how to love ... I only know how to try

dialogue: Jis tarah kuch log doosron ke liye marte hai ... ussi tarah kuch ko doosron ke liye jeena padta hai
englishDialogue: Like some people die for others ... just like that some people have to live for others

dialogue: Aap toh apni saaf sutri balcony mein se neeche gandi naali mein sirf thookna jaante hai ... par us naali mein pal rahe kisi laawaris ko apne barabar bithana jaante hai?
englishDialogue: You only know to spit from your clean balcony into the dirty gutter ... but can you make a derelict living in that dirty gutter sit besides you?

dialogue: Kisi bhi cheez mein itni sachchai nahi ho sakti ... jitni tumse milne ki meri khwaish mein hai
englishDialogue: No one thing can have so much truth ... that my wish has to meet you

dialogue: Zindagi U-turn hai ... pata nahi kab kiski zindagi kaunsa turn maar deve
englishDialogue: Life is a U-turn ... who knows whose life will turn where

dialogue: Mazaak ko chewing gum ke maafik kheechne ka nahi
englishDialogue: Don't stretch humour like a chewing gum

dialogue: Agar koi sachche dil se kuch chahe ... toh namumkin bhi mumkin ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: If someone wants something with a true heart ... then the impossible also becomes possible

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi ek jhoot bhi insaan ko tabaah kar sakta hai ... aur kabhi ek sach bhi
englishDialogue: Sometimes even one lie can destroy a person ... and sometimes even one truth

dialogue: Aurat ka charitra safed chaddar hota hai ... aur agar uspar daag lag jaye toh woh kabhi nahi dhulta
englishDialogue: The character of a woman is a white sheet ... and if it gets dirty then it can never be washed

dialogue: Jis jhoot se kisi ki izzat bach jaye ... aaisa jhoot toh hazaron sach se bhi mahaan hota hai
englishDialogue: A lie that protects the honour of someone ... that lie is even bigger than thousands of truths

dialogue: Pyar karne waala insaan apni zabaan se chahe dus jhoot bol le ... lekin uski aankhen kabhi jhoot nahi bolti
englishDialogue: Even if a person in love says ten lies from his own mouth ... still his eyes can never lie

dialogue: Yeh kya hota hai, yeh kyun hota hai, yeh kaise ho jaata hai ... kyun apna dil achanak kisi anjaane ki pehli hi nazar mein ... apna nahi paraya ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: What is this, why does this happen, how does this happen ... why is it that our own heart suddenly on the first sight of some stranger ... becomes someone else's instead of being our own

dialogue: Beti pati ke pallu se pallu bandhkar agni ke jitne phere leti hai ... baap ka haq utna hi gunah kam ho jaata hai ... aur pati ka haq utne hi gunah zyada
englishDialogue: The number of rounds around the fire a daughter takes with her husband tying their scarfs together ... that much right of the father decreases ... and that much right of the husband increases

dialogue: Abhe aye dhakan ... yeh phone ke andhar hi mooh daalke tereko aaisi gaali doonga na ... ki aakhe telephone exchange mein angaar lag jayegi
englishDialogue: Hey you crazy ... I will put my face in the phone and curse you so badly ... that the entire telephone exchange will be on fire

dialogue: Main chota aadmi hoon ... mere pair zameen pe hai, mera sar mere kandhon par hai ... aur mere dimaag ke andhar meri aukaat tolne ka tarazu laga hua hai
englishDialogue: I am a small person ... my legs are on the ground, my head is on my shoulders ... and there is a weighing scale in my head to weigh my status

dialogue: Jhoot ki umar bahut kam hoti hai ... jhoot jiye char din aur sach jiye hazaar din
englishDialogue: The life of lies is very less ... lies will live for 4 days and truth will live for 1000 days

dialogue: Yeh joh paisa hota hai na, iske paon nahi hote hai ... lekin paon waale se sau gunah zyada tezz bhaagta hai
englishDialogue: Money has no legs ... but it runs 100 times faster than the people with legs

dialogue: Maine kya kya sapne dekhe the ... byah karke honeymoon karne Switzerland jaonga ... lekin ab toh zindagi mein na switzer hai, na land hai, na honey hai, na moon hai
englishDialogue: I had dreamt that ... after getting married I'll go to Switzerland for a honeymoon ... but now in my life there is no switzer, there is no land, there is no honey, there is no moon

dialogue: Phool khilte hai, bahaaro ka samaa hota hai ... aaise mausam mein hi toh pyar jawan hota hai ... dil ki baaton ko hooton se nahi kehte ... yeh fasaana toh nighahon se bayaan hota hai
englishDialogue: Flowers blossom, it is the season of spring ... and it is in this weather that love grows ... the words of the heart are not said by the lips ... infact this story is said by the eyes

dialogue: Kuch hosh nahi rehta, kuch dhayan nahi rehta ... insaan mohabbat mein insaan nahi rehta
englishDialogue: There is no consciousness, there is no attention ... a human is not a human when in love

dialogue: Hamare ghav bahut gehre hai ... woh itni aasani se nahin bharne waale
englishDialogue: My wounds are very deep ... they will not heal this easily

dialogue: Dawa bhi kaam na aaye, koi dua na lage ... mere khuda kisiko pyar ki hawa na lage
englishDialogue: No medicine will work and no prayers will work ... my Lord no one should get in the air of love

dialogue: Main apne mulk ko apna ghar samajhta hoon
englishDialogue: I consider my country as my home

dialogue: Milte hi nazarein dil milaya nahi jaata ... aagaaz ko anjaam banaya nahi jaata
englishDialogue: Hearts should not connect when the eyes connect ... and the start should never be made the end

dialogue: Tum jaise log dushman hote hain sari insaaniyat ke
englishDialogue: People like you are enemies of entire humanity

dialogue: Phir kabhi kisi Salim se mat kehna ... yeh mulk uska ghar nahi
englishDialogue: Never say to any Salim again ... that this country is not his home

dialogue: Ek baar zabaan dene ke baad agar kal ko kuch ho gaya na ... toh main teri zabaan kheench loonga ... phir tu kisiko jaan toh de payega, lekin zabaan nahi de payega
englishDialogue: If something happens tomorrow after you promise ... then I will snatch your tongue ... and then you will be able to give your life to someone, but not your promise

dialogue: Arre janaab, aaj kal toh music companyon ko ghazal ki dhun bhi disco jaisi chahiye
englishDialogue: Sir, the music companies today want even the tune of a poem to be just like disco

dialogue: Aapke mehmaan hai toh hum inke kadardaan hai
englishDialogue: If he is your guest then I am his appreciator

dialogue: Ishwar dil mein ho toh sachai mazboot rehti hai
englishDialogue: If God is in your heart, the truth is resolute

dialogue: Shaadi na hi ek contract hai, na hi koi utsav hai ... agar utsav hai toh logon ke liye hai ... shaadi do aatmaon do dilon ka mel hai ... jisme do jan bharpoor zindagi saath saath jeete hai aur saath saath marte hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is not a contract, neither a festival ... if it's a festival then it's for others ... marriage is a union of two souls two hearts ... in which two people live life together to the fullest and die together

dialogue: Aap itne khoobsurat log hai ki aapki tasveer seedhe dil mein chapti hai
englishDialogue: You are such beautiful people that your picture prints directly in my heart

dialogue: Kuch log pyar karke shaadi karte hai ... aur kuch log shaadi karke pyar karte hai
englishDialogue: Some people fall in love and get married ... and some people get married and fall in love

dialogue: Amir banne ke liye zaroori hai lalach
englishDialogue: To become rich it is important to have greed

dialogue: Taal se hi geet hai, taal hi sangeet hai, taal pe hi saans hai, taal se hi preet hai
englishDialogue: From beat comes a song, beat itself is music, on beat there is breathe, from beat comes love

dialogue: Imaandari se zyada zaroori hai dukaandari
englishDialogue: Salesmanship is more important than honesty

dialogue: Pyar mein giro mat bachche ... utho, rise in love
englishDialogue: Son don't fall in love ... get up, rise in love

dialogue: Hum doston se daant ke aur dushmano se pyar se baat karte hai
englishDialogue: We talk with our friends roughly and with our enemies with love

dialogue: Yeh Mumbai hai, yahan har cheez dikhawa hai jise hum showmanship kehte hai ... sajawat hai jise hum publicity kehte hai ... aur banawat hai jise hum marketing kehte hai
englishDialogue: This is Mumbai, here everything is a show which we call showmanship ... it is styling which we call publicity ... and it is making which we call marketing

dialogue: Hum kala bechte hai, ladkiyon ki izzat nahi
englishDialogue: We sell art, not a girls honor

dialogue: Hum dard bechte hai, khareedte nahi hai
englishDialogue: We sell pain, we don't buy it

dialogue: Mumbai pe raj karta hoon ... raj
englishDialogue: I rule over Mumbai ... rule

dialogue: Asli hai asli ... pachaas tola, pachaas tola ... kitna, pachaas tola
englishDialogue: It is real ... 50 tolas, 50 tolas ... how much, 50 tolas

dialogue: Tere karm hi nahi re ... teri saali poori atma sadeli hai sadeli
englishDialogue: Not only your deeds ... your whole bloody soul has gone bad

dialogue: Aye Baba ... pachaas idea hai dimaag mein
englishDialogue: Oh dad ... I have fifty ideas in my mind

dialogue: Trigger dabaya ... aur khel khallas!
englishDialogue: Press the trigger ... and the game is over!

dialogue: Dushman chatt ke neeche aa jaye ... toh mehmaan ban jaata hai
englishDialogue: When an enemy comes under your roof ... then he becomes a guest

dialogue: Dushman ke ghar mein daakhil hone ke liye ... tameez ki nahi taqat ki zaroorat hoti hai
englishDialogue: To enter the enemies house ... you need courage and not manners

dialogue: Jis tarah chalaang lagane ke liye khiladi ko peeche aana padta hai ... ussi tarah dushman ko jadh se ukhaadne ke liye kabhi jhukna bhi padta hai
englishDialogue: Just like a player has to take a step back to jump forward ... just like that sometimes to uproot your enemy you have to bow down also

dialogue: Jab dimaag mein gussa ho aur aankhon mein nafrat ... toh nishana theek nahi lagta hai
englishDialogue: When there is anger in the mind and hatred in the eyes ... then you can't aim properly

dialogue: Balraj apne dushman ko us waqt tak nahi bhoolta ... jab tak usse shamshan tak nahi pahuncha deta
englishDialogue: Balraj doesn't forget his enemies until ... he makes them reach the cremation ground

dialogue: Zindagi itni lambi nahi hoti ki invitation ka intezar kiya jaaye
englishDialogue: Life is not so long that we should wait for an invitation

dialogue: Aap beshaq unse pyar thoda kam, lekin wafaa zyada kare
englishDialogue: You may love him a little less, but be more loyal to him

dialogue: Koi madharchod button dabakar mere liye yeh faisla nahin karega ... ki mujhe kab marna hai
englishDialogue: No motherfucker can press a button and decide for me ... that when I should die

dialogue: Aapke ghar mein cockroach aata hai toh aap kya karte hai Rathore Sahab? ... aap usko paalte nahi maarte hai
englishDialogue: Rathore Sir, what do you do when a cockroach comes in your house? ... you don't nourish him you kill him

dialogue: Aam aadmi ki tarah jiyo, aam aadmi ki tarah bardaash karo aur aam aadmi ki tarah marro
englishDialogue: Live like a common man, tolerate like a common man and die like a common man

dialogue: They asked us this question on a Friday, repeated it on Tuesday ... I'm just replying on Wednesday
englishDialogue: They asked us this question on a Friday, repeated it on Tuesday ... I'm just replying on Wednesday

dialogue: I'm just a stupid common man
englishDialogue: I'm just a stupid common man

dialogue: Yeh hamare hero hai ... ek phone aaya aur pet kharab ho gaya
englishDialogue: He is our hero ... one phone call came and he got diarrhea

dialogue: Pyar paise se khareeda nahi ja sakta barabar hai ... magar iske upar kharcha bahut hai
englishDialogue: It's true that love can't be bought with money ... but you spend a lot on it

dialogue: Hamara art of living ka class ... matlab daru ka khamba aur teen glass
englishDialogue: Our art of living class ... means a bottle of alcohol and three glasses

dialogue: Tum jaise log na shaadi se pehle maine pyar kiya ... aur shaadi ki baat aayi toh yeh maine kya kiya
englishDialogue: People like you say I love you before marriage ... and when it comes to marriage then you say what have I done

dialogue: Mera beta TV ke daily soap ki tarah hai ... har din dukh, dard aur taqleef ki guarantee
englishDialogue: My son is like the daily TV soap ... he guarantees sorrow, pain and distress everyday

dialogue: Taqat umar ya kadh mein nahi ... irradon mein hoti hai
englishDialogue: Power doesn't exists in age and height ... but it exists intentions

dialogue: Aaj phir jalwa, phir party ... sharaab, kabab aur hum aap
englishDialogue: Today again we'll have fun and party ... with alcohol, meat skewers and you and me

dialogue: Zindagi mein kuch cheezein haasil karne ke liye sahi ya galat dekh ke nahi ki jaati ... balki waqt aur halaat dekh ke ki jaati hai
englishDialogue: In life to achieve certain things you don't look to see if it's right or wrong ... instead you look to see the time and the situation

dialogue: Haath pair mein dum nahi ... lekin hum kisi se kam nahi
englishDialogue: We may not have power in our hands and feets ... but we are not less than anyone

dialogue: Agar chain se sona hai toh jaag jaiye!
englishDialogue: If you want to sleep peacefully then wake up!

dialogue: Only shak ... no f*ck!
englishDialogue: Only suspicion ... no f*cking!

dialogue: Jeete raho ... phulo phalo ... khair chodo
englishDialogue: Live long ... grow your family ... well let it be

dialogue: Krishna kare toh raas leela ... hum kare toh character dheela
englishDialogue: If Lord Krishna does it then it's dance and play ... but if I do it then my character is loose

dialogue: Shola ya shabnam, naa toh hai hi ... koshish karke dekh le ... shayad haan ho jaye
englishDialogue: Whether you get the girl or fire, you already have a no ... but give it shot ... may be it will turn into a yes

dialogue: Life hum mein itna sab kuch deti hai ... aur hum itne se ke liye aankh band karke behte rehte hai
englishDialogue: Life gives us so much ... but we still sit keeping our eyes closed for smaller things

dialogue: Aulad pehda hote hi mar jaye toh ek dukh ... jawan hoke mare toh dugna dukh ... aur agar aulad tere jaisi nalayak pehda ho jaye ... toh zindagi bhar ka dukh
englishDialogue: If a child dies when they are born then you feel sad ... if they die when they are young then you feel double sad ... but if the child born is useless like you ... then the sadness is their for life

dialogue: Yeh na hota toh koi doosra gham hona tha ... main toh woh hoon jise har haal mein bas rona tha
englishDialogue: Had this not been there, then there would have been some other sorrow ... I am that person who had to cry no matter what

dialogue: Hindustan mein ek-atees rajya hai, solah-sau-athara bhasha, che-hazar-char-sau jaatiyan aur che dharm hone ke bawajood ... Hindustan ek hai
englishDialogue: In India, inspite of there being 31 states, 1618 rationalized mother tongues, 6400 castes and 6 religions ... India is united

dialogue: Jitni nafrat hamare liye tumhare dil mein hai ... usse zyada pyar tumhare liye hamare seene mein hai
englishDialogue: The amount of hatred that you have for me in your heart ... more than that, I have love for you in my heart

dialogue: Zindagi kabhi kabhi aaise modh par aa jaati hai ... jahan se koi U-turn nahi hota
englishDialogue: Sometimes life comes at such a point ... from where there is no U-turn

dialogue: Har roz lakhon hazaron phool khilte hai ... magar koi bhi phool apni marzi se kisi ke arthi par chadne ke liye nahi khilta
englishDialogue: Everyday hundreds and thousands of flowers blossom ... but no flower blossoms to be placed on a bier at it's own wish

dialogue: Jis ghar ka jawaan beta aadhi raat tak bahar rahe ... us ghar ke bade buzurgon ki aankhen bhi bahar hi rehti hai
englishDialogue: The house in which the young children stay out till late in the night ... the eyes of the elders of that house, keep looking outside

dialogue: Burre waqt ki ek baat achchi hoti hai ... ki woh bhi guzar jaata hai
englishDialogue: Bad times have one great thing ... that they also pass away

dialogue: Taqdeer kharab ho toh oonth par baithe baune aadmi ke pair mein bhi kutta kaat le
englishDialogue: If the luck is bad then a dog will bite the leg of a midget even if he is sitting on a camel

dialogue: God great nahi hai ... woh great hai apne manne waalon se, apne chahne waalon se
englishDialogue: God is not great ... he becomes great by the people who believe in him, by the people who love him

dialogue: Filmy gaane gayega toh paise kamayega ... varna upar waale ke naam par bhookha marr jayega
englishDialogue: If you sing songs from the movies then you'll make money ... or else you will die hungry in the name of god

dialogue: Bas ek haan ke intezaar mein raat yunhi guzar jayegi ... ab toh bas uljhan hai saath mere, neend kahan aayegi ... subah ki kiran na jaane kaunsa sandesh layegi ... rim jhim si gungunayegi ya pyas adhoori reh jayegi
englishDialogue: The night got over in waiting for a yes ... now I won't be able to sleep since the problem is with me ... and I don't know what message will the morning sunrays get ... will they sing for me or will I be left thirsty

dialogue: Vishvas aur ghamund mein bahut kum farak hai ... main kar sakta hoon, yeh mera vishvas hai ... sirf main hi kar sakta hoon, yeh mera ghamund
englishDialogue: There is a very small difference between faith and pride ... I can do it, is my faith ... only I can do it, is my pride

dialogue: Mere pitaji ka kehna tha ki ... kaam jazbaat ke saath karo ... jazbaati hokar nahi
englishDialogue: My father used to say ... work with emotion ... not by becoming emotional

dialogue: Ragad ragad ke saaf karo ... mere haathon ko maaf karo
englishDialogue: Scrub scrub and clean it ... please forgive my hands

dialogue: Agar kisi ko meri kamyabi se jalan hoti hai, toh achcha hai ... agar koi mujhse nafrat karta hai, toh aur bhi achcha hai
englishDialogue: If someone is jealous of my success, then it's good ... if someone hates me, then it's even better

dialogue: Kuch baatein bina kahe samajhi jaati hai ... aur kuch kehni zaroori hoti hai
englishDialogue: Some things are understood without being said ... and some things are important to be said

dialogue: Yahan har koi saans toh le raha hai ... magar zindagi se bahut door
englishDialogue: Here everyone is breathing ... but far away from life

dialogue: I don't know woh kaun hai aur yeh sab kyun kar raha hai ... lekin ek baar uska pata chal jaye toh usse nafrat karne ki sahi wajah de doonga
englishDialogue: I don't know who he is and why is he doing all this ... but once I know about him then I'll give him the right reason to hate me

dialogue: Aadmi chahte hue bhi apna ateeth nahi badal sakta ... lekin apne aaj ko sudhar sakta hai ... apne kal ko badal sakta hai
englishDialogue: Even if a person wants he can't change his past ... but he can better his present ... and he can change his tomorrow

dialogue: Kuch anjaam maut se bhi bure hote hai
englishDialogue: Some consequences are worse than death

dialogue: Tum usse bachane ke liye kheloge aur main uska the end karne ke liye
englishDialogue: You will play to save her and I will play to bring her to an end

dialogue: Joh tum sun bhi nahi sakti ... usse maine har pal jiya hai
englishDialogue: What you can't even hear ... I have lived that every moment

dialogue: Akad bakad bambay bo, assi nabbe jaane do, nabbe baad kiya tha joh, gunah hua ab sazaa lo ... akad bakad bambay bo, sazaa hui ab gunah lo
englishDialogue: Eenie meenie miney mo, eighty ninety let it go, what you did after ninety, was a crime now take the punishment ... eenie meenie miney mo, the punishment is over now do the crime

dialogue: Jail mein gandagi dhoi nahi jaati ... gunah, gussa, tadap, dard in ragon mein baar baar duboya jaata hai ... saalon saal jab tak insaaniyat ka rang hamesha ke liye utar na jaye ... bas ek rang bachta hai, nafrat ka rang
englishDialogue: You can't wash the sins in the jail ... crime, anger, yearn, pain is dipped in these veins many a times ... for many years until the colour of humanity doesn't come out forever ... and only one colour is left, that of hatred

dialogue: Joh aadmi limit mein rehta hai ... woh zindagi bhar limit mein hi reh jaata hai
englishDialogue: A man who stays within limit ... in life, he always remains within limit

dialogue: Haarne ka darr aur jeetne ki umeed ... in dono ke beech joh ek tension wala waqt hota hai na ... kamaal ka hota hai
englishDialogue: The fear of losing and the hope of winning ... the moments of tension in between these two ... are just great

dialogue: Joh haarta hai, wohi toh jeetne ka matlab jaanta hai
englishDialogue: The one who loses, is the one who knows the meaning of winning

dialogue: Jeb khali ho tabhi toh sapne dekhne chahiye
englishDialogue: When your pockets are empty thats when you should dream

dialogue: Car ke bina pyar nahin ho sakta ... no car, no pyar
englishDialogue: Without a car there cannot be love ... no car, no love

dialogue: Joh soochta hai ... woh zindagi bar soochta hi reh jaata hai
englishDialogue: The one who thinks ... keeps thinking for the whole life

dialogue: Cricketer aur film stars mein zyada farak nahin hota ... dono ki jawani khatam ... to kahani khatam
englishDialogue: There is hardly any difference between cricketers and film stars ... for both when their youth is over ... their story is over

dialogue: Main raaste badalta nahin hoon ... raaste banata hoon
englishDialogue: I don't change routes ... I make routes

dialogue: Paisa, paise ko kheechta hai
englishDialogue: Money pulls money

dialogue: Khiladi khel kheltein hain ... aur main khiladiyon se khelne laga hoon
englishDialogue: Players play the game ... and I have started playing with the players

dialogue: Life mein sabkuch fixed hai
englishDialogue: In life, everything is fixed

dialogue: Chakke sab ka saath nahin dete
englishDialogue: Eunuchs don't support everyone

dialogue: India mein cricket khel nahin hai ... religion hai, pagalpan hai, junoon hai
englishDialogue: In India cricket is not a game ... it's religion, it's frenzy, it's passion

dialogue: Sirf run mat banaoo ... paise bhi banaoo
englishDialogue: Don't make runs only ... make money also

dialogue: Yeh betting hai yah setting hai?
englishDialogue: Is this betting or setting?

dialogue: Rishtey kayam hone ke baad badal zaroor jaate hai ... tootte kabhi nahi
englishDialogue: Once relationships are formed then they definitely change ... but they never break

dialogue: Mubarak ho sabko saman yeh suhana ... main khush hoon mere aasunyon pe na jaana ... main toh deewana, deewana, deewana
englishDialogue: Congratulations to everyone since the environment is so pleasant ... I'm happy, don't go on my tears ... I'm crazy, crazy, crazy

dialogue: Kabira behta tere dar pe, sabki maange khair ... parwardigar bichadon ko mila de, mila de na yaar
englishDialogue: Kabira is sitting outside your door, and he wishes welfare of all ... oh god unite the lost ones, oh please my friend

dialogue: Jhoot nahi bolna yaara, sach kehna ... oh yaara dil na todna
englishDialogue: Don't lie my friend, say the truth ... oh my friend don't break my heart

dialogue: Kam jokhim aur kam munafa, usse business kehte hai ... zabardast jokhim aur zabardast munafa, usse jua kehte hai ... lekin kam jokhim aur zabardast munafa, usse mauka kehte hai
englishDialogue: Less risk and less profit is called as business ... more risk and more profit is called as gambling ... but less risk and more profit is called as opportunity

dialogue: Har badi daulat ke peeche koi na koi jurm hota hai
englishDialogue: Behind every great fortune there is a crime

dialogue: Agar zindagi bhar ka hisaab lagaya jaye ... toh gairon ke muqabale apne hi zyada khatarnak sabit hue hai
englishDialogue: If you account for the entire life ... then in front of strangers it is our dear ones that have proved to be more dangerous

dialogue: Aaj mera happy birthday hai ... saal mein do baar aata hai ... bas
englishDialogue: Today is my birthday ... it comes twice a year ... that's it

dialogue: Akhbaar baad mein aata hai ... colony waale khabarein pehle chaap dete hai
englishDialogue: The newspaper comes later ... first the people of this colony spread the news

dialogue: Jaisi demand ... waisi supply
englishDialogue: The demand ... drives the supply

dialogue: Duniya ko baanta ... humko tata
englishDialogue: You shared with the whole world ... and saying bye to me

dialogue: Border pe marne se zyada bada nasha koi nahin hai
englishDialogue: There is no intoxication bigger than dying on the border

dialogue: Dushman sirf border ke uss paar nahin hota ... ghar ke andhar bhi hota hai
englishDialogue: An enemy can not only be on the other side of the border ... he can also be inside the house

dialogue: Jab zindagi credit pe chal rahi ho na ... toh vastavikta thodi si dhundli ho jaati hai
englishDialogue: When life is running on credit ... then reality becomes a little bit foggy

dialogue: Shaurya sirf kisi ko maar girane ko nahi kehte, shaurya sirf salaami dene ko nahi kehte ... shaurya toh hamare bahut andhar hota hai ... ek hausla, ek himmat
englishDialogue: Bravery is not only to kill someone, bravery is not only to salute someone ... bravery is within us ... it is the spirit, it is the courage

dialogue: Main hamesha ek second aage rehta hoon
englishDialogue: I am always ahead by 1 second

dialogue: Gunaah mein hisaab kitaab nahi chalta
englishDialogue: In a crime there are no accounts

dialogue: Jung mein jab shoot karne ka order dete hai toh, kab kahan kaise uska toh pata hota hai magar kyun ... fauji ko na yeh batate hai, na usse janane ka haq hota hai
englishDialogue: In a war when you get an order to shoot, you know when, where and how to do that, but why ... a soldier is never told the reason behind it and neither does he have the right to know that

dialogue: Koi hawa toh chale, koi patta toh hile ... kaun hai apna kuch pata toh chale
englishDialogue: Some wind should blow, some leaves should move ... we must know who are our dear ones

dialogue: Boni na batta khelne aa gaye satta
englishDialogue: I have not even made any money yet and you guys have come to gamble

dialogue: Sach hamesha woh nahi hota joh sirf dikhai de
englishDialogue: Truth is not always what you see

dialogue: Har sikke ke do pehlu hote hai ... if there is god, there is evil ... agar achai hai, toh burai bhi hai ... agar roshni hai, toh andhera bhi
englishDialogue: Every coin has two sides ... if there is god, there is evil ... if there is good, then there is bad as well ... if there is light, then there is darkness as well

dialogue: Joh aatma badla chahti ho ya phir koi adhoori khwaish poori karne aayi ho ... woh bahut dangerous hoti hai
englishDialogue: A soul that returns to take revenge or perhaps to fulfill a desire ... that soul is very dangerous

dialogue: Jab chote the toh sochte the ki duniya badal denge ... vade huye toh samajh mein aaya ki duniya ko samajh le, yehi kaafi hai
englishDialogue: When I was small I used to think that I'll change the world ... but when I grew up then I understood that, it's more than enough to even understand this world

dialogue: Meri zindagi mein ladki ka aana utna hi mushkil hai jitna purani filmon mein court mein sahi salamat gawah ka pahunchna
englishDialogue: A girl entering my life is as difficult as a witness reaching safely to the court, just like it happened in the old films

dialogue: Maa behen ki izzat ki jaati hai ... na ke unke izzat ki maa behen
englishDialogue: You should respect your mother and your sister ... you shouldn't destroy their honour

dialogue: Jaise maa apne bachon mein farak nahi karti ... aise police wala bhi apne badmasho mein farak nahi karte ... hum sabko ek hi aankh se dekhenge ... maa ki aankh se
englishDialogue: Like a mother doesn't differentiate between her children ... just like that even the police doesn't differentiate between their criminals ... we'll look at all of them with one eye ... with the evil eye

dialogue: Padai likhai mann se karo ... lekin khel kood jamke karo
englishDialogue: Study from your heart ... but play a lot as well

dialogue: Problem kabhi insaan se bada nahi hota ... insaan hi usse bada banata hai
englishDialogue: A problem is never bigger than a person ... the person makes it bigger

dialogue: Tumse milne ke baad maine bhi ek sapna dekha tha ... tumhare har sapne ko sach karne ka sapna
englishDialogue: Even I saw a dream after meeting you ... the dream to make every dream of yours a reality

dialogue: Jab ladka aande zyada khane lage ... toh iska matlab usse us murgi se pyar ho gaya hai, joh aande deti hai ... ya us ladki se joh aande leti hai
englishDialogue: When a guy eats a lot of eggs ... then it means that he is love with the chicken that gives the eggs ... or with the girl who buys the eggs

dialogue: Dono gham se guzrein ya guzrein khushi se ... jahan se bhi guzrein, guzrein apni khushi se
englishDialogue: We both will go through sorrow or happiness ... but from wherever we go, we will go at our own will

dialogue: Hum pyar karte hai apne liye, kyun ki hum mein koi achcha lagta hai ... lekin milta tab hai, jab yeh jaan le ki hum mein joh achcha lagta hai ... usse kya achcha lagta hai?
englishDialogue: We love for ourselves, because we like someone ... but we achieve that love, when we come to know that what we love ... does she love that also?

dialogue: Dil ko dhadakana, dhadkane khud hi sikha deti hai ... par un dhadkano ko zinda rakhna padta hai
englishDialogue: The heartbeat itself teaches the heart to beat ... but one has to keep those heartbeats alive

dialogue: Indian women are like desi daru, always make you lose control ... but Indian men are like a mouse, always looking for a hole
englishDialogue: Indian women are like local alcohol, always make you lose control ... but Indian men are like a mouse, always looking for a hole

dialogue: Jaise pyar ko paane ke liye junoon zaroori hota hai ... pyar ko nibhane ke liye bhi ek junoon zaroori hota hai
englishDialogue: Just like it is important to have passion to get your love ... it is also important to have passion to fulfill your love

dialogue: Smile aaisa ki hosh uda de ... style aaisa ki band bajaa de ... ek baar pyar se dekh le toh, phir kuch aur dikhai na de
englishDialogue: Her smile makes me go crazy ... her style kills ... if she looks at me once with love, then I won't be able to see anything else

dialogue: Ek sach ki umar sau jhoot se badi hoti hai
englishDialogue: The life of one truth is bigger than that of hundred lies

dialogue: Hawa ki tarah hoti hai yeh problems ... kitni hi khidkiyan bandh karlo, andhar aa hi jaati hai
englishDialogue: Problems are like the wind ... no matter how many windows you close, it still comes in

dialogue: Aapne shayad nahi dekha par maine dekha ... ki aapke dekhne mein ek sapna tha ... joh aksar maine apne sapne mein dekha ... aur aaj us sapne ko dekha toh, dekhta hi reh gaya
englishDialogue: May be you didn't see it but I saw it ... that there was a dream when you were staring ... that I have often seen in my dream ... and today when I saw that dream, I was speechless

dialogue: Vaise toh yeh milta nahi ... aur jab milta hai, toh theek se milta nahi
englishDialogue: As it is we don't get to see him ... and when we see him, he doesn't meet properly

dialogue: Let's party and get tight ... because it's love at first sight
englishDialogue: Let's party and get tight ... because it's love at first sight

dialogue: Kuch cheezein purani hoke aur bhi khoobsurat ho jaati hai ... jaise ke gulaab, sharaab aur aap
englishDialogue: Some things become more beautiful as they grow old ... like rose, wine and you

dialogue: Is poori duniya mein na do tarah ki auratein hoti hai ... ek jinke bina raha nahi jaata ... aur doosri yeh jinke saath raha nahi jaata
englishDialogue: There are two types of women in this entire world ... one without whom you cannot live ... and other with whom you cannot live

dialogue: Yaadien bhi kitni ehsaan faramosh hoti hai na ... jis dil mein rehti hai ussi dil ko dukhati hai
englishDialogue: Memories are very selfish ... they bring pain to the heart in which they themselves reside

dialogue: Thoda thoda karenge ... pura nahi karenge ... upar upar se
englishDialogue: We'll do a little bit ... we won't do it completely ... we'll do it from the top only

dialogue: Yeh jayegi toh koi aur aayegi ... woh jayegi toh koi aur aayegi ... kalaiyon ki kami hai kya hamare desh mein
englishDialogue: If she'll leave then someone else will come ... if that one will leave then someone else will come ... there's no shortage of women with soft wrists in our country

dialogue: Berozgar pati ko kaam ke liye utsana chahiye ... kamasutra ke liye nahi
englishDialogue: You should encourage your jobless husband for work ... and not for sex

dialogue: Duniya mein har koi galat hai ... aur sahi woh hai joh kam galat hai
englishDialogue: Everyone in this world is wrong ... but the one who's the least wrong, is the right one

dialogue: Duniya mein jitni bheed badhti jaa rahi hai ... log utne hi akele hote jaa rahe hai
englishDialogue: The more the population of the world grows ... that much more the people are feeling lonely

dialogue: Dil kehta hai unse mil ... dimag kehta hai duty ke baad mil
englishDialogue: My heart tells me to go and meet her ... but my mind tells me to meet her after work

dialogue: Qaid mein hai zindagi, azaad ho jaa ... mohabbat mein chal barbaad ho jaa ... teri shehad si awaaz ko kaano se chakk loon ... tu mere ishq ka meetha swad ho jaa
englishDialogue: Your life is in confinement, so go ahead and free yourself ... go ahead and destroy yourself in love ... I want to taste your honey like voice through my ears ... so go ahead and become the sweet taste of my love

dialogue: Mard ke sar ke baal white ho sakte hai, lekin dil ke nahi
englishDialogue: A man's hair on his head can turn white, but not the hair on his heart

dialogue: Dil tune kuch aisa kar daala ... na jee raha hoon na mar raha hoon ... yo kya ho gaya saala
englishDialogue: You've done something to my heart ... that neither I'm living nor I'm dead ... what the hell has happened to me

dialogue: Main acha hoon toh acha hoon ... aur bura hoon toh aur bhi acha hoon
englishDialogue: If I'm good then I'm good ... but if I'm bad then I'm even better

dialogue: Tumhari zulf ke saaye mein shaam kar longo ... aur safar ek umr ko tamaam kaam kar longo ... aur nazar milai toh pochongo ishq-o-anjaam ... aur nazar jukai toh khali salaam kar longo
englishDialogue: I'll spend my time until evening under the shade of your tresses ... I'll do everything in just this one life of mine ... if you look into my eyes then I'll ask you the outcome of love ... and if you look away from me then I'll just say hi to you

movie: Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga
dialogue: True love ke raste mein koi na koi siyappa hota hi hota hai ... agar na ho toh love story mein feel kaise aayegi
englishDialogue: There's always some foolishness when it comes to true love ... without it there's no feel in the love story

movie: Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga
dialogue: Jab tak true love nahi milta na ... humein pata bhi nahi hota ki life mein kya missing hai
englishDialogue: Until we find true love ... we don't even come to know what's missing in life

dialogue: Tu mera pati ... main teri patni ... bhar de meri maang ... nahi toh cheer doongi teri taang
englishDialogue: You're my husband ... I'm your wife ... fill my hair parting with vermilion ... or else I'll tear apart your legs

dialogue: Itihaas ki ek khasiyat hoti hai ... jab bhi woh khudko dohrata hai ... toh saare pyaade wahin khade milte hai
englishDialogue: History has a speciality ... whenever it repeats itself ... then you find all the pawns standing in the same place

dialogue: Kismat ki bhi ek khasiyat hoti hai ... kismat ka paiya ghoomta hai na ... toh saare paase apne aap hi palat jaate hai
englishDialogue: Destiny has a speciality ... whenever the wheel of destiny spins ... then all the plans change automatically

dialogue: Jiska zor kam hota hai wohi kamzor hota hai
englishDialogue: The one who has a lose grip on things, is a weak person

dialogue: Kabootar ka yuck brings good luck
englishDialogue: A pigeon's potty brings good luck

dialogue: Wife shakti ... husband sehanshakti
englishDialogue: A wife has all the power ... but a husband has the tolerance to bear that power

dialogue: Ranbhoomi mein tantra, mantra ya phir yantra chalta hai ... lekin vijayi wohi hota hai jahan shadyantra chalta hai
englishDialogue: In the battlefield you use either prayers or weapons ... but only the one who uses conspiracy becomes the winner

dialogue: Jung jeeti ya haari jaati hai sirf ek cheez ke basis par ... information
englishDialogue: A war is won or lost on the basis of only one thing ... information

dialogue: Apni position se retire hona bahut aasaan hai ... magar apni soch se bahut mushkil
englishDialogue: It's very easy to retire from your position ... but it's very hard to do that from your thoughts

dialogue: Mera junoon hai sirf mera mulk ... mera Hindustan!
englishDialogue: My passion is only my country ... my India!

dialogue: Jab upar waala kisi ke sar ke upar apna haath rakhna chahta hai ... toh aap badhon ke haath ko apna zariya banata hai
englishDialogue: Whenever god wants to bless someone with his hands ... then he uses the hands of elders like you as his medium

dialogue: Hum zindagi ko nahi ... zindagi humko plan karti hai
englishDialogue: We don't plan our life ... our life plans us

dialogue: Mauke aate nahi ... banaye jaate hai
englishDialogue: Opportunities don't come ... they're created

dialogue: Sau sukh paaye maat pita jinke hoth sapoot ... narak bhog jeeye jaat hai jinke hoth kapoot
englishDialogue: Parents who have a good child attain loads of happiness ... and parents who have an evil child attain the life of hell

dialogue: Police aur neta is system ka woh hissa hai jinhe chheda nahi jaata ... lekin agar baat hadh se aage badh jaaye toh chhoda bhi nahi jaata
englishDialogue: The police and politicians are that part of our system which one should not touch ... but if they cross the limits then you don't leave them as well

dialogue: Rajneeti bolo toh ek second ... socho toh ek minute ... seekh lo toh kuch din ... lekin rajneeti samajhne ke liye poori zindagi nikal jaati hai
englishDialogue: You can talk about politics in one second ... you can think about it in one minute ... you can learn about it in a few days ... but it'll take you your entire life to understand politics

dialogue: Politicians aur diapers ko badalna chahiye ... nahi toh gandagi phail jayegi
englishDialogue: Politicians and diapers should always be changed ... or else it'll spread filthiness

dialogue: Politics mein ek cheez yaad rakhna ... sikka uchle ya na uchle ... keechad zaroor uchalta hai
englishDialogue: Always remember one thing in politics ... whether your plan works for you or not ... you'll always get defamed

dialogue: Haq doge toh Ramayan shuru hogi ... cheenoge toh Mahabharat ... faisla tumhe karna hai Ramayan ke Mahabharat
englishDialogue: If you give me my right then there'll be peace ... if you snatch it then there'll be a war ... now you have to decide between peace and war

dialogue: Main bahut ajeeb hoon ... phal nahi milta hai toh pedh kaat deta hoon ... aur pedh nahi mila toh jadh kaat deta hoon
englishDialogue: I've very strange ... I cut the tree if I don't get fruits from it ... and I cut the roots if don't get a tree from it

dialogue: Politics sher ki sawari hai ... ek baar utar gaye toh jaan se bhi haath dho behetoge
englishDialogue: Politics is like a ride on a tiger's back ... once you get down then you'll lose your life as well

dialogue: Jung joh hai na gurde se jeeti jaati hai ... goli se nahi
englishDialogue: A war is won with courage ... and not with bullets

dialogue: Jab kaatne ki aukaad nahi ho na ... toh bhaukna bhi nahi chahiye
englishDialogue: When you don't have the courage to bite ... then you shouldn't bark as well

dialogue: Power ka ek hi center hota hai ... aur woh center hota hai party president
englishDialogue: Power has only one center ... and that center is the president of a political party

dialogue: Is duniya ki koi bhi taqat us vichaar us soch ko nahi rok sakti hai jiska samay aa gaya hai
englishDialogue: No power in this world can stop a thought whose time has arrived

dialogue: Main is dharti ke mitti ke ek kann ke liye bhi marne ko taiyaar hoon
englishDialogue: I'm ready to die even for one small particle of this land's soil

dialogue: Main bhi tumhare saath chalungi ... sukh mein peeche rahungi aur dukh mein aage aa jaungi
englishDialogue: Even I'll come with you ... I'll stay behind you in your moments of happiness and I'll come in front of you in your moments of sadness

dialogue: Soorma wohi hai bade joh har haal mein lade ... sar hatheli par lekar chale ... dharam unka hai veerta, karam unka hai veerta ... jeet ya haar hogi yeh sochte nahi
englishDialogue: A brave person is someone who fights under any condition ... he's someone who walks with his death in his hand ... bravery is his faith and duty ... and they don't think whether they'll win or lose

dialogue: HIV positive, TB positive, Malaria positive ... yeh medical line na eklauti line hai jismein positive ka matlab bad news hota hai
englishDialogue: HIV positive, TB positive, Malaria positive ... the medical field is the only field in which positive means bad news

dialogue: Har ek friend zaroori hota hai ... par sirf apni zaroorat dekhne wala friend na ... friend nahi hota
englishDialogue: Every friend is important ... but a friend who looks only for his own interest ... isn't a friend

dialogue: Joh decision ek minute mein nahi hota ... woh decision hi nahi hota
englishDialogue: A decision that is not taken in a minute ... that decision is not even a decision to begin with

dialogue: Hindustan aatank se nahi ... aatank Hindustan se darega
englishDialogue: India won't fear terrorism ... terrorism will fear India

dialogue: Tumne hamara balidaan dekha hai ... ab badla bhi dekhoge
englishDialogue: You've seen our sacrifice ... now you'll also see our revenge

dialogue: Inke liye ek pariwar hi Hindustan hai ... aur mere liye Hindustan hi mera pariwar hai
englishDialogue: For them, one family is India ... and for me, India is my family

dialogue: Joh desh ko chahte hai ... woh aur kuch nahi chahte
englishDialogue: Those who love their country ... they don't love anything else

dialogue: Jeetne ka maza tab aata hai jab sab aapke haarne ki umeed karte hai
englishDialogue: The real joy of winning comes only when everyone is expecting you to lose

dialogue: Modi ek insaan nahi ... ek soch hai
englishDialogue: Narendra Modi is not a person ... he's a thought

dialogue: Aaj ke doobte huye suraj ke andhere se main nahi darta ... kal ka ughta hua suraj aasman ko phir se kesariya bana dega
englishDialogue: I don't fear the darkness created by today's setting sun ... because tomorrow's rising sun will turn the skies orange again

dialogue: Jis rang ki goli mujhe chhuke guzregi ... woh rang is desh se hamesha ke liye mitt jayega
englishDialogue: The colour of the bullet that will leave touching me ... that colour will be erased from this country forever

dialogue: Aadmi ki taqat aur uski himmat, uski chaati kitne inch ki hai isse tay nahi ki jaati ... uski taqat hoti hai uske dimaag mein
englishDialogue: The size of a person's chest in inches doesn't define his strength or courage ... a person's strength lies in his mind

dialogue: Main sahi hoon ya galat iska faisla aap nahi desh ki janta karegi ... kyun ki sabse upar main ek hi adalat ko maanta hoon ... aur woh hai janta ki adalat
englishDialogue: The people of this country will decide if I'm right or wrong and not you ... because I only believe in one court ... and that's the court of the people

dialogue: Bheekh maange se acha hai gunda banke apna haq cheenna
englishDialogue: It's better to snatch your right like a goon rather than begging for it

dialogue: Mere hisaab se do hi loktantra hai ... ek woh jis mein sehna hai, chup rehna hai ... ya woh jis mein sehna nahi hai, kehna hai
englishDialogue: According to me there are two types of democracy ... one in which you bear the pain and keep quiet ... and other in which you don't bear the pain, and instead speak

dialogue: Marathi manus ghaati hoga lekin ghatiya nahi
englishDialogue: A Maharashtrian can be rowdy, but he can't be evil

dialogue: Udta teer backside ghuste bahut baar dekha be ... pehli baar udta backside teer mein ghusega
englishDialogue: I've seen a flying arrow enter into one's backside many times ... but for the first time a flying backside will enter into an arrow

dialogue: Aaj ke zamane mein mard hona hi ek tragedy hai, tragedy ... apne mummy ke saamne wife se pyar se baat karo toh joru ka ghulam ... wife ke saamne mummy se pyar se baat karo toh maa ke pallu se banda hua ... apne bachon ko maaro toh nirdayi ... aur kuch na kaho toh laparwah ... poore din ghar ke bahar raho toh aawara .. ghar ke andar behto toh naakara ... apni Mrs. se job na karao toh shakki ... aur karvao toh biwi ki kamai khane wala ... yehi ladies ko by mistake haath bhi lag jaye toh hum zalim ... aur yehi ladies apunko peete toh hum nalle
englishDialogue: It's a tragedy to be a man in today's world ... if you talk with your wife with love in front of your mother, then you're called a wife's slave ... if you talk with your mother with love in front of your wife, then you're called a mama's boy ... if you beat your kids, then you're called a cruel person ... and if you don't say anything to them, then you're called a careless person ... if you stay all day out of the house, then you're called a vagrant person ... and if you sit in the house all day, then you're called a useless person ... if you don't allow your wife to work, then you're called a suspicious person ... and if you allow your wife to work, then you're called a person who lives on his wife's money ... if you happen to even touch a woman by mistake, then you're called an evil person ... and if a woman beats us, then we're called a weak man

dialogue: Yeh roz subah jaldi uthte hai murge ki tarah ... phir aada adhoora khate hai kauve ki tarah ... phir breakfast karte hai bandar ki tarah ... phir office ko daudte hai ghode ki tarah ... phir kaam karte hai gadhe ki tarah ... phir ghar aakar daru peete hai machli ki tarah ... phir mujhpe bhaunkte hai kutte ki tarah ... phir khana khate hai magarmach ki tarah ... aur uske baad taange phaila ke soo jaate hai bhainso ki tarah ... dekho kaise ghoor rahe hai ulle ki tarah
englishDialogue: He wakes up early everyday like a cock ... then he eats little bit here and there like a crow ... then he eats breakfast like a monkey ... then he runs to the office like a horse ... then he works like a donkey ... then he comes homes and drinks alcohol like a fish ... then he barks on me like a dog ... then he eats dinner like a crocodile ... then after that he spreads his legs and sleeps like a buffalo ... and now look, he's staring at me like an owl

dialogue: Bhuji ko raakh kehte hai, jali ko aag kehte hai ... jisne tumhe bachaya usse Lallan ka dimaag kehte hai
englishDialogue: Burning flames is called as fire and after burning what's left is called as ash ... the thing that has saved you is called as the brain of Lallan

dialogue: Apun toh bolta hai Goa chal ... mast faadu jagah hai ... udhar tikane ka tequila ... disco mein hilane ka patila
englishDialogue: Let's go to Goa ... it's a great place ... over there we'll drink tequila ... and we'll shake our leg in the disco

dialogue: Yeh world hai na world, is mein do tarah ke log hote hai ... ek joh saari zindagi ek hi kaam karte rehte hai ... aur doosre joh ek hi zindagi mein saare kaam kar dete hai
englishDialogue: In this world, there are two types of people ... one who do a single thing in all their life ... and second who do all the things in a single life

dialogue: Dil ne aap ko bhi dard diya hai ... dil ne hum mein bhi bahut dard diya hai ... kyun na milkar aaj is dil ko thoda dard diya jaye
englishDialogue: The heart has given you pain ... the heart has also given me a lot of pain ... why don't we get together and give the heart some pain today

dialogue: Madam ... I am your only Adam
englishDialogue: Madam ... I am your only Adam

dialogue: Yeh world hai na world, is mein do tarah ke log hote hai ... pehle jinke paise ekhatte ho jaate hai ... aur doosre jinke paise kabhi ekhatte nahi hote
englishDialogue: In this world, there are two types of people ... one who accumulate all the money they want ... and others who don't have a limit to what they can accumulate

dialogue: Upar waale sachche badshah di courier service lagi hai ... jab jisko kuch chahiye hota hai na ... bhej deta hai
englishDialogue: God has his own courier service ... whenever someone needs something ... he sends it

dialogue: Yeh world hai na world, is mein do tarah ke log hote hai ... ek joh sirf sunte hai aur doosre joh sirf bolte hai
englishDialogue: In this world, there are two types of people ... one who only listen and others who only talk

dialogue: You can kiraaye pe lease it
englishDialogue: You can lease it on a lease

dialogue: Yeh world hai na world, is mein do tarah ke log hote hai ... ek joh saari zindagi school college mein time kharab karte hai ... aur doosre joh khud apna school hote hai
englishDialogue: In this world, there are two types of people ... one who waste their entire life in school and college ... and others who are a school for themselves
