dialogue: Pyar mein itni taqat hai ki duniya bhar ka paisa bhi uske samne gareeb hai
englishDialogue: Love has so much power that all the money of the world together is still poor in front of it

dialogue: Paise kamane aur bade banane ki aad mein ... hum sab ne hamara bachpana, hamari innocence, hamari saadgi kahin kho di hai
englishDialogue: In the rush to earn money and become big ... we all have lost our childishness, our innocence, our simplicity somewhere

dialogue: Pyar ek bhavna hai jisse tola nahi jaa sakta
englishDialogue: Love is an emotion which can't be measured

dialogue: Apne andar ke darr ko khatam kardo ... toh sab kuch aasaan ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: Kill the fear that lives within you ... and everything will become easy

dialogue: Insaan ka dimaag kab kis waqt kya kar behte ... bhagwan bhi nahi samajh sakta
englishDialogue: What a human brain can do and at what time ... even God can't understand that

dialogue: Ladke sirf do hi condition mein raat bhar jaagte hai ... ya toh India Pakistan ka final ho ... ya toh phir kisi ladki ke saath ho
englishDialogue: Guys stay awake in the night only on two conditions ... either there is a India vs Pakistan final (match) ... or else if he is with a girl

dialogue: Khoobsurati ki tareef na ho ... toh khoobsurati ki tauheen kehlati hai
englishDialogue: If you don't praise beauty ... then it's like giving disrespect to beauty

dialogue: Woh maut bhi kitni haseen hogi ... apne janaze ke paas dus barah kudiyan namkeen hogi
englishDialogue: How beautiful will that death be ... when there will be 10 to 12 beautiful girls at my funeral

dialogue: Your first time should be with someone special ... pata hai kyun? ... (kyun) ... kyun ki tum usse kabhi nahi bhula paogi ... aur agar tumhara first time kisi idiot ke saath hoga ... toh zindagi bhar us idiot yaad rakhna padega
englishDialogue: Your first time should be with someone special ... you know why? ... (why) ... because you'll never forget him ... and if your first time is with some idiot ... then you'll have to remember that idiot for your entire life

dialogue: I want to be a part of every part of your life
englishDialogue: I want to be a part of every part of your life

dialogue: Men ... jitna chota dil, utna chota dimaag ... utna chota sab kuch
englishDialogue: Men ... the smaller their heart is, that much smaller their mind is ... and that much smaller is everything else

dialogue: Kutta jab gaadi ke peeche bhaagta hai toh ... usko gaadi khareedni hai yah chalani hoti hai?
englishDialogue: When a dog runs behind a car then ... does he want to buy the car or drive it?

dialogue: Meri toh har raat suhaag raat hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every night of mine is a nuptial night

dialogue: Jab ek aurat se itna dukh utha liya ... toh doosri aurat se thoda sa sukh uthana yaar
englishDialogue: Since you've taken so much grief from one woman ... hence take a little bit of enjoyment from another woman

dialogue: Aapka dimaag cassette ki tarah dono taraf chalta hai ... A side bhi, B side bhi
englishDialogue: Your mind works from both sides like a cassette ... from A side, and from B side

dialogue: Be positive yaar
englishDialogue: Be positive pal

dialogue: Haste huye chehre ka gham padhna kitna mushkil hota hai
englishDialogue: It is hard to read the sadness behind a smiling face

dialogue: Roz sach bolta hoon toh pitai ... aaj pehli baar jhoot bola toh mithai
englishDialogue: Everyday I said the truth and I was beaten ... and today I lied for the first time and I got a sweet

dialogue: Badminton court jao, tennis court jao, food court jao ... lekin woh court mat jaana
englishDialogue: Go to a badminton court, tennis court, food court ... but don't go to the real court

dialogue: Woh na pichle janam mein sudhra tha, na is janam mein sudhra hai, na agle janam mein sudhrega
englishDialogue: He did not improve in his last life, he has not improved in this life, and he will not improve in his next life

dialogue: Aapki har baat paison se shuru hoti hai ... aur paison par khatam hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every point of yours starts with money ... and ends with money

dialogue: Jahan munafa na ho ... wahan bilkul waqt barbad nahi karna chahiye
englishDialogue: Where there is no profit ... we must not waste any time over there

dialogue: Tumhe dekhkar mera badan sizzler ki tarah hot ho jaata hai ... ice cream ki tarah pighalta hai ... boiled ande ki tarah ubalta hai
englishDialogue: On seeing you my body becomes hot like a sizzler ... melts like an ice cream ... boils like a boiled egg

dialogue: Pehle bath phir saath ... hum aur tum din raat, din raat, din raat
englishDialogue: First take a bath then we will be together ... you and me day and night, day and night, day and night

dialogue: Is tarah tumhara take care karoonga ... ki tum mujhe hamesha ke liye apna caretaker banaogi
englishDialogue: I'll take care of you in such a way that ... you'll make me your caretaker forever

dialogue: Jinke apne bistar doosron ke ghar laga karte hai ... woh teesron ke ghar ki chaddar gina nahi karte
englishDialogue: Those who sleep on beds in other people's house ... they don't count the bedsheets in a third person's house

dialogue: Tum jeeyo hazaron saal aur saal ke din ho pachaas hazar ... aur raatein ho ek lakh pachaas hazar
englishDialogue: May you live a 1000 years and may every year have 50,000 days ... and may every year have 150,000 nights

dialogue: Ek phool do maali ... din paali ki raat paali
englishDialogue: One flower and two gardener's ... one for the day and one for the night

dialogue: To understand you ... the elephant wear underwear ... easy
englishDialogue: It is easier for the elephant to wear an underwear ... than making you understand

dialogue: Jeevan mein kabhi kabhi aaisa waqt aata hai ... jab aapko apne zindagi mein sabse pyari cheez aur zimmedariyo ke beech mein chunana padta hai
englishDialogue: In life sometimes a time comes ... when you have to choose between your most beloved thing and your responsibilities

dialogue: Bhere izz my passport and biza
englishDialogue: Where is my passport and visa

dialogue: Main perfect nahi hoon, tum perfect nahi ho aur zindagi kabhi perfect nahi hogi ... par tum mere liye hamesha perfect hogi
englishDialogue: I am not perfect, you are not perfect and life will never be perfect ... but you will always be perfect for me

dialogue: Rehna hai raho, jaana hai jao ... I don't give a crocodile's ass
englishDialogue: Stay or leave, it's your wish ... I don't give a crocodile's ass

dialogue: Maan na maan ... no mehmaan
englishDialogue: Whether you accept it or not ... I want no guests

dialogue: Yeh koi Hindustani sulabh shauchalay nahi ... jahan bandh hone waali cheez khulti nahi aur khulne waali cheez bandh nahi hoti
englishDialogue: This is not an Indian toliet ... where the thing that is supposed to close does not open and the thing that is supposed to open does not close

dialogue: I don't the trust Indians ... (sorry) ... eggjactly
englishDialogue: I don't trust the Indians ... (sorry) ... exactly

dialogue: Sachchai recipes ki tarah hoti hai ... kuch batane mein mazaa hai, kuch chupane mein
englishDialogue: Truth is like recipes ... there is some fun in disclosing it, and some fun in hiding it

dialogue: When in the Rome ... do the Romans
englishDialogue: When in Rome ... do as the Romans do

dialogue: You are wanting the Dundee daddies to giving you the spanking on your the bums
englishDialogue: Do you want the Dundee daddy to spank you on your bums

dialogue: Wife working ... husband jerking
englishDialogue: Wife working ... husband jerking

dialogue: Funny guy, senses of humor ... I like that
englishDialogue: Funny guy, good sense of humor ... I like that

dialogue: Laaton ke bhoot baaton se nahi maante ... "Ghosts of the kicks not listening to the talks"
englishDialogue: People who can only understand the language of beatings cannot be counselled by words

dialogue: Do tarah ke Indians hote hai ... ek jinpe tum bharaso nahi kar sakte ... aur doosre jinhe tum bardaasht nahi kar sakte
englishDialogue: There are two types of Indians ... one on whom you cannot depend ... and other are whom you cannot tolerate

dialogue: Inke logic ka joh switch hai na woh hamesha off rehta hai ... aur agar galati se kabhi on bhi ho gaya ... toh regulator joh hai na hamesha zero pe hi rehta hai
englishDialogue: Their logic switch is always off ... and if by mistake it turns on ... then the regulator always stays on zero

dialogue: Mujhe joh sahi lagta hai main karta hoon ... woh chahe bhagwan ke khilaaf ho, samaaj ke khilaaf ho, police, kanoon ... yah phir poore system ke khilaaf kyun na ho
englishDialogue: I do what I feel is right ... whether it is against God, against the society, police, law ... or it may be against the whole system

dialogue: Nazdiki fayda dekhne se pehle ... door ka nuksaan sochna chahiye
englishDialogue: Before you claim the shorterm profit ... you should think about the longterm loss

dialogue: Jiske paas power hai ... uska wrong bhi right ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: The one who has the power ... even his wrong becomes the right

dialogue: Main kisiko soochne se nahi ... karne se rokta hoon
englishDialogue: I don't stop anyone from thinking ... I stop them from doing

dialogue: Sarkar ek system hai jisme janta bhi ek hissa hai
englishDialogue: Government is one system within which people are one part

dialogue: Aadmi ko maarne se pehle ... uski sooch ko maarna zaroori hai
englishDialogue: Before you kill a person ... it is important to kill his thinking

dialogue: Koi bhi faisla chunaav se hona chahiye ... dabaav se nahi
englishDialogue: Any decision should be made with choice ... not with pressure

dialogue: Taqat logon ko jodhne se badhti hai ... unhe khilaaf karne se nahi
englishDialogue: Strength grows when people are together ... not by making them against each other

dialogue: Nahin karoonga main ... aur suno, tujhe bhi karne nahin doonga
englishDialogue: I won't do it ... and listen, I won't let you do it either

dialogue: Silver Mani light matters mein comedy karte hai ... serious matters mein murder
englishDialogue: Silver Mani does comedy in light matters ... and murder in serious matters

dialogue: Shareer keval aatma ka pratibimb hota hai
englishDialogue: The body is only the reflection of the soul

dialogue: Yeh Superman, Batman aur Spiderman ka baap malum hai kaun hai? ... Hanuman
englishDialogue: Do you know who is the father of Superman, Batman and Spiderman? ... Hanuman

dialogue: Main har ghadi, har minute, har second paise kamana chahta hoon
englishDialogue: I want to make money every moment, every minute, every second

dialogue: Dhanda karneka toh ekdum hatela ... pan kya karega kismat hai na phatela
englishDialogue: If you do any business then it must be very unique ... but what to do my luck is torn

dialogue: Koi insaan mahan nahi hota ... mahan hoti hai chunautiyan ... jab ek aam insaan unhe sweekar kare ... tab woh bada kehlata hai
englishDialogue: No one person is great ... challenges are great ... and when a normal person accepts these challenges ... then he is called someone big

dialogue: Shopping karne gaye the yah shoplifting?
englishDialogue: Did you guys go for shopping or shoplifting?

dialogue: Shraddha ka toh supermarket hai hamara desh ... jiska basement andh-shraddha ke parking se full hai
englishDialogue: Our country is a supermarket of faith ... whose basement parking is full of faithlessness

dialogue: Samaaj, mazhab, sab apni jagah hai ... lekin pyar sabse upar hai
englishDialogue: Society, religion, everything is in it's place ... but above all of this is love

dialogue: Main seedhe sadhe dhang se kehta hoon apni baat ... ek ghar basana chahta hoon main tumhare saath ... kya dogi mere haathon mein bolo tum apna haath
englishDialogue: I'll say my point in a straight manner ... I want to settle down in a home with you ... tell me if you'll give your hand in my hand

dialogue: Yeh meri zindagi hai ... mera faisla hai!
englishDialogue: It's my life ... it's my decision!

dialogue: Yeh duniya bati hui hai dharam ke naam par, desh ke naam par, rang ke naam par, jaat ke naam par ... par yeh woh sarhaden hai jise insaan ne kheenchi hui hai ... lekin in sabse upar hai woh jise insaan ne nahi uparwaale ne banaya hai ... pyar
englishDialogue: This world is distributed in the name of religion, in the name of country, in the name of colour, in the name of caste ... and these are those boundaries that humans have made ... but bigger than all of this is what god has made and not humans ... that is love

dialogue: Main toh sirf ek sipahi hoon jisne maut ko itne kareeb se dekha hai ki ... zindagi ke har pal ki keemat jaan gaya hoon
englishDialogue: I am just a soldier who has seen death from so close ... that I now know the value of every moment in life

dialogue: Jung marke nahi, maarke jeeti jaati hai
englishDialogue: A war is won by killing, not by dying

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi kayar ki shakal ... bahadur ki akal se zyada sahi hoti hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes the face of a coward person ... is better than the mind of a brave person

dialogue: Har sipahi ki zindagi mein aaisa waqt zaroor aata hai ... jab usse apni duty se zyada apni aatma ki awaaz sunni padti hai
englishDialogue: In the life of every soldier there comes definitely a moment ... when he has to listen more to the voice of his soul rather than his duty

dialogue: Jab jazbaaton ki aandhi gher leti hai ... tab aadmi duniya bhool jaata hai
englishDialogue: When the storm of emotions surround you ... then a person forgets about the world

dialogue: Pyar mein chemistry hoti hai aur sex mein physics
englishDialogue: In love there is chemistry and in sex there is physics

dialogue: Har sapna toh sach nahi hota hai na ... kuch sapne aankh khulte hi hamesha ke liye toot jaate hai
englishDialogue: Every dream doesn't come true ... some dreams break forever when your eyes open

dialogue: Koi bhi ladki apna pehla pyar kabhi nahi bhool sakti
englishDialogue: No girl can forget her first love

dialogue: Hasna hasana agar apni limit cross kar de ... toh sari zindagi ek mazaak ban jaati hai
englishDialogue: If jokes cross their limits ... then the whole life becomes a joke

dialogue: Kala aadmi ko bahut kuch deti hai ... lekin TDS bhi poora kaat leti hai
englishDialogue: Talent gives a lot to a person ... but it also deducts proper taxes for it

dialogue: Kuch cheezein adhoori hone ki wajah se hi toh poori hoti hai
englishDialogue: Some things are complete only because they're incomplete

dialogue: Time time ki baat hai, kabhi din hai kabhi raat hai ... khatam ho jaye joh coffee ke bina, woh mulaqat koi mulaqat hai
englishDialogue: Things change from time to time, it's day at times and it's night at times ... a meeting that ends without coffee, is not a meeting at all

dialogue: Shaadi ke pehle pyar bahut zaroori hai ... kyun ki shaadi ek gaadi ki tarah hai ... jitna zyada chalao utna better andaza hota hai ki kab dhakka dekar start karna hai
englishDialogue: Love before marriage is very important ... because marriage is like a car ... the more you drive it, the more better you understand as to when you have to push it to start it

dialogue: Maane ki kasai se dosti karne se murgi nahi bachti ... par kasai apna dost ho toh kam se kam pyar se murgi toh katti hai
englishDialogue: I agree that a chicken cannot be saved by befriending a butcher ... but if the butcher is our friend then atleast the chicken is slaughtered with ease

dialogue: Plane time par hai, economy ki seat hai ... badlo bhes aur chalo pardes
englishDialogue: The plane is on time, the seat is economy ... change your appearance and let's go to a foreign country

dialogue: To win matches you have to take great catches
englishDialogue: To win matches you have to take great catches

dialogue: Iodex lagane se theek hoti hai moch, B-Tex lagane se theek hoti hai khujli ... dil lagane nikle joh pati, usse maarke current gira deti hai bijli
englishDialogue: A sprain can be cured by applying Iodex (ointment), itching can be cured by applying B-Tex (cream) ... the husband who tries to flirt, will fall down with a current from the electricity

dialogue: Dhood ke phatne se banti hai malai ... suit ke phatne se hoti hai silai ... bhoot ke darr se phatte jiski, uski toh rab hi kare bhalai
englishDialogue: Cream is made by boiling milk ... stitching is done when a dress tears ... the one who is scared of a ghost, god only save him

dialogue: Dhoodh ka mazaa tab aata hai jab us mein ho elaichi, badam aur pista ... jab dil se dil mil jaate hai toh ban jaata hai bhai behen ka rishta
englishDialogue: You enjoy milk when it has green cardamom, almonds and pistachios ... when a heart connects with a heart then a relationship of brother and sister is formed

dialogue: Yeh andha kanoon likhega kab tak meri kahani ... ek haath mein yeh kaala coat, doosre mein jawani
englishDialogue: Until when will this blind law write my story ... in one hand I have this black coat, and my youth in the other

dialogue: Kya farak padta hai Daler ho ya Udhas ... show ka mazaa aayega jab aap ho hamare paas
englishDialogue: What difference does it make whether it's Daler Mehndi or Pankaj Udhas ... the show will be fun when you are with me

dialogue: Shaadi actually bilkul chicken masale ki tarah hai ... table pe sajane se pehle chak lo ... toh pata chal jaata hai ki chicken kitna naram hai aur kitna garam
englishDialogue: Marriage is just like chicken masala ... if you taste it before putting it on the table ... then you come to know how soft and warm the chicken is

dialogue: Shaadi salwar kameez ke suit ki tarah hoti hai ... khareedne se pehle try karna chahiye yeh dekhne ke liye ki suit kitni hoti hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is like a salwar kameez dress ... before buying it you should try it to see how much does it suit you

dialogue: Is Madhuri ke saath ek do teen karne ka mauka mile na ... toh koi ek kya, do teen biwiyon ko bhi dokha dede
englishDialogue: If I get a chance to do 1, 2, 3 (dance) with this Madhuri ... then forget one, I'll even cheat two or three wives

dialogue: Jodiyan banana toh upar waale ka kaam hai ... lekin unhe salamat rakhna neeche waale ka kaam hai
englishDialogue: It is duty of god to make couples ... but it is the duty of humans to protect them

dialogue: Mera jaisa chocolate hero action thodi na karega ... entry maroonga late, tab tak action karega mera duplicate
englishDialogue: A chocolate hero like me won't do action ... I'll enter late, and until then my duplicate will do the action

dialogue: Agar meri jagah koi Laxman Prasad bhi hota ... toh is Rekha ke saath laxman rekha paar kar deta
englishDialogue: Even if it was Laxman Prasad instead of me ... he would have crossed the limits with this Rekha

dialogue: Tu jab bhi aaise hasa hai ... hum mein se koi na koi phasa hai
englishDialogue: Whenever you have laughed like this ... someone amongst us has been in trouble

dialogue: Jab dhoonde mard biwi ke saath bahar waali ko rakhne ka bahana ... toh reh jaata hai bilkul akela holding a banana
englishDialogue: When a husband looks for a reason to keep a mistress along with a wife ... then he is left all alone holding a banana

dialogue: Chaukidar kare chaukidari, wafaadari toh kutta bhi karta hai ... joh kare biwi se bewafai, usse wafaa toh kutta bhi nahi karta hai
englishDialogue: A watchman is the one who guards, because even a dog is loyal ... the one who cheats his wife, even a dog doesn't remain loyal to him

dialogue: Daag jaisa ho kameez pe, woh nikalta hai Nirma ya Rin se ... joh aaya hai karke mooh kala, woh nikalta hai dustbin se
englishDialogue: No matter what mark is there on the shirt, it comes out with Nirma or Rin ... the one who does bad things, he comes out from a dustbin

dialogue: Jaise kamino ki pechaan jail mein piste hue chakki ko hoti hai ... vaise apne jijo ki pehchaan Lakhwinder Singh Lakha urf Lucky ko hoti hai
englishDialogue: Just like the grinder grinding in the jail recognizes rascals ... just like that Lakhwinder Singh Lakha aka Lucky recognizes his brother-in-laws

dialogue: Eent ka jawab patthar ... gudh ka jawab shakkar ... aur sajan ko sabak sikhana ho toh chalao dooja chakkar
englishDialogue: A stone is the reply to a brick ... sugar is the reply to jaggery ... and if you want to teach your lover a lesson then flirt around with someone else

dialogue: Katghare mein khada yeh aadmi ek aaisa pati hai ... jiska bas chalta toh shaadi ke din apne patni ko mangalsutra ka dhaaga nahi, Kamasutra ki copy deta ... joh chahta hai ki har subah uski patni Ramayan ka paath nahi, vatsyayan ka paath pade
englishDialogue: This person standing in the paling is such a husband ... who if had the control then he would have given his wife a copy of the Kamasutra on their wedding day, and not a wedding necklace ... who wishes that his wife reads a lesson of erotica every morning, and not a lesson of Ramayana

dialogue: Jab ghar pe ho sakta hai zukaam ka ilaaj toh kyun dhoonde kisi doctor ka address ... ki farak penda hai ki ilaaj kare Munnabhai ya M.B.B.S
englishDialogue: Why should we find a doctor's address when we can cure the cold in the house ... what difference does it make whether Munnabhai does the treatment or a M.B.B.S (Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery)

dialogue: Honi ko kaun taal sakta hai ... joh hona hai wohi hoga ... bachche ke diaper jitne bhi badalo ... geela toh woh karega bichauna
englishDialogue: Who can stop what's going to happen ... what's going to happen will happen ... no matter how many diapers you change of a child ... he will still wet the bed

dialogue: Gaye the dubane Titanic par na duba sake ek bhi naiyya ... misaal hi maarte reh gaye hamare Lucky bhaiya
englishDialogue: He went to drown the Titanic but he couldn't even drown a boat ... our brother Lucky was just left giving examples

dialogue: Shaadi ek mango ki tarah hoti hai ... waqt se pehle pak jaye toh baad mein ras ke bajaye aachaar banana padta hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is like a mango ... if it ripes before time then later instead of pulp you have to make pickle

dialogue: Shaadi ek sandal ki tarah hoti hai ... pehle se agar woh ghis jaye toh baad mein sirf maarne ke kaam aati hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is like a sandal ... if it tears beforehand then later it can only be useful for beating

dialogue: Choona jamke padna chahiye, chahe paan ho Banaras ya Kolkate ka ... saboot tagda hona chahiye, chahe thank you bolna pade kisi bhi ullu de pathe da
englishDialogue: The lime paste must be applied properly, be it a betel leaf of Banaras or Kolkata ... the evidence should be strong, even if you have to say thank you to a fool

dialogue: Shaadi ek nariyal ki tarah hoti hai ... pehle se hi malai kha lo toh baad mein sirf pani reh jaata hai
englishDialogue: Marriage is like a coconut ... if you eat the cream beforehand then only the water remains

dialogue: Gas ho jaye khatam toh jala lo chula ... shehar mein swayamvar kyun kare jab bagal mein ho dulha
englishDialogue: If the gas is over then burn the grill ... why should we have the wedding in the city when the bridegroom is next to us

dialogue: Is Dimple ke dimples dekhkar ... pyar ki acting karna aur bhi simple ho gaya
englishDialogue: Looking at the dimples of this Dimple ... it's become easy to act in love

dialogue: Raat ko halwa khakar karenge jalwa ... aur raat ko phir ice-cream khakar ... I scream then you scream
englishDialogue: In the night we'll eat a dessert and do crazy things ... then again we'll eat ice-cream in the night and ... I'll scream and then you scream

dialogue: Ek mahine se toh hai sookha, na jaane kahan saavan ki chhadi hai ... andar khatiya padi hai, bahar khatiya khadi hai
englishDialogue: I have been dry since a month, I don't know where is the stick of rain ... inside there is a bed, and outside I'm in trouble

dialogue: Bahut ho gayi pyar ki acting, bahut gaa liye duet ... ab jis kaam ke liye main tumhe yahan laya hoon na, just do it
englishDialogue: Enough of this acting in love, enough of singing duets ... now the work for which I've brought you here, just do it

dialogue: Titanic kab ki doob chuki hai varna us mein bithakar pyar se bhejta yeh bhaiya ... train ki ticket book ho chuki hai, biwi ghar se nikal de na toh chale jaana karte "Chaiyya Chaiyya"
englishDialogue: The Titanic drowned long time back or else this brother would have seated you with love and sent you in that ... and the ticket of the train has been booked, so if your wife throws you out from the house then go in it dancing on the "Chaiyya Chaiyya" song

dialogue: When Spiderman is here ... have no fear
englishDialogue: When Spiderman is here ... have no fear

dialogue: Jab cycle pe behto ho toh chalana padta hai pedal ... agar duniya mein aaye ho toh punya karo, ki fayda cheque aur medal
englishDialogue: When you sit on a cycle then you have to pedal ... if you have come in this world then do good things, and why bother about a cheque or a medal

dialogue: Jiski ek biwi uska bhi bada naam hai ... washing machine ghar te lalo, te dhobi da ki kaam hai
englishDialogue: The one who has one wife is also famous ... if you bring a washing machine home, then why do you need a laundryman

dialogue: Yeh ghar hai ya veerana ... na aadmi, na uski jaat ka thikana
englishDialogue: Is this a house or ruins ... neither there is a person, nor are there any signs of someone

dialogue: Hum sab panchi ek dhaal ke ... dhaage ek rumaal ke ... dimple ek gaal ke
englishDialogue: We all are birds on a single branch ... threads of the same napkin ... dimple of one cheek

dialogue: Sita Ram, Radhe Kishan yeh misaalen hai bhagwan ki ... insaano ki agar deni hai misaal toh dena Shaadi No. 1 ki
englishDialogue: Sita Ram, Radhe Kishan are examples of gods ... but if you want to give an example of humans then give of Marriage No. 1

dialogue: Aaj raviwar hai is liye tum log bach gaye ho ... lekin yeh na samjho ki roz Sunday hai ... aaj Ghasitaram ke pedhe khalo ... kal se toh khane Lakhwinder ke dande hai
englishDialogue: Since it's Sunday today you guys are saved ... but don't understand that everyday is a Sunday ... today eat the sweets from Ghasitaram ... since from tomorrow you have to take the beatings from Lakhwinder

dialogue: Gareeb aadmi ko na ungli nahi karne ka sahab
englishDialogue: Sir, you should never provoke a poor man

dialogue: Mann bairaagi, tann anuragi, kadam kadam dushwari hai ... jeevan jeena sahal na jaano bahut badi fankari hai ... auron jaise hokar bhi hum ba-izzat hai basti mein ... kuch logon ka seedhapan hai, kuch apni aiyaari hai
englishDialogue: The heart is ascetic, the body is passionate, there's difficulty at every step ... living life isn't easy, it's an artistry ... being like everyone we still have a lot of honour in our settlement ... that's due to a little bit of simplicity of people and a little bit of our slyness

dialogue: Surveillance mein listening is a fine art
englishDialogue: In surveillance, listening is a fine art

dialogue: Jab aapke paas options ho aur aap confuse hai ki aapko karna kya hai ... toss karlo ... kyun ki sikka jab hawa mein hota hai, ek pal aisa aata hai jab aapko ekdum clear ho jaata hai ... ki actually aapko kya chahiye
englishDialogue: When you have options and when you're confused with what you should do ... then go for a toss ... because when the coin is in the air, then a moment comes when you become absolutely clear ... about what actually you need to do

dialogue: Jeetne se zyada ladna zaroori thehra
englishDialogue: It's more important to fight rather than winning

dialogue: Agar aapka bhi meter chalu aur batti gul ... toh aao milkar bajaye bigul
englishDialogue: If even your meter is on and your electricity is out ... then come let's create a commotion together

dialogue: Main doosron ki tarah safed kapde pehenke haath jodkar tamasha dekhne wala na hoon ab ... kaale kapde pehenke SPTL ki naak mein dum karne wala thehra
englishDialogue: I'm not going to wear white clothes and watch the entertainment like others ... now I'm going to wear black clothes and ruin the activities of the SPTL electric company

dialogue: Nateejon ki sochke faisle lena hamari fitrat nahi hai ... nateeje hamare faislo se badal jaaye karte hai
englishDialogue: It's not my habit to take a decision thinking about the outcome ... the outcomes change themselves based on my decisions

dialogue: Joh joh unke nikat hota hai na ... samajh lo uski jeb mein death ka ticket hota hai
englishDialogue: Whoever is close to him ... they have a ticket to death in their pocket

dialogue: Samjhana aise chahiye ... ki samajhne wala samajhne ke liye khada bhi na rahe
englishDialogue: You should explain to someone in such a way that ... the person who needs to understand should not even be capable to stand up after understanding

dialogue: (Ab hum aapke bina jee nahi sakte) - Hum oxygen hai ka?
englishDialogue: (Now I can't live without you) - Am I like oxygen?

dialogue: Ae Munna, jab tumne tamancha chhua bhi nahi tha ... tab se hum top se apna cigarette sulgaya karte the
englishDialogue: Hey boy, when you had not even touched a gun ... since that time I've been lighting my cigarette with a military tank

dialogue: When I'm high ... I don't lie
englishDialogue: When I'm high ... I don't lie

dialogue: Sapno ke saath do hi baatein hoti hai ... ya toh poore hote hai, ya toot jaate hai
englishDialogue: Only two things can happen with dreams ... either they get fulfilled, or they break

dialogue: Main Mohammed Rafi toh nahi ban saka ... lekin tereko Lata Mangeshkar zaroor banaunga
englishDialogue: I wasn't able to become like Mohammed Rafi ... but I'll make you just like Lata Mangeshkar

dialogue: Kabhi kabhi desh aur kanoon ke hitt ke liye ... uske virudh jaakar bhi kuch karna padta hai
englishDialogue: Sometimes for the benefit of the country and law ... one has to go against it as well to get something done

dialogue: Crime ke saath kabaddi khelne jaise hai ... jitna enjoy karogi utna khelogi ... lekin kabaddi ke is khel mein koi na koi toh samne se dum zaroor todhega
englishDialogue: Crime is like the game of kabaddi ... you'll enjoy as much as you play it ... but in this game of kabaddi someone will definitely break lose

dialogue: Agar aaj main khada nahi hua ... toh faisla kabhi nahi hoga
englishDialogue: If I don't stand up today ... then the decision will never be made

dialogue: Ek goli ek dushman ... do gaz ka faasla aur do gaz zameen ... file closed
englishDialogue: One bullet and one enemy ... two yards of distance and two yards of land to bury ... and the file is closed

dialogue: Roses are red, violets are blue ... lovers like me are very few
englishDialogue: Roses are red, violets are blue ... lovers like me are very few

dialogue: I can die without you ... sach-much ... and it's time for smooch
englishDialogue: I can die without you ... it's the truth ... and it's time for a smooch

dialogue: Jawani mein aise pyar bhare kaand karne chahiye ... varna bhudape mein Ganga mein jaake dhoyenge kya
englishDialogue: One must commit to these naughty things of love in their youth ... or else what sins will you erase in the river Ganga in your old age

dialogue: Besharam gende ki behaya khaal ... bina pancho ki chaupal
englishDialogue: You're like the ugly skin of a rowdy rhinoceros ... you're like a gathering without any knowledgeable men

dialogue: Jaise dhoti pehenke koi bhi Gandhi nahi ban jaata hai ... chikni chameli pe dance karne wali koi Katrina nahi ban jaati hai ... waise hi tie, suit, boot, formal pehenke English bolne wala salesman nahi ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: Like anyone can't become Gandhi just by wearing a loincloth ... like anyone can't become Katrina Kaif by dancing on her famous song ... just like that you can't become a salesman just by speaking in English while wearing a tie, a suit and boots

dialogue: Kya kadardano se yeh mehfil khali hai ... na kahin seeti na kahin taali hai
englishDialogue: Doesn't this gathering have people who appreciate ... because I can't hear whistles or clapping

dialogue: Tu jaaye toh woh aaye ... woh aaye toh ho jaaye
englishDialogue: When you go then she'll come ... when she'll come then that will happen

dialogue: Butter utna hi lagao jitna kha paao ... aisa na ki butter lagao aur phisal jaao
englishDialogue: Apply only that amount of butter what you can eat ... or else you'll slip in that butter itself

dialogue: Abhe kabab mein haddi ... chhed wali chaddi
englishDialogue: You're like a bone in the flesh ... and you're like an underwear with a hole

dialogue: Agar tumse koi galati ho gayi hai ... toh us galati ko theek bhi tum hi kar sakte ho
englishDialogue: If you've made a mistake ... then you're the one who can fix that mistake as well

dialogue: Logon se pyar karo ... cheezon se nahi
englishDialogue: Love people ... and not things

dialogue: Asli khoobsurati tareef ki mohtaj nahi hoti ... uske liye toh bas aankhon ki wah wah hi kaafi hai
englishDialogue: True beauty doesn't need appreciation ... just the applause of the eyes is more than enough for it

dialogue: Roti huyi aurat pe aur dhood wale pe kabhi bharosa nahi karna chahiye
englishDialogue: You should never trust a crying woman and a milkman

dialogue: Dil ki har baat sher nahi hoti hai ... kuch lafzon ke zariye apne haal-e-dil bayaan karne ki koshish hoti hai
englishDialogue: Every statement from the heart isn't a poem ... at times it's an attempt to express the condition of your heart through words

dialogue: Jab tak ek bete ko realize hota hai ki uska baap sahi tha ... uska khudka ek beta hota hai joh samajhta hai ki woh galat hai
englishDialogue: By the time a son realizes that his father was right ... till that time he himself has a son who thinks that his father is wrong

dialogue: There are no bad students ... only bad teachers
englishDialogue: There are no bad students ... only bad teachers

dialogue: Aakhir soch soch ki hi toh baat hai ... kyun ki, kyun aur kyun nahi mein bas soch bhar ka hi faasla hai
englishDialogue: It's just a matter of the way one thinks ... because only a thought separates, why and why not

dialogue: Ek aam teacher padhata hai ... ek acha teacher samjhata hai ... bahut acha teacher ho toh khud karke batata hai ... lekin kuch teachers hote hai joh humein inspire karke jaate hai zindagi bhar ke liye
englishDialogue: An ordinary teacher teaches ... a good teacher explains ... a very good teacher shows an example by doing himself ... but there are some teachers who inspire us for the entire life

dialogue: School ke bahar jab zindagi imtihaan leti hai ... toh subject wise nahi leti
englishDialogue: Outside of school when life takes an exam ... then it doesn't do that based on a subject

dialogue: Ek chota sa tudka ... ek chota sa change ... yehi farak hota hai kyun mein aur kyun nahi mein
englishDialogue: Just one small piece ... just one small change ... that's the difference between why and why not

dialogue: Definitely party hard but work harder ... kyun ki aapka aaj hi aapka kal banata hai
englishDialogue: Definitely party hard but work harder ... because your today is what defines your tomorrow

dialogue: Bhagwan ne do hi toh achi cheezein banayi hai ... filmein aur main
englishDialogue: God has created only two good things ... movies and me

dialogue: Pal hasake jaye ya pal rulake jaye ... hamesha yaad rehne chahiye ... kyun ki joh yaad nahi woh pal nahi
englishDialogue: Whether moments of time make you smile or make you cry ... you should always remember them ... because what you don't remember aren't moments of time

dialogue: Rishtey darwazo ki tarah hote hai ... koi naya rishta judhta hai toh darwaze khulte hai ... koi rishta tootta hai toh darwaza bandh ho jaata hai ... par kuch darwaze hum itni zor se bandh karte hai ki woh darasal bandh hi nahi hote ... bas jhoolte reh jaate hai ... aur humein pata bhi nahi chalta par halke se khule reh jaate hai
englishDialogue: Relationships are like doors ... doors open up when a new relationship is formed ... a door closes when a relationship ends ... but we try to close some doors so hard that they end up not being closed ... they just keep swinging around ... and we don't even come to know that they remain slightly open

dialogue: Ishq nahi full-on ishqeria ho gaya tha mujhe
englishDialogue: Not just simple love, I was totally crazy in love

dialogue: Apni lakeeron par itna bharosa mat karo ... yeh kehti kuch aur hai ... aur karti kuch aur
englishDialogue: Don't believe a lot on the lines of your palms ... they say something ... and they do something else

dialogue: Apni aulad ke khatir zindagi toh maa baap de hi dete hai ... lekin aapne toh apni maut tak kurbaan kardi
englishDialogue: Parents do sacrifice their life for the sake of their children ... but you also sacrificed your death

dialogue: Main tenu phir milangi ... shayad ek khayal banke tere mann mein jotrangi ... ya tere mathe di lakeer banke khamosh tenu takhti rawangi ... main tenu phir milangi ... kithe, kis tarah, pata nahi ... main tenu phir milangi
englishDialogue: I'll meet with you again ... may be I'll live in your heart like a thought ... or may be I'll secretly stare at you becoming a destiny line of your forehead ... I'll meet with you again ... where and how, I don't know that ... I'll meet with you again

dialogue: Tu banda na bada sahi hai ... lekin zimmedari ke naam pe na hug deta hai
englishDialogue: You're an awesome guy ... but you always screw up when it comes to responsibilities

dialogue: (Mujhe nahi samajh mein aata yeh kaisa pyar hai aapka) ... Yeh woh wala hai jis mein jitna karo na kam padta hai
englishDialogue: (I don't understand your type of love) ... It's that type in which you always feel that it's less, no matter how much you love

dialogue: (Tum ladkiyon ka samajh mein nahi aata mujhe) ... Ladkiyon ka samajh nahi aata kyun ki ladkiyon ko samjha nahi jaata
englishDialogue: (I can't understand you girls) ... Girls can't be understood because no one understands the girls

dialogue: Duniya aaj bhi ek hi cheez pe kayam hai ... jiski wajah se duniya kayam hai ... pyar
englishDialogue: Even today the world survives on one thing ... it's the reason behind the existence of this world ... and that's love

dialogue: Aaj ek doosre ke saath bura kar loon ... yeh sochke ki isse hamara kal acha hoga ... isse badi bewakoofi is duniya mein nahi ho sakti
englishDialogue: Today let's do something bad for each other ... thinking that it'll make our tomorrow better ... there's nothing more foolish than that in this world

dialogue: Hum kahan rehte hai usse farak nahi padta ... hum kiske saath rehte hai aur woh humein kitna pyar karta hai ... farak isse padta hai
englishDialogue: It doesn't matter where we live ... with whom we live and how much they love us ... that's what matters

dialogue: Woh aashiq ki kya joh mashooq-e-dil ka haal x-ray na kar paaye
englishDialogue: A lover who isn't able to x-ray the condition of his beloved's heart, ain't a lover

dialogue: Roti ka chakka jab kuchalta hai na ... toh sabse pehle moolya, siddhant, kuchle jaate hai
englishDialogue: When the flour mill of bread crushes you ... then it crushes your values and principles first

dialogue: Charitra aadmi ko banata hai ... kapde nahi
englishDialogue: A person is known by his character ... and not by the clothes that he wears

dialogue: Four things are very famous in Banaras ... Banaras ka Ganga, Banaras ka panda, Banaras ka paan aur Banaras ka zabaan
englishDialogue: Four things are very famous in Varanasi ... the river Ganges of Varanasi, the saints of Varanasi, the betel leaf with nut of Varanasi and the language of Varanasi

dialogue: Joh maza Banaras mein ... woh Paris mein na Far East mein
englishDialogue: The enjoyment that you can get in Varanasi ... you won't get that in Paris and neither in the Far East

dialogue: Ek mulk kagaz pe naksho ki lakeeron se nahi badhta ... mulk badhta hai rang se, bhasha se, dharam se, zaat se
englishDialogue: A country doesn't grow by the boundaries it defines on a map ... a country grows with different colours, languages, religions and caste

dialogue: Hum aur woh milke is mulk ko thodi na banate hai ... hum is mulk ko banate hai
englishDialogue: We and them collectively don't form this country ... it's just we together that forms this country

dialogue: Gale lagake sawal poochega, kaleja nikalke haath mein rakh doonga ... ungli uthega poochega na, toh yaad rakhiyega meri jawabdari aap se nahi hai ... apni imaan se hai, apne mulk se hai
englishDialogue: If you embrace me and ask a question, then I'll place my heart in your hand ... but if you raise your finger and ask me a question, then remember that ... I owe the answer only to my faith and my country

dialogue: Bapu apne style mein kanoon todta tha ... aur main apne style mein
englishDialogue: Mahatma Gandhi broke the law in his style ... and I break it in my own style

dialogue: Ek ladki apni izzat bachane ke bajaye bechne pe aa jaaye ... toh woh kisiko bhi khareed sakti hai
englishDialogue: When a woman comes to selling her honour instead of protecting it ... then she can buy anyone she wants

dialogue: Is shaam ka koi nahi hai jawaab ... jab saamne behta ho shabaab ... aur apne haathon se pilaye sharaab
englishDialogue: This evening is awesome ... as a young woman is sitting in front of me ... and she's feeding me a drink with her own hands

dialogue: Sach kabhi nahi jeet'ta ... joh jeet'ta hai wohi sach hota hai
englishDialogue: The truth never wins ... whatever wins becomes the truth

dialogue: Insaan ke shareer mein 206 haddi aur kanoon mein 570 dharayein hai ... main haddiyan bhi todta hoon aur kanoon bhi
englishDialogue: A human body has 206 bones and the law has 570 sections ... I break bones and the law as well

dialogue: Police station aur hospital koi marzi se nahi jaata hai ... ek baar joh pahunch gaya toh uski vaapsi ki guarantee nahi
englishDialogue: No one goes to the police station and hospital at their own wish ... but once someone gets there, then there's no guarantee of their return

dialogue: Jis race se mujhe nikaalne ki baat kar rahe hai yeh bewakoof ... woh nahi jaante hai ... us race ka sikandar main hoon
englishDialogue: The race from which these fools are talking about eliminating me ... they don't know that ... I'm the king of that race

dialogue: Hamare business pe koi nazar daale woh hum mein bardaash nahi ... our business is our business ... none of your business
englishDialogue: We don't tolerate if anyone sets their eyes on our business ... our business is our business ... none of your business

dialogue: Pariwar ke liye agar kisi ki jaan bhi leni pade ... tab bhi hum peeche nahi hatenge
englishDialogue: Even if we have to take someone's life for our family ... then to we won't step back

dialogue: Itihaas ki ek bahut buri aadat hai ... yeh hamesha apne aapko daurata hai
englishDialogue: History has one very bad habit ... it always repeats itself

dialogue: Yeh race zindagi ki race hai ... kisi ki zindagi leke hi khatam hogi
englishDialogue: This race is the race of life ... it'll end only after taking someone's life

dialogue: Gusse mein liya hua decision hamesha nuksaan pahunchata hai ... is liye pehle maine decision liya and now I'm getting angry, very angry
englishDialogue: A decision taken in anger always harms you ... that's why I took the decision first and now I'm getting angry, very angry

dialogue: Hamare business mein dushman jitne kam ho ... utna hi business badta hai
englishDialogue: The fewer the number of enemies we have in our business ... that much more our business grows

dialogue: Yeh zindagi ki race ke jhatke hai ... yeh pehda hone se pehle shuru hote hai ... aur na marne ke baad khatam hote hai
englishDialogue: These are the jerks of the race of life ... they start even before one is born ... and they don't end even after death

dialogue: Jab sher jungle mein shikaar karta hai ... toh pehle woh khud khata hai ... phir usse geedad aur giddh khate hai ... aur joh kuch bacha kucha hota hai usse zameen ke keede makaude khate hai ... aur meri nazar mein teri aukaat keede makaude ki bhi nahi hai
englishDialogue: When a lion hunts in the jungle ... then he himself eats the kill first ... then jackals and vultures eat it ... then the ground insects eat whatever is left ... and in my opinion you're not even an insect

dialogue: Mere baare mein joh bhi suna hoga bura hi suna hoga ... lekin main itna bura nahi hoon ki mere bagal mein khade hone se koi badnaam ho jaaye
englishDialogue: Whatever you must have heard about me, must be evil ... but I'm not that evil, that if someone stands next to me then they'll get defamed

dialogue: I believe only three things can change our lives ... dreams, suffering and love ... pareshaniyon se main nikalke aaya hoon ... sapna main dekh raha hoon ... aur pyar mujhe aksar ho jaata hai
englishDialogue: I believe only three things can change our lives ... dreams, suffering and love ... I've come out of my sufferings ... I'm dreaming at this very moment ... and I often fall in love

dialogue: Jab naam ke alava kuch bacha na ho ... toh naam ko bacha bachake chalna chahiye
englishDialogue: When you have nothing left other than your name ... then you should protect your name as you move forward

dialogue: Zindagi ka maza humne bahut kam liya hai ... ab vapas lauta hoon zindagi bhar ka maza loonga
englishDialogue: I've enjoyed my life very little ... now that I've returned, I'll enjoy for my entire life

dialogue: Hum bheed ke samne nahi khade hote hai ... bheed hamare samne khadi hoti hai
englishDialogue: I don't stand in front of crowds ... crowds stand in front of me

dialogue: Mann chahta hai ke is waqt kuch aisa ho jaye ... ki yeh duniya so jaye ... bas tum aur hum jage rahe ... aur uske baad yeh duniya hamesha soti rahe
englishDialogue: My heart desires that something should happen in this moment ... that the world goes to sleep ... only you and me would be awake ... and after that may this world remain sleeping forever

dialogue: Main sirf sasural se hi shaadi wale din khali haath lauta tha ... varna jiske ghar subah subah pahuncha hoon kuch na kuch nikaal kar hi laya hoon
englishDialogue: I returned empty handed only on my wedding day from my in-laws place ... other than that whoever's house I reach early morning, I've returned with something or the other

dialogue: Is desh ki gareebi ka karan gareeb nahi hai ... unse lootne wale tum jaise baimaan ameer hai
englishDialogue: Poor people are not the reason behind the poverty in this country ... it's the rich people like you who steal from them

dialogue: India mein officers ka nahi, unki biwiyon ka bahadur hona zaroori hai
englishDialogue: In India it's more important for an officer's wife to be courageous, rather than the officer himself

dialogue: Main kisi se nahi darta ... kisi ka bhi darwaza khatkhatane ki himmat rakhta hoon
englishDialogue: I'm not scared of anyone ... I have the courage to knock on anyone's door

dialogue: Insaan aur janwar mein bolne ka nahi, zubaan ka farak hota hai ... aadmi de sakta hai ... janwar de nahi sakta
englishDialogue: The difference between a human and an animal is not of speech, it's about making a promise ... a human can do that ... and an animal can't

dialogue: Sarkari naukar ke liye tohfa rishwat hoti hai
englishDialogue: A gift for a government employee is like a bribe

dialogue: Dosti aur ladki mein hamesha ladki jeet'ti hai
englishDialogue: Between friendship and a girl, the girl always wins

dialogue: Mera na life ka usool hai ... ch*tiye insaan ko kabhi mat batao ki woh ch*tiye hai
englishDialogue: I have this principle in life ... never tell a jerk that he's a jerk

dialogue: Is duniya ke har chu*iye ko lagta hai ki uski wali alag hai ... aur tere mooh se yeh alag hai sunke mujhe yakeen ho gaya hai ki "L" lagne wale hai
englishDialogue: Every crazy lover thinks that his woman is different ... and after listening to this different from your mouth, I'm confident that you're going to get screwed

dialogue: Do saal mein, chaubees mahino mein, 104 hafton mein, 102 hafte rulaya hai isne ... ek hafta per saal ki khushi ka average kaunsi relationship mein hota hai
englishDialogue: Out of 2 years, out of 24 months, out of 104 weeks, she has made you cry 102 weeks ... which relationship has the happiness average of one week per year

dialogue: Bhai pyar mein log andhe ho jaate hai ... ch*tiye nahi ho jaate
englishDialogue: People become blind in love ... but not a jerk

dialogue: Do takke ki jaan lene nau millimeter ki goli nahi ... chappan inch ka jigra chahiye
englishDialogue: You don't need a 9 mm bullet to take a life that's worth only 2 pennies ... you need a 56 inch wide chest

dialogue: Ab tujhe aisi maut maroonga ... ki tu is janam mein jalega ... lekin dard agle janam tak chalega
englishDialogue: Now I'll give you such a death that ... you'll burn in this life ... but the pain will go on till your next life

dialogue: Jako rakhe saiyan maar sake na koi ... par joh maare satya vaste uske sang saiyan hoye
englishDialogue: No one can kill the one who has God on his side ... but the one who kills for truth, God is on his side

dialogue: Ek shapath aapne li thi ... apni vardi, apne farz ke liye ... ek shapath maine li hai baba ... is medal ki khoyi hui izzat lautane ki ... jinhe khakhi pehenne ka haq nahi ... unhe khaak mein milane ki
englishDialogue: You had taken one oath ... for your uniform, for your duty ... I've taken one oath dad ... to bring back the respect that this medal has lost ... and those who don't have the right to wear this uniform ... to destroy them

dialogue: Ghunghat mein ho ya burkhe mein ... is desh mein aurat ko devi maante hai ... aur joh devi ki izzat utaare ... usse hum sare aam maarte hai
englishDialogue: Be it in a veil or a burka ... in this country we consider a woman as a goddess ... and those who don't respect a goddess ... we kill them openly

dialogue: Dhokhe ki khaasiyat hoti hai ... usse dene wala aksar koi khaas hi hota hai
englishDialogue: Cheating has one specialty ... often the one who cheats is our dear one

dialogue: Lagbag chaar hazar do sau dharam hai is duniya mein ... aur unki wajah se na jaane kitne log har din marte hai, maarte hai ... lekin tum jaiso ne ek naye dharam ko janam diya hai ... corruption
englishDialogue: There are approximately 4200 religions in this world ... and because of them so many people die and kill others ... but people like you have given birth to a new religion ... and that's corruption

dialogue: Choti machli bahut pakad li ... ab magarmach pakadne ki baari hai
englishDialogue: Enough catching the small fishes ... now it's time to catch the crocodile

dialogue: (Rok kar dikha) ... Rokunga bhi aur thokunga bhi
englishDialogue: (Try to stop me) ... I'll stop you and kill you as well

dialogue: Mujrim ko umar qaid ki saza dilane ka kharcha tax payer pe bahut zyada hai ... phaansi par latkane ki rassi ka stock kam hai ... magar sarkari revolver ki goli mein aaj bhi bahut dum hai
englishDialogue: The expense to punish a criminal for life in prison is already very high on a tax payer ... the rope for hanging someone is low in stock ... but even today there's a lot of power in a government service revolver

dialogue: Kanoon ko haath mein lene ka haq ... sirf kanoon ke haathon ko hota hai
englishDialogue: The right to take the law in the hand ... lies only with the law itself

dialogue: Yeh tamancha kacha mein rakho babua ... Bihari hai hum ... thook ke maatham mein chhed kar denge
englishDialogue: Keep this gun in your underwear ... I'm from Bihar ... I'll spit on it and make a hole in your head

dialogue: Saale itna todhunga na tujhe ... koi budget jodh nahi payega
englishDialogue: I'll break you in such a way that ... no budget will be able to set you back

dialogue: Switzerland jaane wala tujhe Shahabad mein hi hazaron mil jayenge aur desh mein karodon ... lekin sirf gyarah pagal honge jinka kisi ladki ko dekhke goal se dhayan nahi bhatkega ... kyun ki woh kisi pool ya gaadi ke liye goal nahi maar rahe hai ... India ke liye goal maar rahe hai
englishDialogue: In Shahabad itself you'll find thousands of guys who want to go to Switzerland, and millions in this country ... but there'll only be eleven mad guys who don't get distracted from their goal when they see a girl ... because they aren't shooting a goal for a pool or a car ... they're shooting a goal for India

dialogue: Ab India khelna hai ... India ke liye
englishDialogue: Now I want to play for India ... for the pride of India

dialogue: Sab badiya hai
englishDialogue: Everything is great

dialogue: Ab zindagi ki cycle pe toh maarna padega pedal ... chahe mile ya na mile medal
englishDialogue: Now we'll have to push the pedal on the cycle of life ... whether we get a medal or not

dialogue: Apni banayi cheezon pe apni hi mohar lagake bechenge
englishDialogue: We'll stamp our own name on the products that we make and sell

dialogue: Aazadi hai gunah toh kubool hai saza ... ab toh hoga wohi joh hai manzoor-e-khuda
englishDialogue: If freedom is a crime then I accept any punishment ... now whatever god wants, only that will happen

dialogue: Insaan ko hamesha dhoke ki umeed rakhni chahiye ... do hi cheezein pakki hai ... dhoka aur maut ... sabhi ko zindagi mein kam se kam ek baar toh naseeb hoti hi hai
englishDialogue: A person should always hope for deceit ... since only two things are for real ... deceit and death ... everyone attains these two things at least once in their life

dialogue: Har insaan ki zindagi mein kam se kam ek mauka aisa milta hai jab woh apni kamzoriyo, apni qabiliyat aur apni fitrat se upar uth sakta hai ... apni pechaan badal sakta hai ... apne aap se behtar ban sakta hai
englishDialogue: In every person's life there comes at least one opportunity when he can rise above his weaknesses, his potential and his habits ... when he can change his identity ... and he can become a better person

dialogue: Dhai din ki dophari ... shaam raat amavas ki ... sheesham ke ghode par hoke savaar ... aayegi shaamat gunehgaron ki
englishDialogue: In the afternoon of twin days ... on a moonless night ... riding on a rosewood stallion ... comes the peril of criminals

dialogue: Hindustani aadmi ka imaan koi paan supari nahi ki khaya aur thook diya ... dushman ki gardan pakad leta hai yeh imaan ... aur tab tak nahi chhodta jab tak ki dushman ke pran na nikal jaaye
englishDialogue: The honour of an Indian is not like tobacco which you can chew and spit it out ... this honour has grab the enemy by the neck ... and it doesn't leave it until the enemy dies

dialogue: Jitna dimaag tere paas hai na ... utna mera kharab rehta hai
englishDialogue: The total quantity of brain that you have ... I usually lose that much quantity of my brain

dialogue: Oye yeh Punjab hai ... yahan raat ko fight karte hai aur din mein invite karte hai
englishDialogue: This is Punjab ... here we fight in the night and then we invite in the morning

dialogue: Yeh dhai kilo ka nahi, poore panch kilo ka haath hai ... pad gaya na toh mooh chibda ho jayega ... haddiyan kirtan karengi
englishDialogue: My hand weighs 5 kg and not just 2.5 kg ... your face will get messed up if it falls on you ... and your bones will pray to god

dialogue: Agar ho baat toh baat banti hai ... aur baat jab banti hai ... phir kahe bhi banti hai, sunne bhi banti hai
englishDialogue: If something great has to happen then it'll happen ... and when it happens ... then it sounds good when you say it and also when you hear it

dialogue: Yeh sochna galat hai ki tum par nazar nahi ... masroof main bahut hoon magar bekhabar nahi
englishDialogue: It's wrong to think that I'm not focusing on you ... I'm very busy but I'm not unaware

dialogue: Yeh ishq kya hai ... sulagti saansein, tarasti aankhen, machalti roohein, dhadakti chattiyan
englishDialogue: What is love ... burning breaths, yearning eyes, restless souls, fast beating hearts

dialogue: Maazi ki raakh mit'te toh chingaariyan mile ... beshak kisiko chaho, magar is qadar nahi
englishDialogue: You'll find embers in the ashes of the past ... you can love someone, but not to this extent

dialogue: Joh vaadiyon mein utar rahi hai gagan se aakar ... joh parvaton par bikhar rahi hai safed chaddar ... wohi toh main hoon ... joh in darakhton ke sabz patton pe khelti hai ... joh oos bankar har ek mausam ko jhelti hai ... wohi toh main hoon
englishDialogue: The one who is landing from the skies into the valleys ... the one who has spread on the mountains like a white sheet ... I'm that person ... the one who plays on the green leaves of these trees ... the one who bears every season becoming dew drops ... I'm that person

dialogue: Dilon ki baatein dilon ke andar zara si zid se dabbi hui hai ... main sun'na chahun zubaan se sab kuch ... woh karna chahe nazar se battiya
englishDialogue: Due to a little bit of stubbornness the conversations of the heart are stuck in the heart ... I want to listen to everything through words ... but she wants to communicate using the eyes

dialogue: Kahaniyon mein suna tha ki mohabbat mein aashiq chaand tak le aate hai ... saale ko humne yeh baat seriously le li
englishDialogue: I had heard in stories that people bring the moon on earth for their love ... but I took that line seriously

dialogue: Zindagi kaatni kise thi ... humein toh jeeni thi
englishDialogue: I don't want to just spend my life ... I want to live it

dialogue: Hum jiske peeche lag jaate hai ... life bana dete hai
englishDialogue: If I stand behind someone ... then I make their life great

dialogue: Asal mein aadmi 4 feet 6 inch ka hi hota hai ... usse upar ki lambai uski akad hoti hai
englishDialogue: In reality a person's height is always 4 feet 6 inches ... anything above that is his attitude
